This building must have been a Chinese restaurant circa 1975 with its round windows, Asian influenced outdoor garden, low ceilings, and the "bamboo" (wood) facade encompassing the entire dining room.   All that was missing were paper placemats depicting the Chinese Zodiac signs (I'm a monkey!) and Lazy Susans on the larger family-style tables.

Meeting the West, the menu consisted of American fare with a very slight Mexican influence.  Upon entering the Manor House, in true Western culture fashion, you're greeted by a display case consisting of pies, cakes, and baseball decorated cookies. Among the dining room, about 50% of patrons and staff were speaking English, and the other half were speaking Spanish. 

I ordered the Bacon, Eggs, and Toast meal and substituted Silver Peso Pancakes for the bread.  One can add hash browns to their meal for a dollar, so I did.   My eggs arrived scrambled as ordered, very tasty, and certainly largely portioned.  Hash browns were excellent, and the bacon was thin and crunchy.  My phenomenal pancakes included a scoop of whipped butter, which was the icing on the cake! (Chef's Note: Add some confectioners sugar to that butter, and it would be icing! Literally!)  No complaints at all for my meal.  

The better half ordered the No. 1 Pork Egg Foo Young Special.. errr, I mean, the 3 Egg Deluxe Omelette, which consisted of bacon, sausage, onions, green peppers, sans mushrooms.  This omelette had way too much cheese to be enjoyable, but the pancakes more than made up for the kitchen snafu.  

Water glasses are tiny and need to be refilled constantly, which I find to be a pain.  Coffee magically stays refilled, which is a definite plus in my book.   Service was good.

The acoustics de Restaurante Manor are AMAZING.  So quiet, even if you have a hangover, you won't be bothered by noise.  Overall, an enjoyable restaurant not to be missed.  

I now find myself craving old-school Chinese/Polynesian cuisine for dinner tonight, certainly due to the decor of this pancake house.   Bring on the Pu Pu Platter, Teriyaki Beef, and Scorpion Bowl for dinner!

Ol̩!

I really can't understand why this place gets so busy the food is really very blank everything taste the same I think they need to start redoing the recipes or something but the pancakes are good but everything else taste funny has a weird aftertaste

The server we had was attentive but the food was ehh.  My friend got an omelette and it was very basic, silver dollar pancakes were very thin, hashbrowns lacked flavor. I made the mistake of getting the fetuccini Alfredo, save your 10$ and go to Olive garden. The pasta was really bad and tasted like they used a jar of alfredo you can just buy at meijer. I told my server I didn't like it and that it was fine that I didn't want something else instead of it because the salad bar already filled me up. The owner didnt reduce my check or anything and said they make their own alfredo. Even when she sat us down, she didn't mention any specials or anything. won't be coming back.

My husband and I decided to check this place out for breakfast one Sunday morning.  We were sat very quickly.  But that's where the good impressions end.  The staff was not friendly at all.  The food was VERY bland....I like bland food...not interested in too many spices, however this food was SUPER bland.  My husband didn't even eat more than 5 bites.  They charged me 75 cents per packet of smucker's peanut butter for my pancakes.  75 cents?!  For less than a serving of peanut butter?!  Though, that was the best part of the meal.  The pancakes tasted....off...as if something else was cooked on the griddle and they didn't bother to clean it off.  Maybe a meat something....it's a good thing I'm not Vegetarian...but there's no way they could know that since I ordered a broccoli omelette.  Then, the manager had the audacity to call my husband and I Nerds.  I do wear that moniker with pride, but she doesn't know that.  All in all.  This was a terrible experience and we will not be back.

I was looking for a 'coffee shop /  Greek restaurant' in East Dundee.  Bascially one that has bakery goods in a display case, a variety of menu items, and one that keeps the coffee cup full. This place fit the bill.  Cindy was our server and she did a great job of keeping my coffee cup full and bringing us what we ordered.   The food was good, the portions where plenty and Cindy's service was attentive and friendly.  What more do you need?
I love the french toast here.my wife and I come here all the time.the food is always good. The staff is always friendly and the prices are fair.

Restaurant is cute enough, and looks like a place where people will loyally attend for years, but the food wasn't very good. I was having a bad day, so I grabbed some sympathy German Chocolate cake along with my meal; what a mistake! It was remarkably tasteless (yet still managed to smell like bananas), soggy, and plastic-y. The French fries seemed reheated. The egg salad wasn't too bad, just soggy as well. You can definitely find somewhere else.

So when I first walked in here I was a little nervous.  It looked old, cheap and dingy.  But it had good reviews on Yelp, so I was going to try it out anyways.  My first impression was that the water tasted off... but didn't smell.  I stuck to the coffee.  At least if there was something wrong with the water they had to boil it first.  My boyfriend ordered the chicken fajita skillet which was incredible.  A huge portion with saut̩ed veggies and of course chicken and cheese.  I think I ate more of his entr̩e then my own.  I ordered a spinach and feta omelet.  It was good, with a lot of fresh spinach, but the feta made it a bit too salty.

Overall, the food was great, service was okay but not so friendly, ambience subpar.  But the kitchen was open which made me feel a bit better about things.

I used to have breakfast here with my grandparents when I was a kid. I am now closer to 50 than I am to 40 and this place hasn't changed much. It does have an odd smell and it does need some updating but when I walk in the door, I am flooded by memories of my grandparents, whom I miss dearly.

Stopped by for dinner on a Saturday night. 2 adults, 2 teens and two under 10. Almost all of us had breakfast except one of our teens. The food was decent and all of us, except for the hubby, took our leftovers home and had them the next day for lunch.

I had the Country Skillet and it was pretty darn good. Totally hit the spot and warmed me up on a unseasonably cold fall night. Hubby also had a skillet and he enjoyed it. Kids had pancakes and loved them. One teen had eggs and the other had.... something. I cannot remember. Not breakfast. But she liked it.

Our waitress was amazing. I wish I could remember her name. She was so great with the kids and just wonderful about checking in with us and refilling our coffee.
Great service great people great food I'm in Arizona now or I'd be there more often

I have came here for years now, their breakfast is really good. I love getting their Manor skillet. However, I always much rather get the food to go, due to the fact that their staff is VERY RUDE AND HAS ALWAYS ATTITUDE. I feel more like they are racist towards hispanics/blacks. The reason why I feel that way is because over the phone, I wouldn't even recognize that it is the same staff! Until I give a hispanic name for my order, then their attitude completely changes. And even one time instead of Alejandro, we gave the name Alex and no attitude change, UNTIL we picked up the order. It is like night and day! 
Overall, good food, HORRIBLE STAFF.

When I walk into the Manor I feel as though I'm taken to the 1970s or 80s. There is a classic retro charm about this all-American diner. This is a place for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or breakfast anytime. They do not skimp on anything, and the food is genuine diner food, nothing like fast food. Rather than fast food: what America is, the Manor provides diner food: what America is in theory. My friends and I had a tradition of always getting their absolutely delicious skillets, my personal favorite being the Greek skillet with gyro meat, onions, gyro sauce, hash browns, eggs, and toast. All of their skillets are worth trying though. They all cost around 6-7$, and each is different enough to satisfy a multitude of cravings and tastes. Their soups and other menu items such as melts and burgers are also worth a try. The soups are simple but good for wetting your appetite, and are included with many meals. I've always found that the meat is cooked exactly to my standards, soft and juicy, but not too tough or dry. The food and atmosphere give you the all-American experience in a genuine unpackaged way.

Been coming here for years as the go to place for Sunday breakfast with the family. The food is good, and the prices are more than reasonable. We have had dinner here before, and it is what you might expect for a diner as far as burgers and sandwiches go. The soups that i have had are all really good. Would recommend if you are looking for a good breakfast place in the area.

Went for breakfast here about a week ago. The ladies in the front give horrible customer service. They were rude and unfriendly. The food was as expected,bland.The coffee was lukewarm and very watered down. First and last time I go.

I agree with other Yelpers this place does need a makeover. Whenever we go here on a Sunday for breakfast it is packed (typically with post church goers and people that look like they have hangovers) but we always get seated promptly and the servers we have had in the past have been attentive. Our food always comes out like we ordered- no complaints.
We will be returning in the near future.

I went here for breakfast and it is a hole in the wall that is hopelessly stuck in the 70's.

The restaurant was dark  inside ( I could barely read a newspaper) and they also didn't have wifi service (even more proof it's stuck in the past).

I ordered basted eggs, sausage links, pancakes and a side of Greek toast - all three were poorly executed.  The first eggs were served with the whites still not cooked and I sent them back, the second eggs were overcooked with burned lace and fully cooked yolks.

The sausage was (one of) the grossest things I have ever tased - I swear it was 90% FAT.

The toasted Greek bread was dry and cold and they didn't butter it, like I had asked.

By the time I got to the pancakes, I was ready to run out of here, but I left hope that they would be edible (since the restaurant's name has "Pancake House" in it.  Boy was I wrong!!!  They were raw in the middle - I didn't even bother to send them back I just left and will never be back!

I have NEVER been in such a hurry to get finished with a meal in all my life!!! We hadn't been here in years, and decided to go for Breakfast there today since all of the GREAT Breakfast Spots were so crowded! From the minute we walked in the door, THE OWNERS, "greeted" us with ZERO enthusiasm! No "Good Morning" and not even the hint of a smile! At our dirty table,we encountered more of the same from the water server to the pissed off looking waitress!!!  Our Omelettes were swimming in butter, and one of ours was cold,,,,,,just like the staff!!! No music playing either,,,,just the crashing sound of dishes coming from the bussing station. Will not be returning here!!!

First choice had a line out the door, so we ran over here.

The plusses occurred pretty early.  My wife like the wood carving of the bear out front, and we got seated right away.  They were quick to make with the coffee and tea.  While we were placing our order, a party of 6 was seated next to us.

Minuses?  Well, if I've already ordered, I'd think that I'd get my food BEFORE the party of 6 that arrived while we were ordering gets theirs. And when I order my eggs poached HARD, it would be really swell if yellow glop didn't run all over my corned beef hash when I stuck my fork in the yolk. Oh, and when we say we'd like to take the oatmeal and the toast in a to-go container, it would be fabulous if you didn't take the toast and throw it away.

I'd have to be pretty desperate for breakfast before I went back.

If you like rules on drink refills, terrible customer service, and finding hair in your food, then come eat here. When I told our server about the long black hair I found in my soup, she stood at our table and mixed through it with my spoon (I'm guessing she didn't believe me, even though it was sitting right on top. She basically hid it). I was very calm with her, but still felt like I wasn't being listened to.
The ice water had a wet dog aroma, the coffee was lukewarm and terrible, and I never thought a restaurant could be so incredibly bad at making a cold sandwich. They basically slapped a handful of corned beef on some bread and pulled some lettuce and tomato out of the garbage.  Our dirty plates were left on our table, and the cashier had to go find our server just so she could split our bill, which she claimed she offered to do for us (but never did).
I've read a lot of the reviews on here, and some people have had experiences way worse than mine. I DO NOT suggest ever coming here, even if you're desperate. Anywhere else is better.

I love this place, Been coming here for over a year now after doing a search for Liver and onions in the area. I grew up in the city and there where a lot of Greek  family owned restaurants around. 
theirs not a lot of family restaurants out here that still serve the old favorites like liver and onions, breaded veal cutlet dinners, club sandwiches, BLT's, Reuben's or patty melt's ETC......
this place has a great menu selection.  The only thing i wish was a better salad bar  more verity like maybe cottage cheese or claw slaw, sliced hard boiled eggs 
One more thing is the daily specials great verity to choose from.....
service is always great
just wish they had Dr PEPPER :)

I have ordered takeout from the Manor three times in the last year, and the consistently rude attitudes of the hostesses have been mildly irritating, but they haven't caused me to stop coming, since it's a quick in-and-out interaction. The quality of the food is about what you would expect from a cafeteria, but it comes in generous portions. It's great for the day that you are hungry and lazy and want more variety than pizza delivery.

Yesterday, my group of 4 decided to dine in. I would not recommend this to anyone, and we will not be back. The waitress was condescending and inattentive. See Mike M's 11/9/14 review - he's already explained it. I will add that the pickle spears were mush, the crackers were stale, and after the waitress brought us our check she never returned, even though some of us were still eating.

I get the distinct impression that their attitudes are due to our ages - we are all in our twenties, and the Manor caters more to the 60+ crowd. My friends and I dine out frequently, speak respectfully to restaurant staff, forgive small mistakes, and tip 20%. This age discrimination is undeserved, unusual, and it's bad for business.
To our waitress: Ma'am, if you serve a table like you don't expect a great tip, that is a self-fulfilling prophecy.
To the management/hosts: I know that your restaurant has been a fixture of the community for a very long time, and I don't expect 1-star yelp reviews to damage your reputation too much. However I don't think that your restaurant is retaining the loyalty of gen X and millennial diners, many of whom ate there as kids, and that is a shame for you.

I've been coming here since I was little. I remember getting ice cream, salad bar and kids meals. Now I go for the soup and sandwiches. The night manager is the nicest man ever. So funny and friendly! Good cookies too!!

10/10 would visit again. Excellent busboys. They was very polite. They work hard. They know what they're doing. The wait time for the food was excellent. Food was good. It was a reasonable price for the food, maybe take a couple bucks off of an item. Table was clean, enjoyed my meal. Good soft music while eating. Wouldn't recommend sitting next to the bathroom or kitchen doors. The waiters could liven up, when they were singing happy birthday it sounded like they were forced to do it. Great hostess, my daughter loved her. The kids loved George's magic tricks. When I was leaving, I left my sunglasses at the table, but thankfully as I was paying my check one of the busboys gave it back to me. Good to know we still have spirit out there.

I would have chose zero stars if I could have. This place is a dump. Every one that said the food is good must be a part of the restaurant staff or family.  For the price there are several options in the area that would far surpass the food and service provided by this establishment.  
To begin the place is dirty and run down. The smell in the air is not of delicious food but more of a dingy, disgusting, spoiled food smell. The hostess was rude. I only wish we left right then and spared ourselves the experience.
The coffee was barely warm and don't even get me started on the water. The menu was unorganized which made ordering difficult. We ordered our so called breakfast and once it arrived at the table we seriously wondered how can this place ever be busy? Everything was digusting. We've never had bad bacon before so thanks for that. The "Manor skillet" was spoiled by using canned mushrooms. The cheese on the skillets was gross. To make matters worse while we are barely choking down this future vomit our entire party was smacked in the face with the most horrific rotten fish smell coming from the kitchen. It was so bad that we just paid and left.
We seriously would have preferred McDonald's. We will never, ever attempt to eat here again. Ever.

My families (mother's side and father's side) have been going here for generations. I basically grew up in this restaurant like most anyone born and raised in the Carpentersville/Dundee area. All I have to say is the owner or owners daughter (I don't know which but she is middle aged with dark hair) is either racist, hates children or discriminates against children and/or families with disabilities.

Occurrence #1: my nephew has autism and on this particular day we had been out and about and it had been a long day. We were all tired and we stopped in for a quick bite to eat on our way home. My nephew was having a rough moment, as all children do, and my sister was doing her best to keep him calm and quiet. This nasty woman (the middle aged woman with dark hair) came over and asked if everything was OK. My sister gave her a half smile and said, "Yes. Everything's fine." and this woman had the audacity to say, "Obviously not!" and walk off! So unbelievably rude!

Occurrence #2: we had my great-grandmother's luncheon after her funeral at The Manor. When we were being seated, my sister asked if we could order for my nephew right away (a means to keep him occupied) and this same person said "No" very rudely, continued ignoring my sister and went about seating everyone else.

Occurrence #3: we were back with a larger group of our family and while we were waiting for our food this same woman came over doting on one of the other children at our table, laughing and talking with him and took him to the front of the restaurant to pick out crayons and coloring materials to bring back to his seat. She never once acknowledged my nephew (the only other child in our group) with a "hello", a smile, or offered him any crayons.

Is it because he's mixed (black, white and Asian)? Is it because he has special needs? She is either racist or this is not a persons w/ disabilities friendly establishment. We will NEVER go back.

The Manor is the type of place where your family brought you as a little kid.  It's the type of place where you see your neighbors, people from church, or school.  The food is exactly the same every time.  The waitresses are sweet and attentive.  Yes it could use a makeover but that may take away from the charm of the place.  It's a community staple, has good food and a great environment.

I cannot tell you how many times I have driven past this restaurant and not given it a second thought until my friend moved right down the street.  She was singing its praises, so we all went there on a Saturday morning around 9 am.

There was no wait for our group of six, which was nice.  They didn't have kid's menus for the kids (or at least we weren't offered one) and there wasn't a kid's section on the menu, anyway.  The kids had eaten a bit before, though, so they just decided to share with us anyway.

Our waitress was a bit...brisk.  I don't think she smiled once.  She was all business and it was slightly awkward.  It was almost as if we were a big inconvenience for her.  So 1 star for service.... I mean, it was fast-ish, but she was craaaaaaabby.

And the food...meh.  My veggie omelet was not very good at all.  I like when the eggs and the veggies are melded together, and this was just sort of eggs-wrapped-around-some-greasy-veggies.  Meh.  But mine came w/ silver dollar pancakes that the kids seemed to enjoy.

My husband got a stack of pancakes, though, and these were REALLY good.  They were better than the silver dollar ones that came with my meal, and they were SUPER fluffy.  So delicious!  I kept stealing bites of his food :)

For four meals (including four drinks), it was $43 without tip.  So it was a bit pricey for mediocre food.

Came here with my family, 3 small kids. We we treated as if we had a disease. My kids are not as loud as others and not the quietest. They behave well in public. It's sad because I pass by this place everyday going to work. It usually costs us 50 bucks at breakfast. Never again for us.

Amazing breakfast from this place, the taste is incredible! And to top it all off, the portions are enormous, allowing you to enjoy all the more flavor. If you like omelettes, this is the place for you.
Shithole ! Service is the worst !!! Nasty old filthy waitresses . Food always comes to table cold . Good revies must be owners friends n family . Terrible place

Ill be honest, I grew up coming to this place.  It was pretty much the only breakfast place around until Randall road started getting built on.  So ill cut them some slack and give them a 2 star just because they bring back childhood memories.  The food and service are just ok.  The omelets are a joke (flat as a crepe).  Skillets are descent.   Nothing specular about this place.  I go back once in a while to remember the good old days but would not say its the go to place for breakfast in the area.

Rude. Rude. Rude.  I have never in my life seen such poor customer relations by an OWNER and her 2 hostesses. Food is okay but I would rather spend my money at a place that appreciates their customers rather than a place that told me they Don't Need my business.  Good thing they don't need it cause NEVER again will they get it.

This place is another example of less than mediocre effort. The place hasn't changed in decades. The d̩cor is the same. The menu is the same. The "specials" are the same. The soups are the same. The lackluster service is the same. About all this place can offer are a good typical breakfast and typical sandwiches. But how hard is it to make toast, pancakes, eggs, bacon, hash browns or a BLT, Reuben or patty melt sandwich?

I ordered the fish and chips once and got a square piece of previously frozen fish and fries. A fish sandwich from McD's had more flavor! Granted this place is not fine dining, but a frozen piece of frozen processed fish is labeled fish and chips?

On a recent visit, five seconds after being seated, the old sour bitty of a waitress greeted me with "Do you know what you want yet?" No Hello or how are you. She came back a few minutes later and took my order. She brought my Reuben sandwich and asked if I wanted the thousand-island dressing. I replied "Yes, that that's what makes it a Reuben." A couple of minutes later she brought it. How many people order a Reuben without the dressing?

After I finished, she slapped the check on the table without saying a word. Upon paying my bill at the counter, I mentioned to the hostess(I think the owner also) that it wouldn't cost my waitress a cent to smile and be pleasant to her guests. The hostess replied "she's always like that." Then get rid of her! I told the hostess "she won't change if you don't talk to her about it." No response from the hostess. That tells me the ownership couldn't care less about the service.

PS I make the point of her age because I usually always find that the older generation have good manners and know how to treat people.

I've been eating here since I was a small child, with my dad. I'm now bringing my young son with me for breakfast as well. He is two and quite happy with the food and atmosphere, as am I. It has been consistently great for the more than 30 years I've been coming here.  The staff is also consistent, with servers working there for many years. The food is wonderful, consistent, and dependable. Well worth the 20 minute drive to get here for us, on which I drive past three other breakfast restaurants.

My husband and I came here for breakfast. We recently moved to the area, and we were driving around looking for a place to eat. When we first walked in, we thought the place was nice and spacious. There weren't a whole lot of people eating, but it still had a nice feel to it. The food turned out very good. The portions are very large. I left with a doggy bag, and had my leftovers later that day. I can't wait to go back, and eat there again. I'm craving it, as I type this!

Displeased with the service. Was not served water or bread ubtil asked. The menu was overwhelming and there are way too many items to choose from that you will literally read the menu for 10 minutes. The expiditer slamed the food on the table... not making eye contact and walked away without asking if we needed anything. My eggs were not cooked right. I did enjoy the pancakes though and that was the only reason I give 2 stars. When I went to pay my bill the hostess completely ignored me until I said something. She was to busy chatting with a server.... unprofeasional. The interior was out dated and desperately needs a remodel. Outside was pretty and good for photo opps.

First time here, Sunday breakfast... pretty simple. Sat us right next to the ice station so you can here them scoop ice into cups throughout your meal. You may be thinking, come on man but really it was so loud you could not hear the person that is talking to you. This went on throughout the entire meal. The coffee was terrible. Nothing like being served coffee with no cream. It came much later. Our waitress was M.I.A most of the time and we only seen here when she came over to get ice I think. We had multiple people stop by. Pancakes came.... with no syrup. Had to wait till the waitress needed some ice to mention it. Came time to pay the bill at the front. The older woman taking care of this didn't say, hello, how are you, how was the meal, or thank you. I think I was invisible, which is exactly what this establishment will be to me. Continue driving up to Randall for a meal.

Is this the glitzy, trendy joint that has the world's greatest fusion food? No. 

It's a friendly, neighborhood joint with a classic, family feel and terrific food!

I give good marks to the manor. Ridiculous consistency. They never burn eggs (very rare).  Around $10.00 for an omelette w toast and hash browns. A good family runs the joint. Coffee cups are tiny. Just sayin....
I like the Manor. It is a very pleasant family restaurant. My favorite dinners  are the broiled center cut pork chop or the grouper (very moist, they use a steam baking style).

Went there on Tues 5/7/13 with family for dinner. Wife ordered salad bar and that night and next day was sick. I noticed that the buffet wasn't very chilled. Also daughter ordered rice pudding and the rice was raw/uncooked. 
Now this is where I get annoyed. Waitress stops by and asks "how is everything?" we  point out that the rice pudding was not good and why only to get "really?". Really? what kind of question is that to a customer? Then when going to pay the host does the customary "How was everything?" We tell him and get "Huh? Usually it's pretty good". Not "we'll take a look into that" or "sorry".

So if you like your typical pancake house for senior citizens with sub-par food and a thousand and one choices with wait staff and management that doesn't care. This place is your choice.

If you think you're money is worth more than that keep looking

Two words to sum it up. 
Blueberry pancakes. Seriously.

And the skillet with ham, bacon, country gravy... whoa. The best grease pit ever. 
Their country gravy is the closest to my own gravy that I've ever had at a restaurant, which means actual chunks of sausage in the mix. Noms.
I would only give this place 4.5 stars, their service can act kind of crabby sometimes, but the food makes it worth putting 5 stars down for the world to see. 
I think we'll have breakfast for dinner tonight.

Very good restaurant with outstanding menu selection.  Four of us went for dinner on January 11, 2014, Saturday evening and ordered a diverse selection of dinner items.  All were very good.  Be sure to review the "special" page in the menu as it offers almost fifteen dinners.  Specials include soup or salad and desert.  All meals come with bread/roll basket.  Restaurant is large but broken into sections so it can be busy without being too noisy.  Washrooms are clean.  We will be going there again.  Perhaps for breakfast but will expect a crowd if I go on a Sunday as it is a Pancake House!

First off I have to admit there is some childhood nostalgia to Manor for me. Growing up after going to the barber in St. Charles my mom and I would go to Manor and get the potato pancakes. They had a location right on the river and I would love to be seated by the window and watch it while having breakfast. This location then moved to Elgin and a few years ago to my disappointment closed. That is were Yelp came in. I decided to do a search for manor (after hearing they were a chain) and was surprised to find this location in East Dundee. Much to my surprise it is the same place!!! The potato pancakes here taste the same and so does the coffee (they have great coffee). The Potato pancakes are made fresh and have a hit of Cheddar cheese. This is one of only a few restaurants I will order potato pancakes (they are great at Our Kitchen also). The old 70's style dinner is great also. Plenty of comfortable booths here. The service here is also always spot on. I never see the bottom of my coffee cup. Still one of my favorite breakfast places!! Glad I found it again on Yelp!

First off, the food is very good. You'd be hard-pressed to find better breakfast cuisine in the area. However, that does not excuse the absolutely abysmal service here. It's not everyone on the staff - not all of the servers and managers are terrible, but some are just unacceptably rude. They act like customers are annoying them. The worst of all is the woman who runs the register. I have NEVER encountered such a rude employee in my life. There is just no excuse for this. Every time I've gone she's been a total jerk. She's even mean to poor little kids asking if they can have one of the free Dum-Dums they have at the encounter. Just appalling.

I'm sure I'll still go here from time to time just because I like the food, but I'm going to hate every minute I have to spend interacting with most of the staff.
Very good pie and coffee.  Never had anything else here.

I went for breakfast with my father and sister. The waitress looked like the living dead. She did not smile or greet. The food was average. Everytime I come here I think maybe I'll get better customer service but I never fail to be disappointed. When we checked out the older white lady at the front was very rude and equally as unfriendly as the waitress.On the bright side, we love the Country Skillet for breakfast and sometimes we have it for dinner too (that's the only reason I like coming here).

I went here for breakfast with a group of folks this past Sunday. We got there at 9:30, which was just perfect timing. Literally, a 1/2 hour later, the place was hopping, and the wait was much longer. 

The Manor has an awesome selection of standard breakfast fare. Everyone sampled some major category on the menu - from eggs to skillets to pancakes. The general consensus - the food was good, but nothing to write home about. 

I had the "Country Skillet", which consisted to eggs, hash browns, cheese, ham, and sausage gravy. It was alright, albeit for two things: 1) the hash browns had so much oil that the shreds magically reassembled themselves into a giant mass globule of potato; 2) the sausage gravy was lukewarm and had no extra-seasoned flavor. 

The server was attentive, the coffee was plentiful, and the price was just about right. Once again, decent enough food, but certainly not a destination place.

This is a diner, right down to the Jello on the menu.  This family owned and operated restaurant has survived renovations and fires and always remains the same.  

Giant sandwiches, great breakfast food, of course Grecian chicken and decent salads.  Pie by the slice for dessert.  It is one of those places you can always count on.  After change upon change in the area, The Manor remains the same.

We go to this restaurant for breakfast frequently because it is close. This is the first time  (Eloise) was our server. She did a great job because there were (7) seven of us and all the food was served together and hot.

Manor has the best pancakes of all the Chicagoland pancake houses I've tried!  My rating below is based on a basic breakfast sampling of regular (original) pancakes, sausage, eggs and coffee.  I rate Manor Pancake House a 5 star.   I eat at Manor whenever I'm not critiquing new pancake houses.  It's my favorite place to go to know I'm getting consistently excellent pancakes.  Never had a bad experience.

Pancake (original) ***** Excellent texture and flavor
Sausage (links) ****
Eggs (scrambled) ****
Coffee  ***** great!

Good food, horrible service. My husband and I ate there 5 or 6 times and EVERY SINGLE TIME we ran into the same issue- rude staff.  Not just not friendly or cranky..but plain rude. The only reason we kept on making excuses for them (anyone can have a bad day, right?) and  going back there is the  food. Yes, they have excellent pancakes, but it's just not worth the aggravation. There are other great restaurants in the area where you actually feel welcomed. We wil not be going back.

I've been going here for years and since I live just down the street I go even more now! Great food and coffee every time, ao if you're looking for a REAL dinner with A+ food this is you're spot.I've even come to know the staff and the owners so it's like a home away from home, they really care and it shows! They have the best pancakes around but what's really great if youre super hungry is their skillets, so much food and soo good!! That just covers breakfast, they also have a great lunch and dinner menu with really great prices. They have weekday specials for breakfast and dinner. I can promise if you go there you will find something you want to eat no matter the time of day because their menu is so big! oh and breakfast is served all day for you breakfast lovers!

What a delightful, albeit typical "1,000 item menu" restaurant hidden away off of Route 72. We have nicknamed it "The Sinkhole Restaurant" because several years ago the parking lot collapsed...I digress...
The selection is substantial and breakfast is served all day and evening. The salad bar  is small and simple but surprisingly tasty.
Our entrees of chicken-fried steak, roast beef slices and a pork thing were so good (we added our own salt and pepper, but we like the control). The vegetables were excellently prepared, not too mushy.

The service was just fine - the senior crowd had just left and we had no problems with the location of our table and the service. It's good to eat out after 5:00 PM
Awesome pancakes!  Everytime I come here to eat, I am never dissapointed! Most pancake places arent that great, but here is the exception!

My personal standard of excellence when it comes to diners. Food is fantastic, service is professional, the owners are very hands on and seem to genuinely care for the customer/establishment. Have eaten breakfast here for around a decade now and I've never been disappointed by the deliciousness of what I order. I'm a simple guy, and The Manor gets every simple detail down perfectly. I couldn't ask for more and I take everyone I know from out of the area here once for coffee and quality dining.
I LOVE the Manor!! Been comin in for years! GREAT food, GREAT service!!!!!

found black HAIR in my manor skillet. The owner of the restaurent was there and told me sorry it fell off our kichten brushes. And tried to take off the buscuits and gravy since it was cheaper. He was rude, and flat out lied to us. Never going back.

Let me start off by saying I am a bit of a foodie.  With that in mind this place is true to it's roots - good food at great prices.  First off  - the service was exellent!  I even overhead another waitress asking someone if they wanted extra gravy to take home with their leftovers.

Second the food - nothing fancy but what I got was good!  They have a very limited salad bar but it met my needs and the three bean salad was a tangy, perfectly cooked surprise!  

For my entree I got the chicken kiev with rice pilaf and green beans.  The rice pilaf was nice (needed a little salt and pepper, that's it) and perfectly cooked.  NOW if some of you may yawn at my selection, then you have never had a perfectly executed kiev, with a crisp non greasy exterior, moist flavorful chicken and when you cut into it a river of buttery goodness which act as additional seasoning for the pilaf upon which it rests.

I have been there 3 or four times: very busy family restaurant with the parking lot almost full every time.  This is a good sign.

Clean with a friendly efficient staff.  The decor looks a little stressed - lots of traffic.  The dress is casual

Very good breakfasts.  My wife loves the Swedish Pancakes with lingonberries.  I like their sausage.  Good coffee and they keep it coming.

Reasonably priced.  Price for breakfast for two:  between 17 - 20 bucks.

On Mothers' Day they gave out a rose to every mother.  A nice touch.

manor resturant has a great selection for breakfast lunch and dinner. they also have weekday specials. they have great hours of service. the food is great and reasonably priced.you can receive to go orders swiftly.there is ample parking and service is quick.they also have a nice bakery selection in front of the store.

I'm not a huge fan of breakfast so when I find a place that does breakfast justice I'm all over it  with that being said I would have to tilt my hat to the Manor. I went there last week in the afternoon but came in for the breakfast after reading the reviews about their to die for  pancakes. I of course didn't end up ordering the pancakes but I got the Manor skillet instead. I was definitely not disappointed. It was a huge portion of eggs made  to order, hash browns, sausage, green peppers and mushrooms and lastly cheese, cheese and cheese. My mouth is watering just thinking about it again. I also snuck a  bite (or five) off of my boyfriends plate, he got the strawberry pancakes, heavenly is the best way to describe them. It was a gargantuan pancake stuffed with fresh strawberries rolled up and covered with whipped cream....sigh....  I can't wait to go back here, so far two thumbs up from me

Good breakfast, comfortable place.  Nothing off-the-wall - just your standard diner fare (which I happen to love).  I had the spinach and feta omelette which was delicious.  It would be a great hangover breakfast!

This is a great dependable family owned restaurant with great dependable food. We've had amazing service there. In the morning, it can sometimes be a bit slow as far as service goes. I would recommend going in the evening for anything but dinner. You can get a delicious breakfast any time of day, which is really quite perfect as a retreat after a night of having fun. I can find meals that are great for when I'm craving something not so good for me, or when I want to keep it nice and light.

Very busy, always. Quick service. Big menu but breakfast is the best. Have tried lots of items but always return for the spinach and feta cheese omelets. They are the best in the area and I have tried them all! Have never been disappointed in any meal I have had here.

I come to this Potbelly's whenever I'm in the area.  The service is always top notch here and I've never had a problem.  The place is clean and the food is always prepared well.  One of the things I really enjoy is the live music they have once in a while.  Once, there was a guy playing the guitar and singing some classics.  We sat there even after we were done with our food because it was great entertainment.  

P.S.  Try the brownie cookie if you haven't before!

I love Potbelly so I decided to order catering for a work event. The process was really easy, I worked with Karen and Steve and they were both very pleasant and accommodating. The food was delicious and ready at my pick up time. After the order, I needed to refund something on the bill (my fault- my work is a tax exempt non profit and I forgot to mention that  before ordering) and the process was really positive. They were probably sick of all my emails with questions but they certainly never acted like it. I would completely recommend them for catering as well as popping in for lunch or dinner!

I LOVE Potbelly, and after a 4 year stint in MN, I'm excited to be back in IL closer to Potbelly! 

I love the food, soups, shakes. I often will order a piece of soup bread (a piece of bread with 3 - 4 diagonal cuts to make it easier to rip apart, only $.99!)

There is a great secret menu - the Lucky 7 (a wreck with double meat, using the meat from an Italian) is my favorite. One of my favorite things about Potbelly is that you can customize your sandwich any way you want. Meatballs on your a Wreck (a wrecking ball), they can do it! I also love that their chicken and tuna salads are meat heavy, not tuna heavy. I also like that neither have onions (you can add onions if you want, but it's not in the salad). 

Also, if you have a problem with your Potbelly experience, if you go onto their website and let them know, they'll do something about it (I know for a fact they then go to district and store managers with customer feedback), and they reward you with two free sandwiches for your bad experience. That's a company that cares, and I like it.

What's hilarious is that this potbelly will yell down the line what tour order is but there is no one at the end listening to it. The order ends up getting re-asked at the end of the line. It's a kitschy thing I'm sure they taught potbelly trainees but it is annoying. Food is good though, bread a bit dry but can't go wrong with the Oreo shake.
Best American fast food in the country. There shakes are the best.  Very good for small party's.

Great Gerkin, I'm impressed! I know Potbelly is 'just another fast food chain', but this one's location and staff is pretty exceptional.

First off, $1 giant pickles! If that's not the way to a ladies heart, I dunno what is.

Second, they've got live music most lunches/evenings and the musicians are indie, local, and outstanding - not to mention the show they're putting on is 100% free! 

Third, Ifound my new favorite sandwich at potbelly thanks to my man-friend (meow!) and the super-chill closing shift guy, after they bonded over their distinguished ice cream palates.  

So, which 'wich the new best in show? THE ICE CREAM COOKIE SANDWICH!!!

They take 2 of their full size cookies (as big as a child's head) and smoosh mounds of creamy, delicious vanilla ice cream in between. And you get to pick the cookie kind, usually sugar cookie, oatmeal chocolate chip, and few other usual cookie flavor suspects, but apparently the real ice cream cookie sandwich cookie combo win is the chocolate chip brownie cookie with vanilla ice cream.  

Potbelly, you can put it in my mouth anytime.

This restaurant has such a cool look to it and had live music too today at lunch. They have outdoor seating which is also nice.

They added a turkey BLT toasty sandwich to their menu and I thought it was really tasty. Toasty tasty! ;) 

I like that you can get either bottled drinks or fountain sodas. I tend to go for the fountain sodas for free refills. 

I tried my first chocolate brownie cookie- oh my- how delicious! Everyone at my seminar (I saved it for later) sitting around me seemed very jealous. I wonder if it tasted even better because of that? ;)

The staff were quick and friendly and got us through the line in a pretty decent amount of time. 

Good food and good experience!

Yummy! They make one of the best subs in the world! You will not be disappointed when ordering any sub, but most if all when ordering the wreck!
Basically every sub is toasted, and of course you don't like toasted subs, that won't toast it. They offer around ten to fourteen different toppings, which have always been very fresh. 

They offer soda as well as tons of different juices, teas and bottle water. They also have some kick ass potato salad and macaroni salad. 

I only wish they had a location closer and in Schaumburg!

Good sandwiches here. Since there are so many Potbelly's around, I'd like to give this place a review about the service. The people are ALWAYS friendly here. The thing I love most about this location is that every time I leave, I feel a bit happier just by the way their staff is so loving and welcoming into this establishment.

The food is awesome as usual, just like other Potbelly's sandwiches. I typically get a Roast Beef or Wreck on Regular, both of which are exquisite sandwiches :)

A MAJOR plus they have is they offer BIG sandwiches now and I can actually leave the place feeling full. Give it a shot if you like toasted sandwiches!

We ordered the Wreck and grilled chicken. It said on the menu that the big size is 30% larger than their original size, so we both ordered the big. Ordered the grilled chicken without cheese, but unfortunately, it came with cheese. Tastewise, it was good and I liked the spiciness of the peppers, but my Wreck was leaking oil. Also, I don't know how the big size is 30% bigger than the original size. Maybe 30% more lettuce? Meh, I wouldn't pay $1 extra for 30% more lettuce. Nothing made it stand out for me to distinguish it from other franchise subshops, and I'd rather pay $6 for a different lunch option.

Yep, it's a Potbelly's, but a good one!

My husband LOVES coming here, and I try to avoid Sub/sandwich places because my parents had a love affair with Subway when I was growing up, and I just got really sick of sandwiches.  But in any case, I think this is a good location for this chain.

My husband always orders the same thing--the Pizza Sub w/ no pepperoni on wheat.  I have snuck a couple bites an I like it.  My personal fav is the toasted TKY and the vegetable soup. 

What knocks this down a star is the lack of soup TWICE in two weeks when I went there.  Talk about a bummer!

Oh, and get a pickle!  It's $1, and it's huge :)

I like sandwiches, but I wasn't immediately sold on Potbelly's the first time I tried it.  Good thing I tried it again.  Since my second time trying Potbelly's I have not gone back to the other sandwich places around.

I usually get the roast beef on white, but today I had the Italian sandwich, and I think it is the best Italian sandwich of any of the chain stores that are around (you know who you are!).

If you like pickles, their pickle oil gives the sandwich another layer of flavor due to the vinegary tang.  Exceptional!  Their bread is baked and I firmly believe that bread baked well can make a mediocre sandwich tasty, and crumbly, tasteless bread can make a good sandwich almost unedible.  Props to Potbelly's for their delicious bread.

I'm only giving this 4 stars, because this Potbelly's is located in a outdoor mall full of store blocks and one way streets.  Okay, whatever, it's a hoity-toity area.  So be it.  But it's the closest Potbelly's to work -- and everyone else's work too apparently; and it's busy most of the times I go there.

Still, I expect that I will be going to this Potbelly's at least four times a month or more.

WOW

I cannot say more about this awesome sandwich shop, but WOW! :)  

Overall ALL the Potbelly Sandwich Works restaurants have been awesome and the consistancy is impeccable! So, if you go to one you can expect the same quality sandwich at another.

Of all the sandwich shops chains out there, THIS one is my absolute best! It has toasted sandwiches, it has awesome chili, soup, potato salad, cole slaw, etc.  All taste very fresh and homemade (or pretty darn close if it isn't!)  

I always have either the Italian OR the Wreck.  I also enjoy the PB&J sandiwich(yes, you heard me) which is awesome(but messy) when toasted.  Their sandwiches are simple, but VERY flavorful(especially if you add hot peppers! yum!)

They also serve hand-dipped ice cream and yummilicous malts. They have other little sweets like cookies, ice cream cookie sandwiches as well.  

This particular location is QUITE busy especially during lunchtime, so expect to wait in line for a bit as they get your sandwiches done. As every sandwich is made to your taste, it will take a little bit to get your sandwich ready. But, oh man, is it worth it! 

Crispy, toasted bread(wheat or white), warm meats and cheese. Their homemade hot pepper mix is hot without being overly so. 

The restaurant itself is very clean and the music is upbeat and not overly blaring or distracting either.  Very casual, but not so much to make it look cheap.  The antique shop decor is interesting and adds to the ambiance of the place. 

Definitely want to go here if you love deliciously toasted sub sandwiches. If it were closer, I'd be going everyday. :)
Great service, healthy, clean and fast!!!  Great great !!!!

I love this place. Omg! not a sandwich eater but damn ... I usually get Multi grain thin cut turkey breast  sandwich and it's awesome , I never was into eating sandwiches but they changed my mind... it's toasted and healthy...:-)

Love them!! They have the absolute best shakes in the 'burbs, and their sandwiches are wonderful! I work in the same mall (The Arboretum of South Barrington), so it is very convenient for me. They are always friendly, cheerful, and quick to make sure that their customers are happy. I was walking back to my own store the other day, two chocolate malts in hand, and accidentally dropped one trying to get back inside. I called over to Potbelly's, explained what happened, and was ready to go pay for another one... They told me to come on back, made another one for me, and handed it off for free. They are spectacular, and I would HGHLY recommend them!!!!!
Excellent place, Excellent service, Great food, Great people, Love this place and stop by atleast twice a month. :)

I am so stoked there is a Potbelly's out here in the burbs. They have the best shakes! I used to get them all the time when I was in college in the city. I have to agree with Maria I have never been to a Potbelly's & not have excellent service. Best sandwhiches around & moderatly priced!

I was super excited when this Potbelly's location opened up.  It is hands down my all time favorite sandwich place.   Between the bread and their special sauce, any sub you get is bound to taste awesome.  Even their PB&J sandwich is so good.  And don't even get me started about their cookies and dream bars.  YUM!

I love Potbelly's.  I usually order the Italian or A. Wreck.  Really, really good.  The sandwiches are toasted and have a flavor that's unique and wonderful.  Service is always friendly and sometimes they have live music (a guy sitting on a stool playing acoustic guitar)  Highly recommended.

I grew up on this place. My family lives a couple of blocks away so we order from here often, and whenever my brother comes home from college The first thing he wants is kind garden. The food is the best Chinese in the area. I like their lo mein and the sesame tofu. Hands down my favorite place to eat. The staff is so friendly and the food is so good and it's a really nice place to go for a date or just for a casual lunch. The food is a but on the greasy side, but that's what happens when you fry something in oil, can't have one with out the other. 10/10 would recommend.
NIce and good quality. Cute inside, authentic enough. Eggroll could be tastier, but the rest was good and nice presentation.
Seriously? Crazy noodle had absolutely no flavor! Beef chop suey was very chewy and also has no flavor.  Do they try their food?  Very disappointed!!

Been ordering from Lin's for many years and drive 15-20 minutes each way for it since it was so good. Sad to say our last meal was "ok" and tonight's was not good at all. Ordered Crazy noodle and it had no flavor and very little meat. Also ordered our staple sesame chicken. It was over fried with little meat and strange flavor. I have a feeling there are new owners. Unfortunately will have to find a new place.

Must be different owners now? Even their website recently changed (and hard to understand?)
I called and ordered a good amount of food(which is a bit pricier than other restaurants in the area) and the caller was adamant unless I was picking up or dining in "NO FREE CRAB RANGOON! SAYS SO ON THE COUPON!" Ok fine,whatever. I had chosen to have delivered. I was told 45minutes to an hour, took an hour and a half! My food was cold and the driver said, "You have a problem,call the restaurant,I only deliver!" The food was awful, barely any meat. The shrimp was the size of salad shrimps and not much flavor. I will NEVER order here again!
The oil hasn't been changed in years. The general chicken was fryed to the bone. Never coming back
Food was not good, no flavor at all and greasy.  I will not recommend.

Great place if you like salt. We were in for lunch and had egg drop soup, happy family, and a tofu dish. The soup was bland and tepid. The best thing about the meal was the fried rice.  In fact the only reason i would consider returning to this restaurant is if i was desperate for fried rice and i was nearby. The meat in the happy family was sparse  and gristly. The dish is marked as spicy and my tongue was burning but it was caused by the excessive soy sauce or salt used, not spice. The tofu dish was bland and mushy and contained no vegetables. Total bill was 15 bucks and change. Not a terrible price for good for but pretty high for the meal we received.
Garbage. It used to be good 10 years ago and beyond. They lost grip. Too many other places close by that are light years ahead. Save your stomach!

I found this place on Yelp, while on a trip.  It was about a half mile walk from my hotel, which was great being cooped up driving all day.

I went in to get something to go.  The lady was very nice and friendly.  It was empty due to the time I guess, right around 4pm local time.

They are located in a shopping center with a few other stores.

I had the garlic veggies with white rice, and it was pretty damn good.  I asked for light sauce and I got just that.  The veggies were still crunchy and not over cooked.

When I am in town again, I will definitely check them out again!

I've lived on the west side of St.Charles for 15 years and have passed Lin's many times. I finally decided to order because I discovered they deliver all the way west of Randall and because my normal Chinese place has changed hands and menus. We got the Willow Beef, Szechwan green beans, small sweet and sour chicken, combo fried rice, and egg rolls. $50 is a little pricey for this number of items but based on the reviews I took a chance. Probably won't order again.

This is the best lunch in town, bar none.  I love the soothing decor and atmosphere which lends itself perfectly to conversation.  It's warm and welcoming, and a perfect choice  great food, very reasonable prices, and a cozy environment.

The service was far better than most chinese restaurants in the area.
My party of 3 had a very attentive waitress and the (owner/manager) stopped by to ask how everything was.

The food was all very good and everyone enjoyed it.
The rangoons were nice and crispy, not oily. The General Tso chicken was flavorful but not very spicy, and the kung bao pork was right on par.... no huge surprises here.

What I really liked was the quality of the meat in all of the dishes. A lot of places use fried chicken that is 70% breading and some unidentifiable meat-ish core..... not here.
My General Tso chicken was legit chicken fried right and instantly identifiable as chicken.

The only thing stopping me from giving Lin's a full 5 stars is that the serving sizes were smaller than most other chinese places in the area.... a lighter eater in my group did have leftovers, so it's not exactly skimpy and the prices are fair for what you get, it's just more of a lunch portion.

The added bonus was that everyone's dinner agreed with them and unlike a few inferior chinese places in the area we did not have to break the speed limit home to get to the bathroom. 

I'll be back for sure.
I have been going here for over 20 years and it is the best. We travel 40 minutes to eat here and the sesame chicken is awesome.

Stick with the the Chinese Take-Out Billboard Classics.....General Tsao, Sweet & Sour, Moo-shu, Orange Flava, etc.

Lin's Garden is our go-to Take-out Chinese Food.

The restaurant is also clean and the food is consistent.

There is not a better Chinese restaurant out there. I am from the area and have been a patron for 15+ years. I have lived in different cities, in different states, and wherever and whenever I get Chinese, I am always comparing it to Lin's Garden - to this day, no other establishment has been able to come close to the taste and quality of Lin's. While I have sampled much of the menu, the staple is their Sesame Seed Chicken. Spring Rolls, Chicken Fried Rice, and Mongolian Beef are all exceptional. I would recommend the food and staff of this place any day!

Always a treat to grab lunch at Lin's!  Before talking about any food I want to say that the customer service is exceptional.  Seeing a welcoming smile from the owner and the cozy atmosphere is the prefect start to any meal. 

Today I grabbed lunch and as usual Lin's doesn't disappoint.  It started with a great bowl of Hot and Sour soup, Crab Rangoon,  egg roll and then the entree the Kung Bao Chicken and Shrimp with fried rice.  Everything was delicious and as I finished one course the next arrived. 

I think one of the best things about Lin's is the portions.  I see some people complain they are not big enough and that is ridiculous.  If you want a meal and then 4 days of leftovers this is not the place.  Unlike most restaurants that operate under the quantity over quality method, Lin's is the opposite.  Fresh food and great portion sizes  are the norm.  Judging by our collective US waistlines, more restaurants should follow Lin's lead!

Amazing food and feeling like you are family when you walk in the door are reason enough to come check out Lin's Garden!
Love this place! I could eat the pork fried rice everyday! Staff is very friendly and attentive. Would recommend the sweet & sour chicken, sesame chicken, mongolian beef and fried rice.

Lin's has been an institution in St. Charles for years.  My wife and I have been going here for years and even though we don't live in the area any longer it is on our places we'd travel to eat at.

The owners are there all the time and the service staff is very stable.  We've had the same servers for the last few years.  The recognize you and know who you are.  They even remember when my daughter was born.  In my mind any place that has that kind of attention to detail is worthy of the full 5 star routine.

Now the food...for first timers you MUST get the sesame chicken.  Most of the people we have suggested this to go in and order just this and have never strayed...yes its that good.  The potstickers, crab rangoon, beef and broccoli, mongolian beef and happy family are all out of this world.

Normally we'll get the hot tea but if the mood strikes may i suggest a zombie or mai tai?  knock your socks off.

Bottom line, there's a reason they've been there as long as they have.  Consistently great food and family friendly.

Really nice people!  They're always sweet on the phone and just as friendly in person.  Their Szechwan green beans are to die for, although salty beyond belief.  I love them anyway...if you're eating Chinese food, your concerns regarding sodium intake should be left at the door.
The rest of the entrees I've tried haven't been anything great.  Last time I ordered shrimp fried rice..the pieces of shrimp were a pretty good size, but it didn't have a lot of flavor.  My bf got the orange beef...let's just say that was a total waste of $12.  If I can convince him to return, we may be back again...otherwise I'll hit up LG for the green beans alone, they're that good.

We had crab Rangoon and egg rolls for an appetizer. Both were very good. They were cooked properly, golden brown, and not greasy. Off to a good start.

For entres we had orange chicken, one of the seafood dishes with scallops, shrimp,and lobster; and satay beef. The chicken was quality, with a nice spicy bite to the orange sauce. The seafood was excellent. I would have liked to have found a little more lobster hidden in the veggies, but the shrimp, scallops were high quality, tasty, and more plentiful. The satay sauce was very tasty also. My only Beef was that the satay beef did not seem as high quality as the seafood and chicken. A little tasteless, and tough, but in a really good sauce.

Service was outstanding.  

The setting is ok, perhaps in need of an update. However, high quality ingredients served in delishious sauces trumps beautiful dining rooms any day.

Will return, maybe for take out.

Looking for a good Chinese restaurant with the classics?  Lin's is it.  No fusion-Thai-spectacle with a sushi bar on the side.  Here there is quality food, good service and an owner who cares.  Portions are good, service excellent and there are tablecloths.  

The crispy fish in ginger sauce was lovely.  The sizzling seafood with rice cakes was chocked full of scallops, shrimp and veggies.  

If you do not want to take the time to really enjoy a meal then go for the take out.

First time visit- ordered takeout.  Had the tomato green pepper beef and the chicken egg foo yung, along with egg rolls.  First, the egg rolls were simply filled with cabbage- not good.  The tomato green pepper beef had, and this is not an exaggeration, a sliver of tomato in it- you know when you slice a tomato and the end part that you throw away- well that was the only tomato morsel in the entire meal.  The chicken egg foo yung was unlike I have ever had- thank God- I have been eating chicken egg foo yung my entire life, and this was easily the worse I have ever had.  Generally, the patty is fried with the chicken in it, and soaked in a tasty brown gravy.  Not this stuff- I was given a box with two patties of fried egg- dry- and a box of "chicken egg foo yung gravy" that was simply filled with vegetables, a couple pieces of chicken, and barley any juice/gravy- to say the least, a huge disappointment.  This was a waste of my money, and to top it all off, had to make myself my own dinner at home.  I will not ever return and would never suggest this establishment.

Was in the city for a conference this weekend and was looking to grab a quick lunch with a colleague from Vancouver. Spring rolls were decent and quite large. The barbecue pork lo mein was tasty but the noodles were a bit over-cooked.  The crispy duck was pleasant and succulent. The won ton soup was the worst I've ever had, in any country. It wasn't that it was over spiced or too salty... Au contraire. It had no taste at all! Bland would be a generous adjective. Let's be real for a minute. Ruining won ton soup is like ruining Kraft Macaroni and cheese. It's just kinda tough to mess it up I thought, with he exception of being too salty. If Lin's could fix their won ton soup then I'd give them a solid 3.5! It's not a first date type of romantic restaurant but has the potential to be a very solid short lunch or "I'd like to have Chinese without driving too far to get it" type of place.
Got the sesame chicken, it was very good, egg rolls were delicious too! The people working here are very nice and hospitable!

My wife and I love Lin's Garden.  We have been going here for 6-7 years.  We love the egg rolls and fried rice. I was also introduced to a dish called crazy noodles which I fell in love with.  It does have some kick but love the flavor. The staff is very friendly and make us feel like family when we are there.  I highly recommend eating at Lin's Garden.

Lin's Garden isn't a fancy place.  In fact, I would suggest for Lin's to update their look. On the other hand, if you are expecting exceptional hospitality and a more classic Chinese restaurant dinning experience, Lin's is the gem for you.  The food is good.  They've got selections on their menu that you might not be able to find at other local Chinese restaurants, but, what makes Lin's a gem, in my view, is the restaurant's very charming and welcoming atmosphere.  Lena, the owner, radiates a passion for hospitality and it is contiguous as her wait staff has apparently also caught it.  Just the hospitality alone will get you back for more.  Lin's Garden, a gem of a restaurant.

First time in, the owner was very friendly. Food was authentic tasting at a reasonable price. The spring rolls are a can't miss!

The exceptional service was not a one hit wonder. The owner knows what it takes it bring customers back and thats why I updated it to a 5 star.

Great! They deliver, the prices were pretty high though, if I remember correctly. I got fried rice (the combo), which was good. It had shrimp, which I didn't like (at the time) but it was rubbery, IMO. Everything else was good, won tons, egg rolls and AMAZING MOO GOO GAI PAN (Must order in stereotypical chinese restaurant voice).
Great food and great service. I ordered the crispy sesame chicken and it's out of this world!

1st time customer, ordered carryout, food was fair in quality and taste.  The chicken fried rice barely had any chicken and the same was true with the broccoli and beef and the egg rolls.  It was obvious Lin's is purposely skimping on the meat but they weren't ashamed to charge us $50.00 for a whole lot of the cheap stuff....... veggies and rice.  We have had very good experiences at other Chinese restaurants in the area and unfortunately Lin's does not compare.  We won't be back.

Returned for a second visit and really debated between General Tso chicken and the Sesame chicken. 

I went with the latter and was mildly disappointed after the yum yum in my tum tum with the Banana Chicken perhaps my expectations were set to high. Nonetheless the sesame chicken was very average in taste. it has it listed as spicy but I found it to be boring spicy. 

The portion was adequate as was service. I'll return for a third visit and most likely will go with the General's chicken in hope of getting a dish where teh spice is nice

I love this place. I always get the Orange Chicken and fried rice. The food is always good, spice tends to vary. Lin greets my boyfriend and I by name every time we come in. Service is usually pretty fast - the one female waitress can be a little over attentive, and the gentleman a little inattentive. We go here for lunch at least once a week, and I always make it back to work in time.
I moved away 10 years ago and am going to Chicago for the weekend.  Only stop I told my husband had to make was Lin's Garden.  Gotta have some sesame chicken.  Hands down the best Chinese.

Amazing restaurant! Have been here twice now with my fianc̩, the crab Rangoon is our favorite appetizer, highly recommend this. People are the sweetest of any place I've been, always friendly and welcoming. I recommend Lin's Garden.

I just love this place. I grew up eating here almost all of my life. Every time I have been here or ordered from here I have a great experience. I just wish I still lived close by so I could eat here more.
Your fortune will look sunny if you choose Lins garden.

I've had the orange chicken and seasame chicken and both were very, very good. The portions are just right and the quality is what keeps me coming back.  They get 5 stars from me because the service is the best i've seen. Waitress was very attentive and the owner is extremely kind and caring.  Great overall dining experience and I will definitly be coming back.
Love the food.  Pot-stickers and Chicken fried rice are my favorites.  Eating at Lin's or just picking something up after work is fast.  The Lunch specials is the best value.

I used to not mind this place to much until I went to other Chinese restaurants and had better. Usually most Chinese places give you a hearty serving and I'm not feeling that here. Small egg rolls with your lunch and small servings of soup too. The food isn't bad it's just kinda "there." Nothing really to exciting but not horrible. It's clean inside and looks like any other Chinese restaurant. Try it. It might be your kind of place but not really for me.
Very good food. Hands down the best lunch value for sit down or carry out Chinese. Have not eaten there for dinner.

A nice looking place, quite large, with cloth tablecloths. The atmosphere is above average for a chinese restaurant. Full bar. Prices seemed average to slightly high. Most dishes in the $8-$9 range. Had to ask for tea, usually its a given We chose the combination dinner for 2. This dinner had soup and several appteizers. Ribs, crab rangoon, shrimp toast and egrolls. A little overkill for appetizer. Our dinner consisted of sweet and sour pork, beef fried rice, and 3 delight which was a beef and chicken dish. Taste was fine but the quantilties were small. We had to ask for white rice and soy sauce. I usually like white rice with chinese food  in addition to fried rice. Service pretty slow even tho the restaurant was not crowded. Maybe carryout was consuming kitchen time. All in all just an average place.We wont go there again
we love this place. sesame chicken (extra spicy) is perfect for my taste. great service and relaxing environment too.

This place is by far the best Thai food I've had in Illinois. I'm so glad that they're located in Arlington Heights which isn't far from work/home. 

My family always orders the beef pad see ew, shrimp tom yum, chicken satay, and hot red snapper. The food is always cooked perfectly and you don't have to wait long for your food.

The workers are awesome as well and very attentive. They always ask if you need anything. 

I recommend everyone to go here! One of the best.

My husband and I went for dinner on a Tuesday night around 7pm and we were surprised to find it completely empty. The entire time we were there we didn't see a single other diner. This made us skeptical but we left with satisfied stomachs and enjoyed the food. I'm guessing this is more of a lunch spot. 

We ordered the pad thai and pad see ewe (both chicken). While the pad see ewe was moist and flavorful, the pad thai was just a bit too bland. It was the first time I ever saw pad that noodles so white. I'm used to seeing them more red-orangish in color. One we added spoonful of the hot chili sauce to the dish it was great. We also ordered and finished a very tasty thai tea.

Service was friendly and fast. There's lots of parking available in the plaza and we will probably be back soon.

Our favorite! Very consistent!
Fried tofu.
Shrimp pad thai.
Penang curry.
Love, love this restaurant.
People who live around this area are lucky!!!
Food was fairly delicious, the price was right but we had a bug crawling on our table. So gross....
For lunch special: I can have the chicken with tasty peanut sauce, and sweet sauce, with eggroll, in one plate, with entree,  rice,  and noodles!!! I'm a happy camper here. Coming back for sure!

I've eaten at a lot of Thai restaurants. Theres not too many authentic thai restaurant i know. I ordered chicken pad thai spicy, which turned out pretty good. It was better than most places I've had. It wasn't too watery or mushy. I also ordered crab rangoon. For 3 dollars they served us a lot. Waiter was very patient and pleasant. Of course i had to order thai ice coffee with my meal. It definitely hit than he spot.

I'm not quit sure how this restaurant has achieved 4 stars. My cashew chicken was seasoned like it was out of the freezer section...where were the vegetables???
It indicated spicy my goodness I needed to dump the jar of hot sauce on it.

I would not recommend this place even if you can bring your own!

I'm starting this off with an admission to what you may already know about my Mother. I love hanging out with her! Just because some of our moments are captured on Yelp and she's mentioned in the reviews, it doesn't mean we get along the entire time we're together.

Now that I'm thinking about it, a conflict ensues when she becomes hungry and asks me where I want to eat. Today, I wanted Fried Rice; but, my mom didn't want Chinese food as soon as she called Chef Ping to place an order and found out the restaurant is closed on Mondays.

Both of us agreeing with Thai for lunch was too good to be true. She showed me a menu from a place she recently tried with her boyfriend and I wasn't impressed. It took my finesse and this app for her to cooperate with me.

Yelp provided over one hundred reviews but it was someone's photo of their  Shrimp Pad Nar that won me over. I don't even know how many times I skipped over this place because of its curious name. Now, Thai Little Home has us wanting more!

Fast and friendly service (even when calling ahead for pick up).

Awesome flavors. No MSG. Easy on the Soy sauce. Perfection!

Decent portions for sharing (or not).

Reasonable prices and conveniently close to my Mom's...
We have tried almost all the dishes here. The one dish that we did not like was the ground beef noodles.
The service was great the food also was very good I had the pad see eww and it was absolutely delious with the Thai iced tea

Great little place to stop in for lunch. They have a great lunch special that provide fried rice, pad thai, chicken satay, cucumber salad, eggroll, and one side of your choice for under $10. The service is fast and portions are more than reasonable. 

I have tried their papaya salad and was a bit disappointed at the lack of flavor, but I am a harsh critic as I use my Mom's recipe for comparison.

This place will be missed as the owners announced they'll be closing this wonderful establishment sometime this year. Occasionally come here when I'm craving sweet Thai food. We always come in for the same thing as it isn't made the same anywhere else, the fried chicken and rice, the amazingly savory sweet red snapper and the mouth watering chicken satay with peanut sauce. It is simply out of this world. We all hope and pray they reconsider their decision on closing, or at least one of their relatives inherits these amazing recipes and continues blessing us with their wonderful food.

I first visited this place on my first day of work.  The food here is close to authentic as you can find in the area.  They have really good lunch specials which are served with an egg roll, chicken satay, pad thai(no meat) and fried rice(no meat) all for $7.25

There is ample seating space and the service is quick.  The place is SO unassuming as it looked like it was empty from the outside.  I visited on a Thursday and the place was full of visitors eating their delicious food.  I'm pretty surprised that the area doesn't have more Quality Thai restaurants but this place definitely fits the bill.

I would definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a somewhat authentic Thai restaurant in the Arlington Hts / Schaumburg area.

The owners of this restaurant received 5 stars for their attentiveness and friendliness; however, I could not rate the food the same way. Im a sucker for good crab rangoon, so I order that plus the spicy chicken lunch special, which was ambitious. I knew they had larger portions with cheap prices, but I can eat a lot.  Anyways, it was good, but not the best I've ever had. With that being said, I still ate most of my meal only taking home a little box.

The crab rangoons were small and crispy. I feel like they could have added more cream cheese/ crab filling. 

The egg role in the lunch special was bomb, but everything else was pretty average. My spicy chicken was not spicy at all. I think they didn't put the sauce on it? 

Pro tip: Use the spoon they give you for the Pad Thai. I know some people are probably rolling their eyes at how obvious this suggestion is, but they cut the noodles up into tiny pieces which makes it hard to manage with a fork alone.

I would recommend coming here, but don't hype it up too much to friends or colleagues.

By far the best Thai food I've ever had in my life! My family has been coming here for the longest time over 30 years! Since they were on kedzie. It's our family's favorite Thai restaurant. I've tried so many Thai restaurants and no one compares to little home. Staff is real friendly, plenty of parking, not a fancy place but it sure is does have the best Thai food. My favorite dish is the beef with green peppers and tomatoes and the chicken egg noodle dish. I also like the shrimp fried rice, chicken kang nua, and their red snapper with pepper sauce is THE BEST!

Slow, rude service. Our waitress came for the first time after we had been seated for 15 solid minutes and didn't come back again. After waiting an hour for one dish, I went up to pay for my drink and leave because it hadn't come out, and she just pointed at my table as their bus boy was putting it down just now. The host was nice and its byob- but overall a very inconvenient experience.
I suggest that the owner have a serious talk with their wait staff and kitchen
My absolute favorite restaurant. Good authentic Thai cuisine with generous portions and good prices. Fish cakes, pad see ew, and fried red snapper with peppers are must-haves!

This review is based on their crab rangoons and their egg rolls. I have tried them twice now, and they are a little TOO greasy - and the crab rangoons have little to no filling. Please make them less greasy and put more crab filling in those rangoons. :)
Food was good the only disappointment was the pad Thai which was super bland. Egg rolls, satay and basil chicken were definitely good. Stay away from the pad Thai.

The food is excellent, and the service is fast. There's not much more you can ask from a restaurant.  

I recommend coming here for the lunch special from 11 AM - 2:30 PM, Monday - Friday (the restaurant is closed on Wednesdays, though). You'll get a lot for $7.25 (There's a $2 upcharge for a dish with shrimp or squid). With your choice of Pad Khee Mao, Pad See Ewe, a Thai Basil dish with your choice of meat or tofu,  a red curry dish with your choice of meat or tofu, plus four other dishes, you can't go wrong.
