Each lunch special comes with an egg roll, chicken satay, Pad Thai (meatless), and fried rice (meatless).  I typically get the Beef Pad See Ewe, which is always good. In particular, I like how the dish has the perfect balance of noodles, meat, and Chinese broccoli. 

As for the restaurant's other offerings, we enjoy the shrimp toast and the Thai calamari. The individual pieces of toast and calamari are big. Both dishes have a nice batter on them. I particularly like the Thai calamari's delicate batter, which allows the calamari to largely stand on its own. 

The service here is fast, and you'll get the attention you need even if there are lots of diners. You shouldn't have a problem finding seating here either. Just walk right in - no fuss. 

Thai Little Home comes highly recommended!

After reading all these positive reviews... I was waaay psyched to try this place on a long commute home. One of these days... as a reward for being patient in this ridic traffic... 

Today was the day... And WTF??? People... called ahead to take my standby Thai favorites... Baseline assessment by Beef Pad Siew and Chicken Pad Khee Mao (sans onions).

Bagged with no sauces menus or fortune cookies can be forgiven... I could have asked for the vinegar jalape̱o stuff... but it was a flag... hot food in clear plastic containers suitable for salad... usually hot food would melt these?

Okay... to the food. Was this leftovers?  The noodles were tepid, overcooked to the point of mush and super oily. NO flavor at all... for EITHER dish. Wow... the proteins tasted like oil too. Verdict? 

BLAAHH....AND.... Bland....Never again.  Waste of $20.

Maybe they have a different cook at lunchtime or something?!!

Great food coming from ordinary yet great people. Was quiet and peaceful,  the staff welcoming and accommodating. Overall a pleasantly nice experience. Great tasting food. Price range mid to low range. A+

Prices are reasonable, authentic Thai food. BYOB... can't get any better than that. 
Service is great. I have been here numerous times and never an issue.. yet.

The food took literally 40 minutes. Even for the appetizer, it took that long. 
I ordered Pad See Ew and the rice noodles were not chewy at all, it tasted like it was years old and overcooked. Took forever to get our check.
They didn't charge is for that but their food overall was not very good. Never going back here again.

this place is amazing!!! food is simply delicious, staff is friendly and they never get the orders wrong EVER. It is a cozy little place nothing too fancy, just good food period. Very fresh Thai food to warm your soul.

Dined here with a colleague during a couple days of corporate training.  Picked it based on the Yelp reviews.  

We ordered a mussels appetizer - it was my colleagues first time having mussels.  They were in a flavorful broth, but some of them were gritty so meh.  Also ordered a chicken satay app - that was delicious.  Perfectly cooked chicken with a succulent peanut sauce.

For dinner we ordered the same dish prepared with two different meats - this is where it gets weird.  So I am sitting there devouring my dinner and I notice that my colleague doesn't appear to be enjoying his.  I asked him about it and he said it was not great - since I loved mine, I wondered if it was him or me.  Turns out that even though they were the same dish, mine was WAY better.  I am not sure how the beef or chicken affected this, but its like we were eating two different things.  

The service was abysmally slow, I think due to the fact that they had a large birthday party.

There are other places I would try before I return here.

This Thai Restaurant has really great food in a very casual atmosphere.  We have been here at least a dozen times for both lunch and dinner.  We have tended to stick with the single dish we like, so we can't offer a wide review of their menu.  For lunch, the amount of food you get for the Lunch Special is enormous.  I've had friends actually leave food on their plates.

The service is pleasant, but a little inconsistent.  Also, there are a few tables on the West side of the restaurant where there is a TV and they do some set up.  We've sat on that side a couple times and it's a little disappointing.  But, we've only been there when they are crowed on the East side.  

We will be back.  It's our go to Thai restaurant.
New to Thai food, but after one taste of the Pad Tai and the Pad See Ewe, I'm hooked!  Order the lunch special and eat happy!
Good food! Nice place, very neat and very friendly service. Had no expectations but the food will definitely make you happy.

I love Thai Little Home! It's a family restaurant! And the best thing is the FOOD!!! Everything is fresh, tasty, flavorful and very well prepared. The appetizers are Bomb! The entries are filling and good portions! We do a family style setting; and get to taste a little bit of everything! It's BYOB!  
You get the chance to pair your favorite wine with excellent food! The serves are very attentive and accommodating! We have follow them since they had the location on Lawrence and kedzie; and we go all the way to Arlington heights from Chicago  just to have a good time and to have Thai food! Love it!

I went to Thai Little Home Cafe for a quick lunch yesterday. Loved it!

I wish I saw Candice's review before I went. BYOB is the bestest! Duly noted for next time.

Thai Little Home Cafe is tucked away in this rundown strip mall but is nice on the inside - nicer than what you'd think you would find here. We went in with the intentions of having a very fast lunch to make a movie and it happened just as we needed to. We ordered, the food came out really quickly and they were fast about bringing our bill and running our card. Plus they were on top of refilling our drinks through the meal.

I ordered the Chicken Pad See Ewe and loved it! It was a big portion for a good price. The chicken was super moist and cooked just the right amount. The noodles in the dish were great. Overall, loved what I ate!

I want to go back for lunch because they have some good prices on specials! And come back, I shall!

We ordered take away dinner. Someone picked up the phone very promptly and the dinner was ready in 15 mins. Good portion size. I ordered Green Curry : 5/5 and Chicken chow mein : 3/5.
Food tastes really good, great service.

PS: I found a stapler pin in my mouth while eating chowmein. My request the chef is please be careful.
Watery curry, noodles that smell of old oil, and smaller than average portions. Mostly just tastes like the disappointment it is.

8pm Tuesday night.  I am the only patron in the restaurant.  Service should be really good I hope.

Starting with the Tom Yum Kai soup.  It is coconut milk based which has a unique taste. I did not find it spicy.  I did kick it up a notch with chili sauce. Chicken and mushrooms were very satisfying.  Large enough to share. Temperature was almost perfect, I am not a fan of Luke warm soup.  Would have been perfect on a really cold night. I ate maybe half of the soup.

Next was an eggplant dish with beef.  Advertised as a spicy dish, I found it tame but very tasty.  The beef was just a bit chewy, but when eaten with the eggplant and julienned carrots, it was a wonderful explosion of tastes.  The serving size was just right, not overwhelming. Especially after the soup.

Even though I was the only person in the restaurant, the rice was perfect.  Not mushy at all so it had to have been pretty freshly made.  That is a big deal. 

Not entirely done, probably over did it with the homemade coconut ice cream.  It was the only thing that was just okay.

All for $18.69 plus tip.  Worth every penny.  You don't have to spend a fortune to have an enjoyable meal.

Once again the yelp community was right on. Thank you.  I travel a lot and depend on your comments.

Best asian joint in the area. Been going here since it was a establishment in Chicago on the North Side.

Appetizers: 

Fish cakes - amazing -- it may sound different, but you will not be disappointed. 

Fried wontons - cheap and addicting. Not going to fill you, but are very tasty.

Satay Chicken - fantastic, it's good sized portion for the price, although it may seem pricey.


Main Dishes:

Pad see ewe - adored by my sister.  She gets this once a week to keep her sanity, I think. 

Chicken with egg noodle - beloved by family and guests when I serve this.

Fried Rice Dishes - would take a punch from Mike Tyson for ...


The FRIED RICE is amazing and is better than any place you can go to, even high priced chains.  Do yourself a favor and get beef fried rice from here.


Other thoughts:

Still home ran by the family who had it in Chicago for years when my parents were just in their 20s (they're in 60s now).  Still roll the napkins and silverware the same way.  Always a friendly staff.

Red sauce on the table is traditional Thai spicy and is delicious.



Key Money Savor:   

BYOB


Bring a cheap bottle of wine from Trader Joe's and you're going to pay $40 for 2 people with a bunch of appetizers and left overs. Great for a casual date night OR a new date where you want to impress your significant other with amazing food so that you look like a connoisseur. 

Final Thoughts:


I no longer order Chinese. Thai Little Home ALL DAY.


Message to the owners:


Thanks for moving 5 minutes from me when we originally lived off Lawerence and Kedzie and you were the same distance away.  Rock on!

Went here for lunch on two occasions this past week. Both times I ordered from their lunch special menu. Both times the food was consistent and the portion was huge enough that I couldn't even finish it. The fact I liked the most is that the food seemed 'clean'...meaning I was convinced that they properly washed and prepped the food before cooking it unlike some other Asian restaurants I have been to in past where the chicken would smell like old rags.
Their service is also amazing....perfect in my mind. The morning server is really quite but extremely observant. As soon as you enter the door, she will be waiting with the menus and as soon as you wipe your hands with the napkin after your meal, she will be ready with your check. She does everything in extreme stealth mode and doesn't always hover over you for the type of service she provides. She should be truly rewarded because in my mind a good server is not someone who can chat up a storm but someone who is attentive, quick and effective. So full points on that. 
I also don't agree with any one star reviews. One star should be reserved for a place that is horrible in all aspects and doesn't even try to improve. You can't possibly give a small business one star because your one item wasn't up to your standards based on just one visit. It could mean a death sentence for them when they are just trying to do their best. And by no means this restaurant is so bad that it deserves such a low rating....that's just my opinion.

Con's:
Noodles were over cooked, super soft and way too oily, order Basil or Cashew instead if you'd like to avoid noodles or give it try, maybe they have improved it already.

Pro's
Clean
Huge portions
Consistent food
Cheap
Awesome service
Balanced lunch special
Awesome chicken and pad Thai

Will be back next week to try something new. Thanks.

My wife and I went for takeout and we were pleasantly suprised. It was very good. We like everything spicy and the spice was hot and had good flavor. The only reason I give it 4 and not 5 stars is the portions were smaller then I thought they should be.

Love this place. Great service for sit down and you can BYOB!! I had my birthday party here 2 years in a row very delicious and affordable. My favorite is the pad se ew, but the pad Thai is delicious as well as the curry dishes. 5 stars!

When visiting Chicago, I came here with a group of friends and enjoyed a great meal! We tried so many dishes, but my favorites were definitely the spicy & sour seafood soup, whole fish with chillies, red curry, and pad thai! Everything was so delicious, had a ton of flavor, and the portions are extremely generous. The seafood in the soup was so fresh, and the shrimp were huge.

I wish I lived in the area so I could go back! They also have these little banana desert rolls, that are lightly fried and dusted with sugar. Those on top of their homemade coconut ice cream was a perfect finish to the meal. Best Thai food I've ever had. Definitely recommend going there!

Appropriately priced. Average service. Food came out with appropriate timing.
Ordered a Pad Thai with chicken ($8.95 for dinner) and the bf ordered Basil Leaf entree with beef.
The Pad Thai was just average. To be honest, it looked lighter in color than most pad thai that I've ordered, but I can't say that it took away from the flavor. It really seemed to be just noodles, eggs and chicken. Other places I've gone too usually add some spice and some green onions and stuff. 

Bottom line: it satisfied my craving for Thai food, but I might try other places next time.

The staff were friendly but had very little personality. 
The place was empty @ 7pm on  a Tuesday night. 
Had the wonton soup and yellow curry chicken. 
I would give the wonton soup 3 out of 10. The yellow chicken curry 8 out of 10. 
Would I come back, no !!!

BYOB. BYOB. BYOB. 

ABC's of Thai Little Home Cafe's Awesomeness. 

A. Affordable.
B. BYOB. BYOB. BYOB. (in case you missed it the first time around)
C. Charming (and really, with enough BYOB supplies, what isn't?) and the Cutest restaurant name ever, and Cost effective (so Cheap!)
D. Delicious
E. Exotic
F. Fast (Holy Crap- this was lightning speed) and Family owned + operated

...alright, imma be honest: I don't feel like finding an adjective for every letter of the alphabet just to be cute so I'm gonna go ahead and skip to my favorite reason (after BYOB) .


S. SPICY!!!  Finally, a Thai food venue that understands when a hot blooded woman says she wants it extra spicy, she frickin' means it. And I like the type of spicy their food is... it's both hot pepper spicy and black pepper spicy. Aaand they earned extra bonus points for having that spicy stuff right on the table for additional DIY spicing. 

End Alphabet. 

Sure there are lots more reasons I love Thai Little Home Cafe but really, if I didn't have you by 'BYOB' I probably wasn't going to win you over with 'C' through 'Z', anyway. My personal menu recos- Spicy Basil Leaves w/ Tofu and the spring rolls. The atmosphere isn't going to put you over the top but the food is good, the portions are large, the prices are low and I swear to you, my leftovers tasted even better the next day- So Delish!

A loyal and repeat customer of this establishment. My family and I have been coming to this restaurant for decades since it was originally established in Chicago and still continue to make the trip out to the suburbs to eat at the new location. 

From the moment you walk in you can see the numerous newspaper and food articles that rave about the food. This place has been a big part of Chicago's Thai food community since the 70's! Way before the whole Thai food craze began and still family owned and continues to put out authentic and excellent Thai dishes. I'm sure there are a bunch of the older generation folks who, if they knew what yelp was or how to use it, wouldn't hesitate to give this place 5 stars.

There is something for everyone at this place. 

1. If you are dining on a budget, all the menu items are cheap and, in my opinion, under priced for the high quality and large portions you get. (no that wasn't a typo, you seriously get more than your money's worth)

2. They offer a variety of freshly prepared and tasty Thai dishes from the classic and well known Pad-Thai to  uncommon dishes like Larb-Kai and other spicy salads. My favorites are the Red Snapper with the house special sauce and the Chicken-egg noodles.

3. If no. 1 applies to you and you enjoy alcohol, then here is another reason to go to this place, it's BYOB and located in the same strip mall as a liquor store!

lastly, service is always top notch. The wait staff is always attentive and the owners love engaging with the customers and taking time out to talk and make relationships.

Go here for either lunch, dinner or take out and you are sure to get a great dining experience!

Absolutely amazing. EVERYTHING is handmade from the crab rangoon, to the sauces, to the coconut ice cream (all mom's recipes)!!!! This family owned, BYOB joint will make you crave Thai food all the time.  Get the lunch special during the week to get great deals on a huge Thai sampler plate. The curry soup and spicy basil with chicken dish are both incredible.   I even saw kids who loved this place.  Cannot wait to return!!!!

This review is just for the Pad Thai I had. Price, portion size, and taste are what's wrong with the Pad Thai. It was almost $10 which is a little high for some Pad Thai. You get a small container of it which contained very little beef. The worst part of it was when I looked at it, the noodles were almost as white as the fresh cabbage they have included. I knew right then and there that it was going to be very bland and I was right. It was still bland even after using some of the soy sauce that they have included. Huge disappointment.

Was thrilled to find this nice family owned restaurant.   The prices are excellent  (most entrees  are 8.95)  and everything was freshly prepared.   We tried the penang curry, red curry and the pad khee Mao noodles.  We liked them all very much.  I was pleased to see the panang curry was light and with a great marriage of flavors not the gloopy mess that you get so many places.
Additionally I was pleased that it was immaculately clean.  Not the most update furnishings but clean wins every time.
BYOB is a plus

Three of us stopped in ( all 3 of us major eaters)
One of my friends that lives local has been eating here for years, for the other 2 of us was 1st time.
We had an incredible manjfest! 
6 appetizers  and 5 Entr̩es 
3 Spring rolls - perfect  little start to  cleanse pallet
Shrimp toast - very tasty 
fried dumplings - delicious
chicken satay 
chicken in a brown light delicious sauce with cashews
Pad thai w chicken
3 orders of  WHOLE FRIED SNAPPER that were super tasty ! 
very good service. Prices incredibly reasonable
Love this place, will be back next time in Chicago

I'm on the hunt for great Thai food in the northwest suburbs area and this place has the rest beat! I always have the chicken satay, Thai egg rolls, and the beef pad see ewe, this place did the job. 

The ambiance is nice and quiet with a beautiful clean dining area. Small and quaint the way I like. Very fast service too, everything was piping hot and served at the perfect moment. Staff was extremely nice and always there if you needed anything. 

I only gave it a 4 because the pad see ewe was not as tangy as I like. I like a little more vinegar and maybe more spice. The taste was not the same that I'm used too. But still enjoyed it.

Absolutely love this place and love that it's BYOB. The tom kha soup is phenomenal, and the curries are also really good. But I've had a lot of other things on the menu and I actually haven't had anything here I didn't like. It's all good. The service is always great as well, the staff are really nice here.

Maybe i ordered the wrong dish (quite possibly) but it wasn't very tasty.  I ordered the chicken pad thai..yes I know that's not true, authentic Thai, but I like trying it at every Thai restaurant just to compare.  The dish was very light colored and tasted like peanut noodles.  I wouldn't say it was bad per se but I wasn't satisfied after the meal was over.  Maybe I just need to try something else if I were to return?

Great Thai food! Love their Pad Kee Mao and Penang Curry....they make it all good! Also, I think the quality of their meat is better than most Thai places...when you order beef it tastes like good quality beef which is always a plus.

Thai Little Home is a must if you live in the greater Chicago area. Family owned and operated, with an atmosphere that is very warm and inviting. You must try the whole fried red snapper-- so good! The tom yum soup is also really flavorful and hits the spot. Red curry is a favorite of mine, and the lad na and chicken egg noodle dishes are also great. I have not had a bad thing here, you really can't go wrong. Yum!

Great restaurant - we went there last Friday and everything we had was very good!

We had the Thai Calamari which was perfectly cooked and tender - so many places overcook it and it turns into a texture similar to rubber bands.

For entrees we had Pad Thai (tofu), Pad Woonsen (Squid) and Panang Curry (Vegetables/Tofu).  The Pad Thai was one of the best I have ever had - a good balance between sweet/savory.  The Pad Woonsen was also very good and again, the squid was cooked to perfection.  Unfortunately, while I liked the flavor of the Panang Curry, the consistency of the sauce fell short of expectations.  It was a both consistency - it did not adhere to the rice or the other ingredients at all which, for me, is a big negative.  I love the sauce so much and want to eat it all, not leave it in a puddle on the plate.

Another nice plus is that they are BYOB  They were very welcoming of it and brought out wine glasses and opener as soon as we sat down.

We'll be back - the Deep Fried Red Snapper looked excellent - there were at least three other tables that had ordered it while we were there!

So glad I found this place after it closed in Chicago. I grew up eating at this place so they set my standard for Thai food. Family owned and the nicest friendliest people ever. And their shrimp fried rice is perfect. Along with their chicken satay, and fish cakes!

my husband ordered take out - pad thai and pineapple fried rice. both dishes are tasteless, the veggie in the fried rice are uncooked and the meat is unseasoned. I have had several trips to Thailand and dine at many thai restaurants in the States. this place is the worst so far, even a dish from food court is better. their fried rice should be called unseasoned veggie salad mixed with stir fried rice. will never go there again.
Entrees have good taste, but smaller quantity than usual. Otherwise good food if you are in the direct vicinity but I would go out of my way to dine here.

I recently moved from Park Ridge to Arlington Heights and was searching for a good Thai food nearby. I decided to try this place because of all the positive reviews on Yelp! I was greatly disappointed. 

To be fair, I am a very tough critic when it comes to Thai food since I have traveled to Thailand so many times and tried all kind of things while I was there. 

I ordered chicken and pork satay, crab rangoon, lad na noodle and chicken fried rice. The satay could use a longer marinating time or cut the meat thinner I suppose. It was pretty tasteless. The peanut sauce was ok, I prefer my with a little kick of red curry. 

Crab rangoon was very disappointing. Barely any filling and overcooked. My kids look at it and was like "is this crab rangoon or fried wonton?" It was dark brown and less than a dime size stuffing.

Lad na noodle was not edible. I ended up throwing it out because it was way too salty. The sauce was also runny like soup, not like the traditional lad na gravy sauce. It also didn't fill up the to go container all the way. It looks like leftover just like someone else already said on here. Also, no vinegar with pepper to go with my lad na noodle. 

The fried rice was ok. Kids ate it but could use some vegetables in it. The 2 slices of cucumber was a joke.The fried rice was more like chinese fried rice, not thai fried rice. Also, did not fill up the container completely. No lime. Thai fried rice with no lime?

I paid almost $40 for food and probably will have to pay another $40 for the dry cleaning. I left smelling like the kitchen.The smell stick to my coat. They need to fix the hood because the smell is leaking out into the dining area.

I guess the further you are from the city, the worse thai food gets. I'll stick with my 2 favorite places in Niles and Morton Grove from now on.

Came here on Friday night with my friends and hubby and had such an awesome time!!! The place was quite spacious and cozy and reminded me of a cafe that we ate at in Phuket a few years back. The service was spot on, everything was brought out pretty fast and hot just the way we like it. 

Onto the important part, the Thai goods. We started with some Thai egg rolls which were very fresh and delicious. Crunchy outer edge the way it needs to be. Then we got the crab ragoons, which were served smaller than we are used to but also delicious. Then again, we did get like 10 little ones as opposed to 5-6 big ones that I'm used to, so overall you get your money's worth. Then we got a few pad Thai's to share and they were light colored like a few people have mentioned, but also tasty. I'm very picky on my pad Thai so I don't know if I would get it here again, but then again it was still okay. I've just definitely had better. Now onto the best dish of the night, the pan fried red snapper with jalapeno peppers. OH MY is all I have to say, it was outstanding. Super spicy, super fresh, with like a sweet edge on the crust, it was just out of this world amazing. The place without the fish would be like a 3 star but that fish alone takes it up a notch. 

I will definitely be back and will bring more friends and family here and get like 5 fish orders. Wish it was a tad closer to my house, but will make the trip on a cold winter night. Oh and one more thing, it is BYOB which make it even more amazing!
CLOSED FOR VACATION returning March 25, 2015. FYI the family is on vacation and is closed right now. Amazing food though when open. Loved the red curry and drunken noodles. Definitely going back.

The food here is great. The lunch portions (around seven bucks) are huge and includes a egg roll, pad thai, fried rice, satay and your choice of protein. I have been to a number of thai places in the area but I feel I can get a great value here and the staff is very friendly. I usually take my co-workers here whenever I am going out to lunch.

So glad we finally found this place!!  After our favorite Thai restaurant closed a couple years ago, we were unable to find a place even half as good.  This was the last place we tried on our Thai quest.  We ordered the thai calamari, chicken tom yum soup, spicy fried rice, pad thai, and basil chicken.  Everything was delicious and so flavorful!  We have a new favorite Thai restaurant:)

I went here for lunch the other day based on the Yelp reviews I saw. Being from CA, I have had my fair share of Thai food, so I decided to come here.
D̩cor: 5 star -nice & casual. Some nice Thai inspired pieces- 
Service: 5 stars- waitress was attentive and kept an eye out on us. We did go later in the afternoon after the lunch hour. 
Food: 3 star. It wasn't bad but it wasn't great. We started with some Thai eggrolls which were freshly fried but dripping in oil. I got the red curry with chicken lunch special. There was a lot of food; an eggroll, chicken satay, red curry, fried rice, cucumber salad and some pad thai all for around $7 or so. The cucumber salad was nice and refreshing but other than that nothing stood out.

Generous lunch specials!  

Service- The service was amazing. It's so refreshing to have things taken off the table or your drinks refilled without even asking!  

Food- I started off the crab rangoons. Delish. They were light and crispy. I then had the lunch special. On the "platter" you get an 1 egg roll, 1 chicken satay, plain fried rice, plain pad thai, cucumber & onion salad, and your item of choice!  I had the beef pad see ew. Very good. It is an enormous amount of food for the money but who would complain about that?  Not me :)
My only issue was that some of the bigger pieces of beef were a little pink inside but otherwise everything was tasty. 

I would definitely go back again!

I don't know why the reviews are so good. My wife and i had two different dishes and they both are pathetic. Red curry tofu and curry chicken fried rice. If reviews are good meaning at least one should be good right?

I'm a regular here and everything is always delicous and the staff is always super friendly. The food is exceptional and I'm hard pressed to find a Thai restauarant just as good anywhere else.
I will warn you that it gets packed on saturday nights.

Highly recommended restauarant

They can get 4 stars just for the fresh made fish cake. It's full of taste of fish, not frozen ones. Fried rice was good as well. 

It's not a Wow restaurant. But with the price I think they do a pretty good job.

I am not Thai so I would not know if food is authentic or not.

refreshing! I haven't found any new good thai places in a while, so I was pleased coming here. Went with family for lunch, and pretty much everything across the board was good!

pad thai- on the lighter side. they use more of a sweet chili sauce than the peanut sauce
red curry and panang curry - acceptable, but pretty heavy on the peanut sauce-- i prefer my curry sweeter with more coconut milk, and this was more thick and chunky than milky.
squid salad- a new try, and i liked it! squid cooked perfectly,
chicken satay - standard
pad see ewe- light on the veggies, but also good.

I think this place is good because it's on the lighter side, not too greasy. standard fare without any disappointments. definitely a good go-to for thai in the area.

It was a Sunday, and we were looking for a decent Thai restaurant near the area, and found this place. Overall, the visit was unremarkable. First off, the service while fast, it was delivered with no enthusiasm or an ounce of friendliness. We ordered tom yum seafood soup, pad see ew, and basil fried rice. While everything was okay tasting, nothing really stood out as different or better than its tens of other competitors in the area. My search for authentic and thai would continue...

Plenty of parking in this strip mall but do not let that fool you. This place will get busy quickly during prime hours.

The ambiance is light, bright, refreshing, and clean with minimal decor but still definitely Thai.

The owner is usually the host and there to greet you with a warm and friendly welcome.

There is a liquor store two doors down in case you forget to BYOB.

I have eaten many a Thai dish and this place is right on par with the best of them and for the money it's one of my local favorite places.

Their spicy is spicy. Mild is mild. Everything is full of flavor and steaming hot.

They can handle big parties, too. Line the tables in a row and take over the whole joint.

Came here last night before a show at the Metropolitan Performing Arts Center in Arlington Heights... only a 6 minute drive away! Serendipitously convenient!

I have to be honest, though, I'm not sure it quite lived up to its reviews.  My brother ordered some pot stickers that he thought were dried out (my dad seemed to agree), and my mom was disappointed with her chicken panang curry, saying it was very one-note and lamented the lack of vegetables.  My dad ordered their iced coffee with condensed milk, and found it too sweet-- though I think both of my parents take the blame upon themselves for ordering things they didn't know very much about.

However, I really enjoyed my vegetables red curry entree with tofu.  It's definitely spicy, but also has quite a few vegetables in it (unlike most of their entrees!)  My brother liked his chicken satay and pork fried rice, my dad liked his pad thai, and my mom really liked the tom ka kai soup with chicken that she ordered.  Anything with meat comes with a full animal's worth, which is definitely a good thing value-wise, but doesn't do much for balanced dishes.

One other thing-- we had to flag our waiter down quite a lot, certainly more than was warranted by the mostly-empty Thursday night dining room.  Overall, I definitely enjoyed my food, and it really was a great value, and they serve coke products! But it was nothing outstanding, like so many of these reviews seem to claim.
Great lunch specials, but unfortunately the chicken is very rubbery. Ordered take out today(Basil chicken) and was not happy with the dish. The chicken was inedible.
Great lunch menu! Great value and plenty of great food! Fast service as well-
Best Thai food to date. Nice setting, staff was good and the food was amazing. I went for a work lunch & I will definitely be back soon. Amazing food must try.
Huge lunch special portions but poor quality food. Very bland and barely middle of the road when it comes to Thai cuisine.

Just recently, I gave my Dad a shout-out because we enjoyed one of his favorite restaurants. So to give my Mom equal spotlight time, I have to review one of her favorite restaurants! 

I've visited here several times--actually always with my folks. We seem to get the same waitress each time but that's not a bad thing. Service is always timely, friendly and attentive. It's a pretty space, white tablecloths give it a more formal feel but it's still really casual. 

We always get the pork satay. I was a chicken satay person but Mom knows best--she said the pork satay will have better flavor because it's will hold up better--more tender and juicy--than say white meat in chicken satay. She's totally right! The pork satay has a good flavor, very tender. Add their yummy home-made peanut sauce it just amps up the flavor! 

For noodles, we pass on the Pad Thai and opt for Pad Khee Mao--wide rice noodles, Thai basil, bell peppers and Thai peppers. You can choose your choice of beef, chicken, shrimp but we always get tofu. Wonderful basil flavor, nice spice and the tofu is cooked perfectly--firm and not mushy. 

Our other go-to dishes include the House Fried Rice--we choose shrimp. The fried rice is light and not greasy. Nice pieces of tomato, onions and green onions. Topped with a fried egg, you could totally make this a meal in itself. The deep-fried snapper, either spicy or sweet/sour, is a great dish too. Fresh fish and it holds up well to the spicy or sweet/sour sauce. The Thai Iced Coffee is always a must. Very good flavor and because it's a little sweet, it helps cool off the palate when you're enjoying all the spicy food. 

So listen to your Mom, she'll never steer you wrong!

Bleh. 

It's the one word I would use to describe this restaurant. 

Food was not good at all. The pad see ewe I ordered was too oily. Although, they did have good shrimp toast. But, that was probably the highlight of my meal.

I gave this place two stars instead of one, only because of their lunch special. Lunch specials are only about 7 dollars, and you get a bunch of food. You get fried rice, pad thai, chicken sate, and an egg roll - in addition to the entree you order. It was very filling - but, I don't know if I would ever fill my stomach with that food again.

Also, service was mediocre. One of the things I hate the most when eating in restaurants, is when they don't serve the food all at once. I was in a group of about 15 people, and we all got our food at different times. The curry came out first. Five minutes later, a few more dishes came out. Another five minutes later, another couple dishes. And five minutes later, the last of the dishes. So, one person got their food first, and 15 minutes later the last three people got their food. A fifteen minute difference between meals coming out is not acceptable in my opinion. 

If you do still end up going here - like I said, the shrimp toast was pretty good. Other than that, don't waste your time.

This place has the best Thai food in the suburbs period! There are no other Thai restaurants that brings the quality and authenticity like this one. The per entr̩e price is extremely fair and the portions are large! The staff is very friendly and the establishment has been family owned and operated for over 30 years. I've been going to this restaurant since it was located on the north side of Chicago. I always eat here with my fianc̩, friends, family and co workers and would highly recommend to anyone. I forgot to mention they have lunch specials Monday through Friday (closed Wednesday) as well. Give it a try and you will not be disappointed.

Excellent food! We've only tried it take out but since we moved around here we've been picking it up every week! The dining room does well too, always a good sign. Only takes 15-20 minutes. My favorite dishes so far are the Pad Se Ewe, Rice Noodles with egg, Chicken Satay.
Delicious food, one of my favorite Thai spots!

I don't get it. Yes, this place is cheap, but the food is not great. I ordered the pad see ewe lunch special, and it came with lots of other food (pad thai, egg roll, chicken satay, fried rice, cucumbers). I was impressed with the amount of food they gave, but much less impressed with the actual taste. The pad thai was very dry and looked/tasted like an instant pad thai dish I had made in the microwave before. I was too full to eat my chicken satay, so I can't comment on that. Everything else was just okay. Again, yes it is cheap, but I think I'd rather pay more somewhere else and get better Thai food.

Best Thai Food I have ever had. Family has been coming to this place for over 40 years! (it used to be in the northside on Kedzie). Love this place, you will never be disappointed. I love their chicken satay, chicken fried rice, and spicy red snapper! I've been to many Thai restaurants and I have to say hands down..this is the best one!!

My husband and I were celebrating our wedding anniversary and I selected this place for their lunch special. I had no idea the servings would be so large! But the food was so good, we both finished everything! The lunch special includes fried rice, pad thai (no meat), one chicken satay (moist and delicious), one egg roll (really tasty), peanut sauce for the satay, sweet & sour sauce for the egg roll. I had mixed vegetables with chicken which included peapods and baby corn and garlic and lots of other veggies; he had the beef with tomato and green pepper in gravy. Service was excellent, food was quick to arrive, nice and hot, quite delicious. Presented very attractively.
Definitely plan to return.

I am so glad that my fianc̩ and I found this place! The lunch specials are HUGE and very inexpensive and their food in delicious! I get the "Garlic Sauce" dish with chicken or tofu and it is amazing every time.

I recently moved to Chicago and absolutely love this spot when I'm craving Thai food! My favorites are the sweet and sour whole red snapper, the seafood soup and the cashew chicken. Although I've tried a lot of other items and never been disappointed! The fried bananas are also delicious for dessert. Lunch specials are a great value as well. A great family-owned, local spot. Highly recommend!!

Wow, first time Yelp post writer, but it was just that good! The food was incredible, probably some of the best pad thai I have ever had. I almost always get pad thai, so I consider myself an expert:) My friends all ordered difference dishes like the whole fish, tom yum soup, and the red curry and they all loved it. The portions were large, service was quick, staff was friendly-- I'll definitely be going back soon!
Amazing food, service, and atmosphere. I promise you that you will not leave disappointed. I drive 45min to eat at this place and we go at least once a week! Go and enjoy

Thai Little Home.  A cute little name for a cute little restaurant.

Don't ignore this place just because it's in a strip mall!  Good things do indeed come in strip mall packages.  (Or something like that.  I can't remember how the saying goes, so sue me.)  The decor is cute but unremarkable, save for the GIGANTIC ALBINO LOBSTER mounted on the wall near the entrance.  Scary, but cool.

During my visit, we ordered the shrimp toast as an alternative to the usual crab rangoon we often order at other Thai and Chinese restaurants.  It was tasty and filling (perhaps a little TOO filling for two people) and accompanied by a sweet cucumber and onion salad.  My chicken pad thai was very good, and tasted even better when I reheated the leftovers the next day.  My boyfriend's beef pad kee mao was excellent and very spicy.  In general, I'm not a huge fan of super-spicy food, but I hate when pad kee mao isn't spicy at all!  I really enjoyed Thai Little Home's version.

No, this suburban strip mall restaurant isn't a stylish place to "see and be seen," but it does provide good Thai food for affordable prices - and the opportunity to see an enormous dead lobster, to boot!  How many restaurants can promise THAT?

This place is pretty standard. 

Thai Little Home has a lot of items on their menu. Some are pretty good, some are not so good. Everything I got was a bit too oily for my taste. But the seasoning is typically right on. I would definitely come back to try out more items on their menu. 

The thai egg rolls - good, but standard 
The pork satay - plump and flavorful. the cucumber salad was too sweet and the peanut sauce started to separate and looked kind of gross. 
wonton soup - DO NOT get this! Not even sure what the filling is made of.
fried rice- solid, good seasoning, not too salty, pretty standard.

Authentic Thai food and very good at that!

Came here with some co-workers.  Had a lunch special choice (pad see ew).  It was typical, but I came back with my wife on a separate occasion and that was a lot better.

We ordered the papaya salad, which my wife loves.  Also ordered a whole fish that was prepared with a variety of veggies.  That was excellent.  

We also had lettuce wraps that is usually ground chicken.  Only, upon inspection, it wasn't ground chicken, it was actually great quality (white meat) chicken that was broken and torn to bits.  That totally won me over as it was fresh, flavorful and good quality.  

This place is a hidden gem in an area in which it can be hard to find good Thai.
New favorite Thai spot. Still Love Alt Thai, though

I ought to write two reviews here, one for me and one for my wife.  I love the food, she doesn't care for it.  The pad thai always seems undercooked (the noodles are white, not brown).

I, on the other hand, just love the beef with oyster sauce from this place.  I remember it from it's old location in the city.  Everybody at banker's Life and Casualty used to swear by it.

I love Thai food and the low prices were very enticing but I did not like the food at this place. We ordered the fresh spring rolls while we waited for our takeout order. Two really long spring rolls were delivered to our table within a couple minutes. They were cut into bite sized pieces like a sushi roll and the syrupy sauce was poured on top. The first bite was surprisingly and uncharacteristically warm, nay, hot! So I recalibrated my expectations for a hot appetizer assuming they had just made it without time to chill. The sauce was sweet, the soft wrap was good but the stuff inside was not. Plain tofu, plain scrambled eggs and plain noodles. No flavor and very spongey. I was starving so I kept eating anyway. After 2 more bites down the line, the roll was lukewarm and then refrigeratedly cold, revealing that the roll must have been microwaved for some reason and very unevenly at that. I wouldn't be surprised if it had been in the freezer. Yuck. We left about half of it on the table. Our takeout order included the potstickers, vegetable red curry with tofu and the Pad Khee Mao with chicken. I liked that the potstickers were made with chicken instead of pork. They were served with a "spicy vinegar-soy sauce" which was not spicy and very vinegary. The red curry was the worst I've ever had. The sauce was watery thin and painfully lacking that yummy rich curry flavor and not a single leaf of Thai basil to be found. The Pad Khee Mao noodles were very mushy and the prominent ingredient in this dish was oil. No real tasty flavor to speak of. The "hot peppers" appeared to be jalape̱os which I always detest when they're standing in for Thai chilies; but alas, this seems to be the norm in Chicago. (I'm partial to the Thai food in Orlando). At least it was nice to see Thai basil in this dish and the chicken was cooked well. Even though I was not impressed I will mention that my husband said he liked the noodles.

My family and I have been going to this place since it was in its original location 30 years ago (though that was before I was born).  You can tell that the restaurant is owned and operated by family, and they have always treated us like we were a part of it.

The food is great, especially given the prices.  I would recommend the Chicken with Ginger and the beef Kang Nua.
Pot stickers were good.  Red Curry was good, but quite spicy..  Its also BYOB which is a plus!

Really good, went here on a whim a few weeks ago. Everything was perfect. We  eat a lot of Thai, and have just added a new favorite close to home.
Perfect place for dinner or lunch or takeout.
Wow!  I was amazed. Small place, but worth it. Service is great.  food was even better. Definitely a keeper ...... deep fried Oreos.

Even before I got into this place I knew it was going to be a good experience.  There were a couple of customers eating at the only outside table when we pulled up.  Before going in, I asked "How's the food".  "Awesome" was the reply "Wanna try some" and a big container of fabulous looking nachos was offered to me.  I' never pass up an opportunity to try something, so I had a taste--yummo!

Inside we met Sammy.  He made us feel like we'd been coming to his place for years.  It was fun.  I'm not going to get into the food--there's lots of others who had said it was delish and it is.  I did have the chili-cheese dog.  The crispy slab of bacon on top was a pleasant surprise.   My friend had the Chicago dog--a real beauty for the eye and the tongue.  

The deep fried oreos went down easy--almost scary easy.

Big Menu--Big Food--Big Value

First off i'd like to say from the outside the place is a little off putting..  However soon as you  walk inside you feel like you have been coming here for years (my first time there)..

As I was looking at the menu on the wall and deciding what to order... Decided on a couple slices of pizza and a chicago style hot dog..  The owner I assume is very nice, makes you feel like a customer whos been coming there for ages..

Everything seems made to order as I had to wait 5-10  mins for order...No problem was prewarned by owner as he said will be a few mins..

Kind of was hoping they had some lemonade of some sort however is just coke, water, and few others in cans...  Howeever am sure don't  sell a lot so no worries..

So i receive my food and on way..  Get home everything is still piping hot..

I eat the chicago style hot dog its good, nice flavor there is nothing bad to say about it.. Other  than the pickle was an off brand...  Can tell wasn't a food brand pickle..  Would order again really want to try other kinds of dogs they sell.

The pizza.  I had to really let this cool down it was hot hot hot.. The  sauce, the cheese, the sausage was all the perfect amount and tasted great.   The crusted tasted reat as well however for some reason it was a little doughy even thou the pizza was so hot..  Kind of undercooked I suppose..  Will I hold it against them no it happens.

Overall I will definitely be going back here..  Tons more on menu I wanna try and prices are great..  Definetely  the diamond in the rough in bartlett.

The best food not just in Bartlett, but the entire Chicagoland area in my opinion. Everything on the menu is absolutely delicious and made to order. Sam is awesome. Very warm and welcoming and accommodating to his customers. He makes all of his sauces himself at home, you can't beat that level of quality. If you're a burger fan, ask for the pineapple crush. It's not on the in house menu but trust me you will not be disappointed. I won't go anywhere else for take out food. This place really is a rare gem and a must try for anyone who stops in Bartlett.

I love this place so much. The owners are awesome. I am a sucker for creative twists on classics but they have to be done right. This place will not disappoint. The fries are fresh cut and some of the best I've had. The Indian inspired dishes are my favorite. I'm making a trip to Bartlett next week just to try more from the menu. This place is a gem.

Based upon Yelp stopped in for a gyro sandwich & a can of pop today, Sept. 15, 2016.  Owner was very pleasant & was very proud of his gyros & pizza. Pleasure doing business with him.  Gyro was very good but would have preferred it's temperature hotter.  I will be back when in the area.  Oh, and YES, sign said closed 2:00-4:00pm.

I was in the mood for wings and I didn't not want to drive anywhere in this cold. I looked up places near me and Sams is only 1 mile away and had great reviews.
 
I call to place an order for pick up and the gentle man on the phone was very polite and answered all my questions. I had a few since it was my first time ordering from them. He said it would be 25 minutes  because they were working on a catering order which I thought was not a bad wait. I ordered 24 buffalo wings with a side of loaded fries. 
   
We get our order n omg the wings are so juicy and tasty! And the fries where too I will definitely be coming again for the dining experience

Update:  Not only do I love Sam, but now I love his son.

Seriously- if you're having a bad day, go here.  Both Sam and his Son have energy, the gift to gab and smile to help to make anyone feel better.  AND, the food is good.

Both gentlemen try to talk me into trying their fried Twinkie... but I cannot. I cannot fall in love with another thing that will make me fatter.  I'm sure it's amazing.

Adjectives time:

-Amazing fresh fries
-Lemon wings were tangy and awesome
-Tandoor pita was flavorful and spicy!
-The owner and his wife were really hospitable

Overall excellent food

Will definitely go back here

Great wings, great handmade pizza like from the old hood in Chicago, great handmade burgers, great sides (especially the mushrooms)! Call ahead, though. They make everything fresh to order, so figure twenty minutes.

The food here is unique and amazing. They have all the American standards plus they have options with a twist. There is nothing better than well prepared food and this place take the time to do it right. 
There is only a small eat in area so with a group it is better to take it to go.

After recently moving to the area from Chicago, (a.k.a. Food Heaven!), we found ourselves craving unique food establishments, rather than the typical food chains. 

Today, I was looking for a good burger and fresh-cut fries and I came across Sam's Grill.

I have to tell you......YUM! 
My cheeseburger and fries were AWESOME and exactly what I was looking for. I'll definitely return....looking forward to trying the Tandoori Chicken.

Also, make sure you meet Sam. He is a sweetheart and one of the friendliest business owners I have ever met.
Awesome food and amazingly friendly service. I recommend sams to all of my friends and they love it as much as me!
This place is awesome.  Just tried the Jalapeno Burger and Loaded Fries.  Both were excellent.  Fast and friendly service as well.  Give this place a try for sure!

UPDATE - 4/6/2015. Sam's offers deliveries on the weekends now. We have ordered delivery now a couple times and both times received our food promptly from a very chill and polite delivery boy.  The delivery offer is a godsend because now I can order on those lazy weekend days when I'm too hungover to think about driving.

I've eaten more or less everything off the menu at this point and it's all great. The hickory burger and Jalapeno Cheddar Burger are my favorites. and OH MY GOD the buffalo wings are perfect. It's still all about the Chicken Tandoori and mexican pizza's though.

On top of everything, Sam is one of the most sincere and kindest restaurant owners I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. He always makes you feel extremely welcome the second you walk into his restaurant.  My only regret of ordering delivery is not getting to stop in and say hi!

- ORIGINAL REVIEW -


I've been holding off reviewing this place for a bit because I wanted to try a lot of their stuff, but upon eating the Chicken Tandoori Pizza last night, i can no longer stay silent. 

It was among the finest pies I have eaten in my life.

The fresh cut fries they serve manage to be crispy, not soggy, as so many other establishments do. The deep fried taco is stuff of legends.

I will not stop, nay, I CAN'T stop going here until I sample everything on the menu.

The people here are the friendliest dudes, if you have to wait awhile for food, trust me, it is worth it!!!

Not good at all! I really have no idea why this place is rated so high. I ordered the pizza and the best way I can describe it is it tasted like a frozen Totinos. The sauce was ultra sweet, the crust was very undercooked with no flavor and the sausage was just so plain and blah! It was like a frozen pizza cooked in a microwave.. Did not try anything else but after that there's really no reason to...
Really cool ideas in the place.  The tandoori chicken pizza is ridiculous!  The wings are excellent too.  Definitely a place to try and go back to.

My husband and I were craving wings but I did not wanted to take a drive to a BWW that is a little far from us and well it was late, so I looked up wings near me and Sam's came up we decided to give them a try and OMG! Best wings ever, first of all the wings are huge and second they are delicious, we have only tried buffalo and parmesan garlic. The guy at the register was so nice and attentive, he even had sauces on the bag without me asking for them. Will be definitely coming back here for more wings and other delicious things on their menu.

Paid my first visit to Sam's. after seeing it listed as #1 in Bartlett for awhile.  I ordered the Tandoori Chicken Pita.  It was so delicious.  Large portion, yet not to heavy.  The service was fast and courteous as well  I cant wait to go back and explore their diverse menu.  Maybe the Gyros burger or wings.

Having Sam's less than a minute from our house is really dangerous. Their burgers are THE BEST! Their wings are also awesome. We haven't found a thing at Sam's we don't love. Definitely one of the best spots in Bartlett

We went there all the way from palatine and the place got closed an hour before its regular time. There were about 5- 6 people sitting inside but nobody had a courtesy to open the door and serve their customers!! Bummer!

Food it great but if you don't get to eat it then what's the point!!

Have you ever had a fried taco?! No? Well, make your way over to Sam's, introduce yourself to Sam (trust me, you can't miss him) and tell him you need a fried taco....STAT! Let him be creative, because he is innovative and a wonderful cook!

Seriously, I love Sam, his wife and their son, Nick. They are some of the kindest people I have encountered in years. AAAAAND they know how to cook.

They have a few seats inside but it's mostly a takeout place and with the sweetest staff at your service, it can def be a place to grab a bite for lunch or a quickie dinner.

I have only had a fried taco and some fresh cut French fries SO FAR but I have to tell you that their food is delish! They obviously use all fresh ingredients and everything is very well seasoned. I cannot wait to explore Sam's menu further. 

I look forward to my next visit when I hope I can try their Saturday rib special ($18.99/ full slab or $9.99/ half slab) or one of their burgers that I understand Sam mixes with his special combination of seasonings. 

I intend on going back to soon to support our local business owner and get my fix of good food at a place I think I could hang out at for hours and hours.
Great specialty and regular pizzas, wings, sandwiches. Awesome burgers. Everything is super delicious.

Okay, time for an update! The owner reached out to me after my previous review and apologized for the service we got that night. So, when we were hankering for a pizza again, we decided to give Sam's another shot, and I am very glad that we did. This time around, we did get our pizza, and it was delicious. We got the Tandoori Chicken pizza, which wasn't really my cup of tea (I am a total baby when it comes to spicy food), it was obvious that the ingredients were of quality and after shuffling my chicken pieces over to my husband's slice, it was wonderful. We also got some fries, which I did heartily chow down on. I'm particular when it comes to fries. They have to be right. If you're like me, come here, because they definitely do it right.

I'm very glad that Sam got in touch with me. We're all looking forward to trying another pizza (and gettin' down on some more of those fries) in the future.
OMG!!! This place is amazing, great customer service, & The food is great,Yum yum!! Thanks for the beer nuggets ;))

Menu selection is very confusing but they have above average food. I come here because I love the home cut fries. I've tried a bunch of things on the menu including the pizza all were good. Wish they had a daily special

awesome food! friendly staff. 
we asked for the potatoe on a stick, and it was great!
pizza, tandoori pita and loaded fries. everything is just perfect quality and excellent taste.

Update?! Of course I have an update! At this point I have have tried everything on the menu and they have never disappointed. The burgers, the italian beef, the pizza, the fries, it's all good. The Chicken Tandoori: pita, pizza and paratha all amazing. 
The burgers are GREAT! One of my favorites is the Hickory Burger. The man is a surgeon with bacon. It's cooked well, it's constructed tightly so the ingredients aren't sliding out of the burger while you eat it. Something I admire in burgers the same way I do sushi that doesn't fall apart when you pick it up. The hot dogs are delicious and there is a wide variety of options. Consistent through all meal options is the quality of ingredients and the great skill with which they are executed.
Sam's very happily marries American standbys with a couple Indian ingredients as an added bonus which is not something I would have ever expected from a place in a strip mall in Bartlett, IL.

For a hole in the wall place, it's pretty good. My coworker and I both got a burger. Honestly, for the wait and price I'd probably rather hit a Five Guys or Smashburger. The fries we're just ok. It was definitely made fresh when we ordered (2 burgers and fries took a little better than 10 minutes).
I would go back to try something else. Burgers are not something I'd order again.

This place is legit. I honestly laughed at the "Pizza" sign on first sight but after checking it out, it lived up to all of the hype. I ordered the buffalo chicken pita and fries. Both were phenomenal. 

Sam says they aren't able to deliver anymore. Thank god I love a block away! 

Only improvement would be later hours. Like 4 am or so.
Does not look appealing from the outside at all, but it's so much better than you could ever imagine. They need a bit of a facelift, but the food is so amazing! Just give them a try!

The deep-fried Jersey Dog was fantastic!  Yellow mustard and a mix of flattop seared peppers and onions blanketed a perfectly fried weenie on a fluffy sausage roll.  My friend got the BBQ Dog... Also delicious!  I work at a higher-end restaurant and we serve amazing hand-cut fries.  I will say that the fries here were even better.  Furthermore they (the fries) were beautiful (strange to say about a French fry, but see for yourself)!
Heads up:  they are closed from 2:00-4:00.  Get this: they leave for the grocery store to replenish their stock, ensuring the ingredients are as fresh for the dinner rush as they are for the lunch crowd.  Certainly cuts into the owners'profit margin to close during such a time, but I give them props for choosing quality over quantity.  Who does that, especially for a burger & dog place?  Sam's does and the freshness is evident and much appreciated!

I'm done with Sam's. 

Tonight is the third time in the last year that I tried and failed to get dinner! They do not keep true to their own posted operating hours.  Always closing early. Tonight I called at 7pm to order wings, he said it would be just a few min. I said oh it usually takes longer. I can't make it that quick. I asked if they could put the order in so that it was ready to be picked up around 745. He said no, we can't do that and then hung up on me as I was trying to say ok if call back in 30 min to order again.  So fast forward to 7:38 exactly I call again.  They won't answer the phone. I called about 5 times. Finally knowing they are going to close at 8 my husband runs over there to order in person....doors locked and lights off when he gets there at 745 which is still 15 min before they are supposed to be closed. I've had this happen 3 times now!  I'm sorry, but no food is worth that effort and it's just poor customer service. If you post you're open until 8, and your answering machine says your open until 8 you need to be open until 8. Or have a well posted disclaimer that says we close when we please because we don't care about our customers. My husband was in the parking lot at 745 listening to a message saying they are open for another 15 min.  Nice. The first time this happened I called 30 min before closing and the guy said they don't take orders that late.....I said I didn't understand because they were open for another 30 min. Apparently when it says they close at a certain time that's when they plan on walking out the door and has nothing to do with what time they will serve customers. You don't want my business, I understand. That's been made clear. I'll make sure to let anyone I can know not to waste their time checking Sams out anymore, I can't trust I wouldn't be making a jerk out of myself recommending.
Food was great but found a nail in my food. Workers refused to take responsibility saying they knew every nail in the store and didn't recognize the one in my food. Never going back.

This is definitely a take-out place unless you are really starving and have no where to go - then you can utilize one of the 3 stools at their small counter or one of the two tiny tables in the entry area.  The Hubs & I stopped by intending to dine in but upon seeing how small it was decided to take it home.  We shared an order of Beer Nuggets and the Tandoori Chicken Paratha sandwich.  The sandwich comes already split in two so it made sharing easy and was enough to share especially with the addition of the Beer Nuggets.    The sandwich was well-seasoned & quite tasty, spicy but not much heat.  The Beer Nuggets could have used some sort of seasoning in the dough as they seemed rather bland but the marinara sauce it came with for dipping was quite good and made up for it in the flavor department.  Our order was ready in 10 minutes.  They have quite a variety of sandwiches, burgers and 11 or 12 different wing sauces so if we're ever in the area again and wanting take out I'd definitely try some more of their offerings.

One visit to Sams and you're going to be hooked! Great tasting and plentiful servings will make you not want to go anywhere else! Sams and staff are very excited to serve you one of their awesome fresh cooked dishes and they are very humble and ready to spark up a conversation with you about anything! If you like a special touch on anything just ask and you'll be served!  Great place to share about with others!

Amazing tacos special on fridays!!! My husband got the chilli burger and he said was awesome too. What I really love about this place is that it is family owned and run and they are one of the nicest people who I have met that run a food biz.

Having a party this weekend and calling for catering :-)

This small hole in a wall kind of place is in a strip mall near my house.  Sam, the owner is a really nice guy who would always remember your name and possibly previous order(s) too. 
My husband is a vegetarian so we have tried mostly all vegetarian items here- My favorite would be the pao bhaji and for the fish tacos. For everything else that I tried I always find something missing- that would be the freshness. For example- the paneer tikka roll is served in a frozen parantha and that kind of changes the texture and taste of the whole tikka roll for me(chicken or paneer is actually good, it's just the bread I never liked). Apart from that I recently tried the giant cheese pizza slice, it was okay, nothing spectacular.

First time customer for lunch today.  Anticipate this being my go-to place for lunch.  Today's lunch was Italian Beef and Fries.  VERY good!  Beef was tender and juicy.  The fries are wonderful.  Had a great conversation with the guys while I was there.  Its obvious they are very proud of their homemade food.

Can't wait to try the burgers, pizza, ribs, and Tandoor Chicke Parathas...mmm.  Wish I was hungry to I could try more stuff today but now I'm stuffed.

Sam's...it's time for your review update!

Three months into our relationship and my family continues to work our way through their ever-changing menu. Lemme give you a few highlights...

Tandoori Chicken. On a pita. On a pizza. In a taco shell...no, not just any taco shell. It's like the best chalupa shell you've ever had but sooo much better. I'll be honest here. The words 'tandoori chicken' scared me at first. I'm picky. I don't like new things. Except that's all a lie because every time I try something new at Sam's, I like it. Basically, tandoori chicken is well-seasoned chicken breast chunks. It's a little spicy. It's not "burn-your-face-off-spicy", but rather, "I-like-my-taste-buds-to-get-a-workout-spicy". The chicken breast chunks are fabulous and fresh!  They serve it with a homemade sauce that I've tasted. It's good, but I am not a huge fan of dairy, so I get that on the side. The seasoning is not like something that I've ever had before...and that's a good thing. It makes the chicken a bright orange color. I thought it was weird until I tasted it. Now, it's one of my new favorite foods. 

Speaking of favorite foods, have you tried paratha?  I did a couple weeks ago for the first time (under duress) and now I can't get enough!  This is a homemade gluten-free bread, like a flatbread made with wheat flour. I loved it plain!!!  I even liked it with sour cream and, as I mentioned, I'm not a dairy fan.  Filled with tandoori chicken, it's waaaay too filling, but flavorful. I really like the flavors in the onion paratha best (so far).  Again, another thing that I never would have tried back in the day, but Sam, Rachel, Nick and the whole crew have yet to steer me wrong.

BBQ Saturday. It's a great day to eat at Sam's!  Try the ribs with the homemade sauce. Talk about finger lickin' good!!!  I still have the BBQ beef sandwich on my list of things to try. Maybe next weekend?

We've fallen head over heals for their hand packed burgers, the Bari Italian beef sandwiches and their gyros fresh off the spit. The fried taco is sooo bad, yet sooo good in all the right ways!  And when given a choice between their fresh cut fries and their beer nuggets (made from fresh pizza dough), we don't usually choose and we eat both. Shhh, don't tell.

So they've added another table and a few more chairs which is good especially for the regulars. I'm a proud regular. Us regulars like to stand around and chat like we're at Cheers...without the beer...and the bartenders...and we like to share our opinions on our favorite foods with the newbies who've wandered in. Don't worry, they won't be newbies for long. Thus, the reason for more seating. Almost every time that I stop in, I see someone I've seen there before and I usually meet someone new who wants to try what Sam's has to offer. I genuinely love coming in here! Don't get me wrong...it's really nothing to look at when it comes to decor. I know that I come back time and again for the tasty food, the great company and the exceptional service. It's a true hometown eatery that's growing every day. I wouldn't be surprised if they expanded to offer a comfortable dine-in experience for their growing number of clientele one of these days. 

Stop in and try something new. You'll be glad you did.

Read some reviews on Yelp and decided to give it a try. I ordered a fish taco and my girlfriend had a slice of pizza. The pizza was average but the fish taco was very good. I have a healthy appetite and the fish taco was enough to satisfy (along with a few delicious fries).  Will be back to further explore the menu!

Update-

I am in love with their food.  Everything I have tried is amazing!  Please support local business and try this place.  You will not be disappointed. 


Great food, good prices, super friendly staff.  

I had the burger and I really enjoyed it.  My husband had the really hot wings (he is a true spicy foods lover) and he was able to finish the 6 wings. The employee told him that they do challenges on Fridays for the wings. I have a feeling my husband will be going to one very soon.  

The only negative- just like the other reviewer said, they also forgot our chili. :(.

This place is terrific. He needs to open a chain. There's a very friendly family running it. The tandoori pizza is GREAT. I wish they still did deliveries. I heard they started doing it on weekends.

Nobody in the area can hold a candle to these guys.

It's been a while since I've been able to come in again, but I finally got a chance last night.  As always, Sam was happy to see me!  Noticed a few new things since the New Year.  Sam put up an abbreviated menu of some of his more popular Indian dishes (he's always made them, just never advertised them).

I got my regular Royal Burger with Jalapeno added (you gotta try this--it's amazing!).  As always, it was delicious.  I also noticed that he had a 2pc chicken tandoori paratha on his new Indian menu.  I figured what the hell, and went ahead and ordered it.  I've never had paratha before, but this was INCREDIBLE.  

Sam was very excited to describe it to me, and from what I gathered, it's essentially a pita that is cooked with egg batter.  It made it very flaky and flavorful--honestly similar to an egg-roll type of flavor and texture.  Mixed with the already amazing tandoori chicken, it was phenomenal.  

Keeping with tradition, the portion size was also very generous for the price.  

Sam also let me sample his new Hawaiian style spicy pineapple sauce.  I haven't decided what this is going to be best on, but I think it's my favorite sauce of his so far.

5/5 as always.  If you're not eating here yet, you're making a mistake!

I seen Sams a few months ago on yelp and after viewing the reviews I knew I had to come here. I finally made it in today and it definitely was all worth the hype. I had the fried taco which was out of this world, and my girlfriend had the jalape̱o burger which was also excellent. Ruben one of the owners was very nice and during my visit made us a fried strawberry Twinkie which wow is all I have to say. This restaurant has a great selection at outstanding prices. Not to mention the owners Sam, Ruben, and the rest of the family are extremely hospitable, knowledgeable and are the definition of what customer service is all about. Will most definitely be back.

Sometimes you're in a greasy-bar-food kind of a mood, but you don't want fast food, and you don't want to actually GO to a bar!

Enter in Sam's Grill.

This is a little restaurant located in a little strip in Bartlett (close to Hanover Park).  It is a little difficult to find--especially in the dark--and it just says PIZZA on the roof of the building, not their actual name.  So be on the lookout!!

There are about five seats in this place TOTAL so take-out is probably best!

Anyway, the service here is PHENOMENAL.  I wish there were more stars I could give this place just based on the service and friendliness of the staff alone.  The food was just as good, but I love a place that has a friendly staff and appreciates your business.  You could just tell they were grateful to have the business from the moment we walked in.

OK, so here is what we originally ordered (to be split among three of us)
12 Hell Raiser Wings (for the husband)
Fries
Gyro Dinner
Italian Beef Sandwich
Loaded Cheese Fries
Cup of Chili

Now after we had ordered that, the nice man behind the counter, Nick, brought it to our attention that nobody has made it through 5 of those wings and offered us a taste to MAKE SURE that's what he wanted (after a burning throat and watering eyes, we determined that NOBODY would enjoy that).  So they made him a spicy buffalo sauce that wasn't even on the menu.  Talk about service!

But other than that, he was really sweet answering all of our questions and after they saw our burning mouths (yikes), a really sweet guy from the back brought out bread with cinnamon, sugar, and honey on it to calm our palates.  How sweet (literally!)

All of the food was really, really good, too.  There was nothing I was eating that I was thinking "I could use some _____" or "I wish it had _____".  It was all very, very good!!

My only complaint is that they forgot my chili :(  I didn't realize it until I got home, so I didn't want to go back.  But honestly, I am more upset about the fact that I missed out on trying some bomb-ass chili (and I know the chili will be amazing if my loaded fries are any indication!!).

So I can't wait to go back...and try the chili. :)

(NOTE: They don't have a menu online, but I uploaded pictures.  I recommend calling ahead since they make everything fresh.  There is also a menu on Facebook on their company page)

Sam's Grill & Pizza is a hole-in-the-wall place in Bartlett that sells bar food. Really good bar food.

I took a lunch group from work over there to try it out. The menu is written in chalk on a giant chalkboard, ordered by a giant grid that's about 10 cells tall by 5 cells wide. It's not the most readable menu out there, so I scanned the paper menu instead.

I ended up getting a Gyro Burger with fries and a drink. I loved the fries... freshly deep fried russets with a good coating of salt. Not greasy at all! The burger itself was excellent. It consisted of a soft bun around a beef patty, shaved lamb (!), lightly grilled onion, tomato and tzatziki sauce. I liked every bit of it.

Really, what tips this from 4.5 stars to 5 is Sam, who clearly has a passion for good food, chatting up the customers, and chicken wings served with ghost chili-enhanced hot sauce. (He kindly provided a sample: Yowsa-hot, but very good. Same deal with the mango haba̱ero!)

So the next time I'm here, I'll be getting the wings. Consider ordering in advance, since everything is made fresh, and we ended up standing around for 30 minutes while everyone's food finished. But trust me; it's worth the wait.

I recommend the Chicken Tandoori... EVERYTHING!  The pita, the prarthana, and yes even the chicken tandoori pizza.  Sams teases with some of the spices and flavors of India on the foundation of the All American Diner.  The combination is WIN!  

I think the name "Sam's Grill" is a misnomer that evokes the standard hot dogs, burgers and gyros.  Though I would pass by it daily, I had not gone into this place for years thinking it was just another dog & burger joint.  Chicagoland is nothing if not overwhelmed by tons of top notch dog & burger joints already.  

I was astonished to find something so unique and unsuspecting hidden in such a inconspicuous location.  After all, it is small and in an off the beaten path strip mall.  It's really for pickup & take out as the front doesn't lend itself to sit down dining.  Although he does have a couple chairs and a stool perched against the wall that is carpet bombed by local merchants business cards and flyers.

The owner and son are very friendly, conversant, and seem to truly appreciate my business.  Though I wouldn't engage much idle chat during lunch rush.  They do have a steady business to run and the staff is small.

The fusion of flavors I found in this place sets this guy apart from everyone else.  Sam's Grill delivers on an unusual blend of oddly addictive Indian flavors and spices with traditional American and Greek foods.

I was stunned at how good my first chicken tandoori pita was and it keeps me coming back for more.  I've now taken it on as a personal challenge to go down the list of Indian fusion creations Sam's has to offer and look forward to more creations.  This flavor is unique, weird, delicious, addictive and something I can't even describe.

I would recommend this to anyone that may think they do not like Indian food due to a bad experience with something a little "too authentic."  Or perhaps to someone that has an interest and wants to try new Indian flavors but might be intimidated or confused by a completely alien menu at an authentic Indian restaurant that may be a bit much. 
 
I wish for nothing but big success to these guys and hope they expand to another couple more locations soon.

Got to get a quick complaint out of the way.  I ordered well ahead of time and was told that it would be 25 minutes.  I get to the place 32.7 minutes later and was told just "5" more minutes before your order is ready...Sure... I ended up waiting another 15 minutes in the shop as the main guy dillywag with his friend.

No apology, no nothing...that kind of irked me, since it was apparent how much bs his estimate of time was.

Anyways, I ordered the chicken tandoori pizza and wings (buffalo/lemon pepper).

Was not that impressed by the pizza.  Indeed, the crust was...fantastic...not sure how to describe it other than pita-ish.  However, the toppings and sauce was meh.  Confuzzle as to why other yelpers raved madly regarding the pizza when it was...alright.

The wings definitely had an awesome crispy texture, but there is a BUT.  Buffalo sauce was leaning too far on the sour side to the point where I would describe that even BDUBs sauce is better.

Lemon Pepper version though was perfect, so I would recommend the wings definitely, albeit, with a different sauce/seasoning other than buffalo.

I am a foodie...I rarely write reviews but this place deserves one!!!
I went for lunch today after reading many reviews about this place...they exceeded my expectations...in both service and taste.
This is a family owned business...Owners are so friendly and after talking with them for few minutes...I can tell they are very passionate about their food and quality..

1) Friench fries with their secret sauce - they are so crispy and goes good with the sauce....these fries are best in town..not exaggerating...
2) Lemon Pepper wings - wowwwwwwwwww...no words to explain and their garlic sauce along with it...never tasted so good anywhere else till now.
3) Tandoor panner on pita - awesome ..paneer is so fresh, tasty and done with right mix of spices.

cant wait to try everything on menu!!!!

My only advice to owners...please patent all your secret sauces :)

Nowadays it's very  hard to find a family own business that  truly knows the meaning of great customer service! The place is very small, but it's kept clean and honestly most of the time I get my food to go.  Now,  about their food... It always tastes fresh, it's delicious and I never been disappointed.  If you can call ahead to place your order you won't have to wait as long for it. Remember they make it fresh, so it takes time.  I love their BBQ sauce, it needs to be sold by the gallons.
