Also, when we had finished our meal, he asked if we were full and had enough. He asked us if we wanted refills...on our food! It was crazy for us to be so welcomed and we felt that was a grand gesture that he really wanted to make the customers happy. 

I definitely recommend anyone to visit here!
Love the food, but the wait system is awful. Needed to leave twice because it was so unorganized. Hopefully they will come up with a better system to accommodate their customers.
Great food and Ari is awesome. Went in for breakfast and can't have meat because it's Friday so Ari made suggestion and it was fantastic! Will be back for sure!

Welcome Home.

The best Biscuits and Gravy I have ever had. This is a cozy small restaurant with 25 tables. A nice plate of fresh fruit including pineapple, plumbs, apples, bananas and dates.

Where the magic really happens is when Ari come's in person to take your order. He is as pleasant and warming as the food he serves.

The most organized, precise, consistent and systematic restaurant I have ever seen.
Ari's does not have a microwave, only uses real whipped butter, and will change your mind with how you look at breakfast.

Ari is a observer who see's all and a great judge of character. He knows just what to do to make your experience the best experience as he read's people well.

This is important and why his food is so great, Ari understands people and knows what people like.

Ari's Kitchen is an experience, a required destination and builds a curiosity for what lunch has in store!

A fantastic Sunday Brunch experience. Great homemade food and outstanding service on a very busy afternoon.  Small quaint dining room with a diner feel.  Ari the owner is interactive with all the patrons and staff.   
Must try for homemade from scratch breakfast.

Delicious entr̩e (but mediocre salad) doesn't make up for being bombarded with political propaganda & religious paraphernalia. I came for lunch, not a passive-aggressive lecture. At least the Zippo lighter collection near the restrooms was interesting.

This is my first review. We've never been to Ari's kitchen before, but the reviews peaked my interest. It was seat yourself, which was a little confusing at first, but was fine. It's a smaller place, but still plenty of room at the table. The menus were a little confusing, but we're understandable. 
   Now to why I gave them five stars. Ari himself took our order and when he found out it was our first time there, he comped our biscuits and gravy and my wife's cup of soup.
   I had an omelette and hash browns with a pancake. The wife had an omelette with a generous fresh bowl of fruit and an English muffin. The food was very good and a good sized portion. It also came out very fast and was more than reasonably priced.
   I would definitely recommend trying it. It was a wonderful dining experience.

I was here on a Saturday morning with my regular men's bible study group. All I can say is WOW. I ordered the hobo train skillet with Texas toast - excellent. My friend ordered the fruit plate and it was freshly cut fruit. The jellies were all made there. Dairy products were all from Oberweis - so you know how good that is! My wife though is not convinced. She says it seems like a guys' restaurant. I think she may have a point there!
AWESOME PLACE!!! ONE GUY TAKES YOUR ORDER, NO MISTAKES! Quality is superb, service is impeccable. Little crowded, but sure beats any other area dine in!!

Ok, the only negative to my experience was the hilarious menus.. But totally added to the experience. Ari IS indeed he man. He's running the show and doing it well. The place is clean, the food is great, and the service is impeccable. My friend got a wrap, I got a panini, we shared fries, and Ari brought out some soup on the house! All of it was amazing. I can't wait to go back!

I'm in there at least once a week for breakfast, my wife is always pissed when I don't bring her with. Have never had a bad meal, fresh ingredients, fast friendly service from Ari himself, this place can't be beat.

So very good. Eggs benny off the charts! Tender bakery fresh English muffin, avocado, onion, tomato, bacon, perfect poach on the eggs, stock based hollandaise... genius! So many sides to pick from my eyes glazed over and I went with roasted asparagus. My companions were there more the lunch menu. Burgers w/hand cut fried, Rubin on fresh bread, soups all homemade. Can't wait to go back in the summer when the outside tables are set up.

First time here, was delicious.  U must try the pumpkin pancakes!! They bring u your own can of whipped cream to the table, with cinnamon butter, YUMMY!! A lot of things on the menu are housemade. First place I've been to that has homemade hash browns with the skins still on the potatos, really tasty.

We were incredibly impressed by our first visit!  Everyone on staff when we visited Saturday morning for breakfast was incredibly friendly and helpful.  The owner introduced himself and said the restaurant has been in his family for 40-some years (I forget the exact number) & he is the 2nd generation running it. He went over the menu with us since it was our first time in.  The servers appeared to be mostly younger folks but they were the sweetest & most attentive younger servers I have ever encountered! When the diners next to us left one of the young gentlemen was training another employee how to properly clean off the tables and explained to, "be sure to take everything off the table top before you wipe it down completely and don't forget to wipe the edges of the table." I was quite impressed with the attention to detail (you would hope all restaurants take as much care in cleaning thoroughly between diners but we all know that doesn't happen all the time at other places).

I had the Western Omelet with home fries & toast and the Hubs had pancakes.  The ingredients in my omelet were very fresh and the veggies were cooked perfectly (still with a little crispness and not mushy).  The home fries were cooked perfectly as well.  The pancakes were clearly homemade from scratch. The owner had mentioned that when going over the menu but the truth is in the taste and those were some fantastic buttermilk pancakes! Given their name they have quite a few specialty pancakes to choose from but not quite so many egg options...okay, they have egg options but I guess I am used to being overwhelmed with option overload of omelettes & skillets at other places. One thing that was different is you don't have the option of toast or pancakes with the egg meals like you see at most other places. I'm guessing this is because their pancakes are completely from scratch and not just from some premade batter.  They do have a combo meal option that does come with pancakes, however, so if you want both that is the way to go.  Their coffee was great, too.  Their was a bit of a mixup with the coffee as we had both ordered the regular but our second cups were refilled with the caramel flavor coffee, but I think someone just made the caramel one in the wrong pot by accident. No biggie, it happens.  I'm not sure if it was due to that little mixup or if it was because it was our first time but the manager brought over a single strawberry crepe for us to try as well on the house. Wow - I'm glad he did because that was one of the best fruit crepes I've had! The crepe flavor was perfect and the strawberry compote was clearly homemade (not the sickeningly sweet jam type stuff or just defrosted strawberries in sugar syrup you get at most places).  I'm usually an egg person but I think I'll have to order crepes the next time we visit!  They have a Friday night fish fry (starting after Labor Day I believe) and the rest of the menu looks good so I can't wait to give them a try for some other meals.  Perhaps I'll even be upping them a star to 5-star status after visiting them more than once.

The location, while on a busy road, is off on its own not in an area with other shopping/dining options so it would be easy to overlook when considering your dining options.  The decor is country and reminded me a bit of Cracker Barrel but with a even more homey feel.  The only thing that took away from the country decor was they have fliers for new offerings & specials just thumb-tacked to the wall around the place...it would be better for them to print a few & pop them in some inexpensive frames & hang them up in a couple places. Or just keep it on the big specials board near the front.

MothersDay Breakfast 2016

"NEW" Louisiana skillet, over easy eggs, with corn tortillas. Bunch of sausage, five shrimp, and a few pieces of imitation crab meat. Pretty good. Old country vibe. Cash only. No credit or debit cards. Cash machine is available.

Stopped in on Sunday at about 10 AM for breakfast. It was fairly busy but only about a 5 minute wait. We had the Carmel roasted coffee which was not syrup flavored and both me wife and I liked the flavor. I ordered the special: pumpkin French toast combo. It took about 20 minutes to get our order which was fine except that it was not hot. The flavors were great but it was only like warm. I asked the waitress if it had been up in the window awhile which she denied. She did offer to take it back to re-heat. Overall I thought the food was good and the service was fine. I luckily had the $30 cash on me but was surprised they do not take credit cards.

Exactly what a breakfast spot should be. .... pretty much exactly what Cracker Barrell pretends to be. 

I can't comment on the lunch or dinner options since I've never ordered them, but the dozen or so breakfasts I've had here have all been great.

The service is always good, the dishes always clean, and the food is always legit.  Their seasonal pancakes are great. The pumpkin  (of course) in the fall was good but this winter's ginger snap pancakes are amazing. 

The food is slightly more expensive than Cracker Barrell or any of the Greek diners, but it's also a lot better quality. Nothing I've had has ever been greasy or cooked poorly.  The steak in the steak skillet is great compared to most places.

Old North lacks the bakery of Harners but makes up for it with way better pancakes. 

Fair warning, they only accept cash so be prepared to either bring cash or use the ATM by the front door.

Impressive menu. I had a difficult time deciding what kind of crepe or blintz I wanted. Ultimately I chose the amazing German Apple Pancake. I ordered a half size, which was still enormous. Word to the wise: it takes 20 mins to cook, so tell them the moment you want one. Don't forget to try their caramelized coffee, it's so smooth.

The portions are generous, the service is quick, and it's family friendly.

But I can't give 5 stars because they are cash only.

Breakfast for two was $40 .

Hidden Gem.  Don't let Bates Motel next door deter you.  Cozy restaurant inside.  Kid friendly with a coloring kit. Amazing biscuits and gravy.... Prices slightly higher than our usual breakfast spot.  Coffee was great ...great service.... Cash Only! ATM on site...   We ordered a 3rd breakfast dish as an appetizer (Apple pancake).   This might be our new go to spot...

We like coming here cause it's such a cozy little place and the service is great. Most breakfast place are loud and the atmosphere seems rushed but even when they are busy here it's never loud and just relaxing. Great little cozy place to enjoy breakfast with the family. Just keep in mind that it's a CASH ONLY restaurant.

I went here once about 3 years ago and I hated it. It probably has changed since then so I should probably go back and try it again. But at the time I went they burned my pancakes, they gave me well-water instead of regular water which tastes absolutely gross, and the waitress we had was rude. They also wouldn't accept credit card payments and I think we had to use some atm there that charged us an extra $3 for using it just to pay for our breakfast. I really liked the atmosphere though. I am planning on going back and writing another hopefully better review

Not sure what my rating was last time but I'll check it after I post this one. I don't want my comments from last time to influence my review :) Nice and cozy place. Nothing gourmet by any means, just good food. Not much different than you would make yourself at home. Fresh ingredients and what I would expect on a diner/pancake place menu. Is that good or bad? Neither, really. If you're looking for a place to take a date or friends that are visiting from out of town then this isn't the place to go. Hungry and just want good food? Stop by! I've been here a couple of times and the food is consistently good. Just nothing to write home about.

Why 3 stars? Because the food is fresh, good, and relatively cheap. The 3 pictures that I posted were one tab totaling $40. Not bad for a Saturday morning breakfast with the family. What would get his place a 5th star (I take my ratings seriously :)? An updated interior (I actually like the outdated look, makes it feel cozy...) maybe? Well this isn't Jacob writing for HGTV! This is me on Yelp so let's stick with the food! On one hand I want to say an updated menu would help but it's not about surprising your customers with new items every time. I think I would like to see the food taken to the next level. Prices are low but the food could be better. More seasoning? Maybe. Less grease? Yes on the hash browns (but then again they are hash browns).  Overall good food for a low price. Not a date place.
My family loves coming in here for breakfast! The French toast is amazing and their coffee is out of this world!

Went to the Friday Fish Fry and we were overall really impressed. I love the decor in the restaurant, it's very antique-y and kitsch. To this day, they had the *best* clam chowder soup I've ever eaten. Cannot say anything about their breakfast, but their dinner is definitely a reason to come back again.
Holy cow, the omelet special smothered in chili was fantastic.   Great interior and service.  It was very slow but we came at 9:30am.

Normally love coming here....but why do kids meals not come with drinks???....food was ok...asked if we wanted regular coffee or carmel coffee....might want mention Carmel comes with additional  cost compared to reg. Coffee. ...also just under 4.00 for a sm/medium sized OJ?????...a full gallon of Oj cost 6.00 at store...so not worth $80.00 spent...should have went to IHOP;)...Happy thoughts; )))

We've driven past here many times and I've always wanted to stop. So glad we did! The service was great - very attentive. The place was decorated for St Paddy's Day and it was very cute.  I had the homestyle cinnamon french toast combo and it was simply delicious! Bf had the corned beef skillet and he enjoyed as well. Would definitely recommend.

Really good food and very friendly staff. Always smells good (no fry smell from the kitchen). We like to eat breakfast there. We always leave with a "to go" box since the portions are big. The only reason I'm rating them a 4 and not a 5 is they are a tiny bit pricey.
This place is great! The food is delicious and fast the servers are friendly and the atmosphere is wonderful. In a way reminds me I'm in the country and in another time. I highly recommend!
Delicious home cooked breakfast! Biscuits were home made and gravy had great flavor. The corned beef hash skillet was also good.

I've driven past Olde North hundreds of times on the way to my parents house, never finding a reason to stop and check it out. Finally, after years and years of driving by, I decided to give it a shot!

Right off the bat, we were greeted by the owner of the restaurant. As a first time patron of the business, the owner explained the whole menu. He broke down the specials, along with what are the most popular meals at Olde North. 

I decided to get the "Country Breakfast", which the owner claimed to be their most popular item. I'm happy to say I was not disappointed! The food was great, everything was cooked quickly and thoroughly. The caramel coffee is a must try, this is coming from someone who very seldom drinks coffee. Their pancakes are made fresh and not from batter, everything was extremely fresh!

The decor of Olde North is definitely old and outdated, though it does give you that feel of having Sunday breakfast at your grandparents. The seating is comfortable and not overcrowded. You are also able to hold a conversation without having to yell across the table at each other. 

All in all, I was impressed with the food and great service, we ate like slobs and I'll be doing it again soon!

Hard to be generous with thid old style breakfast place. No credit cards, well water, that we couldnt drink, no espresso drinks or decent tea, food didnt taste right. Potato pancakes were simply not good, Spanish omelett was passable at best. Staff was pretty cheerful though, hence 2 star. To be honest I forgot that places are like that still exist outside large urban centers.

First and only warning--this place doesn't take credit cards, and the ATM up front charges $1.50 for withdrawals, and a $60 max. 
I drive past this place all the time, and judging by the outside, I couldn't quite tell if it was as gonna be a great hole in the wall place or if the food would reflect the exterior.
Anyway, the food was truly fantastic. I made my own omelette with ham, onions, and mozzarella cheese. Since I don't usually pick mozzarella I didn't know what to expect. Fortunately, I was pleasantly surprised! Not only was the mozzarella a good choice, but the ham was juicy and the onions were fresh, and the eggs were light and fluffy. The hash browns that came with it were great. We also split an Oreo pancake, which management offered to us on the house with no prompting, and we really enjoyed it! Even besides the food, the waitress was really friendly and amicable, and the atmosphere is warm, comfy, and totally made me feel at home. 
Great service, great food, great atmosphere. I will definitely be back.

I don't think I can even begin to say enough great things about this place....

My old man and I came in on a Saturday morning before running errands, we didn't have our kids with us so we wanted to enjoy ourselves-and we did. I'm glad I wore my yoga pants. 

To start off...you should get the coffee. The caramel roasted one. I don't drink coffee on a regular basis, and usually when we're out it's just one cup...I had three. Seriously, get it. 

I had a half order of biscuits and gravy, turkey bacon, one pumpkin pancake and scrambled eggs. 

The old man had the country fried steak, turkey bacon and one strawberry pancake. 

First off...I was STUFFED. The portions were great, everything in that kitchen is made from scratch-right down to the pancake mix and buttermilk that is used for them. The gravy itself is also made out of hog that they cut themselves and absolutely delicious.

The syrups were thick and REAL, the strawberries extremely fresh, and I couldn't stop sopping up the gravy with whatever I could.  

You can truly taste the difference and the quality of the food compared to other places. I see several reviews about the levels of grease/butter etc on things...it's a good 'ol family owned breakfast place, it's not your trendy "egg ____"  so get over yourselves. 

The decor definitely is on the "country" level, the place legit looks like breakfast places down south. There are pictures & trinkets everywhere which I think give the place charm. 

Rick-the owner- was absolutely fantastic. You can truly tell how much he loves the place. He seemed involved in all aspects of the restaurant and we witnessed him talking to every table, seating guests, and running food. 

And of course, as we are sitting there we notice a sign that they make shakes...Oreo & "Shamrock". I couldn't help myself...we got a Shamrock shake...and odg it was amazing. 

We will most definitely be back to try out other items on their menu, we honestly had difficulty deciding because everything sounded fantastic.

My family ate here yesterday for lunch. I've eaten here a few times previous. The staff is friendly and accommodating and the food is good. My husband loved their homemade chili! I'm a fan of their pancakes and this time I tried the potato pancakes which were good. Some of the reviews I find funny especially the one wanting "espresso drinks". The name and the old school feel of this place would tell you go somewhere else for that. Needless to say we will be back!

Four stars for one reason:  The omelet.

The place is old and very worn.  Menu is standard for a pancake house.  And as always, I asked for my omelet to be "raw, running, rare, whatever it takes to get the kitchen to seriously undercook it."  My God, they did it.  Not just on the lightly cooked side, by actually served a bit runny.  

It was delicious.  The problem is I can never go back.  I know they won't make it that way a second time and I'll be disappointed.  So I'll just remember this perfect omelet, the way I make it at home.

The food was good. There was a misunderstanding with the groupons we wanted to use. We asked the boy before we even bought the groupon if we could use one each and he asked the owner and somehow the understanding was that they would accept it. 

Later, we were told we could only use one. The owner agreed to make an exception at first and then later went back on his word and  said he would just buy back one groupon and let us use only one. Due to the miscommunication and confusion there was a lot of discussion at our table with the owner and we were okay with all of it until the waitress sat down right behind us and started rolling her eyes in plain view. She made eye contact with me right after rolling her eyes and then walked away. Very disappointing experience. 

We paid 10 bucks for 15 dollars of food. It would have been 5 bucks off for each of us and this was made such a huge deal.

On a cold Sunday morning in late January I decided I wanted breakfast. After carefully considering my breakfast options from fast food drive thru windows, to places I know have good breakfast food, to Captain Crunch. I finally decided to take a risk and try somewhere I've never visited before. Having passed by Olde North Pancake House many times I've had a mental note in my brain for at least a decade to stop by, but for some reason I never have, until today.

Olde North Pancake house is laid out like an old country house. There is a front door with a very tall step before you walk in the door. There are strange arts and crafts decorating the walls and interior. The best description I can give is one not many people can relate to, it's decorated like my maternal grandmothers house. It's dark, with a big fireplace in the middle, low to the ground wooden chairs and a comfy atmosphere all around. I noticed price tags on some of the arts and crafts and antiques decorating the place so I assume they're actually for sale and that they simply didn't leave the price tags on everything.

Once I came in I was fairly quickly greeted and seated. I looked over the menu closely and noticed that the prices here were considerably higher than most pancake house/breakfast joints. After thoroughly browsing the menu I made my decision to try a Lousiana Skillet. This is a skillet with cajun style ingredients like shrimp, crab meat, andouille sausage and various types of peppers and cheese. What's somewhat different about Olde North Pancake house than other breakfast joints is that the skillets here do not have pancakes as an option, instead you're offered toast or a tortillo. I went with a corn tortillo. They also carry Pepsi products, but do not have Mountain Dew which is rather unusual.

A few minutes later my food was ready, and I was ready to snap the cerimonial picture for Yelp and dig in. The skillet was excellent, it was rich in wonderful flavor. While a bit spicy the sausage was great, the crab meat was moist and delicious and the shrimp was fantastic as well though I had to break the hard shelled tails off and eat those individually. The potato pieces had crisp outsides but soft insides, this skillet was perfectly seasoned and fantastic tasting. The tortillo was a little stiff, but besides that and the fact that the shrimp tails were left on I have no real complaints about the food itself. Simply put of all the breakfast places I've reviewed this is the best skillet I've had anywhere while also being the most expensive.

Overall I was very pleased with my meal at Olde North Pancake house. While the prices are quite a bit higher than most breakfast places the food here was fantastic, I'll definitely be visiting again and likely be bringing other people with me to try it. Overall this comes highly recommended and if you like cajun style food as much as I do the Louisiana skillet is a can't miss menu item. I'm going to give Olde North Pancake House a full five stars.

Back again for the home style cinnamon french toast combo breakfast. Happy to see it is still on the menu. The service is the same which is great. This nice old fashioned family owned and operated business deserves our support.

The further west you go on North Avenue, the fewer and farther between the eateries are. We go out to Pheasant Run for the Coin-Op Show once or twice a year, so we have hit most spots in the area. This trip we decided to try the Olde North Pancake House. 

It indeed looks "Olde", which is fine by me. It is basically an old country house that kind of feels like time has stood still. As they do not take credit cards, in a way, time really has stood still.

The food was decent, but not really exciting. I had the potato pancakes and Christopher had a corned beef hash skillet. Both were a tad pricey, but filling.

If you're in the area, and you are hungry, this isn't a bad stop. Be aware, however, that it is not handicapped friendly, especially for anyone in a wheel chair. There is one doozey of a big step to get in the front door. I don't know that there is any other access point. If there is, it is not obvious.
All our food was cold... Warm at best.  Still paid the $30 bill, but not worth that.  Avoid... There are better places around for breakfast.

best chicken fired steak ive ever had, it is expensive but the food is very good, really no credit cards atm fee drives away customers it costs more in atm fees and losing customers then it would if you just paid the credit card fee, again your prices can clearly absorb it

Came with a family of 23 and gave only 30 minutes notice. The owner made it happen very smoothly. Most restaraunts can't do that even with a reservation. The staff is very nice and welcoming. Food is pretty good. My favorite is the french onion soup in the kettle, with gooey cheese and bread on top.

This place was horrible!  First time there and definitely not going back! I can cook a better breakfast at home. Over priced.  Dark and stuffy. I ordered the eggs benedict and the eggs were way over cooked, hollandaise sauce was thick, salty and most likely came pre made in a can. My husband was pretty disappointed with his order as well. I don't know how this place is still in business! There are plenty of better dining options in the area. I feel as though I've been robbed- of my time and money!
Somebody call Robert Irvine!!!

Update: it's now 10/20/2014 and I still won't return to this place.  I vaguely remember why I wasn't happy - one thing I do remember is that they charge you $1 for an extra plate.  So I had 2 young children with me.  We order 2 large entrees to share with our two little children.  Ask for extra plates to share our food with the children...?  $1 a plate please!

Went here for the first time a couple of months ago & their water tasted very strange. As if the glass had not been cleaned properly so i was probably tasting the detergent. Also, i ordered a waffle and it was the driest waffle I have ever had. My experience aside, i do wish this family good luck in their business.
Workers were very friendly. 
Try it out...hopefully you will have a better experience than me.

Great food, great service, great price...why is it that I never had to wait for a table?!?!  I ask myself that every time I eat here.  Maybe I have been good at avoiding rush hour.  Maybe the place is so big it can accommodate a lot of people.  Maybe they're fully staffed during prime time.  If Madonna were here, she would say "Olde North Pancake House is a mystery..."  

This place has really grown on me.  I was a little weary my first time since I went around noon on a Sunday and did not see any cars parked in the front.  That suspicion diminished over time since I have not had a bad experience yet.  

The waitresses are always happy to serve, and my coffee cup never goes empty.  I'm not a big coffee drinker, but I do like their caramel coffee.  The decor is very country and it gives me a fuzzy warm feeling.  
The food is always delicious and there are tons of menu items to choose from.  

I had the strawberry crepe special during my last visit and it came with 2 crepes, 3 stripes of bacon, and 2 eggs for just under $8.  I've also tried their yummy potato pancakes (and you can get both the apple sauce and sour cream).  They have fish fry on Fridays I have been meaning to try but haven't gotten the chance to.

Other Notes:
-CASH only
-About 4 parking spaces in the front and lots more parking in the back (don't panic if you don't see any cars parked in the front)
-If you're heading West on North to get to the restaurant, you'll have to 
do a U-turn to enter the parking lot
-I believe they close at 4pm on weekends

This place is awesome. My husband and I came in here with my two daughters on a Sunday morning. It was busy but waited only a few minutes for a table. The options for breakfast are extensive. I went with the pecan french toast, Oreo pancakes for the girls and chicken fried steak for my husband. 
They ended up being out of the chicken fried steak so the owner gave us biscuits and gravy & blueberry pancakes on the house. He chose stuffed blueberry French today which was amazing. All the food was delicious!! My daughter's ate everything on their plates and asked for seconds. The atmosphere was prefect and made you feel cozy. If we didn't live in the city we would come here more often. It was worth every penny spent.
The food sucked and the prices were WAY to expensive for what they serve ! Don't waste your time going there.

We stopped by here after church today.  The place was only half full but it seemed to take forever to get a seat (close to 15 minutes).  Needless to say, not a very good start.  I had the potato pancake special.  I don't know what was special about the $8 meal only that there wasn't a lot of food and the pancakes were tough as one side was overcooked.  The server was great (the only saving grace).  They don't take credit cards.  This was the last straw.  The ATM wasn't working either.  What the heck?!?!  

The rustic charm of this place isn't lost, but really.  Step up to the 21st century.  I cannot recommend and will not return.

Went there for breakfast and was very disappointed.  The first thing is the decor, it looks very outdated and messy, dirty and unsanitary.  The food was not nearly as good as you can get at several other places not very far away.  I had an omelet that was very flat and over cooked.  The scrambled eggs were also very flat.  The side order of blueberry pancakes was undercooked in the middle and not very tasty.  The only water available is well water.

Overall, the restaurant seems very cluttered even to the point that the owner was sitting at one of the tables with paperwork and a computer.  It would be nice if there was an office for the owner rather than having guests watching him doing his own daily duties.

The restaurant also does not appear to be compliant with ADA requirements.  There is one stair to enter the front door which makes wheelchair access difficult if not impossible.  The door to the men's room is much narrower than a standard doorway making access for disabled persons impossible.

There are so many better choices nearby for breakfast that I will not be back.

This was mine and my wife's second time there. First things first. We religiously watch kitchen nightmare with Gordon Ramsey. This place is a serious contender for that show. They were going for eclectic decor but came out a bit sketchy. Not the best impression but whatever. Hopefully the foods amazing...

The food: We got a small order of scrambled eggs and toast. Came out like an omlette. The toast was drenched in butter. Most people nowadays live a healthy lifestyle and there already is butter on the table. Should let us decide if we want butter or not...
Also ordered the spanish omelette. It was okay actually but small portion of eggs and a ton of hash browns. The salsa that it came with literally was pasta sauce. It tasted nothing like salsa. Once again, toast on the side, drenched in butter. 
Lastly we got chocolate chip pancakes. What comes to mind when you order chocolate chip pancakes? For me, i think of a small stack of decadent flapjacks that are sweet and fluffy with melted chocolate chips dispersed throughout. HELL NO! It was salty, and heavy handed with baking soda...with the chocolate chips ON TOP. Literally ate two bites and stopped. I like to think we are pretty forgiving but this place was two too many strikes for redemption. Never going back. 

Only thing really good there was freshly squeezed juice. CASH ONLY to match the 1900s decor.

As diner-ish breakfast joints go, this one is my favorite in the burbs. We've been going here since I was a little kid, I swear it hasn't changed one bit. 

Between my brother, sis-in-law, and I, I think we've tried half the menu at this point. Everything has been delicious. They always have a special (usually season themed) pancake. Most recently; gingerbread pancakes with gingersnap syrup. Mmmmm. The caramel coffee is wonderful. Seriously, wonderful. 

You can order a whole bunch of different pancakes in one order. Like, 1 chocolate chip, 1 banana, etc. My sis-in-law loves that option. 

The servers are always very nice and really pay attention. Even when they get busy the servers don't rush but are still attentive. The decor is wonderfully tacky. It looks like someones crafty grandmother's garage sale exploded all over the walls. The best part is you can buy the decor right off the walls. Kitschy knickknacks and breakfast all in one stop! 

NO CREDIT CARDS. No credit cards accepted along with no obvious signs telling you no cc accepted is annoying. But, they do have an ATM in case you're caught without cash.

This is a wonderful place for a family meal. Live the pumpkin pancakes, the art on the walls and the country decor. Service is always efficient an pleasant, and food is tasty. My wife needs gluten free and they have lots she can eat. My son always cleans his plate. 

Do being cash, because they don't do credit cards. There is an ATM, but it's expensive.

Great spot for breakfast. I've driven by here numerous times but since it's not super close to home we've never eaten there. Saw them on groupon so finally decided to check them out. I immediately loved the atmosphere here. Kinda like you're eating breakfast and grandmas. Very cozy feel. Our server was very friendly and I beeline it was the manager who came out and spoke with us and explained the menu and told us about the business. Nice touch. Food was great. I'm a pancake snob and and pretty much disappointed by the pancakes everywhere I go, but these were really good. Taste and texture was spot on, just how I like them. Oh and coffee was great too. I'd LOVE to check out their Friday fish fry, but since I work Friday nights it will have to wait. We will definitely be back for breakfast though.

It looks like all the one star reviews are groupon issues, so stop trying to game the system, blame the owner for enforcing a clear groupon policy, and just enjoy the food and olde timey atmosphere. The biscuits and gravy are superb, the country breakfast is great, of course the pancakes and waffles are good. The decor is intentionally dated and I think it works. It's a classic breakfast place. Sit by the fire and enjoy some great food. I took off one star because I don't think the coffee is any good and they don't take credit cards. I get it, it would cost them at least 2 grand a year to accept credit cards and they probably make that much from the ATM in the lobby, but I don't like it. They could probably raise their star rating 1.5 just by dropping groupon and accepting credit cards, but try it for the food anyway. You won't be disappointed.

I don't like being taken advantage of. If you like being taken advantage of, then here's your place. My husband and I came here on a Sunday, with an Entertainment coupon worth $8. Although the coupon did not contain any "fine print" concerning the use of a coupon on Sundays, they refused to accept it. They told us that Entertainment made an error when printing the coupon. They handed us a laminated 8-1/2" sheet of paper, which had the Entertainment logo printed on it, an explanation of the situation, and an 800 number to call. We took a picture of the paper, so that we could call the number at a later time. When we dialed the number, it was a dead end! We are not amused.

First off this is a family owned place. It is cash only no credit cards.  They do have an ATM right at the door with a 2$ fee to use. If you save your ATM receipt they give you 2$ off your meal. Food is good. The specialty pancakes are the draw.  A few times a year they do pumpkin pancakes which are absolutely amazing.  Staff is friendly and attentive. Most mornings the owner is in and will happily check to make sure your being taken care of and the food is to your liking.  Prices are reasonable.  Higher then Denny's or IHOP but quality and service are better.  I've been a customer here for 12 years and look forward to many more.  Highly recommend this place for a great start to your day.

If your looking for a Starbucks with 50 coffee ideas this isnt for you. A classic cup of joe is classic, dont forget! This place isnt exactly the most appealing from the outside and in a location that feels hidden but let me tell you THIS PLACE IS A GEM! Its a mom and pop style place. Great breakfast foods but traditional. It reminds me of when I was a kid honestly. Remember this isnt your panera or some chain. Not many of these little hide outs left! So what if you have to pay cash! I went there with my family for the first time over the weekend and it was great. Decor may feel outdated to some but I liked it. It makes you feel like your at grandma's house. We watched the birds in a bird feeder out the window by our table for heaven's sake! Where else do you get that back to your roots feeling aside from the movies? Try it. You'll most likely make this a regular spot. I know I will even though its a little drive away. I rather give this place my $ than dropping it at any chain caf̬.

Compared to the other breakfast places in the area, I see no need to ever return here. I ordered a breakfast staple, biscuits and gravy with eggs and a side of hasbrowns. The gravy was way over seasoned with pepper and the pork sausage had little flavor. The biscuit was overly dry. The browns were a disaster, tasting like leftover oil. All this for like $8? Nope.

Based on the reviews here on Yelp we were a bit skeptical about coming here for Sunday brunch, but since its like 1 mile from our home we were too lazy to go anywhere else. I have driven past this restaurant so many times and could not believe we have not been here in the 6 months living in West Chicago. 
 From the moment we walked in we felt at home, it was cozy and comfortable. The hostess in the front gave us a warm smile and greeted us while taking down our names for the table. Luckily we did not have to wait too long (the have call ahead so we do not ever have to wait...LOVE IT!!!) we were seated at a table close to the fireplace. As soon as we sat down our server came over introduced herself and took our drinks order. GET THE CARAMEL COFFEE YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED. Next came our food order, my husband got the Louisiana skillet and I got the spanish Omelet and we got 1 pumpkin pancake. 
   The food arrived in 10 min or so, did not take too long. And oh my was it good! From the very first bite we were in heaven. The Pumpkin pancake was the best pancake we have EVER had. It was so fluffy and moist filled with flavor. Needless to say we devoured our food. After we finished eating, the owner Rick came to our table and check up on us. We could not be happier.We even went home wishing we had more pancakes. I think we found our weekend brunch spot, still can not figure out why this place does not have a higher rating.
Eggs Benedict is AMAZING!  Pancakes made from scratch like you have never tasted!  Pumpkin pancakes are unbelievably delicious!

It is what it is. Very simple with a price that says they are really complicated. Their day has passed them bye with no credit card access and a scam to use their ATM. The food was good but with the underhanded "stuff" they pull, I wouldn't go back. Try your cheap ways some more and see how long you last. I would feel very cheated if I spent any more at this hole-in-a-wall that treats themselves as a Zagat rated gem.

Not good. I believe Linda's shrimp were from frozen as were her vegetables. My biscuits tasted like raw dough, but my haddock tasted OK. At the end, we found out that they did not take credit cards (no problem as I had the cash, but really?). Should have gone to John & Tony's down the street, but thought after 2 years we would give it another go. Oh, I also had heartburn in the middle of the night. Condensed to two words - It Sucked.

This is a favorite for my family, they have great food and the best caramel coffee!! The stuffed French toast was wonderful today!! Also you can sign up to get coupons emailed to you, who doesn't love that.

I might come back here if the sour cream in the crepes was not bad every. single. time. Also the water is well water and if you try to bring in your own water, well, it is NOT OKAY with management. 

Also, (I think the owner?) creeps me out. Every time I would go on a weekend he would stop by our table to see "How we were doing" and somehow we would get trapped into a sales pitch about the carmel coffee and freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juice. He just seemed a little desperate and desperation is not what I take with my coffee in the morning.

The decor is cute tho.

Olde North Pancake House has a dive-y home grown vibe to it. Decor that hasn't been updated since the 70's, but the place is still packed. They have a pretty extensive breakfast menu. Everything we had lived up to expectations for breakfast foods, but didn't set any new bars. They push the potato pancakes here. Particularly some southwest special they were having at the time. I didn't find it very special, but the potato pancakes are different at least. Service was friendly.

Word of caution- They don't take credit cards so make sure you have cash.

Great food! Super pricey. Bring cash or you will have to use there ATM and pay an additional $1.50 for your meal. Weird how they kept trying to sell us stuff, coffee
Appetizers.

Simply marvelous staff. I felt that they have pride in what they do and it shows; they are genuinely friendly and accomodating. The food is very affordable and quite yummy. The ambience brings you to a whole different place. I feel like I am in the country and it's soothing. It's clean and just a great get away.

They were very playful to my 10-month old baby.

I am planning on going back this weekend with my grandma from Philippines. I know she will love it too.

Just bring cash or a checkbook.

I love this place!  The service is great and the food is yummmy!

If you're looking for a good old fashion pancake house...look no further :)

First and foremost:
BRING CASH! Or your checkbook. Credit cards are not accepted, but there is an ATM near the entry with a $60 cash limit.

Nice little restaurant on North Avenue in West Chicago (the far west suburb) with good service and a friendly staff. The interior has a country feel to it and seats about 80 to 90 customers. The parking lot is small and may accommodate about 30 cars. I took a chance on going on a late Sunday morning, right before noon, and managed to be seated right away (table for two) in the already-full restaurant.

I chose this restaurant for the pancakes, of course. I asked my server, who happened to be Rick the owner, if he'd recommend the blueberry pancakes or the cinnamon raisin pancakes. He suggested one cinnamon raisin and two blueberry pancakes so that I could try both. So that's what I ordered, and a side of bacon too. Both types of pancakes had the fruit mixed into the batter and tasted pretty good. Hot blueberries in the pancakes and hot blueberry compote made those pancakes even better.

Three types of syrup were on the table: Maple, Strawberry and Boysenberry. After having the standard maple syrup on my cinnamon raisin pancakes, I tried the boysenberry syrup on the second half of my blueberry pancakes and immediately fell in love with the flavor. Good stuff. Boysenberry... I'm coming back for more!

The grapefruit juice I ordered with my breakfast was excellent. I had to ask my server what brand of juice it was, simply because it was some of the best tasting grapefruit juice I've ever had. Not too tart, right amount of sweetness and hardly any pulp at all. He said their supplier is in Florida and guarantees fresh squeezed juice shipped within 3 to 4 days of juicing. It was really good and I'll probably try the fresh squeezed orange juice next time.

I've really only been to the Olde North Pancake House for breakfast, but their menu has a lunch and dinner section too. A sign outside the restaurant notes their Friday Night Fish Fry special. I also saw a sign inside the restaurant noting an upcoming date when they will be serving pumpkin pancakes. So I guess it's hit or miss when pumpkin pancakes are available, but I definitely want to try those. Yes, I'll be back!

Amazing food! I seriously have never had anything bad here, biscuits and gravy come super fluffy, just like southern cooking. The stuffed french toast is awesome, and the chopped steak is the most flavorful (not too salty) breakfast there is. Love old north!
Very good food, good coffee,nice waitstaff, fair prices, and decent variety.  Better than most breakfast places I go to. Going tomorrow actually.

This place is pretty basic, but not really cheap and the service is rude. They don't take checks or credit cards. They don't have free papers. There is very little parking. There are plenty of better places for spend your money.
Food is good but pricey coffee is excellent but only on the weekends. If you go on the weekend go early and be prepared to wait. Eggs Benedict are very good.

Fabulous food, terrific service, nice home-like atmosphere....the little things that make a business successful! 

One drawback? They don't take credit cards....weird...in this day and age, you kinda have to! I don't carry cash with me....but they kindly took a check. I will be back!

This place kind of reminds me of a nursing home.  There was an older crowd there on a Friday afternoon.  The decor was very outdated.  Don't drink the water!  It has the strong taste of iron which felt like drinking blood.  Get the orange juice--it's delicious.  I ordered the pumpkin pancakes and it was actually really, really good.  I had low expectations walking into this place, but the pancakes really surprised me.  They were fluffy, soft, and perfectly cooked and flavored.  My friend had the skirt steak skillet which was mediocre and pricey.  $12.99 for a small portion of a steak skillet where the steak tasted like rubber?  Hmmm. No thanks.  I don't think I would go back to this place even though the pancakes were amazing, but it did not "wow" me.

We had always passed this place while driving along north avenue, but never around breakfast time - until last weekend.  The building has an antique, chalet kind of design.  Very dark, but warm and welcoming.  Plenty of parking in the back.

Our waitress was very friendly and helpful, and the crayons and paper were great to keep our 3 y/o occupied.  Coffee and water were replenished quickly and the waitress was attentive throught the meal.  They were featuring caramel roasted coffee that day and it was delicious.

The pumpkin pancakes were fantastic - good flavor and perfectly cooked.  The buttermilk and chocolate chip pancakes were also very good.

We ordered 2 eggs, pancakes and some bacon and SPLIT IT.  oh and 2 coffees.  Bill came out to OVER $20...NOT including tip.  This place does have a yummy Russian Blintz, but NOT worth the money to go there...ridiculous.

Oh that's right...they don't take credit cards.  You have to pay cash.  Sorry any business too cheap to pay the CC fees to make it more convenient for the customers will be cheap in other areas...

We had a fantastic breakfast which was a little of a surprise.  From the outside, the location is not much to look at but come inside and it is warm and homey.  The staff was friendly, very knowledgeable of the menu and helpful with ordering.  We split the strawberry crepes and the spanish steak and eggs. It was so good I didn't want to push back from the table.  Might have over-eaten just a little bit but it was so worth it.  The fresh squeezed orange juice was really tasty.  The pumpkin pancakes and bohemian pancakes (with apricots) both got thumbs up from our group.  Wasn't thrilled with their caramel roasted coffee that is one of their specialties.  Probably just a personal preference because it was a little too sweet for me.  BRING CASH.  They do not take credit cards.

Been visiting Old North at least once a month for over 10 years. 
First time a waitress not only remembered us, but knew my "usual" order, the benny, by our third visit. (Although no longer waitressing, Kathy still greets long-time friends and makes sure the operation runs efficiently.) 

The food is fabulous, particularly the Eggs Benedict. The caramel coffee is addicting. The staff is outstanding. The owner Rick always makes sure his customers are satisfied. 

On Sundays, go early for Breakfast or noon Lunch as the nearby church services that let out always cause a line by 10:30 AM. (apparently the parishioners think the food is heavenly too!) 

I'd take off 1/2 star for the occasional water quality and the high-fee, low limit ATM ($3.00/$60 = Minimum 5% Fee?!?) at the front, so stop by your own bank's ATM before you go.

This is a new favorite for breakfast. My husband and I have lived in the area several years and always thought of it as a little dive restaurant. BOY WERE WE WRONG. The place is quaint with a very friendly wait staff. You can not pass up the pancakes and the flavored syrups on the table. Also, the offer a caramel coffee and fresh squeezed juices. They also offer a Friday night fish fry. I am looking to go back for that soon.
LOVE IT!  Cash only takes some getting used to....awesome food...great coffee. I love it, my 8 year old loves it....Russian Blintzes to die for!

This is a great place its got the feel like its been there forever and is very welcoming and cozy. There pancakes are nice and fluffy and do all types of syrups to go with them. My favorite thing there is their eggs Bendick which is nice and fresh. Ive heard that on Sundays it can get busy because the church next door service is over.Nice place to get some pancakes
It's been a family favorite since I was a kid in the early 60's.  Beware - it ain't cheap, but it is worth it.  Also, no credit cards!!!

Wanted veggies, and had a cold that was beating my ass.... hate having a cold! Anyways upon the recommendation of the cashier , very helpful by the way considering I did not know what the menu said.
Was told what was good for my cold was the sav usal - at least I think that's what it was called.
Good for my cold! Noodles yum! Soup was good.
But I didn't get the buns they gave, I mean I get to lessen the heat for those who it's too hot but I wasn't feeling them and I felt bad for wasting them I tossed them in the trash I wish the menu was more descriptive cuz I would of told them none please.

 I love finding places with huge samosas and the sauces YUM YUM YUM! I purposely saved the other one for later to savor it again.

Roti wasn't my taste I like roti normally theirs tasted more floury/dry. I'll try the naan next time.

I will return & recommend this place mine u it looks like a hole in the wall but the food was great.

I am writing this as I'm enjoying my wonderful meal because I couldnt wait! I called in for pick-up and it was ready in less than 10 mins. I ordered the lunch special (refer to posted photo) which came with 3 dishes, rice, and wheat naan, all for $6! Everything was delicious! Flavors were spot on and the portions were generous. Not sure if he owned the place but the guy who helped me was very friendly and seemed passionate about the food, and even took time to explain what's included in the lunch special. I live 5 mins away and can definitely see myself coming here every week. 

I agree with everyone who said the ambiance is not exactly inviting but don't deprive yourself of the chance to try some amazing Indian food. You will not regret it!

This is a real hole in the wall with great food!  I love Indian food and no one does vegetarian fare with more flair and flavor than Indian kitchens!  I am working nearby temporarily and it's kind of a restaurant desert.  Lunch options of Subway, Burger King, etc don't cut it.  If I don't brown bag it I go to Vegetarian Fast Food and it never disappoints.  I am in love with their lentil soup.  But there's a problem...it is far from fast!  No ambience, just a few wobbly tables and chairs, beverages from a low stocked cooler and a menu board in front.  Helps to know your Indian food, and most of the customers were Indian.  The samosas are especially good and I intend to post another review as I work my way through the menu.  You won't miss the meat.  Not sure it's a special trip kind of place but if you're shopping at some of the local outlets, do drop in, get it to go though!

Very good authentic food. The owner was very nice. The food delicious and large serving. It's a small place with a bit of a different atmosphere but definitely worth trying. Another excellent vegetarian option!

When I heard about this place, I was a bit skeptical. Vegetarian Indian fast food? Probably all frozen? I was wrong and I am so glad I was! We ordered a chana batura, samosa chaat, and some vegetarian puffs. Everything tasted fresh and homemade!! It was traditional Gujarati flavors and my taste palette really appreciated this. The kind gentleman at the front (I'm assuming the owner) had good customer service and I will be returning to try out the selection of sweets they have.

Veg. Fast Food is an outstanding choice for vegetarian options. You are really missing out *on life* by passing this place up.

Service: Great! They gave me a free Pakoda my first time here :)
Food: Literally, the best food I have had in my life. Khasta Kachori was mind blowing. Methi Pakoda was outstanding AND filling!
Value: Superb

This unassuming no-frills place serves yummy vegan/vegetarian food with perfectly balanced flavors (not over-spiced). Yes, they cook fresh food every day, I have had sit down meals there and I could hear multiple pressure cooker whistles for 20 minutes. If you are looking for a system detox without compromising taste, do give it a try. I have reservations against eating out of styrofoam, but you can't beat the price.

Love this place - the food is always great - service is friendly.  Best samosas in town!  Terrific if you're on a budget, but it's worth twice the price.  I go there because it's fantastic Indian food, not because it's inexpensive.  That it's affordable is simply a bonus.  HIGHLY RECOMMEDED!

Went here for the first time yesterday to give this place a try. A coworker suggested it and said they have great samosas...I was sold. When I pulled up there were two open signs on but it looked like it was a storage place more than a dining place. When I walked in it was not what I expected, a little sketchy, but what the hell I was hungry! This very nice man was at the counter and suggested I try the dinner special. You get a variety of stuff and he said I would like it. I said cool I'll take that and an order of samosas please. He didn't ring me up but told me to take a seat. I walked over to the coolers and looked at all the desserts they have and grabbed a coconut water for my beverage of choice. I sat down and waited and waited. The dude came out with my food and I stood up to pay and he said it's ok pay later. I liked this guy already! He explained what was on the tray and how to eat it ( for example eat the rice with the soup and dip the bread in the bean dish or whatever I want.) I appreciated that information. I dug in, and wow it was delicious!! Just the right spices, food was so tasty. It tasted homemade to me. Then he brought me a sample of some ball thing to try I liked it!! Thanks dude! The samosas were so amazing!! I can't rave enough about how good the food was. Ok now on to the best part. I finally went up to the register to pay and for my giant dinner special, samosas, and my drink it was $7 and some change!!! I could not believe the price! I am in love with this place and will be back. The nice dude told me to wait a second and went in the back and came out with a couple of desserts he gave them to me to try. He was so sweet and made damn good food! Go there you will not be disappointed!!

Went there for the first time. The owner was super nice and while I waited he fed me and another patron samples of his food. It was delicious. I ordered "the dinner " and asked if the owner had more of what he gave me samples of so I could buy it. Because it was closing time, he only had a few more samples and gave them all to me for free. The prices are very reasonable, the service great, and the food is delicious. Small gem in a nondescript strip mall.

Best meal during our trip. From the outside (and even a bit from the inside), this did not look promising. However, my partner and I ordered the lunch special (four sides and bread) and rather than giving us duplicate meals, the proprietor gave us eight different sides and bread. All were delicious. When we were leaving, we were tempted by the wide array of desserts in their cooler. All the unique colors and shapes were intriguing, but we did not want to just pick one. Again, the proprietor offered to mix them up and picked one each of his favorite ten items and packed it in a to-go container. Hours later when our appetite returned, we dove into the desserts and again, each one had a unique flavor and none were too sweet. I will have to search my hometown of Portland for a similar place. I am hooked.

I tried this little hole-in-the-wall carry out/store a few months ago after reading some awesome reviews.  I have to admit I was a bit surprised at the decor/layout - I think I was expecting more of a restaurant.

I had no idea what to order since I don't know any Indian dishes except for samosas, so went with the Lunch Special. (I wish I could tell you what it included, but I have no clue..)  The woman took my order, but she wasn't particularly friendly.  Some men came in after me to place orders and they got theirs first.  Not sure if that was typical, or if they pre-ordered..?  There are a bunch of chairs to sit in while you wait for your order.  I waited for almost 15 minutes, though it seems much of the food was made ahead of time and was just being warmed. 

The price was reasonable and the food was good.  The portion size was good, too - I was able to make two meals out of the Lunch Special.  There were varying degrees of spice between the different dishes, which was nice.  It's clear it's made right in the back, as I could spy a rice cooker from the doorway.  

I'll definitely be back for another round of the Lunch Special.
Forgot to add that lunch and dinner specials may be made vegan as requested.

I come here for the samosas and spinach balls (That didn't sound right).  I have come to fall in love with their food.  It's not your typical Indian cuisine.  It's a lot more of the finger foods and I would assume it's homemade.  I do not know if this is correct as I am not an expert on homemade Indian food.  They have a lot more on the menu, and will be trying each and everyone of them.  

The prices are awesome and the portions are great.  If you are in to spicy food, you will not go wrong going to Vegetarian Fast Food.

Oh man, I'm so happy I found out about this place. 

It's an Indian snack shop, which sells fresh sweets, loads of snacks, and various Indian sundries (spices, ice cream, frozen food, rice, flours, etc.) It also sells freshly made vegetarian and vegan food. There's a menu full of standard favorites, such as samosas, paratha, pakora, and puris. Also tea (delicious milk tea), lassi (both plain and mango), and coffee. 

I had the lunch special. Apparently, it changes every day. Today was Monday, and if it's the same every Monday, anyone who doesn't do very spicy food would like today's special. For a mere $6 (as of this writing), you get soup, rice, a hot vegetable dish, a hot bean dish, two kinds of bread (naan and puri), and a little cold salad. As you can see from the photo, it's a LOT of food. I was hungry when I went, but I still had to take half my food home with me. That's probably why this place also offers a mini lunch special, which includes all of the stuff I listed minus the soup and rice -- for $3. You read that correctly. I'll probably get that and a cup of tea next time I go, so I might be able to finish it. Really good food. I'll also have to try it on a day when spicier foods are offered; I grew up eating both Thai and Indian food, so I'm pretty spice-tolerant. 

The family who runs this place are really nice, and the gentleman behind the counter is very happy to guide you if you need help with any menu items. Not only that, if you eat in, he gives you samples of other stuff to try. Or at least, he did while I was there. In addition to my lunch special, I got to try a delightful methi pakora (little fried puffball made with spinach and besan [chickpea] flour). After I paid and told him how good it was, the cook sent out a little piece of methi paratha (spinach, millet, and corn flatbread) that she'd just made. 

There is nothing better than fresh food made by people who obviously love making and serving their food. Love it. Will definitely nom again, and will take friends. :9

Good food, friendly and knowledgeable service, and good vegan options.  If you compare it to Annapurna on Devon, but even side-by-side VFF clearly wins.

If you don't know what to get, choose the lunch special.  If you're vegan or have another specialized diet, let them know and they will hook you up.  If you are asked if it is too hot, this is a test.  In my case, I ended up with a spiced chile pakora that was hot hot hot.  The spinach ball pakora things are also excellent and have nicely spiced batter.

Dessert is excellent here too.  I got the Boondi, which is vegan and pretty much just fried chickpea flour and sugar.  My preschooler ate almost all of it.  

Even with few vegan options in the hinterlands, VFF would shine no matter where it was.  Check it out.

We stopped in to try Indian food as we're eating vegetarian right now. We have never eaten at an Indian restaurant (made a few dishes at home) and didn't know where to start. The restaurant is more of a carry-out place, but they do have a community table to eat at and that's where we chose to sit. 

The man at the counter recommended the lunch special which includes soup, rice, beans and vegetables as well as 4 pieces of naan. My husband and I both ordered the lunch special. It was quite a treat as they prepared two different lunches for us so that we could each try a variety of their dishes. Everything was delicious! You could tell it was freshly prepared using quality ingredients. They also sent us out a few other samples to try including a dessert (jalebi) at the end of our meal. Everything is reasonably priced. The service was fast and friendly. They are passionate about what they do and it shows. And above all the food was fantastic. We'll certainly be back and look forward to trying new dishes.
Friendly, fast service and tasty,  inexpensive Indian food on the go. I wish I was in the area more.  Thanks for taking time to explain the ingredients,  DK! I plan to pay VFF as often as possible.

This is a Gujarati cafe/grocery store with a large selection of inexpensive vegan Indian offerings, including two vegan (by default) desserts. The owner, D.K., is a really friendly guy and knowledgeable about what is and isn't vegan on his menu (most of the foods are vegan, whereas most of the desserts are not).

I got a vada pav ($3) which is a potato dumpling placed between a bread roll. This is typical Indian street food in Bombay and I think Vegetarian Fast Food did a good job with it. The dumpling (vada) could have been crispier, but it was nicely flavored.

I also got some dishes for take-out: alu baigan (potato-eggplant) and a cabbage-potato dish. Both of these cost about $3 for a medium-sized portion.

The cabbage-potato dish was excellent: fresh, simple and well-spiced. This is typical Indian home-cooking at its finest.

The potato-eggplant dish wasn't as good. For one thing, the eggplant didn't absorb the curry's flavors enough. Also, the eggplant was kept intact in pieces, rather than being broken apart into a mushier texture; in the case of this dish, a mushier texture would have aided flavor uptake and would have created good contrast with the firmness of the potato pieces. Lastly, I didn't like the spices on this dish. I think there was too much tomato in the mix and not enough garlic and onions.

There were two vegan desserts when I came: one type of "ladoo" (a fried sugar ball made of flour and spices) and also some other greyish bar-thing. I wasn't impressed with either, but it's rare that you find vegan desserts in Indian cuisine, so I'm glad that they're available, nevertheless.

One final thought: that area of Glendale Heights/Bloomingdale has very few cool cafes and coffee shops. Vegetarian Fast Food could really capitalize on this if it spruced up its interior and offered some nice drinks, such as home-made Indian chai, made with soy, rice or almond milk. If it had more vegan desserts, too, it would be a great hang-out spot.

As it stands, it has a few good vegan dishes at really low prices. If you're in the area, it's worth a stop.

If you are looking for comfort home food, then it is a place. Owners are very kind and serve best home cooked food. Food is tasty and very nice people. They served me few of their snacks to try (free) since I was pregnant.:):):)...I was very touched :)

Very small place. Hardly there are 2 or 3 tables. If you are looking for great ambiance, then this is not a place to be. But if you are looking for home made tasty good then visit this..

Pleasantly surprised! I've had Indian food before but I'm not familiar with pretty much anything on this menu besides Samosas.. lol (although I usually only order meat dishes) Decided to try the lunch special to try it out and it was great! Way too much food, so will have to get the mini next time. Samosas were yummy, dishes were spicy enough for me, everything was tasty. The only thing I wasn't a fan of was the white rice, was hoping for a more flavorful rice.
The people here were SO sweet. I didn't get much help picking dishes like I've read here but that's ok, I didn't really ask either. The woman even spoiled my kids with candy. :)

I am new to Indian food and wanted to give this place a try after reading some of the reviews. This is a no frills place which relies on the food. The man behind the counter was very nice explained the menu and gave me an appetizer to try while I waited for my food and a dessert to go. The food was great and very cheap I will be back.
I still love this place.. better Indian food here than you would find on Devon. jut sayin.

Hidden place.. Glad I found it. 6$ for lunch tiffin which includes 4 poori/tortilla(chapati), 2 vegetables, rice and one curry. Quanitity is so much that one cannot finish it in one meal. I usually take 4 pooris extra for 1$ and use it for dinner as well. Preparation is very good. I just take care of not ordering something which is very gujrati. Different menu everyday. So, chose your vegetables. Home made, medium spicy. I am a regular there. Their other snacks like samosa (2 for 1.5$), Pakoras are also very good. I am yet to try their pao bhaji (3$). Just awesome, try it once. I do take out mostly. Very humble and friendly staff.

When I first went there a few years back, the guy working the counter was very helpful and the food was awesome (except for the hair I found in the tortillas).
I decided to give them a second try because the food was actually really good enough that I was craving them, but first..let me start from the beginning. 
The parking lot is average size, but this place is easily overlook.  When you actually find the place you aren't sure if you are walking in the right door, via vegetarian fast food or the next door Chinese restaurant.  When you first walk in, you aren't even sure if this is a restaurant or a run down grocery store.  Ironically its both. The smell was overwhelming, it felt like I was walking inside a unclean bathroom, but I continue onward.  When I got up to the counter, the lady took care of me, but wasn't as helpful as the guy a few years back.  I got my food and went home to try it out.  The food was good, and there wasn't any hair in the tortillas this time, but the samosa were cold in the middle.

This place is located in a dumpy, frowsy plaza, the restaurant itself is a disorganized, messy back room, and the service hindered to frustration by language issues. But the food, Dear God, the food is good. The prices are also quite reasonable. My daughter and I dined in, a mistake. Carry out and you'll never need to worry about the decor.

WOW.  I told Crista L. about this place and we are in LOVE with it!!

I went here around 4 pm on a Monday and was treated like royalty.  The owner was so sweet and kept bringing all kinds of dishes to our table for us to try.  And everything was vegan that day!!  

Totally cheap, plenty of fresh homemade and healthy foods and a huge desert case with all kinds of Indian candy/cookies.

In a strip mall so I never would have guessed...but the food is phenomonal!!

Love this place, and everything they serve. Each day of the week is a lunch special Thursday is my favorite. I love wed and friday as well but wouldn't suggest either to anyone that can't handle so spicy it makes your eyes water...

After reading raving reviews here I decided to try this place.

If we are primarily  rating on how cheap the food is then I would have given it five stars. It had the cheapest Indian food I have had in North America. However, the quality of the food here is proportional to its price,The ingrediants did not taste very fresh. I think they may use frozen food for most part, but you can't blame them since they call themselves "fast food".  What I did not like was the daal(curry) being lumpy, dosa slightly burnt on top and coconut chutney that looked like it had seen better days.

This place looks like a cross between a restaurant and grocery store. It appears that they are not sure which one it will be.

Although I like the concept and had good hopes about this place, it did not do it for me.

It's about time I write a review for this place...

I recently moved back to the suburbs, and as difficult as that can be, a restaurant like this makes it all the more tolerable.

I first saw Vegetarian Fast Food about a year ago and decided to give it a whirl.  Turns out I walked into a smorgasbord of Indian foods.  The owner was extremely attentive and helped to explain the many options available on the menu.  I ended up with a meal that consistented of 4 or 5 different tasty dishes (Indian food often comes in smaller portions with more variety of foods).

I returned 3 times in the first two weeks following my initial visit.  Also, I mentioned that I had just been married on one trip, and left loaded up with a to-go box full of desserts - free of charge.  The owner told me it was a congratulatory present and that I had to share it with my wife.  Now that's classy.

Bottom line: I would give it 4.5 stars.  Great food, incredibly reasonably priced, and not a lot of restaurant hassle.  If you like your vegetarian food, and you enjoy Indian cuisine, get over there ASAP.

I passed this place a couple of times and was curious as to what exactly Vegetarian Fast food was. So I only realized that it was Indian food when I decided to finally go in and check it out. I think they should add that onto the signage, but then again it kind of adds to the mystique of the place.

The owner DK is awesome. He is excited that you've found his place and that you like Indian food. He goes out of his way to give you free samples and explain what items they have and is flexible with the lunch special items. It's no Gaylords but you'll come away from this place with an ok selection of Indian snack type and more traditional type foods. They have samosas, yellow dal soup, rotis, chickpea/ beans and some unknown vegetable mash-ups. He will give you a variety to try, he's trying to find out what appeals to his customers most. The masala tea is pretty awesome too. They have seating inside and a small grocery snack area as well as a bakery sweet case. I do have to say the "fast" compared to other fast food is lacking, but then again it is Indian food. And for that I say, Indian food so fast you'll freak.

Oye, this place reminds me of how much I love being Indian. My favorites are the Samosas, Dhokla, and the Thalli (a platter of all things delicious). The ambiance isn't ideal for a sit-down meal, but don't let that steer you away from trying out this ethnic gem. Yes, there is not meat to be found within the walls, but sometimes even veggies need some love too. Check it out, please :)
My absolute favorite place in the suburbs! Food is delicious and really cheap! The one place I wish I could give more than five stars.
If your a boring white person, don't be intimidated! The staff is friendly and the food is amazing! I crave this homemade goodness all the time!! In fact, I want some right now!

I hate to give this place a bad review as I wanted so badly to like it. However, the food is just awful. It was possibly the worst Indian food I have ever had. I will agree with others that you get large portions, but at the end of the day when you throw 3/4 of it in the trash because it tastes terrible, you're really not getting a good value. The chole tasted like canned beans mixed with canned tomato soup. The soup that came with the lunch special was bland and cold. The mango lassi was tiny, overpriced, and not that tasty. The one things we did like was the sambar, but the vada that came with it was extremely dry and flavorless. I would also like to say that vegetarian food can be healthy, but a lot of items here are deep-fried. Potatoes can also be healthy but if you deep-fry them into french fries it sort of defeats the health factor. Just because something is vegetable based does not make it healthy. They did have decent service although they didn't seem to have the setup needed for a good takeout place, or sit-down for that matter. The little shop attached to it with all kinds of Indian staples seemed promising, but we will definitely not be back for the food.

I gave up meat and rice for lent... It was torture at first, but I'm starting to enjoy my new options.
So I stopped in because i wanted something fast and something without meat.  To my surprise, it's actually a small Indian grocery store!?! Oh even better, because I live off of late night Indian (getting out of work and  staying near Devon leave u little choices)

I must have looked confused because the two men behind the counter were very sweet and patient with me. I told them my meat and rice restriction, and that I'm allergic to nuts.  He picked something out for me and I waited for it to come out (it's only a couple tables and awkward for dine in, so I took mine to go). The owner was so sweet, he even gave me some Spinach Balls on the house... Picture a spicy cornmeal-like batter with spinach mixed in. Delicious. 
I don't even know what this dish I just ate is called, but it's filling and flavorful. So I opened the lid and there was cilantro and tomatoes mixed into a yellowish sauce, and chickpeas. The cilantro and lime remind me of Mexican food. But this is awesome, I never quite liked Chick Peas until today. The bread that comes with is like a mixture between naan and paratha... It's a little greasy compared to any naan I'm used to. But not as tin as the large flat parathas. I will definitely be back for a quick Indian fix in the suburbs.
Went for the Cubs game. World Series playoffs game 7. Couldn't believe they made room for my party of 8 people. Service was slow. But the place was packed. The food was great. Will be back!

Terrible terrible horrible. What's the deal guys?? Horrible sound messing up. Rap crap always playing. Learn to turn off the music during the game. What about focusing on the customers that have come here for years?  Why cater to the drug dealing thugs that hang outside all night?

Only reason service was good tonite was because NO ONE WAS HERE! Sad. I've been coming many years. No wonder why everyone I know that used to hang out here never wants to come anymore.  Bar has so much to over too!

I've been ordering take out and coming here for 5 plus years. I've noticed a slow decline through out the years. I ordered quesadillas last week with a side of avocado. The avocado was disgustingly almost all rotten. I called as soon as I noticed, and of course was put on hold for 3 plus minutes..at that point I just hung up.  

All my orders in the past year or 2 have been made so carelessly and sloppy. I notice the little things- forgotten soups, sandwiches not cut, missing sides, etc. I think I'm done with Pops. As a Roselle resident who lives a minute away, it makes me sad..but I'm done brushing over things that should be done right.

This is one of the only bars that charges tax on alcohol  and seems to change their specials whenever they want. The food is at best average. We used to come up here very often; stopped by tonight Sunday 10/23/2016 and instead of Football they have 60 minutes on. So please take into account that a beer that is 2.75 on special it is really 3.05 there are so many better places out there.

why pops??!! youre close to my house, id love to love you.  any and every time we order from here, the order is wrong. sometimes its a little wrong, sometimes, its not really even close to what we ordered. i guess we are the dumb ones cuz we continue to order, but theres not many other choices. sigh....

First, I am willing to change my review if Pop's management refunds me money they promised for a really lousy evening of food when we invited five friends over. ** Check out my photo ** to see the slushy Pop's pizza we had delivered.
