It's awful. They replaced it an hour later and promised me a refund since dinner was late and after seeing that first pizza, our entire group lost their appetites. As of 4/20/16, our order from many months ago received no refund/credit yet and I suspect they're not anxious to do so. No problem, as I'll be sure to update this review often until they come upon it...

Anyways, their pizza is apparently hit or miss (our unfortunate Fate) and as others say, the buffalo chicken wings came frozen out of a Tyson bag and were simply microwaved. VERY DISAPPOINTED and I can see how people have a hard time returning to any restaurant after such an experience.

Love this place to watch Blackhawks Hockey and plenty of parking here. Food is affordable, but you get what you pay for. The fish fry Friday was pretty evident when you walk in the door-very fishy smelling. I ordered chicken with mashed potatoes and my chicken was hot and my potatoes were cold. Very strange. Our drink order was also wrong the first time. They rectified both situations and our server Jordan was very sweet, courteous and remained friendly despite being extremely busy with many tables. Nice hockey night drink specials. Good variety of beer and ciders too. We've also had the double decker pizza here. Yummy but too saucy in the middle for my tastes.

We have had dinners at Pop's over the past several years and most have been very good.  The service and timeliness of the service is good. I would recommend but on Playoff or Special Sports Events the crowd can be overwhelming. If you're young and into sports bars, your in luck, but I'm a bit older and like a peaceful place to dine, and I have to say on most nights the dining room is just great.
I was in there the other day and it was awesome our server was Donna she was so nice and helpful and my drink never went empty!!!!!!!!

Nice atmosphere, but loud. Food is tasty, but they use day old crust for pizza and rheir chicken tenders aren't good. I hear the wings are really good and the nachoa with chili are amazing!
They have forgotteb to give me part of my order on a few occasions and I've had to wait longer. Aren't that attentive to take out orders.

Not special. Everything tasted blah and wasn't worth the money. My sandwich had slimy lunchable - type meat on it and fell apart. Ordering and delivery was a painful experience from start to finish. I cannot recommend this place. Will never go back... even if I am starving I would prefer starvation over the food and "service" here. I hope they go out of business soon.

Came here to watch the Ronda rousey fight. Great atmosphere okay beer specials. Decided to get some wings to pass the time and they were horrible. Asked the waitress for hot, she rudely said " they're traditional wings... They are hot".
Once received extremely bland no spice and tastes like they came straight from Aldi's. Will never eat here again.

Food was great, I recommend getting the pizza. The blue moons were great even though I lost a bet and had to pay for them all... One thing I would've changed is the company I was with but besides that it was great!

I guess consistent advertising eventually pays off.

My husband and I kept getting Pop's menus and coupons in the mail (and we drove by it often) so we headed there for dinner one night. To our surprise, Pop's is more than just a sports bar -- there is a small restaurant dining room off to the side. Both are easily accessible from either side of the building.

We were seating at a quiet booth in the restaurant and promptly handed menus and a giant bowl of the most delicious bread I've ever had prior to a meal in a restaurant. It was SO GOOD. I nearly ate the whole loaf. For dinner, my husband ordered a rotisserie chicken while I had the fish (I believe it might have been the Friday night fish fry). Both meals were the perfect portion: not too large, but still left you stuffed after finishing off the entire plate. Both meals were also very delicious -- surpsingly so, considering this was just the little dine-in restaurant attached to a bar. Our bill wasn't too bad either. We left satsified. Our meal wasn't the best meal we've ever had, but it was good and memorable enough to put this on Yelp. Whee!

Went to Pops for the first time a couple of weeks ago. Was a Saturday around noon. Five other people there and they all had their food when I showed up. Ordered a turkey club sandwich and got it 30 minutes later. Let that sink in for a moment. Toasted bread with turkey, mayo, lettuce and tomato took 30 minutes with nobody else ordering food. The bartender even went back several times to check on my food.

Okay, every place deserves a second chance right? Went again tonight and it was busier but not packed. Got my food in about 20 minutes this time but my server spent most of the time sitting at a table with two other servers and a couple of guys. Another server brought out my food to her to bring to me because apparently checking on your customer's order isn't something they do on their own? I ended up asking yet another server to get my check and she was the one that rang it up too because mine wasn't around. 

I heard two servers complain to customers about how slow it was and how they weren't making any tips. I empathize with that but complaining about it on the floor to customers is not exactly creating a great customer experience.

On the plus side the place is nice and clean and plenty of screens for sports. The food wasn't bad either but based on the indifferent and apathetic service I think this is my last time there. There are plenty of other bars with big screens and food.

Great atmosphere, however the service is not up to par. I ordered a vodka Sprite. The waitress came back about 10 minutes later to ask if everything was okay. I had mentioned that the Sprite was flat. She then asked if I wanted a new one. 
Hmmmm yes please. As she walks away she took a sip of it to make sure. Keep it classy there lady! 
I placed an order for a buffalo pizza... What do you know I got a BBQ! Who knew they were the same! I think not. 
When I kindly ask her if this was the same pizza she had absolutely no idea. Call me crazy but I thought you should know your product.

This place is hit or miss, but I've been mostly lucky in my experiences. The vibe screams sports bar, but the food is actually delicious. 

The menu is HUGE: the pizza is great, the apps cover all the bases (fried mac and cheese bites are AMAZING), the wings are huge, and everything else is worth a shot. I'm a picky eater, but I always have a hard choice. 

There are only two things that keep me from giving a 5-star rating - firstly, it can be a little pricey. I would get a drink with my dinner if the check for two people wouldn't end up near $50 afterward. Secondly, they aren't great with staffing the bar area. The bar isn't huge, but on more than one occasion, we've had painfully slow service because the poor bartender was by herself, serving the entire bar AND making service drinks for the waitresses. It's not the bartenders' fault, but management needs to have girls on call or something to combat those surprise rushes.

No cockroaches very clean place food still is great. Shout out for our waitress Kathy the best in the world. The staff is very good they bend over backwards for everyone. Don't listen to ex employees who are worthless   Try pops for yourself

First time here, walked in and right away was told we don't have room for you in the main dinning area. In those exact words, not good front staff. Told us WE could look around the bar area ourselves to see if there was room. Not very nice. Our waitress on the other hand was very nice, it was her 1 week working there and we got the best service! Food was ok, glad it was 1/2 price pizza would not pay full price for it. Nachos were big and full of good stuff.

Official Chicago Blackhawks bar!!!

And this is another reason that I love Yelp!  I went to Pop's when I was much younger and I'll always have those memories. And then I visited about three years ago. I didn't love it. Back a year later. It's okay. I head back last year for a party and I can see improvement. I Yelp all about it and now over another year later, I've decided to give them one more star. 

I still don't adore Pop's, but as an official Blackhawks bar with good pizza, decent service and a great location, it works. I've tried the wings and like those too. The service gets better with each passing visit so that's a plus in my book. Our friends love Pop's so I imagine that we'll be visiting again soon. And when I do, I'll enjoy the game with our pizza and wings and I won't feel bad about supporting this local business. 
Bad

I loved this place and went here at least once every 2-3 weeks and for every Hawks game.  My parents were regulars and went weekly.  There was a great atmosphere with a ton of tvs, great food, great waitresses and $13 domestic buckets.  Then a couple of months ago the owners apparently pushed the manager out who took the cooks with him.  Now you just get 30min+ wait time on food and the kitchens closes at 8pm because it can't handle the orders.  This is a recipe for angry hungry and drunk customers and bitter waitresses who are getting blamed and stiffed on their tips.  Not worth the time or trouble anymore, what a waste.
Great drink specials and food is decent.    Good atmosphere for talking and watching sports. Service is either very good and friendly or slow.

My family and I went to Pop's this past Saturday around 4pm.  We were seated in the restaurant side and given menus. We were the only people in the restaurant. After 15 min of waiting I went and asked the women at the front if a server was available. She said she would find someone. Ten more minutes passed and still no one.  We got up and left. I proceeded to call the restaurant and speak to a manager. I shared what had happened and received only a "sorry". Very disaapointing.

I've been here several times and I am never disappointed. The service is good and the food is better.

I really love the cream of chicken soup & buffalo calamari (genius idea...why does no one have this!!!) 

I usually sit in the dining part, but the bar part is nice. I just like a less sporty area when dining. Which I find sets Pops apart from most bars. I like that you can eat in the restaurant and drink in the bar right after if you don't feel like watching sports while eating. Definitely worth checking this place out though!!

Pops has really declined lately. 45 min for nachos over 10 min to order a drink. Yes they still have a buffet on bears game Sunday, but if I can't even order a drink it's not a good time. The bartenders behind the bar are extremely slow and I'd you ask me if you're over 40 you probably shouldn't or can't hang with a full bar. We used to be here at least once per weekend but it is unlikely we will continue to come. Management/owners should be more mindful of what's going on.

I've been going here for awhile. I've tasted almost everything on the menu. Only thing I get now a days is their Buffalo Chicken Wrap, cause honestly Jewel has better frozen pizzas. And anyone who gets delivery all the time like me knows that they screw up more then they should. But tonight was my last straw. Once again they forgot something, this time it was a large ranch dressing. So as usual, I call to notify them. The girl on the phone asks if I would like a credit or to drive 10 mins away, to get my ranch. REALLY? Since you screwed up, I should have to either just deal with it for the time being OR drive there to get what they forgot. Oh Wait! I see how this works. So if I ordered something online from eBay and the seller screws up my product ( or lack of). It's now my responsibility to drive to meet them? Now I know I'm rambling on.....this pissed me off. I even asked her 3 more times. And she repeated the same thing. This was my last straw. And for what.... A ranch dressing?

Went for a Blackhawks Roadwatch....great specials...they had 2 dollar beers, burgers, and hot dogs! DELICIOUS!

Servers were busy, yet friendly and checked on our table frequently even though it was packed!

Friendly atmosphere, great sports bar, good food!

I LOVE THEIR PIZZA AND CHICKEN PARMESAN SANDWICH! 
Grade: A

Went to watch the Hawks game on a Sunday night. Not sure we will be back. 
The place was not busy and there were a lot of dirty tables. Service was very slow. Took forever for server to take drink order and she only asked half the table. Had to wait for her to come back to order the rest.  Food was good and may be the only reason we may try again. 
We go out for Hawks games a lot and  are looking for a place with good food and good service. This place missed with one of them.

I live nearby and frequent this establishment at least twice a week. This is "The Blackhawk's" bar in town. Tons of TVs. Staff is friendly. Food is good. Portions are huge. Order the Rotisserie chicken. Drink specials all week. Different food special each day plus regular lunch and dinner specials. Karaoke Wednesdays and Trivia Thursdays have started to draw groups. Lots of space. Video poker. Pool tables. Darts. Golden tee. There's a separate restaurant area but I've never used it. Good size patio. This is a sports bar with kind of a dive feel. Age range is all over the place. Could use more female patrons.
The manager Russell is really good looking. Like, so good looking that I come here to see him. You know, really get a good look at this attractive man. Phew, is it hot in here? No, it's just Russell.

Pop's has been around for a long time, but I never made it there before. A colleague suggested that we go there, so we did.

Pop's is nothing really special, but they have a nice menu. I ordered a Club Sandwich that came with fries. The fries were excellent, and the Club sandwich very good.

I frequent Teddy's Diner for lunch, and after one visit, I would guess they are both on par with each other. The main difference I could see right away was Pop's was neater and larger.

I will try it again and update my review once I have a few visits under my belt.

Great restaurant if there are no sports on tv  playing. Kitchen is constantly backed up. Not enough wait staff. You can be ignored very easily without a care from management.  We have eaten here every Friday for a few years. Recently the new management has driven service down the drain.  If you don't sit at the bar good luck getting any attention.

Went to Pops for a entrrtInment show in banquet rooms, I have to say it was probably the worst service i have ever gotten any where.  Servers were rude and unavailable. Never once came to see what we wanted to order. Had it not been for the one awesome bartender no one would gave gotten anything.  I ended up cleaning off my own table. Getting my own plates and napkins silverware etc..  At the end of the night the manger refuses to pay the entertainers on a 4 hour show????   With over 75 people who all ate you claim wasnt good enough will never eat or refer anyone to their establishment.  People save your money and spend it else where.  As for the one good employee the bartender he should move on he'll make a hell of alot more money at a new gig!

I was there early today. It took forever for some to come to are table. Food was good. She  gave us are check when we got are food. When I was ready to pay she was MIA. I had to go up to the bar to pay.
Playoff football. Halfway through 4th quarter switch to regular season hockey and say "It's a Hawks bar". Never coming back.

This place is our neighborhood sports bar and restaurant . It's nice because the restaurant has a separate  entrance so kids do not have to walk thru bar. The food is top notch. Linda is the best bartender ever and Tina is the best waitress in town !!
The biggest secret is the bread they serve with dinner entrees!! Homemade perfection dipped in Parmesan freshly grated and olive oil and balsamic !! Ughhh , to die for!
Lunch special was ok, the chicken tortilla soup was excellent but the bartender was slow and inattentive with only 8 people in the bar. Not sure if I will give it a 2nd chance.

We love coming to Pop's to catch a Blackhawks game and to eat lunch or dinner.  The Buffalo Wings are my favorite, Garlic & Parmesan for watching the game.   The sandwiches are good sized and very tasty.  The Chicken Pesto Panini is really good!   The portion sized are large and you always have enough to take home for a meal the next day.

I have been to this restaurant a few times and have always received excellent service. The menu has a huge selection and the food is pretty good. The drinks kept coming and the free bread they bring you is out of this world! Their daily specials have unbeatable prices.

My only recommendation for the restaurant is to change up the nachos. The cheese is just sprinkled over the chips instead of melted  which left me a little disappointed. I was hoping they would be similar to the loaded fries which are absolutely amazing!
Awesome place to watch the Blackhawks!  Good beer selection and good rum (not easy to find in these parts.) Bloody Mart bar all day on Sunday. Foods good. What's not to like.

Vapor friendly!

I highly recommend bacon, sausage and (optional) pepperoni on your pizza. Delicious!

Great food, especially the pizza! I'm super picky, but I love the pizza sauce and cheese they use. Also, it's not greasy like other pizza places I've tried in the area. Food is always consistent, and they offer generous portions. Waitresses are friendly, and it's a fun environment. I highly recommend pops for take out or to catch a Blackhawks game with a beer and slice of pizza!

Great neighborhood place.  Excellent 
pizza, good food in general.  Comfortable

Quality food is great! My first time having actual Chicago style pizza!!! But service sucks. My sis in law ordered a turkey panini and it had bacon but she does not eat bacon nor did the menu say it has bacon. MIND YOU there were no more then 15 people here at this time so it's really slow. So when it came out she says "aw this has bacon I can't eat this" and the waitress says "sooo what do you want me to do about it?" In the rudest way possible what you should've said is "oh I'm sorry yes it has bacon would u like something else or would you like it remade with no bacon?" Keep your attitude and personal problems away from your work place. Don't like your job? Quit, easy enough

I'm not a football fan but if I was, I'd be a Bears fan and Pop's certainly provides a fantastic place to enjoy a Bears game.

Pro tip: Do not order too much food at the beginning of your visit because Pop's lays out a one pass buffet during halftime. The servers will not tell you about this because it is obviously to their gratuity disadvantage.  If you take advantage of the buffet, please be sure to tip your server accordingly because not only do they lose the opportunity for table turnover during the duration of a game but they lose out on potential tips earned from food that would normally be ordered.

The bar area provides many seating option that range from open hightop areas, table seating, bar seating, and a strange and awkward perimeter seating situated around the table area. I saw awkward because you'll be directly on top of the table inside the ring staring at their heads, food, and drinks in very close proximity.  All of the seats have at least decent views to the banks of flat screen monitors tuned to various sports channels just in case you don't care for football.

The thin crust pizza is standard thin crust style found in many bars so it's good but nothing to specifically make a trip to Pop's for. I suggest 2 toppings at the most as the pizza flavor becomes convoluted otherwise. 

The nachos were of the standard bar variety as well and featured nothing special and came out in the standard heaping typical mess. Satisfying but nothing unique.

We were going to order wings but after seeing someone else's order containing average sized wings but pricing, in some cases depending on quantity, at or over a dollar per wing. Whaaaaaat? No, thank you.

So why four stars? Only because it really is one of the greatest places to catch the Bears game in the area. Bucket deals for domestics are cheap as well so you won't have to worry about breaking the bank to come out and watch a game. Make sure you arrive early for decent seating so you won't get stuck with an awkward aerial view of the person inside of the awkward ring.

I've visited here regularly for over a year now. Every Time I come in for a drink I always end up saying hello or having a friendly conversation with someone. It's a unique atmosphere, where people actually talk and smile. Always having great interaction with the staff. Music can be good sometimes too, never too dull or too quiet. I come in when Rachael & Nicole are working the bar. They are the friendliest most outgoing tenders I know. They move constantly to keep the place clean, servers supplied, and visitors happy. It's a hard work ethic with a smile that means the most to me. To see people like them who truly care about others and what they do makes a welcoming bar worthwhile.

Pops is close to me so I have tried it a few times.a large menu  tvs Blackhawks bar and area away from the bar to eat but kids can go any where good for kids.they have great lunch menu a whole chicken and 2 sides for under nine dollers a good deal. I do plan on comming back. Also great for take out

1.45 hour wait for a pizza, promised table service that never received and made to pay for a pizza TNT we never got to eats here nor promised in a reasonable time frame. please do not come to this place. as was sober & with a friend for a leisurely evening that turned out that this place nor manager cares about it.

I love Pops! 
Its an all in one. Want to go on a nice date night with your sweetie.. you head into the dinning room area. Looking for a fun night of drinks and YUMMY food go stright into the sports bar. Or heck do both. The best part is even if you go into the bar you can still get the full menu, which might I add is AMAZING! Its higher end food at low end cost so really how can you go wrong?!?!? They have some of the best wings and ranch (made fresh on site!!). But what keeps me coming back is the Chicken Scampi. I know it sounds crazy a bar that serves pasta dishes, but 95% I HAVE to get it! 

The staff is very friendly and its fast service even when its busy. The bar is also an offical Blackhawk's bar. So you know the game is always going to be on (as well as any other ones) And they usually have some fun raffles going on through out the night. 

All in all a must go to bar for a good time and a BIG bang for your BUCK!

So I must start by saying I have very mixed feelings about this place.  I recently moved very close to Pop's and thought it was going to be a great bar to live near.  In a way I was right but mostly wrong.

The pro's....

Pop's does have great drink and food specials for each day of the week which is nice if you are looking to drink and eat for cheaper than most places.  They do have outside seating with TV's in the window if a game is on, which is always a plus.  


The con's....

For the most part the servers seem to be very nice but at times seem miserable.  I mean I understand it's work and no one wants to work but it gives off a bad vibe.  I was also somewhat under the impression that it would be more crowded on weekends.  For the weekends that I have gone it has been pretty slow.  I know it is called Pop's pizza but I am going to be honest when I say their pizza is pretty bland and nothing to brag about.  



Overall, I give it two stars because I feel there is a lot of areas that they could improve upon.  I do however appreciate the drink deals.

Have tried many things off the menu & have never been disappointed. They have a huge menu! Personal fav of my bf & many friends is the chicken kabobs.. Order them as an App & still more then enough food for a meal! Great drink prices!

This place used to be a 'must go'.  The food was good, especially the pizza.  Within the last year the service has slipped.  There are still a handful of good servers, but more likely than not, you will get a server that has no clue what they are doing.  Take last Sunday for example: we sat down with 6 people for the Bears games.  A server came by about 10min after we sat down, we ordered a Bloody Mary from the Bloody Mary bar (which was not stocked), a couple of waters, and bucket of beer.  The Bloody Mary pint glass showed up with vodka and melted down ice because it had been sitting for pick up for so long, no waters, no beers.  After waiting and waiting and waiting, we decided to go to the bar to get our own drinks.  She came by 45 min later, didn't even realize she forgot the other things ordered.  This went on for the entire game.  We even had to bus our own tables.  When I looked for some 'in charge', they were MIA.  I've been going to Pop's for the last 7+ years, this last weekend broke my loyalty.  Congrats!

Best pizza in the area, but you have to eat in or pick it up.  Delivery is bad.  Pizza is not kept in heating bag and arrives cold!    Waiting now for. A redelivers.  Might get to eat 2 plus hours after placing the order!

Excuse me has anyone seen my affliction t-shirt? Ah this gentleman is wearing it, good.

While I'm at it, has anyone seen my extremely annoying top 20 CD? Good job DJ d-bag I noticed you located it and have it turned up to 11. 

Now all I need is my bleach blonde girlfriend with a muffin top and tramp stamp... and... where... there she is! 

Perfect, now I'd like to set the ambiance somewhere between sports bar and basement layer of a serial rapist. Good. Looks like we are set here.

Went to Pop's for drinks with some friends recently. They get a star for two things, having bartenders (at the bar) and for having functioning plumbing.

They are probably fine for a quick drink, but the wait service is lacking. I am very hesitant to ever frequent a place with so many tables and so little service. What's the point, really???

They have a lot of TVs. They have a patio where people go to smoke, but it is also the entrance and the smokers do not stand 15 feet away from the door...making the place smell like stale cigarettes because of the constant opening and closing of the door. ICK!

Great super thin pizza. Always love the freshly baked cracker crust. Salad fresh looking but veggies were limp. Standard menu but reasonable prices and good quality. Service in dining room this time around was a bit slower despite a fairly empty parking lot and bar. We weren't the largest party for the evening crowd and still had to wait 45-50 min for food. Staff was pleasant. Will always keep Pop's on hand for delivery.

This place used to be our after work place, however as of recently it has gone down quick!  They used to have good drink specials and good service.  

Fast forward to present time, and the only thing worth writing about this place is that they have a GREAT lunch special.  That's why I am giving them 2 stars!
Decent specials. Lots of tvs and screens. Food is pretty decent for a sports bar. Prices are pretty reasonable. Nice atmosphere.

Message to the MANAGER. HIRE another waiter/waitress you cheap a$$.  Great concept but its really annoying when your food takes over an hour to come out and when it does come out its freezing cold because your short staffed. We were here for a black hawks game and the place was packed with one waitress running around like a chicken with her head cut off. 

It's not the waitresses fault, its yours.  Other than that I like the cosmetic upgrades and would be willing to re-review if you stepped up your operations and service. 

Thanks

This is a fun place to watch Hawks games or UFC  & pizza is awesome !   Only issue is you cannot reserve a table by calling ahead so we avoid going there many times unless someone can sit there for 2 hours prior to event starting .  Service is great !

I've been to Pop's on a few occasions, primarily because it's right down the street from my house. It's a pizza and sports bar as their name states...nothing more, nothing less. 

I've opted to eat in both the bar and restaurant area. Either way, the food is the same. Some days are better than others, but either way it's average bar food. I've tried a little bit of everything...pizza, appetizers, salads, sammies, pasta, and wraps. There's usually decent daily specials, that's a bonus. 

Service is always friendly and typically fairly fast. Prices are fair and portions are pretty large. 

As for the atmosphere, this is not a place I would come to hang out on a Friday or Saturday night. As is, the bar area usually brings in some of the local drunks, which I prefer to not be around. If that's what it's like during the week,  I'd hate to see it during amateur hours...

The restaurant is where I prefer to eat if I'm grabbing a quick bite with a friend. It's much more quiet and the service is better. I feel a little less dive-y in that section. Other than that, I stick to carryout. 

Pop's isn't bad if you're looking for a sandwich, some fried bar food or greasy pizza. You won't find me hanging in the bar, or slamming back beers on Fri//Sat night, but that's just my preference...

Been here a handful of times over the past 6 or 7 years. Every time we pass this place it's packed, and for the life of us we can't understand why. You would think they're giving the beer away sometimes. They've done some cosmetic surgery a few times over the years, but it still doesn't hide the overall nastiness of this place. It's in serious need of a real good top to bottom cleaning. 

The service is beyond horrible. If they get your order correct,(They've gotten it wrong more than once) it  takes a long time to get it, and it's average at best. (The pizza is probably their best item, but with all the pizzerias in the area, why bother?) I could walk to this place in 5 minutes and still rarely go, that should tell you something. It's not that I hate the place, but when I go out I want to lean on a table I don't stick to, use a bathroom I'm not disgusted by and get a feeling that they actually spend time behind a mop & bucket.

I gave it three stars because it is, after all, only a sports bar!

I will never step foot in this place again. The service has to be the worst I have ever had. The waitress didn't refill our pops and she grunted when asked her for more napkins.the pizza was good but won't make up for the real bad service .

Very cool atmosphere. Blackhawks were playing in every TV. Waitress was very good with bringing drinks and our food. A friend ordered loaded fries and they looked awesome. Everyone had a good time,  good service and good food.

I've sat in the sports bar on many occasions. Great place to watch sports. No cover for any of the MMA. The drink specials are pretty good. The food is great. Can't go wrong with their wings or thin crust pizza. The service is good too. The waitresses are friendly and the presence of the manager is seen on the floor (you don't see that too often at sports bars.) My favorite thing about this place is the half-time buffet they do during Bears games when you've purchased drinks. I've grown to enjoy this place and will continue to go there.

I am not a big sports bar guy but I really like Pop's. The ambiance is fun and they play great music at night. The video screens are big and when it's not 'sports time' they play music videos. The food is actually pretty good if you eat it at the bar. I have ordered delivery from them and it's usually a hit or a miss. I have been inconvenienced with incorrect orders but the manager was accommodating. This makes all the difference and is the reason why I continue to support them. Mistakes happen and when a business owns up and corrects the mistake, they are regarded as great in my book. People are all quick to judge places based on one mistake but I give credit where it is due since the manager wasn't resistant, cheap, or in denial of my concern.

For this to be a sports bar, their food is amazing.  I've tried so many different items that I can say you won't be disappointed with anything there.  The portion sizes are large, and the food is great the next day as left overs.  You should try the chicken parm, the Philly chicken sandwich, and their wraps.  

Their service could be better, but I always take my food to go anyways.  Definitely recommend the food, but I haven't tried the pizza yet.

Not a bad bar. Good food and decent drink prices. Poor seating placement by the walkway. We have never had a friendly or even non-rude server at this place. They complain about being in their "weigh" and that's not a misspelling if you know what i mean. Don't put chairs and tables by a sever highway if they are going to complain the whole time about people sitting there!!!

We had our company party in the banquet room in the back of Pops (about 115 people).  Dave and his staff did a great job from planning the menu through the entire event.  The staff were really awesome and helped me to set up the room (without being asked!).  It was a huge help.  

The food was great - we had grilled shrimp, filet and meatball appetizers, a family-style dinner with chicken, beef and veggies, and of course an open bar.  There was plenty of room for the DJ and dancing, and we had our own restrooms.  Everything was clean and organized.  Our staff had a great time, and the entire event was surprisingly affordable!  Would definitely recommend to others for events.

I found this place as I was taking a walk from the gym I go to. Amazing salads and hummus wraps. I have just started a Health kick and this place definitely has few healthy options. Most of the bars or pizza places don't really have healthy options that you can eat.

This review is for the bar. PIzza was good to me. The special came with loads of toppings, if you hate green peppers, you will hate the specialty supreme (forgot the actual name) pizza. i also tried the tilapia  which was good. Waitress was very nice and attentive. Forgot her name but she was awesome.

Only thing I dislike is the setup for the tables and TVs. Most of them aren't align with the tvs so you gotta turn side ways.

My wife and I have been here at least 4 times since the Hawks season began . In fact we were really starting to call this our spot to watch the games . As we live in Lombard this is not exactly around the corner . As an official Hawks bar they do it right , great sound , plenty of tv's , good food , good service . So we decided to go last night to see the Hawks play the Sharks a 9:30 game . Sat down ordered our drinks a diet coke for my wife and a iced tea for myself and nachos . Then they started to change all the big screens to fighting as well as the sound , I stopped the fellow who was changing the tv's about the Hawks game , he said that there would be no sound and games were on smaller tv's . I asked about the Official Blackhawks bar credo stating all tv's and sound tuned to Hawks game , he indicated that it was not his call . There were no signs on the doors telling us that the game would not be on , heck my wife had herJersey on you would think the waitress would tell us , nope ! Needless to say we paid for our drinks and cancelled our nachos and left , found another Hawks bar that followed the rules , Pops you lost a good customer! ! !

Not sure why I only gave 4 stars last time.

for the money this place hands down is one of the areas best values - as stated before the lunch menu is awesome - expanded in the last few months - entree, soup or salad and a drink - $7. - and on the menu is one of the best burgers and fries i have ever had .

Sarah still tops lunch time server, but Elysa is great too! 

We are now here minimum of 2 times a week. Value and quality  are the best.

Pizza is ok.  Pasta was ok but meatballs tasted old and tough.  When I picked up the food two immature young girls were not professional at all.  Loud giggly and even made fun of a customer that called (after they hung up).  A young guy came out and chatted with the two girls and loudly dropped the F-bomb twice right in front of me and laughing regarding an order.  Now I don't mind swearing but swearing in front of customers and acting like I wasn't there while they acted like kids was just wrong.  If I was the owner I would be super pissed hearing and seeing what I did.

They treat you like close friends, bartenders are friendly, they have darts, pool tables, you can sit outside, they have a beautiful bathroom and place is very clean!!! Also, great pizza. Love this place. Never have to wait on a drink at the bar!

3 stars for a nice local sports bar. Pop's has a nice, positive ambiance... especially during Blackhawk games. The only downside of the place is the sport TV volume is a little loud... but that's just geezer talk.

I'll give Pop's an extra shiny star for the outstanding pizza! The Pop's Special is thin crust with sausage, pepperoni, green pepper, mushroom, and onion. Drool. 

Here. The morning after. I can't believe I let my Dad steal the leftovers. Dop.
All hail, Pop's!
still drooling... yow, bill

Food is average the pizza's pretty good, but the service seems short handed. 
I give it a ok.

I have to fully agree with another reviewer - HIRE ANOTHER BARTENDER/SERVER.. someone, anyone... to take care of your customers in the bar area.

The bar area/bar side of the establishment is pretty spacious - not just a large bar but many booths & tables.  On 3 occassions (typically after work - say, 5pm), there was just one person serving the entire place.  

"Running around like a chicken with her head cut off".. yep, that describes it perfectly.

The typical wait for a drink refill - even just some water - was probably 20 minutes - if you could flag her down.  And this is while sitting right at the bar.

The food is hit/miss.  Our wings were dry as a bone.  The "fish fry" was just a small plate of ok food.  The mini burgers are typically the safest bet & the fries were good as well.  I had a chicken wrap that was pretty decent.

Basically, this used to be the only place to go close to home, but now that Bulldog has opened, we go there instead.  

I did enjoy the laid back atmosphere at Pop's, the friendly bartenders - when they were around - and the little patio is nice too.  But the bad service now keeps us away.

Good food but service can improve. I will be going here more often as I go to the new amazing gym that just opened across from it. Lets see if there customer service improves. Place is beautiful tho. Love the inside, really nice and clean. I had their hummus wrap and it was very good!
My first job was here

I've been here a couple of times in the last few months.  I haven't been very impressed.  The first time I had the Philly steak sandwich.  While it was plentiful, it wasn't particularly flavorful - spices?  None.  I mean bland.  Now, I'm from Philly, so maybe I'm a tough audience, but if you're going to make it, then let's make it right!  The Bartender was reasonably attentive, which was good.

The next time I had a pizza.  It was fair.  The oven must have been having problems or something because the dough was overdone on the outer bottom of the pie, but underdone in the center.  There was also some carbon on the bottom.  I'd have sent it back, but it took so long to get in the first place...  The Bartender on this occassion, was awful.  While I've never cooked, I have tended bar and this guy was busy in the back, busy chatting up other customers and we had to flag him every time we wanted a refill or the check.

Overall, there's a lot of room for improvement.

First of off, this "restaurant" if you want to call it that got one star, because yelp won't let you put 0 stars. I am a local of Schaumburg, the first time there mailer came to my house I thought let's try it out. Order a burger and wings to be delivered...  when I finally got the food and open up my wings I found on the very first wing a HAIR! .. now that for one is just gross and should be a reason to get this place no stars! But it didn't stop, I decided to go back and give this place another shot and go see how the service was, when I got there I sat at the bar at lunch time. The service was awful!  Sat there waiting for a refill of water, but didn't get one... instead we heard the server swearing and complaining about how " hard she works". After that I decided not to go back inside every again. My friend decided to order some food from there and pay with cash..  the delivery guy came and dropped off the food and after being given a $20.00 for a meal that was only $9.47 the delivery person started to walk away... my friend asks " do you have change for this $20.00" he reply "No, all I carry is $20.00". After opening the food it smelled like cigarettes.

End this all up. Will never be going to this place again! And I strongly recommend neither do you.

I've come in after work for a drink and Linda was nothing but fantastic! She was super friendly and I could tell everyone at the bar felt at home....kinda like Cheers...where everybody knows your name. The fellow bar goers all seemed to be friendly and have a great time catching up with each other. I'd definitely recommend the food and drink specials! Great people, food, and atmosphere!

I've eaten in the restaurant quite a few times. Everything was fine there. Fine, not great. I've now ordered the same item for delivery twice. Both times it was awful. Not even edible.  I don't understand how the kitchen staff doesn't know how to make something you have on your own menu?? I called to complain this last time and spoke the manager "Dave". He was barely apologetic but agreed to send out the corrected order ASAP. 40 minutes later it was still not edible. Apparently Pops is unaware hummus is a condiment not a main course. I wouldn't recommend eating here.
Just a great neighborhood place. Is it perfect?  No, but it's a convenient location, decent food at a great value.

Nice place been around for some time. Food is good, servers are hit and miss. I've had good and i've had those where i literally get up and get their attention.  Overall nice place, dining area is good and bar area is good for a game.

I give it 3 stars because the bar is pretty good and the drinks are reasonably priced.  It's nothing to write home about, but I've definitely had a few great nights there.  However, the food is meh, and their delivery service is extremely slow.

Went here for a roadwatch for the Blackhawks. My friend doesn't drink, so they would let us sit in the roadwatch section. It's not like he's under 21 (he's 24 like me), he just doesn't drink alcohol. Never coming back for anything.
Not good. Margherita Pizza was not good. Garlic bread was so-so. Sauce for the garlic bread was actually pretty good. Nice Hawks atmosphere, just not excited about the pizza.

This is the second time I have been to this restaurant and I have no complaints. The first time we sat in the restaurant part as we had a big group. We ordered the pizza which was great and we had exceptional service. Tonight was the second time I went and we sat in the bar area. It was 5:00 on a Sunday, so it was a little loud as the football games were on tv, but the service and food were great. We had Ashley as our server, who kept up with our drinks, and checked up on us continually. I had the Mediterranean Wrap with Chicken which was out of this world. My parents had a pizza which they had no complaints about. The bar was very clean as well. Definitely going to bring my friends here one day!

I have always had good service at pop's. I've enjoyed the food for years and the drinks are always some of the best in town! The games are always on, good music, and even if they're busy the servers are prompt and very nice. I will continue to enjoy pops for many years to come!

Never eaten a bad bite of food in this place. My boyfriend and i order pizza from here all the time and it's delicious! We also have a great server (Sheila). When we go in there on Tuesday nights to play darts we ask for her and she takes awesome care of us. She's the reason we go back again and again. The bathrooms are newly remodeled and very nice. The only reason Im giving 3 stars is because I wish they had better drink specials. Other than that I really like this bar!

This place has taken a sharp turn for the worse!  It used to have good food and the atmosphere was fun.
This last visit was definitely my last!   The server took forever to greet us, take our order, and refill drinks.  When we got our pizza it was clear it had been sitting in the kitchen waiting.  She seemed more interested in completing her sidework than waiting on her guests.  To add insult to injury the bartender couldn't care less that I kept getting up and asking him to find her.  
I love independent places but there are plenty out there that want you to come back.  Don't waste your time or your money here!!

We used to go here awhile ago but stopped when the service started going downhill.  After taking a long while off we decided to give it another try since it's so close to the house.  I'm really happy we did!!  It looks like they have finally increased their staff and quality of it. 

The food is good and the specials are even better.  Where else can you watch a Bears game and get $2.50 16oz beers!  Thanks to Jess for the great service and for recommending the Italian beef pizza...it was delicious.  

I'm sure we'll be back again for the next game and plenty more to come.  Very happy to see you have turned things around!!

Cute place! Vegan options. Everything except the wraps are gluten free. Wish there were more vegan options however ;))
Cool bike thing that you can blend your own smoothies. Really clean and friendly staff.

5 stars for great friendly service. 
We came at closing time and they still served us with a smile. 
2 stars for taste (given the price) very bland for me but was fresh. 

We ordered the 2 for $10 spicy chicken wrap. Nothing special, something i could make myself for  $1. 
I would recommend for them to make it more flavorful, increase portion for price or make it worth my money.  Salads looked really good but did not try it.  

On a positive note: place was super clean, nice ambiance, great welcoming staff.

2 stars for being a clean restaurant and their supposed organic and great quality food.  Taste, service, and value are totally lacking... no stars deserved.

Here's the breakdown:
I came in with the restaurant having one person inside.  Kind of discouraging since this is supposedly a "hot and new" restaurant.  No worries, I'm not here for popularity.  Upon looking at the menu, the entree which do not come with any sides is priced at $8.99.  So ultimately, you will get a leg and thigh or a palm sized beef (Steer crazy) for $9!  Not a good start.   Sides (rice, quinoa, or kale salad) is an additional $2+.  I ordered the steer crazy with kale, and lentil soup = $15.24.  TASTE: bleeehhhhh!  The soup was tasteless, the beef's sauce had an after taste of can followed with bland tasting meat, and the kale- well it tasted like Kale.  Definitely not worth the price.  As a matter of fact, not worth the visit.  
I can sympathize with the long wait for the food since they have to warm up the beef or whatever they have to do but again, just like the price, it was not worth the wait.

I love supporting small business but it must come with good value, service, and taste for me to ever return.  I'm afraid this is my first and last visit.  Glad I tried something HOT & NEW!

Food smells and tasteless. After one bite, asked for refund or exchange but the owner refused after the employee contacted him. As a new customer i will not be going back. I urge others to stay away to avoid similar experience.

First thing, this place is Zabiha HALAL. Also everything is organic as well. Anyways I really liked their set up, and the guy behind the counter was really nice and helpful. I ordered the Steer Crazy Wrap, the food was good, very flavorful. The only negative was that the portions were very small, someone like me would need two wraps to fill them up. But overall it was a good experience.

I really really want this place to do well. It's like a hot bar with paleo, gluten-free or vegetarian options. For lunch, I was given the option to pick a protein and a side. They say the food is wild caught or grass fed... great for paleo diets. +1

Initially, it looks like they were going to do a daily menu but it looks like people complained so now they're trying to do a set menu and changing it up once in a while? Personally I'd rather they have a set menu because I can at least tell what my options are before I go in (or at least announce on their FB what their current menu is). I think it would also help if they took a nice picture of the protein/sides and taped it up on the glass. When I got there, they had to open every single tray to show me my options. I can imagine that to be very drying to the food and time consuming if people were waiting. 

My protein (salmon) was dry but I think I was supposed to get a sauce on it. Even so, the meat was very dry so I don't think sauce would have helped much. The vegetables I got were delicious. 

The person working there was very friendly and explained everything to me well. +1

Their to-go container is a #5 which is recyclable in Illinois. +1

I will try them again because I really want them to succeed. Hopefully they can find a way to get the protein from drying out. I look forward to what they'll do!

Came for lunch at 12:15pm and the palace was dead. Also silent.  Someone peeked into the kitchen, and notified an employee we were there. Our party ordered the beef wrap, salmon wrap, and various smoothies.  Unfortunately they charge $2 for boxed water... that's more expensive than ordering a box of chocolate milk!!? Outrageous. The omega smoothie was quite flavorless, each of our meals was around $14. I concur that the portions ARE small. The food IS overpriced. The Beef wrap looked pale and was cold, looking nothing like the image of the item on their website. There is nothing like this place for miles, and it's a great concept, but falls very short with its delivery. Cool modern clean interior, unfortunately that's about it.

As a vegetarian in the western suburbs, I've been waiting for this place to open. Stopped in tonight to pick up something for dinner. I chose the veggie wrap because I wanted something raw and fresh that I could carry out and transport easily. I expected I was going to get the standard "salad in a tortilla", but this was anything but. Instead of a soft flour tortilla, the "wrap" was a big, crunchy cabbage leaf - completely changing the texture profile of the dish. Inside was a lightly seasoned combination of kale, sweet potato, red peppers, quinoa, and probably a few other things. I liked the layering of colors and flavors. The chef obviously spent some time thinking through the flavor combinations and presentation. It feels really good eating fresh, clean food prepared to this level.

I will definitely go back and try their other dishes.

I had the Steer Crazy and it was delicious, very tender and flavorful.  For a side I had steamed Kale.  I was a little nervous about trying Kale.  I know it's good for me but I'm not a big fan of its taste.  To my surprise the steamed Kale was truly very good!  I could have eaten even more of it!  This place looks modern and hip and the owner, Omar, was very nice and I could tell he believes in what he is doing.  This was delicious healthy food!

Great place. Super helpful on ordering!  They helped explain every option and how it's made organically and where it's from. Such a great find while in traveling. It always feels good helping a local small business.

Two girlfriends and I went to have lunch at 'the new place in town' and really enjoyed our experience. The owner was friendly and helpful, the food was yummy and served in a compostable bowl, and the interior is spacious and clean. Everything is made fresh to order, but if you're short on time, there's additional ready-made salads, bakery items and desserts for a quick take-away option. Wishing much success to OrganiSoul! Looking forward to returning.

Stop and please read.  This place is not for the vast majority. I should have thoroughly read the reviews before taking my family there.  Don't make the same mistake I did. The menu is hard to understand.  We ordered the Tika chicken, the beef wrap, the salmon wrap, and the chicken wings.  Here is my honest review.  The Tika was tasteless even though we asked for spicy, the beef wrap seemed uncooked and the salmon wrap smelled bad.  Both wraps had old soggy cold vegetables. The worst was the cold slimy chicken wings with no flavor and the skin looked uncooked.  They were nothing like any wings I ever had, and did not look like the picture.  The food was expensive, the naan was from Costco, and they charge for water from the dispenser.  We ended up leaving our food on the table, that's how horrible we thought it was.  The girls working there didn't seem to care and had very little service experience.  They saw us walking out and didn't try to stop us or ask what the problem was.  I feel bad for the owners because I don't see this restaurant lasting long.  After checking the website, we realized the only testimonial was from the cashier who took our order.

Great service, atmosphere was a little odd, but the food was good.  I had the salmon based on the recommendation by the clerk there.  It was a bigger portion than the chicken.  Veggies were great, salmon was good.  I would go back for sure.

First visit was awkward, but we really enjoyed our food. Like so many other reviewers, I want to cheerlead to wish Omar and his team success. But I think there is somewhat of a lack of actual restauranting experience happening here. I have eaten at restaurants across all of North America and most of those have a tilt to vegetarian, so I have a pretty broad perspective when I say I support and welcome his concept...but it was not overly polished yet.

My suggestion? If fresh is your focus, then you should not have drying out foods visible along the counter. The practical answer is to simply not to have them so visible. We all know it takes a while to build a customer base and churn your offerings hourly.In the interim, please don't let me see what time can do to fresh ingredients... 

But that is a minor detail. The actual quality of the food is their focus. My curried lentils were a nice texture and a lighter flavor. Brown rice as a side was a nicely flavored supplement to it. My friend enjoyed her salad very much, adding avocado to enhance it. Gratefully, the food experience outweighed the uneven experience at the counter.

We still have high hopes for their content, their commitment to the quality of the ingredients and the impact on the larger food chain of his restaurant. I'm confident that their traffic will increase and that will raise the experience bar. We even smiled when understanding and supporting Omar's struggle to find a way to fully execute his commitment to composting. One more reason to support their thoughtful model!

This was a COMPLETE upset from the beginning. We were so excited to try this place and well, Don't waste your time or money. Yes, it's healthy and NO it's not reasonably priced, one piece of dried out salmon and three sides for $29.00...ugh. To add insult to injury, it was all cold and apparently was sitting around most of the day since they don't have any customers. The manager and his wife are nice but have no idea what they're doing. Sad to report but won't be returning.

Stopped here for a quick dinner. Trying to eat more organic in general and this seemed like a place to check out. Ordered a salmon wrap which overall was good. It was on the spicy side that I didn't anticipate. The size was on the smaller side. Also ordered a side of kale which was over salted. Almost couldn't eat it. Had a sprinkle of sunflower seeds on it. If not for the salt it would have been good. Also wished I could have gotten a glass of water. Didn't purchase the boxed water which really would have bought the price up.  The small wrap and small kale salad was around $12. Not a good value.
clean food however overpriced for lemon juice and organic lettuce
Delicious and original! Wonderful options for vegan and vegitarian plates. Great flavors-without sacrificing the organic lifestyle! We need more places like this!
I really was greatful to see an organic restaurant in the area. I have eaten in twice and really enjoyed the deep flavors. I love to support local businesses.

Fantastic food! I have a gluten allergy and they were incredibly sensitive to my needs, I got to meet the chef who hand delivered my meal and actually re-made with no complaints after something wasn't as expected. The staff are attentive and courteous, overall a wonderful experience!

I used a coupon and the man behind the counter charged me full price $9.95 . The coupon said all wraps $4.99- I was waiting for my receipt but he asked for my email and said my receipt would be emailed to me. I Thought this was strange after paying  cash. I received no email with my receipt. Although the wrap was pretty good, I did not care for the deceptive practice by the cashier.
The food here is always great! Their sandwiches are AMAZING!! The meat is always fresh. Their salmon is the best I've found!!

Excellent butcher and I enjoy the variations they make (Their taco brats for example are crazy).  It's pricey but as you can see not listed to be a cheap place.  They have truly high quality meats, etc.  Always enjoy taking a trip to pick out a few pieces for BBQ.

P.S. Steak potato salad is the greatest in my opinion. I suggest at least trying it.

It gets packed on the weekends for good reason they rock. A small butcher shop but they are staffed with great people. I was able to get through the line quickly with all of my questions answered. I love supporting local businesses so I will return. Mmmm meat.

They have THE best, FRESHEST Salmon!! It cooks perfectly and when done, just parts with a fork!! Sooo good...:) They also have lots of other great stuff. I definitely recommend them! 
Gotta go....I'm on my way over there for MORE Salmon!! :)

Best meats in the McHenry County area.  The brats are amazing and the fresh cuts of meat are all prime cuts.  New staff is very friendly and helpful.  Weekly email announces specials that are hard to beat.

Also makes sandwiches to order, fresh soups.  Everything you would need for a complete meal is available here.

On a random Monday night, I decided to stop at Butcher on the Block to pick up a few bones for my dog.  I got there about 30 minutes after they closed and the kind staff opened their doors for me!  Although they were out of the dog bones, they took down my name and number and told me they would call when they got more in.  They were the kindest and most accommodating employees (even after closing time!)  

Even my dog loves the place :)

I love this place! It's so wonderful to have your own butcher in your neighborhood! This place has always been friendly and very accommodating! I normally order steaks and the slider burgers from here, but this time I ordered the crab stuffed salmon-OMG this salmon was unbelievable, hands down the best freshest salmon I've ever had and the crab stuffing was soooo good! The filets was enough for two people! I cannot wait to order this again! It was so good I called the owner (tom) to tell him that it was the best salmon I have ever had! The food is pricey, however you are paying for quality food/ no fake food here! No antibiotics, no GMO PRODUCTS! All real food! Oh yeah, the steaks are just amazing! So glad it's in my neighborhood!
So glad someone clued me into this place, its amazing.  Love the samples on Sat. and their sandwiches are delicious!

This place is the best, friendly owners and staff and the meats are top of the line.  Brats are kick ass, meats are well trimmed and very fairly priced. I recommend getting on the mailing list for specials.
Like this place but extremely expensive. Good handmade sausages. Family ran which is neat.

This was my first time getting meats from here - I usually go to a butcher elsewhere but I wanted to try to find somewhere closer to home.  I called in my order of a beef brisket and three slabs of St. Louis cut ribs on Monday of this past week for pickup on Friday morning.  (I was having a cookout on Saturday and needed time for my rubs to make everything 'happy'.)  I asked if there was a particular time to get my order and I was told I could come anytime - I followed up saying I'd be there around noon- they took my name and cell number to confirm the order.

Flash forward to Friday, I stopped nearby to do all the rest of my shopping for the party and drove over here to quickly pick up my order at 12:15.  I got in and the person behind the counter told me that my brisket was ready but that the delivery truck hadn't shown up with the ribs yet.  I responded, asking why they didn't call me - that I drove there all the way from Dundee.  He apologized, then told me he'd check again to see if the truck had arrived.

This is where the visit went downhill...there is not separation from the meat counter all the way to the back of the shop, so I saw him look out the back door and then speak with someone else before going into the cooler, brought out a bag, took some ribs out of it and put them into a separate bag which he brought up to the counter, told me the truck just came in, quickly placed on the scale and almost immediately pulled off to wrap them in paper.  

When I saw them briefly on the scale, I thought the ribs looked small and asked to see them.  He pulled out a section of ribs that were cut in half across the slabs, leaving the rib length at about three inches.  I told him that wasn't acceptable - that I had ordered three full slabs of St. Louis cut ribs, and that those must have been someone else's order.  He said that they weren't, and pulled out another of the 'mini-slabs' out of the  bag and tried to tell me that that's how they received them and showed me that "put together" the mini slabs equal a big slab.  

Again I told him that is not what I ordered and said if the truck did truly come just now, there should be more ribs on it seeing that it would be their delivery for the weekend.  He then told me that the ribs he had was all that they ordered for the weekend.

I told him that he could keep the ribs, they were not what I had ordered and I was unhappy with them.  I then asked to get a pork shoulder instead and have that along with my brisket.

Everything cooked up well at my cookout and was delicious, but the fact that the employee lied to me about the truck 'just arriving' and instead pulling out (what I consider to be) a substandard product compared to what I ordered, and then proceeded to try to convince me that it was what I had ordered is what caused this two star rating.  

I don't care how good your product may or may not be, but DO NOT LIE to customers - especially when they can see your actions and know you are trying to cover your tracks.  I WILL NOT BE BACK.

My coworker introduced me to this place when our office moved to Huntley. They have the best sandwiches and soups. Thinking of the food I have tried is making me drool (lol). The place is small but their selection of meat is good. 

I have tried the turkey & fresh mozzarella melt sandwich and it was beyond words, perfect for a cold day as it is served warm. Their Italian beef is perfect along with the mushroom and Brie bisque soup. If you come here for lunch or meat purchases you will not be disappointed! :)

Yummmmm.......

I have only purchased their sandwiches, but they are amazing.  If you order the 12 inch sub you get 2 massive 6 inch subs for around $8.00.  I have tried multiple sandwiches are they are very good.  In case you are wondering there is no seating there.

Amazing brats, delicious selections of meat, and yummy side dishes! You cannot go wrong with anything you get at BOTB! If your looking for an appatizer  go for their stuffed mushroomsSO GOOD. I love treating my family to a BOTB meal. Anything you get there is  better than going out to any returaunt around here!

Just grabbed a couple of RIBEYES for the game ... And they had samples out...uh oh
Cajun crab salad!!!! Solid Gold
Chicken Salad...awesome !!
Dropped $60 real quick

Hot dog special and 7 meat chili didn't make it out of the parking lot!!

They are open Super Bowl Sunday till 4!!! I may be back .... My first visit was a thrill... I now know why they are legendary!!!
Fresh and delicious. This place always good variety and everything I've purchased so far tastes fresh and delish. The staff is friendly and helpful.
Great service, knowledgeable staff, amazing food!! Prices are reasonable too. Best butcher in the area, by far!
Not impressed.  Not much taste and a bit pricey which I wouldn't mind if it was good.  Costco has better tasting meat.  Won't be back

I love going to this place.  Their selection of meat...both frozen and fresh is just awesome.  The food has always been good and will continue to go back.  You just don't find places like this anymore.
Bought your precooked jalape̱o and cheddar brats at meijer. Very tasty but there were bone fragments in one of them. Thought I chipped a tooth!
Love coming here to get sausage and brats for dinner! All the staff is super friendly!

I've purchased meat from this place many a times, but today tried the sandwiches for the first time. Wow!!!  I had the Philly cheesesteak and had low expectations. I couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. Don't get me wrong, it's no Tony Luc's or Jim's but its the best I've had outside of Philly. Nicely done!!
Have yet to try anything that hasnt tasted heavenly! There Brats are the best ive ever had!

BY FAR the best meat market in the Huntley/Lake in the Hills area... If you live up here and you're getting your meat anywhere else, you're doing yourself a disservice! And they have a lunch menu... Great sandwiches!
Excellent quality and most of the staff is very friendly!

username: R I C K Y B O B B Y.
review_text:
Without doubt, one of the best butchers in the far west / northwest suburbs.  I have been here multiple times, trying their steaks, brats and sandwiches primarily.  The steaks were cut thick and moderately priced.  The brats are amazing!  So many different choices (seriously, like 40 different types), and each one that I have had, have been great!  The little known secret to this place however, is their sandwich specials.  They usually have 6 sandwiches available.  I am recommending the pot roast sandwich and the carnitas sandwich.  Both are so juicy and tender, that it is difficult to eat one without making quite the mess.  It is so good though and worth it!  They also serve the sandwiches in mini-sizes, so if you want to try both, get two minis and test them out!

Check out their website ahead of time so you can see just how much they have!
Great meats and wonderful deli sandwiches but the owner is a prick. Always giving attitude and acting like his service is a chore to him

Whoever wrote that the owner wasn't very nice is right on. The sub was decent and seeing how we live close, we would have made our way back but not now. He was very rude. It definitely was a chore to serve us. Just too bad...

We started using this butcher when I read how meat is normally processed. This butcher uses local animals with no hormones. The health and safety of my family is worth the few extra bucks I spend as opposed to caputos. Try it, you will get addicted too. I was also surprised at the other foods available such as delicious hot soup and marinades.

Wow, what a find!  Their selection of homemade sausages and brats is ridiculous.  My personal favorites are the Italian Stallion sausage (spinach, garlic, mozzarella, pepperoni) and the Santa Fe.  They also have wonderful steaks and roasts and if you're looking for a recommendation or some tips on how to cook those beauties, as the peeps behind the counter.  They are incredibly friendly, polite, and in the know.  I haven't stopped in for lunch yet, but you better believe I'll be heading there soon.

Pricey for sure. Meatloaf is tasty as is the stuffed chicken breast. Use your better judgment when it comes to preparing (their directions aren't completely accurate). We tried the tamales and they were a little...questionable in taste. Ribs are good, but very fatty...:/ So, we aren't 100% sold after 3 visits just yet...

Excellent quality meats...prices seem high for the Boars Head lunchmeat since you can get it at Caputo's down the street.  However, the meat selection is excellent and the staff is very helpful.  I needed suggestions on the type of beef to buy for a particular recipe and they were made excellent suggestions!  

They also have soups and sandwhiches to go....all are awesome!

Place is awesome!  Their selection of meats are phenomenal, be it steaks, frozen seafood, or my favorite, the sausage and brats. I've had a few of their rotating sandwiches, and those are great as well.

Customer service is quite good.  Jill is definitely the friendliest I've had serve me there, but the other employees are very helpful too.

If you're looking for some unique brats and sausages, or some premade seasoned cuts of meat, this place is where ya need to go.  They've also got sauces, marinades, and a small deli with Dietz and Watson products.

Happy carnivoring!

II am a health conscious, label reader! I go Organic as much as possible and when it comes to the meat I purchase, I will only purchase my meat from this place! The beef tenderloins are better then Ruth's Chris or any other steak house I have visited..Yes, they are more expensive then your local grocer. But you get what you pay for......

I always forget about this place (It's literally a block away).  Sometimes when I'm craving some good fresh meat, I'll pop in.  They have all sorts of different tasting sausages, and even some interesting steaks (cowboy meat was pretty tasty).  They also usually have some tasty soups and side salads.  If your looking for friendly service and some fresh meat for a summer cookout, this place hits the spot.
Great selection, friendly service

Scrum-diddly-uptious.  That's a technical term.  My coworkers and I head here for a reliable lunch served up by passionate locals.  Made-to-order sandwiches and fresh fantastic soups always rock our worlds.  They don't have a plethora of vegetarian options (because it's a butcher shop, obviously) but their health nut sandwich and cream of asparagus soup are the bomb!  The cream of mushroom soup and crab chowder are also fabulous favorites.

Best brats you will have in your entire life!!!!!!!! I tell everyone I can to go there.  Gotta keep small businesses going!  Bought their chicken nuggets for my nephew, so good, and I felt much better that I wasn't feeding him super processed meats (like the grocery store brands) $ was reasonable too.  I always get a pepperoni stick to eat there because this place makes me so hungry. Heard the pre made frozen beef patties are delicious too I'll have to try them. Keep up the good work!
Great place to get some great meat!

This business is practicing false advertising in saying they serve grass fed beef.  The meat is not really grass fed.  The cattle graze for only one third of their lives.   The rest of it's life it's fed corn or grain like all the rest of mass produced meats, yet the prices here reflect true grass fed beef.  If you want real grass fed beef you will have to go directly to a beef farmer out here, order on-line, or pay through the nose at Whole Foods.

Nice meat at this place, but it was a small store and it was expensive. They were charging double the price my butcher out in Rockford charges for NY Strip. I bought 2 Porterhouse steaks and it came out to $40.00 (one big and one small). I am use to pay at the most $30. The steaks were awesome, I am not going to lie. If you want good meat and you are willing to spend the money, Yummy!

Years ago I was treating rudely by a woman with a nasty attitude and never went back. drove out if my way to give a local business another chance yesterday.  I was trying to decide what to make for company at Easter.  I guess i asked too many questions because the man who waited on me was abrupt and said in a mean way you keep looking and said he had work to do and turned and walked away and left me standing there.  The other man behind the counter did nothing.  I left.  When they were also threatening closing due to slow business, I shopped there to help them.  I don't care how good their meat is their lack of customer service is appalling!!!!
My husband got food poisoning from the deli meat. Pretty bad and lasted  about a day. Needless to say we have never gone back.

This place is amazing.  We are in love with their fresh made brats and sausages.  The specialy flavors are amazing.  I LOVE the cordon blue and I think my hubby died and went to heaven when he bit into the philly cheesestake.  The Chedder Brat and the Tailgater are also winners.  The staff is helpful and knows there stuff.  You don't see it in the case they will go in back and cut up what you need.  Yes they are more expensive but you cannot compare a place like this with grocery store prices.
I have three words: CAJUN CRAB SALAD!!! I crave this stuff!!! The puppy steaks seem to do the trick for my dog and MOST of the time the customer service is just what I need!

I've been searching for 8 years for at least a decent Asian place in this area since I left my home state. 8 years. I found some good places in China town in the city but nothing that I would really say in comparable to my fav place back home (which is knock your socks off, China town good, real Asian cuisine).... until now. 

Liu's was AWESOME. Fresh, flavorful, and all around amazing. 

First, NO MSG ADDED!!! YAASSSS! All the ingredients are fresh. Did I say that enough?? The chicken, it isn't the gritty, gross dark parts. It's good, cooked crisp (or tender of not breaded). Meat is also tender and not chewy. 

Sauces are not overly garlicky or sickening sweet. There is also wide variety on the menu of dinners and specialties, vegetarian too. 

This place is great! If you are like me and are searching for your Chinese go to, you've found it. 

**Side note- I went here Oct 22, and it was still called Liu's. Not sure what's up with the name change and yet still referring to Liu's on the Yelp info. I'll be going here again soon and will be updating.

Yu's over Liu's

Eh. Was looking forward to trying Liu's  (not Chamber Red as indicated) based on ratings but ... eh. Food was decent...even pretty good but many things left to be desired.

Ambience: it's October but today was warm and humid and they did not have air on so muggy inside. No tablecloths as shown in photos so more stark in appearance. Weird mix of primarily country music playing. Plastic dishes and serveware took away from presentation for sure. Oh...and if you're planning on using the loo at Liu's bring your own paper towels because both bathrooms had none. 

Food: As I said...decent but portions small for the price. We like Yu's in Schaumburg and this place got higher ratings but I cannot figure out why, for the life of me.

Service was nice, friendly and prompt although we were the only people in the dining room.

Overall not impressed, although not terrible, by any means....just nothing standout-ish about it. Not likely to return.

Overall, I wasn't very impressed with the food but since my grandparents and parents liked it I'll give it 3 stars. 

I did take out but the decor and ambience is nice. 

The service was good, they were very timely and accurate with my pick up order. 

I had the pork potstickers. Although they were fresh, I thought they were very bland. I've definitely had a lot better. 

I also had the lettuce wraps and I just wasn't impressed. Nothing was bad about it and they give you plenty of meat but I didn't enjoy it either. They only give you two pieces of lettuce. Although the pieces were large, 4 pieces would have been nice. 

My grandma had the chicken cho mein. The meat quality and portion was good. Again, I wasn't blown away by this meal, it was just OK. My grandpa had the beef skewers, which was 3 long skewers with thin slices of meat. He enjoyed them and the meat was good quality. 

Although nothing is wrong with this restaurant, it wasn't memorable enough for me to come back.

The food at this restaurant is fantastic! It's delicious enough to make my husband and I want to drive 20 minutes from Geneva for takeout. However, the service need some serious work.

As other helpers have noted, the food at Liu Brothers is fresh, well prepared, and extremely tasty. Lately, I have been getting the panang curry, which is just the perfect amount of sweet and spicy. I could eat a bucket of it. My husband and I have also split the Szechuan eggplant, which is great too. And the appetizers, including the soups, egg rolls, potstickers, and dumplings, are all amazing. No complaints whatsoever!

That said, they certainly need to work out some kinks with regard to service. Whenever we go, we wait a very long time for our food to come out. When we were last at the restaurant, we waited 40 minutes. During that time, we actually saw three couples walk out without ordering. Liu Brothers is short-staffed in both the kitchen, and on the floor. I am hopeful that they were higher than new employees soon, because it would be a shame if this gem in the western suburbs closed due to poor service. Until then, order takeout, and pick it up 10 to 15 minutes after it is scheduled to be ready. If it happens to be early, you can always heat it up on low in the oven.

I grew up in Malaysia and my stepmum is Chinese. The food is as authentic as it gets! We started with the tender salt & pepper calamari. Four of us shared the Penang curry, Kung Pao chicken, sesame shrimp and tofu mapu (sp?). It was all divine! The prices are very reasonable and BYOB makes it a very affordable night out.

Ok so it's not the easiest place to find, it's in a strip mall on the north side of Main St. But it's worth finding. 

It could use a little more ambiance, the decor is kind of plain if you're eating in, but here's the best part, the service was really good, you can bring your own beer or wine & the entrees were great. She has the chicken veggie steamer which she really enjoyed & I had mooshu chicken which was delicious. You don't see that much anymore. 

The only disappointment was that we had chicken satay as an appetizer & it was on the dry side. 

Their portions are large, we both got to go boxes & their prices are good.

Go & enjoy!

I am always in search of authentic Chinese restaurant, i.e. the ones don't feature General Tso' Chicken, Sweet & Sour Anything, Chop Suey, etc., which are far and few between in many suburbs. When Liu Brothers popped up on my yelp search with almost perfect rating, I was very skeptical: the quite town of St. Charles is an unlikely place to harbor an authentic Chinese restaurant and "Bistro" doesn't necessarily convey authenticity either, but I wanted to give it a try.
