As we walked into the restaurant, my heart sank: the waiter is not Chinese, there are no Chinese patrons and there are only knives and forks on the table! Shoulda brought my own chopsticks...

I took a deep breath and scanned through the menu. The menu is not as lengthy as many Chinese restaurants, and there is no two-menu system (you know, one for Chinese expats, and one for locals). Most of the items listed are typical Americanized Chinese dishes but we quickly decided on two of the few atypical ones: Szechwan Eggplant and Liu Brothers' Crispy Duck. 

It turned out the waiter is the owner of the place and he is knowledgeable about the food. He had me when he brought us two pairs of chopsticks, as well as authentic Chinese chili paste without us asking.  

10 minutes later, I was a total believer of the five star rating. The Szechwan Eggplant was the best I have had in a very long time: the eggplant is well-cooked and tender, which is hard to come by when it's cooked to order. The sauce was reminiscent of the classic Szechwan "Yuxiang" sauce, sweet, a bit tangy, slightly spicy all at once. The duck was not Cantonese or Peking style roast duck, but Szechwan style tea smoke duck. I think the name Crispy Duck is a bit of misnomer as the skin was not particularly crispy but who cares when the flavor and the tenderness of meat was awesome? Needless to say, we devoured the food. 

In case you are wondering, the kitchen staff are Chinese (the Liu Brothers?) and I am pretty confident they are trained chefs. Finally, a Chinese restaurant that emphasizes quality over quantity and it's not too far from home. My taste buds are in luck.

It has been years since I've found Asian food of this high quality.  My husband and I tend to avoid Chinese food since we moved to the far west suburbs because most of it tends to taste very fast-food like.  We came to Liu Brothers on a recommendation and we fell in love.  

Let's start with the crab Rangoon.  The shell is light and crisp and the filling is delicious.  It may be the best I've ever had.  We then had shrimp fried rice and Chicken dish with vegetables.  The quality of the food is superb!  

You know how Chinese food leftovers get congealed together in some type of gel?  I'm sure it is due to a thickener they usually add.  Not this food!  It is just as fresh and delicious reheated as it was the night it was served.  

This is our go-to Asian restaurant.

We ordered take out on a Saturday night. 20 min later we were eating some of the best Chinese food we have had in a VERY long time!  Everything was delicious!!! The Crab Rangoons were on the smallish side, but OMG SO GOOD!!!  Also had the hot and sour soup, sweet and sour chicken, and the chili pepper beef. Everything was spot on--even the sweet and sour chicken, which sometimes becomes a soggy mess when you get it as take out--with the sauce packaged separate-it was perfect!  Oh, let's not forget our meal was totally affordable--especially for the quality and amount of food!!!  We will be returning can't wait to try some other items!!

UPDATE: New owners. We've been here twice since they took over and gotten takeout a couple of times as well. Food is still good, and they've added some new dishes to the existing menu, too.  Personal touch pretty non-existent now, but the food is solid. 

Slowly but surely hitting some of the places in our new area. I needed soup, the 6YO just needed edibles, husband was craving Asian. Ended up here and think we've found our new Chinese spot. 

Can I rave about the wonton soup for a second? It was EXACTLY what I wanted - and super fresh - and then I wanted more so I ordered some to go. 

Everything on this menu is made fresh to order. Every single thing. I thought that might take awhile (and I'm wary of things taking awhile after six weeks on Miami Time) but it really didn't... so it was fresh AND fast. Sold. 

The crab rangoon was light and crisp, and a new favorite of the 6YO, who pretty much wanted to eat until she burst. 

For entrees, we ordered honey walnut shrimp, orange chicken, and combination chow mein. And all were obviously fresh - and delicious. 

The staff was friendly and attentive, and the little kids' chopsticks (topped with a bright yellow VW Bug) kept the child occupied while we waited for our order. 

Will definitely return. Soon.

We went to Liu Brothers last night after reading the Yelp reviews. We had spring rolls, pot stickers and chili pepper beef. Everything was fresh and delicious. We have found our new favorite Chinese restaurant in the area.

The wife found this place on yelp and we needed a restaurant in the middle of nowhere to take the mother in law, who lives out there.

The service was excellent.  However, we we were the only people there.  At least two phone orders came in while we were eating and didn't seem to stress the staff.  Some people picked up carry out as well, but that was it.  Otherwise, this is a pretty dead restaurant in a strip mall.

More importantly, the food was delicious. We had the hot and sour soup, egg drop soup, sizzling seafood soup, spicy tofu, and fried egg noodles with shrimp.  All were good.  The hot and sour soup was a little too gelatinous and the broth tasted as if it were slightly burnt.  

The wife said the opposite about the egg drop soup.  She really liked it and the broth was not gelatinous.  I had to agree that her soup was better than mine. 

We all agreed we would come back for more.

Since my last review this restaurant has gotten new owners. There are no kid menus or menu items and while the recipes are very similar to the previous owners they're just not quite as good. Still an ok restaurant but not the superstar it once was.

Awesome Fresh Food
We go here a lot and love the fresh,  generous portions. I am still dreaming of the succulent juicy shrimp my husband ordered. I also love the fried rice, it is simple and tasty and the rice sings!
Do go check out this hidden gem,  such places are hard to come by in the suburbs.  
Can't wait to go back

Let me start by saying that I used to l o v e this place. I hadn't been in awhile because I had a run of eating there way too much and I had to take a break. So my friend (Who was also a big fan) and I decided to go back tonight. There was a new person who seated us, but that's no big deal. Walking to our table we saw into the kitchen and saw it was different people too. Uh oh.

So we order and the food comes...not quite the same. Especially the fried rice, which we sent back. I loved their fried rice previously! They didn't use a lot of soy sauce and it was lighter and tastier. This one had a lot of soy sauce and also had a curry taste to it. So they went from having the best fried rice I'd had to the worst. Very unfortunate.

The most frustrating thing though was the fact that they have kept the name and the menu...so you walk in thinking that you're going to have the solid meal that you're accustomed to having at Liu Brothers, when in fact it is not Liu Brothers, but a cheap imitation. I actually felt duped. Funny, somehow they feel ok about charging what Liu Bros charged for a meal that was far inferior to the original. Which actually makes me angry. They cut corners that Liu Bros didn't cut but still charge the same?! Not ok. 

They may have the name but this IS NOT the Liu Brothers I used to enjoy so much. Too bad.

Absolutely love having this place nearby. Super quick and extremely convenient! Does Asian food sound good? Yeah!
A ton of it together around lunch time sound remotely appetizing? Yeah! 
General Tso's EVERYyday? Don't mind if I do.

They have remodeled and I kind of like the new, darker look. Gone are the paper covered tables and in with glossy dark wood. The food is still outstanding and I love byob.  We went last night ( Saturday) and the place was almost empty. I think when they closed to remodel people thought they were closed for good. I hope word of mouth spreads that this made to order Authentic Chinese food restaurant is indeed open and better than ever!

Amazing! For months I thought this was a casual sandwich shop...then I found out...it it an outstanding 5 star Chinese restaurant/hidden treasure in St. Charles. My friend had me try the to die for Honey Walnut Shrimp infused with a light coconut sauce. I will be dreaming about that one. For an appetizer we had the salt & pepper calamari which was not your out of the frozen bag icky parts...perfectly cut and seasoned with fresh green and white onions....yummmm! My ultimate favorite Chinese Restaurant now. Plus they had great music and the highest rated excellent service!

My husband and I went here for an early dinner last Saturday. It was us and another table at about 5pm but by the time we left an hour later, the place was filling up. I can definitely say that overall, it was delicious. My husband got egg drop soup, which he loved and said it was probably the best he's ever had, as well as the Mongolian beef, which he loved even more than the soup. I had the garlic scallops and holy cow, they were amazing. The garlic sauce is incredible and the scallops were cooked perfectly. 

Our only complaint was with the crab Rangoon. My husband and I are crab Rangoon junkies and we were disappointed because there was hardly any crab in each one. I noticed it when I first took a bite and from then on, my husband and I were pretty much having a search party to find crab lol. If you're not going to put more than one or two VERY small pieces of crab in them, you should call them cream cheese Rangoon instead. But overall, it was very good and we'll definitely be going back.

We went to one of our favorite St. Charles' restaurants this evening.  We often have recommended Liu Bros to friends.

But not any more.  What was once the freshest and best prepared food has become run of the mill.  We knew immediately when we got our meals that something had happened.  The quality of the ingredients and the preparation was not the same.

When paying the bill we asked if there had been a change of ownership.  There has been.  New  owners.  And it shows in a decline to the average from the exceptional.

If you are a regular, you are in for a disappointment.   If you are here based on recommendations, you are about to wonder what the fuss was about.

Sad

Time for an update since there's been a change of ownership.

Just before year end, the brothers, Kevin and David, and their partner, Kevin, sold the business. The brothers stayed on until mid- to late-January to teach the recipes to the new owners/cooks. 

We have gone in and carried out a couple of times since the new ownership took over, most recently last week. I ordered dishes I was more than familiar with to gauge the kitchen's performance. 

The crab rangoons were good. They were cooked differently and had the look of something that had been fried in a tempura batter. The result was a delightfully crispy and flaky, but light, shell which I thoroughly enjoyed. The filling had a dominant flavor of something akin to green onion. Could have been an under-mixed batch of filling. The rangoons never had a strong crab flavor to begin with so that wasn't missing, but I'd have liked a bit more balanced flavor. The accompanying sweet sauce is the same- a little thicker perhaps- which is fine, but still fresh and bright. So the jury is out on these depending on the filling.

The chicken fried rice was definitely a disappointment. The chicken was not browned and the rice was very pale. Overall the dish was just very bland and had a greasy quality. Definitely a step down here.

Lastly we had the honey walnut shrimp, which I must say was better than ever. The shrimp were just perfectly cooked- and that wasn't always the case when David and Kevin were in the kitchen- they had a tendency to overcook the shrimp by a minute or two and the shrimp got a little rubbery. These were perfect. Again, the sauce was perhaps a little thicker, but that was just fine by me as it coated the shrimp and walnuts perfectly. Speaking of the walnuts, they had a much better candied crunch than I remember, so perhaps the new cooks are paying more attention to the walnuts too. The dish was the best example of this Liu Bros classic that I have ever had. An improvement here.

So the new ownership is batting .500 for us right now...I'm a long-time regular customer and I will not be too quick to dismiss the new iteration of this restaurant. Based on what I have seen thus far I am willing to give them some time to refine their approach.

Had we never ate here before, I would say the food was very good. However, we have been regulars since they opened and the food is just not the same since new ownership. Still very good... Just not the same. We miss Kevin!

Hands down best Chinese food in the western burbs.  Won 
Ton soup was bursting with flavor.  Pot stickers devine.  Chicken was fresh, all white meat, and spicy!  Will return ASAP.
I was sad to hear the old owners were gone, but I'm happy to report that the fried fish and eggplant dishes were just as lovely as ever. Basil chicken was also quite good with lots of fresh basil.

This is the BEST Chinese place I have found so far; I mean seriously, everything is delicious and you can tell that it really is made fresh, which is unfortunately unusual for Chinese food in the US. I highly recommend the vegetable tofu soup, fried Shanghai egg rolls and the Szechwan eggplant dish.

I can't imagine giving this place anything less than five stars. I have eaten out at many Chinese restaurants and this place far surpasses any that I have ever been. I was pleasantly surprised at the freshness and quality of ingredients in everything placed before me. You don't see that in many local Chinese restaurants.

Our meal started with a tasting plate which consisted of a choice of fish cakes, edamame, and small slices of savory beef. All were very tasty and warmed my palate up for the soup we ordered. The hot and sour soup was the best I have ever had! Then came the entree which was the Kung Pao Chicken. I was able to choose how spicy I wanted it, which was very spicy. I was happy to see that they were generous with the chicken. My husband ordered the Szechwan Eggplant. I had a taste of his and it was out of this world! 

The staff was friendly and the price was definitely reasonable considering the freshness and quality of food. Everything is made from scratch as you order them, including the soup. The atmosphere is pleasant. I look forward to trying other items on the menu. We definitely will be back!

Fantastic service and the food was unbelievably delicious! We were just driving through the area looking for Chinese and were pleasantly surprised by this hidden gem. We loved how the food was made to order even the soups.

After hearing about Liu Brothers, husband had early dinner on Sunday afternoon. We were on our way to a concert at Arvada Theater and had only 1 hour to dine. We were the only customers. 
Had Chicken Wings, Hot & Sour Soup, Orange Beef, and Schezwan Shrimp. Wings were so-so. Everything else was WONDERFUL.
Will go back soon. I'm especially anxious to try the soups and noodles. 
Got to the concert with plenty of time to spare.

I always go here for lunch, they are doing it right with the quality and portions. Not your typical Chinese food restaurant, like the name says it's a bistro. The two brothers are ahead of the game in flavors and quality and by far surpass any other Chinese restaurant in the area.

Liu Brothers Restaurant !!  Class act !   Had a mishap at restaurant today at lunchtime ( not necessary to go into details ) ... But needless to say the owner and server made it right !!!   Will be happy to go again... The food is fabulous and the experience turned out to be amazing !  Well done !!     This was not the first time Ive been there. I return over and over for the Crag Rangoon !   I already knew that the owner was a great guy !

Excellent food, I have eaten here 5 or 6 times.  Great flavors and what a spot on selection to adequately appease the typical local palate while still doing justice to what Asian foodies really go for.  I give the food 5 stars hands down, I give the restaurant 4 stars as the location and space are not consistent with the food and staff has been decent to good, never great.

Outstanding!   We have been in the Tri-Cities for 15 years and consistently disappointed in the options for Chinese food, until we found Liu Brothers.  

We started with Egg Drop and Hot & Sour soups - both were fabulous.  Entrees of Cashew Chicken and Mongolian Beef were top notch, and the Orange Chicken was incredible.  

Service in the dining room was a little slow, but not too bad since everything is made to order.  Definitely worth the wait.  

We will be back again & again!

When it comes to authentic Asian cuisine, this place is as good as it gets. Relocated to the Fox Valley 2 years ago, and I'd been searching for a real good Chinese restaurant in the area, but had yet to locate one, when some friends at the local dog park recommended this place.
Quality is definitely the main priority. Since July, I've been there at least a half dozen times for dinner and twice for lunch. The Szechwan and Mushu are superb. I haven't had comparable, in years. The soups and noodle dishes, made with homemade chicken broth are some of the best I've had. Lunch portions are of decent size. I haven't been disappointed with any entree.
The only issue I have is with the size of the appetizers. They're very good, but smaller than some I'm accustomed to. Used to have Sunday brunches of Chinese appetizer plates and soup. Unfortunately, I cant do that here! They don't even offer an appetizer plate.
Nonetheless, service is great and the owners are very friendly. The place isn't overcrowded, so there is generally no wait. I've found a new favorite restaurant!
Food was full of flavor, portions were generous and the staff was super friendly. Only downfall was the wait, it took 45 minutes for a to go order.
Excellent food, super nice owner, byob, I love it all! I've been there twice and intend to go back many more times.

We order from here at least 1x a week (I work close by) and so far everything is SPOT ON. honey walnut chicken, sesame chicken, stir fry vegetables, fried rice (it's REAL), beef broccoli, the appetizers (we've had them all) and we're happy it's BYOB for those after-work meals. We will be ordering here much more often. 

We are proud to patronize this business -- they are dedicated to quality Chinese food in St. Charles!

Outstanding food!

Understanding that it's a new restaurant and folks are understanding the business of running a restaurant, the waiter didn't write our menu request and brought the main course directly without the appetizer. It also took a long time to get our food.

The 4* is for the food and good ambiance.... minus 1* for service

They've updated their menu a little and have a few more choices now. They have a wider variety of appetizers as well as a few vegetarian-friendly options. Wait staff is great and the atmosphere is usually pretty quiet. I highly appreciate that they don't have a TV running in there like most restaurants and they keep their music pretty quiet so you can actually talk to the people you're with!

Went here for takeout yesterday. My mate got veggie chow mein with veggie egg rolls. I got honey walnut shrimp and crab Rangoon. The service was great & the food even better! I was impressed with the quality and size of the shrimp, as well as even though it was takeout; they still a superb job with presentation. I highly recommend this establishment.

Liu Brothers is delicious. The food is phenomenal and above and beyond any other Chinese restaurant in the area. It is BYOB, which I wasn't aware of, but luckily we went with good friends who knew and came prepared! We ordered several items and tried a bit of everything. We had the crispy chicken wings, which are out of this world, the pot stickers which were also very good and the spring rolls which are above average. For entrees we ordered the Orange Chicken which is amazing. Just order it, trust me. My husband had ordered the Mongolian Beef as it is one of his favorite Chinese meals, and it was very good, but he specifically asked the waiter for the chef to make it hot, and oh boy did they. So if you like hot ask them, just be prepared to sweat! One of us also ordered a special that was on the menu that was a chicken chow mein that was delicious. The food is really great.

The only problem with Liu Brothers is the service as others have said. I'll be honest, our friends had been there before and warned us about the service and that you will wait and wait, that the waiter is a young kid who spends a lot of time on his phone and ignoring customers so we kind of knew what we were getting into. But we were assured the food was worth it. And really, it is. If you aren't in a hurry and can just relax, pour your own wine and deal with wet glasses (yeah, they brought us soaking wet glasses straight from the dishwasher) and wait for food, it's tolerable. And to be honest, after some wine it began to become hilarious to see what would happen next.  And really, the night we were there we had the owner as a waiter and so it wasn't too bad. But the spotty service is the only reason for the 4 stars.

I went to Liu Brothers with my family on a Friday night. It's a BYOB, which is AWESOME. I got the Mushu Chicken and spring rolls. The spring rolls were fabulous, the chicken just okay. Our waiter forgot about us, so it took more than 1 hour for us to get our food. Friendly service, nonetheless. However, I would go somewhere else next time.
Hidden gem! Unpretentious good food. Nice people. What else can you ask for? Reasonable too.

I've been to this place 6 times. The first 2 times I was amazed at how delicious and fresh my dinner was. It has gone down hill since then.They have apparently gotten busy because tonight my dinner was not good. Slabs of under cooked, chewy chicken floating in oily sauce. It's sad.

I came here with my boyfriend for the first time last night on a recommendation. We were very impressed. I really enjoyed the decor and atmosphere. The place wasn't busy at all because of it being Ash Wednesday, so we had great service of course! Very friendly and accommodating staff. 

To start we had the pepper and salt calamari. I've never had calamari like this before and it was delicious. Great flavor and I would love to have it again. 

Then we both had the wonton soup. We really liked that too, great flavor and lots of wontons in it. Both the calamari and soup were a great price. 

For entrees I had the orange chicken and he had the beef and broccoli. The sauces on both meats were tasty and both portions were of great size. We had to take half home because we were already full. 

Overall great experience and for a great deal as well. We will definitely be back to try more items on the menu.

As I write this, I am literally eating my last crab rangoon from Liu Brothers Asian Bistro. I am so impressed that I had to convey the impact it has had on me while my mouth was still evaluating the complexity of quality fried cream cheese & crab meat.

Around 4pm I remembered that an asian place opened across town & on a whim, ordered takeout on this chilly Friday night. When I picked it up, it was PACKED and at 6pm, they took their last carry-out order, even though they are open much later. I recommend calling early & making a reservation! 

I ordered the crab rangoons, kung pao chicken & szechwan eggplant for under $20! I never get crab rangoons, but these were PERFECT; crisp, lightly fried with delicious yummy filling. The kung pao chicken portion was giant & had so much chicken compared to any other restaurant we've ever been to! Typical kung pao chicken entrees consists primarily of celery & peanuts. Instead, we received smokey and savory, quality pieces of chicken. The eggplant was also so so special. Caramelized, spicy, and worth fighting over for the last piece. My boyfriend will now have to sleep on the couch because he ate the last piece while I left the table to refill my water. 

St. Charles residents might not be the most cultured of people, but thanks to Liu's, they now know quality Chinese-fusion.

I'm so sad to say the new owners (and regardless of what they say their is a new chef) have taken our favorite Chinese and our favorite restaurant in Saint Charles away. We hope the original owners re-open somewhere new. The quality, taste, service and decor are all drastically different.

Excellent service, friendly owners, food was spectacular! Never tasted Asian cuisine so exquisitely done... Will definitely be coming back if I'm anywhere near here! Accommodated a party of seven with ease!

So far one of the better Chinese take out places in the area. 15 min. Drive home and the food was still warm. We ordered sesame chicken which was pretty tasty. Mongolian beef I would not order again! Tasted like it was in a mushroom gravy sauce, yuck! Crab rangoon was good. They do have a nice seating area. Would like to dine in next time and give something else a try. It's in the same plaza as Gino's East.
Bland American Chinese. I had the Kung Pao shrimp. Large nice shrimp with a sweet peanut, carrot, and celery sauce. The hot tea was insipid.

Went once before, months ago, and loved it. Raved to my family and took them tonight. BIG disappointment. The Satay Chicken was over cooked and came with a "satay" sauce apparently without peanuts! Thin and tasted like weak curry. The crispy duck was dry and seemed like it had been sitting out for hours. The plum sauce had an odd under flavor. The bowl of rice had a crust on it like it had been dished up hours earlier and left out. The sizzling beef was a cheap, very chewy cut. Ugh. The waitress was nice enough, but seemed left on her own to greet, manage several tables, clear them, and handle take out. Across the board just not good. Probably won't return.

Great place! Very welcoming staff. Very fresh food. Had crab rangoons, orange chicken, honey walnut shrimp and Combo stir fry noodles. 
Crab Rangoon's were light and crispy and delicious! Served with fresh made strawberry sweet and sour sauce. 
Shrimp was fresh and tender and deveined! Plus!! It's rare that chefs devein shrimp anymore. The sauce was great and abundant.
Orange chicken was perfectly cooked, juicy and tender and remained crispy to the last bite. Orange sauce tastes like it was made with fresh oranges, because it is! Not overly sweet just very flavorful.
The noodles were great. Good flavor, not mushy and over cooked as many stir fries are. 
Overall a great meal and I can't wait to explore the rest of the menu!

Checked this place out just to try something new and different. I knew the reviews were good but once you try any of the dishes, the quality and superior taste is the best I've had in a long time. Everything is fresh made to order so if your looking for fast take out you are better off going to a low quality turn and burn place. Good atmosphere so come if you want to enjoy a great BISTRO.

I love this place, but they need to rethink the way they handle "front of house." The food was VERY good. The woman seating and waiting tables was clearly overwhelmed. It took forever to get our drinks and she never refilled my water glass. It took 20 minutes to get our check and there were people waiting to be seated. We were on our way to a movie and we missed it because it took an hour and a half for dinner. This is a small place. If staff can't handle a full house, go to plan B because there were at least two other tables angry at the indifferent, slow service. Bad service will kill a restaurant.

When I first reviewed Liu Brothers I gave them 5 stars because their food is incredible, but the last two times we went, the service was terrible. The food took too long to leave the kitchen and even thought the restaurant was only half full, the kitchen and waiter were obviously overwhelmed by the amount of diners. 

Last time we went it was for lunch, and my husband and I ordered two appetizers and soup. Our appetizers came out, but we sat for a long time waiting for soup. It was lunch and we had to go back to work, so after an hour went by we asked about our soup and explained that we had to leave soon. The waiter, instead of checking with the kitchen, said he didn't know what the hold up was, and if we couldn't wait we should "just leave!"  

We left hungry and angry. 

Liu Brothers, you have a good chef, which is why I'm giving 2 stars. But good food is not enough. You actually have to serve the food. We will not be back.

Easily the best Asian food I've ever had.  We chose pepper and salt calamari and crab rangoons to start us off.  They were delicious, the calamari lightly breaded and tender, the rangoons light and crispy. And, the house made sweet and sour sauce was fantastic!  The chicken and beef were very tender, the sauces were fresh and light, but so tasty, and the baby bok choy was perfectly cooked.  We will definitely be back!
I don't think they serve alcohol, but a sign on the door welcomes you to BYOB.

The food is amazing but I have been very disappointed in the customer service the last few times I have been there. Also, I have called for take out a few times and have been told they are not offering take out and that I could try back in an hour. I have never experienced such a thing. I really hope improvements are made because the food is wonderful and I would love to support them but they are making it difficult to enjoy.

Best Chinese for miles! Fresh fresh fresh!!!
Great service. Don't be out off by the strip mall it's in, great food!

Wonderful food and service. My favorite was the sizzling seafood soup to start the meal. We also enjoyed (and shared) the garlic scallops, black bean flounder, and the chicken with homemade noodles, which was new on the menu. The best Chinese meal we've had in a long time.
The boys give it "five stars". Very excited about having this type of sit down Chinese restaurant in St. Charles.  Wife loved the noodle bowl.  Calamari was spicy but good.

I'll begin by saying, I am a foodie. I love good Chinese food...and this is it.
I had the Szechwan Chicken. The other person I was with had Sesame Chicken.
The Szechwan chicken was the BEST I have ever had...and I tried it at many, many places, so this is quite the compliment. 
The food was fresh, hot and they gave great portion sizes. We both had leftovers.
I don't live in St Charles, but I will make the drive for this food.

The server was pleasant and attentive.  We were their on 4/4 if the management is paying attention.

If you have not tried Liu Brothers, I highly recommend it.

I have never had Chinese food of this quality. I have never had one bad bite of food from this establishment and that is a rarity when it comes to Chinese food especially the deep fried options. I honestly couldn't speak highly enough about this place. They make all their sauces from scratch and use the highest quality meats and sea food in all their food. My two favorite meals are the honey walnut shrimp and the Szechuan chicken. Both are absolutely remarkable. The spring rolls are the best I have ever had and the bacon and veggie (eggplant I believe) appetizer is also a must try. The owner, Kevin, is extremely nice and easy to talk to which is always a plus. The only problem you might have with this restaurant is that you might get addicted to it like my gf and I have as well as my best friend and his gf. He made a yelp account just to write a review on this restaurant bc he loved it that much!! 

P.S. It's BYOB and who doesn't love byob?
Best Chinese place in the burbs. I highly recommend their beef vegetable soup. Try to stay away from the Americanized versions and go for their more authentic Chinese food you won't be disappointed

Great food great service.  Visiting from Los Angeles and this food is as good as anything I've had in Hollywood.  Don't expect cheap, to-go style Chinese food.  This is fresh, made to order Chinese food.  Orange beef, shrimp chow mein, and the basil chicken are to die for. Oh and BYOB which is Awesome!
Went in with really high expectations based on reviews and was only slightly impressed. My kung pao chicken was largely dominated by an over abundance of celery.

My husband and I absolutely love this place! Asian food is probably our favorite type of food and boy am I glad we found Liu Bros! The service is great. The people that work there are very nice. The food is also excellent and good quality. I really love the orange chicken! It's also BYOB :)

well I've got to dock some stars. I had my suspicions last time we dined in that they did not wrap up all my leftovers. This time I had half of my meal left on the plate. Lots of veggies left in my Szechwan chicken. I opened my leftover container and while i think all my chicken may be here I have almost zero veggies in there at all. I had sizable bell pepper and zucchini pieces left and lots of onions. The veggies are why I get this dish and I would like them in my leftover box not what you choose to put in it.

Also my husband can't stand the waiter. The food flavor is totally worth five stars. I just want everything what we paid for. I'll just insist on them bring me a box next time instead of wrapping it up for me or we"ll always order take out. This is unacceptable to me.

This place came highly recommended and it did not disappoint! The spring rolls were the best I've ever had. The Honey Walnut Shrimp meal was unlike anything I'd had before, it was amazing. My gf had the Szechuan chicken and loved it too. The staff was very friendly and personable. The owner was there and greeted everyone and thanked everyone for coming. Top-notch establishment worthy of my first Yelp review!

still outstanding food!!..... very different from the average Chinese food down the street.  I would however suggest to the owners that really good food will only carry them so far and the lack of well trained wait staff will eventually cost them business.  At the low end a restaurant is mostly about the food quality but if you aspire to be a step above average it has to be both the back of the house presented by a quality serving staff, because eating out is the whole experience.... 5 stars for the food and 3 stars for service......... Still a big fan!
Everything on the menu is to die for! They've elevated asian cuisine to an entirely new level! You'll never taste a better crab rangoon. Melts in your mouth!

We tried Liu's bistro for the first time tonight and I am very impressed.  It was one of the best Chinese food diners I have ever had. I ordered crab rangoon, hot and sour soup, sesame chicken and Kung pao chicken for my family. The Kung pao and hot and sour were the best I have ever had. I would of never expected such awesome Chinese food from a little place in St Charles.  I will be back.

Giving this 5 stars as we just finished take out and the quality was far superior to any other Chinese take out that we have had. We got 2 chicken dishes and the taste was great and you could tell the difference in how healthy this was compared to every where else. It was byob, but only see ourself using carry out.
Amazing! Some of the best Chinese food I have ever tasted. Best within 20 miles at the very least. Must try.  Hot & Sour soup was my favorite.
Great service. Outstanding food.  If you're looking for great Chinese food in St. Charles, try this place.

The quality is superb. We've gone here for dinner and were blown away by the simplicity and authenticity of theflavors. It's our new favorite Chinese restaurant in the suburbs. The salt and pepper squid is unlike anything I've had anywhere, cooked to perfection. The Kung Pao tofu my wife had was caramelized goodness.
The food was just ok. The service was very poor and the atmosphere was pretty chaotic.

The food was phenomenal!  Had the seafood soup and the flounder special in black bean sauce.  Both were so good! We also had the key lime cheesecake dessert, delicious!  We will definitely be back.  Also, Kevin, one of the owners is very very nice and sure has a lots of good stories.  These folks will be around for a while great service, great food in a great ambiance.

Really impressed with this place. The Orange beef and Orange chicken are the best I ever had. So is the chow mien noodles and crab ragnoon. Their breaded meats aren't over breaded and the sweet and sour sauce is amazing. And the byob is kinda cool too.
Delightful ambiance. Healthy amount of parking. Polite staff. And, most importantly, the food is fantastic. I would recommend stopping by before this place gets big and you have to wait for a table.

After driving past this place countless times, we finally decided to try it out. I checked the yelp reviews for menu suggestions. We ended up ordering the sesame chicken, Mongolian beef, egg rolls and hot & sour soup. 
I called at a busy time on a Friday night and was told 35-40 minutes. I showed up exactly 35 minutes later and my bag had just been put on the counter. The guy at the counter was very friendly. The total was $31 which is pretty reasonable for a family of 3. 
Dinner was amazing! Our favorite was the sesame chicken. The flavor was perfect. My 4 year old was hesitant to try it, but when she did, she literally jumped up and down and kissed me after taking her first bite! She loved it. 
Everything else was wonderful and I would order it all again. Very fresh, and you could tell that higher quality meat was used. Portions were good sized. The sweet and sour sauce was home made and had a very interesting sweet taste to it. 
Compared to a few other places nearby, this was by far our favorite. Next time we will dine in.

I have continued to recommend this place, and everyone who has gone is now a repeat customer. 

I recommend:

The soup meals - the seafood soup is especially good
Sesame chicken -  the sauce is SO good
Shrimp Chow Main -  the fresh cabbage adds just the right texture and flavor
Crab Rangoon - Homemade and delicious!
Food was fresh and huge portions.   Wife had the honey walnut shrimp which was excellent. I had the spicy fofu and it was very spicy. Served with mix vegetables in a dark broth. Dish was excellent.

seriously, this is the best and freshest Chinese food i have even eaten. All the food is cooked fresh to order and the owner is always present with a sense of urgency.  We have become regulars and never turn down a meal here.  The servers need a little work, but the food is great.

This place is fantastic!  The restaurant has a simple, refined decor.  Tables are nicely spaced apart.  The food is just great!  I had the:

Won Ton Soup - really good, though my mother had the egg drop soup and loved it
Salt and Pepper Calamari - my favorite!  Great breading to squid ratio, and the flavor was increadible
Chicken Fried Rice - good flavor and large piece of chicken
Kung Pao Chicken - delicious, not too spicy (ask for it hotter if you really want a kick).  I would probably try another dish next time though.

Also, my dad had the Salt and Pepper Fish - same great flavor as the Calamari and probably the best entree ordered!

As a side note, the owner and cook talked with us for quite some time.  They seem like really great people and the cook explained how everything is fresh to order and if he wouldn't eat it, he wouldn't serve it.  A great addition to St. Charles eateries!

Great veg noodle soup and fresh rose on each table is nice touch. But, I had to ask for chopsticks! At a Chinese restaurant! No vegetarian option on lunch menu and server refused to accommodate with an eggroll that comes with the other options (at same price). She also told me how good the soup smelled before giving it to me...creepy. Good price for good lunch, but I'll wait for a few more months to return until server gets more experience. Btw, are the Liu brothers in the kitchen?

When in this place on Friday and loved it!  This is the best Chinese restaurant in the area. I ordered the Mongolian beef and it was great. All the food was great. It's a byob place so stop at the liquor store before you go.
Easily the best Chinese food in the Fox Valley.  Good fresh flavors.  Love it.

Glad to join in on praising this place,truly enjoyed the quality of ingredients and care in preparation.Its very rare that I walk out the door in this cuisine and and say wow that was some home cooking.Great little spot ,all about the food in fact I think I will go back for lunch today before the masses find this place

My husband and I just got back from dining at Liu Brothers and it was off the charts delicious!  Their food is light, delicate and not at all greasy.  The calamari is well seasoned and not heavily breaded.  Truly wonderful.  My husband ordered the Honey Walnut Shrimp and I had the BBQ Pork and Noodle Meal Soup and we were not disappointed!  Having a local Asian restaurant of this high quality (and reasonably priced) will save us from having to drive into Chinatown --where we usually went to get good Asian meals.  No doubt about it...we will be regulars from here on out!

The honey walnut shrimp - very very good!  And Kevin, our waiter/co owner, was very pleasant and very attentive to our needs.  Please try the restaurant for yourself - this is a hidden gem in St. Charles, and I would love to see it stay for a long time.
buiscuits n gravy was delicious!! so were my over easy eggs, toast n sausage patties i ordered!!

I have been wanting to check this place out for a long time.  Finally, we went there for breakfast.
The Good IMO:  Staff.  All of them were very nice.  Welcoming and friendly.  Decorated nicely.  Prices decent.
My kids enjoyed their pancakes, bacon, French toast.  :)
The Bad IMO:  I ordered a skillet with over easy eggs.  The eggs were cooked hard.  Literally yolks were like eating a hard boiled egg... no wet yolk.  The meat, and potatoes in my skillet were also over cooked.  

****Before paying for my meal I already decided we won't be back.  After the kindness of the woman at the cash register asking how my meal was... and apologizing for the over cooked eggs...she took it off my bill.  She promised they will be perfect next time.  I may give this place another shot only because of the Great people that work there.

My brother, father and I came for lunch. We waited for 20 minutes to be seated - while there were over 10 open tables and booths. We thought it could be because of their kitchen size, or to keep labor costs down. Either way, not a great start.

I had the orange juice, and a chicken salad meal, which was great. My brother had a panini, which he enjoyed. my father had the pancakes and eggs, which he said were very good.

Great portion size for their price, it was around $10 a person for drinks and food.

Service was quality - our server was prompt, fun, and very knowledgable of the menu. 

Definitely would've been five stars, had we not waited for eternity to be seated.

I came here to eat breakfast with my husband that is a first.  I order the special two eggs, tow pancakes, and two bacons.  I was so delighted to have had my order how I like it.  I read of two eggs there were four.  I don't like bacon so I had a substitute.  I ordered sausage instead I received tow if those but they were a pretty size and  very delicious.  It came with fresh squeezed orange juice and fruit in the side.  The pancakes were made to perfection.  I was so happy I did not go to McDonald's by myself. 

My husband ordered stake and eggs.  His order had 3 big platters one with his huge stake and fresh not frozen broccoli.  One order of pancakes.  On the third plate he had four eggs, hash browns and fresh fruit.  Wow this was amazing.  I had only had this kinks of breakfast in Canada back in the day.  They give you so much food and is fresh not burned..

No wonder my husband was upset when we took him for potato pancakes at this other restaurant there the food was horrible he got sick and I just could NOT eat those sweet potato pancakes.

I recommend this restaurant in a second.  I did not know I had such a great restaurant walking distance.  Yum.  The restaurant is clean and big.  It is also cozy.  

I give 5 starts it deserves it.  I am glad I came here.  Now I know not to drive for miles.

I've been here multiple times and have had good and bad service.

I've been here with co workers three times. First time, I got the Spartan omelet which was good. Second time, I just wanted coffee. I was there for about a half hour and had to BEG for a refill. Third time, I got the modified 2 x 2 x 2.x 2Two eggs, two bacon slices, two sausage links, and two (pumpkin) pancakes. I ate them without syrup (as I always do) on a dare from co workers.

This is okay if you need something quick. Inside is very modern (used to be the Sandpiper). I'd go to Red Apple in Carol Stream if I want the most bang for my buck!!!

It had been far too long since my last visit and I found myself in the area so I stopped in. The place looks great and is all festive for the holidays. I just went with a basic egg yolk special number 2 and it came out promptly and to perfection.

My server Ted was a delight and was very attentive and professional. I look forward to another visit soon with a skillet and perhaps a five star will be in order. It's nice having a breakfast restaurant open at 6 a.m. they have had the same owner for five and a half years. Remember stopping in when it was the Sandpiper as well.

First off I went in there in the morning my first time there I ordered a lunch meal I tried the milk shake requested that they make it thick the waitress brought it to my table it was a milk substance not thick next my meal was hot the sandwich was okay. I figure I would inform the young lady behind the register that my shake was more milk than shake she apologized and offered to make another one free of charge I was turned off by the first milk shake so I refuse her offer. My second trip I went into the establishment got there breakfast meal food was Luke warm and two day later I became very ill from what I can say I trace it back to one place so with that I will never eat there again.

Walking into the restaurant  I was pleasantly surprised, by the amount of cars in the lot I thought for sure it would be await. I was seated right away the wait staff are super friendly. The size of the restaurant  is huge you would never guess it, the decor is really modern and cool huge photos of Chicago and old vintage food signs. New like comfy seats. Foods really tasty AND THE BACON IS HOT AND CRISPY. GLAD I DIDN'T LISTEN TO THE NEY-SAYER. I ENJOYED THE VISIT.

Was there for the 1st time this week and already made plans to return next week. Good food. Nice atmosphere. Friendly waitress (who didn't mind us leisurely talking over coffee after our meal. Spacious parking lot. What more could you want? Thumbs up from me!

Excellent Breakfast & lunch food; great omelettes (if you like your eggs well done or dry you should request it because they come wet); biscuits and gravy are good, not super filling; grilled chicken club sandwich very good I subbed the pesto for their chipotle mayo which was very good; coleslaw good. Coffee good; fresh squeezed orange juice good
Service good

Great service. No wait on a busy Sunday. Server was very nice and kept our coffee hot. 
Food was very tasty, and was very quick to come out of the kitchen. 
We even got a little extra serving of corned beef hash. 
The place was clean, and for the amount of people in it eating that's not easy to do.

A local spot with southern flare. This place just keeps me wanting to stop in anytime I'm in West Chicago for work. The service is always great. The food is always served fresh. I highly recommend trying any of their omelettes with a side of buttermilk pancakes. Their fresh squeezed orange juice is always the perfect balance of sweet and tart.
First time here and so far I'm impressed. Great service and a terrific breakfast menu. You can tell the locals love the place. Very clean
Great food at generous portion sizes. I come here for breakfast and lunch and am never disappointed. Homemade soups, friendly service and good prices.

Quick, friendly, and accommodating staff. Sometimes at off times like 3pm service is poor at other joints. Not here. I don't eat bread or potatoes so subs were requested and gladly made. 1st prize for cleanest smelling bathroom. Good food.

This place is great cafe/diner food.  I'm amazed at people who expect to taste cafes to be 5 star restaurants.  This place does exactly what you would expect.  We have gone about 5 times and had consistently: Hot decent coffee, Good food, large portions and attentive service.  There's a great menu and the place is clean and large enough to  accommodate very busy days.  No complaints about this great breakfast spot.

This place is as good as it gets for a breakfast restaurant. Me and two others own a local business not far in Winfield and this is our default Friday lunch. The meals are priced excellent, the wait staff is very friendly, I've NEVER had a bad meal and they have a cute waitress named Philomena. 

I recommend any of their skillets or the steak and eggs.

I've always seen this place packed so I thought we'd try it out.  It was a Sunday morning, place was busy.  Had about a 20 minute wait prior to getting seated, which is fine and understandable.  Place was "busy" but NOT packed.  I had my niece time how long it took our waitress to arrive at the table to ask what we wanted to drink and it was OVER 8 minutes.  She had up to 10 before we would have walked out.  The service here is TERRIBLE.  I had to grab another waiter in order to get a refill on coffee.  We saw our waitress about 3 times.  Once to take the order, once to bring the order, and once for the check.  SHE DID NOT come back to refill coffee, ask how food was, ask if everything was prepared to our liking.  The food was satisfactory, BUT NOT WORTH GOING BACK FOR SUCH TERRIBLE AND UNACCEPTABLE SERVICE.  The bill was $57.00 for 4 people and we all just had breakfast and coffee?????  Needless to say I did NOT leave a tip.  Very very disappointed in the place and will certainly NOT be going back.

After several visits, I'm happy to report that they do everything well here. The waitstaff is pleasant, the managers engaged, and the food is excellent. 

I typically get an omelet and hash browns, extra crispy, of course. The last time I got a skillet that changed my life. My wife and kids love the pancakes and French toast. 

The quality and service warrant five stars. Unfortunately, it's really more expensive than it should be. I'm knocking down a star for my perception of value.

Liked the food, our server was very nice and attentive. All was well until a busboy ACCIDENTALLY cleared a table when a mother and daughter went to the restroom.  When they came back to the  table and mentioned it to the waitress , the waitress actually brought the busboy to the table and YELLED at him embarrassingly, the whole restaurant was looking. Very unprofessional.  We will never be going back. The food was mucho delicioso.

I love this place. I come here often and the food is always fast, FRESH, and service is great. I always leave full and have loads to take home in doggie bags if I need. (I just personally never take home breakfast)

I come here whenever we go to breakfast

Last weekend I had brunch with a friend of mine at the Egg Yolk Cafe. We were going to Kline Creek Farm and faced with limited options, both agreeing reviews, pictures and the menu at Egg Yolk looked good. 

When we got to Egg Yolk on a Sunday morning, we were told it would be a 15-30 minute wait which seemed reasonable. When we were called to be seated, they actually had called us before another table and the other lady made a seen about us being seated first. We just stood confused as we honestly had no idea who was there first or what was going on...but it put us in an uncomfortable situation and I think their hosting needs to keep better tabs on things. Now when we were sat, we waited. A lot. Like 15 minutes before we were even greeted. And then she had to get us menus. After she dropped those off, it was another 15 minutes before she came back to us. It was a bit frustrating waiting 30 minutes just to place our orders. 

We finally got to order and the food was eventually brought out to us - again this took quite awhile. And she set it down and walked away before we had a chance to remind her we had no silverware. So we sat for another 5 minutes with our food in front of us but no way to eat. When she came back around, she was of course apologetic that she didn't realize we had silverware. She snagged it off another table and all was well in the world. I understand it was busy and it's a diner but there were some serious service flaws.

For brunch I had a delicious ham & cheese omelette. The cheese oozed out of it when I cut into the perfectly cooked egg. Everything tasted very fresh to me, perfectly sized pieces of ham, very enjoyable. The hashbrowns that came with it were different than any I've previously had. The shreds of potato were more thick but still soft & crispy in all the right spots. 

Overall, our meals were good, service wasn't but it could have just been an off day. I wouldn't hesitate to go back but would prefer trying somewhere else before returning.

I'm just not that convinced. 

Maybe I went on an off day, or maybe this is how it always is, but the service was really bad. What should have been maybe 40 minutes top for a meal turned into an hour and a half just because the waitress couldn't get our food to us in a timely fashion and made us wait 30 minutes to get our check. Believe me, if it was busy, I wouldn't have minded so much. But, it was just a basic crowd. Nothing special about it.  

The food? Meh, pretty good. It wasn't anything to brag about. Basically all the same options that any other breakfast place has. I did have breakfast though. Their lunch menu looked decent too. Maybe their lunch is better?

Maybe next time will be better? I'll update if it is.

My husband and I love this restaurant. We can always find something on the menu to please both of us. We never have to wait for a table very long. Always great soups to choose from. Very accommodating waitress, Robin. Very kind, strange to say that about a waitress, but true. Understood my diet struggle. 
The remodel after taking over from the Sandpiper is pleasant.
You will not regret coming here!

My favorite place for breakfast! The staff is always friendly and attentive. I love that ma and pa feeling I get every time I go. The Denver omelette is my absolute favorite! Plus every dish comes with a piece of fruit. Great food and great service!! Keep it up!
Great coffee and the best breakfasts around! I can never finish the whole thing, which makes it the most amazing deal ever.

Just like everyone else said, it's as good as good can get.  From the moment you walk in the door the service is exceptional...attentive, friendly and thorough, and the food arrives well-prepared, fresh, hot and fast. You can't ask for more.

The food was adequate. Brought out lukewarm for the omelette and unable to melt the butter pancakes.
The silverware was worn out ( my knife appeared to be spot rusting), the appearance is dated.
It is a great spot for locals and everyone appeared to know each other.
So three stars because I did not get sick and the people are very nice.
Perhaps Easter Day was a bad day to try a new place.

The food is pretty average for a breakfast place, hence the 3 stars. I usually get the omelet with ham (since I don't like their sausage). Today I had a side of corn beef hash and they added a very bruised strawberry on the side. Made the dish look sad. Hubs always gets the neltnor skillet, with my bonus hashbrowns cuz I keep forgetting to ask for something else. The pancakes I get chocolate chips but they just add a sprinkle on top, not melted in the actual pancake, for a $1 extra. Not worth it. One time I inquired why they're not inside, she had an attitude and told me that most places don't and I should have asked prior to ordering. Well ok then! So, hungry and in the area? Sure. But not worth a special trip.
Very good food. Large size meals, and price doesn't hurt your wallet. Food was all fresh and prepared to order. Would definately recommend this place!!

If I could give this place 10 stars I would! LOVE LOVE LOVE the customer service & food here! The owner puts a lot of time & hard work into making sure everyone is satisfied/ had a wonderful experience! He also walks by tables & starts conversations with his customers! That's how it should be in every restaurant. The staff is super friendly, with great manners. Food is also very delicious & filling! You almost feel like everyone who works at egg yolk is your family. I love it. Will forever be a loyal customer here! Recommend this place to everyone! :)

Never order the side of fruit. It's $3.79 and you get one small slice of watermelon, a slice of cantaloupe, a slice of honeydew, and one strawberry. For almost $4?! That's a rip off. The food was good but I won't go back with prices like that.

This restaurant delivers grade A breakfast, without the insistence upon itself that is reflected in the prices of other breakfast restaurants. You want a good breakfast that won't leave your wallet, empty?  Go here.

I personally have not been here since it changed from the Sandpiper a couple years back (despite living but a couple blocks away...)  Anyway, family has, and said it was good.  Nothing more or less than what it was before they changed.

Been here a couple of times and I love the way they  have renovated this restaurant. The chorizo skillet here is my usual.  We are still getting to know the servers but they are usually more than capable.  There are one or two servers that are a bit stingy with the coffee but other than that the food and service has been good.

I'm not from around here and needed a good place to get breakfast. I drove past this place and thought I'd give it a try. They have all the traditional food you might be hoping for, plus a few custom extras that other places don't have! The atmosphere was vibrant and happy, and the staff were fast and very friendly. 
The most important part, the food was fantastic! I got the Wisconsin omelette, which has 3 types of cheese in it, and the hash browns, which were amazing. I normally soak my potatoes in ketchup, but these tasted so good that I almost left it off completely! They had the perfect amount of crunch to them. Hoping to come back some day to try the lunch food!

Well the food and service are Definitely 5 star . I see they treat Customers and really like how people are treated like family . Somewhat busy and it seems like they call most people by first name !
( Dale Carnegie's book . How to win friends and influence people) 
Ordered 2 eggs over easy ( perfect )
And I got 4 easy . Same price. 
Not to many places do that any more
Yes I'll be back and yes I recommend it here.

We were looking for a good breakfast place on the way out of town. My three boys are pretty simple - pancakes - but my wife and I enjoy a good range of choices. We were not disappointed at all. I love corned beef and hash with eggs and Egg Yolk had an awesome corned beef hash skillet. Sooo freakin good and a great size portion of the skillet alone let alone the huge pancake that came with it. Didn't come close to finishing even though I wanted to. Whole family enjoyed the experience. The decor of the place was very nice but prices were so reasonable. I wish I would have eaten here all three mornings I was in town!  Next time I come back to St Charles area I will definitely come back.

I've been to Egg Yolk Cafe for breakfast 4 times now.  On Saturday or Sunday, this place always has a line, which to me is a good sign.  The staff is always energetic and engaging.  The food is very good.  For as busy as it is, it's always clean.  It's now our go-to place for breakfast.
My omelet was delicious but the toast and the hash browns were both burnt.   Great service
too crowded decent food terrible take out they tell you how long you go there and wait and wait then they give you cold food sdsssssssssssssssssssssssss run

Egg Yolk Cafe is one of the closer breakfast places to my brothers so we end up there fairly often.  Also, they were open on both Thanksgiving and Christmas which worked out nicely for us as we're too pathetic to make ourselves breakfast.  

The food is always really good.  Greg almost always gets the corned beef hash and eggs, Sue has the pancakes that come with it, and I get confused because the menu is too big.  They have a hawaiin omellete (I believe they call it the Hawaii Five-O, which is silly, so I'm refusing to call it that), that is really good.  It's canadian bacon, pineapple, and cheese.  I've also had the biscuits and gravy, they were really good.  They have tuna salad stuffed pineapple and I appreciate the attempt at stuffing something but let's be serious, just put the tuna salad on a plate with chunks of pineapple.  I won't mind if it's not in an uncut half of a pineapple that I now have to awkwardly cut up with a butter knife.  

The service is usually pretty good, not great, but *pretty* good.  The dining room is actually a little nicer and newer than most of the diner-y places in the area.

I was decently surprised by this place. I think that the new owners are doing a stellar job and have really turned this place around.

I think we made poor choices on what to eat, but we will for sure return.

Egg Yolk Cafe's food quality and menu selection is a very nice improvement over the old Sandpiper Restaurant at this location.  We had stopped going to Sandpiper years ago because  we were never happy with our meals.  About a year or two ago, we started hearing very positive things about the new restaurant, and decided to try out Egg Yolk.  We have been pleasantly surprised with the friendliness of the new owners, the improvement in the menu and food quality, and the good service we have received from the waitresses at Egg Yolk.  So nice that West Chicago now has a good breakfast place in town!
Good food. Kinda pricey. Cute place. Very clean. Nice waitress. Overheard a fight in the kitchen. Swearing, yelling, dropping F bombs. Scary thing in this day and age.

Went here for the first time for a Saturday after Thanksgiving brunch.  It wasn't too busy but the placement of our table was kind of awkward.  One side was flush against another table, and the other side was into a walking area.  Fortunately nothing happened, but it was kinda awkward.
The food was pretty good.  I got some crepes and they were good.  Coffee refills were quick.  The orange juice tasted fresh squeezed, and was tasty.
The only thing I dislike about these places is the price of their a la carte eggs.  I mean 5.49 for 2 eggs.. C'mon man.
But that is typical of most breakfast joints.

The food in general wasn't too salty and came out pretty hot.  There are quite a few options which is always nice.  The eggs benedict were good and their hash browns also had a nice brownness to them.

They have turkey patties as a replacmeent for pork.

Every time I come here it's always been good so I try to venture out and try new things so I had the festive pumpkin spice swirl pancakes. These are so good! Nice frosting glaze added- Perfect, hit the spot! Would have taken pic before I devoured half of it but it was calling my name!

They have hands down the most amazing fresh sqeezed orange juice EVER.  I've ordered it to go.  The omelet are awesome.  Service at peak times can be real real slow.  Once I did order to go and service at the front was awesome.  They did forget the orange juice to go once, and I had to drive back for it.  YES it's worth it!  Another time I ordered to go... and I called it in ahead of time cuz I was in a hurry.  I walk in and nothing was done... all I had ordered was like pancakes, orange juice and toast or something.. LIKE SERIOUSLY?????  I was NOT HAPPY.  But since the food is good... they get good ratings.  I've also tried a custom veggie skillet there, was DELISH!  

I'm a huge fan of brunch... and this place is great if you're near the area.

Wonderful improvements to the old Sandpiper- the owners of Egg Yolk Cafe have made (and continue to make) great updates to this restaurant.

They have an excellent new menu. The food quality seems improved too. The prices are reasonable and affordable. They now have freshly squeezed orange juice and the serving size is generous. Their strawberry crepes are AMAZING and come with a bowl of fresh whipped cream- you get three big crepes- wow. I had a breakfast combo with scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and french toast and ate every bite.  

The service is very good too, with some familiar faces from the Sandpiper. I appreciated that our server checked on us a lot but just walked by intentionally, without interrupting our conversation- it was a perfect balance and we always had just what we needed. I also liked that they leave a carafe of water with lemon on your table so you can refill your own water as needed instead of it happening throughout the meal and you feeling like you have to stop your conversation each time.  

This is a comfortable restaurant and a great place to have a good conversation over great food and great service. I look forward to trying their lunch items eventually too. 

Please note- the restaurant now closes at 4 pm so is no longer open for dinner.

If you're looking for a good mom and pop breakfast location, Egg Yolk Cafe is an awesome stop! Growing up in the area, this use to be the old Sandpiper Cafe, which looked old and dingy. Now that it's turned into Egg Yolk, the atmosphere is very homey with your standard breakfast fare. There are some unique  bites (lox Benedict), and their servings are huge! If you're looking for a good, standard breakfast place, Egg Yolk is awesome!

I didn't set out to go to Egg Yolk Cafe, in fact I didn't even know it existed. When driving on a Sunday morning to visit a different breakfast place, I missed a turn and the yolk was one me as I wound up stopping here instead. Having spotted it from the nearby intersection I decided I was hungry enough to just give it a try, and boy was I in for a treat.

Egg Yolk Cafe is a very typical breakfast/diner restaurant. The decor inside is pleasant, the place itself is very clean. There's high ceilings and even a skylight. The inside is surprisingly spacious and well decorated for a family diner. After being seated I looked over the menu and quickly identified a Mexican skillet as the menu item of my desires. Shortly thereafter a waiter came to the table, took my drink and food order, and within about 10 minutes my food had arrived at my table. 

While the place is clean, spacious and aesthetically pleasing, it would all be in vein it if the food weren't up to snuff. The Mexican skillet I ordered came with lots of cheese, eggs and clearly lots of spicy chorizo sausage ground up on it. There were a few jalapeno peppers in the skillet as well to give it that extra bit of spice. I was also given two bottles of different hot sauces.  The dish was garnished with a strawberry in the corner to give it an extra appetizing look. The first thing that's notable about this particular skillet is that the potatoes covering the bottom of the skillet were very well seasoned and well cooked and were quite flavorful. Often times when ordering skillets I find places serving bland, flavorless, unseasoned potatoes as filler. The potatoes here had some hot and some caramelized onion mixed in. This along with other seasoning added some extra flavor and were easily the best hash potatoes I've found at the bottom of a skillet. I seriously wish other diners would try these skillet potatoes out and take notes on how it was done. The eggs were made well, and there was a generous amount of cheese and meat on the skillet. It was spicy, but not too spicy, and the extra hot sauce bottles allowed me to add a little extra kick if I wanted it.

I also opted for pancakes instead of toast. These were fairly average pancakes with nice thick syrup that had a good amount of flavor. While there wasn't anything particularly unique about these flapjacks, but they were a nice compliment to the skillet.

Overall I was extremely pleased with everything about my experience at Egg Yolk Cafe. This is an egg-cellent place to grab breakfast and I will definitely be coming back in the future, just writing this review makes me hungry for their food. I HIGHLY recommend the Mexican skillet here, and I'm going to give this place a well deserved and somewhat difficult to obtain from my grading standards five star review.
Much better than the previous establishment. Awesome that they are super local and not expensive. On par with Egglectic and Egg Harbor and can handle their crowds a little better.

When we arrived at the new Egg Yolk Cafe (formerly The Sandpiper) they were mildly busy for a Sunday morning, but there were still over a dozen tables open.  We were immediately run down by 4 bus boys that seemed to be in a rush.  Not one of them excused themselves or apologized for their rudeness.  After about 5 minutes an "owner" looking man asked that we wait a moment, so we did still wanting to check out the newly renovated space.  A family of 6 came in 5 minutes later and told the owner that they were just going to sit over "there" and took their seats.  I gave the owner a sour look as we had already been waiting and there were only 2 of us.  He grabbed a couple of menus and sat us at the nearest table.

The waitress had informed me that the Corned Beef Hash was "homemade" when I asked, so I was pretty excited to order that with a couple of scrambled eggs, hash browns, and pancakes.  My boyfriend ordered the Potato Pancakes along with some bacon and scrambled eggs as well.  I also asked that they bring out a new pitcher of water as the ones they leave at the table have lemon in them and I cannot have lemon at all.  The guy acknowledged that he understood, yet all he did was dump out the water in the pitcher and refill it.  My boyfriend did a quick taste test of it and confirmed that I couldn't drink it.  I nicely asked the waitress for just a straight up class of plain water.  She was nice enough to oblige.  

When we received our food I was dismayed to find out that the Corned Beef Hash was not "homemade" as I was told previously, but just the canned stuff browned up a little.  Complete disappointment.  My boyfriend's Potato Pancakes were a little floury and contained corn as well as carrots.  They were quite bland and could use some seasoning since all I really tasted were the corn and four.  Overall everything was pretty greasy and nothing really had any seasoning!  I was pretty disappointed as I've wanted to try this place out ever since it changed over!  I drive past it every day on the way to work and the positive reviews only heightened my interest even more... Needless to say we won't be coming back!

This our go to place for breakfast and lunch in the winter for their soups.  Everybody is friendly and we have our favorite servers but all good.  On the weekends the place is super busy, but we can always catch the busboy or our waitress if we need something. If your check comes out to slow, it is because food comes out of the kitchen like crazy on the weekends. Remember this is a larger restaurant so lots of tables. If you don't get your check the Hostess stand has it in the computer already. I would rather have no check then cold food.

Formerly the Sandpiper Restaurant, the Egg Yolk Cafe is under new ownership and management.

I dined here for lunch during their early transition period. The menu is a standard breakfast & lunch only menu focusing primarily on breakfast entrees...  pancakes, crepes, waffles, omelettes, other egg dishes. Their lunch items include soups & salads, paninis & wraps, various sandwiches and burgers.

Although I stopped in during lunchtime, I chose to try a bacon and avocado omelette with hash browns and wheat toast. The omelette was nicely shaped and folded, covering almost half of the plate. It was slightly overcooked for an omelette, but I was okay with that since I don't like runny eggs. Hash browns covered the other half of the plate. The bacon was fine, but the avocado was not very appealing. 

At first I thought they made a mistake and added mushrooms to my omelette. I don't like mushrooms, so I began picking them out of the eggs. But upon further inspection, I realized the brown pieces were indeed avocado pieces. Now, I'm no chef and I don't know if the cooking process affected the color of the avocados, but I know I've had green avocados in an omelette at other restaurants... which causes me to think that these ones were old and brown when they were were added to this omelette.

Anyway, the service was good and friendly (their saving grace). And I am pleased to see that this restaurant space did not ultimately shut down, but rather is being redefined. So for now, I am stretching to give it a 3-star rating, and I'm hoping the kinks in their food prep or freshness will be worked out soon.

I work in West Chicago, and I will be back once they are in full swing to reevaluate their quality, for better or worse. So, give them some time to make their transition. But for now, don't order an omelette with avocados.

Oh, and new for this restaurant: Free WIFI... yeah!

Stopped here on a whim while looking for some breakfast. Hits all the rights spots....good egg options, pancakes, waffles, etc. Not all breakfast spots offer up pepper jack cheese so that was a welcome surprise and made my omelet even better. Overall...good breakfast spot.

Food is good, service okay, but when you order breakfast, every single little thing results in an extra charge making a $6 meal and $12 meal which is my only beef really. 
Waited forever to get my check and never did so I had to go up front to ask and then pay. Which is one of my pet peeves.

For days I drove past this place, wondering what it was like. Finally I was able to try. I do not regret it, my meal was delicious, service was prompt, and the atmosphere was interesting. 

Only downside to me is that I don't think they stay open very late, more of a breakfast-brunch type of place. I wish they were open more hours, but maybe that has since changed.
i like egg yolk very much! the food is great and the amount is even greater! but i love the way the host treat us! they even speak spanish! good place great people!
The wait is bit longer than usual; Bigger portions so order less if you visiting with family. Very fresh food

What a great place for breakfast. Tried it for the 1st time on a whim. The staff always greets you with smiles. The food is great, always hot and full of flavor. I tell everyone I know about this SPECIAL place!! I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!

This diner has great comfy atmosphere, feels a little like a mom and pop Perkins, it's big and can seat many patrons. We were excited to have brunch here and were not disappointed. The menu had all the favorites one wants, eggs Benedict, omelettes, skillets, waffles, pancakes and then all the standard lunch fare.  They were very accommodating to my request of extra veggies in my breakfast skillet and it comes with 4 eggs!!!  The pancakes were amazing!  I only had one complaint, we waited a good 25 minutes for our food, but it was very busy, full at the time we were there. Once our food came, it was all together and all hot, and our waitress was attentive and came around with coffee refills regularly. If I lived in West Chicago, I would definitely come back.
Excellent food, large portions. Great prices and very friendly staff. I would definitely come back to this place. Came in with my band and the customer service was outstanding.

I am giving this a 4 because is  very good and very fresh. However the wait is much too long.  Do not mind waiting when the restaurant is full but when I see that there are a dozen open tables I get annoyed. Last Sunday we waited 30 minutes only to see many empty tables and many people behind us still waiting.  Will probably only go there on weekdays. Too bad this is a great place

I generally don't go to places that do not have a website just because I like to check out the menu before I go. 
We just needed to get out of the house and this was the closest thing so we stopped in. The staff was super friendly, and the portions were a decent size for their price bracket. Unfortunately their food was not really anything spectacular....but it's definitely not bad either. But seeing that they had what seemed like an endless menu, I didn't really expect it to be kick ass either.

What a nice restaurant! First time here, and was impressed the second I walked thru the door. I was greeted with 2 beautiful smiles (and may I add, by 2 beautiful ladies :).! The decor and atmosphere was also welcoming and modern. The waitress was at my table the second she saw I was seated comfortably. Very polite, had a smile on her face, and all around did a great job. The omelette was perfect. Food came out very quickly. All good. This establishment has it right. Full 5 stars in my book. So if you're cruzin down 59 in West Chicago, and looking for a great breakfast, stop on by. You'll be glad you did!

I had a nice lunch here the other day. It was my second time trying to eat here, and the first time I actually did it. Last time, I saw a line of high school kids hanging out in front and decided to take a pass, since it was cold out and I didn't feel like waiting. This time, the high school kids were all leaving when I got there. This slowed things down a bit, but I did get to wait inside, so no big deal. My advice to you is to keep an eye out between 11:00 and 11:45 during the week when school is in session if you need to get in and out of here quickly.

I ordered the crepes with strawberries, bananas, and walnuts. I was immediately impressed with the quality of the fruit. Sometimes, a menu will read "fresh strawberries," but they really mean "fresh from the can." Other times, the berries are fresh but come doused in syrup, like the canned ones. Here, there were just sliced berries on top of my crepes, which were cool and naturally sweet. The bananas were not brown or mushy. The walnuts were added with a good nut to fruit ratio in mind. These would have been the best crepes I've had in a long time, except the actual crepes were slightly undercooked and mushy. Still, they were not undercooked to an unsafe or disgusting level, and the large portions meant I could set aside the few mushy pieces and still fill up on the rest.

I also liked that they give you a full carafe of water here. The service isn't bad, but it isn't fast enough to fill up the glass of a pregnant woman who goes through water like Shamu at Sea World. My glass was never empty, but I didn't have to flag somebody down for more water every five minutes, either. Very nice!

I might bump them up to a fourth star on a later visit if I don't have to stand around waiting for the football team to clear out because there is slightly more staff to accommodate the lunch rush.

People who don't give this atleast 4 stars don't know what they are talking about. Seriously. This place is off the hook. I love this place and the food is extremely delicious and they get you your food on time. Trust me and atleast try it

Great food and a great place !
