We have went several times now.
Breakfast and lunch were both very good.

Will be back
They have very good breakfast . There omelets are outstanding . Two thumbs up excellent.
Nice surprise!  We were looking for a place for breakfast and stumbled on Egg Yolk Cafe. Typical diner menu options, quantity and quality were great!  Service was quick & friendly.
Neltnor Skillet! Very friendly staff, good food & clean atmosphere.

Really friendly staff and good breakfast. My husband raves about their skillets (and cleans his plate every time). They give you a big portion and there are lots of choices on the menu. I usually have to ask for my hash browns to be well done, otherwise they're a bit under done and not crispy. They have a really nicely updated and comfortable space, with lots of light from large skylights (they could use a bathroom remodel though--they're pretty nasty). But we overall love this place and the food, and are here about every other week for breakfast.

We arrived at 10:00 Saturday morning for and were told it would be a 20 minute wait "while the kitchen catches up". The dining room was about 3/4 full at the time. We were seated in about 20 minutes, but waited another 15 before a wait person came to our table. We placed our order and waited another 30 to 40 minutes for our breakfast. Food was not good, over easy eggs were cooked hard, pancakes were tough and the toast was only toasted on one side. Home fries were tasteless and cold.
Greenville needs a good breakfast place, I hope they get their act together.
I give between 2 and 4.  Four because the Food and selection is excellent, as is environment and friendleness and two for service as the waitress was more than extremely slow ....terrible.

This used to be the Sandpiper restaurant for a long time and stopped going because was not impressed so when this new place opened I was anxious to try it and wow what a nice looking place which was needed and the food was good. I thought the overall experience was good and I had breakfast at lunch time and the rest of the family had lunch. I thought the blueberry pancakes were good but lunch looked good to and was from what I heard from the rest of the family and when i go back I will have to try it. The parking lot needs a lot of work but they just opened and maybe have not got to it yet since it was crumbling and hard to walk on for some one who has a problem walking on loose gravel. I will be back.
From the genuine greeting to the tasty food and friendly servers, this place quickly became a favorite for Sunday morning breakfast. I look forward to every visit!

Excellent local restaurant with friendly service and great food.
Large portions at reasonable prices.

This place is quickly becoming our go to for breakfast on Sunday mornings. My boyfriend and I like coming here because it's close to home (great if we've been drinking the night before), the service is always prompt and friendly and the busboys are great at refilling water (again, clutch if we were drinking.) Coffee is hot and plentiful and the food is delicious! Not sure what everyone is complaining about. I really like the lox benedict (their hollandaise sauce is a little lemony but still hits the spot) and my boyfriend swears by their skillets. And most of the time we can get out of there for around $20! Can't beat that! :)
We go to the Egg Yolk quite often.  It is a favorite!  Great food, excellent service with WiFi.  Portions are a good size and we always have some left overs.

Wow is all we can say.  This place is so great it ruins all our visits to other breakfast places.  We always find ourselves comparing any place we go to Egg Yolk Cafe.  The owners are great, everyone is so friendly, the wait staff is attentive and polite....just an over all awesome experience.  My wife would just say two words...APPLE PANCAKE!  We are always glad to tell our friends about this place...we love supporting local businesses and wish there were more of them like this place.

Regular weekend customers for breakfast.  Always greeted quickly and with a positive attitude.  Food is better than most.  Pancakes are very good.  Coffee is average.  Pricing is in line with everything.  The service is excellent, and where Egg Yolk really does a good job in differentiation from other breakfast joints.  
Never had a poor dining experience.  Happy for the new owners.  West Chicago needs a place like this.

Good breakfast place. Walked in about 8am on a Staurday and it was already crowded. Excellent french toast, good coffee, prompt service. Portions are good sized and maybe a tad more expensive than other breakfast places. Seems to be family run and they know all the "regulars". Nicely remodeled.

Took a chance while driving by after seeing positive reviews. Very nice inside. The food was great, very generous portions (the sausage links are huge!) and the service was really good. We don't liveclose by, but would be willing to make the trip to come back.

I use to come to the Sandpiper when it was open, and after a few bad experiences had given up on the place.  I was happy to see that new owners were taking over and that the Egg Yolk was born. I came in and was greeted by some very friendly employees and taken to my table within 5 minutes. My waitress was a cute and bubbly brunette by the name of Jen that made the experience quite enjoyable. Upon her suggestion I ordered the STEAK SKILLET which was AMAZING!!!! And the fresh orange juice was fantastic!!! Everyone was helpful, the decor appealing, and the prices more than fair. I look forward to going back and visiting this new and improved restaurant. Do yourself a favor go see for yourself.

Really liked my visit a week ago.  Everyone is friendly.  Wait was less than 5 minutes and for mid-morning on Saturday, that is impressive.  Food was very good and you get a lot of bang for your buck with the 7.99 options.  I look forward to coming again when I'm in the area.

I'd love to have been a spy on the conversation when the owners decided to open this place: "Let's serve the same food that everybody else does, about the same quality as everybody else and charge about the same, too." I would think that new owners would want to be inventive, unusual, find something that makes Egg Yolk distinctive from every other restaurant. The food wasn't bad, just ordinary. Not worth the drive for me.

Love this new restaurant!!!! Have been for breakfast quite a few times since the old Sandpiper was bought and reinvented. Everything I've ordered both breakfast and lunch has been fresh and delicious. I love how you can order breakfast or lunch items all day. The service is great and everyone there is extremely friendly and accommodating. Really feels like a family environm ent with good home cooked food. This is a great addition to West Chicago and I wish the owners a lot of success.

We were "now and then" patrons of the Sandpiper, but we have become "regulars" at The Egg Yolk Cafe. The service is excellent, the prices are very reasonable and the food is wonderful.
My favorite is the steak and eggs. The skirt steak is always tasty and perfectly cooked. The menu says it comes with two eggs, but I always get 4. (by which I mean they routinely serve the 4 eggs, I have not requested extra eggs) The hash browns are crispy and done all the way through and the toast is fresh from the toaster hot and buttery.  My husband loves the Julienne salad...plentiful, fresh and crispy.
We were not the least bit disappointed to hear they had torn out the bar and are replacing it with a "Party Room" for private events. I think it will be a perfect place for baby and wedding showers or perhaps a dining room for a larger family or group from an office or business.. We wish them much luck !!!!
On Sunday mornings they are packed, but after about 1:00, things slow down a bit and you should have no trouble getting a table.

When the prior Greek restaurant closed, I was so upset since it was the only decent place in the area for Greek food.  Then Kouzina came along.  Now you can find me there at least two days a week :)

At first I was hesitant, especially after reading a negative review.  I'm so glad I decided to try for myself.  I've been meaning to write this for some time now, wanting to encourage people to give it a try.

First the new ownership and service team is impeccable, very friendly and welcoming and always great attentive service.  They remodeled the place and it looks much better and is very clean and welcoming.  I have been seated in booths in the main dining area as well as at the smaller tables in the bar.

The bread is phenomenal, I'd have to say it's my new favorite Greek bread.  Anyone who knows me knows that I judge a place by their bread, and in this regard Kouzina nails it.  It's freshly baked and has the crisp crust I look for, and the olive oil they offer has great flavor.  They will bring butter if you request it.  I could make a meal out of this alone. Well, this and one more thing...

The saganaki.  The show stealer is the saganaki!!  Insanely good!  Best I've ever had, better than Parthenon and Greek Islands.  It's a higher quality cheese and the portion is the perfect size for individual orders.  Call me hungry but this is saganaki that I refuse to share.  Order it, you'll be glad you did.  And during the week it's half price if you eat it in the bar during a specified time period.  It's so creamy and doesn't turn to rubber like other cheeses I've had.  The taste is fantastic- makes me salivate thinking about it.  Ugh, so good.

Everything I've had here is top notch- my usual order is chicken kabob with Greek rice and a side Greek salad.  The chicken is so tender and cooked to perfection, and the grilled flavor is sublime.  The Greek rice is so good, great flavor with the sauce on top.  Goes well with the kabobs.  Their salads are enormous, cold, fresh and crisp, and their feta cheese is delicious.  A meal in itself.

I've dined with others who have enjoyed the gyros platter, the salmon, and the Greek potatoes.  What a relief to have such high quality Greek food without having to drive to the city.

Kouzina, you saved the day!  Keep doing what you're doing.  You're now a permanent part of my rotation.

In this world of mixed culture Restaurants this is as close to being on one of the Islands as you will find locally. 

The dishes are wonderfully authentic, fresh and inviting not to mention the enormous Bar area that begs socializing. 

Been here for both Lunch and Dinner simply bound to delight.

Best greek food in the area. Starting with the plethora of appetizers top choose from, saganoki, grilled octopus, tarama, keftedes, ect.. you get the picture. Its hard to even venture from that part of the menu. 
Now finding an entree will be the hard part. 
-Gyro is a standard go to, much better than the fast food places around. 
-I love the mussakka, always went home wondering why i ate so much... probibly because its soo GOOD!.
-personally when i feel like fish i like the sea bass, the whole fish broiled with latholemeno on top.. suclent 
-If im feelin lamb, ill go with the chops or loins. Again with that latholemeno sauce( you put that sh** on everything! (Cc franks redhot)) 
-dessert prob go with the baklava sundea or galaktoboureko
-dont forget about the frapp̩ on the way out..

I missed having a Greek restaurant close by.  This place recently opened and I had to give it a try.  I went with my dad and we both got gyros.  I got the appetizer and he got the full meal  (I have pictures of both so you can see the difference).  We also had saganaki.  All was good.  The gyro meat was pretty much the standard; not amazing, but, not bad.  Saganaki also was as expected.  Service was fast and courteous.  4 stars for now and I will update as I visit more.

***Update.  Now 5 stars!  I have gone back a few more times since my first review and have always been very happy with the food and service!  I haven't tried all that many dishes.  I always get saganaki.  I have also had their gyros and hummus and Kouzina fries.  All tasty!  I will continue to try more dishes as I eat here more.  I'll keep updating with pictures and descriptions of the food.  My only gripe would be some items are a bit pricey; however, if they are cooked to perfection then the price is justified!  Service here is top notch!  I've had at least 3 or 4 different servers / bar tenders and all have been amazingly helpful and provided a great dining experience!

This place has a lot of potential. However, right now it's a joke. An embarrassment to Greeks everywhere. From cheese that was suppose to be feta with ragu sauce dumped on it.... To burnt souvlakia and fries underneath swimming in oil. Service was average, bus boys were doing all the work. 
Greek cuisine is the best out there just don't use this place as an example till they get their act together!

Never left a restaurant before tonight.  Walked in and noticed many open tables and they were not overly busy yet had to wait 10 minutes to be seated.  Once seated we waited 15 minutes as wait staff continuously walked past us never acknowledging us at all.   Usually you would be told that they will be with you very shortly but no one came to the table.  We stood up and walked out and we'll never return. It's a shame since our family and friends really enjoy Greek food and was looking forward to trying this restaurant out.

Lunch review. 
One good constant from the last owner is Zach, a server we really like. Wish I could say the same for the Moussaka and the menu in general under the new ownership.

Lunch prices seem high, and in comparison to dinner, dinner prices seem a little low for Schaumburg but I think they will be pumping drinks, more on that later.
Moussaka is $15 for lunch and $17 for dinner?
Big problem right away is that I don't like bechamel instead of the usual layer of mashed potatoes in my moussaka. The other problem is it wasn't half as good as the moussaka the previous restaurant was finally knocking out the last few years. Didn't like the clunky steak fries at all.
No octopus main course on the lunch or dinner menu? What kind of Greek Menu is that?
There is a small octopus appetizer. I like my own lamb, chicken and meat dishes better than most restaurants, so my test for a Greek restaurant is the moussaka and octopus, my octopus has really improved though.

I drank mass quantities of strong iced tea but saw a flyer on the way out with $5 cocktail specials on 4 nights. I can only imagine what a $5 martini tastes like in Schaumburg and am going to keep it that way.
Service was intelligent and attentive, we like Zach. Interior is tastefully toned down from the last owner, and so was THANKfully the droning Fox Noise in the bar.
If you are heading West, exit onto Plum Grove Road and then turn West on Golf when you leave.

Ok, I was disappointed and am not going back until the menu, and/or cook changes. 
I took a chance on these average reviews. You can too, but I'm not recommending it. 
Chances are very good they are going to need Groupon or other promotions so you might want to wait that out.

Unfortunately this place falls very short on food quality and flavor. I was really looking forward to the grand opening as I am a fan of Greek food.
Tried it twice just to give it a second chance. Both times were overpriced in relation to the poor quality food. I don't mind paying up for quality but this was high prices and poor quality.
The Gyro meat was sub-par, I've had far better at fast food places even. The sauce on the Pastitsio was terrible.The roast lamb was chewy and poor flavor.  I didn't bother with desert. I would think with the grand opening they would go high quality to match the high prices, unfortunately that is not the case.

Food is good.  Wouldve 4star but too expensive for what it is. Gyro is the same as you would get from a fast food restaurant. Saganaki and salad were good but again way too expensive. Fifty bucks for lunch for 2? Hate giving mediocre reviews to new places but value isnt there.

Horrible experience. We didn't even get to the food actually. That has never happened. Me and my boyfriend decided to try a different, new place. We sat down, I ordered a glass of iced tea, while my boyfriend went to the bathroom. We waited 20 minutes for the waiter to bring me my iced tea, and come and take our food order. He NEVER came back. Yes! I never got my tea and we decided to leave because we were both hungry and if it takes more than 20 minutes to bring me my drink, food was probably going to take 2 hours. Omg I have never been so disappointed at ANY restaurant. Even McDonald's. We are not complainers usually and we have never left a restaurant before. The tables next to us were also looking around and didn't look happy because none of them had their food and they were there before we came. It was just a chaos. I have never expected such disappointment even from the most average food place. The owner really needs to hire a lot more waiters or something else must be done, but this place's service is a joke compared to all schaumburg restaurants. I regret we even went there and wasted so much time.

I wanted to really like this restaurant as there aren't many Greek restaurants in the Schaumburg area. The meal started off well the waiting staff was attentive and bread was brought to the table. My wife and I each ordered pita gyro sandwiches. The food was brought to our table nice and hot and it was all very tasty. That said I have a couple caveats. It was obvious that the Gyro meat served was not made in house. Also, the french fries were undercooked, they were still edible but they were definitely a little floppy. Finally, the restroom wasn't quite up to standards that I expect which are quite high. It's not that the bathroom was dirty or anything it just wasn't well-maintained and could have been cleaned a little bit better with a little bit more attention to detail. I'll probably come here again although the food was overpriced.

I stopped in on a whim and hoping to score some decent saganaki and I was definitely not disappointed! The saganaki was so flavorful and had that perfect crust and sizzle. Every part of my entree was delightful; the leg of lamb was just perfectly tender and oozing with juice, the potatoes were cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the little side of vegetables was amazing- this is the first time I've ever really enjoyed eggplant. It's a little pricier than I normally go for, but I think it's worth it.

So, my husband wanted to try here (since he loves Greek food) let me start by saying I didn't want too since it's been so many other names. However, he won and I was OK with it. How hard could it be to mess up soup and salad??? So, he brings it home and we have dinner. Not even 2 hours later, and we're both sicker than ever!!! The only thing we had in common was the soup! 
Yes, food poisoning! Needless to say, we will NOT be coming back! Greek Islands in Lombard from here on out!!

Second trip in two weeks, lucky me. Excellent again, Avgolemono soup over the top. Cream base with a good amount of lemon and rice, great start  with the warm bread.  Chicken lemononada was cook with a pan search, tender.  The artichoke and spinach with lemon suace was very well put together. Rice and tomato sauce done and good flavor. Really good with sauce. One of my favorites roasted veggies, egg plant, pepper,  okra, onion were roasted perfect, nutty flavors from roasting and spiced perfectly, try them. Service from Jenny excellent, a real treat.
They serve delicious food and a very clean restaurant great updates to the decor too!

We live very close by and used to go to this restaurant when it was the other Greek Restaurant. We stopped going bcause the food went downhill.  I was excited to see the new one!
Driving past every day and finally seeing the Now Open sign we found a night to venture in.
Monday and not very busy.  Our server was very attentive and had suggestions at every course.
A warm loaf of bread was put on the table immediately with seasoned oil and a few kalamata olives (a nice touch).
Appetizer:  Saganaki and it was delicious.  Not too thick, perfectly melted.
My husband had a cup of the egg lemon soup and was licking the bowl.
I had a small greek salad filled with onion, tomato, cucumber, kalamata, lettuce and a nice chunk of feta on top with the perfect amount of a greek vinaigrette.
Entrees: 
Beef Kabob with roasted potatoes.  Ordered Medium and it came out prefectly pink.  Not dry at all.
Chicken, spinach artichoke with lemon sauce. rice pilaf (i finished every last grain)
Both served with roasted veg plate of okra, onion, eggplant, zucchini, garlic, pepper and tomato.
The owner, Charlie, was at the front the whole time and greeted us / shook our hands on the way out.  
Classy way to start a new business and make people feel welcome.
This place was horrible!!! Food tasted terrible and to top it off my gf and I got food poisoning. Time to go throw up again.
Very yummy! Stopped in for dinner tonight, Saganaki was so good and the Galaktobouriko was amazing. Definitely will be back. Good service and nicely decorated.

Loved the old Greek Village Tavern but our first dinner at the new Kouzina was awesome! Saganaki was best I've ever tasted, gyros platter was delicious but just a tad greasier than desired (but taste was worth it ), and my wife's lamb/beef burger was phenomenal! Great service as well. We'll be back!!

I first looked up to read some reviews and some were not so good. However I decided to check it out for myself anyway. And boy am I glad I did! The food was wonderful, the service was good, and the atmosphere was enjoyable. I am first generation Greek so I do the difference between real and generic and this was real. I had the combination plate and enjoyed it immensely. My dinner mates both ordered the same thing which was grilled calamari. I did not try it but it sure looked good and they both said it was. I know I will go back!

I came here for lunch with my husband for the first time. Other than being over-priced I really enjoyed the Gyro sandwich I ordered. The Gyro meat was perfectly cooked and deliciously spiced. The atmosphere was inviting and the decor was tasteful. The Greek restaurant options in this area are few and far between so I look forward to coming back sometime to explore their dinner menu.

Ugh. I was excited at the thought of a Authentic Greek restaurant coming to Schaumburg but unfortunately Kouzina is not it. I love Greek food. It's delicious flavored and spices are stapled on the food but here it was like they had never had it before. I ordered 2 things: melitzanosalata(eggplants dip) and pastitchio(Greek lasagna). I've had both these at many restaurants in Greektown,Chicago and love them but at Kouzina they just weren't authentic. The taste of the melitzanosalata was weird as if it had a lot of mayo in it or something. Also, it was bright pink??? Never had it pink. The pastitchio tasted like chef boyarde spagettios. I'm not joking the only thing about this place was the service and they all spoke geek and we're professional. I suggest that, if you have the time, go to Greek town and any of the restaurants in there are 10 times better thank Kouzina
Dolmades plate was tasty   Food service was SLOW. So if you have plenty of time and good company get some good Greek food here. If you're in a hurry you may be frustrated!

If you have not tired a Joey's Special Sub with Mayo and Italian dressing you're missing out!! 

Homemade sausage, roast beef, chicken salad, sauce and dressing are few of the items that are made daily here..

I've lived in the area for eight years and have always had this place on my list. Boy did I wait too long before trying out. I placed two orders;

1st- I was hungry and looking for lunch. After pondering the menu, went with the large Italian sub and medium potato salad. The Italian sub was simply prepared, meat, veggies, and a tasty Italian dressing on a sesame seed Italian bread. All combined to a tasty sandwich, with the meat standing out in the end. I haven't had much luck with potato salad, this one was decent - all potatoes were cooked through, which usually is not the case at other places. Dressing on that was alright.

What I was really surprised was with my second order. Did not want to bother cooking dinner, and saw a side case of already prepared Italian dishes. I got the braciole and got a veggie rotolo. These came in microwaveable dishes. After reheating, we were pleasantly surprised that might. The marinara sauce was nice. The braciole was tender and did not require a knife to cut through the tasty layers. 

Would definitely come back again for a quick Italian fix.

An Addison staple.  I always try to stop in when I'm in town.

The sub sandwiches are outstanding.  Always fresh, and never skimpy.  The meatball sub is one of my favorites with the Italian a close second.  The other food (pastas, Italian dishes, etc) are a great option if you don't feel like cooking dinner.

I have never been disappointed with the service or prices.

I can't believe in all the time I've been eating at Mario's that I haven't written a review. Time to remedy that. 

I've never had a bad meal here. 95% of the time I get the 10" American cold sub. The bread is always fresh and it comes with ham, bologna, salami, lettuce, tomato, and mayo. That's the way I have mine, but they are more than willing to accommodate your sandwich to your likings. (No tomatoes for the wife). 

Other dishes my wife and I have enjoyed are the Joey sub, the roast beef sub, meatloaf, and grilled chicken panini. 

The portions are always generous and most of the Old Girl can't finish hers. Lunch the next day becomes a battle as I try to wolf it down before her.

Friendly service and authentic Italian food. Their gravy (red sauce) is as good as I've ever had and I grew up in an Italian family where everybody could cook. The meatballs and rotolo are dense and flavorful. We get a lasagna for Christmas every year and it never disappoints. The place itself is no frills but fine for lunch.

I think the macaroni salad here is amazing but the lady who took my order could be a little nicer. She seemed annoyed to be dealing with me even though it was dead inside. Also, when I asked what sizes the salad came in, telling me small medium and large is not helpful whatsoever without any context. I had to ask if she could show me the sizes before she pointed out the containers they use. Seriously, is it your first day working? Otherwise how would it not occur to you to do that automatically? It's like she didn't want our business. It seriously turned me off and now I'm not so sure I'd come back even though I like the food. I don't like patronizing businesses who do not seem to appreciate their customers.
A very good Italian Deli!  I took several laps thru the sandwich menu.  All of them are very good.
Great place for catering. Excellent food great service and very friendly staff. They go above and beyond for you. There subs and lunch are excellent as well.

Great food..always!  From their subs to warm food to desserts, it is all wonderful!  I can't stop getting the American sub, my husband "the Joey" but we have had lasagna,  ravioli, gnocchi,  etc and all have been delicious!
2 best lunch spot for me. here is one of those. other ? it is Se:::. ~~

Stopped in at Marios which is a frequent lunch spot for me. This is a standard Italian style deli with a good selection of sandwiches and daily specials. Their sandwiches are big as I normally get a 6 inch. I had the ravioli and sausage lunch special today. Portions are generous. The interior of this place is a bit dated but the food more than compensates for this.

They have VERY good Italian Sandwiches...don't skip over The Joey, very good rare roast beef. 
They have a lot of traditional Italian dishes as well available, I have heard good things but have not tried. This is a no frills place but you can get in and out and it is a solid sandwich! 

You can't compare them to Serino's which is just up the road, it like comparing McDonald's to Burger King....they are similar yet totally different. But, Serino's can be a madhouse at lunch...but that can say a lot a place too.

I used to love this place.  Ordered regularly for years. I went in today and got an arrogant, unfriendly, Woman behind the counter. This is after I purchased $40 of food. Got home and the seafood salad that I bought was all fake seafood (and not advertised as such). Miserable Woman behind the counter, fake seafood. Regular no more.

I am so glad to see that Mario's doesn't have a review under 3 stars. I love this place. I will be honest I've had some of their other menu items like chicken parm or pasta and wasn't impressed. But I hands down have never had an Italian sub better than theirs. It is by far the most amazing sand which I've ever eaten. That is basically the gist of my review. Go their and get the Italian sub. You will not be disappointed.

Best sub sandwich in the entire Chicago area. Maybe the world!  Moto Buene !   Also the Chicken parm is simply amazing. Bring you appetite. Portions are huge. Sometimes on Saturdays, the have chicken cacittiore. It is heavenly!  Mario is wonderful, his wife and sister too!     Keep doing what your doing. Gracia
No frills, but all flavor! Italian sub with hot peppers is the way to go! Don't let the simplicity change your pallet. And get ready for a lot of decisions!
Great Italian sandwiches and pasta dishes.  I'm surprised but I was able to get a braciole here.  You have la nonna taking your order and making your sandwiches.  Old school feel and taste.  Love it.

I would die for some Mario's chicken salad. Seriously, it's that good! I don't know how they do it, but theirs is by far the best I've ever had. Get it on a croissant for the best taste! 

Also try the pasta salad, potato salad, homemade meatballs and fresh homemade Italian sausage. Whenever I'm in Chicago, I take orders from my family back east and bring back up to 10lbs of frozen sausage. I get some weird looks from TSA at O'Hare, but it's totally worth it!
You need to try, no you "must" to try this place.

My boyfriend has been going to Mario's since he was a kid.  We have been here many times together and I just feel like the quality of their food has been going down in the last year or so.    Their italian sub only has like 3 pieces of meat on it and you have to ask for additions like tomato and onion on your sandwich.  Very OK sandwiches.  

Save your money and go to Serino's deli about a mile down Rohlwing in Addison.  They have much better subs and awesome homemade pizza!

The subs are simply delicious. No chipotle,saian fusion, oven baked melt type of subs. The american is simple and so very delicious.. Small little italian deli.. plenty of pasta options and dessert.. Lasagna didnt blow me away but its great to be able to order lasagna to go n get it in 5 min. Not bad either.. I will definitely return.

I'm not normally a religious person but... JesusT*ttyF*ckingChrist that's one good veggie sub!

Now, I'm generally not much of a sub fan. I might even hate them. Something about them reminds me of grade school lunches where the cheese would sit on your sammie unrefrigerated for hours to the point where it goes a big rubbery one and gets all melty and disintegrated. Yucko the Clown. 

Mario's veggie sub has become my new Tuesday (or any time I'm in the area) tradition. Get the 10 incher (trust me- if you go with the 6 your life will only be full of regrett), no mayo, and ask for the spicy cheese- that ish is seriously spicy and oh-so  GD delish. 

On occasion I'll veer from exclusively getting one 10 inch sub and opt for a little variety... like maybe I'll get two 10 inch subs, OR a 10 inch sub and ravioli, or a 10 inch veggie sub and the delish veggie rotolo... and I mustn't forget a kolacki cookie and gelato. Everything is phenomenal. Truly. And there's TONS of veggie options. 

On some days the super nice little woman behind the counter asks how many sets of silverware I need  for all the food I've ordered... as if I'm order for multiple people. Just one, I say. In fact, I probably don't even need the one bc everything is so good I just dig right in with my digits. Plasticware can't hold this Bia back, yo.

The environment inside is kinda sterile but it's a deli- whadya expect? And I'll admit that sometimes the worker bees can be kinda cold but I don't care- that veggie sub still manages to warm the cockles of my heart and I'm giving them 5 stars for it. 

Viva La Veggie Sub + 10 inches or BUST!

It was cold. Bigby's Pour House was about fifteen minutes from opening. And, I was hungry following a traffic-ridden drive from the city. It appeared that the fates had written me a prescription for an unshakable case of the hangriness.

Ooooh, lookie - there's a sandwich shop next door!

Crisis averted. I was surprised to find a warm, cozy shop with a family feel once I walked through the doors. Turns out they've been around for years, and you can satiate your craving for all things Italian between their impressive offering of just about any pasta dish your carb-lovin' heart desires and their standout sandwiches. I went with the deceptively simple yet all-out awesome roasted red pepper and fresh mozzarella sandwich. If you're into salads and soup they make them too. But you must save room for the cannoli - it's not a recommendation, that's a rule.

Thanks, Mario, for turning my frown upside down.

love this place. 

this is my niece's favorite place to go after school. this is definitely a great place for fresh sandwiches and hands down loved my the teens at   addison trail.

Fresh food, fresh meats and a great selection. I prefer this over subway any day!

Best place ever. If you can't find anything you love here than you have a problem. Family owned by the nicest people ever. The only problem you should ever have here is deciding what to chose for your meal.

As a regular customer of Bigby's Pour House which shares the same building, I have been to Mario's many times.  I like Mario's, but I don't love it... well at least not everything.

What I do love is that it is not Sub-Johns-nos.  I like real old fashioned sub sandwiches.  I also like that they have a variety of other dishes such as lasagna, chicken Vesuvio, meatloaf, eggplant parmesan, etc.
The food is all "homemade" tasting which puts it above all those chains.

Walking into Mario's from either the outside entrance, or the hallway shared with Bigby's you find yourself in a small, somewhat sterile environment with food cases on one side and plenty of tables and chairs on the other.  Everything is clean and well kept which is great for a restaurant.  It definitely has that deli feel to it that doesn't really encourage you to hang out.  I usually take my food over to Bigby's to enjoy it with a beer.

The counter is usually manned by Mario himself or his wife.  They efficiently understand what I am ordering and get the ball rolling.  The one area that I think leaves room for improvement is personality.  Perhaps they have been doing this for so long that it doesn't seem important anymore, but personality goes a long way.  All the times I have been in Mario's I have never felt that they appreciated my business.  I don't even care if they remember me personally, but just give some indication that you are happy to see me choose your restaurant.

Once you order, you get to hang out while they make the sandwich fresh (or heat up your entree which was precooked, but kept cold in the display case).  Speaking of the hot entrees, they are served in styrofoam bowls/plates and there is only plastic utensils.  I know that this is the way things are done these days, but that doesn't mean I have to like it.  I often avoid those items  if I think about it too much before ordering.  I also find the sauce to be good, but a little on the salty side.

Sometimes if the Bigby's/Mario's schedules overlap, I will get some dessert to go with my beer drinking.  (I'm weird that way.)  Mario's has a nice selection of homemade desserts like cannoli, Napolean, tiramisu, cookies, brownies, and other things that I cannot remember.  Anything that has cream in it and benefits from being chilled is delicious.  Unfortunately, they keep the cookies and brownies in the same case and I didn't like that they were served cold.  They also have gelato (hidden off to the side by the napkins and utensils).  I have only had the hazelnut and vanilla.  The hazelnut gelato was very good.  The vanilla must not be as popular because it was a little freezer burned.

So overall I like Mario's.  I don't know if I would go out of my way to eat here if it wasn't next to Bigby's, but it is definitely a nice break from the limited Bigby's menu.  Unfortunately Mario's is usually a couple hours away from closing when Bigby's is opening up, so the window of opportunity is small.
Keep the fresh subs coming and I will be back... and looking for a little smile.

Mario's is a perfect place to pick up lunch or dinner--especially when you're on the run and/or don't feel like cooking at home.  There's not much character to the place-it's a bit like a cafeteria, but the food is the real reason to visit.  I've picked up dinner here several times and taken subs with me to picnics and even to tailgate at the Bears games. Always a hit. 

Sub sandwiches, paninis, pasta, salads, soups--there's lots to choose from.  My favorite is the Italian sub--stuffed with meats, topped with lettuce and tomato and their Italian dressing, all on a nice hearty italian bread.  Delish. I've had other sammies here and have never been disappointed.  The Ravioli is also a solid choice.  

Service is always friendly and prices are very reasonable.  There's a sweet station with gelato and pre-packaged Italian Ice.  And don't leave without checking out the pastry case--delectable delights!

'My sub runneth over!'

Yes, the meat was literally popping out of the sides of my Italian sandwich.  I was in sub heaven.  The sumptuous meat and cheese was complimented by a few pieces of lettuce and tomatoes and topped with Mario's Italian dressing on a very fresh sesame roll.  The only thing missing was a few thin slices of onion.  My wife ordered the veggie and a small cup of fruit salad and was quite happy.  Yes, vegetarians, between the veggie sandwich, eggplant paninni, and pasta dishes you have many options. 

The only thing that I won't do next time is order the 10" sub.  I guess I'm just not man enough!  This was the first time in a long while that I haven't been able to finish a sub.

Next stop at Marios will require ordering one of their beautiful looking pasta dishes.  I think I'll plan an evening visit to Marios for dinner and wash it down with a couple of Two Brothers pints from my favorite bar next door, Bigby's.  Yeah, that's the ticket...

I've been here a bunch of times and it's a great place for a meal.  The owners are quite nice and were a great help on my last group order.  I ordered 4 different subs and they advised me what subs are the most popular and what is usually on them.  I got a hot corned beef and stayed away from the vegetables while the turkey got a touch of mayo along with swiss cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions.  The Italian has hot capacolla, genoa salami, mortadella, provolone, along with some veggies.  They use fresh Turano bread so it's got a nice "chew" along with some sesame seeds.  The bread has to be thick because they're so well filled.

They have a daily hot pasta menu item and for $7 or $8, it's definitely filling.  There are plenty of semi prepared items in their display case which can be heated up and added with sauce or perfect for a take home dinner to add to your own salad or sides.  The seating area is simple and clean.  There's parking in the back and it's not that difficult to get out onto Lake Street.  They close at 7PM on weekdays so it may not be the easiest place to get to on a busy weeknight but it's definitely a solid place for a meal when you're in the area.

I started going here only because I frequent Bigbys.  They are really nice people and make some very, very good food that you can have brought over to Bigbys.  A little expensive, but the portions are always big and the quality is first rate.

I've never eaten even a mediocre bite of food from this place. Everything is delicious. Even though I'm hooked on the sub sandwiches I stop in frequently to pick up quick dinners for my boyfriend and I. They are super friendly and know what they're doing when it comes to cooking!

Love their pastas and Italian meat loaf. Have not found anything to not like here. Been  
stopping in for take out dinners for years now and am never disappointed.
Great prosciutto sub!  Even took a special request for fontinella cheese on it.  Wish the bread was a little better quality like Gonnella.

Mario's is a stellar choice for deli sandwiches, pasta, scrumptious desserts and more. We stopped in for a quick and light dinner on Friday and were thoroughly impressed.

My Italian sub had plenty of meat, tasty cheese and just enough dressing; the bread was chewy and perfect. My husband's panini looked delicious, but I wouldn't know since he scarfed it down so fast! I do wonder if I could get some giardiniera next time, that would be the perfect final touch to my sub... Anyway, the perfect end to our meal was the triple-chocolate brownies we took home for later: super-fudgy, with a light, creamy white chocolate layer on top. Drool.

The space itself is clean (although a few tables could've used a wipe off) with maybe a dozen tables. There were cool pictures of various forms of pasta all over the wall, and some maps of Italy and its regions.

There was also a freezer case with sorbetto and other frozen delights.

We inspected the various pasta delights while standing in line, and let me tell you, I'm looking forward to going back and trying the spinach gnocchi.
Wow! Is all I can say. Great subs . Homemade Italian food. Don't know why it's put under a food mart. You really can't  buy stuff there.

Well, well, well. I've had Mario's subs many times before, never actually been there or bought them until recently. I stopped in, two subs, two sides and $20 dollars later I was out the door. I ordered an Italian sub and got a small side of their macaroni salad which was delish. Boss man got a turkey salad and a side of pasta salad, aww but they gave us potato salad :( waah waaah. Over all the place is good but $10 per person? Don't think I'll be a frequent shopper.

This is the best deli in the surrounding suburbs.  There is nothing bad on the menu.  Their subs and paninis are amazing, along with their pastas.  I like that their sauce is not sweet like most other Italian restaurants.  It tastes authentic and like a tomato sauce should taste like.  We have been going here for 15 years.  We go here to treat ourselves:)  Go here once and you will see why..

Not a bad joint.   I had the Italian sub.   I am a rather sub snob, so they are not the best I have ever had.   The meat on the sandwich was nothing out of the ordinary.   Italian dressing and not mayo is always a good sign you know what you are doing.   Couple other Italian delis nearby that are at least as good if not better.

Mario's did have some interesting home made desserts on display.   I did not try one, but the cannoli looked really good.   Worth stopping in and grabbing a bite.   Would not drive out of the way to get one though.

Fresh bread, fresh meats and cheese, and lots of pride go into this food.  I have been here a few times and I just love the food.  One time I got the grilled chicken sandwich sub and the chicken was juicy, most places make it dry as heck.  I would definatley recommend this place!

I've been coming here ever since they expanded from the deli in the 90s.  If you grew up in Addison with bunch of Italians, you know this is the real deal.  Their subs are great for lunch, but their meat balls and the sauce are the real deal.  I love going there, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Just  fantastic.

Fantastic selection and delicious marinara sauce! I LOVE pasta and Mario's has every kind of pasta you can imagine as well as italian meatloaf, rotollo, eggplant parmigiana, subs, soup, catering, and chocolate covered cannoli. Every meal usually ranges around $7 or so but man is it worth it. It's fast and they have more things than you will ever be able to try. Great for casual lunch! Right next door to Bigby's Pour House which is also amazing. I think I will be moving in.

I'm not much of a sub. sandwich person...& I can easily pass up cold cuts/lunch meats...however...I absolutely am addicted to Mario's Italian sub sandwiches!   The best!!!!  So delicious & freshly made to order.   And they actually put meat in it!  It's not all bread w/nothing in the center.   I don't know how people eat that Subway garbage.  Disgusting.  I wish Mario's would open up a place in the Northwest burbs....I'd be there all the time.  And I'm going to order one right now & go get it after work.

DELICIOUS!!! Mario's has the best veggie sub I've ever had. All of their other subs are really great, too. They put the perfect combination of veggies and condiments and make it with a lot of care -- it's not just thrown together like a lot of other places do. I have tried many of their homemade soups, and my favorite is the cream of asparagus. They also offer hot plates which I have not tried yet, but they're homemade daily and look very good. We frequent this place when we're in the mood for a good sub.
The food is always amazing and the people that work there are always very nicce.

I came out this way to take a customer out to lunch, and man was this place excellent. I had a turkey and cheese sandwich and I LOVE when the turkey is overflowing off the sides of the sandwich. I wish I was hungrier because all of the italian stuff at the counter looked soooo delicious.
Oh Joey!  You're the perfect size sub.  If only you can give me something hot to put in you!!!

Now, I know a lot of hard-core, true-blue Italians that refuse to eat anything other than their grandmother's cooking, but Mario's has some pretty damn good food.  They make large batches of italian food to be bought in bulk or single servings.  My coworkers and I have stopped in there for their deli sandwiches and they're the shiznit.  It's like a good Turano bread that's not too dry and tough to chew through, yet not spartan like Jimmy John's bread.  Most of the time, the sub is about the bread, however with them having deli meat as well, the meat is outstandingly fresh and excellent.

I used to live and work in the area.  Our office made regular runs to Mario's and never had a single complaint.  The have the BEST sub sandwiches around, period!  They also have daily hot specials. Our favorite was the Lasagna, oh boy! My mouth is watering just remembering it. You will see 'Mario' there almost all the time.  They have catering available and a banquet/meeting room available in their modern facility.  You should have seen the old place --- half deli, half catering and half convenience store featuring Italian goods.  The place was popular that often people occupied all the open spaces waiting for their turn.  The new place is spacious and has tables if you want to sit and eat your food there.  Mario's is worth the travel if you are not fortunate enough to live near by.
We stopped in for lunch. Ordered a tostada, sopes, chicken burrito, side of beans and horchata. Everything was great except the beans.

Great owner and homemade Mexican food. I ordered a steak burrito, steak tacos (Asada), chicken quesadilla and chips/salsa. Price was $18 for all four items. Everything was made-to-order and warm when I got it home.
portion size is great, made fast and the order was correct i just found it slight bland no real flavor.

I've been there a few times, just not for me.  Food is okay, there are better Mexican restaurants/carryouts in the area.  The few times I have been there they have not been open when the sign says they are supposed to be open and calling ahead I've been told they are too busy and unable to take my order.  I don't mind bad service, but when I cannot flat out order multiple times, I gotta ask myself if the food is worth it, and in this case, it is not.

Food is sometimes good and sometimes not. THEIR CUSTOMER SERVICE SUCKS! and the employees never look happy. Also, always check your order before leaving. I ordered steak tacos, was given beef and when I called back, they said they remembered clearly I ordered beef, even after I nicely pointed out that the receipt even said steak tacos. When I went back for the corrected order,  the man yelled at me. No offer of free food, discount or apology for wasting my time or wasting my gas, to return to their restaurant to fix their mistake.
Very good Mexican food, decent prices.  Will definitely go back often.  We first tried this place a couple of months ago and love it.

Seriously the worst everything!  Don't know how a place can stay open serving crap food and service. Do yourself a favor and drive the extra mile for a better meal. It's bad when I have a taste for Mexican food and would rather eat a ketchup sandwich then to ever go back there.

This place is pretty good, went there last night and got a chicken burrito,  steak taco and a tamale all for under $9
The taco was great, a lot steak on it. The burrito was pretty good,  and it was really big. I needed to add sour cream and guacamole. But everything tasted great.  
The tamale, I was not impressed.  Very little meat. 
Other than that the staff was polite and fast. 
Glad this place is close to the house. 
If you are in the neighborhood,  stop by.
They have great selection of food.
There's not a whole lot to write about.  It's not bad it's not great it's just 'meh'.
Shotty excuse for Mexican food. Bald owner is mean as a snake.  Why bother?

El Grande burrito is your typical strip mall fast food Mexican restaurant. The menu is on large signs on the walls with virtually every type of Mexican food offered. The widescreen TV is tuned to ESPN Deportes so if you speak Spanish and like soccer you are all set. The tables are Formica with wood trim and the chairs are typical vinyl style. Counters and stool seating are on either side of the restaurant. You order and pay at the counter and if you're having horchata there is a self serve dispenser out in the dining area marked no refills please. The food is very typical of many of the fast food, order at the counter Mexican restaurants in the area. You can't go wrong with tacos and the chicken and steak are especially good. My go-to meal for dinner is the Bisteak ala Mexicana. My favorite carry out is chicken enchiladas with green sauce and my wife's favorite is the chicken nachos. El Grande Burrito is good for a quick and tasty lunch, dinner or carryout take your pick
Had a fast food feeling, but good

I went 2 this restaurant last night.  With my friend Nikki & the owner was FucKin up all the orders so bad that people were swearing @ him & calling him names. I wouldn't go back 2 that dump if u paid me 100 dollars. I give this dump 1star. If it was up 2 me I would give this dump -5 stars. I'll never go back there again

This place is a little hidden gem! I'm surprised they have not grown into a larger restaurant. We could use a larger Mexican food restaurant in SE. Great food, flavor and the people that work there are just awesome. I always get the steak taco special and my wife gets the quesadilla. Love the Mandarin soda! My only complaint is the straws are too short for the soda bottle so I push 2 together which sometimes doesn't work out too well. Sorry I had to complain about something!
the food is so good & inexpensive and the owner is always so friendly!

Tried 2 times now. Was not impressed either time. Friends say the place is great however I was less than impressed both times. Cheese enchiladas seemed reheated. Flank steak was chewy. Bill for two came to $26. Portions were a bit small I thought. Food was overall okay however I feel there are better options in the area.
Love this place.  Great for takeout and prices are very good too.  I order from here at least twice a month and have been for about 5 years.

6 STARS!

This place rocks!  Great pricing and great food.  Fast as lightning preparation too.  I live 2 blocks away.  I call in the order, grab my keys and go.  Food is ready as soon as I get there and it tastes great.  I am a regular for real.  Everytime I order I think to myself "maybe this is the time they will screw it up" but they never, ever do.  Great track record.
Very happy to see a good taco come to South Elgin.  Good price, good food. I'm sold.
I'd pretty much go on a killing rampage if this place closes. Amazing food. Awesome staff.

We were pleasantly surprised by how much we enjoyed our Gyro sandwiches from this little food oasis in Prairie Grove!

We have driven past Gianelli's many times and always thought "we should try that place sometime."  Unfortunately, it always seems out of the way when we are feeling a craving for good Chicago Style fattening foods.

Well, I am here to say that all of you others out there should not be making the same mistake that we had been making since they've opened.

We just did the drive thru, so that is the only experience that I can base my review on.  We placed our order and were greeted by a nice young dude.  We paid at the window and waited maybe 5-8 minutes (typical for a nice fresh gyro).  An older guy, who I believed to be the owner, handed us our food and was very pleasant.  The ride home (about 5 minutes) was very difficult, because the aromas coming from our piping hot bag was too much to resist. Once we had plated the food, my wife and I both devoured our tasty tasty gyros in no time. We said to each other "these are the best gyros we have in a loooong time and much better than Tommy's or anything else that is nearby!"

I'm interested in going back and trying some of the other sandwiches.  I will be sure to snap pictures and share my thoughts when I do.

Nice place. 
I had two delicious Chicago dogs - perfect, every ingredient was great quality right down to the celery salt. My nephew had the beef/sausage combo which he he loved - it was much bigger than most other places. The fries were fine, but nothing special. The place was clean and the service plenty fast but not overly friendly. Not the place where everybody knows your name.
Since my last review they changed their fries. So much better. And I discovered they have multiple Pizza puff flavors!! Service is still spectacular!
Ordered 4 gyros and two fries. And it was amazing!!! The size was generous and the owner was nice enough to give us another fries for free!! Had a great experience.

Got the Gyros through the Drive thru for a quick easy dinner after work for me and my girlfriend. I love gyros and have had them from many places all around the Chicago area. They were not the best gyros I have had but they were pretty good. Lots of meat that was cooked perfectly, fresh tomatoes and onions. They have the thick yogurt style tzatziki sauce which was decent but I do prefer the half yogurt half sourcream version. Decent fries. I also got an order of cheese sticks, which were good, basic run of the mill cheese sticks but I will say their house made "Red gravy" or marinara sauce that came with it was excellent. I plan on stopping there again and most likely will try some pasta or a meatball sandwich.
Excellent food and service! Best Beef and Vienna Hot Dog in Northwest suburbs! You must go! Very nice owner who cares about his customers!!!
Great customer service! Food reminds me of Greek place on 31 & 176. Huge helping gyros platter...it's a challenge to finish!  Been 5 times, never had a bad meal yet.

Great food been eating there weekly since they've been open! A lot of their dishes are homemade you cannot beat the quality of food for the price they offer! Simply the very best Italian beef I have ever had!

What a great place!!!! We will become regulars! The restaurant was so clean, the people working there are so pleasant, the place smells divine when you walk in the door, the owner is hands on, stopping at tables.  We ordered gyros, an italian sausage sandwich and onion rings. Gianelli's has the sausage made especially for them, and it shows, It was moist and delicious!  While speaking with the owner, who was so hands on, he was telling us he makes his Italian beef from scratch. He then brought out two mini beef sandwiches for us to taste. So darned great, unbelievably well done. Tender, well seasoned and just delicious! Seriously some of the best beef I've ever had. They make their red sauce from scratch, as well as well as their meatballs. The food is just wonderful!!! Run, don't walk and try them out, You'll love it! Support your local independent restaurant!

Have been here 3 times and have always enjoyed the food as well as the service.  Finally, someone who knows how to carve a gyro at the right thickness so as to get the best texture not all just crisp.  
The beef is outstanding and hot dogs are great.
The place is super clean and well furnished, definitely different than any sandwich/fry place I've been in.
Super glad to have Gianelli's in the area!

Went here for lunch for the first time today and have always wanted to try it because I'm always in that area working......biggest mistake ever. I ordered the Italian beef with cheese and a regular size coke and paid ten dollars for the worst Italian beef sandwich I've ever eaten. The bread wasn't toasted the meat was luke warm and not fully cooked and the mozzarella cheese was under the meat not melted at all....a friggen cold piece of cheese. Needless to say I will not be going there again and I strongly recommend doing the same.

I tried this place for the first time today.  I enjoyed my pulled pork and the fries were fresh and just right.  However my daughters cheeseburger was bland and only adequate.  Also, it was expensive for a lunch.  Over $20 for 2 people is too high for burgers and soft drinks.

We tried this place for the first time last night. The hot dogs were awesome. Poppers were also awesome. We had ordered a total of 4 but only received 3. My husband asked the guy at the counter about it, he was totally apologetic and brought us our 4th hot dog right away. Then the owner came out and made sure we got our hot dog, then brought some fruit snacks out for little one (after he asked if it was ok, which was much appreciated!). The fries were just ok as some people have said but the people there are super nice and the atmosphere is great. We will definitely go back for dogs!

You know the kind of place that just feels...right?  The tables are clean, the workers are smiling and actually look like they are happy to be at work, and you just know who the owner is because he's everywhere cleaning tables, checking orders, or even swinging by to make sure everything is to your satisfaction.

Now onto the food.

My first time at this place and I got a half beef and it was plenty enough to fill me up (but hey - I'm a chick so what can I say).  One word folks - YUM!  It was well seasoned and by that I mean it had lots of flavor.  And the tenderness?  Like butter baby, it practically melted in my mouth.

Ohhhh the calories.  I'm looking forward to my next visit because their hamburgers smelled heavenly.  I saw one on the board with grilled onions and velveeta - yep!  Velveeta folks - gotta try it.

Will be back and will bring DH this time so we can try twice as many different things on the menu.
Really good family friendly atmosphere. Husband are gianellis combo. He loved it. Cheeseburger was render and good. My 6 year old said the hot dogs were the best and he had two. We will come again!

Went when it first opened and had the Italian sausage as was recommended by the worker.   Terrible.  Mushy soggy with tasteless sauce. 

OK, I thought.   Ordered the wrong thing.  My wife stopped in for Italian beef.   Said it was plastic-y and tasteless. 

Strike 2.  

OK, I thought. I'd love a good gyros spot. Maybe the gyros.   Nope. Sister-in-law tried it. Threw it away after 2 bites. 

I want this to succeed. It's close to my house, is nicely decorated. But everything we tried was bad. 

Folks, if you can do something about your food. I'd really like to eat there.  But you have miles to go.

Worst gyro I have ever had in my life. I ordered a gyro platter. It was $2 more expensive than just the gyro sandwich. This led me to assume it came with something extra, like fries or a small salad. Nope. Just an open faced gyro sandwich in a big box. So what was the additional $2 for? I work 30 seconds down the road (literally. 30 seconds). By the time I got the food back to the office it was cold - not even lukewarm. I couldn't reheat it because the tzatziki sauce was already on the sandwich. Long story short I threw it out after a few bites. There are some pros. The staff is nice and the interior is clean. 

Working just up the road, everyone in my office was so excited for a new place to be opening up. Sadly, most of us have tried it with underwhelming results. I hope Gianelli's can get it together soon.

The tuesday pasta specials are amaaaaazing, big and affordable - and yes, the meatballs ARE that good. The chicken caesar salad is the best around, actual shaved parm even. The peach smoothie is heaven in a cup, real-fruit fresh. And i can never resist their yummy cannolis! We've been really pleased with everything we've gotten here. We visit weekly. Dare i say better than portillos? The pasta & meatballs definitely are, imo. Support a small family owned local business and check them out, youll be glad u did!
So good. The sandwiches are huge and delicious. The people are friendly. Will definitely be back.
Hot dog was just ok.  The fries however made up for anything my dog was lacking.  They were very good.  Overall it was good and I would be willing to give it another go.

2nd time coming here and I've loved it both times. I take my son here with me to visit daddy on his lunch break because he works close by and we haven't been disappointed. Great kids meal selection and great staff! Very friendly! And I love the French fries here!

Great place. Been here about a dozen times. And the food is awesome. Best Chicago hot dog anywhere. 
I will be back 
Jim
Great food! Classic Chicago dogs with all the condiments. Amazing beefs. What more do you want? The kids menu is really nice with a great variety of food. Can't wait to go back!
Chicken Caesar Pita, yum. I also recommend the Italian beef. These are great people and a nice local place, I will continue to visit them and support this local business.

Super cute and cozy environment! Great service, 3 different people checked on us throughout the meal (including the owner). I made my own creation of a "Grilled Chicken on a Pita" loaded up with grilled onions, jalape̱os, lettuce and tomato & BBQ sauce... It was awesome! Fries are delish too! We will definitely be back for more :)))
Horrible place food was bad. Cheese burger tasted old fries were not good and the cheese for the cheese fries was watered down. Did not even taste like cheese. Will never go back.

Our first time .  Food was good we had gyro, hotdog, ff, cheese sauce,  only thing we didn't  kike funnel cake but u may.   Service  rocked very friendly.   Nice inside,   should be great in warmer weather to outside seating.   We will go back. .  U should  at least try this olace 1 time

Neat little place.  Very clean and the menu is a cool chalk board painting.  Burger was really good, beef was one of the best I've had around here.  Nice people behind the counter.  Prices were good.  I don't think it's the type of place to sit around and watch a game even though they have a a big tv but I'd say it's much better than going to Portillos and feel like one of the herd

We had the corned beef special with choices of mustards and horseradish. Delicious. The meat was more moist and flavorful than at the hipster Logan Square restaurant we ate at the day before. Nice family owed business like ours. Support local and avoid corporate food.

too good not to like! finally a place that understands how to cook/cut gyros and starts with the BEST brand. best hot dog brand and super fresh toppings! ital beef and sausage are very good! ital meatball sand is homemade goodness, hot and fresh! Gianelli's is best in 50 mile radius. if you don't like this place i'm happy not to see you there. more for me! only Johnnie's and Gene and Judes in the same class!!!
I don't see why people go here when There's  a Portillos about 2 miles away

I got the prairie dog, the chili was flavorless, the cheese sauce was flavorless, and the onions were precut, from a bag and have been sitting around for hours. Bigger isn't always better, I threw it out. The Chicago dog's bun was beyond soggy, it fell half and could not be picked up. GROSS. The fries, really? How can you get those wrong? They were cheap and tasted terrible. I will never be going here again. Waste of money. This is the Chicago land area. Hotdog stands are a dime a dozen, without good ingredients and good food, it doesn't matter how nice the staff is or how charming the ambiance, people will not go back.

The burger was very dry, fries and onion were inedible, tasted of old grease. My husband said the onion rings tasted as if they were "redunked". The Italian beef and chicken sandwich were very good, very large portions. The gyro was just okay, the gyro sauce  tasted of nothing other than sour cream. I hope they make some improvements, this place has some potential.

From good to bad and everything in between. First off, when they first opened, Terry and his wife were there to greet and introduce themselves to everyone. It really is a family run business. My wife and I have been here 6 times so far and have a good idea of what is what.  Terry is very proud of his Italian "gravy" and it makes for one of the best meatball sandwiches in the area. Hot dogs are good, but nothing special. The combo beef and sausage I would like to try again, but not for the price of what I was given. A full sausage with just a couple pieces of beef and dry as hell. Unfortunately, the burger was the worst burger I have ever eaten. Got the "Mount Vesuvius" and the meat was terrible. It was dry, old, and reheated. It should have never been served to anyone. I threw half of it out. But to keep it upbeat, the Gyros do rock. Have not been back since the Mt. Vesuvius incident....hopefully just growing pains. Will try them again with an update down the road.
Very good burger. Great attentive and friendly service. Daughter had hot dog and pizza puff. She thought both were very good. We will be back.

All I have to say is wow, im not really sure where all the negative reviews are coming from , "took one bite and had to throw it out" "onions are pre-cut/from a bag" "tasteless food" . I have been here many times since they opened  and will keep coming back to support a local restaurant that has an amazing staff and great food, I have talked to the owner many of times and I know for a fact that everything comes in fresh and no the onions are not from a bag and do not come in "pre cut"  Their hot dogs and burgers are very good and my favorite thing I have had is the beefs!! They are outstanding! The restaurant is very nice inside and is kept clean and their staff is always friendly and helpful, I would highly recommend ignoring all the negative reviews and go and give this place a try, So far I have loved everything ive tried! I dont do reviews online but for this place I had to:)
My new favorite coffee shop. I travel 20 mins to get coffee here! Their iced teas are delicious too! Staff is very friendly and personable. Try their el jefe egg sandwich- it is delicious!!
I love their delicious pumpkin spice Kate's that they make with homemade pumpkin syrup!! Far better than everyones "sbux" in my opinion!

I have been here 5-6 times now so it is long past time for me to pen them a review. This place is very much a staple to those in Barrington, and after you pay a visit it is easy to see why. Why people would bother with the Starbucks located nearby when we have this place is beyond my understanding. It is located right in the heart of downtown Barrington on the corner of Cook and Station streets. "Downtown" is admittedly a bit of a parking nightmare, especially on the weekends, but the entire area is very walkable, so it is really not that big of a deal. They have a large outdoor seating area, which is a cool spot to post up and people watch while you enjoy your cup of joe. Wifi is both fast and free. The atmosphere is trendy and a tad on the pretentious side, but this is Barrington after all. Staff, on the other hand, is super friendly and inviting. 

They have all the standard coffee drinks you would expect to find, along with a specialty Latte menu that rocks! I recommend you try the "Honey Bee" which is made with local honey and lavender syrup. Yum! They have another called the "7th heaven" which has a caramel and macadamia nut flavor that similarly rocks my socks. They make all their flavoring sauces for the drinks here from scratch, which is what makes the taste so distinctive and memorable. 

Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters, located in Crystal Lake and also owned by these folks, provides all of the coffee and expresso beans for the drinks. I would describe the taste as less bitter than most (probably because it is a million times fresher since it's local) and of the light to medium bodied variety. It's really delicious but if you are used to Starbucks it will seem a tad weird when you take your first sip. 

I have managed to resist all their very delicious looking pastries that they offer up each day, so I am no help with that one, but their Panini's I have had a couple of times and they are quite good. Try out the Amarillo Chipotle with bacon (is anything with bacon bad?) and pepper jack or the Greek with Spinach and Feta.  

They do open at 6 in the mornings, which sounds like a great option to grab a cup on the way to work in the AM, but with Barrington Station right down the street for those that commute into the city, it gets crazy busy sometimes. 

Overall, this is a quaint little indie coffee shop that you should make a point to visit if you are in the area.

Cook Street coffee is a staple of Barrington. I've been going here since I was in high school, basically when the shop first opened. With it's warm and casual ambiance, this quaint coffee shop provides only the best lattes and baked goods. 

The staff is always super friendly, the coffee is always on point (especially their seasonal coffee's if you have an extra buck to spend), and most importantly, it's the best working environment. You'll find A LOT of high schoolers with their laptops and books open in the late afternoon (after the high school lets out), but a perfect space for professionals needing to be productive. Even if you need a quick morning bite, they have a full, delicious menu filled with breakfast sandwiches and paninis. 

It's more $ than you'll find at a Starbucks, but it's the price you pay for a quality (& delicious) cup of joe.

One word: Yum!

We stopped by this coffee shop in downtown Barrington yesterday after stopping at a couple local boutiques, and ordered a couple Cold Brews with some vanilla syrup. It's great coffee! 

I love the space, there sure is a lot of it: perfect for the student to hang out and study, a couple to enjoy some quiet on a date, or even for a business meeting.

It's totally clean, the staff is friendly and greets you as soon as you walk in, and the pricing isn't outrageous.

I will definitely be back!

Great coffee and great beans for taking it home. Try any of the Conciouscup coffees in a French or Aero press, wonderful! Bar drinks here are some of the best in Chicagoland and there is a nice atmosphere with unique character. Why patron a liberal corporate giant when you can support a great local business like Cook Street offering better products with kinder staff?

This is my go-to coffee shop in the Chicago suburbs. This coffee shop is the definition of local. They make their own flavored syrups, which are truly magical. 

In the winter seasons, I look forward to the salted caramel pumpkin spice latte. One of the best lattes I've EVER EVER had. The touch of crushed sea salt is sheer perfection. 

During the warmer seasons, I opt for the vanilla granita. It is a refreshing, iced espresso beverage. 

The key to their brilliance is truly their syrups. The syrups do not mask the espresso but rather enchance it.

Great Customer Service!! I mentioned my coffee last time was not good and they fixed it w/out complaining or rolling eyes. Great location on a sunny day to go outside w/your dog. 
Way better than Starbucks

BOMB. Only downside is the place is usually pretty packed so it might be difficult to find a seat. They make their own chai in house so when you walk in you're welcomed with a yummy smell of cinnamon and espresso. Every drink I've had has been awesome. The iced mocha, the iced mocha picante, and the regular iced coffee. I love all of the options and brewing methods they have. There are a few food options and usually some doughnuts available. I tried the grilled cheese with red peppers. It was good but a little pricey. But it you want coffee and a small snack I definitely recommend. The baristas have always been friendly, knowledgeable and talkative. I work for Starbucks but drive 30 minutes out of my way after work or on days off to get coffee here!

I live near here and I have to say I really love the ambiance of the place.  Exactly how a coffeehouse should feel in my book.  Excellent music selection and it is played at a perfect non-obtrusive volume.  The coffee is very good as well.  Thank God Barrington has a place like this.

I woke up this morning with a bad, bad, bad craving for scones.  And, I really did not want to trek all the way down to the city just to get one.  I figured that there *has* to be a local bakery selling a decent one.  

A quick search of Yelp directed me to Cook Street Coffee.  A local coffeehouse?  Why, yes, please!  I'm always on the hunt for great local coffeehouses.  I made sure to look at the pictures and read the reviews to confirm that they do sell these little treats.

In twenty minutes, we were at the coffeehouse, which is located in a cute downtown area by the train station.  I thought it was really funny that there is a big name coffee chain literally located a few minutes from Cook Street.  I wanted to yell at the people sipping their beverages there and tell them to go to the local chain.  I resisted the temptation though.

It was pretty packed for being 9:30 on a Sunday morning.  There were several patrons dressed in super tight, Spandex biking gear, probably refueling after a long, hard bike ride.  There were groups of people sitting outside, sipping coffee and enjoying the beautiful morning.  I also noticed that there were several families with their little tots in tow.  That's definitely a good sign.

They brew Conscious Cup Coffee, which prides itself on roasting socially and environmentally sustainable coffees.  That is another big plus in my book.  Their menu is fairly extensive, and they serve a wide array of espresso beverages and iced drinks.  I was intrigued by the caramel vanilla latte, mainly because I've never had both in the same drink.  For those that can't do dairy, they do offer soy and almond milk.  They also offer a 1% organic milk.

My beverage was amazing.  You could really taste the coffee coming through.  In addition, it wasn't overly sweet, which was my initial fear since it contained both caramel and vanilla.  I definitely would order it again.

My fianc̩ ordered a double espresso and he enjoyed the acidic taste to it.  He did have to add some sugar to it to make it a bit more palatable.  He prefers acidic espresso to the most burnt and bitter ones.

I did not leave without getting my hands on a scone. I really had to resist the urge to buy them all as there were only four left.  They offered a chocolate chip, blueberry and possibly cranberry or cherry almond.  I stopped paying attention after she said chocolate chip.  The scone was baked to perfection and had the right hard exterior and soft, crumbly insides.  Now, if only they offered it with some clotted cream and jam.  That'd make it even more prefect.

They also offer a small selection of Spunky Dunker donuts for those who don't like scones.  I couldn't resist the donuts, and a glazed chocolate cake made its way into our order.  The donut was pretty good and I really liked the chocolate glaze.  

For those not into pastries in the morning (seriously - what's wrong with you), they offer a selection of breakfast paninis and sandwiches.

Service wise, the woman who rang me up and the woman who made my drink seemed nice.  We really did not interact with them that much.  You can eat your treats outside since they do offer outdoor seating.  Unfortunately, all the tables were occupied so we sat at a bench across the way.

The only downside were that the prices were pretty high.  My 12oz drink cost 4.70 (and perhaps more since I had it with soy milk).  We spent almost $12 total.  However, I believe it was worth it.  I'd gladly spend that money and support a local business.  It's worth it.

I definitely have plans to visit in the future to try more of their coffee drinks and of course, to gorge myself on their amazing scones.  And, I'd be interested to visit their location in Crystal Lake.  Big props to Yelp for this amazing find!
Great coffee shop close to Barrington Train. I am a big fan of the vanilla/caramel latte as well as the ample seating a free wifi.

Great coffee, great customers, great location, great environment, and great staff.  This place has the best latte's you can get in the area.  I am here to do some work, and it's easy to focus.  They have a seating area brightened by the natural daylight gleaming through the windows, accented with wood to give it a cozy feel.

I feel productive and energized, exactly what I needed from my caffeine run.  Cook Street, keep up the great work!

I stumbled in here on accident because there was no parking near the starbucks.... because I'm a basic B*

I'm glad I did. Cook Street's iced coffee is almost as good as Blue Bottle iced coffee.   And being that Blue Bottle doesn't exist in the Chicago land area... I would go as far as saying they have the Best iced Coffee around.

This is my hometown coffee shop.  Love their coffee and the relaxed feeling. Since I work from home, this is my mid day get out of the office break place. After hot summer bike ride, I'll stop here for an iced Americano.

My favorite time to be here is on the weekend around 11ish when I'm confused about whether I want breakfast vs lunch.  The "Papa Ship" panini helps me fill my belly without resolving the confusion.  Two eggs, bacon, ham, and double the cheddar cheese on a ciabatta bun toasted like a panini.  #winning

my family and i were visiting friends (we drove from CT) and were told that this was the plave to get coffee. and it was.

the staff was very pleasant, the coffee was delicious, and my 4yo loved the donuts (he had 3 in 4 days we stayed in Barrington) 

sure, there's a Starbucks around the corner, but come on, GO LOCAL.
