if/when I'm (ever) in Barrington again, this will be the stop when I need some coffee or a donut for the king.

outdoor seating adds a nice ambience as well

My husband and I are always on the lookout for local independent coffee shops near us. This was about 10 minutes for us, but on our way for errands for the day.

First impression, great corner storefront in the middle of downtown Barrington.

As I was ordering my white mocha, the barista mentioned that they like to put lavender in to enhance the flavor. My husband and I were both intrigued and ordered that. We also ordered the Mediterranean and Greek breakfast sandwich. 

Our coffee and breakfast sandwiches were absolutely delicious. 

It was great weather, so we were able to sit outside and enjoy. 

We will definitely be back!
They also have great panini and donuts. Service is good too.

Excellent use of the old Caribou (I saw the bathroom signs and I know!) This shop knows how to pull a good shot and make a great espresso drink. They have homemade syrups which they use to customize the drinks which are very tasty. There is a wide selection of snacks, including donuts from Spunky Dunkers. They also have several local GF options. I tried breakfast panini on GF bread--it was very good and a rare treat. Although there seems to be plenty of seating, this place is very popular and fills up in the afternoons. The cheerful and sunny corner location certainly has something to do with that. Street parking can be an issue in downtown at times, and there is no drive through here. It didn't look like they have much in the way of outdoor seating, but it's the middle of winter...maybe they cram in a lot of tiny tables. The staff here is exceptionally cheerful and friendly. A great experience!  Too bad they aren't larger, they would use twice the footprint.
Every single time I come here, there are heaps of coffee grounds covering the bottom of the coffee cup. Staff was rude, very dismissive, and did not say hello.

I've got a latte love for Cook Street coffee. Pun intended. Their lattes are to die for. I normally need some type of sugar or syrup to add to any latte/cappuccino, but not here. They taste perfectly amazing with just the right amount of foam and flavor every time. The baristas are always so warm and welcoming! Oh, and the donuts are another fave. Basically, it doesn't get much better than Cook Street.

I don't usually buy coffee, but when I do I buy Cook Street Coffee.  

I first got suckered in a few months back when they gave out free samples of coffee and baked goods to morning commuters.  The first one's always free...
Now, when lethargy creeps up on my morning, I will stop by to get a little jolt.

It is a nice little neighborhood spot with a very friendly staff.  I take the train to work and the Barrington metra is a 3 min walk away.   So glad that they are right around the corner!   They also remodeled with more seating to just hang out to read, study, work or pretend to do any of those.

I know, this probably isn't blowing your skirt up since Barrington is Barrington... but they have a few select establishments that are worth visiting if you are in the area.  This is one of them.

This place looks great and I was excited especially when the sign said chai tea latte "made from scratch" ....except it wasn't. They use Oregon chai straight from the box. The drink tasted okay, but just don't advertise it's made from scratch if it's not. That's all I ask.

Now that I have had the scone (awesome!!!), I will put this at 5 stars.  Staff are still SUPER friendly and appeared to be working their butts off to manage the line that just wouldnt quite.  I must admit, I have now come here almost every time I have been in the area (especially over the chain that is on the same block).  
I also overheard them say that they have a kid size (like for hot chocolate)-super if I overheard correctly!

With a love for coffee and experience working at Caribou Coffee for a little I started out 2014 with the mission to visit all of the coffee shops in my area. After visiting a few, I thought why not write reviews and share my thoughts on each of them. So here we are... with out any further ado let's dive right in to my unbiased review of Cook Street Coffee. 

First I will say, I also did a review of Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters and extremely impressed. I thought it was the best it could get! The owner sent me a message on yelp thanking me for the review, and recommended I visit his other location (Cook Street Coffee)... I was shocked to see that this location was better than the last! I have reviewed dozens of coffee shops, and so far... this is the best I have ever been to!

Location & Ambiance:
Great location, and the ambiance is on par with the best of the best. The staff swiftly greeting me even though I got there only minutes after they opened. 

Coffee:
Well it is a coffee shop, so lets talk about the quality of my cup of coffee! First, take a look at some of the pictures I posted! The coffee looks great, and tastes even better! I got a small latte, and it tasted great! The milk was not burnt, the espresso was brewed correctly, and once again the staff was amazing! They recommended different drinks knew the ins and outs of coffee. 

Food:
I got there just after they opened and the increasable staff recommended that I try a scone! They had just been taken out of the oven so I tried the almond scone as well as the chocolate scone. Both were amazing, and complimented the great latte I was sipping on. 

Staff:
The staff, as I have mentioned throughout this review, it is by far the best staff I have even seen in a coffee shop. The other location, Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters, has a great staff as well but nothing compares to the experience I had at Cook Street Coffee! Its a 30 minute drive for me, and I will definitely be going back again!

Overall, I can definitely say this is the best coffee shop I have even been to. It redefines how I will be rating coffee shops in the future. Its a must try if you are in the area, and if you aren't near by its worth the drive!
As a hipster I love cook street coffee. When I come here for my usual coffee I feel the MOST hipster. Love cook street coffee and its vibes.

Awesome! The white mocha was delicious probably the best I've had in the area they also offer organic 1% milk for your drink which I can't find anywhere! This is the best coffee house I've been to in the area since we moved here and I'll definitely be returning! They also offer donuts from the local spunky Dunkers which looked awesome, I had the breakfast sandwich (the usual bacon egg and cheese) it was delicious and they even offer on 9 grain bread so good def my new favorite coffee place :)

I am a coffee addict, and I'm not talking about plain old brewed coffee.  I like all the syrups and extra calories!  So when it comes to mixed coffee drinks, I am a huge fan of Cook Street Coffee.  Their syrups are homemade, and the flavor of the espresso is rich and delicious.  They use compostable cups, which should be standard these days.  My only complaint is how tiny the place is.  It's hard to find a place to sit, so I pretty much order my coffee to-go every time even when I'd like to hang out.  Besides that small detail, I think all coffee shops should model themselves against Cook Street.

My favorite caf̩ to go to in the morning! I absolutely love their coffee and breakfast foods to eat. Their donuts are fresh from Spunky Dunkers which is perfect! It's a great place to study, read a book, have a coffee date with a friend... You get my point! Definitely would recommend!

This is the best!
We drive from Schaumburg to get the best. Words cannot describe the value found with the product these folks create. 
Please open one in the Roselle area.

A Suburban indie coffee shop that's sure to warm the cockles of your heart. 

Locally owned and serving locally roasted coffee is just one reason you should check out CSC. The atmosphere is friendly (as I learned when an older man played an impromptu game of 20 questions w/ me while I tried to work), warm, inviting, and upscale... at least in comparison to most indie coffee digs.
 
They have a frequent  customer card and a few week days even have specials. Their hours are, erm... they okay, yo. Only open till 6 during the week and 5 on the weekend, but I'm not from around the area so maybe that works for them. I had gotten there around 4:30 on Tuesday and defo could have stayed past 6. There are plenty of outlets for laptopping and lots of table, booth, and bar space to meet up with friends or sip solo style.

I got one of their seasonal pumpkin chai lattes with soy and it was really good, but a LOT sweeter than I thought it'd be. Also, pretty pricey at almost $6 but I guess I don't mind paying a bit extra knowing I'm supporting the local flavor.

I think I found my new favorite coffee spot. The coffee and food were delicious. Perfect for a good read or if you're looking to get some work done. They played City and Colour and The Shins the whole time I was there. My only complaint was that it seemed like it took 10 minutes for my coffee to be made.
Best coffee in the area. Great sandwiches with gluten free options!  Old fashioned donuts and hot cocoa perfect for kids!

This is what a coffee shop should be...friendly, warm, comfortable, and accommodating.  The scones and croissants are delicious and best of all baked fresh every morning. Get there when it opens so you can enjoy a warm raspberry white chocolate scone or a Nutella croissant.  The coffee is great and the attention to presentation is wonderful.  Check the pictures. My favorite morning hangout place in the suburbs!

As the sign says, friends don't let friends drink corporate coffee. This place is a great alternative.

Try a granita, which is comparable to a frappucino but with more rich coffee flavor. The hot cider is well-spiced and even better with a dash of caramel. Better still, their flavorful brews are local and sustainable. Hippie high five!
 
The baked goods are just ok. I might try another muffin here, but then again, I might not.

The staff is helpful, there's plenty of room at the larger tables to spread out and work if you like, and the people-watching is great. It seems all of the Barrington area's most eccentric characters get their beverages here, and some bring their dogs, too! Don't forget to check out the art (also local, and available for purchase) on the walls.

I really wanted to like this place. Ordered a cup of black coffee, and unfortunately it was under roasted, producing a strange vegetal flavor. Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich was OK, about on par with something from Panera. Prices were high in my estimation. The place was uncomfortably crowded on a Saturday morning, which is to be expected, but it certainly prompted me to take my breakfast to go. I might give it another try, though.

Great full-service cafe in downtown Barrington.  

I always prefer to patronize independents instead of a gereric and ubiquitous Sbux.  Cook Street makes it really easy to do.  They are on the same street as a Sbux, so you just walk past the Sbux and walk into Cook Street!

Love love love this coffee shop! Nice and cozy and friendly service. The soy lattes are pretty decent! The second best cup I've ever had at a coffee shop, although it's really foamy and frothy unless you're into that. Prices are reasonable as well. 

WAYY better than Starbucks. Support local businesses! :)
Every single time I come here, there are heaps of coffee grounds covering the bottom of the coffee cup. Staff was rude, very dismissive, and did not say hello.

I've got a latte love for Cook Street coffee. Pun intended. Their lattes are to die for. I normally need some type of sugar or syrup to add to any latte/cappuccino, but not here. They taste perfectly amazing with just the right amount of foam and flavor every time. The baristas are always so warm and welcoming! Oh, and the donuts are another fave. Basically, it doesn't get much better than Cook Street.

I don't usually buy coffee, but when I do I buy Cook Street Coffee.  

I first got suckered in a few months back when they gave out free samples of coffee and baked goods to morning commuters.  The first one's always free...
Now, when lethargy creeps up on my morning, I will stop by to get a little jolt.

It is a nice little neighborhood spot with a very friendly staff.  I take the train to work and the Barrington metra is a 3 min walk away.   So glad that they are right around the corner!   They also remodeled with more seating to just hang out to read, study, work or pretend to do any of those.

I know, this probably isn't blowing your skirt up since Barrington is Barrington... but they have a few select establishments that are worth visiting if you are in the area.  This is one of them.

This place looks great and I was excited especially when the sign said chai tea latte "made from scratch" ....except it wasn't. They use Oregon chai straight from the box. The drink tasted okay, but just don't advertise it's made from scratch if it's not. That's all I ask.

Now that I have had the scone (awesome!!!), I will put this at 5 stars.  Staff are still SUPER friendly and appeared to be working their butts off to manage the line that just wouldnt quite.  I must admit, I have now come here almost every time I have been in the area (especially over the chain that is on the same block).  
I also overheard them say that they have a kid size (like for hot chocolate)-super if I overheard correctly!

With a love for coffee and experience working at Caribou Coffee for a little I started out 2014 with the mission to visit all of the coffee shops in my area. After visiting a few, I thought why not write reviews and share my thoughts on each of them. So here we are... with out any further ado let's dive right in to my unbiased review of Cook Street Coffee. 

First I will say, I also did a review of Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters and extremely impressed. I thought it was the best it could get! The owner sent me a message on yelp thanking me for the review, and recommended I visit his other location (Cook Street Coffee)... I was shocked to see that this location was better than the last! I have reviewed dozens of coffee shops, and so far... this is the best I have ever been to!

Location & Ambiance:
Great location, and the ambiance is on par with the best of the best. The staff swiftly greeting me even though I got there only minutes after they opened. 

Coffee:
Well it is a coffee shop, so lets talk about the quality of my cup of coffee! First, take a look at some of the pictures I posted! The coffee looks great, and tastes even better! I got a small latte, and it tasted great! The milk was not burnt, the espresso was brewed correctly, and once again the staff was amazing! They recommended different drinks knew the ins and outs of coffee. 

Food:
I got there just after they opened and the increasable staff recommended that I try a scone! They had just been taken out of the oven so I tried the almond scone as well as the chocolate scone. Both were amazing, and complimented the great latte I was sipping on. 

Staff:
The staff, as I have mentioned throughout this review, it is by far the best staff I have even seen in a coffee shop. The other location, Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters, has a great staff as well but nothing compares to the experience I had at Cook Street Coffee! Its a 30 minute drive for me, and I will definitely be going back again!

Overall, I can definitely say this is the best coffee shop I have even been to. It redefines how I will be rating coffee shops in the future. Its a must try if you are in the area, and if you aren't near by its worth the drive!
As a hipster I love cook street coffee. When I come here for my usual coffee I feel the MOST hipster. Love cook street coffee and its vibes.

Awesome! The white mocha was delicious probably the best I've had in the area they also offer organic 1% milk for your drink which I can't find anywhere! This is the best coffee house I've been to in the area since we moved here and I'll definitely be returning! They also offer donuts from the local spunky Dunkers which looked awesome, I had the breakfast sandwich (the usual bacon egg and cheese) it was delicious and they even offer on 9 grain bread so good def my new favorite coffee place :)

I am a coffee addict, and I'm not talking about plain old brewed coffee.  I like all the syrups and extra calories!  So when it comes to mixed coffee drinks, I am a huge fan of Cook Street Coffee.  Their syrups are homemade, and the flavor of the espresso is rich and delicious.  They use compostable cups, which should be standard these days.  My only complaint is how tiny the place is.  It's hard to find a place to sit, so I pretty much order my coffee to-go every time even when I'd like to hang out.  Besides that small detail, I think all coffee shops should model themselves against Cook Street.

My favorite caf̩ to go to in the morning! I absolutely love their coffee and breakfast foods to eat. Their donuts are fresh from Spunky Dunkers which is perfect! It's a great place to study, read a book, have a coffee date with a friend... You get my point! Definitely would recommend!

This is the best!
We drive from Schaumburg to get the best. Words cannot describe the value found with the product these folks create. 
Please open one in the Roselle area.

A Suburban indie coffee shop that's sure to warm the cockles of your heart. 

Locally owned and serving locally roasted coffee is just one reason you should check out CSC. The atmosphere is friendly (as I learned when an older man played an impromptu game of 20 questions w/ me while I tried to work), warm, inviting, and upscale... at least in comparison to most indie coffee digs.
 
They have a frequent  customer card and a few week days even have specials. Their hours are, erm... they okay, yo. Only open till 6 during the week and 5 on the weekend, but I'm not from around the area so maybe that works for them. I had gotten there around 4:30 on Tuesday and defo could have stayed past 6. There are plenty of outlets for laptopping and lots of table, booth, and bar space to meet up with friends or sip solo style.

I got one of their seasonal pumpkin chai lattes with soy and it was really good, but a LOT sweeter than I thought it'd be. Also, pretty pricey at almost $6 but I guess I don't mind paying a bit extra knowing I'm supporting the local flavor.

I think I found my new favorite coffee spot. The coffee and food were delicious. Perfect for a good read or if you're looking to get some work done. They played City and Colour and The Shins the whole time I was there. My only complaint was that it seemed like it took 10 minutes for my coffee to be made.
Best coffee in the area. Great sandwiches with gluten free options!  Old fashioned donuts and hot cocoa perfect for kids!

My favorite morning hangout place in the suburbs!

Try a granita, which is comparable to a frappucino but with more rich coffee flavor. The hot cider is well-spiced and even better with a dash of caramel. Better still, their flavorful brews are local and sustainable. Hippie high five!
 
The baked goods are just ok. I might try another muffin here, but then again, I might not.

The staff is helpful, there's plenty of room at the larger tables to spread out and work if you like, and the people-watching is great. It seems all of the Barrington area's most eccentric characters get their beverages here, and some bring their dogs, too! Don't forget to check out the art (also local, and available for purchase) on the walls.

I really wanted to like this place. Ordered a cup of black coffee, and unfortunately it was under roasted, producing a strange vegetal flavor. Bacon, egg and cheese sandwich was OK, about on par with something from Panera. Prices were high in my estimation. The place was uncomfortably crowded on a Saturday morning, which is to be expected, but it certainly prompted me to take my breakfast to go. I might give it another try, though.

Great full-service cafe in downtown Barrington.  

I always prefer to patronize independents instead of a gereric and ubiquitous Sbux.  Cook Street makes it really easy to do.  They are on the same street as a Sbux, so you just walk past the Sbux and walk into Cook Street!

Love love love this coffee shop! Nice and cozy and friendly service. The soy lattes are pretty decent! The second best cup I've ever had at a coffee shop, although it's really foamy and frothy unless you're into that. Prices are reasonable as well. 

WAYY better than Starbucks. Support local businesses! :)

Hours M-F 6a-6p
Sat 7-5
Sun 7-4

Stopped in with the wife over the July 4th weekend about an hour before close.Only one person appeared to be working and was a little worse for wear but rose to the occasion. Had a mocha and the wife a tea. Both were great. The atmosphere was relaxing, music low key and we could actually carry on a conversation. There was ample seating for maybe 40. The d̩cor was tasteful and internet uninterrupted.

I think it also begs to mention that they offer grounds for composting and the solo-cops are actually compostable...so they go the extra mile to do a little bit for the planet. I wish they were open later...maybe just one day a week.....as an alternative to the conglomerate down the street. We'd travel the distance

My friend just moved to Barrington from Massachusetts.  I found Cook Street on the internet and called up to see if I could order her a gift certificate remotely and have it sent to her.  Jamie was so helpful! I hope to visit Cook Street Coffee when I make it to Barrington.

"Good people Great Coffee" is the motto and they are spot on.  Two great brews daily along with a great cappuccino bar.  Always something good to try.  If you don't know what you want the friendly and knowledgable staff are there to help you navigate.  Truly a great coffee experience.

I just stumbled across this place the other day. I was actually walking to Starbucks and walked in front of this place and thought...hey why not! I only ordered a blended coffee, which was delicious! So glad I went in. Very cute local coffee shop. Staff was really nice prices were good. Definitely need to go back and try more stuff.

A nice place. They had good coffee drinks and other fun stuff like matechinos. Very nice staff and a good atmosphere all around. Plus fast free wifi.

Why go to Starbucks down the road when these guys are better and local. Check it out.

I met a friend here for coffee late in the morning the other day and was not disappointed.  I would much rather support a local business than give my money to Starbucks, which isn't all that great anyway.

Since it was March I had an Irish latte and it was quite yummy.  As an added perk the barista even added an extra shot free of charge.  My beverage was very good, as was the apple cake I had - dense, sweet and delicious.  It was so filling I didn't even have lunch that day!

The staff was quite upbeat and friendly and there are plenty of tables and regular chairs around.  The only downside is there are only a few comfy chairs to relax in while you enjoy your delicious coffee.

I really love this coffee shop. Last time we came in a large group and all ordered different items. From their basic cup of coffee to cappuccino to mochas to tea - all a great choice, rich and delicious. 

They also have great pastries. Even by the afternoon, they have a good selection that tastes and looks fresh (which is surprisingly so uncommon!)

We happened to stop here after browsing the downtown area in Barrington. The usual  'go-to' Starbucks was at then end of the block, but thought we'd try Cook Street out instead.  What a treat! They had some great flavors and everyone with us enjoyed the coffee and the atmosphere.  We tried a Cherry Mocha, Americano and one of the house blends.  Great to see some unique independent shops out there. If your in the area, make sure you check it out.

Delicious matte. There is a gentlemen I spoke with briefly who I will assume is a manager and he was just a genuinely nice person. He really enhanced my visit and made me happy that there are some newer local spots becoming staples in my hometown.

My go to for coffee!  I love the fact that they use punch cards! They have amazing pastries..which are in house made! Nutella croissant is my fave. They started making sandwiches and paninis, which I've yet to try.  But I always stop in a couple times of month to get my caffeine fix.

I have been in here four times when I am in the area for work.  Staff was friendly, professional, and I have to say...pretty damn cool.  They support local artists and are green with thier cups and products.  The inside was clean, free wifi, good chai tea.  The outside area is spacious and the inside area is bustling with activity every time I went.

SO EXCITED!! Every Sunday we drive to Barrington to have breakfast but this morning we felt like a real good cappuccino. We googled best coffee houses and were prepared to venture to the city, just to get a great coffee. We've become so complacent in our coffee experience. I call it an experience because there is NOTHING like a good cappuccino, expresso, or just a cup of coffee. To our surprise we saw great reviews for a place called Cook Street Coffee in Barrington. We've seen it a million times but just assumed it was another want to be coffee establishment. 
We decided to try it, with high hopes that it would be what we were looking for. How nice it would be to have something so close to us. 
Not only did it exceed our expectation on their cappuccino and expressos but their breakfast sandwiches were delicious too. 
The barista (owner?) was there and spent time talking to us and informing us that they roast their own beans. We told him we were interested in purchasing a home machine and he couldn't be more helpful. Giving us his business card to call him with any questions. 
It was a very friendly and inviting environment with outdoor seating too. It is now our new breakfast spot.I'm only upset that I have spent all these years going to the chain coffee houses when this one was so close!

My favorite coffee shop in the northwest suburbs.  Great vibe! Comfortable!  Food items I have tried are good.  Every drink in have had excellent.  Wish it was larger so a group of people could meet for book club etc but then it might lose some of its 'feel.'

I can't be entirely sure, but this place looks like a converted Caribou Coffee on the inside. If so, they're clearly doing much better. The place has been pretty jumping almost the entire time I've been here. For good reason. They have great drinks and baked goods. I had a vanilla latte and pumpkin bread and loved them both. And they seem to do well despite a Starbucks four doors down.

I discovered this non-chain coffee shop through Yelp just this morning.

I was quite dismayed as I approached Station heading north on Hough because on the corner is a Starbucks!  I thought for a few moments that this place had been bought out.  I turned on to Station anyway and was pleasantly surprised to find the shop IS there, just a few doors down.  It's still frighteningly close to "that other place".  I hope they survive and thrive despite that!

I was very pleased with both my purchase and the service!!  I got a pumpkin bar- it was yummy with a flaky crust and I got a soy chai latte- it had the perfect amount of froth which I wasn't expecting.  I LOVE froth! 

I'll definitely go back.

Love this spot.

I was immediately reminded of my days of yore working at Lake Zurich's Custom Cup (it's now the drive-thru Starbizzle). A very similar vibe with a lovely, neighborhood feel. Independently owned, family run, local product, great service and wonderful coffee. 

One of the best, foamiest, smoothest cappuccino's I've had in some time. Bravo, Cook Street Coffee, Bravo!

Support local. Java up here!
Favorite local coffee spot.  Staff is friendly.  Good ambient music.  Cozy.  :Coffee variety changes every day.  Great place for a cup of coffee and conversation or work.

I like this place!  Cute little coffee shop. Not all coffee shops are created equally and this places is way better than their competition down the street.  Baristas kinda have an attitude but don't they all?   I was surprised at the prices! Not too bad at all!   Points were deducted due to attitude,  not bad, just blah...

An extremely lively place, full of energy with fabulous coffee from Conscious Cup in Crystal Lake. I'm pretty sure they manage this place as well as I see some of the same baristas. 
Ambiance is more cozy, as it is smaller than Conscious Cup. Shaped in an L, the area in front of the counter is generally where it is louder. Back of the place is quieter and there is a nook where one can have a quiet group meeting.
Like this place a lot and highly recommend it. Their granola-honey bars are amazing!

Extremely disappointed with the service here. The girl with the blue hair behind the counter clearly noticed there was someone waiting in line to order and continued to chat with her friends. After waiting in line for 5 minutes I decided to interrupt their conversation to order my small coffee. I should have left. 
Blue-haired girl took my money and handed me my coffee all while continuing conversation with her friend.
So basically I should have just walked the extra few steps and gone to Starbucks down the street. Won't be returning to Cook Street Coffee anytime soon.  
I would give this place zero stars if it were an option.

My friend just moved to Barrington from Massachusetts.  I found Cook Street on the internet and called up to see if I could order her a gift certificate remotely and have it sent to her.  Jamie was so helpful! I hope to visit Cook Street Coffee when I make it to Barrington.

After waiting in line for 5 minutes I decided to interrupt their conversation to order my small coffee. I should have left. 
Blue-haired girl took my money and handed me my coffee all while continuing conversation with her friend.
So basically I should have just walked the extra few steps and gone to Starbucks down the street. Won't be returning to Cook Street Coffee anytime soon.  
I would give this place zero stars if it were an option.

Maybe i am spoiled...okay that is not a maybe.

I have had soooo much good coffee(eww and bad coffee) that i feel my heart should have quit ages ago.

I read the reviews and was pumped to go to CSC.  I get there and ask if they have food(website sure said they do)... the girl gives me a look like I had walked in without clothes; she responds "We don't have food,  we have some pastries"  

did you ever have food? did you run out? why does your website say you have food? Why can't you give me something to work with? 

I can already tell you have pastries! ughhhh

i was like F* the food, lets move onto a latte. 

I got it and booed so loud in my head that it might have gone telepathic.
(specifics: it was closer to a cappuccino, milk was too hot, and only a distorted taste of coffee could be tasted through the congestion of milk)

Maybe the girl was only partially trained on the machine along with being half trained with communication. I hate to write a place off, but with the distance from where i am to barrington, i would only go back if i had been impressed. 

If i am ever in the area I will give them another shot,  or rather let them give me another shot.

but only then.

This is my new favorite coffee shop. It's a bit of a drive from my house but worth it.

I'm rarely in Barrington but there was a store I wanted to check out so I was there early one morning... Of course the store was closed (I'm really good at that). 

I skipped breakfast in order to get to Barrington early so I figured I'd stop at the Starbucks right down the street and read for a few hours.
I parked my car, got out, and began walking towards Starbucks when I saw a sign that said "Coffee". 

Discovering cafes and bakeries really gets me excited. Choosing local over chain was an easy decision. 

Cook Street Coffee is a nice sized space with plenty of seating, free wi-fi, huge windows, and great lighting. It's really warm and inviting.

Their display case is filled with awesome treats from local sources. Cookies, cakes, granola, pies, and more. I had a slice of apple-peach pie. It was so good that I went back there the next day and got another.
Of course the main reason to go is for the coffee. On both days I got espresso drinks and their shots are pulled perfectly--the beans don't taste burned, the shots are not bitter, and everything is nicely balanced (syrup, milk, etc).

On both days I was able to spend a good amount of time reading and enjoying the ambiance. The crowd is really diverse and interesting. It's really everything I could want... except that it's not close enough to me. =)

The coffee is amazing!

I had an iced mocha and it was the best I've had in a long time. Much better than Starbucks or Caribou. Prices are comparable to Starbucks and Caribou. 

It also does not have an overpowering coffee smell so even if you stop by before work, you won't smell like a coffee house. 

The staff was really friendly and the building is really clean. 

If you're in Barrington, GO HERE!

A true town coffee shop. buzzing with energy and community. amazing fair trade coffee & a wonderful environment! [with free internet]. its a pretty decent size so you won't feel cramped, but you'll feel like you're in the mix and well loved. 

the baristas are friendly and warm - open to conversation. if you frequent there - you'll have a fast friend.  -- simply a good place all around. 

starbucks is on the opposite end of the block.. and this place is booming with people all the time.  so that must say something. .. =] 

if you're ever in the area - or live in Barrington,  check out Cook St. -- you'll love it!

A coffee shop like this has been missing from Barrington for years.  I'm so happy Cook St. Coffee has filled that void.  It has a very warm and cozy atmosphere.  It has a great neighborhood feel and good coffee.  Forget the Starbucks around the corner.  Cook St. Coffee is the place to be.  I just wish they had more seating and more outlets.  It's hard to find a place to sit and plug in a laptop, which is a coffee shop essential.

On to the specifics of the coffee itself!  They roast their own beans, and they are good at it.  The flavor of the coffee is far superior to anywhere else I've been.  They also make their own flavor syrups, and they are all-natural!  This is so rare in the coffee shop industry.  Most syrups are brand-name and full of preservatives and high-fructose corn syrup.  They offer various seasonal syrups too (lavender, pumpkin spice, peppermint, etc.).  I haven't had one I don't like.

Cheers!
Best coffee in northwest suburbs. WAY better than Starbucks. Espresso is very smooth. They also have free wifi.

My first trip here was a success. On a Sunday afternoon it was surprisingly crowded with people just "chilling." A mix of older people and high schoolers mainly. While I didn't try the coffee, they had a great selection of tea and I had the green tea with mango which was delish. It's cute inside and my friend and I lucked out by scoring the big leather chairs. One thing I loved is the paintings all over the shop with scenes of Chicago- they are for sale. Also I've heard a local artist does the window art. Go here over Starbuck's I'd say.
nice espresso and treats are pretty tasty too

If you like coffee, you must try this place.
I had forgotten what real espresso tasted like! Most coffee shops have switched over to automated espresso machines (the machine does all the work) because they are easier for the employees to operate...but not Cook Street. They hand pull all of their espresso shots, and that combined with their special fair trade beans produces a delicious, creamy, smooth shot of espresso for your latte or mocha.
The staff is primarily young people (20-30's), but they are friendly and take pride in working for a independently owned coffee shop (which you dont see much of anymore). The wait is usually a bit longer than other places especially if they ate busy, so give yourself extra time if youre in a hurry. Well worth the wait.

FORGET Starbucks, please.  Go to this place and taste real coffee.  Having lived in Australia and having drunk real coffee for two years - only to come back and taste the horrible after-taste you get in a cup of joe at Starbucks, I was desperate.  Now, I'm HAPPY!
I come here when Im craving a rich, dark espresso on a dreary morning and need a little extra pep in my step. Which is pretty often. I'll take this place any day over Starbucks...this is REAL coffee.

Amazing coffee.  Best taste of real natural coffee.  Love the atmosphere and people.  Great location.  

Since I worked for the local roasters I know how genuine the coffee is here.  Awesome.

I love local coffee shops and this place is great.  They serve conscious cup coffee which is roasted at the store and tastes great, not burnt like some other places.  The pastries are delicious - especially the scones!

I love this place! Whenever I'm heading back into the city I stop by and get a latte. I also know of a friend who is obsessed and does a lot of his from-home work here. I go to Starbucks a lot in the city where I go to school and it just isn't the same. I've always had the best service and everything is very clean and tidy. The best part, it isn't overpriced and they encourage you to hang around and chill for a while. Sometimes Starbucks is too cluttered and pushy, I always feel like they are trying to push you out. I never thought I would be yelping a coffee house but this place is amazing!

I love this place! The staff seems very knowledge as they are friendly. One can enjoy a nice cup of locally roasted coffee (try the Guatamala, roasted by Conscience Cup in Crystal Lake; organic and fair trade certified!). The atmosphere is relaxed compared to the crowded chains. Don't get me wrong, it can get crowded; probably because more people are discovering just how special Cook St. Coffee really is.

I have to agree with Richard B in that Cook Street is my new favorite coffee place.  Not only do they make a great mocha, but the price is good ($4 compared to $4.50 at Starbucks) and the shop is clean, spacious and nice to hang out in.  Their drinks themselves are as good as any "mom and pop" store I've been too, let alone the "chains".  Ever get a "bad mix" where the top is all espresso shot and the bottom all chocolate?!?  Not here.  Coffee is full of flavor.  Staff is very friendly.  I've learned the way to tell your espresso-base drink will be good is when they don't even offer you the chance to put on whip-cream.

First time I visited Cook Street was for a meeting during the holidays and I love the mocha I got. Every time I head into Barrington I give myself some extra time to stop on in. Great break from Starbucks.

I love Cook Street Coffee. It's so cozy but really open because all the walls have floor to ceiling windows. Great for people watching! Of course I love supporting local business as well. Great for meetings with a group, catching up with a friend or two, or just popping in to read the paper. The food and coffee are wonderful!
The people working here are very friendly. Nice atmosphere. The only reason it doesn't score 5 stars is cause it closes at 6.

I visited Cook Street cafe for the first time after moving to Barrington.  I went there to do some work.  I enjoyed the layout and the big windows.  I ordered a mate latte (dirty). I love mate so I thought, "why not?"  It wasn't what I expected and I wanted to be a big girl and suck it up and drink it.  I couldn't.  I went up the  counter and said it was not very enjoyable and full expected to pay for another latte.  I was pleasantly surprised that the woman made me another drink free of charge. She seemed a little hesitant though but did it anyway.  I will go back in the future since it's a good place to get some work done.

This is my new favorite coffee shop. It's a bit of a drive from my house but worth it.

I'm rarely in Barrington but there was a store I wanted to check out so I was there early one morning... Of course the store was closed (I'm really good at that). 

I skipped breakfast in order to get to Barrington early so I figured I'd stop at the Starbucks right down the street and read for a few hours.
I parked my car, got out, and began walking towards Starbucks when I saw a sign that said "Coffee". 

Discovering cafes and bakeries really gets me excited. Choosing local over chain was an easy decision. 

Cook Street Coffee is a nice sized space with plenty of seating, free wi-fi, huge windows, and great lighting. It's really warm and inviting.

Their display case is filled with awesome treats from local sources. Cookies, cakes, granola, pies, and more. I had a slice of apple-peach pie. It was so good that I went back there the next day and got another.
Of course the main reason to go is for the coffee. On both days I got espresso drinks and their shots are pulled perfectly--the beans don't taste burned, the shots are not bitter, and everything is nicely balanced (syrup, milk, etc).

On both days I was able to spend a good amount of time reading and enjoying the ambiance. The crowd is really diverse and interesting. It's really everything I could want... except that it's not close enough to me. =)

The coffee is amazing!

I had an iced mocha and it was the best I've had in a long time. Much better than Starbucks or Caribou. Prices are comparable to Starbucks and Caribou. 

It also does not have an overpowering coffee smell so even if you stop by before work, you won't smell like a coffee house. 

The staff was really friendly and the building is really clean. 

If you're in Barrington, GO HERE!

A true town coffee shop. buzzing with energy and community. amazing fair trade coffee & a wonderful environment! [with free internet]. its a pretty decent size so you won't feel cramped, but you'll feel like you're in the mix and well loved. 

the baristas are friendly and warm - open to conversation. if you frequent there - you'll have a fast friend.  -- simply a good place all around. 

starbucks is on the opposite end of the block.. and this place is booming with people all the time.  so that must say something. .. =] 

if you're ever in the area - or live in Barrington,  check out Cook St. -- you'll love it!

A coffee shop like this has been missing from Barrington for years.  I'm so happy Cook St. Coffee has filled that void.  It has a very warm and cozy atmosphere.  It has a great neighborhood feel and good coffee.  Forget the Starbucks around the corner.  Cook St. Coffee is the place to be.  I just wish they had more seating and more outlets. They also make their own flavor syrups, and they are all-natural!  This is so rare in the coffee shop industry.  Most syrups are brand-name and full of preservatives and high-fructose corn syrup.  They offer various seasonal syrups too (lavender, pumpkin spice, peppermint, etc.).  I haven't had one I don't like.

Cheers!

It's cute inside and my friend and I lucked out by scoring the big leather chairs. One thing I loved is the paintings all over the shop with scenes of Chicago- they are for sale. Also I've heard a local artist does the window art. Go here over Starbuck's I'd say.

I come here when Im craving a rich, dark espresso on a dreary morning and need a little extra pep in my step. Which is pretty often. I'll take this place any day over Starbucks...this is REAL coffee.

Amazing coffee.  Best taste of real natural coffee.  Love the atmosphere and people.  Great location.  

Since I worked for the local roasters I know how genuine the coffee is here.  Awesome.

I love local coffee shops and this place is great.  They serve conscious cup coffee which is roasted at the store and tastes great, not burnt like some other places.  The pastries are delicious - especially the scones!

I love this place! Whenever I'm heading back into the city I stop by and get a latte. I also know of a friend who is obsessed and does a lot of his from-home work here. I go to Starbucks a lot in the city where I go to school and it just isn't the same. I've always had the best service and everything is very clean and tidy. The best part, it isn't overpriced and they encourage you to hang around and chill for a while. Sometimes Starbucks is too cluttered and pushy, I always feel like they are trying to push you out. Great for meetings with a group, catching up with a friend or two, or just popping in to read the paper. The food and coffee are wonderful!
The people working here are very friendly. Nice atmosphere. The only reason it doesn't score 5 stars is cause it closes at 6.

I love mate so I thought, "why not?"  It wasn't what I expected and I wanted to be a big girl and suck it up and drink it.  I couldn't.  I went up the  counter and said it was not very enjoyable and full expected to pay for another latte.  I was pleasantly surprised that the woman made me another drink free of charge. She seemed a little hesitant though but did it anyway.  I will go back in the future since it's a good place to get some work done.

They really do need a bigger restaurant! Can't wait until the new location is finished.
The people behind the counter are ALWAYS nice!!!! That goes such a long way and is truly what is missing at a lot of restaurants! 

Another lovely lunch there again today. I brought my sister and mom in for a nice bite, they were totally happy with their food!

Order the bruschetta! 

Thank you for being consistent with quality, freshness and friendliness! :)

We've been waiting to order from here ever since we moved to the area, and tonight we finally did!  The pizza was really good.  We got a thin crust cheese and pepperoni.  We tried an order of buffalo blue cheese fries, but they weren't as good.  The Italian beef was delicious, and very juicy.
Every time I have gone to pick up a pizza, I had to wait.  Last time was an extra 20 minutes after said pick up time.
Fabulous!!   Great authentic Italian food. Everything I've ever had was delicious.  Can't wait for the new location to open for a full service dining restaurant.

Pretty legit pizza. Welp, I can't quite claim that I'm a pizza connoisseur by any means but I've tried plenty of pizza in Chicago so I consider myself to be pretty good at judging good pizza.

Came here & got a large pizza this past Sunday to take to a friend's house for the football games. Took them the average amount of time, 20-30 minutes for a large pizza. The staff, including the owner, was pretty friendly. They even included plates & napkins.

Let's move on to the most important part, TASTE! Off jump, they had a nice amount of cheese to add a nice gooeyness (don't think that's a word lol). The crust was not uncomfortably thin like New York pizza. Sauce, while not the best I've had, got the job done. Overall, good spot for a quick local pizza.

Friends and i stopped in here after a wine tasting at Lynfred just down the road. We thought this was a sit down place, but it is definitely more of a place to order take out or delivery. So, not a great vibe if you eat in.

We ordered pizza and cheese fries. The pizza was pretty good, but the fries were just OK. It was clear they were frozen and fried. One of my friends ordered a sandwich and she said it was fine. Nothing wrong with it, but nothing exceptional either.

Overall, the experience was just OK. I would order a pizza from here again if I was nearby, but I definitely wouldn't eat in again.

I looked at reviews and decided to order from them. Ordered multiple items for delivery: Thin-Crust Pepperoni Pizza, Chopped Salad, and Soup. The presentation of the food was unreal especially for a delivery place. All of the food was fresh and very good. 

The best portion of the whole meal was the Thin Crust Pizza. We requested it extra crispy and it was cooked to perfection. I eat pizza 1-2 weekly from all different pizza places. Hands down best thin crust pizza I have had in the Chicago area. 

Will order from again in near future and highly recommend!

I've ordered their pizza for the past few years and definitely a fan.  It pains me to write a slightly less than positive review, but we continually have an issue with their pizza and despite always mentioning this to the staff nothing ever changes.  The issue is that we love garlic.  We always order garlic on our pizza. Unfortunately when we get the pizza, everything else is great, but you can't taste any garlic!!!  I don't know what the issue is, if they aren't putting enough on, or forget to put it on, but I've never ordered pizza with garlic from a pizza place where you couldn't at least taste some hint of garlic....whats up with the garlic mystery at Italian Pizza Kitchen guys?

We love the Pizza here! They are super fast with delivery and every pizza has been great. I love the "white" garlic pizza and the chicken bacon ranch pizza. The Gluten Free Pizza is very tasty, my non gluten free family even request it! 
They have so many choices for the wings and so far, every flavor has been great! 
Gluten free pasta is awesome too! Vodka sauce was just ok. 
We'll order from here anytime we want a good old fashioned Thin crust or a unique topping pizza.

I've ordered a few times for dinner and for work. The pizza is average at best and priced okay. Nothing special here, but it's fairly reliable and right by my work. 

So, why one star?
Today was the second time I've had a bad experience with one of their delivery drivers.  The first bad one was last year and the guy was just late and rude. But today I had to lock up my brakes to avoid an accident with an old, gray station wagon with an Italian Pizza Kitchen sign on it because he turned left from the oncoming lane, across my lane of traffic WHILE GIVING ME THE FINGER. 

Nope. If the food was something special I'd have no problem, but I'm  not supporting a mediocre restaurant that also hires people like that. 

UPDATE!   The owner of IPK messaged me apologizing for the poor employee behavior. He seems to really value his customers so I'll be giving them another shot..... on a funny note, I appreciate Lauren O's message, shaming me for writing a negative review. Your tears taste delicious with this pizza.

My experience with Italian Pizza Kitchen is solely based off of my delivery experience. Nothing too exciting to report, but hopefully this is still helpful. Here goes...

A couple weeks ago my parents and I went over to my sister's place for games, drinks and to hang out. For dinner we planned to order in. My sister suggested IPK. She said her and her boyfriend order food from there all the time and it's really good. However, she said their pizza wasn't her favorite but she has loved everything else. 

So why, did I decide to order pizza? Who knows. I blame my decision on the bottle of wine I drank prior.

I claimed not to be super hungry so my mom and I split a 12 inch pizza. We went with the Bianca which consisted of fresh ricotta, mozzarella, and parmesan on thin crust topped with your choice of broccoli or spinach (we had spinach). Then all of that is drizzled with extra virgin olive oil (no red sauce).

It was definitely tasty. Not my absolute favorite pizza, but a good combo for sure. My main complaint was that their was too much spinach. It was literally a thick layer of chunky spinach laying under all that delicious cheese. Too much for me.

The delivery was timely and everything came hot. My dad got an Italian beef sandwich which looked really yummy, and so did the other burgers/sandwiches that were ordered. I thought prices were reasonable as well.

I'll for sure be enjoying their food again since it's a staple spot for my sis. Can't wait to dive into their menu outside of pizza, because they offer a lot of other options!

My first thought for pizza tonight was Rosati's, but they didn't have any current coupons and they apparently weren't running any specials, so IPK it was!

I know the owner of Italian Pizza Kitchen values input, as both the +1 and I were contacted following our last reviews. He included his number and offered an "improved experience," which was thoughtful. I hadn't accepted because, though the sentiment is nice, I just feel uncomfortable about it. Anyhoo, we decided the extensive menu and coupon were enough incentive to give them another shot.

We ordered Take Out: a Shrimp + Spinach Linguine and an 18" thin crust with spinach + half anchovies. I was quoted 25-30 minutes (they're 10 minutes away).

I arrived on time (7:45) and my order was taken out of the warmer. When I got home and my +1 saw the pizza:

"How does it go again? ' Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me?' " 

The cheese was half hardened and the pasta lukewarm, so we had to reheat it all. Makes me wonder how long it sat.

The linguine was cooked well and the sauce was tasty, but the shrimp were SUPER salty (frozen/brine). They included a sandwich roll which felt pillowy and soft in the cellophane. Oh, and a little packet of parmesan cheese: nice!

As for the pizza: it had LOTS of cheese. Heavy, oily cheese (no Lowfat Moz here!) and a too-hard and really bland crust. IMO the only flavorful part was the sauce, which is a shame. Definitely sad I ordered such a large pie because the bf wants nothing to do with it.

Maybe it's about timing, or maybe it's just me, but I need a better pizza. The search resumes!

Stopped in with my wife and 2 daughters last night the girls love the caprese sub and we ordered 3 of those I had a cheesy beef on garlic bread always great, we visit weekly love the location and the food is always very good.
 We will not be returning- after spending nearly
50 dollars on 4 sandwiches my wife asked for a little balsamic vinegar to add to her sandwich that was a bit dry, the portly bearded rude guy behind the counter started barking how he would have to charge us extra for vinegar! I reminded him that we just spend 50 bucks and wanted a dash of vinegar for one of the meals, my request was rudely shot down" I'm not the owner I just work here"( he obviously eats there as well) we ate and left and won't return. The guy upset our family meal with rude cheap behavior, I wish them well at the new place but we won't return.

Very much a fan of this pizza joint! I love pizza. Would rather eat pizza than most other things. I love thin crust, deep dish, stuffed. I really love pizza. I order delivery several times a month. Always great. I'm always disappointed with most other pizza joints. Not here. 

Want great pizza? Check this place out!

Make sure you use your mailer coupon whenever ordering here. IF you do not, you will definitely be paying outrageous amounts for pizza.

I would give the pizza itself a 4 star rating but the price and service is a 2 sooo 3 star is where we will settle. 

I ordered "a large, half vegetarian pizza with sausage and another half of cheese and pepperoni." OMG. Pizza total was $47 when they came and delivered it. My bad for not really paying attention when they rambled the total back to me on the phone... but holy heck! Turns out they charge for every. single. topping! Instead of having a standard, flat rate, vegetarian... they charged me for olives, and for spinach, and for broccoli, and for mushroom, and for the kitchen sink....

The first time I ordered from them I thought it was a little steep for for a 2 topping medium... I have learned my lesson. I had also ordered the "garlic bread" which turned out to be non-garlic bread...

I love supporting local establishments... but I also like to have money in my wallet. It's just pizza people!

I enjoyed the thin crust pepperoni pizza, and would order it again. My wife isn't crazy about their gluten-free items though, and wishes that they would improve those.

I like that they offer a lot of coupons and decent deals. It is a fairly affordable option that delivers pretty quick. I'd recommend it if you are looking for some good pizza.

I've always had pleasant experiences with IPK. Last time we ordered something was on Christmas Eve. The total for 2 pizzas came out to be over $40, but we figured as long as we didn't order this stuff every day, we'd still have enough for retirement. Overall the pizzas are pretty good, quality wise. If you want to see a comically large pizza, order a stadium sized one. It's pretty much a full sheet pan of pizza. Silverware looks toy like next to that behemoth. Note for everyone, they go pretty heavy on cheese (like a solid half centimeter or more) so if you love cheese, leave the order as default, if you are trying to cut back on calories, go light on cheese.... and stop ordering pizza. 

Bottom line: great for a local, once in a while treat.

We ordered pick up on a Thursday night around 8:00 pm and when we came in here, there was nobody dining in but many pick ups. We had jumbo chicken wings with Asian ginger source and BBQ deluxe medium pizza with mushrooms. The wings were good! Pizza is good except the fact I can't find my extra mushroom easily. We asked to put the extra mushrooms on one side and I found 2 pieces mushrooms. 

Will come back again!

My husband and I order from Italian Pizza Kitchen a couple times a month due to the fact that there really aren't many other decent (non-chain) pizza places in the area.  It's also our go-to pizza joint for when we have company at our home. So far, we've had at least 10 people try the pizza (family gatherings, parties) and everyone agrees that the pizza is pretty dang good. My husband and I have also eaten the pasta, wraps and salads. It is safe to say that I've enjoyed every single item we've ordered.

I've seen some of the Yelp complaints and I cannot speak for customer service or how warm the food is (as we usually do carry-out) but I can say that the food is delicious and we will continue to order from IPK!

Been a little disappointed in my last pizza go to, so it was time to try some place new...I am a fan! Superbowl Sunday and the pizza was delivered a little earlier than expected...win #1, still steaming hot perfectly intact (no cheese slid all over from being unlevel...you know what I mean..)...win #2, great flavor...win #3
My old pizza place just lost a lot of business...welcome to the family Italian Pizza Kitchen...
I gave IPK 4 stars bc the pizza was fantastic!   We had bbq chicken pizza and salad.  This was our first time eating here and we will be back.    Place was busy and clean.  Two thumbs up.
always superb. we order at least a nite a week near the end when we need a night off of cooking. this place has ruined us for other pizza!
Crazy good wings. The Habanero Cilantro are awesome. The Pizza is perfect :)

My #1 go to pizza around here when I have guests.  They have super stadium pizza size which feeds 15+ people.  The flavor is all a perfect balance from the authentic cheese, to sauce that is not sweet, and dough.  I grew up ordering from White Cottage in Wood Dale and this pizza is very similar.

Keep up great work!!

Craving a football sized calzone? How about a bucket of gnocchi? Well, if so, you're in luck with Italian Pizza Kitchen. Not only are these quick, Italian eats tasty and fresh, the portions are B.I.G. 

The fam and I rolled in on a sleepy Saturday afternoon, looking to fill our bellies and not upset anyone in a more upscale restaurant by bringing a 14 month old. We had the whole place to ourselves, which worked out well since they only have a handful of tables and one highchair. Score! The folks behind the counter were super sweet and helpful, welcoming the three of us as we made our way through their plentiful offerings. 

I sampled quite a bit but here are a few standouts...

Cheesy garlic bread: A thick coating of flavorful, garlicky cheese atop toasty bread. Yum fest all around. 

Caprese sandwich with pesto: Very fresh bread stuffed with an ample portion of thick mozzarella medallions, bright tomato, a drizzle of balsamic and a delicious spread of pesto. The sammie was large and in charge, ensuring that I had a sizeable lunch the next day. 

Gnocchi with sauteed spinach: I'm not kidding when I say the portions are huge. My daughter ate some, I ate some, my husband ate some, my daughter ate some the next day for lunch and we *still* have some left. The gnocchi were none too soft, covered in a zesty marinara and a decent serving of sauteed spinach scattered about. 

Pro-tip: I overheard that they deliver within five miles. Definitely want to give that a go in the future!

We have been ordering from Italian Pizza Kitchen for 4 years. We have had everything from pizza, salads & multiple large catering orders. We have never been disappointed & always tell friends to try them out. To our pleasant surprise they deliver to us in Bloomingdale, thank goodness

I recently moved to Roselle and need a good pizza place so I found Italian Pizza Kitchen and I was amazed by the portion sizes the pastas are fabulous and you get a bang for your buck I recommend getting the family size it's a lot of food for not so much $$ also the chicken is tender and juicy I have yet to try the pizza maybe that's next on the list

I ordered pizza from here for the first time and I was impressed. You can certainly taste the quality in the ingredients. It's more expensive than most of the pizza places nearby but you get what you paid for. I think the quality is well worth the price. Check your mail for coupons. I got a 12 inch thin crust cheese pizza free with my 18 inch pizza order. Yummmmmm!!!

Bummed I haven't ordered from here sooner.  I had the shrimp/spinach pasta and my hubby had the fried fish.  The food came in under an hour and was still hot!  Everything was delicious-will definitely be ordering again to try the pizza.

1st time customer, ordered food for delivery and it was fast. 
I ordered a burger and chopped salad, both amazing!! Would recommend to all!!

I think I'll stick to their pizza. I've tried branching out a lot at this place and keep getting disappointed. Today I tried their Gnocchi Florentine. I wasn't expecting miracles because it's a pizza place but it was just... disappointing. Despite the abundance of spinach, ricotta and tomatoes... it was just really bland. Not surprisingly, the gnocchi is probably store bought so it was just ok.  

The thing that made me super frustrated was the quality of their containers. I only work about 3 minutes away. When I got to my office, the paper bag holding my gnocchi was leaking. I didn't even have to open the paper bag because the top literally peeled off because it soaked through so much. The top of the pasta container was the flimsiest thing I've ever seen. It looked like I could peel off the foil on the paper top and it was soaked too. Everything they gave me (napkins, utensils, parmesan cheese packages) were soaked too.

Luckily I had an extra tupperware in my car otherwise I would have had to throw away the second half of my gnocchi.

*EDIT* The owner contacted me and said that he's looking into new containers!
These guys are alright. If you call 10-15 minutes before they close your order will not be fulfilled.

Italian Pizza Kitchen has my favorite pizza in the area. Definitely recommend the pizza. Don't recommend pasta.

Today I stopped by and ordered their Linguini with chicken and broccoli for lunch. I thought the price tag of $13.50 was pretty high. I assumed the pasta dish was either really gourmet or descent but a ton of food. Unfortunately it wasn't even descent. It was so nuclear hot that it was burning my tongue - clearly microwaved. Also half of the broccoli was rotten. It was completely black and mushy. Overall very disappointed. I'll continue to order pizza but will not order anything else off the menu moving forward. I don't see a point in offering dishes like this. They should either take it off the menu or make it worth $13.50 which means making it when its ordered and with fresh high quality ingredients.

I mainly ordered from here because I saw they sold bosco sticks. It was reminiscent because I ate them all the time growing up in high school. They call it stuffed garlic sticks here. They add a bit of parmesan & parsley on top & cook it to a perfect golden brown stuffed with mozzarella cheese, served with marinara dipping sauce on the side.

I ordered two 16" thin crust pizzas; one with mushroom & pepperoni, the other with Italian beef & giardiniera. I must say.. OMG .. can they make a pizza! Its not soggy at all & they use Serano cheese (I believe), which just dominates all the pizza places around here. They were generous with the giardiniera & had a great ratio of italian beef as well. 
I've also ordered their Cod fish sandwich here over 4x now. The fish is a nice thick cut fried to a nice crisp & topped with cheese, romaine & as much tartar sauce as you'd like. I honestly forgot but it miiight come with a tomato slice, lol. The bun is nice & airy with an oily sheen on top. Everything paired well together.
I also had a side of spuds which were nice, my favorite is mozzarella & pesto. The only problem is now they use crinkle fries, back maybe more than half a year ago they used actual "spuds (wedges of potatoes, skin & all)," now their the frozen fries identical from the ones at White Castle.

If i could change one thing it would be the pizza marinara sauce. It's really good but on the more saltier side & i.m.o needs a little more sweetness.

Id like to give this outfit a better rating cause the pizza is very good. Delicious even. But it is so expensive for what you get. Just not quite worth it for pizza night. No complaints about quality or quantity.  What else can we say?  It's pizza after all. It will come down to quality, quantity and price. Customer service was fine, delivery was fine etc. I can't comment on the rest of the menu cause it's been so long.
Good pizza, pretty good wings, and their appetizers too! and its so close to home.

Have only ever had delivery. They are always on time and their hot wings are to die for! Their pasta is alright. I cannot stress enough if you're looking for regular buffalo wings theirs are great! Their minestrone soup also is pretty good.

Small little pizza place in Roselle. We ordered a customized pizza -- spinach, black olives, chicken, and cheese and an order of fried zucchini. The staff there was nice and the pizza came out in under 20-minutes. 

Pizza was "meh"... I always thought a true sign of good pizza is when you have it cold the next day and it still tastes delicious. Well, we never really experienced the pizza hot to begin with, as for the most part, it was luke warm at best by the time we dug in. In my opinion, the pizza had way too much cheese and the chicken that was on it was rather bland and dry. On the other hand, the fried zucchini sticks were decent, but my vegan friend wasn't too impressed. I'll stick to her opinion -- can't trust a meat-a-tarian like me for reviews on veggie apps.

Dont think you'll get even decent customer service even if you spend over a hundred dollars on three pizzas and some wings! Next time my family has a pizza party we will not be going here!! Thanks Italian pizza kitchen for a stressful situation that could have been SO SO simple if you just honored a damn coupon that we drove back to the store to get a refund we were told we could get over the phone! Shitty service and pizza that's nothing special!!

Excellent food (sausage and peppers are amazing) 
Only eat here while visiting my husband on his lunch break - but have always been greeted by friendly employees.

DISAPPOINTING....

Today was my second time experiencing Italian Pizza Kitchen and honestly it will be my last! Two months ago I ordered the margarita pizza and it was cold, flavorless and lacked cheese. Since it was my first time, I chose not to complain. 

Well today I gave them a second chance and when I placed my order I mentioned to them the issue I had with my previous pizza. This time I decided to add a few ingredients (similar to my favorite pizza place) hoping it would be just as good. Their margarita pizza normally only comes with plum tomatoes, fresh basil, olive oil and topped with mozzarella cheese. I added garlic and marinara sauce to give it added flavor. I also asked that they make sure it has cheese on it throughout and that it be hot.  

HERE WE GO.....
The pizza arrived and I was APPALLED! It was once again cold,dry, and lacked cheese. It looked like crackers. Not to mention they did not put the plum tomatoes on the pizza. To make things worse, I called and spoke with Carmen (manager) and he was extremely rude. He was not empathetic to the situation at all and even tried going tit for tat with me. He told me the tomatoes were not added because I added marinara sauce. REALLY! When you add something it doesn't mean take something away! Then he referenced my  previous experience as told to the order taker telling me "you had an issue last time too". You right, I did and I was reassured it wouldn't happen this time. He went on to tell me that margarita pizzas are not suppose to have much cheese on them! WHERE IS HE GETTING HIS INFORMATION FROM??? Every margarita pizza I have had had plenty of mozzarella cheese on it. He told me the pizza came out of a 500 degree oven then boxed and sent directly to me. Well, I don't know what happened between it coming out of the oven and delivered, but it was very cold. He kept asking me if I wanted a new one sent out with my tomatoes added and I told him NO! If they messed it up twice why would I give them a third try? I told him I wanted something else or my money refunded. He placed me on hold. Then Rosa (owner) picked up and was very empathetic. She apologized and was more interested in rectifying the problem. I ordered the boneless buffalo wings with blue cheese dressing and they were okay. 

Ultimately, I was not charged for the $19 crackers but I do not think I will be ordering from here again. Sorry, but I can get a better pizza for less than $10 at Domino's. Perhaps things could have been different if I had better customer service. There's too much competition in the pizza world to lack in this area.
Absolutely ridiculous!  Ordered 24 wings and they will only allow one sauce. Had to order multiple orders costing me way more!  Greedy!

Love this place! I'm pretty sure we are birdlime obsessed!!  How did it take years for us to finally meet?!
We actually found them here on, Yelp! After reading many good reviews, we gave it a try.. we are thrilled that we did! 

We ordered many different things, over the course of two months. (Yes, I will admit- we became a slightly addicted to their food! Ordering four times in one week! No joke!)
First being Alfredo with stuffed cheese  ravioli- which was very good!! I find it to be a rather hard challenge.. Finding good pasta dishes when ordering in. 
Their wedges are AMAZING! Not only are they good, it's a huge order. We've tried basically all of the different ways they can be made, we love them all. 

Their pizza has to be one of the best pizza joints around. No joke! We are pizza snobs.. Not only was the pizza piping hot when it arrived, when we would reheat the left overs, the pizza tasted just as good as it did when arriving after being freshly made. 
Their cold subs are pretty good. However, I was a little weirded out, when mine came with four huge fresh mozzarella balls. (Yes, they were huge and round, they basically took over the sub.) their bread is always very fresh. 
Chicken is pretty good! It came with four to five rather large prices, along with fresh bread, cole slaw and wedges. Chicken is always very fresh, warm and very crispy. 

We also tried their out if this world amazing brownies. Yummy! We heated ours up, and added ice cream. You just cannot go wrong with that dessert. Cheese cake was very good- typical Eli's brand. 

Only one item we ordered, that we sadly ended up throwing out after the first bite. Sadly, it's one of our favs..fried zucchini. They also do not serve it with any type of sauce. They were SO mushy! Honestly, they were gross. 
After ordering many times, we finally received a coupon for 30% off our entire order. Awesome! Well, not so much when we called to place our order. The gal taking our order ended up being slightly rude, when we mentioned our coupon. Asking us over and over again what code was printed on the coupon. Almost not believing us, that they in fact had a coupon out for 30% off! (They staple it to the box, and no coupon code is provided on the coupon)
In the long run, we did receive 30% off. 

Overall, great place with great food! Only wish they offered more coupons then the one 30% off coupon we received after placing many orders. (20 plus)
The pizza and wings are very good.   Sometimes the pasta can be a little inconsistent but yet good.  We carry out from Pizza Kitchen weekly.

If you're in Chicago this place is a must. Screw the chain restaurants. This is the proverbial hole in the wall joint with impeccable wings and unbelievable chicken parmigiana. I am thinking back to the $150 I spent in Manhattan where I thought Id have the best Chicken parm in the world. It sucked! Little Italy? Even worse! Its all hype! This place rocks! Come to Chicago!!!!

LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! I used to work in the area, and this little gem was tucked away in a tiny establishment. What an awesome, awesome spot!

I've tried many different varieties of pizza here...favorites below:
Buffalo Chicken Pizza - this is unlike any buff chick pizza I've ever had. It is so incredibly cheesy, delicious and stuffed full of flavor! My only recommendation is ask for it to be made without onions or bacon. Trust me, I LOVE bacon but it's gotta be crispy and it is not when in the pizza. The onions are too much for this pizza. Ask for extra ranch!
Margarita - this is my second fave. Again, another pizza I've tried at many different places, but IPK does it the best.
Standard sausage/pepperoni/cheese - even the norm is incredible. 

There is something about the cheese, sauce, crust combination that makes me want to stuff myself silly. If only they delivered 30 miles away!
Love this place! Fresh ingredients and exceptional service. Has healthier options if you're looking for that too! I love the diversity in their menu. Will keep returning for sure (:
Great food ! Owner is passionate about his buissness and food and it shows! Food specials change regularly and food is great. Check them out for there slices at lunch or at dinner.

To update my previous review, which was a good one, due to poor concern for customer service I'm downgrading my review. We've spent several hundreds of dollars with this Roselle location in deliveries over the past 3 months. When we ask about using a coupon on their menu we just got from them about a week ago for free wings, they said the coupon was expired end of February. We looked and found it was in fact expired. When we got our food we got a new menu, which still had the February expiration date on it, except it now has a rubber stamp date on it til July. How can they send out a menu with coupons that have expired then refuse to take them, only to send you more showing expired but altered with a rubber stamp???? When we called today to complain and get the wings refunded back to us for last nights order we were turned down..saying they can't give away the business. Well, they just gave up my business. If they can't see their way to honor a coupon they know is expired when they give it to me and then send me another one with a rubber stamp date over the pre-printed date which is expired, they don't need my business. Their food is good, kinda pricy but food quality was worth it. That said no amount of good food can negate to poor customer service and misleading menus that seem to be out of date, misleading on products available and misleading on coupons offered, at least as the mood fits them. No more business from us, they will be a few hundred dollars less profitable now, hope it was worth the trade off vs just honoring your coupons.

(UPDATE #2)
Owners contacted us only after seeing negative review on Yelp saying they wanted to make things right...after 2 phone calls the previous day to try to make this right they now WANT to make things right after seeing posting in Yelp. My fiance called and spoke with one of the two owners but they were only willing to make things right, ON THEIR TERMS. What started out as wanting them to honor a coupon THEY SENT US IN THEIR MENU A WEEK AGO FOR FREE WINGS AND THEY REFUSED TO DO AT THE TIME OF THE ORDER,  them saying it was expired, only to have them send us our order the other night with the same menu, same expired date of February 28th but then a rubber stamp over that saying expired July, and in the owners reply to me in Yelp acknowledging both the clerk who took the order, and the other owner who we called yesterday should have honored the coupon and refunded us...was only recognized after they are called out in public here on Yelp. Still, they then expect that just a coupon or a future discount will suffice....not a chance after putting us through all this when all we wanted in the beginning was them to honor the coupon THEY sent us. Very dishonorable business, shady practice, deliberate misleading menu fliers and non-caring owner. I can't stress enough to anyone thinking about going to this restaurant or ordering from them SHOULD NEVER BUY FROM THIS RESTAURANT EVER!!!!!

My rating is now a 1.  So much for their public displays of correcting the issue we had the other night.  Their solution:  place ANOTHER order with us and we'll give you a % off.  What the % off was he never said.  Nonetheless, making the customer happy should be on the customer's terms NOT management who screwed up in the first place.  I requested half off my 70.00 bill.  Lets face it, the order taker blew it, her manager blew it and then the 2nd manager only took 1 step forward to correct it but only on THEIR terms.  Sorry.  Three days of inconvenience and aggravation isn't worth your unknown % off.  They don't need our business, that's evident.  And now they've lost it.  You don't screw up 3x and then have the nerve to say PLACE ANOTHER ORDER with us we'll do you a favor.  Seriously?  Great food isn't worth poor treatment and disrespect.
Failure to place an order correctly on your part does not necessitate over over charging me. Will never go back!  First time customer, you lost me.

My first experience here was a VERY positive one.  My only complaint is definitely a first-world problem.  Their menu is HUGE and everything on it looks delicious.  Therefore, I had a hard time narrowing down my choices!  Wahwah.

We ordered around 6 pm on a Saturday night, and our food was going to be delivered within the hour (it was!!)

We ordered:
8 buffalo wings (bone in)
Medium thin-crust pizza w/ half cheese and half sausage
Tortellini Veneziana (sans the peas--I megaloathe peas)

Let me just say that everything was amazing.  EVERYTHING.  My husband likes his wings hot, and I am pretty white when it comes to spice pallets.  We both agreed that these wings were a great compromise.  The flavor is REALLY good, and then the heat sort of sneaks up on you.  So it was the best of both worlds, in my opinion.  They were really meaty, too.  There's nothing worse than bony wings!
