I like foods spicy though, so more heat would have been nice, but I enjoyed the food exactly as it was served. The staff is incredibly friendly and more than willing to explain things to you or even just chat.
The restaurant is small, it has about six tables, People are friendly.  The sandwiches are amazing, the depth of flavor is unbelievable.  Highly recommend the chicharron!
So good!! Definitely come super hungry because it's very filling, and you'll cry watching the yuca or bites of sandwich that you can't finish.
My favorite take-out spot in Naperville/Aurora. Delicious sandwiches with flavor combinations that are to die for. Personal favorites: the lomo saltado and the butifarra.

DELICIOSO! C̩sar, the owner & chef, is formally trained and certified in culinary arts and holy smokes, what a difference in the quality! I ordered the Chicharr_n sandwich and Yuca fries -amazing! It was cooked right in front of me, everything was fresh and light, not too heavy. We also ordered a new sandwich, the Seca. The beef was perfectly cooked. I'm in love with this place because it's not Panera churned out by teenagers, loaded with preservatives. It's better tasting and BETTER for you. This authentic Peruvian food puts all the surrounding chain restaurants & burger joints to shame. A MUST GO!

Fantastic hand made to order deliciousness.

I had the steak sandwhich, wife had the breaded chicken.  Great flavor combinations, excellent sauces.

We ordered both the chauma (fried rice) and yuca fries to try both and were very happy we did.  Fantastic simple rice.  Would come for lunch just for the rice.

Well executed, we will definitely be back to try more!
The chicharron sandwich is amazing!! After I eat two sandwiches I take a chicharron to go because I love it so much!!
Good food......the beef sandwich and the fried rice was good...had a fried chicken sandwich (since that was the only one available) which was kinda ok....

Excellent place, clean and makes you feel welcome. Food was great, we totally recommend the lomo saltado sandwich but we also tried the Aji de gallina one and it was very tasty. We would come back next time we are around.

Food was fresh, interesting different flavor combinations. Price was a little higher than I would have liked, but very unique and a nice change of pace. Fried rice was a good size portion. Fried Yuca was good but I think I prefer regular fries ( just my preference) pork sandwich was my favorite thing I tried. Staff was very friendly.

We had several different dishes here, including the Peruvian Poutine (which was delicious!)
The staff was courteous and friendly, and the restaurant was BUSY (which is usually a good sign)!

This place is amazing! My husband and I stopped in after seeing it on Yelp, and not only was the customer service amazing, and the people were so nice you genuinely want them to succeed, but the food was AMAZING! We shared the lomo saltado, and the chicharron and yuca fries! Soooooooooooo amazing! Ask for the sauce that comes on the poutine to dip them in! Outstanding! We will definitely be back!!!

Extremely impressed by this restaurant. The menu is very simple but offers great variety. You can tell that great care is put into everything they make. It is delicious! I highly recommend the poutine peruanu. It's a great twist on a Peruvian classic. (Papa a la Huanca_na) The lomo Saltado sandwich is also great.  I honestly don't think you can go wrong here.

 I would just love to see ceviche added to the menu and a few other Peruvian classics.

Amazing! My husband is Peruvian so we tried this place with a knowledge of what to expect. I am vegetarian and knew I would be limited but the Quinoa burger was the bomb. What flavor! Also love Yucca and was not disappointed.  My husband had the Lomo Saltado and said it was delicious. 
The Alfajors were gone for the day so we'll need to come back for those and compare them to what we are use too!
Love Alfajors so I was sad I did not get any but my waistline thanked me for it. A sweet treat.

The reviews are correct, this is a great find.

While the decor is virtually non-existent and the location is only good for people living nearby or riding the Metra (station very close), this little joint is worth a visit.

The owners are very friendly and make delicious food to order.  I hope business continues to pick up with more Yelpers visiting as it would be a shame to lose this gem.

Peru was our international country this month and we chose to dine out vs cooking at home. This is a wonderful find that we will visit again. We shared 3 different sandwiches each of a different meat and a side of fried yucca. All fantastic. Service very friendly helpful and prompt. Very reasonably priced. Its a small menu done right. Every sandwich unique and very flavorful.

The Lomo Saltado will blow your mind. This place is seriously legit. Such great service and deduction to quality. The bread is amazing!

We also ordered the fried yucca and it was excellent!

Just wanted to add that I've been here several times since my initial review and I have never been disappointed. My husband is from Per̼ and he absolutely loves this place as well. My favorite is the lomo saltado. The beef is very tender and juicy. I've had lomo saltado in quite a few Peruvian places in the city, and this is by far the best. Many times I've had it in other places it's been dry and tough. The fried yuca with salsa a la huanca_na is amazing as well. My husband's favorite is the chicharr_n, but between the two of us we've tried all of the sandwiches aside from the quinoa burger. The arroz chaufa is delicious and the alfajores (dulce de leche shortbread cookies) are to die for. Everyone that works here is very friendly. I'm hoping someday to try the tamales. We will definitely be back many, many times in the future.
Great creations of food. Looking for a place that takes a sandwich up a notch this is it. Fresh ingredients and hand made to order.

We had an appointment in Naperville, and are always on the lookout for new local restaurants to try.  I found this on Yelp, and we were really glad we did.  My husband who is Mexican loved his Adobo de Cerdo sandwich, and only wished it had been larger due to how good it was!   I had the milanesa, and it was good, though I would have enjoyed it a bit more with a bit more seasoning.  In fairness, my mother-in-law makes the world's best milanesa, so I am judging it against really high marks.  The fries were good and a large portion; next time I'd like to order the yucca just so I can try it :)  We enjoyed talking with the owner and discussing the differences between Mexican and Peruvian food.  We would definitely visit this again to try other menu items!

I can't believe how close this place is to my house, and I am so excited about that.  I did have a little bit of trouble finding it - It's got a sign on the street, but I couldn't find the right strip mall building at first, so if you have to drive around a parking lot twice like I did, don't give up!  It's worth it!  I got takeout on a weeknight for my husband and I and didn't call ahead, but it was very fast service.  The restaurant is pretty bare bones and on the empty side, so my guess is they do a lot of takeout business.  If this place was on grubhub, I would probably get delivery constantly.  We had the chicharron and the aji de gallina sandwiches with the fried yucca and the rice.  Everything was pretty good, but I would probably skip the fried yucca next time.  They were prepared really well - crispy outside, nicely salted, with a good, creamy/garlicky dipping sauce, but they just weren't really my thing.  The chicharron sandwich was the star of the show.  The pork is crispy and salty, with nice bite from the pickled onions (I don't even like onions) and sweetness from the sweet potato.  We also got the cookies at the register (on another yelper's recommendation) and it was like shortbread clouds.  So good!

Please, please, please go to this place.  It was very empty when I was there (weeknight takeout) and it would be a crying shame if a place this unique, delicious, and fast went under.  You won't regret it. Next time you're thinking that you want something fast, skip Chipotle and try local instead!!
Incredible food. Freshly made. Came with a group of 6 and each of us had something different.. Each of us looved it!!!

Amazing! My husband is Peruvian so we tried this place with a knowledge of what to expect. I am vegetarian and knew I would be limited but the Quinoa burger was the bomb. What flavor! Also love Yucca and was not disappointed.  My husband had the Lomo Saltado and said it was delicious. 
The Alfajors were gone for the day so we'll need to come back for those and compare them to what we are use too!
Love Alfajors so I was sad I did not get any but my waistline thanked me for it. A sweet treat.

Incredible food. Freshly made. Came with a group of 6 and each of us had something different.. Each of us looved it!!!

Give this place a try...or five.  What a nice change from one of those big chain burritos or a common torta. But this was not Mexican.  After my first experience with Sangu Che Peruvian Flavors, it"ll be hard to go back to those other places. Why would I?  The lomo saltado was incredible, and the chef took the time to acquaint me with his work; the sauces, the secrets of great French, or should i say Peruvian, fries, the drinks, and how Peruvian food is head and shoulders above Chilean food.  He was so excited to talk about his food you know he puts the same enthusiasm and care in his cooking.  It showed.  I'll be going back soon, next time with lots of friends.

Can I just begin with how much I adore this place- you'll want to check this review out! 

Let me give you my experience here :

It's a rainy afternoon and I just got out of yoga... As I walk through the door I'm greeted by smiles, hellos and a board of pictures of people at Machu Picchu! I start to gander the menu and see aji de gallina, lomo saltado and chicharr_n - all famous Peruvian dishes I'm well aware of :) (I'm thinking at this point this is too good to be true) and of course it is for me since I'm a newly vegetarian. Wahhhhhhhh... so I figure I can start with the fried yucca and maybe a salad. Oh no, no, no ... Cesar, the nicest chef around, catches wind of the fact I don't eat meat and offers to whip me up a sandwich of veggies! :) :) :) 

Now I'm thinking this could go wrong. This could go terribly wrong since I'm already well aware of how rich these food combos can be- tomatoes marinated with cilantro, onions and lime, olive sauce, eggs, aji sauce .... But fear not because Cesar really knows what the heck he's doing in that kitchen- the first bite and taste buds exploded- ( it took me back to Lima, Peru- literally). You wonder why there's no picture with this review? Because I devoured my sandwich and sweet/spicy/peanut coleslaw (seriously an awesome spin on Asian Peruvian fusion and American slaw)... I also washed that down with fried yucca and huancaina sauce(best dipping sauce ever), part of a tamale and an alfajore(the first think I ate)... Let's just say my belly and heart were extremely satisfied. 

Now I can't sit here and give all the credit to the food because anyone can cook - I mean, I cook Peruvian food, and yes it's hard, but it can be done! But there is some serious talent here. Cesar is not only from Peru but has moved around the U.S. cooking at various places. His concept of sandwiches on these famous dishes is genius and you won't be left wanting more. All the food and ingredients are fresh and prepped each week, which is not easy, if you've ever cooked these dishes. Cesar also does a great job explaining this food to newcomers as I asked how overwhelming it must be for people who have never seen this stuff before. Hearing his story made the experience just that much more awesome and his and his mothers hospitality and friendliness made me feel like I was in their home (how it normally is in Peru too!) Thank you again for that :) 

All and all, this little slice of paradise has something for everyone. I recommend the lomo saltado (steak lovers) or chicharr_n, Salchipapa for the kids, Plato del mes for the drunkies and tamales for the brunch goers. Again, you really can't go wrong and if you're still lost don't be afraid to ask Cesar- he won't steer you the wrong way! Keep up the good work Sanguche - my new favorite place! 

-ChiGirl Fit

What a great restaurant. No frills, cooked with love and taste profiles that are complex and reflect truly authentic Peruvian food. Chef Cesar, who is Peruvian, and his mother have brought a new, vibrant taste to the suburbs. 
The sandwiches are out of this world. The meats- chicken, pork or beef are all tender, flavorful and well portioned. The Aji de Gallina a shredded chicken dish as a sandwich is awesome. My other favorite is Chicharron, a pork butt sandwich with meat that melts in your mouth. The same is true of the sirloin. 
Another authentic dish is Peru Poutine which is your choice of meat over hand cut fries smothered in Huancaina sauce. It is absolutely incredible. 
This place is low key, with great food!!!!!

We are lovers of Peruvian food of all types. This was our first time here. Both ordered the Lomo saltado sandwich...extremely tender and flavorful pieces of steak, onions, peppers and grilled tomatoes on the yummiest roll. It was incredible. Like lick the paper in the basket for every last bit delicious! The owner and who I assume was his mama were there. They were both incredibly helpful. They recommended Yuka fries and they were incredible. The dipping sauce with it was almost too good to be true. I needed more fries. Honestly I would have dipped a stick in it. So tasty. Don't pass this place by, it's super yummy and super affordable! We'll likely see you there bc we've got lots more menu items to try.
Awesome sandwiches! The Milanesa is soooo goooood. And the empanada is great! A welcome to the neighborhood of naperville

The Owner/Chef is so personable and makes you feel special. He remembers what you like to order and even intricacies like your favorite sauces and to add extra onions.  This place is gem in Naperville you have to try it.
Great food, but they completely forgot part of our order and took another 20 mins to make it.

I visited this place a week after opening. The outside isn't very inviting but in the end, that really doesn't matter. I looked at their menu and was surprised to see how small it was. They only had three sandwiches and everything was an add-on. I ordered the Aji de Gallina (two of them) and when they were given to me, they were too salty and the meat seemed like it had been out too long. We ordered separate fries and drink and the total was nearing 30 dollars. In my opinion, for that kind of money, I'd rather go to Red Robin (only two miles away) and eat a great sandwich or burger with bottomless fries. Don't waste your money here.

AMAZING!! Saw this place by accident driving by, and boy, am I happy I did! Nice little family owned and operated restaurant. The food is full of flavor combinations that I have not had before. A must try is the Lomo Saltado and fried rice, my favorites. Our new spot for neighborhood quick eats.

Outstanding!!!! Had fried rice and yucca! Also tried the chicharron and hubby had lomo saltado 
Although it did take a while to get our food, it was worth every minute!! Definitely on my list of favs in Naperville

Yuuuummm. Naperville is stepping it up with cool new cultural cuisine restaurants. Me and my best friend checked this place out *after Yelp suggested it*. We tried a bit of everything. No seriously, we ordered about 7 or 8 different things. It was all delicious. So many different seasonings and flavors. I recommend the entire menu. That friend rice was perfect. Light and flavorful. How do you do that. And the fries and this...sauce they put on it. And the meat...chicken, steak....SO good. Again, I recommend anything on the menu. Try it all. Get the daily special. I will be a regular customer here for sure!

Amazing place for authentic Peruvian flavors. The milanesa sandwhich was fantastic and so was the fried rice and fried yucca. My husband and I will definitely be back. Everything was freshly cooked. Can't wait to try the other menu options!

I've tried a few dishes so far, last time was the quinoa burger, and I tried a bite from another sandwich that I don't remember. Absolutely incredible sandwiches and yucca fries. The rice was also good, much better quality than you'd get from most restaurants.

Amazing, authentic flavors. Well as far as a Caucasian American can tell. Delicious and fresh. That lomo saltado sandwich was probably one of the best steak sandwiches I've ever had. Their fries are good too, but could be a little crispier. It's a little expensive for lunch but definitely worth it once in a while or for an awesome takeout dinner.

This place is great! Saw them some time back and knew I'd have to stop by sometime. I love Peruvian food, and am lucky enough to have tasted authentic versions of it. This place didn't disappoint! I ordered an all time favorite: Aji De Gallina, which is Peru's answer to chicken curry. The sauce is made by blending milk, bread crumbs, chicken stock and aji yellow peppers. The aji pepper is extremely rare outside of Peru, and is only available in paste form in the states. The base dish is a tad bland but you have to add the spicy aji salsa to get the full effect of the dishes' flavor. I love that it was paired w sweet potatoes, as Peru has a plethora of potatoes cultivated there.  The neatest thing is you can order this dish as a platter or in sandwich form. They offer plenty of other options of well known Peruvian dishes presented in sandwich such as Lomo Saltado. I will be trying that next time :). On the weekends they offer Peruvian tamales wrapped in banana leaves. Nice music and a friendly staff round this place out to a solid 5 stars! This hidden gem doesn't disappoint with it's authentic offerings, unique concept, and great staff! They even have a wall where customers can bring their Peruvian trip photos (bringing some of mine for sure).

This Peruvian food is comfort food.  The chef really knows how to execute the casual
dishes with flair and authenticity.  We ordered the Lomo Saltado sandwich, fried yucca
and fried rice to share.  It was plenty for two.  One can get Inca Cola or fountain beverages.  We were glad to order one alfajore cookie at $1.50, which was large and good to share while
waiting for the first basket containing the fried rice and fried yucca  with accompanying mild auce.  Did not miss the catsup at all. Our beef sandwich, which arrived later while still munching on the first one, was tender and tasty. We arrived about an hour before closing, after finding it despite heavy traffic. If all the tables are taken, ask to sit with someone.  You might meet a new friend.

Wow! let me start by saying wow, this food is excellent! I have never had Peruvian food before and I was looking for something to spark my taste buds. I am so use to eating garbage American food everyday and tonight I had enough. When I saw this place had five stars on yelp, I said "yeah ok", I'm sure it's not that great" cause out in the western suburbs people don 't know how to rate food at all (no offense). So I drove 15 miles to get food from this place and it was empty because it was Sunday at 19:25. I was immediately greeted as I walked in the door by the chef and he ask me what I would like. I told him I have no idea but what do you recommend. He said try the Adobo de Cerdo and I trusted his judgment as I had no clue what anything was. I also ordered the Yucca with some pepper and cheese sauce and holy Peruvian was it so good. As I was waiting for my food to cook, the chef was giving me samples of stuff on the menu and it was all so good. I wanted to order everything on the menu but didn't have enough time. I highly recommend  this place as this is hands down the best food I have ever had out in the western suburbs. I have never given a restaurant five star before and I would not make this up. If someone doesn't find this food good then you don't have taste buds!

WOW! The staff was very friendly and welcoming as soon as I walked in. Mentioned that it was my first time in their establishment, gave me a sample of their beef sirloin. I was immediately hooked. Ordered the Lomo Saltado and a side of the Yucca Fries, both were fantastic! I will definitely be back! Thank you!
Awesome food! Great way to taste the flavours of Peruvian Cuisine. The tamales are out of this world!

This is my first experience with Peruvian and this place has very tasty sandwiches! I give it 4 stars since it is a bit pricey and they bring out the sandwiches well staggered. I find it very rude to eat before everyone has there food and I sat in front of a warm sandwich for nearly 10 min while we waited on my husbands. Please bring the food all at the same time!

Went here for the first time on the Fourth of July, and I thought it was delicious! Place was huge, large open seating with a window front that opens up on nice days. TV's everywhere, perfect for watching a game. Large center bar with seating all around. 

I ordered the Mozzarella sticks...so good, and the Monte Cristo sandwich with fries and my boyfriend ordered the pepper and egg sandwich with tater tots. Food was hot, large portions, fries & tots perfectly crispy. Mozz sticks had the perfect breading and weren't soggy at all.

I would've given 5 stars, but our waitress wasn't the nicest, but she wasn't mean. She was the only one working the floor and had about 10 tables to look after on her own so I understand the lack of small talk. She didn't mess up our order at all and was very efficient at her job, but on a holiday like the 4th, I kind of expect a little friendlier attitude.

My boyfriend and I will definitely be back, must try the pizza...it looked and smelled delicious!

We have ordered sandwiches and pizza here.
The food has been good. Fast friendly service.
Only complaint is way too much cheese on pizza. It takes away from the flavor if the toppings.

I love this place!
Their wings, pizzas, beers and appetizers are excellent.
The service has always been fast and friendly when I've visited.
Every time I'm in town, this is my go-to place.

Got it 30 minutes quicker than they said and very hot.
Very happy with food and delivery.
Food and service were great! We ordered burgers and were not dissapointed!! Tater tots are an option! Hello?? Yum! Also, I'm a big fan of Lagunitas A Little Sumpin' Ale -which they also have!!!

Since they've remodeled the place looks sharp and the food is good.  My low rating is for customer service (or lack there of).  Twice now we have been turned away because we had most but not all of our party with us when we wanted to secure a table for the game. We are big spenders and tippers and they missed out on a lot of $ by doing this, but the worst was the manner in which they treated us.  Not nice or friendly or even willing to compromise.  The next bar we visited was MORE than happy to seat us and take our hard earned cash!
Took the whole family,  everyone love their food. Pizza, salad and eggplant Parmesan were awesome.

The driver conned my kids out of a bigger tip, claiming he didn't have change!  We ordered the gyro platter that they boast to have a "generous portion", I mean 4 strips of meat for $11, not a generous portion in my book!  To top it off,  the manager kept making excuses for their poor service!

I've eaten here regularly since they originally opened and have always enjoyed it. I know they changed owners, however, the last couple of trips make me not likely to come back. The pizza was horrible. It was so greasy that my wife and I didn't finish the only pieces we tried. The owner Dennis not only belittled some lady at an adjacent table, he rolled his eyes when we politely said we didnt want the pizza when the server asked how our food was. By the way we didn't ask for it to be taken off our bill. This has no reflection on our server. She was great. This used to be my go to place, but I'll take my business elsewhere.

I've gone here twice recently and wanted to wait to make a review. Both times I asked my server for recommendations and received nothing and got the answer of "everything is good". That's not helpful at all with a menu that has over 50 items. 
The first time I got the buffalo chicken wrap and my Mom got a hotdog. Simple enough, right? Wrong. My wrap was vacant of blu cheese completely and maybe there was some watery ranch, but including tell because I was too focused on my Mom complaining that her hotdog was still frozen in the center. Not cold... frozen!! Come on guys- it's a hotdog!! How do you screw that up?! 
The second time I went I went on a date and we had a waitress who was over every 5 mins asking if we needed anything, which can be as annoying as not having a server at all... Especially on a date! We got a pizza and though good was quite expensive and underwhelming. 

Unless this place gets white table cloths and napkins, I don't see a reason for the outrageous pricing. Also.. Cut back on the crazy menu and maybe they can keep up with food consistency and quality.

We absolutely love their pizza. The white pizza is the best! We've tried many of their pizzas and they're all so  very good. I normally order my pizza with extra cheese but they load their pizza up with cheese so there's no need to order extra. We enjoy going to the restaurant but we also have it delivered often and the pizza is delivered so hot that we seriously have to wait 10 or so minutes to eat it. The pizzas are a bit pricey but sooooo worth it!

The burgers aren't what they used to be. They've always been a little overpriced, but now that they have switched to a lesser quality frozen patty, it's even more so. Too salty and overlooked to boot. I appreciate them taking it off my bill, but I will stick to just ordering pizza from there. Please don't change the pizza!!!
Great place to catch a game and hang out, the Italian Beef is surprisingly one of the best in the city.

Delicious food
Fresh and huge portions 
Great atmosphere & service

Could have cleaner silverware though

We have been coming here for years.  It is a good location, can always get a table, food was good and so was the service.  

Unfortunately, we may not come back.  The service had been terrible.  They have seemed to have forgotten that the customer service does matter and there are many other choices in the area.  

We have ordered the steak nachos 50+ times and they have been awesome.  With the expansion, and apparently, new ovens, they can't seem to figure out how to melt cheese.   The nachos consistently come out with unmelted cheese and they are put off if you ask for it to be melted.  Why would you serve chips with just shredded cheese?   Their excuse are "the new ovens" but after hearing this excuse five times, we question their dedication to delivery quality food and a good experience for their guests.  

The worse offense is a server rolling her eyes at you and displaying attitude you wouldn't tolerate from a four year old. 

To management, please consider kitchen staff training on food preparation and customer service skill training for the front of the house.  Until then, we will enjoy melted cheese elsewhere.

I was here recently and the service was horrible!  We got some ditty middle aged woman that was slow, incompetent and non-acknowledging. We ordered the chicken wings because that was a daily special. The presentation was Awful, the blue cheese dressing didn't taste like blue cheese and the plate it was served on had 3 big chips out of it.  I will attempt to post a pic.  The double crust pizza was all dough and little toppings.  The Diet Coke tasted like Coke (I still think they had them hooked up to the wrong dispenser.)  On our way out we had to walk right past 4 employees standing by the door chit chatting and not one of them said Thank you.....  Most likely I will not be back unless it's to drink a few beers. Very unfortunate!
The staff is incredible and owner Dennis accommodated my request on a very busy night.  Food was fantastic and service was excellent.  I would highly recommend the Roadhouse!

they have the best nachos in the area and they have amazing pizza service is great the staff is friendly I would highly recommend a place we frequent the establishment 1 to 2 times per week for dinner and or drinks

Good pizza and a great server.  My rating is based upon our greeting    It was a beautiful Fall day and we asked if we can sit outside. The hostess, who was not even taking care of, responded with no its not set up.   It would have taken 2 minutes to set up.  The game was being broadcasted outside and the fairs and tables we outside already.  Not sure why they would not accommodate a customer.  Then they say us in the back.  Wouldn't you think if someone wanted to sit outside you would put them at least in a window seat as there were plenty open.  A little empathy and training would raise their score

Love the pizza here! Thin crust, pan and Chicago style are my favorites! They always have plenty of cheese as well. 

I have ordered a few different sandwiches before for delivery and all were fantastic! Pastas were a bit too saucy, however great for leftovers. Panzerotti's and Calzones are enough for about three meals. Portions are huge all around. 

Love this place honestly! Consistent and fantastic food. Yay!

My family and friends have been eating here for years and the food and service has always been amazing.
Recently the expanded so we we excited to check out the new menu and look.

Disappointment!

The place looks great, the food was amazing as usual but the service has gone to hell.  
-our waiter was in a hurry to get our order,
 -made us ask for water or a dtink
-after I found 5 sets of dirty silverware at the table he just dropped off another and left leaving a bandaid that fell off his neck on the table
-never checked on us after our food came
-had to get another server to tell him to bring the check

To many other details to go into.

To bad .. use to love the place.

Avoid this place at all costs and save yourself much money and grief.

Ordered delivery and the only good thing that happened was the order was here in 30 minutes. I tried to pay for a $50 order with three 20 dollar bills. The driver was unable to give me $5 in change after a $5 tip. I made him go back to the bar to get me change. When he arrived back, he looked all butt hurt I made him do his job. I delivered pizza for 3 years and not carrying at least $5 to make change is unforgivable.

Now, on to the food. Evidently, Randall Roadhouse hasn't figured out that hot food left to sit in plastic containers with no ventilation results in everything being incredibly soggy. Completely ruined the meal. I could literally wring out the pita for my Gyro "Platter". It didn't help the mushy tomato slices were placed under the other food in the container. Food portions were nothing special for the exorbitant price. Speaking of the price...

The total for my fiance and I came to $50 for 2 entree's and 2 appetizers. This is as much as a meal at Biaggi's costs and they are a real restaurant, not a dive sports bar in a dead strip mall. I gave this cesspool a chance based on the positive reviews. Last time I'll make that mistake.

Fun atmosphere, great service and Wow!! The best steak nachos! I love how they section off the ingredients since I am a "ratio" perfectionist. We thoroughly enjoyed them and the 2 of us could not finish the whole thing. We will be back to try the tavern fries next!!
We love coming here, with or without the kids. Big food portions, friendly servers and plenty of tvs to watch the games... So this has become a regular place to eat as a family.
Great since the remodel! More open tables and bigger bar! Pizza is great. My friends love the nachos!

I have ordered from here for years, and have only had one problem in all these years, pizza delivered toppings completely slid off pie. Lol. They brought out another one immediately. Love this place. Never ever had bad food they have great friendly staff and awesome  food.

Wasn't wow'ed. Food was fair at best. Had an awesome waiter which is why I gave it a 3. Menu is huge, not a fan of too many options. 1st time here and ordered eggplant sandwich,  hub chicken. Eggplant was like a chip with the occasional soft inside. Chicken was fresh but very plain. Honey mustard was diluted tasting not a good flavor.  Arniepalmer tasted like lemon water, bland.  Nice atmosphere beyond that
Ordered Vodka cranberry with vodka. Manager refused to replace. So ordered water. Lol. Food was ok n

Total hidden gem tucked in a strip mall.   We have been coming here for years and have never had a bad meal.   The staff is both friendly and attentive.  The pizza is amazing and the nachos are a must try.   Keep up the good work guys.

We came here because our favorite place was closed...the only reason the review isn't one star is because our service was *sort-of* good... our server seemed like she was new, so I can take it with a grain of salt.  The food is the huge loser here... (maybe we were because we ate it...) Three of us had salads, the dressings were gross, obviously bottled and bland, I feel that if you use bottle dressing, at least buy something that doesn't taste like crap. The lettuce was so wet, that the plates had puddles of water in them. The marinara sauce on the chicken parm sandwich was also pretty bad, bottled and bland again... I hate to waste a meal, so we won't be back... I guess this place spent all of the money on remodeling and forgot that having decent food is important.

Awesome service, 15 minute wait time. Great food I had chicken finger wrap my boyfriend had eggs Benedict and we split chocolate chip banana pancakes!!!


Pancakes were to die for !

I have been going to and ordering out from Randall Roadhouse for a decade now and never had a bad meal. 

The pizza is to die for, I never bother ordering anywhere else. 

My entire family can fill up for dinner on their nacho plate, it's got everything from guac to salsa to olives to tomatoes with chicken, steak or ground beef add-ins.  Seriously SO good. 

It's a sports bar, it's loud, and sometimes crowded, but always good food and a good time!
This place is amazing. Nate is a wonderful manager and Tyler is as well. Dan C. Is the best Baretender this side of the Mississippi. We recommend the Dan-a-Rita. The pizza is awesome too!

We were pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food on our delivery.  Bacon cheeseburger was cooked to order and as good as eating in restaurant.  We just ordered again and would recommend as an great alternative to the typical pizza and Chinese delivery.
I gave it 2 stars just because the server was friendly & sweet, but the food is not good. With that being said, don't go in with expectations & Oo they are very eXpensive for the quality & the area.

I was there this week during their "GRAND REOPENING", January 18, 2016. We all ordered burgers of some sort. Mine was a Turkey Burger. It was made from ground turkey breast, well seasoned and at least 1/3 pound. Very good sandwich. The fries were hot and good. We all thought the food was enjoyable. The best part was the service. Unobtrusive, and very friendly. They were there when we wanted something and invisible when we just wanted to visit. Like they had ESP.
At the table next to us, two people were dining on the largest pizza I have ever seen, It was almost three inches thick and dripping with cheese.I bet it could have fed at least six, maybe eight hungry people. Judging by the expressions on the faces of the people, it was as good as it looked. Next time, that's what I'm going to order.

I feel conflicted on this review...i think the thin crust pizza is really good. We live in the area and get it often. Never an issue with the pizza. However had the buffalo chicken salad and was by far the worst ive ever had. Huge chunks of lettuce, it looked like there was no buffalo sauce on it. It was watery and a weird brown color with an awful taste. Stick to pizza and avoid salad!

Randall roadhouse is very close to
Our house so we go here more times than not just because it is. The food is pretty good (especially the pizza). The selection on the menu is huge. I believe they are over priced on most things except for the pizza. Usually there is a wait so most time we just carry out the pizza.

The Philly cheesesteak and tator tots are usually pretty good.  I'll never order the gyros again.  The meat was way over cooked (a couple pieces were almost completely burnt) and they didn't bother with either of the requested instructions.  No onion and sauce on the side should not have been that difficult.

So I want to give 5 stars for great food that is reasonably priced but the customer service is so bad I just can't. We arrived with a party of five, including three teenage boys all around 6 feet tall. The hostess refused to seat us at a larger table or to slide to tables together, in fact she mentioned that the couldn't give us the larger table because a large party of regulars might come in. So our choice was eating over each other's elbows at a four person table that has one end against the wall with a fifth chair slid up to the end or after complaining to the waitress we were allowed to slide to high top round table together which was plenty of space but awkward. The frosting on the cake? As we were leaving they seated another family of five ( 3 teen boys and 2 parents) at the larger table we had asked about. Oh and when we went it it was 5 pm on a Saturday and the place was basically empty. Never again. It was just insulting.

Used to love going here but they changed a lot. They have great pizza (double dough) and their nachos and cheese fries are crazy good. Mostly because of the portions. But they got rid of their golden tee machine and put in the gaming systems. It's also kind of a drive unless you live near by. If you like pizza and a bunch of deer heads and fish on the walls then this is the place for you.

We have been frequent diners for awhile and love the food and service.
However our recent visit was so disappointing. From start to finish.
Didn't get any server to our table for 10 minutes and had to get hostess to find someone.
Our server seemed irritated to take our table and was very quick about taking our order and made sure she told us this mistake was NOT her fault. She told us they were out of fries and wouldn't be surprised if we left because of it. One of the drinks had what seemed to be a small piece of lettuce in it, but we took it out and blew it off. (another time in the past, there was a paper strip that's used to secure the silverware into the napkins, in one drink)
First round of food took forever. Finally came ate that, then ordered the bigger meals.
Figured the Chicago Pizza would take longer then the nachos but we were wrong. They both came out together and also took forever. Not sure why as restaurant was not busy. Think the servers last comment she made before checking on us of "oh shucks" meant she forgot to put the nacho order in.
When nachos came out they looked different.  We order these almost every time we come in.
The cheese was barely melted, barely any chili and the chicken was cut so large you had to cut it up. My first bite into my nachos I had a piece of what seemed to be plastic wrap or bag.
Asked hostess, as our server was MIA again, if there was  manager on duty, she said yes and I asked her to send them to our table...5 min later the server came back and we told her our issues, she apologized offered to make another we accepted.  Those came back normal and good. One ingredient was missing from our pizza. Not once did a manager come to our table, which is not good customer service. 
One of my kids wanted Ice cream and she came back 10 min later saying they were out and next time we come in we could get some . She packed our food, but didn't realize until next day she forgot to pack one meal. Took awhile to get bill but she finally she brought it and guess what? Not ours!
We watched from a distance and could see her fidgeting through her checks and came to our table.
Seems as though the one comment on here about them caring more about the remodel then their customer service is correct!  Not sure we will be going back. Not worth the money, if the service has gone to crap and the management doesn't give one.

We love having the RRH about a mile down the street. Our agency orders food for delivery every week. Good salads and wraps. The pizza is great - real Chicago style pizza. It's great for business appointments too.
Great  place!  It is loud and typically packed but food is fantastic, great staff.  Love that they deliver to Cambridge Lakes!!!!
Ordered a deep dish pizza for work. Pizza took awhile to get here but thats ok the taste of the pizza was amazing! Would definitely recommend! They have a hugeeee menu as well!

Nachos are huge and pizza was excellent.   Service was adequate at best,   I would not recommend if you're looking to be waited on without asking for everything twice,  or in a timely manner.   The place was not busy,  just selective service.

I made a return trip to Randall Roadhouse. I have been watching what I eat  lately and needed a local place for a salad for lunch. They had a great selection of salads (some healthy, some not so much). But chose the Chef's salad without the bacon and huge croutons. The order came fast and was huge. They had a nice selection of dressings and had a couple healthy choices like balsamic vinegar. The salad was terrific and a bit much for  my lunch, so I was able to take the rest home and had it for an afternoon snack. The service was quick and friendly. I'm warming back up to them.

I've held the fourth star back because of their prices, considering they are a sports bar, after all.  Everything else here I like.  It's a decent sized place, very clean with lots of nice flat screen TV's & a couple of projection screens.  It doesn't matter where you sit, you WILL see the game.  Oh, and they don't have music blaring over the big game either - they have the audio on so you can see AND hear the action.

The service was quick and friendly.  They have a HUGE menu, which we found surprising.  We weren't expecting to have so many choices from a sports bar...they have a whole page worth of items on the menu that's just steaks and pasta dishes.  We did find the "Chef's Corner" area of the menu a bit confusing...I'm guessing those are their "specialty" or "signature" items.  Most places put those items in the appropriate area/category of the menu and then highlight them in some way (which I would prefer) but not here.  So there I was surprised they didn't have a Buffalo Chicken Sandwich on the menu when my hubby pointed out they do, it's just not listed with the sandwiches, it's in the "Chef's Corner".

Everything we tried tasted good & was good quality.  I liked that there were a few choices for side items with the burgers/sandwiches (fries, onion rings, coleslaw or cottage cheese).  But I did think many things were a bit overpriced.  $7.50 for fried zucchini or fried mushrooms?  Maybe they are giving you a pound and a half of 'em, I don't know - but that's the same price they are charging for 12 fried shrimp...I don't know, I guess most places are raising their prices these days just to make ends meet.  I do like how a few of their items, such as potato skins, have a half-order available. And they have various drink specials every day except Saturdays (at least according to their website).
food gross , even the pictures people are posting (the one of the pizza) looks like a baboon ass . omg you people are nuts .

I gave Randall Roadhouse a second chance after a less than stellar first impression. I haven't been here since the remodel so I figured I would check it out. Much to my surprise the remodel was very nice and seemed to be a nautical theme (think wide planks and dock lighting). The inspiration for writing this new review came from the great service at the bar. Dan was attentive and personable making for a great second experience. The food was great and better than expected. I'm happy to say I will definitely be back.

This place is a minute from my house (only lived here since December 2014), and I've been here probably a dozen times. Never disappointing. Never a wait to seat, always good beer selection and great food choices. Love coming here for games or to cure the work week blues!  My wife and I usually get this one younger waiter, white kid who always wears shorts and high tops, even in the winter. Awesome service from this guy.

This bar/tavern has a great friendly atmosphere. Multiple TVs for 360. The serving sizes are absolutely ridiculously large, the way restaurants should be. Our waitress was effective. The calzone was delicious and big enough for two people. The pasta bowls were incredibly large and delicious. I would be willing to come back here again... Again... And again!

I just went here for the first time and really enjoyed it. The food is fantastic and the portions are huge! I got the Cobb salad and it was like they gave me a whole garden. The service was great, they seem to really care about their customers. They have a great beer selection, however their prices are a bit high compared to other bars in the area. None the less I will definitely be back!

The food is fantastic!!  We use RR for catering often.  Pizza, sandwiches, apps, burgers, etc. are all amazing.  HUGE portions!! Very friendly service.  Try the pulled pot roast, wow!!  Tons of TV's, also great for carryout.

3 stars only because of price.  Burger was good, onion rings good and portions were plenty. Service was also good.  Plenty of TVs. The group at the bar were a bit obnoxious. The old guy in the 80s running pants and matching hoodie took it upon himself to sing every 70s song he chose to play. All in all, I will be back, as long as I don't have to listen to his version of karaoke.

Very pleasantly surprised how good the pizza was and would consider a fifth star if they upped their craft beer draft options. Happy to see Dogfish IPA on tap, but would welcome some additional options.
We LOVE Randall Roadhouse Pizza!  It is the best around here! The other food is good also but we always get the PIZZA!!!

Still as amazing as the first time I came here!! 

My bf and I wanted to grab dinner on a wednesday night and he came up with the idea of us calling it in before we left, so then when we got there we wouldn't have a long wait. he is so smart! I called and placed our order of a small pan pizza with sausage and a small thin crust with mushrooms. She repeated my order to me and said we could pay when we got there.

We walked in and told them we had called and they said our pizza would be ready in about 5 minutes. We ordered a beer and then our waitress brought out our pizza....yes one pan pizza with sausage and mushroom. We told her the mistake, and she said how sorry she was and would make us our pizza right away. My bf said he would just keep the pan, but they could make me my thin crust, she asked if we were sure and went to place our order. O well it was worth a try, right.
When she brought my pizza out she said it was going to be free because of the mix up, wow was not expecting that, SUPER NICE, they did not have to do that!! 

I come back for the amazing food and the friendly staff!!
Waited 10 minutes for service, then went to the bar to ask if anybody was going to serve us, same thing happened last time we were there.
Best bar in the burbs! The food is out of this world dine in or carry out! Fast efficient service and the owner Dennis is the best in the biz...
Just got delivery pizza from here.   Crust is soggy and cheese is too salty.   Would not order again.

Been there plenty of times. Old ownership and new. Food is great. Service is great. The two new owners are always there and they are meat heads.  No personality and it seems they really do not care about semi regulars.  We have spent a ton of money there but because of the new ownership we are going to find another place.   I hope they do well but I'm not going to help them.

The pizza is certainly above average.  But I ended up here looking for the best burger in the area.  Some websites pointed me in the direction of the Randall Roadhouse.  I was ready to not believe the hype.  But, after having their burgers on 4 different occasions, I can certainly say they are "THE BEST IN THE AREA".  Every detail is right.  The burger, the bun, even the pickle.  Perfect burger.  

Not sure what the in-restaurant dining experience is like, I've always gotten take out.

My all time favorite hang out during the day. There is much to like here starting with a friendly inviting and consistent staff that works regular hours Monday through Friday. I can't speak about the weekends and nights but if your a daytime person looking for a drink or a great lunch, stop in and give it a try.

This place has been open a little longer than 5 years and that is saying something for a start up local bar in this economy and the reason isn't hard to understand after ordering your first meal here. The food is simply above average quality for the price. The portions are large and the ingredients are fresh and vibrant and full of flavor.

There is something to be said for a great bartender or a great server and regardless of where you sit here, your going to get great service that makes you smile, pair that with the outstanding food and you can't miss.

I am new to this area, and I have given this place 2 chances, even though the first time I had a very similar crappy experience. 

Their food is ok, nothing special at all which is expected from a regular bar.  My main problem is with their "regulars" whom happen to stare you down the moment you walk in like its southern 1920 and you're black.

The worst part is the table with the most obnoxious people, who just sit there mean-mugging and give you a hard time for using the juke-box.  They had a SERVER that WORKS THERE whom had just gotten off her shift and joined them, she just sat there laughing it off with them.

I can't believe how Neanderthalish these people can be, all we did was order food, play some Golden T and get some tunes going.  We kept to our selves and disregarded everything until one of my buddies got shoved aside from one of the guys going to the restroom.  We could have made it a point to take the 3 Twerps outside and put a few dents in their fragile frames, but figured we'd be gentlemen and just leave.  The place would probably put it on us since we're new customers anyways.   

I figured a nice midwest suburb 2 weeks from 2010 would have gotten past trailer-trash behavior, but I was wrong.  Even the bartender was less than courteous.  

It's their loss because we are new in this town and looking for a close-by bar to start visiting and bringing friends and family to.  I will never go there again, it's not like their food warrants taking such hostile treatment;  I had the spicy chicken burger with jalapeno and it was less than average.  Their poppers were average, but they did have a decent Diablo Shrimp appetizer.   

I plan writing a letter to the owner regarding that idiotic server, in case he cares to make new customers. 

To be fair our server was nice, and perhaps when you visit during different hours (I visited in the evening on both counts), perhaps you won't run into trashy people like this.
Generally nice atmosphere, cool bar, a bit cramped inside.  I'd eat there again.  Food was typical, burgers quite good.  Staff friendly enough.  Maybe 2.5 or 3 rating on 5 scale.
Just an average place, but if your in the area and need some food its okay.  I prefer downtown Dundee.

Hands down the best thin crust pizza in all of the suburbs.  Typical sports bar/restaurant combo, but I don't go there for the ambiance.  The rest of the menu is very very good as well.  But you have to get the pizza.  It's OUT. STANDING.

Great local bar with great food and good service.  Inside they have updated all the electronics from top down.  I would come here over the "wing" place to watch a game or two.

Sports theme all the way with great drink specials.

Rumor has it they well be expanding the establishment nearly doubling the size which will be impressive to say the least.

A must stop for pizza, burger and a beer!
The family liked it. Nikki (6 yrs old) gave the fries a top rating. We will be back. Great food and enviroment. Give it a try!

Decent pub with decent pizza...

I think the pizza has a little too much cheese in spite of asking for easy cheese but still when it's hot.. It's very tasty...

It's hard to mess up pizza and beer.

The staff I had was polite but not overly friendly...
Great pizza and burgers

Been here quite a few Sundays, due to the Loaded Bloody Mary for $5. Very good bloody for the price. 
I've tried quite a few things on the menu, and most of the stuff doesn't disappoint. You can't beat the prices and portions though. Most times I end up taking half of my meal home with me. Would definitely recommend this place to friends!

The food here was pretty gross. My salad came out soggy and my husband's chicken wrap had no flavor and was kind of soggy as well. Poor beer selection.  But there are a lot of TVs if you want to chill, drink beer, and watch a sports game.

Could this place be anymore overpriced? The calamari costs more than it does at a seafood restaurant.  The place is way too loud. Also, there are a lot of townies here pretending it's a college bar; sorry, I went to college for that.  I went here for dinner and they were blasting the music so loud, I couldn't hear the people at my table during dinner time! Is it a family restaraunt or a bar for jerks who want to yell and whistle at the TV?   During one of this winter's ice storms, the parking lot was not salted and everyone walking in and out was slipping and falling down. When I got home, I called to tell them about the treacherous conditions in their parking lot. I was told by the cool-guy that answered the phone, " what do you want me to do about it; isn't it icey every where?"    Instead or ice skating across the parking lot, I should have just fallen down and sued the place.  A lot of townie bros here pretending to be frat boys= about as lame as it gets.    Never again!!!  Not as cool as the regulars are pretending it is.
way overboard here,foods ok, pizza is not that great -ok,dannys pizza -elgin the best,drink prices  way too high,service just average,not that fun here ,go elsewhere,i will never go back,sorry

In a land (area) filled with chain restaurants, this is a great non-chain place to eat.  The food is great.  I had the home made chicken flautas with a home made chipotle and home made guacamole and pico!  If you like prepared frozen food don't go here!  My father-in-law said his chicken taco salad was the best he ever had.  The bosco sticks were awesome.  This is a very family friendly place.

The food at Randall Roadhouse is good, however it is very overpriced.  My husband and I have spent 40 on a bar food dinner without any drinks.  They are many other local places who have food that is much better in terms of quality and price.

My husband and I have been to this restaurant on multiple occasions and really enjoy the atmosphere and food.  Its a small place but has a unique charm.  They offer a large menu with plenty of drinks available.  The burgers are very good and the pizza looked tasty although we haven't tried it.  Its a nice change of pace from chain restaurants.
Randalls road house has a cozy bar/restaurant atmosphere. Their food is very good.  I highly suggest their cheesy beef panzarotti, once of the best things I've ever tasted.

Randall roadhouse has been open for about 2 years now and i have enjoyed it the few times i have been there.  They recently won the BEST BURGER award for the entire mchenry county and this award was through the daily herald and done by the people, not some food critics.  

This place is a bar/restaurant with more of a bar than restaurant.  As you enter you notice a very large and long bar, lots of large TV's and a large projector TV as well.  To your right there are some stairs that take you up to a higher level (but still in the same room) to where there are about 15-20 tables and booths to sit down and eat.  Since there is smoking in the bar area, i could imagine on a busy day the smoke would carry up to the eating area, but we have gone in the afternoons since it's less crowded (i have kids).  

Of course i had to get the burger, and let me tell you, its the best ive had in the NW suburbs.  My other favorite was the village squire burgers but these are just a little better.  I did not care for the pizza as much but other things i have tried there were great.  

I would give it 5 stars but since there is no seperate eating area for us none smokers i can only go during the days hoping there are not many smokers.  But they do a nice job of seperating the bar from the actual restaurant area.
Large portions, friendly bar good value. I enjoy this place everytime I eat there. Bring your feed on as will need it to eat everything on your plate.

Great local joint. Fun servers, nice bartenders. GREAT pizza! A little expensive, but you get what you pay for. Salads, sandwiches, pizza, tons of appetizers. Lots of TV's. Loud. We watched the final game of the Stanley Cup here and it was a blast! Have never had ANYTHING we didn't like here. My father in law gets the pepper and egg sandwich and loves it. My husband loves the patty melt (even though it's not as good as Parkside in Huntley). Mostly, we get the pizza.
Great place - tons of t.v.s and a nice area for sitting if you don't want to be at the bar.  Lots to look at on the walls!  Try the huge steak nachos - one of our favorites.

Best bar in the area. Everything on the menu is phenomenal. Must trys: steak sandwich, chicken flautas, steak nachos, french onion soup, fried chicken dinner, PIZZA, quesadillas, pasta with vodka sauce and the burgers. Also, even though  I haven't tried it, heard the chicken salad sandwich is amazing too. The waitstaff takes care of you like family and the bartenders know how to make a good drink. Overall, awesome.
This is one of my favorite go to spots for mexican food. It is authentic and amazing. We have never been let down when going here. I highly recommend Los Gomez.

Loved it! Amazing flavor on the beef steak and the beef lingua. The gordita was nothing like we've seen before --so delicious!  Had grilled veggies on the side as well and homemade sauces.  
A really small place with an extensive and authentic menu.  

Don't let the ambiance discourage you.

Nice hidden gem that you wouldn't think existed in the back of this shop. I've swung by twice for lunch and have gotten the 3 tacos lunch deal both times. The menu has a good amount of choices, but I'm hooked on the chicken tacos. Each time the tacos have been A+. Good value as well with a can of soda included in the price as well. 

The place is definitely a to go establishment with little seating available. Just a small bar seating type seats. Parking is no problem. Wait time can get a little long if you catch them during a busier time. When I'm on my lunch break I tend to want to get in and out quickly. Overall great service and the food will keep me coming back.

Yelp works wonders in the city, but it seemed to lose its magic in the suburbs.  

However, Rosa J. made it work and found "Taqueria Los Laureles" inside a tiny supermercado in Rolling Meadows, not too far from the Woodfield business/shopping districts.  She literally went through three (3) pages worth of Yelp search because she wanted something inexpensive with a local flare.  

This place is mainly "solo para llevar," but there are five (5) chairs available for patrons choose to dine in.  Hubby and I ordered two (2) gorditas de asada, two (2) tacos de chile relleno, and two (2) horchatas medianas.  The total came to $19 and some change.  

The steak was made fresh, which I could see what the cook was making in action.  The Mexican police soap opera kept everyone entertained.  It was a bit funny and occasionally over the top.  Nevertheless, my Spanish is still at the elementary level and didn't fully understand every line.

Hubby was glad that the chile relleno taco was available for those who want non-meat options.  The only minor complaint I had was the corn masa pocket was slightly dry, and the horchata could use a bit more cinnamon to balance out the "sugary" taste.  

Nevertheless, I was glad that this little taqueria exists in the suburbs because we were about to end up at a "Pa*da Expre*s" for lunch.

I eat here at least once a week because the tacos are amazing and best I have ever had.  I get 2 chicken and pork pastor almost every time. Thank God for this place.  My wife and I found it by accident and we now come here on a regular basis.

I am updating my original 5 star review from back in 2014 to 1! Things have changed in the quality here. Very disappointed! Prices have gone up and I would be OK if was good and therefore worthy of the price. (1) steak taco is $2.49! Ridiculous! These use to be very filling and very full of flavor. Now, the meat has a lot of fat on it and lacking flavor. Horrible experience today for lunch and it is a true shame because I use to enjoy it!

The best mexican I've had so far!

The "restaurant" is located all the way in the back of the teeny tiny grocery store. From the looks of the place, the food doesn't look that great but based on the reviews, I had to check it out. There are no tables and barely any places to sit.

I have been here twice now and have ordered the chicken gordita and taco. The food is so amazing here!! The prices were pretty standard as well. If it were healthier, i would come here all day everyday.  They cook everything fresh and right before your very eyeeess. woooo!
 
Lunch time can get very crowded so expect a long wait. They take credit too!

The marinated steak was sooo good. Ordered it in a burrito to satisfy a very long craving lol i made the rookie mistake of cutting it in half which made it fall apart but it was worth making a big mess! I finished 3/4 of it so I have a snack later when I'm missing my meal haha
Best authenthic tacos ever! The asada is juicy and very well seasoned, always a top pick for me. Chicken and al pastor are always fresh since they are cooked to order, and very flavorful.
Great tacos , very good quality food. Look forward to trying more things on the menu.

The chicken tacos here are a major animal. The asada and pastor are also excellent. This place rivals all the best taquerias in the city. I wish they hadn't changed the recipe for their roasted red chili salsa, as the new red salsa has less flavor and some unnecessary heat. But maybe we'll all luck out and they'll go back to that awesome recipe. Call ahead for lunch, as the lines get pretty long here. Best Mexican food within 20 miles, no doubt!

This place is awesome. It's inside of a grocery store and I would have never known of its existence if it wasn't for you awesome yelpers. I ordered myself a burrito for $5 for lunch last week. It was stellar. Very fresh, the steak was flavorful and tender and did I mention the burrito was huge? I couldn't finish it and ate the rest the next day. It was still good although I microwaved it.

This is definitely not a sit down type place although there is a counter with some chairs where you can eat what you've ordered. Seating is limited so it's more of a grab n go. 

I love this place, I want to try their tacos next.

Although the ambiance of this place might throw you off, don't let that defer you from the amazing food!

Edit: Just came here  a second time for lunch again because I was dying to try their tacos. I ordered one pastor, one chorizo, and the third was barbacoa. I really enjoyed the pastor and barbacoa. The barbacoa tasted the best, I will definitely be ordering that one again. The pastor was delicious as well. Both were very juicy but not to the point where it destroys the taco. The chorizo was good but not great, I've had better. 

What I like most about this place is that it's 100% authentic. I can't name a lot of places around the suburbs that think to give you lime with your tacos although that should be a standard thing always. 

The tacos were huge as well and I'm not sure if it was because it was lunch time, but I bought three tacos for $7 and got a can of pop as well. 

I am definitely going to be a returning customer.

Well not sure why the reviews are so great went here and sad to say not good ordered a couple steak tacos with onions cilantro and cheese well no cheese no biggie,  also ordered cecina taco they cook them with grilled onions and chop it up never had cecina like that.
The steak meat was dry and not much flavor, I tried the chili rellono it was burnt like they put on the grill and I had charred meat on it pretty grosse. I'm not Mexican but I might as well be I eat Spanish food once twice a week so I know good mex food.
It was busy and maybe the cook was overwhelmed, mot sure won't be back was looking forward to it being as good as reviews but not.

Can't stay away from this place! Tried a cecina (skirt steak) burrito and it has made my decision for next time even harder. I want to try a gordita, but the chicken and skirt steak are both so good, I like both the tacos and the burritos... and I haven't even tried the al Pastor yet!

I have to say I was very impressed in the way the owner responded to my initial review. It was authentic and left me feeling like we were heard and mattered. 
So we decided to try again. We ordered again at work yesterday--the people who liked it the first go-round--and we were all happy. Food was fresh and savory. We had veggie burrito, with the most AMAZING refried beans ever. Chile renello dinners and steak tacos. I heard the tacos were melt in your mouth. Someone also order the horchata which was excellent.
We picked up the order yesterday and discovered the front is a cool grocery store with a lot of specialty items.

Ok. The place is in the back of a grocery store. There is only counter seats - 7 of them, the place is not uber clean BUT it is ridiculously delicious. This is a gem, it won't last long in this form, meaning it will likely become a full blown restaurant at some point. Take advantage of this place while it lasts. 

I had a chicken burrito, one friend had barbacoa, another had chile relleno tacos, ALL of it rocked! I will be back soon.
Hands down the best authentic Mexican food I've ever had. Their tacos are to die for. I recommend the chicken tacos!

My new favorite place for authentic Mexican tacos!  While I've been loyal to another local restaurant, the quality of the food is not consistent. Just when I thought there was no other option local to my area, I came across the positive Yelp reviews for this place, and they are spot on!  The marinated steak is fresh, tender, and grilled perfectly. The Al pastor tacos are just as good, but the steak is my favorite. And the tortillas are very fresh with perfect grill marks that make the tacos visually appealing. Downside is that this place is also a grocery store, but we do mostly take out so no biggie for a quick grab and go meal. I'm hooked!

Back again less than 4 months later. These tacos are so freaking delicious I can't even begin to describe what they do to my taste buds!  We ordered 18 tacos today because we wanted to try a little bit of everything.  I wish when I made tacos at home they tasted this great!!  No better way to celebrate the 5th of May.  Keep up the great work and food guys!!
Best Mexican restaurant. Everything on the menu is delicious and not pricey. Not much room to sit so carry out is the best option

This is the only place around the area that has authentic mexican homemade food! Their prices are very reasonable for the huge portions they serve. If you have not yet you must try their fresh waters horchata and tamarind they're amazing!

You're gonna love the comfortable atmosphere here. The establishment operates as a storefront for Hispanic products and within it lies a humble sit-in counter. The counter sells tacos and burritos with exceptional recipes.

Great little place.  Let me be honest, I'm always just a tiny bit skeptical when I try and find a Mexican restaurant or taqueria like this place and don't see any reviews by any Spanish yelpers!  Lol all in good fun though.  But I always have to think how authentic because a place like El Sombrero that I reviewed is the furtherest thing away from Mexican food. It's kinda like that hot sauce from New York city!

Moving on from my side comments and history trying to find gems in the suburbs...this is definitely an authentic Mexican taqueria (meaning what's served is likely limited to tacos, tortas and burritos and of course rice and beans). It's a small little grocery store that reminds me of a few of those little shops on the south side I grew up in.  On the back corner is their restaurant.

The price is pretty cheap, especially for the portions you get.  The food is not the bet but it is pretty darn good.  Very tasty and filling.  Their carne asada is okay but I like the Milanesa (breaded steak).  Try this place out, it doesn't disappoint.

And the do take credit card.

I asked Juan Zavala at Taqueria Los Laureles to cater for a surprise 70th birthday fiesta for my husband.  Several friends and I tried the food first and determined everything was delicious; we decided on the steak, chicken and pork/carnitas tacos in addition to rice, beans, and guacamole plus all the trimmings.  Juan was prompt for delivery, plus he checked with us several times during the party to see if we needed additional food, and then he arrived quicky with a reorder.  All the guests asked where we had gotten the food since it was extremely delicious.  I could not make a higher rating than 5 stars or I would have!  Juan/Johnny greatly contributed to the success of our party, and I would highly recommend his food as well as his catering service any time you want your guests to rave about your outstanding party!

Best tacos i ever had. It's those tiny hole in the wall joints that serve the best food, and this place doesn't let you down. I went for the first time today on my lunch break and got 3 tacos but the asada was the best asada i ever had hands down, so good I'm bringing my fianc̩ tomorrow.

Great food and value, but terrible service.  I yelped this and looked like it was good and cheap.  Went in and ordered from a cashier that looked and acted like she did not want to be there.  I tried using a "check in special", but the lady said it was outdated and the special was more.  Paid and waited for me food expecting the worst.  It was awkward waiting for my food standing there with someone that did not want to be there.  

When I got back to the office.  I found the Pastor taco was good and very generous portion.  I then had the chicken and it was ever better with green peppers I had not expected.   I then followed it up with an excellent carnitas taco.  The salsas and lime were a nice touch. I have a big appetite and could not finish these.

Next time I will order a chicken and carnitas taco and kill time looking at the groceries instead of hanging around the the restaurant.

We moved from the city recently -which had many taco choices-  and looking for something authentic in this area. We tried a few spots and they were Ehhhh... - not bad but not great. I happened upon this place by way of Yelp.  I was pleasantly pleased. We had tacos and burritos with pastor, Steak and chicken... All of them great! Highly recommend this spot!! Authentic and delicious!

Tacos were excellent! Definitely worth a visit. There isn't a ton of room to sit at the counter but you can carry out. Very reasonably priced. We will be back - looking forward to trying one of their tortas!

I don't think it could get much more Mexican than this place. The chicken burrito was excellent....and I'm from New Zealand so I know burritos. The location itself is worth the visit. Great meal and I'll be back.

This is one of my favorite mexican foods i frequent, and i am originally from Mexico. The food taste is as close as it can get as Mexican food. The prices are very affordable compared to the competition too. 

I recoomend the most the tacos and burritos. The Tacos are just amazing. I recommend, the asada, carnitas and barbacoa tacos, to be truly mexican add lemon and salsa to each. They are just mouth watering at every step. The tortas (sandwiches) are excellent too and the most fulfilling meals are the burritos.  

Dont forget to try horchata drink or sangria soda.

Very good authentic Mexican tacos, gorditas, burritos and such. Best for meat lovers. Generous portions and nice service. The food is served up at a bar at the back of the grocery store. Good price, great tacos. Start with steak!

The BEST quality tacos in the burbs. The lengua (tongue) melts in your mouth. The carne asada (marinated skirt steak) is cooked to perfection and always made to order. The green sauce has the perfect amount of flavor and spices. This is a hole in the wall (back of a grocery store), but the love and passion oozes from the Zavala family that owns the shop. They care about their customers and providing excellent service. You won't be disappointed.

This location has some of the best steak tacos I've ever eaten. Whether you're in the suburbs or in the city of Chicago I definitely recommend giving this location a shot. Real authentic Mexican food with such an amazing flavor to their meats. The marinade that they use for their meat is excellent. The owner & employees there make you feel right at home & add to the experience there that will leave you desiring to come back not just for the food.

Food is outstanding, love the chicken tacos. The meat was very flavorful and tender. This is no sit down place although they have some counter space to sit but only a few chairs. It isn't anything fancy decor-wise but for fresh delicious to-go food it is perfect.

Had 2 chicken tacos was good and marinated beef taco was better.  Comes on corn taco. My wife had marinated pork 2 tacos good also.  Setting is just stools, nothing special, people are friendly price is right.
By far the best Mexican food EVER. All prepared right in front of you. Definitely a must try!!!

Great tacos and burritos- thank you yelp reviewers for bringing me into the market for really good food.  We have been several times in the last couple of weeks and have tried the Cecina, Lomo, carne asada, Al pastor, carnitas, Barbacoa, Napolitas asada (cactus), and the grilled peppers and onions- all worth repeating.  
I realized how great  los laureles was when I returned to my prior favorite taco stand and found the flavors there to be lacking.
I can't wait to go back and try more!
Leagua is my next taco to try.....

Bonus is while I wait I can pick up a few Mexican  pantry items that they don't carry at the European Markets or Mariano's since its a taco counter in a small grocery store.

As a note about the service.  It's a taco counter in a mercato - so no white linen service but the nice guy with text book perfect English is fun to chat with and when the very nice lady that didn't know any English took my boyfriends order and he was ordering Napolitas asada and I was trying to tell him it was cactus and he didn't believe me she could someone that could explain it to him.  Super helpful.
Just pretend your on the beach in Mexico and try to use the local language and you'll do just fine.

We will definitely be back for more
The Asada Burrito is amazing! Also tried the Chile Relleno Taco which was very good.
Fantastic tortas and tacos! I totally recommend their marinated steak for the choice of meat. Great taste in every bite. Definitely coming back for more.

Excellent authentic mexican tacos at a great price.  Carne asada tacos are seasoned well and the quality of the meat is above average compared to other Taquerias in the local area.  Other stand outs are the chicken and carnitas tacos.  The sauces they give with with your meal are very good:  green being on the spicier side - red having a bit more flavor and less heat.  Only gripe is that you are limited to a certain selection of tacos for their taco special (3 tacos plus a can of pop for $5.99) with the asada not one of them.  Small complaint for what is otherwise great inexpensive food.

Fantastic place.  It is a tiny grocery store and the take out place is in the back right corner.  The menu consists of burritos, tacos and tortas (I have no idea what a torta is).
Burittos are 4.99, tacos are 1.75 (best deal is 3 w/ can of pop for $5), and I have no idea what a torta is lol. (went yesterday so prices are estimates)
I had the burrito and my gf got 2 tacos (which she thought was a quesidilla but I will go into more details on that a little later)
My burrito was godly, the menu is pretty barebones in terms of describing what the heck is actually in the burrito.  I took a few bites of it and was a little disappointed that it did not have what I thought should be in a burrito (beans and rice).  Thank goodness it didn't have that bull crap because it would have taken away real estate from the glorious glorious meat.  I got the al pastor (which is marinated port, I am a huge pork lover) and it was the best meat I have ever had.  It was delicious.  I am not a big foodie so I decide what tastes delicious by how much I want another bite, and Oh how I wanted bite after bite.  The burrito was comprised of lettuce, grilled onions, tomatoes (which I hate and would have asked for them to remove if it was listed on the menu, but again the menu is literally Burrito - al Pastor... and nothing else!), and meat the glorious meat.  Next time I go I am going to get the 3 taco combo so I can try other types of meat cuz goodness gracious it was good.  The burrito itself was not big but it was so good.  In terms of value, I would say it is just as good as those other burrito places (Moe's Mondays might be a better value since it is a bigger burrito w/ drinks and chips but it does not compare in taste at all).
My gf got two "quesidillas" it was located at the bottom of the taco section.  So she thought they were going to be quesidillas but they were quesidilla tacos so she could have gotten the 3 taco deal and had a good old time.  But anyways, she absolutely loved them and she loves this place more than Qdoba (which is her go to "Mexican" food place, she goes all the time to that terrible place).  Even though she did not get a quesidilla she still loves the place more than Qdoba, quite an accomplishment.
We both had a hard time of ordering since we do not speak spanish.  I think of it as part of the fun, I do not think she liked that aspect as much as I did.  
In sum,  this place is awesome.  It is located in the strip mall on Algonquin along with China 1 and a Dunkin' Robbins.  Funny thing is that it is located right next to an actual sit down Mexican Restaurant, screw that I am going to the grocery store for my restaurant needs!
I love mexican food but I am no means an expert when it comes to this delicacy.  So come try it out if you are not a taco snob.
