Portillos always rocks. This portillos is the first portillos I tried  several years ago. Still great fast food and employees are always on it. I am still in awe at the line at the drive thru. They must be doing something right to have a customer base like they do.

I want to preface this by saying I love Portillos and frequent it often (just not this location).  We went last night on our way home. Order process was ok except couldn't hear her too well when she repeated the order back. But that's not surprising for how loud it is in there. But the order came out correctly. 

Down at the other end the girl/lady that was packing up the orders stuffed all of our stuff into ONE paper  bag, including the eclair cake. We had to ask her for a separate bag for the cake and it was like we were totally interrupting her life. When we got home and unpacked everything, it was all smashed because of being crammed into 1 bag. 

The biggest disappointment was that nothing had any flavor to it whatsoever.  My hot dog....no taste. Wife's hot dog (with everything)....no taste. Both our cheese fries....no taste.  I have never had that happen before. But we do not normally go to this location. Maybe people in St Charles do not like flavor. I find that hard to believe though since the other places around all have flavor. 

Hopefully Portillos reads this and sees if this is just a one-off or if there is a bigger issue that needs to be resolved

I can never find an Italian Beef in Chicagoland that is on par with Portillo's. I love a beef dipped with sweet peppers. Maxwell St Polish is fantastic. Hotdogs are always good. I love their shakes and cheese fries. Ribs are good. The sauce isnt my favorite BBQ but the ribs are still delicious. Garlicky breadsticks, salads, chicken clubs, are all good.

We were traveling and had checked into our hotel near Portillos.  I have never heard of Portillo's, so it was all new for me.  I saw that the drive through had alot of cars in line and the parking lot was fairly full at 8pm at night.  I thought that must be a pretty good place, so that's where we stopped.  My daughter had the ribs and loved them.  I had a hamburger and onion rings and it was really good too.  Although we didn't have time while visiting St. Charles, I would have gone back to this restaurant again.

Ok it's been a while since I've been here and right now I'm on my 3rd day of horrific food poisoning! I ordered the Mediterranean salad with hot chicken on top and my daughter had the cheeseburger and fries. When the lady handed me the salad from behind where they make it I was a bit surprised. I said this is it? The lettuce was chopped up with everything else and looked wilted and old. I asked if they had more fresh lettuce and they told me that's what they use for the salads. I thought ok and sat down to eat. I also ate 3/4 of the cheeseburger meat as my daughter said it was too salty. She was right. It was like eating pure salt! I took the meat and cut it up to put it in my salad. That night I was tossing and turning with the most horrible stomach ache.  Since then I've been too sick to eat and spend my time in the bathroom! Horrible! Will never eat there again!!! 

Please don't review this business if you received a freebie for writing this review, or if you're connected in any way to the owner or employees

I love Portillos. You cant beat their food. Unfortunately, this location does not take getting your order correct seriously. I have had two instances in the last month where I ordered something, it was correct when she repeated it back, and got home and it was wrong. I'm at the point where I will not be returning to this location, simply because I enjoy having chicken in my chicken chop salad. 

Again, Portillo's typically has great food, but two missteps in the same month can't be a coincidence. Save yourself the trouble, and visit a different location.

Every time I go to Portillo's, I am thoroughly impressed. Never once have I been at all disappointed in my food or service. Each and every employee that I have encountered has been nothing but friendly and glad to serve me. Not to mention, the food is never anything less than phenomenal. I've ordered several things from there, and never once have I been unsatisfied. The burgers and hot dogs are juicy, tender, hearty, and covered in fresh toppings and condiments of your choosing. Their moist chocolate cake is some of the best I've had to this day and their award winning ribs with their tangy BBQ sauce is absolutely to die for. If you decide to go out to eat or you're visiting from out of town, Portillo's is with out a doubt the place to go.

Portillo's in itself is fantastic for Chicago-style dining with a casual, vintage feel. Hot dogs, fries, tamales, chili, Italian beef, burgers, salads, pasta, shakes, and cake... you can't beat any of it.

That said, I frequent this specific location for lunch and service is quick and friendly. Staff is 110% helpful 100% of the time and the food is always consistent and delicious. Heck, I was even given the wrong order once (soup instead of chili) and the service in righting this error completely made up for the mistake.
I love Portillo's and I really love this location.

One of the few places a family of 6 can agree on.  Something for everyone.  Mother and girls get salads with the chopped as a current fave.  Boys get chili and jumbo dogs.  The crinkle fries are the best and the chocolate cake is tdf.  A bit expenive fir the portion size but food is consistent.  Restaurant is always busy and crowded.

After moving to New Mexico 8 years ago, the first thing we do after landing is go to Portillo's! Hot Beef Wet is the only way to go! Love that they ship also as we frequently need our Italian Beef fix and they deliver.

This location is the best! I had a burger meal it was amazing, 1hr before that I was at stafford square mall & got the worst meal threw it out driving back to st Charles my girl says let's just get portillos on the way. We stopped in & ate in great service awesome food can't wait to go back.

Had a great experience at the St. Charles Portillo's tonight. My charbroiled chicken sandwich which is usually fantastic just wasn't up to par. Mentioned it to the Manager, Jason, and he couldn't have been more apologetic or helpful. He quickly brought a replacement and a piece of chocolate cake. We were very appreciative. No one can be 100% all the time but when Portillo's falls short, which they rarely do, they might it right.
This is a must have! Depending on when you go there could be a good wait. Love the place. Sure wish they had one closer to where I live.

Portillos will always be my go-to. The food is always fantastic. There are also so many choices so it's hard to get sick of it! The service can be slow sometimes, but it is definitely worth the wait. My favorite is probably the Italian beef! It's a must-have.

Portillo's is one of my favorite local spots- and this one is no exception. One of the nice things about this St. Charles location is that it appears to be less busy than the location in Batavia (crazy), and has a private room (unlike the South Elgin location). However, I always feel most crowded in this particular Portillo's compared to the other two that I've been to numerous times. This particular location is very well run, has friendly employees, and has management that I've only heard be kind to their staff. As far as food- I rotate through a few of my favorites every time I go- Jumbo hot dog, cheese fries, onion rings, Italian beef dipped, chopped salad, or the breaded chicken croissant. I still haven't tried the ribs- it is on my list- but I hear they are delicious. Oh, and the chocolate cake shake and strawberry shortcake are delicious for dessert.

I highly recommend Portillo's as well for a private party- they are reasonably priced, have great service, and nice private rooms so your party can ignore the hustle and bustle of the rest of the restaurant. It was a great place for a wedding rehearsal dinner I attended a few months ago.

We have ordered catering from this location for an office of about 80 on several occasions, they are always courteous and provide great service. The food is consistently good here, especially the Italian beef.

Best chopped salad and great beefs!

Portillo's is really a one-stop shop for high quality fast food. I love the wide variety of menu items. 

My favorites are the Chopped Salad (with lemon poppy muffin) and the Cheesy Beef Croissant. 

I also like the traditional Beef Sandwich and the Breaded Chicken Sandwich. 

I think their hot dogs are ok. I don't care much for the bun. But they do make it proper with all the fixings. 

Get the tiramisu or the chocolate cake for dessert!
I always go through the drive thru. My order is always correct. Food is always good and at the right temp. No complaints. The best beef anywhere !!

Thoroughly impressed that the man that took my payment in the drive thru actually paid attention to the fact that my debit card isn't signed, and he asked for ID!! I'm thankful when that is noticed these days!! 

Annnnnd great food as usual!!!

Very Good as always only thing I have to say are the portions are getting very small!
Use to be one sausage and peppers did the the trick today I had to get 6 of them and the sides of pepper you need 2 to do one sausage. And NO I'm not a huge guy or professional hot dog eater.
JUST RAISE THE PRICE instead of shrinking the portion size and be honest with your customers

Finally dined in at the infamous Portillo's. Had picked some ribs up once before, but never took the time to dine in. Typical Midwestern dine in experience with a washboard hanging on the wall along with some steel tools and the other midwestern chain decor. It reminded me a little of a Famous Dave's. 

I really wanted an Italian Beef. Kind of a let down. I ordered mozzarella and hot peppers. Either they forgot the cheese for .50 cents extra or their idea of cheese is throwing on two shreds of mozzarella.

While I like the fact that it was drenched in juice, it just didn't satisfy my hankering for an Italian Beef at all. For all the praise and accolades this place gets, I just didn't experience anything that amazing or mind blowing.

The fries were pretty good. Like that they carry the krinkle cuts and that they were hot!

Prices are reasonable. Food is ok, but nothing I will be rushing back for.

Loooove Portillo's!  I know hotdogs are not so great for you.  But man oh man, they are so stinkin' good here!  And the chocolate cake is to die for!  Every time my husband and I mention this cake to each other, we both begin to drool and fantasize about this cake.  It's that good.
I don't think I've ever been to Portillo's where it hasn't been busy.  It's busy, loud and seems like a ton is going on.  But that's part of the fun atmosphere!
It gets 4 stars because the end total seems to be a bit on the pricey side considering we're eating hot dogs, fries and cake.

Addiction palace right here! I love portillos! Best hot dogs and roast beef subs I ever tasted! The chopped salad is also delicious, the best salad there. I love how the restaurant isn't like any other fast food chain you see on the streets, McDonalds. But, portillos has quick order and pick up stations. I absolutely love portillos!!

I haven't had a bad experience at Portillo's. Fast service, even when the line at the drive-thru is dauntingly long.

Italian beef - 4 stars. Tastes great, but when I had ordered from this location most recently (March '13), it had a lot less beef than I remembered. I remembered having a beef at the Portillo's in Rolling Meadows where they had double the meat.

Maxwell Street Polish - 5 stars. Delicious! Nice snap. Soft bun.

Grilled tuna sandwich - 4 stars. Healthier alternative to their Italian beef. I never order salads at an eatery because I can just make one at home in lickety-split.

Chicago-style hotdog - 5 stars. Perfect how it is.

I've also tried the beef-n-cheddar croissant (the croissant is a bit sweet), breaded halibut sandwich, and chili-cheese hotdog. All were good to try, but they didn't become repeat buys.
It's Chicago. It's portillos. Best fries, best beef, best dogs. Hands down. That is all.
Amazing as always. This place gets PACKED at lunch!

All is right with the world when you enter Portillo's. The team is ready to take your order at seven different spots throughout the line, you pay, and your perfection of a sandwich is ready before you can even get your individual ramekins of ketchup. Atmosphere = awesome. Service = impeccable. Food = unmatched by any other similar establishment. It you are within driving distance? Portillo's is a must.
Been eating salads for years now finding old brown lettuce! Is this due to the new owners? I know for a fact that Dick had his employees throw out anything bad/half bad.
Great Portillos at this location.

I've been in St. Charles three days and eaten here everyday. I think I drank an Italian Beef sandwich. I tried to order a salad and they almost kicked me out. I suggested they put some beef or sausage on the salad and they retorted with, "How about we put some lettuce in you Italian Beef and sausage sandwich?" Touche, and deal! Ribs and burgers too. There should be in house paramedic over there. I don't even know if I have the right Portillos.

Two star's because of all of the other spots which are much better. We've all been here so you don't need all of my musings. The problem here is they consistently don't have jumbo dog's ready?!?!? This unit isn't one of the busier one's. It's mind boggling that you can go to a place that has hotdogs on a sign and they're not ready for ten plus minutes? Don't go to this one in a word "awful".

Brought the family for dinner as we were staying across the street at Pheasant Run Resort. I had the combo sandwich with the beef and sausage, it was not great, just ok. Somehow the bun was soggy but beef was dry, weird right? Atmosphere was cool though and you get the food so quick which was great for the three young boys.
Fab hot dog here today. I had the polish dog with peppers and french fries, and an eclaire cake dessert. WOW good hotdog...as usual with Portillos.
Not my favorite Portillos. No strawberries to make a shake.  Not happy not that complex a menu that you should be out of anything.

Not from around the area, the locals recommended that I stop here. I've had a meal with an italian beef sandwich, and a chili cheese dog, and I stopped by for a late night smoothie. The italian beef sandwich was so good. It's pretty much a roast beef sandwich but whatever they do with it definitely works. As for the chili cheese dog, you can't mess that up too much, and theirs was as good as any. And by the way, the strawberry banana smoothie was probably the best smoothie I've ever had. Got a couple more days here and I am definitely stopping by again and seeing what else they have! For a 'fast food' place, this is a no doubt 5 stars

My updated review is for the following (not food quality related) - just to let people know:

As of JULY 21, 2012 - HOTDOG PRICES (and probably other prices) have went UP:

** 3 hot dogs, including tax = $8.07.  Kinda pricey....

Just take note...

Do yourself a favor go run a few miles and then treat yourself to a chocolate cake shake. It's a really cool different place. Kind of like carnival food and and Italian restraint combined. Very good worth the trip!

We had the party room at this location to gather family to celebrate our mom's 90th birthday.  The room was great and the service was even better.  We had one employee (I believe his name was Carlos) who kept everything stocked; food, drinks, plates.  He even rescued a bunch of balloons that my granddaughter untied and floated to the ceiling.  The food was wonderful as always.  Thanks, Portillo's!

This Portillos has gone downhill, they hired a bunch of high school kids and the place isn't running the way it used to. They didn't even call our number last time and our meal was sitting there for a good ten minutes. I also got an undercooked chicken sandwich here in the drive through, wouldn't have know if I didn't ask for it cut in half.

I don't like hot dogs!

I do however love the chili cheese dog here. Fat girl heaven. Can I also get a side of onion rings and ranch? Yes? Oh dear.

Hhhmmm... Dessert.... CHOCOLATE CAKE SHAKE??!! 

I die!
Not as busy as the location in Batavia, so it's a much quicker drive thru!

I'm addicted to Portillo's chopped salad - sooooo good! My sister-in-law and another friend had both recommended it, but I wasn't thrilled at the idea of bacon in my salad. But oh my. Love. And this Portillo's is good about cooking the bacon thoroughly. Their drive-thru line also isn't usually ungodly long the way it is at many other locations.

If you want to eat inside, don't go during lunch hour on a weekday. It's packed, as expected.

Every single thing on the menu is delicious!  One of my favorite places to eat, so I'm glad there are many locations throughout the suburbs.     Amazingly quick drive-thru service at this location .....never skip this place just because the line looks too long, you'll have your order in a jiffy.    Friendly staff inside and out, no matter the weather.    This particular location has great decor too.   Come in hungry, it's all yummy.

This is my favorite fast food chain OF ALL TIME! My only criticism would be the disgusting chocolate cake shake. Don't ever eat it! My go-to meal would be the Italian beef with grilled onions and melted mozzarella cheese with cheese fries. TO DIE FOR!
Excuse me.  For real?...2 pickles per hotdog...I'm in love!
No better spot in Chicago or anywhere for an Italian beef or hotdog.

i haven't yelped a Portillo's in ages and i think it's time for a reminder that this stuff is FeeeeNomNomNom.

And yea, their dogs, IB's, burgers and salads are great but lest not forget about their....
Grilled Yellowfin Tuna Sandwich.  It's one of life's better pleasures, if you've not already, check it out.

Portillo's is fantastic and each time I go back to Chicagoland I always stop by one and lucky for me they are all over the place in Illinois!  The following items are can't miss, spectacular, total ownage choices for meal greatness.

-Italian Beef (Ask for it with plenty of juice and add hot peppers and you are in for a treat)
-Chicago Style Hot Dog (Great dog and use this in place of fries to complement your Italian Beef)
-Chocolate Cake Shake (WOW, this thing is soooo good and is a great desert)
-Chopped Salad (This is not ordinary salad, this thing has some real flavor and is quite hearty)

Overall:
Chicagoland Staple
Get the Italian Beef Dipped and with Hot Peppers

Having heard so much about Portillo's, I had to try it out when I visited Illinois.  I definitely was not disappointed with my dog, but when weighed against others I tried during that week, I can't say that it blew away the competition. 

They are packed at lunch, so they are definitely doing something right.
Polish covered in sauteed onions and Garbage Salad with lots of fresh veggies, meat, cheese and yummy dressing for a reasonable price in a clean and friendly environment? Yes please!
Chopped salad or ribs outstanding!!

I love portillos! It is always my favorite stop when I get back to chicago. The restaurant is always busy yet they always get the food out quickly. Be sure to try the chocolate cake... it is to die for.

Portillo's used to be my favorite restaurant when I was a kid, but since becoming a vegetarian it has lost some of the appeal (I loved the hot dogs).  I was upset with them when they re-did the Barnelli's menu a couple years ago and removed one of the only vegetarian salad options (they still have a garden salad but it's not anything special), and since I don't eat fish either there aren't a lot of choices left.  They have a grilled veggie sandwich that is pretty good but I don't crave it or anything.  So I can't give it 5 stars anymore, but I still like to go there once in a while for the cake shake and fries (warning to strict vegetarians/vegans - last I heard they cooked the fries in beef tallow).  It's still a really fun place and everyone I know loves Portillo's so I'll give it 4 stars.  If you DO like hotdogs you'll LOVE this place :)

Another plus is that they're almost always very fast and very accurate with your order.  When I was younger the nearest Portillo's was in Naperville and it was always perfect!  I've had a couple problems at the Batavia and St. Charles locations but I think in terms of service it's still at least ten times better than any other fast food chain.

OMG! We love this place. We unfortunately go to a lot of drive thrus in our busy days and this place is top notch. We have been here hundreds of times and I think the most they have ever messed up our order was to forget to give us a straw once. They really have the employees trained nicely unlike some big corporate fast food restaurants.
We can never move out of IL until Portillo's started moving into other states.
There is such a big variety of items to choose from. The salads are good and char broiled chix is so yummy you don't miss the breading. Beef anfd cheedar croissants are so good and the Italian beef does not compare with any others. YUMM YUMMM

So many people rave about Portillos, and as a kid I used to aswell. Not anymore though....

Where is the celery salt? Stingy on the mustard. Their Chicago dogs, although steamed, are not always hot enough. Cheese sauce for cheese fries is bland. The chopped salad is decent but their standard trademark fair leaves much to be desired. Looking for a hotdog in the tri-cities? Check out the cart in the Industrial Park in Batavia.... other than that you could be SOL for the area.

The folks that live in this area told me about this place that makes bad ass hot dogs, ribs, hamburgers and lots more. That Portillo's is the place to eat at. So I went and had the Jumbo hot dog and double burger. Yes they were correct, Wow is all I can say. Very good food and a cool place to dine at. I would recommend this place to anyone who travels in this area to dine here. The staff is very nice and the coca cola is out of this world. Very clean restaurant and bathrooms.
Everything I've had here is good, from the perfectly crunchy/salty fries, to the best beef sandwiches at any establishment, to the chopped salad that's always fresh and delicious. Not a complaint.

Finally Portillo's comes to Elgin. My husband and I have waited for years since we moved out here from Bloomingdale. I have to say, I really like the Poppyseed Chicken salad. I'm surprised nobody has said anything about that? Of course the chili/cheese onion hot dog is by far the best in the land!!!!

You gotta love Portillo's! This restaurant's design theme is "30's Prohibition".

Their Italian beef is awesome! I have them add cheddar cheese for even more flavor. The Beef-N-Cheddar Croissant comes on a huge croissant almost as big as the Italian Beef sandwich itself. So if you're looking for a softer bread, try the croissant.

They also have a Barnelli's side to the restaurant where you can order pastas and salads. I don't like the bacon they put in some of their salads because it is too chewy (fatty). Otherwise, everything else is good.

Weekday lunchtime is always busy, but you can still find a table to eat at. The parking lot is generally packed, so if you can't find a close parking space, you can park in the Target parking lot and walk over. The drive-thru line is usually VERY long and I've seen order-takers come outside to pre-write orders for customers waiting in the drive-thru.

Everyone swears by their chocolate cake. Their strawberry shortcake is good, but nothing special.

My review of Portillo's is for this location only. 

Portillo's food is great! The seating and service in this location leaves much to be desired. There are too many tables crammed into the space, they need to take about 1/4 of them out. 

The service on the salad side is awful. Sometimes you order and in moments your salad is ready while others who ordered 10 minutes before you are still waiting. Just hope you're not in the latter crowd. They just don't have their act together. 

I used to work down the street from this location and while it was convenient I found the Glendale Heights location had much better service.

Portillo's is the best. When I go to a restaurant, I usually know what I want before I get there. Portillo's has so many great items that it's hard to choose. Their cheese burger and polish are what I usually end up getting. Everything from their salads to their chocolate cake are fantastic.
I don't know about all of u but portillos is the best hot dogplace it's better than scoobies
If u live in Chicago, I shouldn't have explain this restuarant. If u don't know Portillo's, GO! The best hotdog in Chicago that all started in a little shack.
Go here often for lunch. Compared with other locations they have people are great and they are always busy. Other day credit card machines were down and staff handled lunch crowd very smoothly.

I'm not usually a huge chain person, but I love Portillo's.  They are known for Hot Dogs, Italian Beef and Burgers, but have many healthier options as well.  If its a Barnelli's as well as Portillo's than there are Pizza's. The salads are excellent as well as their grilled chicken and Grilled Tuna.  With Portillo's you always get quality whether you want a guilty pleasure or something more healthy.  Also if you want a little something to complement your meal the smoothies are very good as well.

It's been a while since I came in, and it seems the new management knows what they are doing, especially since the last time I was in. For some reason it says closed on yelp but I was their on 9-20-16
Starters:
Pakora and Medu Vada-perfectly crispy and crunchy
Main course
sizziling Tandoori Chicken and the super tasty bed of onions under it hit the spot with some nice fluffy yet crumbly naan and some butter chicken which  put me over the edge in a heavenly food coma. 

Dessert-mango lassi to wash it all down and i  headed home to  sleep as if I just had my last meal for a deep hibernation

India Bhawan has the best butter chicken that I've ever encountered. The sauce is smooth, rich and intricately layered with flavor from coriander to ginger and cinnamon. I order the butter chicken with the garlic naan every time. The naan is crisp and flaky on one side but nicely buttered and garlicky on the top side. Their standard jasmine rice is al dente and perfectly cooked.

I've tried the goat chettinad which was flavorful but crept up on your tastebuds which heat and formidable presence. If you can handle the heat and spice, go for it. India Bhawan takes up a sizable portion of the strip mall but it is beautiful on the inside with nicely appointed adornments. 

Their bathrooms are glitzy to say the least but impeccably clean. I haven't ventured to the bar area but their house wines are pretty tasty for the money. Be prepared to split dishes because their portions are large. Yelp has a free appetizer (vegetable pakora) if you do their checkin.

My parents have raved about this place so I had to check it out.  I have been here twice now but the food just hasn't met my expectations.  I would like to give it 2.5 stars.  The service was okay but the food did not taste right overall.  Some items were okay, others weren't.  For example, one time I went and asked for a spicy Malai Kofta dish, it came out mild and sweet tasting.  And after it was sent back, it came back out with more cumin taste then red chili powder taste.  I am generally not a picky eater and don't criticize about my food unless it stands out (in a bad way).  I did like their Indian style specialty pizza.  They are not bad.  Some of their apps like Chicken 65, Chili Paneer, and Andhra Cut Mirchi are good.

Am not sure if I'll return here anytime soon.  A part of me says to give it a one more time.  Maybe a third will be a charm.  Who knows?

I LOVE chicken tikka masala. It's one of the only things a picky eater like myself likes at an Indian Restaurant. I had a favorite place. It closed. I finally found another favorite place, and then it too closed. I found this place through Yelp a while ago and was finally able to try it a couple days ago! SO happy i did. 

We ordered for carryout. My son went to go pick it up, he said the interior of the restaurant was really nice. I was a little worried, because the reviews are like either 1-star or 5-stars, seems like people either love it or hate it. 

Chicken Tikka Masala: was a little bit more yellow than i like, so i was nervous when i opened the container. But i have to say it was DEEEE-LICIOUS!! My son and i both really, really enjoyed it. It was creamy and buttery and fabulous! Lots of flavor, just a smidge of spice. Based on this first experience, It's right up there in my top three ever. I was a little disappointed in the size of the serving, when you're paying $15 for some chicken i guess i kinda expected a little larger container. Ultimately with the extra rice and sides i purchased, it ended up feeding two of us. If we had not gotten sides though, there's no way it would be enough for two people. 

The Garlic Naan was BEAUTIFUL! Is that weird to say about bread?! lol. See picture. It was truly the most beautiful presentation of naan i've ever had. It tasted really nice, as well. Very pleased with the naan. 

Samosa: wasn't my favorite. I still have one left, i'm going to heat it up and try again, but it just had a little different taste than i'm used to. I usually love samosas. I need to try and put my finger on what I don't like about this one, and then will update. 

Overall, i think it's a tad expensive. However from a quality perspective - it was really good food! I am definitely excited to try it again! Looking forward to it.

Tip: per their website, looks like they do deliver! Never seen an Indian delivery place - i think it's great! Unfortunately, i'm sure we're too far away so we'll have to pick it up. But that's fine. 

Definitely worth the try!!

Visited on a recent Saturday evening. People at my table ordered different types of dosa, vada, and paneer tikka.  Pleasantly surprised by the overall quality and portion sizes. Dosas were crispy and paneer was creamy. Sambhar recipe may need to be tweaked.... It seems mild, and needs more spice and tangy flavors. Service was responsive but key staff seemed extremely busy. 
There was a private party that evening in the main dining area. This created a huge noise factor for diners (family members singing with microphones). We requested staff to shut the doors between the party venue and the dining area but they did not.  If I go back to this restaurant I will call in advance and check if the restaurant is hosting a party that evening.

Ordered delivery twice from this restaurant.. Both times food was delivered 1.5 hours late and they do charge a delivery fee!  When I called the delivery is always 10 minutes out. Also one of the delivery was missing rice for the two curries.... Decent food, really bad service.

I went here last night with two other ladies and we were thoroughly underwhelmed. I am sad to write them a bad review since it seems like so many people love this place and also because I love the other location Clay Oven Tandoor in Long Grove. I was not a fan of this location because the service was inattentive and slow. Also, the food was not very impressive and a tad bit on the pricy side for what you get.

Let's start with the service. We sat around and waited for a while before we got water, then sat a while again before we were able to place our order. It also took 40 minutes for our food to come out. One of the dishes wasn't even warm when it came out.  My water glass sat empty for a while and I had to ask multiple times for it to be filled, but they kept forgetting. I love Indian food and I was not a fan of my dish. We were all disappointed in our meal. 

I might go back and try the lunch buffet, but I'm not sure if it is worth it.

DONT have business hours up for Monday if your aren't open on Monday. Hours for Monday are posted on both Yelp and Grubhub. Ordered food on Grubhub - the order went through with an estimated delivery time. Two hours later and still no food. Called the restaurant with no answer. Had to call Grubhub and after 10 minutes on the phone with them they find out they're closed on Mondays. I was looking forward to trying this place. Disappointed with their poor communication skills and attention to detail.

Despite the numerous Indian restaurants in the area, this place is in a category by itself. Don't be deceived by the stop mall location, the inside of the restaurant is gorgeous with modern decorations, high ceilings and huge amount of space. 

Next the service: in one word Excellent! We were fortunate to have Rocky as our waiter and he was the best!  He was attentive, informative, and just the right amount of interactive. He made great food recommendations and really knew the menu well. 

The food....an upscale unique interpretation of Indian food.....simply said AWESOME.  The cut mirchi was such so uniquely made I was blown away. The quantity of paneer tikka appetizer was enormous and soooo freaking tasty. A little spicy but it was perfect for me. The bullet naan was soft and had a nice hint of spice. 

Overall a very classy upscale Indian restaurant with excellent food and even better service. The prices are a little higher than the average Indian restaurant, but you are getting TWICE the quantity, so keep that in mind when ordering. We can't wait to go back again.

Horrible food . We went for buffet and they used stale meat my daughter got sick with food poisning . Gives reason for empty restaurant . Staff was yelling at owner for non payment of there paycheck . Will never go back

New Indian pace in Palatine. Just two words!!! Mind Blowing!!! The food and service is top notch. We tried tandoori chicken and chicken tikka masala,both were perfectly spiced and yummy.
The restaurant is beautiful and huge. Service is attentive and courteaus. Will definately be back soon.

I was at the restaurant yesterday for buffet and was thoroughly impressed with the amazing food. New management is just awesome. Chana masala, paneer, pakoras and Naan - all were just brilliant. Highly recommend. Best food after long time.

Went to this place over a weekday lunch buffet and thought it was decent enough to return. They didn't have the dish we wanted in buffet selection so decided to do takeout instead. Mind you their entire buffet is $11.99 which includes a bunch of items, bread etc at the table, and 2 people could eat heartily in less than $30 with tip.

We decided to do 2 dishes in takeout and paid just over $30 for these, no bread/naan..just the dishes, and all we got was a lousy leftover container with the food. This is the same amount of food I usually get after I've already eaten as leftover at other places like Gaylord or India House. For the amount of money charged for each dish, the quantity is not even enough for a single person. Sorry quantity, mediocre taste, decent ambience... would never do this place for a-la-carte, if at all.

Having said that, buffet is decent in terms of spread, so anyone going there stick to that.

I'm so confused with what do I start with for this great place I visited during my recent Chicago trip.  
I knew Amit from his Tamarind court days, while I was staying in Niles, so thought of trying this new project of his.
We went on a Wednesday night, as I desperately wanted to try their South Indian buffet. I had some friends from the southern part of India. 
Impeccable service and awesome food would be too little to describe our experience.
My friends said the food tasted like home though miles away, & guess what they serves unlimited dosas complimentary along with the buffet.
We tried Goat chettinad, & was just speechless. So was the idli & vada's.
Our server Patricia was guided well through our dinner.    
Great job India bhavan, & kudos Amit , looking forward for the next visit already.

New Indian place in town - we are sure gonna be there. And so it was for dinner yesterday.

Like many others have pointed out it is a new restaurant and one section of the restaurant was still undergoing reno as we were dining. This was a tad annoying at times with the drilling sound.

We ordered the Medhu Vada, Onion Pakora, Chicken 65, Paper Masala Dosa, Onion Rava Dosa and Chicken Chettinad with Naan. 

What we thoroughly enjoyed :::: were the Medhu Vada, Onion Rava dosa and Naans. The vada was fluffy & crunchy! The Onion Rava Dosa was superb in texture and taste.

The rest of the food items were good but nothing extraordinary. The Chicken 65 tasted like a simple chicken fry tossed with curry leaves. The Paper Masala Dosa was over done on one side. This biggest disappointment was the Chicken Chettinad which was loaded with pepper and other Indian spices. Those flavors were very dominant and did not allow us to enjoy the dish. This was such a shame since the chicken itself was juicy and very nicely cooked.

Food service was a tad slow as well.

An OK experience overall. Am hoping to try the restaurant once they are well set up and hopefully have another favorite in India Bhawan.

We went for team lunch buffet today and most of us were happy with what they ate. They have wide  variety of options for all kind of eaters. I loved the dal tadka n white rice. It reminded me of my moms food. Potato fry was good just don't over eat it. Mini samosas were nice too. Pungulu were bit hard on the shell to crack but sambhar compensated it.  Dosas were good and naan was soft but bit thick. Veg biryani was good 2. 

I love the ambience and lighting inside. Will definitely visit in summer again.
Worst experience I ever had today...atleast not one of item is fresh ... Biryani smells bad.I left that without eating.

Have gone for Buffet several times now and have not been disappointed. The buffet is very large with a wide variety of Indian favorites. Nice balance of Veg and Non-Veg items. The head chef is- in a word--Amazing! Spice level is generally on the high side which I appreciate. Tandoori Chicken brought sizzling to the table and Dosa available for asking. Rarely do I encounter Northern and Southern cuisine on the same buffet so expertly prepared. The atmosphere of the restaurant is clubby and cool...Very nice. Large space. Comfortable and friendly. Highly recommended!

First visit will not be the last. Excellent quality food. Good service. A bit spicy for some, but perfect to me. Lots of veg options. Lots if no wheat options. Interesting choices too like goat - but regulars like chicken tandoori. Very nice spot for dinner. Easy parking too.  Eat here!!

This restaurant is beautiful because of the ambience and lights. It has beautiful chandeliers and colored lighting that changes throughout our meal. Definitely a good idea for a date night! The food was great and came in large portions with 3 choices of naan bread, garlic, butter and herb, but you have to pay extra for it, it doesnt come with your meal. 
The wait staff was very attentive, but we waited longer then I expected to get our food and the resaurant wasnt crowded at all. Also the wait to get our check was longer then expected as well. I like that they have two different menus because they also have a bar section of the restaurant with a bar menu. 
If you choose you can have bar food, like burgers, salads and appetizers. Or if you'd like indian food you can choose that menu in the restaurant. I am going back and this place can easily become one if my favorites.
The food was so  delicious and it's worth money of quantity I would highly  recommend server name was patty she was very friendly also

We ate buffet here. Starters were pretty decent and they served us hot dosas which was very impressive unlike other restaurants where they just make it beforehand and put it out there. Moving on to main course, I'd say they have very good options for vegetarians. I loved malai kofta, one of the best I've eaten so far in US. Everything was flavorful. However, we reached at around 2:30 so couldn't really enjoy the food as much as we wanted to but it was good. Thumbs up.

I went back yesterday, and was much more pleased with my experience! There was butter chicken that day, so I was in luck! The servers were better at refilling everything. The tandoori chicken was fresher. I still wasn't asked if I wanted a drink, though. The servers could be a little more prompt at emptying the table. There were still a few dishes that left something to be desired, the one that stuck out from my yesterday was the hard rasgulla and watery korma. My two lunch buffets experience there demonstrate the buffet items range from amazing to just okay.  Keep up the amazing things, and take out the not so great things! Therefore, I'd like to take my 3 stars to 4!

Indian Bhawan has great food. We first went on a Saturday night. Although it was eerily empty, the decor was modern and the staff made us feel quite welcome. We ordered masala dosa for an appetizer and it was sooo good. It was a huge portion and presented with hot Sambhar and coconut chutney. Yum! Then we ordered paneer tikka masala and bhindi amchur. While the paneer was tasty, the okra was amazing. Probably the best we ever had. We had plenty to take home for leftovers. After our meal, we decided that we had to come and try the lunch buffet. So we went on a Saturday afternoon. The options were plentiful and some things were spicier than I could handle but still, the food was great. Hot, fresh naan and tandoori chicken were brought to our table too. We left with happy tummies. 

All and all, the food is a tad expensive but is really, really tasty and we recommend it.

Visited India Bhavan today for their Lunch buffet with a group of 6. The ambience is great and spacious. Well that's the only good part of it. Although we were a group of 6 we were crammed up into two tables which could barely fit all our plates and glasses. There was no place for the breads, dosas and tandoori chicken which came in later. We just had to juggle everything between the little space we were left with. When we asked the server if he could add another table so that we could ease out he bluntly replied that it's Friday and we have lot of folks coming in. Well the place had quite a lot of tables vacant and they remained the same till we had left.

Now coming to the food, there was a lot of variety and almost equal options for both veg and non veg food items. But unfortunately just having lot of options is not good, it also needs to have some taste. The goat curry, chicken curry and tandoori chicken were very low on salt and not very tasty. Tandoori chicken had almost gone dry, probably was sitting on the sizzler for a long time. Other items were ok, didn't find anything that caught our attention.I have had better Indian food in the vicinity. Most of the folks on our table were visiting for the first time and were not too impressed with the experience. I think the place is still new and has a good scope to improve.

Forget about all of your other Indian restaurants in all of Chicago. This place is absolutely the best. There is not a dish on the buffet that was not amazing. Even if it's not your kind of thing, even if you think you would never like it, try it, because you will either like it, or you still won't like it because it's not your thing, but you will try to like it because you want to because it's so damn good.

I would have taken photos of the food, which I like to do, but I ate it too fast and I couldn't stop myself, so no pictures. Just go eat it. Don't even take a picture of it. Just eat it. Today. Do it. Go.

Spouse and I have lived in many places where Indian food is ample and wonderful. This is the best Indian food we've had in nearly 20 years. Why are you still reading this review? Push the button for directions and go.

The restaurant seems pretty unassuming from the outside - located in a small strip mall, in a space that was initially going to be an italian restaurant. When you walk in, though, it has a large spacious, beautiful interior - with a large bar area to the right, an even larger dining area to the left, and a small party room in the back. The decor is what I loved most about this place! It's sparkly, a modern touch, just beautiful - very different from what you would expect from an indian restaurant - word is, they kept the decor from the italian restaurant that was going to open there prior to them - LOVE it!

We went for the lunch buffet to try as much as we could. There were plenty of items to choose from - Chaat, fruit, salad, samosas, pakoras, gobi manchurian, rice, idli, sambar, chutneys, raita, 5 veg entrees, 5 meat entrees, gulab jamun, ras malai, and fruit custard. They bring fresh masala dosas, naan, and tandoori chicken to the table if you want any of them. The food was decent, not the best I've had but definitely not the worst. The samosas were small and delicious! Chaat was pretty good. I really enjoyed the gobi manchurian so I looked past the extreme oiliness. Idli, sambar, and chutney were fine - nothing to write home about. The dosa was a decent size, yet contained maybe half a cup of the masala, which itself was pretty tasteless to begin with. Wednesdays are dosa night, and judging from these dosas - I wouldn't want to go out of my way for that. The veg entrees were palak paneer, dal makhani, mushroom muttar, potato fry, and navratan korma. I absolutely loved the navratan korma: Extremely flavorful! The mushroom mutter was pretty good. The palak paneer is usually my favorite, but didn't have much flavor other than the spinach and paneer, the dal makhani was extremely tasteless, and the potato fry was nearly inedible due to how extremely spicy they made it. Another table heard me talk about the spice after downing a glass of water and they agreed that they couldn't even finish one bite. The fresh naan was great. Dessert was pretty good.

Overall, food was decent - not the best, but there were definitely items I enjoyed. I have never heard of sit down indian restaurants serving pizzas, but they do - and I'm intrigued - I will probably come back to try those at some point when visiting my parents again in the suburbs!

If the owner reads this - seriously, do you know where all that decor is from?? LOVE! :)

By far the best Indian food in the area. I frequent a lot of Indian restaurants so I know what's really good. The selection on the buffet was very good and fresh. The staff is exceptionally professional and will stop to answer any questions. I just spoke with a cook and I think an owner who each came over to ask how I enjoyed my meal. 

Please give this place a try. We.want to keep them around. The decor is very nice too. You won't be disappointed.

I love Indian food and have been to many if not all in the area. After reading the reviews I was hopeful that India Bhawan would not disappoint, but sad to say I was terribly disappointed.  

From the beginning we waited in the entrance for longer than one would expect for a restaurant that was pretty slow for that time of night on a Friday.  When we were seated the waiter (didn't have a name tag) kind of tossed the menus in a pile at us and walked away.  We ordered as soon as he appeared, which took so long the hostess came to our table to see if anyone had taken our order.  The chickpea bread with the sauces was very good, but when it was 30 minutes and we STILL hadn't seen any food we grabbed a server and asked for more and also asked that our water glasses be refilled.  That took 10 minutes and STILL no food.  Took about an hour for our food to arrive and I can't speak for the rest of my party (though they probably would have eaten the tablecloth they were so hungry) but my Aloo Gohbi (cauliflower and potatoes in a creamy spicy sauce) was probably some of the worst I have ever experienced.  The sauce was hot but the cauliflower and potatoes were warm at best.  The cauliflower was noticeably scant in this dish that had an over abundance of UNDER COOKED potatoes.  I thought the price $13 for a mostly potato dish was over the top.  Again waiter MIA so I asked the hostess if we could get our bill and a takeout box (thought I would take my potatoes home and cook them).  After a few minutes our waiter appeared from the bathroom reeking of smoke and offered to box my leftovers, I declined, paid the bill and left.

My wife and I came here last month and absolutely enjoyed our meal. Our server, Rocky was courteous and attentive. The food was better than anything we ever had on Devon in the city, sorry to all those who love Mysore Woodlands, Tiffin Kitchen, and Shera Punjab, but this place was wayyyyyy better!  

We ordered the Baingan Bhartha, Appetizer Sampler, Mango Lassi and Okra Stir Fry, plus Onion Paratha. Everything was AMAZING!!!

The owner, Amit came over to greet us and ask how everything was which was a great touch.  Our server, Rocky made our experience fun and memorable. This place will do extremely well and I wish Amit, and his wonderful staff much success!  We will definitely return!!!
Beautiful establishment.  We had takeout and it was delicious!  Friendly staff.  Will come back for dine in.

Their lunch buffet is delicious.  Great selection of different vegetarian options along with curries, chicken, goat.  I like how they bring the naan and tandoori chicken to your table too. We've been going back on a regular basis because the food is delicious.

We hosted a party at India Bhawan for 80 people and it turned out to be a memorable event with good food and music and very well coordinated by Amit Thanks to Amit and Staff 

Looking forward for  Holi party :)
Great service. Great food. Well prepared. Best Indian food I've had in northwest suburbs.

Amazing Great tasting food. Nice interior. Owner was even nice. However I am not taking any stars away but as other Indian Restaurent they lack in their service. Hopefully they will take this opportunity from this comment to make it even better. But we did got ok service. Nothing bad. Definitely recommend this Restaurent. We will be back for sure for their dosa and pizzas too.
Excellent food ! Loved the service and the options. The tandoori chicken was better than some of the places in india. Highly recommended.!!
Very good new restaurant. . I like food and ambience.. specially service they're offering.. one of the best restaurant I visited.

The tandoori style meats are all I order from this establishment and it's the best in the area.  The prices are a little high but you do get quite a lot of food for the money per dish. The ambience is great as well.  Great bar section with many televisions to watch sports!
I just spoke with Nick, the owner.  A new manager, Boney, has been hired and they have reopened as of 20 September.  Welcome back India Bhawan and bring on the buffet lunches again!!
Food great. Service, not that great. Atmosphere classy. Price HIGH!

Great food! Very few resturaunts will make authentic dhum biryani the proper way, homemade style and this resturaunt hands down has the best biryani and mango lassi (they use rose water essense) we found this resturaunt on a whim and it surpassed all expectations, decor food quality taste and service. A must try!
Overall Good. Great Buffet. Great ambience. Most dishes are tasteful. This location has been our preferred place to eat. Would definitely recommend. Worth a try

Love the India bhawan food.Had Chicken Hari mirch and Chicken Briyani.It was so yummy. I would highly recommend the server name is  Roque Britto.. He made great food recommendation and really knew the menu well.Highly recommend!!
Chaya

This is for a Sunday lunch buffet. We reached here when they were about to close. Wide spread of food than any other Indian restaurants. Chicken 65 was very delicious. They serve naan bread, masala dosa and tandoori chicken to the table. Very attentive staff. Will definitely go back for the buffet. They catered food for VKK event in lemont, delicious authentic South Indian food. Overall 5 stars this time.

The food is great and the staff is extremely friendly. Also a great atmosphere. Ask for Rocky as your server. He makes sure you are happy and does everything he can to make sure you have the best service

Definitely my favorite Indian restaurant in the area...and it seems to be the only place to serve garlic naan in Palatine! The decor and dining room are surprisingly grand and spacious. It is not what you would expect to find in a strip mall....nor is it a carry-out kind of place. The colored lighting is slightly odd and would be better suited in a night club...but it's also kinda fun. Be prepared for a doggy bag because the dinner portions are large. The Chicken Tika Masala is my go to dish and is always spot on. My only complaint is that you have to pay an extra fee if you want/need another serving of rice.

Went there for the Sunday lunch buffet. Pretty large spread of options and they bring fresh tandoori chicken,nan and even dosas to your table. I've definitely had better tasting dishes but overall we were pretty happy and probably will be coming here again.

I would have to agree with some of the other reviews that the service is subpar.  The food was ok but not always fresh.  I ordered lentil soup which was reheated. The few other times I went the food was ok but service needs to be improved.

I have been a customer of india bhawan from day one and make it a point to eat here at least once in now twice a week. 
The restaurant is a new one and all my visits have been just great when it comes to food and service. I have had their executive lunch buffet about 7 to 8 times and all the times I've just been impressed with the quality and the spread. Also, I have dined in 5 or 6 times including their dosa  night on Wednesdays and have nothing but great things to talk about this place from the ambiance to food to service. 
Lately, I have seen some reviews which are not that great but then we can't be rating a place on just one visit. It took me few times to realize that they have been getting better and better day by day as they are getting busier too.  We all have our days and so does a new place. Give them some time and if they are consistent in what they are doing they will do well.
I wish you guys at India Bhawan all the very best and much success, we needed a good restaurant in this area and there you are.
Get some more specials like your dosa night and try harder.
Cheers..

Went with some co-workers here for their lunch buffet.. What a surprise! Beautifully decorated, incredibly friendly staff, and a wide open room with plenty of seating. It's hard to tell from the outside, but this place is definitely legit - great ambiance despite being in a strip mall.

The buffet was out of this world, not only in terms of taste, but in variety of dishes. Somehow, they managed to keep everything high quality and fresh, despite having a gigantic table full of different curries. I went back for seconds, thirds, and fourths, until I couldn't fit anything else into my stomach. 

I definitely recommending coming and trying this place out. I'll definitely be back soon.

I came for a banquet and found the food to be good. Only concern is that they had no one at the front to guide regular buffet guests to another room. Instead I watched the person who was paying for the banquet have to tell people where to go.
India Bhawan has great tasting food Lamb Rogan Josh is a great plate!!!, staff very professional, and the decor is beautiful! Highly recommend!!

Love the food with so many great choices. Indian pizza is amazing!  Had the chicken tandoori pizza which was delish and can't wait to try to the vegetable kadai pizza next.  Tandoori chicken entr̩e is awesome and loved tandoori veggies too but they can come very spicy so you may need to ask to tone them down.  Patty is an awesome server and took great care of us.  Have a decent wine selection too!

I would say its PATHETIC.. been there for Lunch Buffet... I was so pissed off and embrassed.. SERVICE   of breads & dosa at your table is very poor... if your planning to go with family... please do not go for it... food is more pathetic..!!! U might just hve fruits and come back...!!! PLEASE DONT GO FOR IT..!!!

We went for a father's day brunch. The service is horrible. Had to wait 20 minutes for Naan. The place is decorated nicely but they are just understaffed and poorly managed. Tandoori chicken was not included in the buffet which I have never seen and i have eaten a lot of buffets:) The buffett 16.99 which is expensive. This is my second experience and both have been poor.

My wife and I went to the Sunday buffet brunch today, and really enjoyed the experience. Food was very good, and at $13.99 per person, we thought it was an outstanding deal. We've also had the takeout, and the food was also very good, but not nearly as good a bargain as the buffet. I'd recommend either.

It was OK. Came with family here for first time, the only curry that was acceptable flavor for us was basic dal. Vada and dosa was averagae, desert was OK, I was expecting more taste for the price. I don't plan to come to this place ever again. I would give 11 out of 10 for cleanliness, service and ambience tho. I would give 2 out of 10 for taste.

Just moved out from the city and went to Devon Ave a lot. This place is great!!! I had veggie samosas, chicken vindaloo with rice and naan. 
A+, will repeat! Great service and relaxed atmosphere and good tea too!
Easily the best Indian I've had in the suburbs.

Very decent buffet options. I loved the breakfast items like idli and dosa. I generally thing if the buffet is pretty good, the dine would be much better even, which I am yet to try. They even have a trendy lounge area/sports bar. I loved the authentic Indian aura in the restaurant. The place was bigger than a usual indian restaurant.

Service is good,but there are very few options available in the menu. The taste is very average when it comes to buffet. Dosas are good, but not the  best. Only limited number of choices available when it comes to buffet and even dosa. Not really my best choice, I would give 2.5/5

Weekday lunch buffet is a pretty good deal for $15 (tax included). Should be cautious about Dosa takeouts as the Sambhar seems to have been made in the morning and not stored well. Found it very pungent , and quite different from how it is served during the buffet.

That's the only downside I've seen so far. No other complaints.
Delicious lunch buffet. Clean place, good service and most of all great tasting food :) Welcome addition to the neighborhood

From the tasty mango lassi to the perfectly fried vegetarian appetizer platter to the delicious aloo tikki masala and paneer, this restaurant is a suburban gem and deserves a try!!! Ask for rocky, one of the kindest servers we've had the pleasure of meeting!!

Mediocre food but great ambience! Went these late in the evening with friends and family. The service is terribly slow and the chicken starters tasted chewy and not cooked. The biryani was ok but the gravy dishes were very ordinary. The bar is one of the biggest I have seen for an Indian restaurant in the suburbs.

Overall very good. Nice quality people providing great service. Rice crepes were yummy. Food is definitely unusual so if you're not adventurous it may not be for you. If you are it's definitely worth trying as its quite good. I do wish that they would provide some description of what it actually is besides just the name of the dish. Overall good experience.
Best place to eat authentic Indian food...it has amazing sports bar and fine dining. I have waited long time to have good restaurant in and around this area...
Dosa night didn't have chutney at all. No white rice too.. Tomato chutney and chicken gravy was raw. Not cooked properly.. Disappointed!!!
Looks Fancy from inside and out. Food was horrible and the service was super horrible. Will never go to this place ever again.

Went there for the first time to watch a cricket match. The staff, manager and owner were all very friendly and courteous. The bar section of the restaurant was pretty good.  There were about 20+ TVs  around the bar and gives a good viewing experience from any place in the bar.  The restaurant was big compared to other Indian restaurants in the area.  There was ample space between the tables and did not feel cramped.  The ambiance was great and the restaurant looked a little upscale.  We went for a buffet lunch and the spread was generous.  The food overall was good in general but I particularly liked chicken 65 and rasgulla a lot. If you like Indian food you should definitely try this restaurant once.

This is really yummy. Reasonably priced. Extremely good service. I felt terrible when after sampling the Wednesday night buffet, I didn't care for it. I was told it was no problem and they were glad I tried it. They then made me a perfect paneer makhani. Beautiful decor too!

Loved all the food.. There was plenty to choose from. They even bring out fresh sizzling chicken.. Really liked this place. The service is great too. The place was pretty packed on a early Saturday afternoon.

I was visiting a friend in Chicago and knowing how I love Indian food and especially buffets where I can try a little of everything, we visited this restaurant on a very busy Valentine holiday weekend.  The food was wonderful, our server, Rocky, was engaging and attentive and the owner, Amit, stopped by to check on us. No complaints here.  Now all you need is a franchise in Louisville, KY where I live.  I'll be back next visit.  Good job!

Got carry out last night and everything was terrific. Food was ready and waiting for me, and it was hot and delicious. Can't wait to come back and try the lunch buffet. We have been disappointed with other Indian places in the area and are so relieved to have found this place.
Tried this place for  a Sunday lunch buffet.  The food was excellent, the service knowledge.  The variety is one of the best I've ever seen, particularly in the desert
Great food! Absolutely delicious! Ordered for delivery- food arrived on time, portions are big enough to feed more than one person.

My wife and I took my son here on Sat. He said the same thing I did the first time coming here. He said per word... The spice level was perfect and the flavors were perfect. He loved it. And as usual my wife and I loved it as usual. This is our home for great. Indian food. A matter of fact, while we were in the restaurant he was texting his wife to be and was telling her, how he can't wait to bring her to the restaurant. He loved it. And of course I will be back for father's day, if not sooner.

I had dinner with my family in this beautiful restraunt last weekend and we loved everything about it from ambience to service and the best part was food. 
This place is huge and very beautifully done, high ceilings, well lit, classy interior and the washrooms were just wow.. I got a chance to peak inside the kitchen and just to tell you all, unlike other Indian places their kitchen is spotless clean and again huge. I was surprised to learn that they are a Indian restaurant but their amazingly beautiful bar had a totally American menu and we tried some stuff from the bar too and gosh!!! One of the best burgers I've ever had. Fresh and juicy with lots of sides. 
Now coming to the Indian food which I found one of the best in the U.S. Their portions are huge like the restaurant, kid you not. Every Indian place I've been to give you 16 oz bowls or copper handis, this place each entree is 24 oz and you get basmati rice on every table. Chicken tikka masala and Kadai chicken were to die for, chilli paneer and mix grill top notch, dal panchratni was flavorful and one of the best soft naans. Prices are comparable to other upscale Indian places with double the quantity of food. Overall 5 stars and the servers were so friendly and knowledgeable that added a cherry to the icing. A must visit if you want to enjoy some hard core Indian food with classy setup.

Stopped by for lunch here while I visited Chicago for work. I noticed that restaurant was new from the Yelp page, as well as the clean and elegant interior space. Service was friendly and prompt. The main reason I stopped by was because of the lunch buffet, which I am glad to say is worth it. I stopped in around 1:30, and all the buffet stations were filled with steaming hot food. The food itself was filling and flavorful. I especially enjoyed the chicken makhani, with it's nice thick gravy. Naan was hot, soft, and moist. 

Definitely will stop again once I'm back in the area.

I just discovered this place, and I love it! Extensive menu with many delicious vegan options. Tastes very authentic. Will be ordering from here frequently from now on!specially the chicken 65 is delicious.

The place has a great ambience and a wide selection for lunch buffet.  The staff is courteous and prompt.  The gulab jamuns and carrot halwa were amazing!   A little pricey than other Indian restaurants.

Went for lunch buffet today, they were just packed. Being so busy the servers were attentive and super fast. After a long time I really enjoyed authentic punjabi food. Each curry had a different color and taste. They also serve masala dosa with the lunch buffet which was a treat. Will be back soon for a la carte.

Looking at the reviews wanted to give this new place a try and as luck would have it, it was Dosa night tonight at India Bhawan.  After years I had authentic south indian food in the US. One of the very best. The restaurant has beautiful interiors and is clean. Service is top notch and all the servers are courteous and polite. This place is unlike a typical Indian place from a standpoint of interiors,  service and is very classy with terrific authentic food.  They do a lot of other things like concerts and bands on Saturdays, they also have a huge classy bar where they have Karaoke nights on Fridays.  Have to check it out this Friday as they are open late till 3 in the am. At least some Indian place is thinking outside the box rather than the typical lunch and dinner. I wish them all the luck and success and hope they do well as we needed a good Indian place in Chicago. Highly recommend and if you don't give this place a try.... Your loss.

Just had a horrible experience with this restaurant. I placed a online order for delivery. I was told that it would arrive in one hour. After close to 1.5 hours I called to find out where my order was. They told me it would be there in 10 minutes. It took them 2.5 hours to deliver our order. I refuse the order because they acted like they did nothing wrong.  They really shouldn't offer delivery because they suck at it.

The only good thing about this place is the overall ambiance. But that doesn't really matter as the food tasted below average. Want some details? Chicken 65...over-fried. Chicked tikka masala...really? Being a punjabi, let me tell you that it was an insult to call whatever you guys prepared as chicken tikka masala. And yes, it's not cheap if you compare the price with other Indian restaurants, $13.99 for lunch buffet. To the owner - instead of putting more stress to the interior of the restaurant, you should have focused on finding a good chef. Thumbs down.

Absolutely the best Indian food that I have had in decades. We have lived in cities with large Indian communities in the past. The food was amazing. This is better. The Tandoori Chicken was especially smoky and delectable. Go.
Excellent! Owner was attentive. Made our anniversary dinner extra special. Food and service was top notch. Butter chicken and garlic nan were delicious. Check it out!

A wonderful new addition to the ethnic flavors in north Palatine!  I've been anxiously awaiting their opening  - so I was happy to be able to try their lunch buffet today.  It was delicious!  There were many choices:  fresh fruit and salads, two soups, three appetizers, idli & rice, vegetarian & meat curries and three desserts.  Tandoori chicken and naan were brought to the table - piping hot.  My favorites among the entrees were the goat curry and the navratan korma, a delicious mix of vegetables in a wonderful sauce.   Every dish I tried was well spiced with a lot of flavor and not excessive heat (for this white girl!).  The kheer was a perfect balance of rice and milk.  Since I live less than 2 miles from India Bhawan, I will be back often!

I would have given this place 4 stars but because of lack of service, I will keep it to 3. The food was very good but the waiters and servers had no clue what was going on. I am not blaming them for the poor service instead the blame should be given to the management. We saw the manager stand behind his counter and not to anything while wait staff was running with no clue on what was going on and what to do.
Awesome spread on the buffet! The food is yumm.. Nothing comes close to this around this area for Indian.. The dosas, medu vada, sambhar are the best I have had in a long time, they are a must try!

Went there at the grand opening day.  All the dishes were delicious. I would give it a five star for food. Being a south indian myself I usually have less expectations when it comes to south indian food at restaurants. However, their idli, sambar... were pretty impressive too. Service could have been a tad bit better. Overall a nice place to eat with good food and great ambience though. Would certainly visit again soon.

What can I say, I just found my favorite restaurant in entire Chicago. This place has the best of South Indian and North indian specialties. Fresh made Idli, Dosa and wada and Tandoori chicken served with your buffet items and fresh fruit. Other places will cost you double if you order these s. Indian foods separately. Servers are very polite, and the ambiance is excellent. Overall 5 stars. Maybe they can add more variety to their deserts other than gluab jamun, kheer and custard which is standard at any typical Indo/Paki restaurant.

Brought my brother and sister in law here for the lunch buffet. They live in Hong Kong and travel all over Asia, so they were skeptical of Indian food here in the 'burbs. After they had their third plate each, they said, "Yep, this is some gooood Indian food!" The rest of us agreed. Great variety and service, very flavorful, something for everyone, and we never felt rushed. Thanks, India Bhawan! We'll be back many times!

Went out to eat with the family after a long day of Christmas shopping. The service was excellent from the moment we entered the door. The restaurant is absolutely  stunning inside. The food is very tasty, and the presentation made it ten times better. The food came in time even though the place was very busy. We will be back again.

I had their lunch buffet. They had a lot of options and the quality of food was great. Especially the biriyani and chicken 65. The ambience was also good. Masala Dosa, naan and sizzling tandoori chicken were brought to the table
No contest - best food in Barrington.  Add a tasty local craft beer selection, generous portions and a casual industrial rustic decor. You won't be disappointed.

Good guys with good grub.
Kind of zip by and miss it if you're not looking for it. Buffalo Pizza rocked

Absolutely one of the best burgers in the chicago area. And don't even get me started on the chips! They make them in house and they are amazing! The owner Scott is always there to make sure your experience is everything you could ask for. Staff are very accommodating and personable. I've eaten here on multiple ocasions and it never disappoints!

Cooper's is great for dine in or carry out.  This our "go to" place for carry out for the kids.  Awesome pizza and incredible barbeque.  Delivery is always hot and shows up on time. 

If you are dinning in, try the Granny Apple salad, all ingredients are fresh.

 Scott the owner is always there to make sure your experience is perfect.  Keep it up!

Cooper's has something for everybody, given their wide array of burgers, wraps, salads, and sandwiches, with the Buffalo Chicken Wrap being one of my all time favorites! I always leave satisfied, and it's defiantly worth a try if you've never been here before!

Worth the wait for the pizza. If u are planning to have one, think about ordering ahead. This is a cozy place in the heart of Barrington and very awesome staff. The place filled up as we waited for the food. The salads and sandwiches that came out for other tables, came out much quicker and looked awesome. Will be trying some salads next time.

I just had a baby.  Why is that relevant?  Because for the last 9 months, Coopers has been my go-to pregnancy pizza provider.  This review is for delivery only.  We haven't eaten in the restaurant.  

Coopers is yum.  Do they take a little long occasionally? Sure.  Is it worth the wait? Absolutely.  You can count on a solid hour delivery time, sometimes a smidge more.  However, the food arrives hot and delicious.... so who cares?!

Our go-to pizza in the pizza margarita.  It's perfection on a pie crust!  The ingredients always taste fresh.  This pizza has olive oil, sliced plum tomato, buffalo mozzarella, garlic, parmesan, Romano, and fresh basil.  Ask them to cut it in squares instead of wedges... it tastes even better :)

I've also tried several dinner salads and their wings.  Everything is fresh and consistently good.  I highly recommend Coopers for a no-cook night at home!
The Spicy Chipotle Chicken Quesadilla??  To die for!!  Always served hot, with plenty of fresh sides! Don't miss it!  Worth the stop!!
great pizza!!! but the fact that i ordered a pizza at 6:30 pm and it finally got delivered at 8:15 is unacceptable!!   no comp no apology no anything!!!  thanks but no thanks cooper pizza!!!

Someone brought me a salad at work one day and I couldn't stop raving about it.  Turns out it was the Granny Apple Salad from Cooper's in Barrington.  I can't even tell you how good that salad is.  The ingredients are so fresh, the chicken perfectly seasoned and cooked, and the dressing was perfection!  I've been impressed with everything I've tried from Cooper's!  Their pizzas are great too!  If you haven't tried Cooper's yet, you need to!  Better than some fine dining restaurants I've been to!

When I'm in the area...I always try to stop in here...good food, friendly staff and comfortable enviroment....but it its a small place (not cramped either mind you)

I like helping the local businesses because there is a sense of real 'i give a damn about how you think my business is' but a;sp showing this... just being natrual company run as a person...you dont really have to work at anything more because when you put effort into your work...I think it shows....and good work should be recognied...hence the review.

I want to like this place, I really do. They're close to my house, the pizza is pretty good, and the secret barbecue menu is very promising. However, every trip here ends with something bizarre happening that makes me question another return trip.

In no specific order:

1. My wife's deep dish pizza was given to another customer WHO DIDN'T EVEN ORDER FROM COOPERS. This person walked into the wrong pizza place and left with our pizza. To add insult to (first world) injury, there was no offer to make it right by Coopers. I would expect a free pizza, not a "please wait another 40 minutes for us to make you another pizza and charge you full price." 

2. The food is always slow: We now build an extra 10-15 into our wait time when we order take-out.

3. The prices: We ate off the "experimental barbecue menu" and for 2 BBQ meals, a hamburger and a salad the bill was $75. Apparently secret menus have secret prices. I think the BBQ was $20/plate. Ouch. And the $5 discount card isn't going to help this problem.

4. Bizarre policies: Burgers only done medium well. What? Why?

Again, I really want to like Coopers, it's local, it's not a chain, the owner is frequently sitting in the restaurant. But based on numerous experiences here, I don't think I can keep showing up hoping something has changed.
Not sure I'd go back...the place is stuffy and  needs to be cleaned. The food is bland also pricy for what you get. You can find better food in the area look around!
Salads rock.  Great craft beer selection.  Nice staff, fair prices. Parking can be an issue, I recommend the garage or lot across the street.

I am sitting here in the restaurant as I write this review. It's been half an hour, there's two other tables here, and we haven't gotten served the one pizza that we ordered? Also they seem to be severely understaffed and their hosts work at the pace of turtles. They don't have good attitudes either. I've finished writing this review and no sight of the pizza. No WAY am I coming back.

UPDATE: I went back and it appears their cooking time has improved!! 


I soooo want to give Cooper's 5 stars...The pizza is off the hook good, the wings are awesome and their salads are great.

If you're not pressed for time, like someone else shared, add 15 minutes to the pick up time quoted and you'll have an amazing pizza when you finally get it.

Who are these people reviewing this place so highly. I went here on a Friday night with my wife craving a burger.  I was told that burgers cooked anything but well done is not allowed when the owner is not cooking. For health code reasons.  What???? Need this review to go on???  How can the cooks not know how to cook a burger?  What else can't they cook?  I'm not going back to find out.

I really want to love the place.  The food is decent.  Pizza is the best in the area.  But the customer service is terrible!  The man who is typically there (I believe, the owner) NEVER cracks a smile and seems annoyed to have to take care of you.  The last time I was there, they were training a new girl and she just stared at me when I asked if our pizza was ready.  So the experienced waitress came over and muttered under her breath that the requisite 20-30 minutes hadn't passed yet.  Then on the way in/out of the kitchen she had an audible spat with the kitchen staff about what her next tasks at the restaurant needed to be.  They all seem depressed, unhappy to be working there, and completely annoyed at having to deal with customers in any way.

I love Cooper's! The staff is really friendly and the food is great. What more could you ask for in casual neighborhood spot?!

My personal faves are the Mediterranean Salad and the Ceasar Salad. Great portion size and super tasty. My sister and nephew LOVE their Gluten Free Pizza! It's really hard for people with Gluten allergies to eat out, but Cooper's has made it easy and convenient without sacrificing flavor.

I said it before and I'll say it again, I love Cooper's!
Average sandwich place. It will cost you $10 for a sandwich though, which is kinda high for what it is. The pretzel bread buns are pretty good.

I came here on my Birthday a week or two ago and loved all the different options. Even though we only ordered a couple things, I thought the pizza had great flavor and I really liked the potato skins..yummm! I would definitely check Cooper's out if you're in the downtown Barrington area. :)

I've found Cooper's to serve authentic sandwiches, wraps, and salads which are among the most generously-portioned I've had (no bagged-lettuce on a plate), without being over-the-top huge.
