To me, Beef Shack just sorta is what it is, but the locals here adore this joint and the food is both cheap and tasty. You could do a hell of a lot worse if you are looking to grab lunch.

Just like any stereotypical Italian girl, I love a juicy Italian Beef sandwich. Beef Shack is close to my work, so I decided to try it out. I have gotten the cheesy beef on garlic and regular bread. Both were delicious, but I couldn't really dell the difference since both were pretty garlicky. Not worth the up charge. I have also ordered the chopped salad which is great if you have someone to split it with along with a beef!  Sandwiches are made fresh and quickly! Make sure you get it dipped!

I have to say I was disappointed. I recall years ago this was Zippy's and it was really very good. 

The ambiance and decor is interesting. It has a rustic, country sort of feel. Their signage is supposed to look like something from the Ozarks, I think. Their seating is cowhide.

Their menu is very limited. Burgers, Dogs, Italian Beef and for the day they had a Combo special. I thought the fries were okay but was disappointed in the burger. 

Too bad. It's a great location.

They gave me hot peppers instead of sweet even though the printed receipt said Sweet. When I got the new sandwich it had less beef than the first.  Most places would try to make the second sandwich better.

Came to this restaurant for the first time and we absolutely loved their food.  My husband got a garlic cheesy combo and I had a regular combo and we had fries.  Very tasty.  I thought their beefs were better than Portillos, yes that is saying a lot but for me it was.  

Cons - 

Very small menu, definitely not a lot to choose from, we were surprised they did not at least have more options like onion rings and mozzarella sticks.  

Also, I am not a big fan of their au jus, it tasted more like simple oil instead of a yummy juice.

Pros-

Food was still tasty, they do have a catering menu that looks fabulous, next time we go we will place an order on this menu

Overall, if you want a great beef, definitely check this place out.

The cheesy Beef on Garlic was really good. It was a big too. The fries were really good as well. They give you a good amount of fries too. The menu is not that big, but if you want a top notch beef and fries this is the place to go.
First visit food was fresh service was awesome. The beef is better than Portillo's on the real. I loved it!!!!

Love me some beef shack.

Beef:
The beefs are very flavorful and come with the standard offerings (hot/sweet peppers, au jus) but what I also appreciate is that they offer a 'half' size. Sometimes I want an Italian beef, but a whole sammich is too much....especially when ordering fries (and potentially a shake). On one occasion, I requested sweet peppers and only got one pepper. It was a bummer, but I've forgiven them since then and not too worried about future visits.

Fries:
Greasy, fresh cut fries; so awesome. Dunk 'em in ketchup, or eat them plain; you can't go wrong. If you REALLY want to up the ante....go for the "Shack Sauce". You won't be disappointed, however it MAY ruin fries for you at other locations. I'm giving you a fair warning.

I know Beef Shack is my go to beef spot, because I live really close to a Buona location & honestly don't even hesitate when I drive by BB to head to the Shack...
Despite being somewhat difficult to access (thanks to the Valli parking lot) Beef Shack is undoubtedly awesome.
This place is awesome!!! Best cheezy garlic beef in Chicago! They do have a few locations- so if u r in the area.... Definitely try them!! You will not be disappointed!!

Had the cheesy beef and fries. So yummy! I ordered the regular size and it was huge. Bigger than what you would expect from a beef joint. Meat was tender and juicy. Lots of mozzarella on this sandwich. The fries were hand cut and I ordered them with cheese. 

My daughter (11) had the grilled cheese sandwich. She's my picky eater but she devoured the entire sandwich without a complaint. 

My son (9) had a plain burger. The kid is not big on cheese (he does not get this from me lol). The burger was char grilled and very good.

My husband ordered the combo with cheese. Another winner

Be prepared to wait a few minutes for your order as it takes time to create perfection. Trust me you won't be disappointed
Just as amazing as the st. Charles location. Great staff! I like the seating here because it's more kid friendly than the stools at the other location.
GREAT FOOD & GREAT SERVICE. I stop by every time I'm in the neighborhood. Highly recommend, best beef I've ever had...and I've had them all! Sleeper item on the menu..the CHEESE BURGER!

What a great location & the food is absolutely phenomenal.  I recently returned here after a few months.  My first meal here was a five star experience & after returning here agin I got to experience the same five star meal.  

Right away a few things stand out to you as you walk in the doors.  The place doesn't look like some cheap fast food restaurant.  Most hot dog & beef establishments just throw the place together & call it a restaurant & cut costs on making it look nice but not this place.  This place looks like they spent a lot of money just to make it look nice.  The wood paneling gives it an upscale high class look which I can't say I have ever seen with a restaurant that serves hot dogs & Italian beefs.  

Next, the food which is the most important part is also the best.  They offer three different types of Italian beefs.  They offer a regular Italian beef, a "cheezy Italian beef" & lastly a "cheezy beef on garlic.  All of the beefs are available in a regular size or a mini size for almost half the cost of the regular.  The regular is a very generous portion.  The "cheezy beef" on garlic" is hands down the best Italian beef sandwiches I have had & that is saying a lot especially with the competition in town.  

I usually am not a huge fan of getting burgers when I go out but the burgers here are delicious.  The burgers are Angus beef & it is a pretty large portion.  They also have a special sauce called "Shack sauce".  This sauce is a game changer.  Every time I have been here I have asked for extra sauce & I usually order something else just to dip it in the "Shack sauce".  For drinks you can get a 24 oz cup for $1.89 & it is fountain drinks so you can have as much as you want.  

The hot dogs here won't disappoint either.  All of the hot dogs are Vienna beef.  They offer two different kinds.  They have the regular dog or the double dog.  If you are looking for an option that is healthier than Italian beefs, bugers or hot dogs, they do have a Shake salad.  As for the french fries they are all fresh cut & seasoned very well.  

This particular Beef Shake location does have a drive thru.  

Overall you can't go wrong by eating here.  They don't have a hundred items on the menu because the items they do have on it have been perfected.  It is always a good experience eating here & I look forward to eating here again.

Fries were ok like five guys 
Beefs was like zippys just smaller needs more beef three to 4 slices on a beef is a joke and the shack sauce is just thousands island 
2 garlic cheese Beefs 
One cheese fry with shack sauce 
One drink = $23 buck 
The place was dead we was the only people in there 
First and last time we will go

I didn't like the food , hot dog  was poor it came with regular relish no tomatoes or pickles , the fries were ok and beef was on toast bun . Definitely not the Chicago food I remember.  Should 've gone to portillos

Oh my GAWD!! If you want and/or are looking for a really good, FANTABULOUS beef sandwich on garlic bread with mozzarella, this is the place to go! Definitely the BEST Italian beef sandwich around; and the fries... YuMMMMM! If you like real potatoes, their fresh cut fries are super great! There aren't too many places that I can think of that have fresh cut fries. I do LOVE fresh cut fries over regular french fries. 

It might seem just a tad pricey but, for what you get, it's not bad. The sandwich is quite large. One bag of fries can be shared by two (unless you really love fresh cut fries a lot, in that case, get your own bag)! Free refills on drinks. 

Besides Nana's in Streamwood, now I know where else to go for those fresh cut fries (which I can't stop raving about) as well as that beef sandwich on garlic bread! LOL

I would give them 10 stars!!

My family and I will certainly be going back!!
This place is really good.  I do not like spicy or zesty beef and this is perfect.  I love the beef sandwiches.  Their shack sauce is to die for as well.   We return often.

Holy sh*t Beef Shack, where the hell have you been all my life?!?  People, forget Portillo's if you want Italian beef and head straight here.  Yea, it seems slightly pricey at first, but once you take that first bite of the cheezy beef, extra wet, you'll be willing to cash in your 401k if need be.  And the fresh cut fries are simply incredible.   Just the right amount of crunch, creamy insides, and cooked in fresh oil so there's no nasty greasy aftertaste. 

Haven't had anything except the beef and fries, so I can't comment on the other coupe of things they have there.  But with a name like Beef Shack, why would you have anything but?

I don't get it. I don't know why this place doesn't have lines around the building. Their food is delicious. Beef, hot dogs and fresh cut fries!  Fresh and good. Must be the parking lot and congested area.  Give it a try. It really is worth it. I love this place.

Barely edible.

Barely any beef on the sandwich.  Over cooked and soggy fries.  Hot dog with very firm casing, no fresh pickle, no fresh tomato, very squished with overcooked and soggy fries.   I really don't understand where the four and five star reviews come from.
Forget  portillos  and look no more..the cheesy beef is outstanding...you must order  on the garlic bread.the home cut fries are excellent

Forget  portillos  and look no more..the cheesy beef is outstanding...you must order  on the garlic bread.the home cut fries are excellent

Looks great really fresh ingredients, would have been great toasting the bun with a little seasoning. I guess it reminded me of a in and out which I thought was mediocre. Last time I hade their cheesy beef on tiSte garlic bread. That will be my go to .

Mouth-watering! Have been to the Belmont Ave location so I already know how incredibly delish the Italian beef is there, so when I was nearby to this location I couldn't help myself. This makes 4 days in one week - yes it's that good; especially when I have only one week here before heading back home to CA. As I'm about to write this review I noticed some unfavorable reviews, and out of sheer curiosity I have to read them to know what there could be to complain about. After reading them, I'm convinced they're bullcr@9. Specifically addressing the "grease" left on the paper - seriously? It's the LEAST greasy of any Italian beef sandwich I've ever had! That's the generous au jus, on the most generous portion of delicious lean beef you'll ever get on a sandwich. I rarely eat fries, but have to make the exception for these. Try them, unlike anywhere else, THE BEST, well worth the calories. And order their special cheese sauce to dip them in, unfrikkenbelievable. Watched someone who special ordered them smothered in mozzarella with bacon, raving about them. Both the cheesy beef and the regular Italian beef, with the best sweet peppers ever, are seriously award-winning sandwiches. Guarantee, Beef Shack will not disappoint. So dang addicting.

Get your mind out of the gutter! This place serves food not scantily clad gentlemen. 

It's new & improved & I think for the better. I wasn't a big fan of Zippy's and although Beef Shack uses the same building, some of the same menu items and apparently has the same management, I like it much better. Michele K. is right on that the interior and exterior remind me of a quick service restaurant I'd find at Disney World. To me, that's not a bad thing at all although I could see how it could put some people off. 

The menu is simple - burgers, dogs, beef & fries. I went with a couple of coworkers and had myself the double dog. Not a bad deal at all for under $5 plus it came with a very generous serving of fries. I loved their fries! They were beyond greasy...but...they're fries. It's to be expected. The flavor and cut of the fries was spot on but just know the grease on the fries may just eat through the bag. I recommend getting a tub of their special Shack Sauce to dip the fries in. It's much better than having plain ol' boring ketchup. I got my double dog plain and it had standard Vienna beef hot dogs on a plain bun. Nothing fancy, but I enjoyed it.

Beef Shack has a drive thru and a decently sized dining room. It gets quite busy at lunch! I will absolutely be back as my coworkers all raved that the beef is better than Portillo's!

I've tried the beef and the cheese burgers here both were very very VERY good!!

Cheeseburger was cooked medium well (perfect for me) with grilled bun and fresh lettuce and tomato ( i requested no chipoile mustard.) Fries are a good large portion, home made and cooked in hot enough oil to not be too greasy.
 
  I tried a reg beef w sweet peppers a few months ago and it was a good portion, very flavorful and comparable to the best beef sandwich shops in the area, if not the best.

Service wait was not too long for a beef, and i called in the burger order, paid for it and walked out with it 2 minutes later.

This is a rehash of zippy's.

I can only vouch for the cheezy beef on garlic. It's the best! The combination of the bread, garlic flavor, roast beef, au jus and mozzarella is heavenly. I am of the opinion that I wish the beef was shredded and more flavorful like johnnies in Arlington heights but... Johnnies can't compete with the garlic spread and cheese.

The only reason it's 4 instead of 5 stars... I desperately miss the waffle fries that zippy's had. Beef shack now has hand cut fries done in peanut oil I think. The times I've got them they are hit and miss. Sometimes over done and soggy, sometimes light and crispy perfection. Even with inconsistency, I'm sure the new fresh fries are better/healthier than the previous waffle fries... But charge us more! Bring hem back??? Please???

Great lunch place though, happy they take "BELLY" rewards. Take advantage of that for free fries!

"Beef Shack, baby. That's where it's at." 

The Beef Shack just opened and although the name goes perfect with the B-52s song, I found the experience to be mediocre. The remodeling is a huge improvement from the previous Zippy's and the restaurant is well staffed and managed well but the food itself didn't quite leave an impression. 

What's better than a regular Italian beef? Cheesy Italian beef with sweet peppers on garlic bread. We also got the angus cheeseburger and fries with the Shack sauce. Although the Italian beef was a foot long, I couldn't help but think of Portillo's and for a $5 cheeseburger, it didn't quite measure up to Five Guys or Smash Burger. It'll be hard to stand out amongst these giants that do beef so well. 

With a limited menu, I was hoping that Beef Shack would offer something unique but it fell short of expectations.
Don't bother there's a lot more Chicago beef stands around which is 10 times better than this place
Skimpy sandwiches, RUDE ASS WORKERS, best bet is PORTILLO'S down the street !!! Highly don't recommend this horrible place !!!

Cheesy beef on garlic bread!!!    Awesome!!!!!

Fresh cut fries are great!!!

Menu is limited - beef, hot dog, burger, fries... That's about it....  But, you don't need to order anything except the beef anyways!!!!

Great "Combo" and fresh cut fries!  Drove by this place a million times and now I wish I woulda have stopped sooner! This is my new favorite place in this area... Look on Local Flavor for discounts and coupons ;}

This is one of my favorite places nearby to order beefs. I'm not sure what kind of bread is used but thats my favorite part! The burgers are also WAY good!! I only give Beef Shake four stars due to the lack of options for my son. Other than that, love it.

I love their hot dogs w/ fresh cut fries. 

Very clean, organized, and have an excellent customer satisfaction oriented staff. 

I believe this is the best place in 5 to 10 mile radius. Great management! These guys are serious. No high school screw ups here

Good job guys.

IBB

The Cheezy Beef was better the second time around, with a great balance of flavor and texture.  It had the perfect amount of cheese, and the garlic roll had more bite to it without being crusty.  The beef, like the first time, was fantastic.  I also got fast and friendly service, which is always a plus.  The management really cares about the customer experience so that should certainly be applauded. I would definitely come back again.
Beef is good but greasy.  Not a fan of the a-la-cart menu. Also a little pricey. Will return but not too frequently.

I scrounged together $4 for a mini beef to satisfy some serious hunger pangs. And, frankly, it was four bones very well spent. And while I could've probably taken down a full size sammich, my pants are grateful that I pulled back a bit!

I frequented this location quite a bit in my teens when it was Zippy's, and I'm pretty stoked that the new owners kept similar offerings with Beef Shack. The menu is pretty limited (at least in the drive through - I didn't walk in), a few types of beef offered various ways, a handful of sides, beverages, and a salad option. I chose the mini cheezy beef with sweet peppers. Giving myself a pat on the back for that one. 

I see more beef shackin' in my future!
Good food, but terrible service.  If you can deal with poor customer service, then try it, but otherwise stay clear.

The Beef Shack is a little old place where, we can get together. Well.. not at this one but we'll get to that a little later We'll start this review with a story. A long long time ago I visited a place in Saint Charles called Beef Shack and I was pleased with the depression dog and fresh cut fries at a good value. Some time later I saw that a long time favorite spot of mine called Zippy's had closed, but in its place there was a sign mentioning a new Beef Shack would be opening soon. As the days went by Beef Shack eventually opened up and one day I finally had the opportunity to stop by this beef shack and give it a try.

In visiting the Beef Shack I decided to go with the hot dog that I had at the other location along with a cheesy beef. The inside had the same rustic wood decoration of the Saint Charles location and I had expected my food would be the same in quality. I placed my ordered, looked around at how they re-decorated and waited for my order to be ready. Besides adding lots of wood paneling they replaced a lot of the tables with and added stools with cow patch looking art on them.

Once my order was ready it was time to dig in, the first thing I tried was the hot dog. It was absolutely buried in fries. These were fresh cut fries but didn't taste quite as good as the ones served at the Saint Charles location. They were very greasy and had a strange cooking oil flavor that really didn't sit well with me. After I buried my hot dog out of the pile of fries I noticed it was covered with grease and residue from the  fries. The bun was almost completely soaked, my hot dog was a natural casing sausage with very very light condiment application except for relish which was excessively added. The bun was seedless and there were a few sport peppers on it. Despite quality ingredients being used here this was a messy hot dog, a sloppily prepared hot dog, and just a bad hot dog overall.

Now being called the Beef Shack I thought, "well maybe the Cheesy Beef here is better". Well, I opened it up to see some almost hardened mozzarella cheese on the outside. The bread was tasty but a bit on the hard side with spots that were soft and spots that were too firm. The beef itself was very very bland, it could have been Arby's roast beef only I think that has a little more flavor to it. They were also very conservative in the amount of beef they put on the sandwich, this combined with the less than optimal bread meant you tasted the bread more than the beef. The cheese was okay but wasn't soft in any way shape or form and had the consistency and appearance of that elmers glue you would use to make projects with in elementary school. My overall opinion is that this was a bad Beef sandwich though it was not worse than the hot dog which was ruined by grease from the awful fries. 

I've definitely had worse hot dogs, but going in with expectations of this being like the Saint Charles Beef Shack I came away thoroughly disappointed. I definitely miss the Zippy's that was previously occupying this spot as they had excellent chicken sandwiches and waffle fries. If you want a huge pile of nasty greasy fries and bland beef served on questionable bread then Beef Shack in Hoffman Estates is the place for you. Instead of calling it Beef Shack perhaps the "S" in the front of the second word in the title should be moved to the back of so it would be called Beef Hacks. I genuinely regretted having eaten here. One star for the Beef Shack in Hoffman Estates.

Roommates and I are regulars here!  Love the food! The service is ALWAYS great !  The prices are totally reasonable ! The only suggestion I have is to offer a smaller french fry size....great for 2 people but if you're by yourself its way too much.   MANNY are you listening ???  Lol after eating at fratos and having to throw it in the trash .... the shack is the place to be !

I love this place. Menu is limited which is great I don't have to look at the menu for 20 minutes trying to decide what to eat. Everything is delicious. I also like how they are on
 restaurant. com. Only downfall is there is absolutely nowhere to change your childs diaper. No changing table at all.
Great food.  Recently tried the steak burger and it's excellent.  Fresh cut fries are delicious.

I love their hot dogs w/ fresh cut fries. 

Very clean, organized, and have an excellent customer satisfaction oriented staff. 

I believe this is the best place in 5 to 10 mile radius. Great management! These guys are serious. No high school screw ups here

Good job guys.

IBB

The Cheezy Beef was better the second time around, with a great balance of flavor and texture.  It had the perfect amount of cheese, and the garlic roll had more bite to it without being crusty.  The beef, like the first time, was fantastic.  I also got fast and friendly service, which is always a plus.  The management really cares about the customer experience so that should certainly be applauded. I would definitely come back again.
Beef is good but greasy.  Not a fan of the a-la-cart menu. Also a little pricey. Will return but not too frequently.

I chose the mini cheezy beef with sweet peppers. Giving myself a pat on the back for that one.

The only suggestion I have is to offer a smaller french fry size....great for 2 people but if you're by yourself its way too much.   MANNY are you listening ???  Lol after eating at fratos and having to throw it in the trash .... the shack is the place to be !

I love this place. Menu is limited which is great I don't have to look at the menu for 20 minutes trying to decide what to eat. Everything is delicious. I also like how they are on
 restaurant. com. Only downfall is there is absolutely nowhere to change your childs diaper. No changing table at all.
Great food.  Recently tried the steak burger and it's excellent.  Fresh cut fries are delicious.

beef shack looks like the krusty krab so I never wanted to go...

but one day i decided to go and i must say... beef shak's italian beef is the best italian beef ive ever tasted!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

cheezy beef forever!!!!!!!!! 

p.s. do not get the garlic cheezy beef. its average.

Once again I have been disappointed by this place, for me it will be the last time, I'm disappointed enough to take the time to write a review, each time I have gone here and ordered a hot dog and burger I've sat in the drive thru watching my hot dog cooling off sitting on the counter while I waited for the burger to cook, to most that my not be a big deal, I prefer all my food to be as hot as it could be, today I brought in a coupon that if I purchased a sandwich, fries and drink I would get a sandwich of equal or lesser value for free, I was told it didn't count that the fries came with the hot dog even though you would have to pay the same even if you didn't want the fries, I still got suckered into paying $2.00for a .12 drink, last time I stop at the Beef Shack, I expect they will be gone in the next year or so.

Not for the calorie conscious I'm sure but their beef sandwiches are absolutely delicious!! I never understand why they are never busy because their food is very good for "fast food". Don't hesitate to try it...but tip would be they are very messy so don't try to eat on the go! :)
great place and reasonable . fries remind me of five guys . Restaurant. Com has a great deal is you want to try this place out.

Good cheesy beef sandwich in garlic bread with peppers. 

Fries were really good and they give you enough to serve almost 2 people.
Actually if you get a full beef sandwich share the fries it will be more than enough. I got a mini beef sandwich and a fries and I was pretty full.

Solid beef for a suburban joint.

Try it out.
Best beef sandwich and fresh cut fries you'll find anywhere! The toasted bun makes it perfect.
Cheesy Beef with hot peppers and fresh cut fries is my go to and is always great!!  We got delivery to our office and it was super quick.

Great tasting beef sandwiches. In my opinion the beef here is better than Portillios.  I would recommend this restaurant if you enjoy beef sandwiches.  The menu is limited with hot dogs, beefs or hamburgers.
The only negative is the parking lot and during lunches it was hard to get a parking space.
Should specify that a 15 dollar minimum is required for delivery. Kind of ridiculous since one person is hardly going to polish off 15 dollars worth of food.
We go here often and like it better than any other place around. Great sandwiches and nice people work here. Better than Portillos.
The beef sandwich is okay but not half as good as Portillo's.  The concept of fresh cut fries is great, but they are so greasy I can feel my arteries clogging up!

First time here today. Ordered a "Cheezy beef" with hot pepperz, and friez with "shack sauce." Gotta admit... I was pretty impressed. They weren't "chinsy" on the cheeze (or hot pepperz), the beef could've been more thinly sliced (though, still tasty / juicy), but it was the bread that was on-the-money. Flavorful and nicely toasted. (It never decintergrated while in the palmz of my clutchez) And the friez were much like 'Gene & Judez,' so a total WIN. I got the "Shack Sauce" to add a lil' adventure. Good (and interesting), but not really necessary. Still think 'Johnnys' will alwayz be my favoritest spot in Chicagoland for beef, but this may be my new, "runner-up," second choice. Can't wait to come back and explore some of the other menu optionz. (SOON) Gotta give 'The Beef Shack' a BIG thumbz up.

Ok, the staff here is less than friendly, but in this area (and I have to say it) they have one of the best beef sandwiches I've ever had.  The fries are good too.  You will pay more than you expect and for some it's not worth it.  But the beef is good.

Might be my new favorite beef. I've already been here 3 times.
I love that they load on the cheese, and then melt it.  This gives the fresh bread just the nicest little crunch.  Well flavored beef.  I'm a hot peppers guy, which weren't overpowering- just enough on the samich.  I've had both the reg. cheesy beef and the garlic; I did think the garlic was a bit overpowering which took away from tasting the beef, but was still very good.
The fresh cut fries even held up well to doing takeout and getting all the way back to the office for lunch. mmmm.
They just need to add shakes & malts.

No bendy straws here.  :P
Big beef sandwich on garlic bread with green peppers, topped wirh mozarella cheese !!!! Delish !!! Oh and those delicious fresh fries!!!  Yum. Will certainly be back!!!

Was bummed out when zippys closed down, glad to see another beef joint take its place. 
I got a cheesy beef on garlic bread, fries and a drink.
Beef = meat itself was good but the bread was too buttery.
Fries= fresh cut and delicious.
Staff was pleasant and quick.

I have eaten here many times so obviously I like it! First the fries are absolutely amazing, I love fresh cut fries and these really hit the spot for me! They can be greasy, but they are fried! They make them fresh with each order, nice touch! Their hot dogs are good, nicely cooked with the right amount of condiments. I have had their grilled cheese as well, it is a big sandwich and has three types of cheese on it. I liked it, but I think its missing something, can't put my finger on it though. I haven't tried their beefs but the bf says they are delicious! This is a regular spot for me.

I've been watching them remodel this building for months on end as I eagerly awaited the chance to taste the menu. After what seemed like years, they finally opened their doors and I immediately noticed a lot of traffic through their tiny parking lot and drive-thru lane. Last night I finally had the chance to check it out.

A quick Google search will reveal that the owners of the old Zippy's also owns Beef Shack so Beef Shack menu items and "mini" serving options reflect this, albeit a much smaller menu. Beefs, hot dogs, burgers, fries, and salads are all that's on the Shack menu but the star of the menu is the same as it was for Zippy's: the cheezy beef. More specifically the cheezy beef on garlic bread.

We ordered a cheezy beef on garlic, a cheeseburger, and fries with Shack Sauce.  The roll is toasted with the beef, cheese, and peppers loaded on top which results in that classic flaky, crusty goodness on the outside of the bread with a creamy, melty cheese layer on top.  And the garlic bread...they mean garlic when they say garlic. I was afraid I would only get a hint of garlic flavor but this was a pungent kick of you-obviously-don't-have-a-date-tonight flavor.  And it was so much better than I remember the Zippy's version was. My only complaint was the bread to meat ratio was meager bordering on pathetic. Skimping on the beef is NOT the Chicago way and sincerely disappointed in that regard.

The burger was fresh and hand made and the bun was obviously fresh because both the patty and bun were pillow soft.  The toppings included cheese (optional) with lettuce and tomato with a microscopic dab of chipotle mayo. Where's the onion? I can only guess that they make the burger this way to avoid masking the flavor of the juicy patty and I can appreciate that style. My only complaint with the burger is the hefty price tag of $5 for such a small patty that is served a la carte. A small serving of fries to accompany it would justify the pricing.

They serve fresh cut fries here which you can see being cut and put directly in to the fryer. I love fresh cut fries but we has a few clumps that were undercooked which indicated that fries were overcrowded in the basket and not properly rotated while cooking. That's just a matter of method though and quality would obviously change between chefs.

While the Shack Sauce was fantastic and reminded me of a better version of McDonald's "special Big Mac sauce," I was sorely disappointed to find that the tiny container I received was only half filled.  Really, guys? You're going to actually charge me 50 cents for sauce and then short me on the quantity? First of all, a sauce that lacks originality and is likely made from condiments that are readily available shouldn't be charged for and if it is charged for it should be served as a significant amount so that the sauce doesn't dwindle to nothing barely halfway through the only size order of fries available.  That's okay though, you won't trick me again next time. I'll just ask for some free mayo, ketchup, and relish on the side and make my own Shack Sauce, thankyouverymuch.

Overall a great meal, although expensive at $16 and change for three items and no drinks.  The interior and exterior projected unique, designer level ambiance which includes industrial touches such as pre-rusted corrugated metal awnings and extensive use of metal piping on everything from door handles to railings.  Everything is brand spanking new so everything is sterile clean, unlike the greasy dilapidated mess Zippy's condition was before closing. 

One of the best cheesy beefs I've had due to the strong garlic flavor but other menu items don't seem to deserve much attention other than alternatives for those that aren't in the mood for a beef.  I'm still glad we've got a seemingly solid joint in the same spot as ol' Zippy's and I acknowledge their wisdom in keeping a concentrated menu but I miss having an option for gyros so close to home. I'll just have to satisfy my grease cravings with that glorious garlic cheezy beef instead.
I had high hopes for this place.  The workers there are the only shinning light.  I really do not enjoy my buns to be soggy.
Just great food, and at a decent price. The sauce is amazing, I want to take it home with me. Suggestion for the team: add onion rings to the board!

First time here today. Ordered a "Cheezy beef" with hot pepperz, and friez with "shack sauce." Gotta admit... I was pretty impressed. They weren't "chinsy" on the cheeze (or hot pepperz), the beef could've been more thinly sliced (though, still tasty / juicy), but it was the bread that was on-the-money. Flavorful and nicely toasted. (It never decintergrated while in the palmz of my clutchez) And the friez were much like 'Gene & Judez,' so a total WIN. I got the "Shack Sauce" to add a lil' adventure. Good (and interesting), but not really necessary. Still think 'Johnnys' will alwayz be my favoritest spot in Chicagoland for beef, but this may be my new, "runner-up," second choice. Can't wait to come back and explore some of the other menu optionz. (SOON) Gotta give 'The Beef Shack' a BIG thumbz up.

Might be my new favorite beef. I've already been here 3 times.
I love that they load on the cheese, and then melt it.  This gives the fresh bread just the nicest little crunch.  Well flavored beef.  I'm a hot peppers guy, which weren't overpowering- just enough on the samich.  I've had both the reg. cheesy beef and the garlic; I did think the garlic was a bit overpowering which took away from tasting the beef, but was still very good.
The fresh cut fries even held up well to doing takeout and getting all the way back to the office for lunch. mmmm.
They just need to add shakes & malts.

No bendy straws here.  :P
Big beef sandwich on garlic bread with green peppers, topped wirh mozarella cheese !!!! Delish !!! Oh and those delicious fresh fries!!!  Yum. Will certainly be back!!!

Beef = meat itself was good but the bread was too buttery.
Fries= fresh cut and delicious.
Staff was pleasant and quick.

I have had their grilled cheese as well, it is a big sandwich and has three types of cheese on it. I liked it, but I think its missing something, can't put my finger on it though. I haven't tried their beefs but the bf says they are delicious! This is a regular spot for me.

Just great food, and at a decent price. The sauce is amazing, I want to take it home with me. Suggestion for the team: add onion rings to the board!

So I live nearby and have been watching the renovations to the old Zippy's that was recently closed with mixed emotions. I used to love Zippy's and it's been around here for many years. And waffle fries!

But I recently learned that the owners of Beef Shack are associated with the Zippy's family and they have a very well reviewed location (as of this posting) in St. Charles. So why not, let's give them the benefit of the doubt.

Went through the drive-thru at this location and the service was very quick, efficient and friendly. Much appreciated. Their menu is basically a slimmed down version of Zippy's, and although some favorites of mine are no longer available (chicken gyro, waffle fries, onion rings), I've always thought that a more simplistic menu at a place like this promotes better quality in the selections that they do have available (see: In-N-Out Burger).

I grabbed a cheesy beef on garlic bread with hot peppers and an order of fries. The fries were crispy and really well seasoned, fresh cut fries will always be a favorite of mine and Beef Shack does them really well. They also have a 'Shack Sauce' available for an extra 50 cents which they said is some sort of Thousand Island dressing based dipping sauce. 

The beef sandwich is served on traditional Turano bread and they don't skimp on the cheese, which you'll find oozing out of the side of the sandwich. The beef is pretty well seasoned, but I must agree with another reviewer who said that they don't give you quite enough meat to get to the optimum bread to beef ratio. Because of this, the sandwich is just a little bit duller than it could be. Overall, though, the quality of the food is better than Zippy's has been over the past few years and that's what we're going for, right? I'll be making regular stops at the Beef Shack for sure!

Yummm... ok, back to lunch. :)

I finally got to try this place today, but sadly the food was very disappointing. I ordered the cheesy beef on garlic with hot peppers. The sandwich lacked quality and quantity, in terms of the beef. The fries were good, but like others have stated, way too greasy. All this place did was make me miss Zippy's.

Great food! Just went for my first time and I was impressed. The people i was with had the beef and I tried the burger. Everyone liked the beef and I'm still thinking about what a great burger it was. BTW, the fries are fresh cut and awesome!

"Just remember who's making your food" is what the manager told me when I asked if I could use my belly account with a coupon. A simple, "no I'm sorry would have done" but the manager chose to be snarky.  Customer service here is awful but the beef sure is tasty. Not sure I'll be back due to the attitude. Portilllos is just down the road.
Top notch beef and fries. A little pricey for a beef. I would say better than Portillos.

2nd favorite place to get a beef sandwich in the northwest suburbs.  When you have a craving for an Italian beef sandwich with mozzarella cheese on garlic bread this is a good place to go.  Great customer service the staff is awesome everybody there is really really nice very impressive.  You only need to order one fry for every two people.  I use the deal from Yelp and was able to get me and my girlfriend a great meal for 10 bucks.  For businesses like this I wish we could give 6 stars.

One word...Fantastic!  Beefs are legit.  Great meat. The bread they use makes the sandwich.  Garlic bread is also tasty.  Burgers are good. Hot Dog comes with fresh cut fries. Be sure to try there shack sauce dip your fries in it it's glorious

Beef Shack has opened up where Zippy's used to be. We stopped in for a quick dinner the other night. The place has been remodeled very nice and clean. The menu is limited to just beefs, hot dogs, and burgers. We had cheesy beefs with fries and a cheese burger. The food came fast and was exactly what we ordered and very good size portions. There was 4 of us and we ordered 3 fries could not finnish them. The fries are fresh cut and taste like homemade, very good. Prices are not bad either. The employees were cleaning tables and sweeping the floor. Also the bathroom was clean. I will be going back again.

I can see the pictures posted of the inside of the restaurant and they all show the restaurant is EMPTY. Why? Because this place absolutely SUCKS!!!! This is yet another visit for me, as it will be my last visit here. And yes folks, it is consistent; it consistently sucks in service and quality!!!! Unflavorable yet GREASY chips of beef and way to greasy fries!!! Too much money wasted here by me!!!! Back to BUONA BEEF!!!!

Beef shack is great, yes reading the food it's greasy but for me I don't eat unhealthy that much so it's just the way I like it! My boys and I eat here all the time when we want a good beef and cheese fries!
Beef on garlic with mozz and peppers, fresh cut fries...doesn't get any better!

I was hesitant to try this place after hearing horror stories about  the predecessor, Zippy's.  Thus, after hearing that it's owned by the same people, I waited to see the reviews!  

My mom had a cheesy beef and she though that it could totally compete with Portillo's.  The only problem with the sandwich was that they give you a huge piece of bread and not enough meat.  Despite that, the beef was perfectly cooked. 

I had a burger and it was perfect.  I don't eat processed-cheese product, aka American cheese, so I asked if they can swap it with mozzarella and they had no problem accommodating me. 

The fries are fresh cut and you can probably share a bag with 3 people, that's just how much they give you.  It's funny when people complain about fries being "too greasy" and soaking through the bag.  It's fried, people! Those fries were downright amazing! 

The staff is young and friendly and doing a great job so far!  The prices are very good for the amount of food you get and the quality.  I would definitely go here again if I have a fast-food craving!

You can't beat the hot dog for $3 and some change. It comes with mounds and mounds of fresh-cut fries--I"m talking 2 orders worth from the average fast food place. The price can't be beat. Good Chicago style dog and fries are yummy

I've only ever gone through the drive-thru, but every time I've been there, the place looks completely dead inside with no one there. Crossing my fingers this place doesn't close down! I'd miss the great deal on their hot dogs.

I can't believe the good reviews about this place. It has to be the worst shack I've ever been to. I order the mini beef sandwich and fries. Thank goodness I ordered the mini...the experience could have been doubly bad if I ordered the regular beef sandwich. When our order came up, the oil was soaked through the bag. that should have been a red flag, but we were starving  After peeling away the oily soaked wrapper, I discovered soggy, flavorless fries. Well maybe the beef would be better. NOT! The beef was bland as bland could be. I was only able to tackle half the sandwich. There was just way too much grease. It was a heart attack waiting to happen. We left with a nauseating feeling and both fought back the urge to chuck it all up...
Better than portillos! Sad that beef villa is gone but happy that I can still get a good beef there. The hamburgers are pretty good too.

No joke..no one of the best beefs I may have ever had!! I will definitely be back. The beef and the cheese was just right and of course on garlic bread. I was beyond impressed and it just doesn't get much better than this!! Go today you won't be disappointed :)

I stopped by here and tried the cheezy beef with fries. Its in the same location (remodeled) that Zippys was at before it closed down. I wasn't expecting much in the first place. Overall, It wasn't too bad but probably mediocre at best. Not sure if I will go back, especially with portillos being pretty close by.

Ordered hotdogs, didn't care for the fries that were soggy wrapped around with wax paper, it really made the meal unappetizing. Bag was soiled in oil from fries! Also went through the drive through, young man working wasn't very friendly. Much better options around in the neighborhood. For those who think Beef Shack beats Portillios has poor quality of food. Go eat at BIG SAMMYS BETTER QUALITY CHEAPER PRICE
Very flavorful. Fresh cut fries. Made to order. I ordered the mini cheesy beef on garlic with hot peppers.  I will definitely be back here!

I was excited to hear there was a new cheesy beef sandwich place in Hoffman estates, I missed the old Zippys. I ordered the regular garlic cheesy beef with sweet peppers.  It did not disappoint, the really slather the garlic and cheese on there and contrary to previous reviews, I thought there was plenty of beef on there.  They may have changed their tune and upped their beef ratio :)  They said that they have only been open for a week and business is good.  They are off to a great start,  I will definitely be back!!

I was hesitant to try this place after hearing horror stories about  the predecessor, Zippy's.  Thus, after hearing that it's owned by the same people, I waited to see the reviews!  

My mom had a cheesy beef and she though that it could totally compete with Portillo's.  The only problem with the sandwich was that they give you a huge piece of bread and not enough meat.  Despite that, the beef was perfectly cooked. 

I had a burger and it was perfect.  I don't eat processed-cheese product, aka American cheese, so I asked if they can swap it with mozzarella and they had no problem accommodating me. 

The fries are fresh cut and you can probably share a bag with 3 people, that's just how much they give you.  It's funny when people complain about fries being "too greasy" and soaking through the bag.  It's fried, people! Those fries were downright amazing! 

The staff is young and friendly and doing a great job so far!  The prices are very good for the amount of food you get and the quality.  I would definitely go here again if I have a fast-food craving!

I've only ever gone through the drive-thru, but every time I've been there, the place looks completely dead inside with no one there. Crossing my fingers this place doesn't close down! I'd miss the great deal on their hot dogs.

Thank goodness I ordered the mini...the experience could have been doubly bad if I ordered the regular beef sandwich. When our order came up, the oil was soaked through the bag. that should have been a red flag, but we were starving  After peeling away the oily soaked wrapper, I discovered soggy, flavorless fries. Well maybe the beef would be better. NOT! The beef was bland as bland could be. I was only able to tackle half the sandwich. There was just way too much grease. It was a heart attack waiting to happen. We left with a nauseating feeling and both fought back the urge to chuck it all up...
Better than portillos! Sad that beef villa is gone but happy that I can still get a good beef there. The hamburgers are pretty good too.

No joke..no one of the best beefs I may have ever had!! I will definitely be back. The beef and the cheese was just right and of course on garlic bread. I was beyond impressed and it just doesn't get much better than this!! Go today you won't be disappointed :)

I stopped by here and tried the cheezy beef with fries. Its in the same location (remodeled) that Zippys was at before it closed down. I wasn't expecting much in the first place. Overall, It wasn't too bad but probably mediocre at best. Not sure if I will go back, especially with portillos being pretty close by.

Ordered hotdogs, didn't care for the fries that were soggy wrapped around with wax paper, it really made the meal unappetizing. Bag was soiled in oil from fries! Also went through the drive through, young man working wasn't very friendly. Much better options around in the neighborhood. For those who think Beef Shack beats Portillios has poor quality of food. Go eat at BIG SAMMYS BETTER QUALITY CHEAPER PRICE
Very flavorful. Fresh cut fries. Made to order. I ordered the mini cheesy beef on garlic with hot peppers.  I will definitely be back here!

I was excited to hear there was a new cheesy beef sandwich place in Hoffman estates, I missed the old Zippys. I ordered the regular garlic cheesy beef with sweet peppers.  It did not disappoint, the really slather the garlic and cheese on there and contrary to previous reviews, I thought there was plenty of beef on there.  They may have changed their tune and upped their beef ratio :)  They said that they have only been open for a week and business is good.  They are off to a great start,  I will definitely be back!!

Gotta respect a place with a small menu. Means the item you order will be fresh and a speciality. I ordered the cheezy beef on garlic and it was an improvement on zippys that used to be in this location. On par with portollos and better than buona.
This place is great. Love the fries hotdogs are as close as you can get to gene and judes.
I really like their cheesey beef on garlic bread. I don't like their kids menu and they don't have milk. It's not family friendly. They are kind of expensive with very little on the menu.

The beef is ok and the atmosphere is alright. I feel when I go there I'm just another number which bothers me because I really enjoy good customer service. I went in the bathroom and let's just say they need to pay a little more attention to cleaning. There was pee all over the toilet and no toilet paper kinda sucked but I wouldn't expect any less from the beef shack. I would rather go 5 minutes up,the road to a place where they care about their customers and keep their bathrooms clean.
Great beef. Especially on garlic bread. And the fries are amazing. Get the chipotle mayo to dip them in. So good!

Recently visited Beef Shack. My wife ordered the chicken sandwich. She said it was one of her best chicken sandwiches she ever eaten. She normally goes to Portillo's, however she found a new place for chicken sandwiches. I ordered the cheesy beef with fires. It was a very pleasant surprise. The cheese made the beef sandwich. It was properly melted. The hand cut fries were a big hit for my wife & myself. It was cut while we waited. As we walked out of Beef Shack, someone said thanks for coming, looking forward to your return visit. The overall experience was 5 Stars.

We came on a Saturday afternoon. 1 car ahead of us in the drive through. He had to wait for his order. When we pulled up to the window, we were asked to pull over and wait for our order. We ordered 6 hot dogs. Nothing outrageous for a place that only offers hot dogs, hamburgers and beef sandwiches. We waited 15+ minutes after we were asked to park and wait. The food was hot. The dogs, eh, ok. We won't be rushing back here.

Nice atmosphere and simple menue.  Had beef sandwich and it wasnt bad however it had no taste whatsoever.  Fries were ok nothing special.  Shack sauce wasn't good in my opinion.  Probably wont be back. Im not sayong don't go I would definitely give it a try. Friendly staff.

I'm back.
The hamburgers are unbelievably good...
I'm a very picky eater-I don't do seafood and don't care for poultry-trying on and off to become a vegetarian...without much success.
This is definitely my go to place...

Sorry to say, 1 star is even too much for the Beef Shack.   Very small limited menu.  Two of us ordered hotdogs & fries...and OMG....the worst of both we have ever had.
The hotdog was terrible thick skin you couldn't even bite into it.   And the fries...YUCK....limp greasy pile of mess.   All stuck together under cooked and just a gross mess.

Will definitely NOT go back here or recommend them to anyone.

Wish I had enjoyed my beef like the other reviewers have. I ordered cheesy beefs extra wet with extra cheese. Wasn't much cheese even with requested, and paid for, extra. They provided Au Jus on the side which was nice as this was a drive thru order.  The flavor of the beef was average, only a bit of gristle in the meat but after the reviews I was expecting much better, this was about on par with any old beef joint. The Angus burger was a bit over cooked, approaching hockey puck status. Hot dogs were ok nothing spectacular. I only had a short drive so I cannot blame a long transit for any of this disappointment. I am glad the others are enjoying the new place but my search for a great Schaumburg area beef place continues.

Love the new decor, redone inside and out, reminds me of a theme park...
As for food, garlic cheesy beef is good, its still exactly the same as when it was zippys, and the cashier confirmed it is the same owner. Beef is cut thin, good amt of beef, cheese, and garlic. Fresh cut fries are a generous size order, split between three of us, and didn't finish them. Menu is very small, which is fine sure me, my husband liked the zippys pizza and would like to see that on the menu. 
Like the option for the mini size beef as the large is huge for one person. Also they went back to coke products instead of RC which was a part of the zippys downfall.
Hit the spot with a greasy cheezy beef and hot peppers.  The right size portion to satisfy a late night hunger. NO complaints

My wife received a coupon in the mail so we thought we would give it a try!!! Much to our surprise it was great. I had the cheesy beef on garlic bread with hot peppers and my wife had the mini cheesy beef on garlic. It was one of the best I have had.  The fries are also the best in the area, just like they make at Gene & Judes in River Grove. We will definitely return many times.

As Hoffman Estates residents, we've enjoyed Zippy's for years. Once we had a beef crawl, comparing Al's, Johnny's, Portillo's, Buena and Zippy's. Zippy's was by far my favorite. The Beef Shack would place last. My beef was lean, but salty by my taste, shredded rather than sliced, and not much flavor. The bread was a sandwich sub style roll, not crusty Italian bread. The sweet peppers were very good, perfectly cooked and full of flavor. As the only other offerings are an Angus beef hamburger, hot dog, and salad, I don't expect to be back.

Just picked up a beef sandwich there yesterday!  It was outstanding!  I love the menu, you got your beef, with cheese and on garlic bread.  And that is the menu.  Why you would go there for a hot dog or a salad is beyond me.  

The sandwich is huge, with the cheese melted in a broiler, this is livin' large!

Only gripe, the parking lot is tiny.......... 

I will be back!

GREAT BEEF, really, especially if you want a cheesy beef on Garlic Buttered bread, this is the place to go. My favorite - 5 STAR beef. BUT, If you want almost anything else, go anywhere else. 

Very limited menu, which is OK if everything else is great - but that is not the case. Hot Dog is just OK, comes with fries. $5 for a hamburger?

Fries are VERY greasy, I mean wring them out greasy, disgusting. Couldn't finish 1/3 order and I'll eat just about anything.

Shack Salad, similar to a chopped salad, had almost NO CHICKEN, 3 tiny pieces that I could find. The online menu description says "Topped with A CHICKEN BREAST". NOT!

NO ICE TEA!!! Never heard of that at a restaurant.

I placed a call in order. The food was done on time. However, they failed to put the fries and sauce in the bag. Luckily I realized it before I left. The first person didn't apologize (oops). However, they quickly got them ready and apologized for forgetting. 

My full order consisted of a Mini Cheese Garlic Beef (no peppers), fries and the special sauce and cost $7.22. The food was very very good and I would certainly order it again. In fact wish I had ordered the full beef since it was so tasty. The fries were in a good sized bag and had a great flavor. The special sauce was good but in way to small of a cup. They really need to work on that. I look forward to trying their burger and see how they do with that. 

I was happy to see they had Coke products, but no types of deserts. The menu is limited but have to say, I will be stopping by on regular bases after having had it once and as long as they do a few things very well they will do well and I'll keep stopping by.

Don't miss out on trying this place. BTW when you search for them on the net the St. Charles one comes up they haven't updated their site yet. Shame on them...

They should not be allowed to call themselves the "beef shack". Their beef is bland and the cheese is disgusting. The fries could be good except they are swimming in grease half the time. The hot dog isn't a true Chicago dog and didn't have the typical toppings. Their menu is pathetic! I saw a sign that said "beef, burgers, dogs, salad, and more"... the only other thing they have that isn't listed is fries... I guess that's the "more". They only have one burger option, which was decent at least. The service is abominable... in our most recent trip it took 15 minutes sitting at the window for 2 orders of fries and they were super greasy and just warm, definitely not hot. I honestly don't understand the positive reviews here... I've gone here several times and tried everything on the menu, and nothing is good enough to get me to go back!
Easily the best beef I've ever tasted.  The bread is super.  The Cheezy beef is about $7.. with fries you and a drink you are looking at $10.. its not cheap- but its great

Attended the wine dinner last night and it was excellent. Met chef Chris and the staff. Great people and very professional. As this was my first time at Retro Bistro I am looking forward to my next dining experience there very soon.

After letting the new place work out the Bugs we finally made it to retro bistro.   I would have given five stars, except one of the entrees, the steak frites,  the steak was cooked perfectly but served room temp..  It came out last, and the server told s it would be right out.  After three or four minutes the steak finally arrived.. Cold..  Ok., so it was a great steak and the frites were super tasty, but that was a bummer.   

Not a game ender.

The confit duck and chicken entrees were five stars, and the duck liver mousse and escargot were also five stars..    The service and cocktails also would rate five stars..     

However serving a cold steak... Bad so. 4 stars.

We told the server about the steak and she was very gracious, and gave a free desert to take home..  Note..  We told her after as the steak finished as it was still tasty, and my friend decided to eat it..  They would have made a new one.

Excellent choice for a Saturday.

I was excited to have a new resturant in Crystal Lake. My experience was mixed. The staff was friendly and for the most part attentive. (Ricardo is just great! 5 stars for him) This is an upscale resturant with prices to match. My wife and I had the cheese and sausage plate and a drink each and our bill with tip was almost $60. The cheese plate is $24 which was short on substance, perhaps 2 or 3 oz. of meat and cheese and a big pile of grapes. 

I have two suggestions for management regarding staff. #1 no cell phones while on duty. Patrons should not have to wait for service while staff check their phone. #2 If you want to be upscale, be upscale, have the waitstaff and bartenders in all black attire, lose the blue jeans. The current black tops are classy, but not with jeans.

I will go back soon to sample other menu items.

Once again the crew at RB didn't disappoint with a fantastic dinner. Chris is very generous and when he found we were there for my dad's birthday picked up our first round of drinks and also comped us a charcuterie plate. My dad is about as Midwest as you get. Straight meat and potatoes through and through and he loved everything he ordered. Clean plates everywhere. I hope that everyone tries this place once or more. Fresh ingredients cooked perfectly in a casual setting.

First time here and kept it simple. The wife and I sat at the bar, she had the signature goose martini and I had a cab. A $12 martini should be spot on, however I bet you would receive the same mediocre martini at Labemis. My cab was fine, but for the premium price I was partially offended by the bartenders using a measuring glass to pour. We decided to order a appetizer before committing to a dinner and glad we did; we split a simple cheese board, a $24 dollar mix of raisins posing as grapes, cheese samples and some meat pate. The place is at best average parading behind a stuffy facade that the service and product quality can't back up.

Great menu with a nice selection of salads and appetizers. The escargots are amazing!! Some classic French dishes are done well, the duck and nightly specials. Servers still need to be schooled on menu but otherwise nice place
Been there 2x and they don't miss.  Duck leg divine !  Delicious appetizers. ...excellent service.....Will return often :))))

I've been anxiously waiting the opening of the restaurant and had a chance to stop by today. I was immediately seated. The bread and tapenade was brought to the table and menus came shortly after. Tracy offered her recommendations each step of the way and I went with most of them. The Parisian Peach Sour was amazing! It was just the right mix sweet and sour. I ordered the Crab and shrimp cake. It was devine. The blend of flavors were perfect. I finished my visit odd with the Limoncello Mousse Cake. It was beautifully decorated and so light.
I'll definitely will be visiting soon!

While this was not the best restaurant I have ever been to, it is a step in the direction for the food wasteland know as McHenry County. After reading so many reviews on the high prices that this place charged, I can understand why it is so hard to run a decent restaurant in this part of the world. I had the trout which was great. Another diner at our table had the short ribs that was wonderful. The heirloom tomato salad was also tasty. Our server was attentive and offered us a taste of the wine we were about to order. We sat in one of the front booths that appeared a bit quieter than the back part of the room. All of our entrees were under $25. Do people in this area ever venture to any metropolitan area in this county for fine dining? Good food prepared in a nice atmostphere costs more that your chain dining experience. This is a great addition to Crystal Lake. I will be back soon.

Literally the best new restaurant in the area!!! Finally someplace with amazing food, atmosphere and style. The menu is to die for!!! Short rib is the best I've had!!!!  You will not be disappointed!!!! I already can't wait to come back!!!!!!

Stopped in for a solo dinner one night and had the Provencal Merguez Sausage & Pancetta Pasta. It was wonderful. I saw another review that thought the dish was too "soupy", not for me, loved it. Can't wait to dine again and try more of the menu.

This place just opened and already hitting out of the park.  The service was friendly and timely.  I had the osso buco and it was great.   My wife enjoyed her entire.  Very good beer selection and the wine list is decent.  I never order desert but did and it was fantastic.  Great place for date night.

The service was excellent. Our appetizers were excellent. We had the duck liver pate, escargot, and the smoked salmon potato pancake was outstanding. Short rib entree, rainbow trout, beef filet au poivre, were great. The seafood pasta and pork tenderloin Normandy were very good. The herb roasted poulet was cooked well, but, lacked in flavor (wouldn't recommend). Overall, we will be back.

Decided on Retro Bistro with my daughter today and we really liked it. I had the gazpacho and Croque Madame and my daughter had the Croque Monsieur. Both we're delicious and very well presented. The fries were really good as was the bread and butter served at the start of our lunch. Here's what would have made it a five for us:

- the water and iced tea had a weird taste. Maybe it's the city water? It wasn't stale but it just tasted a touch different.
- we both thought the sandwiches could have benefited from less ham. We felt 1/2 the amount of ham used would have been perfect and not overpowered the sandwich. Same price point, less cost = more margin! 

Welcome to the neighborhood! We'll definitely be back and we'll recommend RB to friends!!

Finally, a great little fine dining establishment in Crystal Lake! I dined here on a Tuesday night. We came at 5:30p and were promptly seated and by the time we left, it was full. You're greeted with white tablecloths, and servers bring out crusty French demi-baguettes, creamy butter, and homemade olive tapenade. We enjoyed the $5 glass of wine special, then noshed on house salad with a creamy, tangy vinaigrette, And two kinds of tart flambes (ok, that's a fancy name for flat bread pizza): duck confit with goat cheese tart and the four cheese. Both were tasty. The pizzas were crisp but tender, the toppings flavorful and filling. The charcuterie and cheese platter for two at a nearby table was ample and looked delicious. Prices are high, especially for main courses, but they do offer a pre-fixe menu for $35. Will have to try that next time. Welcome to the neighborhood!
Updated 8/20/16: Went here again for an anniversary dinner for 6 people. It was incredibly noisy and difficult to have a conversation. Very bad acoustics. We were very underwhelmed by the main courses. The steak au poivre was not peppered enough. The seafood pasta was a huge disappointment due to lack of fish variety and bland flavor. We all hated our desserts. The strawberry shortcake was served with a hard shortbread cookie, there were no fresh strawberries and it was served with ice cream instead of whipped cream. The creme brl̩e was the worst. The sugar crust was too thick and the torch burnt the sugar. Burnt sugar is NOT tasty! Service was just ok. The food took a long time to come out. Our total bill, which included alcohol, wax $405 but we all left somewhat dissatisfied. For that price, we expected much better. We certainly won't come back here for dinner. Drinks and appetizers maybe. Dinner never.

Wow, what a gem in the middle of quaint downtown Crystal Lake!  Having dined at Retro Bistro
in Mount Prospect many times, I was thrilled to find out they had opened a location in the Northern burbs.  Retro Bistro Crystal Lake did not disappoint.  Beautiful room, very cozy and intimate.  Great bar area with Retro's signature drinks and fabulous wine list.  Dining available in the bar and the main dining room.  Service was impeccable, as was the food. Similar menu to Retro Bistro Mount Prospect, and always superb.  Host Chris Barth welcomes everyone and makes you feel right at home.  A great experience.  Can't wait to go back!

Let me say we have been going to Retro for 15+ years. However we had not been there in a few years due to our disappointment the last few times we dined there. So when Crystal Lake opened we though it would be a great chance to check it out again. Sadly we were again disappointed. 

The positives. The goat cheese salad always good. Good vibe in the place. It was packed. 

The negatives. When the waitress presented the skate wing, as soon as it was placed on the table, I thought, that does not even look appetizing. The best I could describe it is grey and drab. A large portion accompanied with maybe 3 shriveled string beans. I've ordered skate wing before in a variety of restaurants, so I had some expectations. Francesca's in Barrrington does a nice job with it, when they do have it on the menu.  It tasted as it looked. 

We also ordered the pasta dish. Ok. Nothing spectacular that would make me come back and pay the high entree price. 

The strawberry shortcake. This version had some ice cream, whipped cream, sliced strawberries and then I guess the "shortcake" was this round biscuit that was set atop.  The biscuit was dry and tasteless. Good thing that there was enough of the other stuff to mask it. 

If we do go back, a big if, it'll be at the bar. A glass of wine and salad at most. 

The entree prices are vey high. With that comes expectations that diners will be 'wow'd'. We were. Just in the wrong direction.

Like a previous reviewer, we have also dined (and love) RB in Mt. Prospect and are also very happy they have come to Crystal Lake!  We had a delicious dinner tonight and can't wait to go back!  Not only was the food fabulous, the ambience and service was outstanding!  What a great addition to downtown Crystal Lake!  Can't wait to make a return trip!!

Made a reservation for our anniversary dinner.  Mentioned the special occasion on the phone when the reservation was made.  No mention of it at the host stand or by our server.  The service was very rushed. We received our entrees before finishing our appetizers. Although the food was good, overall the atmosphere felt more like casual dining.  Not what I had hoped for for a 2 person $150+ anniversary dinner.
Happy that there is a new restaurant that opened up in downtown Crystal Lake! Really great food and staff is very friendly!  Our family will be back!

We recently celebrated my 40th Birthday at Retro Bistro and it was fabulous!  Chris, Lorraine, and CJ treated our group of 16 like royalty.  Their attention to details....all the way from plated hors o'euvres (with gluten free accommodations!), to their amazing menu (We tried the Short ribs, Ahi tuna, Salmon special, tenderloin special, and several other dishes that were all delicious), to an in-house made chocolate and raspberry birthday cake....it was all top notch.  All of our friends raved about the food and service.  We were all thoroughly impressed.  My husband and I cannot wait to return!  Thank you Chris, Lorraine and CJ.  I recommend Retro Bistro to anyone that is looking for a local restaurant with amazing food, and fantastic service.  You will not be disappointed.  We were not!!
I've been here 4 times already. The food is amazing and it's really comfortable with great staff. I'm really happy they're here.

Food was excellent and service was great.  I ordered the Wasabi Crusted Ahi Tuna and the small goat cheese salad.  The goat cheese salad was wonderful - a must have. The Ahi Tuna was excellent.  Rarely do I find that higher priced restaurants are worth the cost, but felt this was.  My friends enjoyed their dinners as well.  Definitely worth your time and money.

This is my favorite neighborhood bar. The staff is always very friendly, and the chef is on point with everything he makes. They recently released a new menu - the grilled cheese and tomato soup is the best I have ever had. They always have an exceptional beer list that is constantly rotating, a large selection of bottles, and a full bar for cocktails. There is never a boring night here - whether it is open mic night, trivia night, a special event beer dinner, live music, etc. - and in the summer, there is nowhere I would rather be than chilling on their outdoor patio. Cheers, Team, you have made this an amazing place!!
I walk in at 10:05pm on a Saturday. I wait by the door for  7 minutes for the hostess who was very rude to come and tell me "We don't take any orders after 10:00pm" and they close at 11:00pm.

More new managers or owners. The menu is confusing to say the least but the beer menu is better and have beer in stock. They don't have wings anymore?!? They have lollies?!!? No deals for football on Sundays. I'll think I'll be taking a break and finding a place for deals for the games.

We didn't eat here, so I can't say anything about the food or drinks. All I know is that we stopped in around 7 pm on a Monday night and it was completely empty inside. Just 2 employees standing around. Also, smelled heavily of smoke and the inside wasn't very pretty. The food looked good online, but I could not stay inside. The outside patio chairs looked uncomfortable, so we left.

Stopped by here for a late lunch. Great food and service. Ordered chicken tenders & a patty melt. Chicken tenders were absolutely the best!!!  Tater tots were good too. Patty melt was tasty. We're not from the area but next time we're around, we will
stop by to eat.  The owner Melissa stopped by our table.  Great customer service.

I guess we lucked out? Staff was super nice and accommodating. Came with our 2 and 5 year old - waitress had a great seat to fit the height of the bar chairs. Beer list is great and Ms. Pac Man puts it over the top. I'll be back. Heck, I might become a regular. Well done Rivers Edge.

I give it 5 stars for allowing dogs on the outdoor patio. But the food, staff and beer list were just ok.  My husband, our two dogs and I decided to stop in after a nice walk along the river.  Upon sitting down we were greeted by our server.  She offered to get the dogs water which was nice.  When we asked her about the beers on tap she explained a bunch were out and couldnt explain what had replaced them. My husband and I both ordered a beer and then decided to order some tater tots.  The tots were absolutely delcious and perfectly crisp.  We wanted the hot sauce on the side rather than lathering the tots in it.  This was a good choice because the tots remained crisp.  The Bourbon and the super hot sauce were delicious.  I would definitely go back here if in the area with the dogs but I would not go out of my way.
Great food (Burgers), Beer and service.  Nice outdoor seating in downtown Batavia.

We went here this past Friday. I can't speak for the inside, as we ended up going upstairs to the patio/deck area. It's really nice. The service was quick, although it was busy up there with  a band... I can't say anything about the food as we didn't have any. But it was a great place to hang out outside and listen to a band play on a Friday night. If we are back in the area again with a babysitter for the night, it is pretty likely we would come back here. It was a good time.
Great burgers and love the atmosphere. Outdoor patio is a great place to enjoy beautiful River Street and the back deck is fantastic music venue.

The staff is very friendly.  The food is just average.  Their beer selection is nice however and I enjoyed the live music going on there.  I will be check it out again.  Swell atmosphere even if it is in a pretty dead town.

These guys have AMAZING burgers. We have been there a few times and have tried almost every burger and while they have all been fantastic, the Blue Bacon Burger is my favorite. They are cooked to medium unless you specify otherwise, but they are always cooked perfectly. Great flavor and they are huge. The burgers also come with a side of tater tots, and really who doesn't love tater tots. I think they deep fry theirs or something, because they are amazingly crispy on the outside, not the soggy mess they can sometimes be at other restaurants. And if you're a real tots fan, the tot-chos are also great. But probably dangerous, because they are covered in cheese, jalapenos and bacon.

As for the beer, they try to change it up quite a bit and really know their beers on tap. Their service is fantastic and it's a great place to just hang out, have a beer and maybe a burger, but be hungry!
Amazing beer... great food... who doesn't love some home cut fries!!! Service couldn't have been better. Highly recommended to sit outside as you just won't want to leave.. relaxing !!!!

We came here with a Groupon and honestly weren't expecting much but this place is pretty keen. It's a little hole in the wall off River Street (about a mile's walk from our house) that has a bunch of beer, a few cocktails, and damn good burgers. They also have nacho tots, which might be proof to me that God exists. 

Lots of TVs playing various sports ball games (GO TEAM, DO THE THING TO WIN THE THING!) along with a big jukebox that might end up with "Hollaback Girl" playing on repeat, depending on how drunk I get.
staff was friendly. food was amazing. captain crunch Chicken tenders, brisket and house made bacon burger was ahhhmahzing! Lots of delicious rotating beers including three Floyd's. i recommend
We go for open mic, it's got great deals! New late night food menu which our friends have enjoyed.
The hamburgers are super! Love the small town atmosphere and great service and they were slammed today. Definitely going back
Sorry to say that after many years of going to this great place, new management and new menu have caused our family to take this restaurant off of our favorites list!
We came here with a Groupon n honestly surprised with how great this place is. Everything from the bartender/waiter to the food ,drinks and Music . Definitely coming back with or with out a Groupon!
The spinach dip is to die for. Small and cozy atmosphere .  The owner is amazing and super friendlly. Go and cheit it out, I recommend it.
Great downtown Batavia stop off for great food, great service and nice street side outdoor seating. Totally recommend. Jason and the bar team rock customer service
We had a great time.  Food was very good and the beer selection was great. Service was excellent, could not have friendlier!

Decent food, terrible service. We waited 50 mins for our food and there were only two other groups in the bar. 

P.S. Don't get the fries

Great Place. Especially to hang out before a concert at Arcada. Hot Wings where spicey and served Steaming. Pizza, Thin Crust with Sausage, was pretty good, but could have used less cheese and more sauce. Our server Berry, she was top-notch! Recommended, and try to sit upstairs.

So, we have been here twice in the last month and both times had a nice experience.  The food here is nice and fresh.  Herb salad dressing was the best.
I love that even though this is bar food it is fresh and thoughtfully prepared.
This is my second review of this place.  Apparently my firs review was too positive because it was banned to the"not recommended" review file.  WTF?

Anyway, I think this bar and grill is great.
yes a small but fun bar live music fun atmosphere and good company food is real goood !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Food was horrible, chips were too salty and when I asked if they could give me chips without salt they didn't do anything about it. Service was okay, but food was not very good. Asked for no onion in my salad and there was onion.

Great place! Just stopped in on a whim for lunch; good beer and a delicious portobello mushroom sandwich.  The bartender Bobby was great, and the chef brought me the sandwich himself. Great atmosphere, very chill. If you're biking through, or just wandering,  I recommend this joint for a relaxing stop.
Great downtown Batavia stop off for great food, great service and nice street side outdoor seating. Totally recommend. Jason and the bar team rock customer service
We had a great time.  Food was very good and the beer selection was great. Service was excellent, could not have friendlier!

Decent food, terrible service. We waited 50 mins for our food and there were only two other groups in the bar. 

P.S. Don't get the fries

I love that even though this is bar food it is fresh and thoughtfully prepared.

Anyway, I think this bar and grill is great.
yes a small but fun bar live music fun atmosphere and good company food is real goood !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Food was horrible, chips were too salty and when I asked if they could give me chips without salt they didn't do anything about it. Service was okay, but food was not very good. Asked for no onion in my salad and there was onion.

Great place! Just stopped in on a whim for lunch; good beer and a delicious portobello mushroom sandwich.  The bartender Bobby was great, and the chef brought me the sandwich himself. Great atmosphere, very chill. If you're biking through, or just wandering,  I recommend this joint for a relaxing stop.

Been here multiple times, for many different occasions

Beautiful Ambiance 
Food is Great
Service Is Great
Wines Are Yummy

I loved the wines and I joined the club. My favorite is Lux Pino and Lux cab.
I came here by my friend's suggestion. We had a great dining experience!
