For our dinner we ordered rolls to share. Shakou Roll was way too salty and our least favorite. The Green Dragon was a repeat favorite. While I found the Flaming Hamachi too spicy for my taste, I admit to being a light weight. The rest of our party loved it! The Ocean Drive was good but not something we would probably repeat with so many other options.

For dessert, we split the Pyramid and it was perfect!!!!

While we enjoyed the food and beverage, the ambiance is not as great as the Libertyville location.

Don't go out of your way for this place. Each of dishes we tried were bland and not very creative. At this pricing model the food should explode on your tastebuds. 

The ambiance is swank with a great sound system, the help was attentive and friendly.
The design of seating is not very comfortable...hard surfaces on the chairs ask for a booth.

If your looking for excellent sushi to drop your $$$ on this is NOT the spot!
Great food! Sit in a booth to be comfortable, otherwise you will sit in a metal chair by big windows and freeze!!

Located on Main St., across from the old theater, this Sushi spot is prepped for partying. Valet service is a nice touch.

As I walked in, I was struck by two things--the loud decor and even LOUDER MUSIC. Think clubbing, a la 2002. The hostess greeted me and proceeded to take me to my spot--a single stool wedged between a full bar of people. Hmm....no thanks. I made a reservation, I'll wait for a table. She then tells me to go upstairs, wait at the bar and they will give me a table. I go up the elevator and as the door opened, I nearly fell back from the noise. Not only was the music LOUD, the people were yelling like drunken college kids on Spring Break! I looked around and it seemed as though I had been transported to the Jersey Shore--Snooki and all. I nearly left, but I was tired and not in the mood to go elsewhere at this point. After about 10 more minutes, I was seated at a couch and table. 

Matthew greeted me and certainly put me a bit at ease. I order the seaweed salad and the 15 piece sashimi. The seaweed salad was good (and quite large), but the sashimi was terribly disappointing. The fish quality was just very mediocre. It was so bad, I actually left 5 pieces on the plate. I just couldn't stand to eat any more mushy, raw fish. Again, Matthew was great. I would give him 5 stars. The "manager" in jeans and the striped shirt was pretty blah. He just stood there and was not a great representation of a good host.

Overall, this place seems to be the "happening" spot for Cougars and others aiming to recapture their youth. The noise level was obnoxious and it wasn't worth the price for the mediocre food.

Overpriced average food. I like the interior decorations and the service was great but the food and price are factors hard to overlook. We started with the seven ahi special per our waitresses recommendation and it was pretty decent - fried/crunchy rice on bottom of ahi tartar with some tobiko and a jalape̱o. 

Our main entrees were less spectacular. We got the sambal shrimp, japanese steak, and a black window roll. It came with a healthy portion of vegetables but the proteins were cooked mediocre. The steak came out too well done and didn't have the bite to it like a steak should have. The shrimp wasn't as fresh as I expected and the scallops on top of the black widow were overdone as well. I thought the flavors of each dish were pretty good though. All of this came to around $45 per person (including tax and tip) which I know could have been spent on a better meal...

Lunch review. 
Nice larger $15 lunch bento boxes, a little pricey but it's Barrington and you don't get the $8 lunch special everywhere. Really nice place. Street parking. 
Perfectly cooked grilled vegetables. 
Appetizers are not large. Intg drink options, cool multiple bars. Good busyness lunch or first date place, many seating options, upstairs and downstairs.
Nice upstairs rooftop option. 
Has a River North feel, even the no parking option.

Garmin and iphone both flip out on the location, all new, my sisters got lost meeting me.
Across from the Catlow movie theater, near where the empty parking lot WAS, on Main Street in Barrington, also Lake Cook Rd.
I wonder what that shiny elevator cost em?

The restaurant itself is really pretty.  I love the decor and ambiance.  The booths were extremely comfortable and the place looked clean...however.  The music is super loud (and terrible).  The food itself is just ok and extremely overpriced.  We paid $18 for an 8 or 10 piece roll that only consisted of shrimp and some other cheap ingredients (cream cheese, spicy mayo, cheese, etc.).  My $8 glass of wine was possibly the smallest glass of wine I've ever seen in my life.  My fiance ordered a beer and the waitress didn't offer a small or large option, so naturally (we found out when we got the bill) brought him a large...for $12.  For dinner, my fiance and I each got entrees.  When ordering our entrees, the waitress offered us white, brown, or fried rice.  We both ordered fried rice.  When we got the bill, she had up-charged us $3 apiece for the fried rice and made no mention of it when we ordered-pretty tacky.  The waitress definitely seemed like she was just trying to make our bill as expensive as possible rather than being fair.  The service was nothing special and the hostess was less than friendly.  I'm glad we tried it, but we won't go back.

Decent speed of service,
Poor sushi consistency - all rolls kept falling apart.

Terrible attention to table cleanliness (we ended up continually clearing our own table and asking for the waitress to remove bottles and dirty plates.

Price to quality of service ratio is way off.

Seriously better attention and service at happy hour at Wok N Fire. 

Really too bad. This place is so nice in appearance but just frustrating dining experience.

Delicious. Not much more to say but that. Everything is phenomenal. Pretty pricy but still worth it!  Staff & ambiance are amazing as well. Well
Done!

I'm perplexed by some of the reviews here.   Simply put, I don't know of any place within 30 miles that rivals this place:  atmosphere, food, crowd, and service were all a notch above what you find in the burbs.    It doesn't completely achieve the personality of many of the places downtown but does a very commendable job of losing the sterile lifeless feel that is so epidemic in suburban restaurants; a condition that stems from the typical unoriginal formulaic cookie-cutter process usually used to create them all the way down to the menu items.

The Seven Spicy Ahi,(currently $11) a variation of the very popular spicy tuna over toasted rice dish which to my knowledge got its start many years ago in LA at the original Katsuya, was pretty much the best iteration of this well-know item I've ever had beating Katsuya itself, killing E+O's, and being quite a bit better than Wildfish's; just to name a couple I've recently tried.     I probably marginally prefer the modified version (mine) of the original Sushi Bombs at Kaminari but alas this is no longer available now that the ownership of Kaminari has changed hands.

I've been to Skakou Barrington twice now and tried a large sample of the menu.   Not every dish was an absolute winner but I don't recall any I flat out didn't like or that wasn't at least on par with what I'd get elsewhere around here.   Along with the Seven Spicy Ahi, I recall the Braised Short Rib (currently $24) also being outstanding.

Prices are EXACTLY what I would expect for a restaurant of the mid-to-high-end variety in this location with food averaging about $40-50 per person + drinks.   Since this is what I usually pay at any restaurant of this level in this area (Arlington Heights, Algonquin, Barrington, Schaumburg, etc..), I don't get all the comments on being over priced.   In any case, while you can dine here for less, expect to pay at least $40 per person + drink costs.

Bottom-line, I definitely recommend checking Shakou Barrington out.    

I have been to most of the places in the area, but if you do go to Shakou Barrington and feel there's another place within 30 miles that is better, please drop me a personal note.   I'd love to try it!

The decor is beautiful...like nothing we've seen in the 'burbs. We started with two appetizers: the soft shell crab appetizer was good, though it was deep fried and a bit greasy. The pot stickers (gyoza) were delicious. Three at our table had the short rib, which was unanimously the best any of us had ever had. The short rib was served over grilled vegetables with a side of rice. I'll be dreaming about the sweet ginger soy sauce forever. The other person in our party had a noodle dish, yaki udon, which he said was great, with lots of shrimp and scallops. Our desserts--a chocolate pyramid and chocolate truffle--were delicious--satisfying but not too sweet.

Not worth it. You're just paying for the "rooftop view." It's not like we're downtown or anything for it to be an "experience." Horrible service. The waitress was very rude. The food wasn't really anything special, I've had much better food for much cheaper. They don't do substitutions for anything unless you want to pay like 1/4 of the original price extra, which is ridiculous. You're literally just overpaying for the "ambiance" when you come here... Which isn't even that great. Won't be coming back here.

Celebrating my son's birthday.
Nice ambiance, great food, wonderful servers! 
Even my kids loved it! We'll definitely be back.

While the ambience is great - it feels like a downtown restaurant - the sushi is not up to downtown standards. There is hardly any fish in a roll, it's mostly rice and pretty unremarkable. Make the drive to Bistro Wasabi, it will be a better meal.

The sushi is good, but overpriced. You can go right around the corner & get better sushi for a lot less money & you won't get the euro-trash-cool decor or the club music. And you'll be able to talk to the people at your table. Only worth it if you're out on the roof deck.

Much better than the St Charles location .They have a nice rooftop ..The ambience will remind you of a nice place downtown in River north or the West Loop .I forgot we were in Barrington .Typical PAN Asian menu
.
The Maki rolls were pretty good ..The drinks were typical of a place like this ,a little weak .Thats why I stick to scotch!
overall a great experience

Great quality sushi...that's all that really matters, right?

Only drawback is somewhat limited beer menu. If you enjoy solid sushi, don't pass this up.

My husband and I went to Shakou on a Saturday night. We had a 7:15pm reservation and decided to go a little early and have a drink at the bar. We got there at 6:45pm and the place was PACKED!! Always a good sign considering this is a newer place in the area. Unfortunately we weren't able to sit at the bar, but I was pleased to see the place busy. 

We ate like champs. I had their cucumberita, which was a little strong for my liking, but I drank it. I think their drink menu has some good variety when it comes to beer, wines, and cocktails, but it is a on the pricey side. 

Now, their dinner menu is awesome. Great selection. Almost too much to choose from. We were there with another couple and we all ordered 2 different rolls, and a sashimi platter. My stand out favorites were the flaming hamachi roll, spicy tataki, green dragon and the crunch melt. All were different and very fresh. 

I have to say, sushi is my favorite thing to indulge on, but Shakou is definitely pricey. Is it the best sushi I've every had.....? Not really. It was great, like super fresh and very tasty, but for the price I guess I could go somewhere else and get the same quality for a fraction of the price. Just to put it into perspective, we were 4 people, we all had drinks, 2 rolls each and a sashimi platter and we walked out of there spending over $300.... 

I'll definitely go again for special occasion, but it won't be my go-to sushi place.

I absolutely love this place! The food was phenomenal and the service was incredible. The bartender was so nice and offered drink and food combinations that were so spot on!
I ended up ordering more to take home with me! What a great little restaurant! I HIGHLY recommend it!
Good atmosphere, but very pricey! for the quantity and quality.

My husband and I visited this restaurant last night and it seemed pretty empty for a Saturday night. We were seated right away at a booth and I personally really liked the interior. Our Waitress was nice but the food was just horrible. I ordered the salmon teriyaki and the "steamed vegetables" were soooo undercooked!!! The zucchini was hard and spongey I couldn't eat it all. My husband ordered sushi and rigimi. Both were disgusting. The fish on the rigimi was so warm and since it's raw fish you would think it should be cold, right? He only had half a bite of one of the pieces and left the rest. He also had one piece of the sushi and left both plates full and the waitress didn't bother asking us if she can get us something else or not. We paid $100 to leave hungry. Not returning.

If i could give zero stars i would. I will never visit this restaurant again. My friend took me here for my birthday dinner this past Tuesday. We had never been before but was drawn to it for the patio and to find a new sushi place. The both of us spent Wednesday  night and Thursday fighting an awful case of food poisoning. I have never been so miserable. Please eat at your own risk.
Service is really bad, food is about an 8/10. But service is really bad. It may stem from poor managerment. Took about 20 minutes to get utensils, we ate our appetizers with our hands.
Dinner with friends was great! Glad I made the trip out to this new place. I had a tuna special roll & really enjoyed it.

Shakou popped up in downtown Barrington about a year ago. This is the second sit-down sushi place in town, joining Sagano around the corner which has been around since the dawn of time. Shakou is a modern, trendy and buzzing atmosphere which is very popular. It is arguably the most trendy restaurant in town. Recently, they opened their rooftop dining facilities which are open air - I haven't been up there, but it looks awesome from the street and I have heard it is great.

I generally break sushi places down into three categories. You have "stand sushi" which would be like Sushi Station or even grocery store sushi...quick, convenient, sort of the hot dog stand of sushi, generally pretty affordable and pretty forgettable (assuming it is edible)....then you have what I would call "mid-tier" - these are generally family run places that have been around for a while - probably were super exotic in 1992, very traditional interior etc...and generally an OK experience, though again, often forgettable. Prices are a bit higher, but not too bad. Then you have "Flagship."

Shakou falls into the Flagship category...the type of sushi place against all others are judged. I know of one other place within 15 miles that can match it's food....I would also put the food on par with just about any flagship sushi place in the Midwest. It is good! The variety is quite diverse - you can get your simple California role, or something super colorful that is probably on fire or something. The atmosphere is trendy chic and what I would call dressy casual....a pair of chinos and a colored shirt would be ok, you'd not be feeling overdressed in a suit, a pair of nice shorts....your t-shirt and baseball cap, not so much.

The menu is pretty extensive and even if Grandpa Bill doesn't eat sushi, he can always order a steak or something. The downside if you are doing Maki here is the price. Generally they are 15 to 20 bucks a role here...and who orders one roll? You can easily run up a $40 or more per person tab without drinks....can you do it for less? Sure, but whole sections of the menu would be off limits. Let's just say I won't be ordering take-away from here any time soon....in my mind, this is really more of a special occasion, first date type of place. I am sure there are regulars who go there quite a bit, but I think it is cost-prohibitive for that - just me....for that special occasion though, or when you just want really well done sushi, Shakou fits the bill...one thing that does annoy me though - all their testimonial banners on their website from NBC and local media outlets...I am really hoping that this doesn't turn into a big chain - they already have 4 locations - in my experience, restaurants go way downhill when they try to have one in every town.

I was underwhelmed. The decor is beautiful. The music too loud. Our servers hounded us for our order. We were celebrating my non-birthday birthday dinner. We got there at 5:30pm. We had reservations and were seated quickly. Our server was training new ppl for this location. Apps came quick and so did our food. Let's talk about price. It's borderline outrageous. Sure sure, I know it's Barrington but you can't charge double or triple the cost what other sushi places in the area charge. How can ONE roll be nearly $20? We prob won't go back. If you want take out try Naomi or Sagano. If you want a quaint little place try Sushi Asahi or Sushi AI. You'll get better prices elsewhere for sure.

I would rate the food a 3 out 5 and the service a 1 out of 5. We had a party of 12 with 6 checks. The restaurant refused to split the checks and became frustrated when we asked. They also forgot several of the dishes in the party and they were brought out after we finished eating and included in the bill, plus the roll she accidentally out in. Terrible. Will not be returning.
Tilapia is amazing! Been going here since they first opened and I'm delighted! Always good service and outdoor seating on the balcony is fabulous.

I felt compelled to write a good review for this place because I heard of someone who recently posted about a bad experience .

We have always had great meals and service at Shakou. 

The sushi rolls are creative and tasty . I like the seared rice for a departure from the normal preparation.

My entree tonight as every time I am here was the Sea Bass . A beautiful piece of buttery fish with fresh grilled vegetables . Tastes great almost feels like a healthy choice . 

The bartender Matt makes a wicked Manhattan. Tonight we followed that up with an excellent hand made Old Fashioned that our server Jean made for us.  

A special place in Barrington . Enjoy it !
Delicious, fresh, flavorful food.  Modern and fancy atmosphere with a bit of an upscale vibe.  Wait staff was super attentive, but not pushy.  Sushi was incredibly fresh and melted in your mouth.

Went there for my birthday dinner everybody there seemed really nice to us (the host staff, the bartender and our servers Kevin and Keely). I  think the price is reasonable and our food was phenomenal. The service was going kind of slow but it was a busy Saturday night and we couldn't decide what we want for our entree once Keely checked on us so it took forever for our food to come but that's not the restaurant's fault. The 20 pieces sashimi plate for $30 is a steal! Our drinks were awesome. Anyway I have to admit that the music was too loud and 8 of us had to yell talking to one another across the table. When I have a craving for sashimi and I'll be in the area I sure will come back to Shakou.

This place is fantastic. I'll admit I'm not the first to order sushi, but they have great sushi and other great options if you aren't into sushi. Food is fresh and plated very nicely. I was on the rooftop for a private part and it was absolutely beautiful. Great to see Barrington stepping up there game with new restaurants like this one.

Our first time there, we found the pricing to be out of line. The food was so-so, the wine was over priced compared to other restaurants in Barrington.  The service was adequate, nothing more. The loud techno music needs to be turned off and more conversational dinner music to be played.

I ordered brown rice instead of white rice and they charged me for it. I was very surprised to have to pay an additional three dollars just for a bowl of rice. 

If you need to be in a glitzy restaurant this place is for you. The outdoor upstairs patio was very nice but I don't think we ever go back there again.

Great date night. Service was outstanding, and food was stunning. Can't wait to try more of the menu as we only had sushi but everything that came out of the kitchen looked fantastic. I do recommend sitting up stairs, little quieter and if weather allows, roof top patio.

For all the hype, you would think their customer service would be exceptional! But not the case in my experience. I was there this past Saturday with a bunch of my girlfriends and we were in the upstairs bar/lounge area. We each placed our drink order and requested the bartender to split our checks(needless to say I can't think of his name -the guy with a Mohawk) apparently he had a problem with this and he showed this to us by rolling his eyes and saying 'whatever!!!'. Sorry, we only asked 4 separate checks,that's too much to ask! We were shocked! One of our friends' was from out-of-state, visiting us and we wanted to take her to one of the coolest places in Barrington, well I'm sure this place made a great impact on her! We did not place another drink order with this gentleman and proceeded to go downstairs as our table was ready. The hostess wasn't very happy and commented that we should've come downstairs earlier as she texted us a while ago. Wow, really? 
When we were seated, we made it clear to our server that we wanted our checks split to which she said,"haven't you been here before? We can't do that." ( don't know her name either as I believe she did not introduce herself) 
So we got poor service from not one or two, but 3 employees at this Barrington location and I'm not sure I would go there again or recommend this to any of my friends. Oh! and  If you don't have cash, don't even bother, becuasue if you are going with a group, they will not do seperate checks!  I absolutely expect better service than what we received for their pricey drinks and would recommend McGonigle's pub across the street , where staff is always friendly, any day

I wish this place was better. This review is about a month late, but my Valentine's date on the Saturday before was cut very short. And I mean 45 minutes short. I have never felt as rushed as we were that night. Food is great, and we had no intention of taking up the table for the entire night, but for the $100 we spent we were basically pushed out the door. Food coming 4 minutes after appetizers is a rookie mistake for a place like this. Then asked about dessert before half of our entr̩e was gone. My husband didn't even have a chance to finish 1 beer. He had to chug the last of it after the check was paid before our plates were cleared.

Tried the Newest addition to the growing family of barrington restaurants. Shakou is a great new spot that brings a fresh hip atmosphere to barrington. This was opening weekend and they did a fabulous job of providing good service and excellent food. We had not eaten at any of the other shakou spots so we did not know what to expect - pleasantly surprised. They do need to work out a few minor kinks: we had to wait a long time between courses but we can forgive this on a packed opening Saturday.  The only true complaint is a very minimal wine list and no corkage - if you are only offering a dozen or so total wines and all inexpensive let your guests bring their favorite bottles and charge $25.00 per bottle. 

We will be back, but not often I they don't fix the wine issue.

The atmosphere is swanky, feels like I'm in the city! The upstairs is beautiful for a venue! 

We ordered the bi bim bop and firecracker shrimp. Both were better than expected.

Staff is friendly and excited about the new opening!! Great addition to downtown barrington!
My wife and I love this restaurant.  Consistently good food, good service, and nice ambiance both on the roof and downstairs.

Not only have several people told me about their own rude treatment at the hands of owner Adam, meaning he didn't learn anything from me publicizing his yelling at me- but now a friend told me they're swapping premium liquor brands. Yep. She ordered a Bailey's- as listed on menu- and knew what she got wasn't the real deal. When she questioned the bartender he admitted it wasn't Bailey's- saying he can only serve what he's provided. Wonder what other top shelf brands you're paying for but not getting?

Great atmosphere and menu. Excellent sushi bar and fresh creative sushi options. Try the rack of lamb appetizer, delusions but built for one so order more if your not alone. Severice is good, very friendly. We haven't been there in the summer yet, I can't wait to come back and try their roof top patio. Priced a bit on the higher side but worth it.

Good, fresh sushi. Good selection of sake. I had the pure snow. Quite pricey at $24 though. I tried a sip of my wife's watermelon cocktail and it was tasty. The roof top deck looks nice for the summer. The blue neon lighting is a little tacky
I would give it 0 stars! Headache the minute sat down. If you want to speak with people you are with good luck!! I would not return!!
Cool vibe, but underwhelmed by the food. Disappointed it was a chain. Just nit sure what to say about this one, iind of expect to find the rat under the chef's hat....
Awesome drinks, even better sushi. A must if ur in Barrington. Fun for all, especially on Friday nights. Good happy hour crowd!

For those who would like to experience what it is like to eat inside of a Ed Hardy graphic t-shirt then this is the place for you.  For those of you that are ignorant to what good food at a reasonable price is... this is your spot! Perfect place to take your girlfriend "Snookie" from jersey shore and spend your paycheck to try and get laid. If she sees the "SWANKY" decor and "SHINY" martini glasses that are there to distract you from the utter bullshit that this place is. You might have a shot!

I was SO excited for a new Asian cuisine restaurant in Barrington. However, if you're used to even halfway decent sushi or service, you will be disappointed if you go here. Overpriced for starters, but I understand good sushi can be pricey. Beyond that, the service had terrible attitude. I picked up sushi to go, asking for an extra side of eel sauce. They took that to mean don't even put ANY eel sauce on any of the sushi. Forcing me to drive an extra half hour back and forth for it, only to be met with a manager who tried to convince me the roll DID have eel sauce (it did not). 
Finally with my eel sauce, the sushi was still very sub par, beneath even the lowest tier sushi I have ever had. Great idea, terrible execution. Will not be returning. Learn a little something from the incredible service at the brunch restaurant next door.
If you're still hungry for sushi and don't want to pay a fortune, go to Naomi's. Way better. Way nicer.

Service was the  worst! We were totally ignored.. Server was very friendly but preoccupied with another table. Food took 45 min! They were obviously under staffed. Food was as good as any city sushi spot (so I gave them 2 stars) decor was nice but acoustics were pretty bad. The club music was very Schaumburg and tasteless, don't get me wrong I love me some good EDM. We won't be back-- plenty of other places to get good sushi without the annoyance of having to ask host for a glass of water and wait 15 for check and ask for it twice.

Food is very very good, prices are very steep. I got the green dragon roll and it was amazing and came with 12 pieces I believe but I ended up paying close to $30 just for one roll and an appetizer split amongst 3 people. Go here with your parents or boyfriend

Went here last night with out a reservation around 7:30 for 2 people expecting to wait at the bar until something opened up.    When we got there, the hostess immediately lead us to seating, only problem was it was at the Sushi Bar, which we didn't want.  She then sent us upstairs where there were "tables available".  Only problem was the tables were for seating of 8-10, which wasn't really what we had in mind either.  

We had no problem waiting at the bar, that had been the initial plan anyway.  She indicated it would be about an hour, so we ordered some calamari and some edamame to go with our drinks and wine.  Bartender was great, she helped us with a wine selection.  Less than 10 minutes later and before our appetizers arrived, we got a text message that our table was ready (???)  Ok...The bartender  transported the appetizers to the table for us, but we were a little skeptical based on the initial 15 minutes here.

From there forward it was outstanding.  Table by the window.  Good service.   I had the Sea Bass and my wife had the Short Ribs.  Both were as good as it gets.  I would highly recommend either and reasonable portions as well.  The atmosphere is great.  I don't recall the wine, but it was good and the wine selections by the glass were plentiful.

Just before we were leaving, we ran into some friends that were coming in for a late dinner.  They had been here before and had also been to the Shakou in Libertyville.  They indicated they loved it as well.

After thinking back through the night as I was writing this, I upgraded it to a 5star even with the hostess snafu, the rest just made up for the confusion.  Ww will be back.

A friend and I came here for lunch because all our friends had been raving about Shakou and we weren't disappointed. We both had Bento boxes and they were very fresh and delicious and a lot of food for the money. Our server was attentive and friendly. I want to go back and have dinner there.

I would have given 5 stars, but the table we sat at was definitely too small for 4 people. I almost knocked my glass off the table a few times, but other than that the experience was great.

Food was delicious, ambiance and decor were beautiful! 

I will definitely be back.

What a great addition to the corner of 59 and Main Street! This was my second visit in the past 6 weeks. Food was consistently wonderful. I enjoyed the sushi and my husband ordered the short rib. He liked it so much on our 1st visit, so this was an easy menu choice for him. The service was great and ambiance was beautiful. I moved from the city where there were many great sushi places near by. This is such a great find! I'll be back

Girls night out, NOT!  I arrived a few minutes early and after I was seated I asked our waiter, Tim, if they had any specials:  His exact words: "We have a bottle of wine on special, but it is $90 and I don't think you can afford that".  Seriously?  Then, not being familiar with all the nuances of sushi and feeling adventurous to order different then my standbys, I asked Tim for a brief explanation of some of the menu items.  He was curt, rude and could not be bothered.   The night went from bad to worse.  My girlfriend never received her water, I ran out of water half way through dinner, I had to get up and find our waiter to ask for another bottle of wine (when he saw me he assumed we wanted our check).   Tim walked quickly by our table a dozen times, never stopped to check on us, never asked how the food was and he rushed by so we could not even stop him and we tried.  Then when we wanted our check, the bus person had to track him down.  He stopped plenty of times at his other tables, but those patrons were little older and he assumed they would spend more than us I guess.  So, if you look like you are flowing with cash, this is a great place, if you are an average working girl/guy (who also happens to be a server at a different establishment), I suggest a different place.  Oh Yeah, I spoke to the manager (after waiting 10 minutes for him) and he just nodded and said:  Ok, well next time we will give you a free dessert.  There will not be a next time.

Best new business in Barrington. Have been there about 20 times since they opened last fall. Not only is it a great "grown" up place but they are wonderful when you have kids with you. Literally, the best kids meal. Would totally recommend this for not only for sushi but their other items---the braised short ribs are outstanding.

Finally a suburbs restaurant that actually feels like the city!!! The ambience and decor in Shakou is young and inviting. We were super pleased with the sushi selection. It was quite hard to pick what to order, given the expansive menu. Because of this, we will certainly be back... There is so much more to try and enjoy. Thanks Shakou!

A nearby sushi restaurant was closed yesterday so we searched for another and came across this place. We though sure lets give it a try. We walked in and saw 2 people sitting down, others getting seated, and we saw some empty tables in the dining hall. We went to the front and asked if there was a wait and the little girl hostess said Yes its 1.5 hours. Im like for 2 people?!?!?!? SHe looked at me and said yes. My friend and I couldnt get out fast enough to find another restaurant. Are you kidding me 1.5 hours? Even the nicest busiest restaurants dont have a 1.5 hour wait how could a restaurant like this with no line out the door have such a long wait? I dont want to use my imagination on why they might have said it but we will not be returning Ill spend my money elsewhere. And reading the other 1-2 star reviews it sounds like some of the people who work here/own this place are not nice so Im glad I went elsewhere. I hate supporting selfish rude business owners.

I recently posted a review which I am revising due to a break down in communication.

4 stars because the reservation process should have been better communicated.  I made the reservation 1 month in advance but I was not aware that I needed to confirm the day of.  The seating arrangement was very tight for a party of 12.

I am happy with the way Adam handled my concerns.

The food and signature cocktails impressed everyone.

Good service, good food, and pretty nice ambiance, but it was definitely over-priced. I would agree that the sushi was higher grade here than at most other sushi restaurants I have been to and that there is a premium for that (I live in Chicago and eat sushi A LOT), but it wasn't worth the price when I compare it to similar quality sushi, even in Chicago.
Great atmosphere and awesome staff.  I enjoyed the selection of rolls and appetizers.

Glad we have a new restaurant in Barrington.  It has a fun atmosphere and they did a great job decorating it.  Food was satisfactory but did not blow our socks off.  The nigiri was fresh.  The miso soup was a bit watery for my taste.  The rolls were ok.  The staff was friendly and the food came out quickly but we were there for lunch on a weekday so things were slow.  I'm sorry some have has such negative experiences.  Hope they are just working out the kinks.
Yummy yummy!  Great presentation and delicious food!  Also, service was great and great Mojito.

My friends and I go out every Friday for dinner, sometimes we try new place and sometimes  old favorites. This was a new experience for the 4 of us,and for a change I get to write a good review! The ambiance  on the upper outside deck was terrific. The seating was varied between high tables and very low tables. We were told there would be a 45 minute wait for outdoor seating @9pm but were pleasantly surprised that we were seated after only minutes. The wait staff was attentive and the food was really good and we thought very reasonably priced! I would recommend this restaurant and will definitely go back!!

And we have a winner.  This place is great.  The outdoor patio is wonderful.  The bar is very hip and cool.  The menu has a ton of great options if you love sushi or want a Chinese dish.  I highly recommend this place.

Finally some outstanding sushi in the burbs!  The cuts of fish were like butter. Fresh and melted in your mouth. We had a large group and tried many appetizers, salads, and nigiri. It was all fantastic and the service was good as well.
Great steak and shrimp dinner followed by an out of site dessert! Friendly staff and prices seem in line. Wife and Father-in-law also had a great meal. Defiantly would go back.

Cool looking restaurant, great rooftop patio with nice view of downtown Barrington.  The sushi was good but not as good as Tokio Sake or Bistro Wasabi. The service was absolutely horrid. We were told that it would be a 30 minute wait for a table on the patio. Ok so we went to the bar to get a drink. Before we got our drinks were even ready a hostess came over and said our table was ready.  We said give us a few minutes to get our drinks and settle up. We go to our table and no server. We see a server and ask her to find our server. The hostess walks by and doesn't check in. After 20 minutes of NOBODY coming to our table we flag another service and explained the situation.  She was great (Shannon I think?) and apologized and took our orders right away. My martini was terrible, what martini has huge chunks of ice in it?! At least they comped the drink. When we talked with the manager Zachary, he didn't apologize once, just told us why things had gone wrong. We said we'd like to be back if the staff ups their game. He told us to show his card when we go in next time. He gave us a card with someone else's name on it! So weird.

Shakou is unique sushi and Asian food, but it's way too expensive (both food and drinks) and this restaurant is SO loud you can't hear the people at your table talking.  With so many Sushi offerings nearby, not sure we can justify another trip here...
Love the stylish space and rooftop - great addition to Barrington - great sushi for the burbs

Decide to celebrate my belated bday here, sat at the bar very friendly staff they have me favorite vodka (Chopin) food was delish (had a noodle dish with veggies shrimp and scallops) I'll be back to try sushi and wine next time

Went to lunch with 6 people today. Service was excellent, food ( rolls, shumai soup, bento box)  was amazing and the watermelon cocktail did its job. The bento box is huge!  Can't wait to go back again.  I love that the manager came over personally to check in as well.

Shakou Barrington is relatively new, I like the contemporary decor, good service & easy parking.  We have ordered several things to share:  the Mushroom Salad was excellent, crisp with delicious dressing, a must try.  Fried Soft Shell Crab was fine but the crust/batter was a little too thick.  We also ordered two rolls, Black Widow was very unique, black rice topped with scallop, great presentation, special and delicious.  However the Fillo Wrapped Ahi Tuna was very disappointing, there was too much sauce over the roll and you couldn't tell there was any tuna inside, I did not like the texture and will not recommend that roll.  Lastly, the Chirashi with Seasoned Rice was good, sashimi were fresh however it would be better if the slices of fish were thicker.  All in all, a nice dining experience and I may go back to try some other dishes.

I would have given it 5 start but the music was just too loud and we could hardly hear ourselves talk. There were 6 of us.

The food was tasty and good, reasonably priced. We were there for dinner.  Our waitress was nice and informative. Had ShrimpTempura appetizer, California Roll & Veggie fried rice.

We have also been for lunch. The Bento Boxes are excellent .

They just opened this location and let me say it is absolutely amazing in all aspects!! The service was superb all the staff were extremely nice and helpful. The interior is amazing and the rooftop patio is gorgeous. I would go just for atmosphere alone let alone the food! Food was absolutely great. We had the pink cadillac, ocean drive, dragon fire, and black widow for rolls and I also had the seafood miso soup which was great and had a bit of a kick to it and lots of flavor! All the rolls were amazing probably some of the best sushi I've had and I love that they give you the option of having black rice. I usually get brown but the black was a great alternative and get it extra flavor and density. My guy even said "I don't care much for sushi but this I actually do enjoy". For dessert we were recommended exotic bamba which was very light yet sweet and hit the spot even though all the desserts looked absolutely amazing. We sat upstairs at the bar and the bartender Doug was super helpful and nice. I'll definitely be going back. 10/10 would recommend! Great for drinks and dates too!

Came here with my dad and his girlfriend on a Thursday night (2/4) for my very belated birthday dinner; it was our first time here(since we usually go to nearby Sagano for our sushi)--it was awesome here! The menu is gi-normous; loved the huge and creative variety of maki rolls plus the large selection of fish to choose from for both nigiri and sashimi entrees. There was also a sizable part of the menu that had non-raw fish selections(like steak, duck, chicken, etc.), which I'll probably add to my order list when I come in the next bunch of times. Our server Liz was very attentive, knowledgeable and engaging to work with--she even made some good white wine recommendations to pair with our sushi and brought out this huge slice of amazing chocolate cake with a lit candle without anyone in our party having requested it.The ambience was really cool too:if you were to turn Versailles into a minimalist 21st combination of restaurant and cocktail lounge, this is the place: high ceilings, floor to ceiling windows, black velvety-looking walls with matching booths, chandeliers, sexy metallic-finished bar/dining area, chill-out techno playing overhead--it was like no other sushi restaurant I've been to in the 'burbs. The clientele was a mostly a mix of families with kids who sat in the half of the place that had the booths and larger tables; in the bar area, there were mainly young women celebrating someone's birthday, and middle agey-looking couples. There were even these 2 cute little old ladies who shared a front booth, who appeared to be enjoying the food and the vibe of the place. Overall, I would definitely come back here; this place really livens up downtown Barrington, so having grown up in neighboring Barrington Hills, it was great to see such a hip, vibrant business move into town!
great atmosphere, has a 2nd story outside patio if spring ever arrives. sushi is excellent...
Great food and cocktails. Service is still a work in progress, but we'll definitely go back

I love, love, love this place!  I have been here numerous times for lunch and dinner and I am never disappointed.  Their staff is extremely attentive and knowledgeable.  Their food is very generous for the price - nice, thick cuts of sashimi in their bento box for lunch and their rolls are generously sized as well.  Great place to just hang out for an appetizer and drink or for a full meal.  My new go-to place in Barrington!

Not impressed!! We were expecting high end sushi and food.. We ordered the appetizer of beef w/ asparagus and ceviche.. It was small and dry.. The ceviche was served with Tostitos Chips. Not good... The sushi wasn't very appetizing, terrible presentation. I did order the Chilean Sea Bass, that was good. Service was terrible. Our waitress couldn't really recommend anything on the menu. She didn't seem that into the food.. We had reservations and we sat at a very uncomfortable small high table.. Definitely not going back..

If I could give this place zero stars I would!! I was so excited to try this place out as I love trying new restaurants, am a big foodie and absolutely love sushi. Unfortunately, I was completely disappointed. The atmosphere is nice and looks like there is a neat patio area upstairs. However, the service ruined everything. The girls at the front desk were extremely rude and didn't even try to be helpful. While I was discussing an issue with my reservation that I had made with one of the rude host girls, the manager or owner walked up. I thought my issue would get resolved at that point, but instead the owner/manager was even more rude than the host girl. I couldn't believe it! The food is very expensive and pretty much just like any other sushi in the area. The owner/manager needs a reality check that just because they are new and busy right now doesn't mean they will stay that way if they don't keep the customers happy and wanting to come back. Horrible horrible horrible and a waste of my money and time.
Have been there a couple times for business and for pleasure. All experiences have been great!

Without a doubt, the sushi at this restaurant is the worst I ever had.  The sushi all tasted like the fish had been stored in lemon juice, which unfortunately is common among restaurants that try to mask the flavor of old fish.   All of the sushi "leaked" on the plate, further suggesting something wasn't right with the fish.   The only thing worse than the food was the service.  The service was slow.  It took at least 20 minutes to get menus, then another 20 minutes to get our drinks, and then another 40 minutes to get the four selections of sushi we ordered.  When we finally got our food, two of the orders were wrong.  The server just rolled her eyes and took it away.  When she came back with the right order another 25 minutes later, never saying a word, just dropping the plates with a loud thump and a crappy attitude.  To top everything off,  I was sick for a day after eating something at this place.  All of this for came at a high price, too.  We found the prices almost twice those of sushi restaurants that are 100% better.
Excellent atmosphere, great food, and outstanding service. This has become a family favorite. It is much more than just sushi.

A great addition to the Barrington restaurant scene.  The atmosphere is perfect for a quiet date or a group.  We enjoyed going with a group and being able to share various Maki.  There is an outdoor deck on the 2nd floor, which makes a warm weather visit a must.

Your review helps others learn about great local businesses.

THRILLING... that sums up the feeling this foodie feels about Shakou coming to the village!
Not only was the food exquisitely presented but it tasted delicious too! We mostly had Sashimi and Nigiri. My litmus test for great sushi is, how well the fish stands on its own without sauces! I love the creative and out of the box rolls, however, they mask the true flavor and freshness of the fish. I am more than delighted to say the fish was fresh, flavorful, and at a perfect temperature. Also, the flavor of their rice was nothing less than perfection! Not only do they have typical Japanese restaurant cuisine but they have entrees with such meals as Chilean Sea Bass, Tilapia, and other delightful looking meals. I definitely plan on making this a regular dining experience. I held back on the desserts but they looked fabulous! My birthday dinner will be celebrated at Shakou and I will definitely be trying their desserts.

Had a fantastic evening with friends at Shakou. This new restaurant is way too cool and hip for Barrington! The service was good and the food was terrific. I recommend the short ribs, sea bass, and sushi. Try the duck appetizer, amazing! Everything was nicely prepared and fresh. Try it soon if you haven't been yet. Looking forward to hanging on the amazing second story patio this summer!
Great food and the atmosphere was great! Server did try and rush us at the end but we were a little late for our reservation...We will be back!

Beautiful place great decor.... Great out door patio too.  The food was excellent we had 20 people the service was great.  All in all everything was delicious.  Looking forward to my next meal there...

My family went there for take out last Friday. We ordered Baked Haddock, Fried Haddock and a Rib Dinner. Mind you, we are not strangers to this fish fry. I just want to say that we picked ours up about 6 p.m. It was awesome!!! I had been craving baked haddock for days and it was cooked to perfection. The fries were delish!! and the coleslaw it the best I have ever had. I want the recipe... good.  I sampled the fried haddock as well and it was unbelievable as well. Of course I had to try some of the fall off the bone tender ribs too. The sauce is fantastic, not too spicy, not too sweet. You can eat in or carry out here, we like to take it home. I only wish I could eat here every Friday night! Go here, you will not be disappointed. Fish is served 5-8 pm. Don't forget your cash though.... it's cash only, the dinners average $10 to $12.

As you enter, the door "Slams" behind you. Everyone in "Our Place" immediately is aware that you have arrived..."heads turn in this classic dive".

17 metal bar stools envelope what appears to be a meticulous Walnut Wood Bar with a dimension of clear liquid. The concrete floor is layered with epoxy supporting 7 vinyle bench style booths straight from 1960.

Schooners of PBR on tap wash down the daily lunch special; "Damn near perfect Dive Bar"...

After living away from the area for over 35 years, I was  excited to go to a Friday night fish fry!

This place did not disappoint. We got the following:
Shrimp Plate - 5 giant butterflied shrimp with fries GOOD
Perch Plate - generous portion of ocean perch and fries EXCELLENT! 
Haddock Plate - two huge pieces of haddock and fries  EXCELLENT! 

The tartar sauce was overly sweet for us, but it was good. Cole slaw was good, too!

We will be going back this Friday to check out a couple of more fish and seafood options. I hear the ribs are good, so I will try those at some point. 

The staff was very friendly and helpful. 
Service was quick, fast, and in a hurry. I ordered take out and was out of there in less than 10 minutes. 

Prices are very reasonable. 

If you are in the area, you should check it out. I don't think you will be disappointed.
Came back and tried the 16oz butt steak, it was fantastic.  Ribeye will be next!

A friend told me about this place. He said i had to try the fish fry. The fish was awful the only thing I liked was the coleslaw. So I give it two stars for the coleslaw only. Now there's something fishy about the fish. Back in my day while I was going to college I used to work on fishing boats. They said I was getting a haddock dinner but that fish sure tasted like cod to my taste buds. Oh well I am still in search of a good fish fry out here. Maybe i should have tried the catfish instead .

Hands down best fish fry in the Fox Valley! Staff are super friendly and service is good. Ribs are excellent as well.

Fills up fast on Friday fish fry so get there early or order take out. Great little neighborhood bar. Perfect for having a beer with friends and being able to talk with out competing against 40 TV sets and a juke box!

My wife and I went here every Friday for years for their fish. She got catfish and I got haddock and it was always delicious! Friendly, friendly wait staff and bartenders. Their ribs are some of the best I've had also. Very reasonably priced. If you're ever in the area on a Friday night I encourage you to go.

Great little bar.. older crowd so dont expect a rowdy crowd.. friday night fish fry is very good. However they also have other food thats great any time.. grill is not open all the time only for lunch and dinner. But if u are in town and want a good bite to eat try the our burger it is a very good burger that fills ya up

Stopped by this place on a whim and we were pleasantly surprised. We have driven by for years and never thought to stop in because it doesn't look like much on the outside. We have been missing out. Food was outstanding and owners are very polite and friendly (especially the wife). Prices were fair too! Highly recommend this place for a low key dinner and drinks. Family atmosphere.

First of all - this place does NOT take credit cards!!  Leave your plastic at home and bring your cash.  This is not stated on the menus nor the front door so be warned here!

We went on a Saturday night on recommendation from my husband's coworker.  Had a wonderful meal and great service.  My husband got the rib dinner for $11.50, I got a half fried chicken dinner for $9.  We shared our meals and honestly, they were both absolutely off the charts yummy.  He had a beer, I had a couple of cocktails, and our bill was only $33.  Unbelievable value.

The building and interior are not anything fancy - remind me of a resort town bar in Wisconsin.  Lots of beer signs and simple decor.  I won't even suggest it needs updating because it is what it is and the decor is very bar-like. 

Our server was incredibly sweet and apologetic about the cash thing (no, we didn't know, and tried to pay with a credit card) ... she told us where the closest ATM was.  Told her we'd be back next weekend so she gave us a take out menu and explained the menu very thoroughly to us.  She told us that the Mexican Pepper Steak, when served, is so popular that people call ahead of time and "reserve" it.  Some people reserve extras to take home and freeze!

So if you're looking for great food and a relaxing bar where you feel like you're among regulars but not treated as an outsider, try Our Place Restaurant.
Get to go fish fry from here, so yummy! It is cash only and you cannot call ahead but it's ok bc when you get home the food is worth the hassel :-)
Great food!  Doesn't look like much, but the food will keep me coming back.  The service is amazing!

So I went back bc some local friends wanted fish. Mistake!!! I met the owner- he was a jerk. His name is Kenny, he is a large man with the voice of a shrimp. He bragged about his food (which sucked) and he swears like a sailor. I had a burger with beans (no taste or flavor) and the beer was flat. Again, this shit hole sucks. Why I let my friends talk me in to going back is beyond me.

Best pasta ever. Saturday night all you can  eat pasta for $8.50 is totally worth it. Meat sauce is loaded with meat. Not a lot of parking and doesn't accept credit cards but has a great small neighborhood bar feeling to it.

This is a great local's hangout, it has a bar and restaurant area. They are really known for their Friday Night Fish Fry. I go here all the time for the haddock fish fry on Friday nights. It does get pretty crowded on Friday nights, it can get pretty loud inside as well. It's very similar look and feel of a place you'd see up in northern Wisconsin. Food is always good. We've order most everything on the menu over the many years we've been going here and everything is honestly good. Generous portions, you will not go home hungry. Ken the owner is always great to chat with if you do a take out order, he sits in the back and takes the orders. The waitresses are always pleasant and great service. This is a CASH ONLY business, so just make sure you bring cash. They have monthly specials, so check them out. First Saturday of every month is Steak and Lobster, second Saturday of every month is Fajitas, third Saturday of every month is Prime Rib and remaining Saturday's are Chef's Choice Special. Great little place - Enjoy!

the place has been revamped and still has that cozy feeling, Each Saturday has a different special. The first of the month is Steak and Lobster yum and at a great price 19.00 . I had scrimp scampi with steak yum 13.00 mmm comes with a potato or rice and a vegetable green beans so good with a tomato sauce. The waitresses are great and so are the owners who come over to greet you and always have a big smile on their faces. Thank you  Kat

I. Love. This. Place. The atmosphere is great (in the hibachi area - dark behind you, but comfortably lit in front of you). I've been here 3 times and every chef has been great. I love the little tricks they do and the humor they put into food preparation. If you gave never been to a hibachi before, I totally recommend Kyoto. If you've been here before, you know why. 


If you get steak with your dish, as was recommended to me by a chef here, I'll recommend to you - mix the mustard sauce with the ginger sauce and use it with your steak. Holy. Crap. It's amazing! 

We will be regulars here for sure!

This is one of my favorite restaurants anywhere.  I don't give five stars as that would be reserved for that caliber of restaurant.  Habachi is good depending on the chef..little stunned last time when the chef was brought out a big beer to drink while he made out dinner.  Thought it was a joke when he toasted the adults.  Nonetheless, even though he was drinking as he cooked, who doesn't, he performed all the standard "tricks" flawlessly.

Sushi here is stellar..

1/5 service - Sat for about 10 minutes and no server. Whoever it was that took our order didn't even put our sushi order in so waited extra for that. Finally the actual server comes and even after that it was another 10 or so minutes to get the hibachi chef who then leaves for some time. The dude's car got hit in the lot so he comes back off his game which I don't fault him for but should've asked for a sub since he threw hot veggies at a girl's eye and pretty much burnt everything he cooked. 

1.5/5 food - sushi was eh, had the spider roll and it was unusually salty and the portion was ridiculously small for the price. Fried rice would've been good if it wasn't burned. The burner isn't cleaned well with every course so it leaves some gunk on the food. Food probably would've been good if it wasn't burnt. 

1/5 price - food and service did not live up to he hefty price. 

Will I come back to try again? Nah not worth the drive.

Went tonight to celebrate my daughters birthday.  Today is her actual birthday and she specially requested sushi.  First, they understand NOTHING about what gluten is .  They awkwardly switched servers 3 times due to gluten confusion.  So as it turned out , hardly anyone served us---HORRIBLE service.  They forgot to bring my salad and the fried rice--which came with an up charge was undercooked and crunchy.  When I told them, they pretty much said "oh, well--I tell the kitchen".  Nothing further.  I'd explained it was a special night and that we were celebrating our daughter's  birthday.   This went totally ignored, yet we heard the loud cymbals as they clanged their way through the restaurant to celebrate other diner's birthday.  This was a horrible, over priced disappoint.  We had to finally flag someone down just to get our bill.  Did I mention not only terrible service by completely lacking ?  Go to Wasabi grill instead--they won't disappoint .

Me and My wife went to this Japanese Grill for our date night and it has some of the best Japanese Noodles and Sushi! We loved there spicy crab sushi, everything tasted great and it was very fresh. A lot of sushi bars lack freshness. This place definitely had it!

This place is hands down the best around for the money and quality can't bet it always nice staff and cooks are always super upset to make it a good dinner experience for sure. When parents with kids always sit with us they always mess with them I bunch to make them laugh and keep the watching! We have always had amazing food with never having anything cooked wrong and can't beat the price. A must try for sure!

I really enjoy Kyoto, the food is delicious. My most favorite thing they cook up for you on the hibachi grill is the fried rice!!!! It is outstanding, I wish they'd give you more! 

Personally I don't like how crowded it gets, it's not comfortable for me to be smushed next to 12 people. And after several times going here and other hibachi grills I've noticed all their tricks are the same, so it gets a little old for me. But on a plus side, the food is terrific and I have never been disappointed. :)

My sister and hubby have raved about this spot forever. I have to be honest I'm usually one that avoids Japanese steakhouses- not sure why... But I never thought they'd ever have good sushi. Let's just say this place is a winner and surprised me. GREAT sushi very fresh. Outstanding drinks and hibachi was wonderful. We had Andy for our chef he was EPIC so great with the kids. Highly recommended and - get reservations or go early. It's PACKED and for great reason.

I had an awesome time. The dinner combos were perfect and filling. Price was actually not bad either. The service was exceptional. I had dinner in under 30mins which was kinda quick for a busy night. Overall awesome place with a bit of a higher price if you want hibachi.

We've tried numerous places locally but we believe this is the best sushi in the area.  Very fresh with a large and diverse  menu.   They have a great carry out business.  As far as the cooking areas,  they have a terrific atmosphere with highly skilled cooks--and very entertaining.   Overall,  the staff is reliable and very friendly.  I recommend this place for anyone looking for a good sushi bar or for a Japanese steakhouse--or both!

The worst service I've ever had.  The server literally looked annoyed.  I would not recommend this place if your looking to relax and have a good time.  They take their time to seat you even with a reservation and then can't push you out the door fast enough.

Koyoto is ab average sushi place for the area. If you want better you're better off going to Chicago or Naperville. Or bistro wasabi! But it's not bad for the area. Their chicken teriyaki is really good!! I always ask for extra sauce and they give it to me! Their lobster roll is super delicious with salmon over it. 

Service could be better! I think it's an English barrier.

Very  slow ,and sub par service staff makes this a must avoid if possible place when in Crystal lake. With the amount of places to eat out there you could do so much better and at half the price. The wait staff sees you once to take the order then to drop off the check other than that your on your own. We had one cup of tea in two hours when we asked for more hot water the girl said they were out?  seriously?  We asked for soda instead but she never came back...some other person came and dropped off the bill 15 minutes later .. Sorry but this is not being attentive to customers and to never check back to see how your food was  is really basic service they don't do here ... AVOID THIS DUMP!

Went here right when they opened so it was us and one other couple at a table which was super nice since we didn't feel squished in. Boyfriend has never been to a hiabachi grill before and it was fun. Super filling!!! Loved the soup. the salad was just okay. The rice was yummy he had fried which he enjoyed I had white rice. Then shrimp and veggies comes even before the main course and I chose the ginger dipping sauce. Very gingery I loved it! Boyfriend like their teryaki sauce best he also tried the mustard. My first time drinking SAKE! I had their cold dry one but it came in a cute bottle which I loved and they gave me a little glass. I liked the taste it went down easy. Boyfriend had Sapporo beer which he enjoyed it comes in a big bottle. WE both loved ending this huge meal with their green tea ice cream. Smooth and creamy. yum. So full but so worth it! It is expensive but we wanted to try this place and you get a lot for your money. Staff was excellent!! no complaints and everything moved quickly maybe because we got there so early but it was great.

Teppenyaki (not hibachi, very different). You have to love it. I have been to several including ones in Japan and Okinawa (yep been there and got the shirt). Most people compare these types of eateries to similar ones in the states because they not experienced ones in Asia. In most the grill is a bar type with a curve or round style, so you sit, drink, and eat. This place is OK for the area. Very packed on the weekends and loud because the grills are so close together. However, considering it is in the states.... Not bad. 

. You have to love it. I have been to several including ones in Japan and Okinawa (yep been there and got the shirt). Most people compare these types of eateries to similar ones in the states because they not experienced ones in Asia. In most the grill is a bar type with a curve or round style, so you sit, drink, and eat. This place is OK for the area. Very packed on the weekends and loud because the grills are so close together. However, considering it is in the states.... Not bad.

Okay food, APPALLING customer service!!!!!

We made reservations almost six weeks ago for 11 people to celebrate two birthdays; I have a very serious chronic health condition, and was, unfortunately, unable to attend at the last moment...which was upsetting, as none of us had ever been there and I was incredibly excited to go celebrate with my family! 

When my family got there, they were harassed for over five minutes for having only 10 instead of 11 people - the staff was incredibly rude, complaining over and over and OVER that accurate reservations are important.  THEN they treated them poorly the entire time (presumably because of the "incorrect" head count), and continued to complain about the "missing person".  And they brought the check before dessert even arrived!  My husband went to place and order for me to go (I was sooooooo excited to try their food...I wanted sashimi so badly last night; I had been looking forward to my husband and brother-in-law's birthdays, and trying Kyoto all week!), and they brought the check within two seconds of the dessert order.  My family had PLANNED to order $15 worth of sashimi for me and at least one more round of drinks (10 alcoholic beverages would have added up to a quite nice chunk of change, I do believe), but Kyoto made darn sure to push them right out the door as soon as they could.  

So thanks a whole lot, Kyoto, for ruining two birthdays, and making me feel even worse than I already had.  Thanks for making someone who was really sick and already in bed at 6pm on a Saturday night cry.  Next time I'll be sure to get sick at your restaurant and sleep at the table, just so you can not harass my family, kick them out early, and not let me have a meal.  And guess what?  The food, according to ALL TEN PEOPLE, wasn't even worth the price, the HORRIBLE SERVICE, the way you made me cry (thanks again!), or the overcrowding (they couldn't even interact - so what was the point of going to celebrate?).  Next time we'll be sure to go to SAKURA IN MCHENRY where we always get amazing food and service.

You really should be ashamed.  Just...ashamed.

I had a reservation booked two weeks in advance for 8pm and after 20 minutes the host told me that until the last 2 people of a 14 person party got here we couldn't be sat. I'm sorry but if I make a reservation for a specific time then it obviously was for a reason. In order for a restaurant to succeed in this industry then the service and food have to both exceed expectations.

I love Kyoto by far the best Asian food in Mchenry county. The hibachi salmon is my favorite. Huge portions. The sushi is so fresh and I love the salmon sashimi. The place gets packed fast so make reservations.
Love this place! Most frequented restaurant in a short stay by far. Love the Chicago roll. Also great value. Look forward to sampling everything they do!!
We don't eat here very often, but we have never been disappointed. My last meal was a bento box in January of 2015. It was good.

Very disappointed. I am giving one star because the fish tasted good but all the special rolls were sloppy, the wrapping wasn't tight, in fact in several it didn't even connect. The rice on the outside was strange looking and the fish was "squished". When we points out that the special rolls were so sloppy that you couldn't eat them with chopsticks we were basically given a oh that's too bad and asked if we wanted forks. After we asked for boxes for the leftovers they brought over an appetizer to apologize. How about combing the sushi rolls that were not rolled properly. The evening ended with my husband sick as a dog on the couch.... Leftovers are in the trash and we will not be back.

My favorite Japanese restaurant. Great atmosphere,  entertaining at the hibachi grill table. Food is delicious. I always get the filet and shrimp. It's a ton of food but you can split it with another person for a charge. Excellent food and service.
Excellent food and service! Loved their carpaccio, beef with asparagus, rolls, and food made by the chef on the hibachi grill. Good selection of sake and drinks.

I've been here for almost every birthday since I was 5, this is my favorite restaurant in the area. DEFINITELY the best sushi in McHenry County. I could drink the house salad dressing, the sake tuna carpaccio is EVERYTHING, and I've never had a bad sushi roll. The fish is always fresh and delicious. I recomment the mountain roll, and if sushi isn't your thing the calamari teryaki is delicious. I don't have a single bad thing to say about this place.
Love the ginger dressing. Delish sushi. Yummy drinks. My regular order, hibachi filet with fried rice my favorite.

We so enjoyed dining here for dinner! Sat in a booth as we were only getting sushi. Service was attentive, and the food was amazing. Highly recommend the Moon River maki roll. Really loved the atmosphere too!

We had a party of 5 and ate on the Sushi side of the restaurant. Minus all the production and "show" on the hibachi side you can concentrate on the food. In a word...TERRIBLE. 2 had sushi and ate half. They used minced sushi in many rolls and the texture was awful. 3 of us ordered from the hibachi menu. The 3 dishes were salmon, scallops and golden shrimp. The shrimp was gut wrenching swimming in egg juice. The salmon looked like it was fried under a press. The scallops as well with strange breading ...all with a taste of old oil. How this restaurant survives is beyond me.
My favorite japanese restaurant so far! My friends are real experts when it comes to world cuisine and they were stunned by this place! Cant wait to go back soon.

This is date night for 30+ and older couples.  :-)

Very popular in town for couples night out etc.  

Great steaks and great sushi.  

Enjoy a nice Japanese Restaurant right here in Crystal Lake.

Great food!  chef was entertaining and the dinner was very good.  Also, note the bartenders were great.  

One issue was hostess.  We had a reservation, and upon checking in about 15 minutes prior, we sat over at the bar.  About 5 minutes prior to our reservation, the hostess came to us sitting at the bar waiting, and advised it would be shortly (Confirming our name, etc). We didn't have a problem with them being a litte late.  It was a saturday night. 

45 minutes later still no dinner.  Finally, we went to the hostess.  I KID YOU NOT, she had the tenacity to tell us she DID infact call us, and "you were busy talking".  ARE YOU KIDDING ME!   

I understand the place is packed, and she's got a lot on her plate. DO NOT blame a mistake she made or whomever on us.  The fact she confirmed we were still present 5 minutes prior to our reservation.  Shoudl have justified her walking over and poking us EVEN IF WE WERE talking.   However, I am sure she never called our name. We were hungry to begin with, so trust me.  I'm ready to goooooo :)


I really prefer to give a lower rating, because I've never been so affended by a hostess.  However, since the food, chef and bartenders were good. I will not penalize them.

Had reservations tonight for 7:30. They were more than an hour late! If they are full with reservations why do the take walk-ins? You would think management would have this figured out! She was rude as well.
Very disappointed!!! Won't go back.

I have done the sushi and the hibachi at this place and loved them both. If you want to do something different for a small party or a birthday the hibachi is very entertaining! Sushi is always good and food is good quality.

Excellent sushi - my favorite of any I've tried. Cooked hibachi items also top notch. Cooking tables are fun as the chefs are skilled and entertaining. Best sushi and hibachi steakhouse you'll find. Must try the kyoto roll! They moved into a new location so there's plenty of seating, full bar.

Hostess were a bit rude; didn't make you feel welcome at all. Arrived at 6 Saturday night and were seated immediately which was a pleasant surprise. The wait staff was quick and attentive. We had a great chef, "Billy the Kid"!  He was funny, energetic and lively the entire meal.  I had filet and chicken.  The filet was melt in your mouth delicious!  Haven't been here in years but will come back again.
Excellent sushi! The Godzilla roll was huge and so delicious. Fast service and friendly staff. I will definitely be back here.

Where to start? The Hibachi grill is 'the' place to sit for an entertaining show put on by their chefs. Each chef does the show slightly differently, but they are all talented and cook the food to order. Meal starts with miso soup and a Fantastic Ginger salad dressing (YUM) on the salad. Seafood, steak, fried rice - we've never been disappointed with the food. Staff serving drinks and soup/salad are not always there when you need them, but the show is so good the restaurant gets 5 stars anyway. It's a nice date place, good for family events, and good for kids. The chefs are always really nice to the kids.
Great sushi..get the Crystal Lake roll... And if nice outside patio is wonderful ... As are their Manhattans!

This restaurant doesn't even deserve a star. I order over $100 of carryout yesterday and the food was not up to standards as served in the restaurant.. I called and spoke with the manager and they did nothing. I will never return and I will tell all of crystal  lake about it. There is another Japanese Steak house not much further name Kobe. I will stick with them. There treat their Customers like gold and the food is 2000 times better.

Don't drive to Benny's if you are craving Hibachi.  Equal experience and food quality here in CL. Service is very good and setting is cool. Sushi and grill chefs are pros.  The sit down / sushi bar section is somewhat small but it works.  Place Is hopping on the weekends, but we have always been seated quickly.
Favorite special occasion restaurant!  Excellent food and best portion size of similar restaurants in the area.  Looking forward to our next visit!
Love the new digs. Brought my two year old and he loved it. Always get the spicy shrimp and it's to die for!!!  The chefs make me laugh ever time I'm there. Stay for the green tea ice cream too.

The chef was friendly and fun.  The food was really good.  But service was ok, the waitress seemed mad to be there, didn't crack a smile, did her job but you can feel the uneasiness when she left our sight.  Id go back but will definitely ask for different waitress.

Ive never liked sushi.  My entire life, every time I tried it I was left disappointed and couldn't understand peoples obsession with the stuff.  Then I was talked in to ordering sushi from Kyoto.  Fantastic.  Everything we have ordered from there has been delicious and impressive.  As far as everyone else who complained on here its not really fair.  It gets crowded yes, but that because its the best restaurant in town.  A 20% gratuity is fine due to the fact that when you cheap it out its 15% and with a chef doing tricks at the table I would expect to pay 25% so the way I see it its a deal.  My recommendation is that if you want good sushi but don't want to deal with the hassle of being seated, order ahead of time and get it for pick up!

The food is good. Really good. This time we didn't have to wait. The issue this time was the service staff. They are all new. One didn't know what the other was doing. We had to flag them down for water and drinks. As soon as the food was done cooking, WHAM! Whose ready for ice cream? I get the idea if flipping tables but come on for $150 I better have better service than this. There was another family at the other end of our table, our waitress fawned over them, even taking 5-6 retakes of their picture. We got a 1 quick snap blurry picture. Happy birthday to my husband. For her efforts the waitress got less than a 10%. Had she treated us better it easily would have been our standard 25. Perhaps management should start reading these reviews and doing some quality control and retraining staff.

This place is fantastic for all occasions! The owner and all staff are great. I go there with my girlfriend on special nights or with the entire family too! There are no complaints here. Clearly all the food is fresh and the chefs make the entire experience a joy. I typically get the steak and salmon and both are always delicious. Also, they have a great cocktail menu. 

If you plan on going there on a holiday, then make sure you make a reservation!  This place gets packed for a reason!

I'm giving four stars. The food is absolutely to die for, however unfortunately over the years they keep raising prices. But I do recommend bringing family and friends here especially for a birthday! Sushi is made fresh and you can watch them do it.

You had me at lobster tails.

And almost lost me when 'tails' turned out to be just 'tail.' I mean, if a menu implies plural lobster tails - you can't really blame a girl for being a bit miffed when the dish comes up short. 

Fortunately, this was a case where quality definitely won out over quantity - and I'll take one DELICIOUS lobster tail over two not-so-delicious tails any day. After just a taste, Kyoto was back in my good graces.

My dining companion and I opted for the Hibachi style lobster tail, which is DELICIOUSLY prepared with salt, pepper, and soy sauce - already removed from the shell and separated into small fork-perfect pieces. Extra presentation points for using the hollowed-out shell as a garnish!  

I should preface this portion of my review by pointing out the fact that I've just recently jumped onto the sushi bandwagon. This probably goes without saying, but as such -- I have yet to cross the line into more adventurous territory. 

Translation: I don't eat raw fish (yet). 

Thankfully, there are plenty of other fish (and crustaceans!) in the sushi sea - so this hasn't hindered my newfound maki Love one bit. And I'm usually not one to kiss and tell...but between you and me? I've hooked up with more than my share of shrimp tempura rolls. In the process, I've become acquainted with all the little details that equal a tasty roll in my book. (1) A crispiness that is not lost amongst pieces of avocado (I Love me some avocado, but crispy shrimp trumps green mush!); (2) Reasonable roll-to-mouth ratio (because it's just not enjoyable if I have to cut the roll in half); and (3) It's got to be tight! (loosely packed rice and hanging-off seaweed ends need not apply). 

Kyoto's shrimp tempura was amazingly crispy - with a surprisingly light batter, and was definitely the star of the roll (take a backseat, avocado!). Also to my delight, the roll was perfectly sized and I easily took it in with just one bite. Alas, If not for the sloppy seaweed ends -- Kyoto would have earned a perfect score from me. But hey, what's a couple presentation points lost when taste and service score near perfect? I'm definitely willing to overlook a couple loose (seaweed) ends, and will continue to roll with Kyoto!
Never disappointed.  Some of the best sushi in the area!  The box lunches are a great deal as well as the Spicy Maki combo at dinner time.
So many choices on the sushi menu! The pictures of some of them, as well as our very knowledgeable waitress, helped us decide. Super Yummy!!!

First time ever dining here & it will be the last. Made reservations for 2 of us 3 weeks ago for 7:30 and didn't get seated until 8:20.
