When we placed our orders we asked about soups, she quips clam chowder .. she doesn't mention the other soups, that I later learned,  are available that night .We asked what came with the ribs, she snips "only fries". In the past we always had a choice given. We asked she go back to the kitchen and ask what our choices are. A while later she comes back and again barks "out of ribs". We had it with her attitude, so we got up and started to leave. As we were walking out the door a thin blond asks us how was our dinner. After she confirmed she was a manager I gave her some examples of the waitress's rude attitude, Amanda overhears and runs over to challenge us with "how was I rude". Maybe the owner may have handled it better, but as I looked over my shoulder, as we exited, the blond and waitress Amanda were laughing and smiling with each other... so much for professionalism and respect in the treatment of your customers. ...by the way, we had a great experience down the street at Savory restaurant.

Food - is OK.  Service - well, if you want attitude with your food, you're all set!  Not knocking the servers. they have a tough job.  The owner and his son . . . are out of control arrogant.  We've dined in and carried out . .  had errors on our orders both ways . . . and WITHOUT FAIL have been given the attitude that whatever the situation is, WE are at fault and WE should apparently be honored to be dining here.  Save your money and go to V&V . .  food and service is 110% better.  Pasta Mia is a waste of your disposable income.
Went on Friday night!  Great Music - by some local talent - Johnny Monaco!!!  Great food - service could be more attentive...

My wife and I enjoy sitting outside with a glass of wine and a couple slices of pizza. On our most recent visit however, armed with a restaurant.com coupon we took my wife's sister out for a birthday dinner. My wife ordered a pasta dish while Sis and I had veal Parmigiana. So disappointed! The veal was so overcooked and dry. Wife's pasta was OK but light on the shrimp. 
Upon arriving at the restaurant I stopped inside to let them know we would be sitting outside. I was handed menus and had to go back inside after 15 minutes as they forgot about us 
Pretty lousy experience!

Very inconsistent  in quality of food and authenticity lately.  :-(

  We recently had a sit down meal on a Thursday evening when I craved a good sandwich and the wife wanted some pasta. Skipped all other restaurants in town, went here knowing best, and ordered their steak sandwich.  Simple Pizza bread appetizer arrive15 minutes  after ordering. Steak it self was very cold and over cooked.  Sent it back, and was returned to me within 3 minutes, same piece heated on the grill and was under seasoned.  My wife ordered a simple Alfredo pasta and she commented that she'd had better at local chain restaurants.  What's most concerning is that things appear to be precooked and reheated. The alfredo sauce sounds like it was out of the jar. 

  Unfortunately, the ingredients  and detail to quality has gotten worse over the past year.  Pizza is either burnt or under cooked... yes that can happen. Cheese quality has changed and only the owner(s) will know why!  The family was going to this place for over 3 years now and once upon a time officially claimed this the best pizza joint in Bartlett to all our friends and family. NO MORE

Stick to simple marinara dishes, but know that it will not taste like anyone's mother is truly cooking this, but rather just some random staff in the back. 

This was one place we loved the most  to eat at in our community, but it's time to move on to the city over and find another to take its' place.

This is the second time I've been to Pasta Mia and the only reason I went tonight is because I didn't feel like cooking. I should have saved my money.  The waitstaff has the attitude that they are doing you a favor.  The service is dismal but don't bother complaining as that falls on deaf ears.  The food is okay but not anything special.  I came home angry that I gave that establishment my hard earned money.

We were in tonight  (again)    great time:   food was awesome  service was awesome. and of course cocktails AWESOME.    keep up the good work Pasta Mia.  I love the fact that the whole family is involved there. Good idea Pete.  Pasta Mia knows how to keep their customers happy, and the neighborhood loves them.

Love the remodeling job as well.  keep up with the music there.  Great idea.   It works....
Tammy W.

I have only good things to say about Pasta Mia. 

Each and every time I've been there they have been quick, clean, cheerful, and tasty. Nuff said. 

It's a great place in Bartlett that's not just another chain restaurant with mediocre products.

Well i decided to try Pasta Mia again... I eat there a year ago and said I would not recommend, I thought a year later and with a restaurant.com coupon maybe I should try it again.  I went for a late dinner on a Saturday night.  Service and kitchen were very slow (and yet there was only one other table eating).  Pizza, took 30 mins to cook and was then served with very light toppings; pasta, served "warm" due to hold back for the pizza, pasta and shrimp were extremely over cooked; Garlic bread... one order was burnt, the other was good. On a postive side, the salad produce was fresh (but again the meet was over cooked).  The kids meals came fast... came so fast that the kids were all done eating before the adult meals arrived (same thing that happened last time we were there).

We order out pizza every week. 1/2 the time with them. I know some personally that tried to schedule a party during a 1/2 price pizza promo. There was nothing stating it as not for large group. Even when it was confirmed it was stated they would honor it. Then they received call that they will not after confirming everything. So wrong! Where is old school customer service. Is one party worth a weekly order from a group of long standing clients? Makes me rethink ordering there again.

Really solid Pizza/Pasta joint near downtown Bartlett. The restaurant seating area is relatively small, but that doesn't keep people from packing the place on a busy Friday/Saturday night. As you might gather from the name, the pasta is a major draw here. The servings of largely Italian-based pasta dishes are very generous, and should almost automatically be accompanied by a to-go container. 

The pizza here should definitely not be overlooked, as it's also very decent. If you're looking for a quick lunch, stop in and order a slice and they'll cut a generous slice out of a finished pizza on presentation on their large serving counter. They'll give it a quick blast in the oven and pack it up for you and you're on your way. If you have the time to fight the crowds on a weekend, the fresh pizza is really the way to go. I've had a good experience with it nearly every time.

Pasta mia is very popular with local kids sports teams after games, and it's not uncommon for big crowds to roll in/out as their evening events finish up.

I really enjoyed my visit here. I've lived in Woodstock for a little over 2 years now. However, being that I come from living very close to Chicago...I'm constantly looking for unique places to dine out at. Local mom-and-pop diners are great, but that's just not typically what I'm going for in regards to atmosphere. This place had a typical bar feel to it (nothing wrong with that). Their drink options were awesome, the food menu was extensive. The waitstaff was attentive, friendly, and quick to handle any requests.
We had the Beer Nuggets as an appetizer and those were awesome. I LOVE my carbs and these hit the spot. Soft, billowy, fried hunks of pizza dough served with homemade marinara/pizza sauce. I had to cut myself off because they give you a heaping helping and I needed to save room for my actual meal. Lol.
Off the kids menu, I ordered the mac n' cheese for my 2-year-old daughter and a milk. This wasn't anything super special, but she enjoyed it. What remained, we took home and she finished the next day for lunch. She also put her seal of approval on the Beer Nuggets,
I had their Burger of the Week which was their Black Bean Veggie Burger...which I replaced with a grilled chicken breast. It had guacamole, pepperjack cheese and jalapeno slices on it. Man! It was soooo good, and came with fries that were delicious.
I ordered a dirty martini to start with and it was made well. They didn't bother with the vermouth (thank you very much) which tells me there is a bartender at work who knows what they're doing. Then, I had a glass of Murphy-Goode red blend. Again, very good. Surprisingly nice wine selection for a bar atmosphere. My one critique is that both drinks that I had could've been a little larger. Both the martini and wine were unusually small pours.
I'm excited that there is such a great, modern concept place to dine near me...and I look forward to going back for another experience soon!

We love their food, it's a geat atmosphere for families, game night and cocktails out! They have a burger special each week that's usually really good. The GM is great about walking around to check on tables and ask how your service is. I appreciate that the servers are attentive and have a good attitude. On a few occasions I've see the chef come out of the kitchen and talk to tables which is fun to see as well. 

I love the Tomato Tower and Szechwan Beef Lettuce Wraps as entrees even though they are on the starters menu - both great options if you're looking for fresh and light menu ideas. Flatbreads are excellent and easy to share as a starter as well. The Southwest Chicken Wrap is excellent and I've ordered the Horseradish Encrusted Salmon numerous times - if it comes out and the crust isn't a little crispy/crunchy send it back (I've only had this happen once but they are happy to fix it for you). I'm sure it's a bit tricky to have the crust be crunchy but not burnt so I'm happy to cut the kitchen some slack on occasion. ;)

One of the first times my husband & I ordered carry-out for dinner they forgot to put my side salad and my husbands french fries in the bag. When we called to ask if we could come get them the GM asked how far we lived (only about a mile) he offered to have one of their staff members (probably a bus boy) bring it to us. It was so nice and they sent us a short note inviting us back with a small certificate for the trouble. I've always been really impressed with this place but it's obvious they are really trying to keep the residents of Huntley coming back again and again - I know we do!

We went in for dinner tonight and had OK food.  I had the ribs and bourbon shrimp entree.  My wife had the trio of sliders.  My meal was good.  Ribs were dry compared to other area restaurants,  but had a tasty BBQ sauce on them.  My wifes slider meal was very well done.  She had to add extra ketchup to eat them.   We had chips and salsa with guacamole as a starter which was spot on.   I checked into yelp and showed the waitress the 15% off,  and she did not deduct it from our bill.   To sum up our meal experience,  we probably will give them another try.   With higher priced entrees you would think service would be spot on. Not clearing the table of used plates from the appetizer before serving the main dinner means there is a lack of management oversight. The restaurant looked to be adequately staffed for a 5pm Saturday night,  so small things like that should not happen.
Food has always been good every time we've been there. Servers are quick and helpful. Prices may be a bit higher, but worth it. Will be back.

This was our first trip to Pub 47 after hearing many great things. The food was good but the service was very slow. After ordering, out soup/salad came quickly. But, had to wait at least another half hour for the main course to arrive. I had the prime rib sandwich which was good. But, not worth the $15 price tag. We'll back. Hope the service is better next time.

We have been once and I was very impressed. It was busy due to Cubs Playoff. Ordered the chicken wing special. OMG. I have never had larger wings in my life. I am craving them now.

I ordered the grilled veggie wrap. I liked it. I would order it with less mayo next time. Just my personal prefeence. Husband ordered the cajun chicken sandwich special with homemade chips. The sandwich was cooked to perfection and the chips were awesome. 

Looking forward to going back.

We came out here ion the recommendation of a friend. I see the bad reviews but wonder what the deal is with those. The location of Pub 47 is off the beaten path in a crappy strip center. Walking in, the entryway is a bit odd and easy to miss. Once inside it has a sharp contemporary interior, a mix of bar & dining room.

Our service was really good and so was the food. My girlfriend got the Penne Pasta. It was good but a bit bland. It was big bowl so she ended up taking some home too. I had a beer and the "3 Pulled Pork Sliders" and they were really good. 

So far I'm only one visit here but we'll be back. It's 15 mi or so from my house.

IFrom the main road, while rolling North on route 47 through Huntley, you may have by occasion caught a glimpse of Pub47.  Perhaps you thought as we did, that it probably was a local dead end type locals bar - but you would have been mistaken, as we clearly were.

We started hearing about this place from different people.  Bikers love the place for its pizza and craft beer selection.  Others like our Doc at Landin Chiropractic Care, raved about their amazing salads and attentive service.

Today we decided to finally check out.  First impressions upon walking in was how warm and inviting it was.  We were greeted by a big smile from our hostess, who offered us various seating options.  

The lighting in the bar area was low but not dark or gloomy, with an open floor plan.  Large windows and plenty of monitors on the walls but nothing like a sports pub.  Some dinning areas are raised, and they offer a combination of low and high tables.   No paper napkins at this place...which is a good sign of things to come.  The servers were dressed in black and quick, helpful and friendly.  The menu is large, but made up of variations of chicken, steak, lsalads and pizza.  Even if your are fickle, you'll find something on this menu  

My wife ordered a fresh potato chips and dipping sauce - simple but warm and delicious.  For the main order, she had a nice side salad, Chicken Piccata, with asparagus, and garlic mash potatoes.  I ordered the Cobb salad and added grilled steak, with a vinaigrette dressing.   Both our main meals arrived in short time. While waiting I decided to look up Pub47 on YELP to see what others had to say.  A discount coupon popped up offering 15% off our meal...sweet what an unexpected surprise bonus!   

The manager stopped by our table and introduce himself as Gordon and confirmed that we were indeed going to receive a discount.  We exchanged pleasantries, and shared with him that we were here based on what our friends were telling us, and how much we really liked the food.  

So what about the food...

Both our meals were excellent and plated beautifully.  Had we not been so hungry, we would have perhaps thought to take a picture as they looked like plated art.   Our waitress visited often (but not too much) and provided us with plenty of refills on our ice-tea.  When the bill arrived, the 15% discount was there.  In truth, we were never there for the discount from YELP, and we would have happily paid full price for the meal, as it was worth every dollar.   Instead we tipped our waitress higher and waived good bye on our way out - satisfied with our experience at Pub47. 

We will be back soon to try their pizza and craft beers.  This time we'll gladly park ourselves in the bar area.  You should definitely NOT hesitate to visit this place.  Make sure you proudly mention that you're a YELPer!

I feel like this place is getting such a bad rap! We recently moved to Huntley and on our first weekend in town we checked this place out! Turns out Pub 47 is also new in town. So I will say, when a new place opens up I like to cut it some slack especially in the service department--the servers and cooks and bartenders are still trying to get everything figured out and there might be some hiccups. 

On our first visit, we took my parents out for lunch.  The owner actually came over to our table to welcome us and tell us the the special drinks they were serving that day.  I thought that was a really nice touch and he sold all 4 of us on a drink! The drinks sounded so good when he described them and I really enjoyed my sangria!

We were sitting in the bar area and although it was busy, we had great service there. The menu has A LOT of options.  I would actually argue that there are too many options and they should consider cutting back.  It does seem like they are just in too many different places at once.  I really do like the wraps and sandwiches options though because that is what I am looking for when I go to a pub or bar.  

Anyway I ordered the Southwestern wrap and I really loved it.  My mom ordered the same thing but felt "meh" about it so I tried hers and figured out they had forgotten the dressing.  Oops. Since her wrap was more than half gone we ended up not saying anything about it.

I visited a second time with my husband on a Friday night and this place was busy! I had the French onion soup which was amazing (with a crap load of cheese how can you go wrong) and pulled pork sliders.  My husband tried a Whiskey Stone Sour off the drink menu and it was great! We ended up recreating them at home later! Service was great again and this time there was nothing wrong with the food! 

I really like the food and the atmosphere at this place.  It is honestly a bar where I feel like I could go and hang out and have drinks and not feel out of place.

This was such a great place to go for dinner... From the wait staff to the management (Ben) everyone was very kind, and the food was delicious. If you want food that is more upscale from your typical greasy bar food this is the location you want to eat. I had the Santa Fe chicken salad and the French onion soup. The Gruyere cheese was fantastic. My wife had the Ruben and it was stacked full of quality meat.  Every few weeks they have a tap take over with the local crystal lake brewery... All in all it was a great hip bar that would would not expect to find in the quiet town of Huntley!!!

I stopped in here the other day for the first time. Great job on the decor. I sat at the bar and found a great beer selection. I heard the pizza was very good here so I had an individual size which was outstanding. The bartender was attentive and helpful. The atmosphere was friendly and inviting. I will definitely be back next time I travel through Huntley.
We stop here on occasion on our Bikes.  Service has been below average even when it is slow.  Our last visit the beer was flat and they were in no hurry to make it right.

My wife and I went to Pub 47 with 4 of our friends on Saturday, September 17 at 6:30pm. We were seated by the window so I had an excellent view of behind the bar. We all had dinner and drinks. We suspected the drinks were being watered down when throughout the evening every one of us had 4 shots of Patron each and 2-3 beers or mixed drinks each as well and none of felt even the hint of a buzz. I personally am a lightweight. If I have 2 bottles of beer at home I'm buzzed. So I thought it was strange but when the other people said the same thing about not feeling the drinks, it was confirmed. However, we didn't say anything until we physically caught the bartender. My wife ordered her 2nd mojito for the night. When she got it, it was so full of ice that she couldn't even get the straw to go all the way through. So she started taking scoops of ice out. After taking 3-4 scoops out, the glass was still over half full of ice and there was next to no drink. It was ridiculous! So she asked the waitress if she could just have a new one made because there was just too much ice and no drink. The waitress was very nice and we saw her tell the bartender (we were in sight of behind the bar but we were not within ear shot). The bartender just took the glass and filled it with spritzer water and gave it back to her!!!!!! When we told the waitress what the bartender did, she went and got the bartender. When the bartender came over she came with a serious bad attitude. When my wife explained what I saw, she tried to make some lame excuse and was very confrontational. She didn't listen to anything my wife had to say. She just kept saying, "So you want a double." My wife said nothing like that. She said, "No, I only want what I ordered. " However, after realizing she was getting nothing but attitude from the bartender, she finally just said fine in order to not ruin our evening with friends. We spent nearly $600 that night between the 4 of us. Bought 24 shots, 10+ beers, 6 meals & appetizers and 3+ mixed drinks. We only had an issue with 1 drink and got incredible attitude including dirty looks all night after that!!! To add insult to injury, you guys had the nerve to charge my wife for the double that she didn't even want!!!!! Absolutely ridiculous!! We will never go in to your establishment again and we will be certain to tell EVERYONE we come across about our horrible experience!!!!

So my family and I had our first experience at Pub 47. The bar was packed with people however we were sat right away. Our waitress was amazing. Kept asking if we needed anything all night. My one year old had a French fry, gagged, and threw up on the floor. The staff was so helpful and helped clean without hesitation. The owner even came by and asked if we were alright and if we lost anything in the mess. We all laughed and got back to eating. 

The food was good. I got the chicken Caesar wrap. It came with a little cup of dressing. Maybe a little bigger cup next time or ask to put dressing on the wrap. Their French fries are FANTASTIC! And if you like Mac n Cheese this place should be your next stop. 

We will definitely be coming back here soon. Thanks to the staff for a great night out with my family.

Food was delicious,atmosphere was warm. 
Staff was friendly and Hospitable. Food came out looking beautiful and appetizing.  Will definitely come back.  We were with another couple, we all got different entrees and all were fabulous! Must try it.

First time eating in at Pub 47. My husband had the caesar salad which came in a tortilla shell which was delicious.  I had the french onion soup and salad as well as a build your own bloody mary which was fantastic! We came on a Sunday evening so it wasn't too packed and our waitress was very attentive.  She stopped by several times to check on us which we appreciated. Before we left one of the managers stopped by to say hello and also gave us a free sample of their garden vodka which was AMAZING! We will be back again for sure!

Great addition to the neighborhood!  Friendly and attentive staff across the board. Kaitlyn was fabulous.  We order cocktails and decided to try a pizza.  Thin crust sausage and mushroom pizza.  It was perfect. Chef came out to check on us which showed us how much they care. We will certainly come back

I really need to edit my first review.  Not sure why I was so positive the first go around and I learned my lesson.  

This place is good only if everything else in the area is full.  Food is basic and staff is subpar.

I was pleasantly surprised! The food was fantastic; but the service was really what sold me on the experience. Our server was very attentive to our needs and you truly sensed she cared. What was also a lot of fun was that we happened to arrive during a "Tap Takeover" from a local brewery. Great specials on drinks and the pint sized glasses we drank from we got to keep. Definitely a great time.

One for the fabulous bartender! None for the food!! Greasy fatty Reuben with 1/2 the meat it usually has & NO thousand island, just completely drenched in grease! The aMaZiNg John must not be working tonite. Horrible food eXperience .. Boo!

Great food! Great service! Great menu! Large portions! We've eaten here a half dozen times and it's always been excellent. Manager and staff truly care about their customers! Prices are reasonable also. I highly recommend this restaurant!!
Service was great. Food was good too. Santa Fe salad was great. Next time we'll get the Drunkn Hooligan drinks.
My husband and I went here for our anniversary dinner. The food was amazing...sirloin skewers with garlic mashed potatoes.  Chicken quesadillas...both delicious!!!!

Came here the first time with my family. No high chairs available for my girls who are 10 months old. How do you not have enough high chairs for the family portion of this restaurant. Another family with 3 kids came in about 10 minutes later and left because there was no place for them to seat their kids. Huge black mark I would say.
Girls had to eat on our lap...had the tequila chicken sliders....Super dry and bland. Just a dry piece of chicken on a bun with some tortilla chips on top. Servers really seem unorganized and flustered. I am in the service industry myself so I do not think I am out of line with my assessment.
Came back a second time with the family, figured give them a second chance since we live so close. Got a burger and ordered medium, got very well done. Very small portions. For the price ($10) I expected more. If you want a great burger go to Tracks in Cary. For $10-$13 you can get a massive burger with TONS of flavor. 
Only thing this place has going is the restaurant itself which is done beautifully. Hence the 2 stars and not 1. Great spot to watch sports. And my wife loves the patty melt, but unfortunately that's it. I will not be going back.
Corned beef dinner was so awesome we got one to go. Got the 15% off thru yelp check in but it only took it off my pop. :( won't take it off the special. Super bummed about that but oh well
We tried again with better luck this time. The mushroom ravioli was awesome. You can put that sauce on anything and it will taste good. Still issues with getting that second round of drinks.
Great food and great service! We love the atmosphere and have had yet to have any issues! The staff is super friendly and knowledgable! Keep up the good work!!

Came  on a Sunday for lunch.  Bloody Mary's were good.  Build your own.  Sort of fun.  We ordered the sampler  platter and as it sounded good on the menu. When we got it.  It was a ton of Home made chips.  2 chicken  wings.  2 chicken tenders.  The shrimp were small but a lot and Calamari  was ok.  Sort of Disapointed

My wife and I stopped by for a late Saturday lunch after running errands . We like to try different places. Great atmosphere with plenty of room to get comfortable. The Combo sliders were very good and we took a pizza home as well for later that evening . It did not disappoint . We ordered the Veggie Plus . A nice variety of vegetables..
 My wife's bloody Mary was one of the best she has had in a while and they offer a good selection of beer. Service was good and the chef ( maybe owner?) stood where he could be seen talking to the customers . Always a nice touch
This place is musch ! The service was the slowest in all of Huntley. No wonder  nothing ever makes it on this location .
Service was great. Food was good too. Santa Fe salad was great. Next time we'll get the Drunkn Hooligan drinks.
My husband and I went here for our anniversary dinner. The food was amazing...sirloin skewers with garlic mashed potatoes.  Chicken quesadillas...both delicious!!!!

Came here the first time with my family. No high chairs available for my girls who are 10 months old. How do you not have enough high chairs for the family portion of this restaurant. Another family with 3 kids came in about 10 minutes later and left because there was no place for them to seat their kids. Huge black mark I would say.
Girls had to eat on our lap...had the tequila chicken sliders....Super dry and bland. Just a dry piece of chicken on a bun with some tortilla chips on top. Servers really seem unorganized and flustered. I am in the service industry myself so I do not think I am out of line with my assessment.
Came back a second time with the family, figured give them a second chance since we live so close. Got a burger and ordered medium, got very well done. Very small portions. For the price ($10) I expected more. If you want a great burger go to Tracks in Cary. For $10-$13 you can get a massive burger with TONS of flavor. 
Only thing this place has going is the restaurant itself which is done beautifully. Hence the 2 stars and not 1. Great spot to watch sports. And my wife loves the patty melt, but unfortunately that's it. I will not be going back.
Corned beef dinner was so awesome we got one to go. Got the 15% off thru yelp check in but it only took it off my pop. :( won't take it off the special. Super bummed about that but oh well
We tried again with better luck this time. The mushroom ravioli was awesome. You can put that sauce on anything and it will taste good. Still issues with getting that second round of drinks.
Great food and great service! We love the atmosphere and have had yet to have any issues! The staff is super friendly and knowledgable! Keep up the good work!!

Came  on a Sunday for lunch.  Bloody Mary's were good.  Build your own.  Sort of fun.  We ordered the sampler  platter and as it sounded good on the menu. When we got it.  It was a ton of Home made chips.  2 chicken  wings.  2 chicken tenders.  The shrimp were small but a lot and Calamari  was ok.  Sort of Disapointed

My wife and I stopped by for a late Saturday lunch after running errands . We like to try different places. Great atmosphere with plenty of room to get comfortable. The Combo sliders were very good and we took a pizza home as well for later that evening . It did not disappoint . We ordered the Veggie Plus . A nice variety of vegetables..
 My wife's bloody Mary was one of the best she has had in a while and they offer a good selection of beer. Service was good and the chef ( maybe owner?) stood where he could be seen talking to the customers . Always a nice touch
This place is musch ! The service was the slowest in all of Huntley. No wonder  nothing ever makes it on this location .

Great food and atmosphere. Had the horseradish encrusted salmon. Flavor of the horsey sauce with the wild rice and sal mon was incredible. I ordered the Wild berry parfait for dessert. A little heavy on the whipped cream but very cool and refreshing!

Our first visit! Fresh homemade bread with maple butter, to start. Had the slider combo plater: pulled pork, cheese burger and grilled chicken with chicken corn chowder soup as a side.  The fries are amazing! 

Really great food! Nice menu, great variety, great price. Eric is great server, total win for Huntley!!

Love the food.  Great Service.  Went for lunch came back for dinner.  Just would not play the machines.  The cash payout went down. Then ticket would not print out. Real hassel to get my cash. If I play they better pay!
I've gone here several times now, and the only successful thing I've had to eat here was the bruschetta. Most of the waitstaff is very unfriendly and the overall environment of the place is chaotic.

Last night was actually my second trip to Pub 47.  I was so excited that a new place was opening up close to home.  The first visit was last Thursday night.  When we first walked in i was impressed with what was done to the interior.  It was warm and inviting.  We were seated, there were 5 of us (3 adults 2 kids).  I ordered the cod dinner with asparagus, the girls ordered the build your own pizza.  The other two adults got the salmon & hamburger.  We were very impressed with the menu.  There were some really good options & it all sounded great.  Our server was very nice & attentive but a bit scattered.  I dismissed that because it is a new place & a new ordering system.  When our food arrived we were all a bit disappointed.  My asparagus consisted of two miniscule over cooked droopy stalks that were tossed across my plate, my friends salmon was clearly over cooked & dry with an odd stalk of rosemary sticking out of it, the hamburger had a huge clump of guacamole on top & the pizza the kids ordered was wrong.  The food tasted ok, not horrible but clearly not as good as the menu descriptions sounded!  I decided to not write a review based on this visit and give it one more shot before i wrote a review.

My second visit was Saturday night and the place was very busy... A good sign!  My husband and i decided to go out for drinks & appetizers.  We sat at the bar and ordered 3 items.  First we ordered drinks, nothing fancy, my husband got a beer & i got a vodka cranberry.  Then we ordered the crab cakes, beef skewers, & rock shrimp.  I liked the crab cakes, my husband did not.  There was a lot of filling & very little crab which bothered him but the flavor was good so i was fine with it.  The rock shrimp were pretty good, very generic and nothing special but I liked them.  The beef skewers where another story.  I was really excited for those because they were supposed to have a horseradish sauce, which I love.  I was so disappointed, the skewers were so drenched in sauce you could hardly tell there was meat under it and there was not even a hint of horseradish.  The sauce was so bland and boring.

To summarize, the atmosphere is good, the service is good, the menu sounds fantastic but is very poorly executed.  We will try it again because we are so badly hoping that we will have a good restaurant close to home without going to Randall Rd .

Way to pick it back up Pub 47! Hubby and I came here 2 times in the last couple of months and things have been way better! New wait staff additions are great! No longer feel like I am bothering my waitress/waiter by being there.

Had some friends come into town a few weeks back and decided to give this place a try.  I was extremely impressed with the atmostphere.  I have drove past the place since it opened a few times.  It was surprising considering previous businesses at the location. 

I was surprised by the menu and foods. My dish was great, and everyone i was with enjoyed their dinner. Also had a unqiue appetizer which was pretty cool. 

Totally different from previous business in the location.

The decor is nice and the layout is good.  And that is where the compliments end.

I was hoping a new start for the chef would help.  After eating here, I am just under the impression John Hennessy can't cook.  Probably why his other endeavors have failed.

We decided to get an array of appetizers.

The calamari was really greasy and had no flavor. 

 We got the chicken strips, which were rubberized planks.  There is a thing called brining to make them juicy, give it a try guys.

The cheese curds were OK, but they looked they were purchased from a vendor.  

I came, I saw, I left bloated and disappointed.

A coworker mentioned how she has eaten here before and she had a great experience. So I decided to try it out, I always love to eat and try to places. Now, she did dine-in and I ordered carry out so maybe this effects the quality of the meal (it shouldn't). 

The process started out unprofessional and weird. I called in my order and it took a while. From me telling them what I want, to finding out my total took way too long. I first spoke to one person who took my order then I was transferred to someone else who was supposed to give me a total. While I was "put on hold" by the second person, I heard everything they were saying. It was unprofessional and unorganized. The person even said "this is such a mess". My thought was "if the ordering process is a mess and unorganized, I wonder how my food will be". After receiving my order (half soup, half salad) I was unsatisfied. Let's just say, Huntley doesn't offer many good food options anyway, and this didn't sway my opinion. My Cesar salad was drenched in dressing that seemed watered down :(. I ordered salmon to add to the salad which seemed like a fancy option...it wasn't. It was plain and tasteless. On top of that, the price for the salmon as an add-on was inconsistent (yelp) had a pic of the menu and it said $4 yet they told me $5. Seems like a huge rip-off for the quality and taste. 

One bright side to my lunch was the French onion soup wasn't bad. Would I come back here? Most likely not. They don't even have the hours open on yelp. It took me three calls until someone answered at noon. I was first wondering if they even are open for lunch, apparently they are but I couldn't find the hours anywhere and no one answered the first few calls.

I have nothing but wonderful service every time I visit Pub47. The NY strip is the best around and the specialty drinks are amazing (Huntley old fashioned is my favorite!)  definitely worth 5 stars!!!
I had the salmon Wellington which was great.   The roasted chicken was good.   The other dish was the Cod which was enjoyable. Service was good and we intend to be back.

This was my second visit in recent weeks. 

My first visit was on a Wednesday evening and we ordered their homemade pizza. Service was good until food was brought to the table. When we desired water refills the service was nowhere to be found. 

Pizza was hot, thin like I like it, and tasty. Sausage had nice flavor. Sauce was a bit bland which seems to be a theme here. 

Today I came in for a quick lunch with my daughter who had the pulled pork sandwich. Sauce was a bit bland for our taste and the pork was decent but would likely not order again. 

The "homemade" Italian beef was dry and had no flavor. This was more "French dip" than Italian beef.   There was no traditional oregano/garlic juice, just dry dry dry meat and a side of au jus which also had no flavor. Won't order this again as it was poorly prepared. 

Service was Ok except I REALLY needed some hot something to kill the bland. Waitress forgot to bring it out and it was 15 minutes before she finally brought it out. 

Overall so far not impressed. 

Order the pizza.
Service was good.  I don't usually send food back but I had to send the chicken dinner that I order back.  It had as much flavor as a dry piece of toast.
We are never disappointed in our many trips to Pub 47. The food is outstanding, the service is fantastic, and the people are so friendly! We go probably weekly to this new fav spot.

My boyfriend and I have been coming here many many times since it opened.  The other night we had dinner and TWO beers THAT WE DIDN'T EVEN LIKE and told the waitress, however she didn't seem to care  So when we received the check we almost fell off our chairs when we saw $9.50 for each beer.  We saw the manager on our way out and shared our experience with him who also didn't care.  BEWARE OF BEING GOUGED.  We will not be patronizing this establishment.

For a 2nd visit, things got better. The service and food was alot better,and the staff was very polite, but when it came to getting the bill, we had to have someone find our waitress. (Probably was there another 10-15 min more than we wanted to.)  Overall experience, I would tell my friends to go there.

Great atmosphere!  The manager was very nice and offered great hospitality greeting us at the door, telling us about the restaurant and stopping by 2x to see how our meal was. So glad to have this restaurant in Huntley.

Excellent beef stroganoff it was worth the wait - there was a 16th birthday party that was kind of loud in the bar but once in the restaurant it was a little less noisy,  food was great...love this place!!!
Great food. Menu rocks. If you want to get away from the same old stuff on Randall rd., head over to pub 47. You'll even enjoy some nice fireplaces to stay warm ;-)

We have been here before.  Not really sure what happened.  The staff was attentive but the food was fairly bland.  I was in the mood for just a simple burger.  I order the smaller quarter pound burger and it was a bit on the dry side but really had no flavor at all.  I have had better burgers at the local fast food restaurant down the road.  My wife had an even worse experience.  She ordered the beef stroganoff.  This plate was a whopping $18.00.   asked her how it was and she said it reminded her of eating Stouffers.  I took a bit and it did not have any flavor either.  Just bland and very boring.  She also did not get her salad that she ordered.  I person who delivered the food said they would take it off the bill.  Did not happen and the waitress said they were unable to.  She did offer a dessert but we just wanted to go home at that point.  She did try to make it better but we just did not want anymore bland food.  I did have the Huntley Old Fashioned and it was quite good.   We will not be going back thee are a few other choices in the area and we would be pleased with the other places.  Way too expensive for the food that was served.

I person who delivered the food said they would take it off the bill.  Did not happen and the waitress said they were unable to.  She did offer a dessert but we just wanted to go home at that point.  She did try to make it better but we just did not want anymore bland food.  I did have the Huntley Old Fashioned and it was quite good.   We will not be going back thee are a few other choices in the area and we would be pleased with the other places.  Way too expensive for the food that was served.

Wow finally a restaurant that's got it together!  From the time you walk in we were greeted by Lawrence and Gordon.  They both have personalities and are very nice and helpful to their guests.  The bartenders all smile and are very helpful.  Our waitress Tabitha was phenomenal!!!  We had the fish fry one was broiled and one was lightly breaded both were outstanding!  We will definitely be back again!

Just finished dinner for the first time here and was impressed based on some of the reviews. Had tacos and quesadillas and wife had Chicken & Goat cheese with peppers. Excellent food, perfect sized portions, very attentive service and the GM was warm and welcoming also when he visited our table.  No clue why people are complaining about the food we thought it was excellent. We will be back for sure!

Our second visit in a month.   First visit it was not the best.   It was super busy so we gave it the benefit of the doubt.    Went back tonight,   Sat at the bar.  Only 7 people at the bar when we arrived.  Ordered a few cocktails and appetizers.     Not once did the bartender ask if we needed a refill.    We had to flag her down each time.   We saw the manager talking to the hostess.  Two girls sitting by the front door for about 30 mins with no one coming in at that time while we could not get service.     We asked for a menu to take food home and 20 mins later we finally said we had to go with no order.   Oh well.    We were not able to order food this time but previously it was mediocre at best.


Redeemed themselves.    Stopped in again and totally different service and food was delicious.     We did not take the manager up on any discounts.   We stopped in on managers recommendation to give them another try.   Happily the opening pains have been worked out.   We will stop back.

What a change from the previous place - the food is off the charts!  Such a variety of traditional pub grub with a touch of class (the steaks, burgers, seafood, salads were great)! Everything our family ordered was great - and reasonably priced.  The customer service was what set the pace - greeted immediately by the host Larry - class act!  So knowledgeable about the menu and just perfect on his recommendations.  The servers know their stuff, answered every one of our questions as well as their recommendations were spot on. Definitely our new place.  Highly recommend!

I've passed this place so many times and finally went for dinner. This place is a gem.  Greeted with a very friendly hostess. Had a great waitress. So attentive. The place was busy but she always came to our table to make sure everything was good.  The food is fabulous. Great portion sizes. Great prices and the best part....the presentation of the food.  Whom ever came up with the idea on how to plate up the food really knows what they are doing.  The atmosphere is warm and relaxing.  Will definitely be coming back here! The owner obviously knows how to run a restaurant.

Good IPA beer. I had the beef stroganoff which was OK but not great. Others in our group liked their food more than I but have to go with my plate. Very warm inside, almost uncomfortable. I'd still go back however I'll try something else next time.

Let's start by saying we eat out a lot it's nice to find a new place close to our home goods size menu the food was very good   lots of TVs great for watching a game and it's also a place to take your family The inside was very nice outside it's a strip mall once you're inside you never know you're in strip mall The owners done a really nice job good luck hope everything stays this way

We tried Pub 47 soon after they opened as its close to where we live. Since that first time we now average eating there twice a week. They know what they are doing from the hostess when they seat you to the outstanding customer service from ALL the servers. GM Gordon keeps the room well managed, and even the Chef comes out from time to time to get feedback from patrons. The law of averages says we should have had a bad meal or bad service by now, but, that's not happened. We bring out of town guests here as well as kids, and grandkids and all have enjoyed their eating experience at Pub 47. Menu has a nice selection and the chef does well keeping things fresh vs frozen or prepackaged. Servers keep an eye on you and I've never had to ask for a refill. Pub 47 simply does an outstanding job across the board.

I have been there twice now in both times the food presentation is beautiful and taste fantastic! The nachos are huge in the chips flavor is incredible. I also tried the Asian salad which is also large enough to take half home and tastes great. Both times the service has been prompt and attentive. It currently is my favorite restaurant around exclamation

I really wanted to like this place as the decor and atmosphere seemed great. I have no complaints about the food itself, everything was great. We ordered the cheese curds for appetizer and they were good, I got pizza and it was delicious, my sister ordered mini burgers and said they were great. 

The service however was terrible. Our waitress hardly came to our table and the worst part was she walked past our table SEVERAL times without stopping. She gave us "a few minutes" to look over the menu and came back to the table after about 20. My sister ordered a beer when we ordered food and that arrived about 15 minutes later from someone else. Our waters were empty for at least 15 minutes before they were filled and the food took far too long. Finally when our food arrived and another server brought it, he tried to place the pizza tray on the wire stand and managed to drop it so my pizza started sliding off the tray. I grabbed it to stop it and he apologized but didn't help me or offer anything else.

Not sure I'd want to come back after the service we had.

I fell at this restaurant several weeks ago after receiving only a portion of my meal, I was charged for the complete meal even though I was taken away by ambulance no restaurant employee or owner has contacted me to resolve the situation, those I was with will never go back, and some groups have already canceled reservations after hearing this...bad call Pub 47!
Great food great atmosphere. Gets pretty packed on the weekends for dinner

First visit to this Establishment. Courteous staff, although we happened to get a slow inexperienced server, she was very pleasant so it was not horrible.
The mussels and clams appetizer was by far the poorest I have had, and I've eaten
Them at dozens of restaurants in the area . The cooks seem to be in love with salt.
 My wife ordered a chicken with wild rice soup that was too salty for her and she likes food on the salty side. We also had the "world famous Mac n cheese".
Average at best. The good news, steak sandwich was good and the sliders ,while overcooked had good flavor. Over all very unimpressed, rookies does it better .
 Very odd set up in the restaurant area. May try it one more time down the road.
The decor is much improved from the last business. Friendly and prompt service were consistent over three visits. The appetizer menu is great and the burgers are huge.

I came in tonight not expecting anything special just meeting some friends. The waitress was incredibly rude. We sat down and waited about 20 minutes then decided to go up to the bar to ask for drinks because we were hungry/thirsty. Werent irritated or anything just hoped for a drink while we waited. They said since we had a table our waitress should be taking our order and to sit down and wait. Then once we got our drinks (from a waitress that wasnt her) she finally came over and told us we couldn't sit at the table because we only ordered drinks that we had to go to the bar. Only reason we hadnt ordered food is because she hadnt come to take our order! We had reserved that table with our friends btw. She did not ask nicely she acted as if we were horrible people for thinking we could sit there. So weird. She smacked the bill down on the table and left immediately. I was in shock because we hadn't done anything to be treated this way we wanted to have a relaxing night with food and drinks. She also gave herself a 10 dollar tip out of our friends bill without asking(they paid in cash) Who does that??!! Overall ridiculous experience. I'll come back to try again and hopefully try the food next time but i sure as heck wont ask for Kristin to be our waitress.

Let's start on a positive.  If you like alcohol and atmosphere and want to catch a game on a TV outside your house this is s place for you.  If you are going for food I suggest you go somewhere else.  Now before I start on the food keep in mind I walked in to order take out.  I have yet to dine in so for me to comment how positive the beer and atmosphere is throws caution flags right?  Be prepared to wait and hour for your food to arrive if you walk in to place an order.  I have heard the same for dine in.  My order?  I ordered 6 mild wings,  12 spicy wings, an order of Szechwan beef lettuce wraps,  chicken tenders and a southwest chicken wrap.  It took an hour. I live 1 mile from the restaurant.  The food was cold.  I asked how many tenders in an order I was told six!  I got three!  I got 4 fried jalepenos with it and maybe an extra small portion of fries,  the six wings came hot when I ordered them mild, the 12 spicy wings came mild when ordered spicy, the wrap fell apart as soon as it was picked up and the Szechwan lettuce wraps was beef and dressings laying on top of a bed of lettuce.  Nothing that you could make a wrap out of and all of the food was cold.  It tasted bland as well. If you are going for drinks have at it.  If your going for food stop somewhere else first and finish off there for drinks.  Horrible experience.  My other experience was ordering one pizza to go.  I sat and waited at the bar for 40 minutes.  The pizza actually wasn't bad so at least they have that going for them.

It's a nice addition to Huntley, happy to try it out.  Our server started out good then he just disappeared after getting our meals. No drink refills, we had to flag down for our check and then still seemed bothered he had to stop! The food portions are big! homemade chips are good, kids pizza was a hit, husband had the stuffed chicken and my mom and I had the roasted turkey open face sandwich. I know it was busy but when everyone around you is getting checked on but we kept getting skipped, it puts a damper on the meal.

We were at a party there friday night,  werer served all appetizers chicken, onion rings, pulled pork sliders, etc. I enjoyed them all very much the stand out was sausage and peppers. The place was very  busy the service we recieved on our party of 25 was great my glass is up for Christina she was very good. Just one issue when sambuca is ordered it comes in a brandy glass we 3 coffee beans very important.

Had an opportunity to check this new restaurant out with family.  Have to say that they did a great job at the remodel.  Very warm and modern.  Bar looks great lot's of room.  

I started with the baked onion soup which was pretty good but I would say over-priced at $6.50.  A few of us ordered their panin's, but what we got was far from a panini.  I would say they lightly toasted some sourdough bread and placed the contents in.  
Would have to recommend they purchase a real panini maker and change the bread.  Otherwise the were just basic sandwiches.  Would not re-order.

Their fries are very good.  A few others had their Italian Sausage and pepper sandwiches-Small portion and both sandwiches had no peppers.

Their slider burgers are good and would go back for those.  Dont bother asking for a trio to try their Chicken, Burger and Pulled Pork sliders-the waitress said the chef will not allow customers to mix and match.  Really?  They are all the same price, so not too sure what is going on with that decision. It's a great way to try all three.

Everyone was friendly, the Manager was very professional and very much working the room.  However, I think he has his work cut out for him with the kitchen.  I suggest they check their orders before taking them out because not any of us rcvd  everything we ordered.  A few rcvd chips not fries.  Fries not chips and salad dressings were wrong.  

All in all, I would go back to try their other items.

This place is very popular with the parking lot always full.  Food is very good.  More upscale but prices are not too bad.  Salads were excellent with homemade dressing.  The French Onion soup was very good, not overly salty with much flavor and crouton that wasn't too soggy before finishing.  Service was great and loved the "create your own" Bloody Mary.
Great food great atmosphere. Gets pretty packed on the weekends for dinner

First visit to this Establishment. Courteous staff, although we happened to get a slow inexperienced server, she was very pleasant so it was not horrible.
The mussels and clams appetizer was by far the poorest I have had, and I've eaten
Them at dozens of restaurants in the area . The cooks seem to be in love with salt.
 My wife ordered a chicken with wild rice soup that was too salty for her and she likes food on the salty side. We also had the "world famous Mac n cheese".
Average at best. The good news, steak sandwich was good and the sliders ,while overcooked had good flavor. Over all very unimpressed, rookies does it better .
 Very odd set up in the restaurant area. May try it one more time down the road.
The decor is much improved from the last business. Friendly and prompt service were consistent over three visits. The appetizer menu is great and the burgers are huge.

Then once we got our drinks (from a waitress that wasnt her) she finally came over and told us we couldn't sit at the table because we only ordered drinks that we had to go to the bar. Only reason we hadnt ordered food is because she hadnt come to take our order! We had reserved that table with our friends btw. She did not ask nicely she acted as if we were horrible people for thinking we could sit there. So weird. She smacked the bill down on the table and left immediately. I'll come back to try again and hopefully try the food next time but i sure as heck wont ask for Kristin to be our waitress.

All in all, I would go back to try their other items.

This place is very popular with the parking lot always full.  Food is very good.  More upscale but prices are not too bad.  Salads were excellent with homemade dressing.  The French Onion soup was very good, not overly salty with much flavor and crouton that wasn't too soggy before finishing.  Service was great and loved the "create your own" Bloody Mary.
Food was really good we had beef skewers and wings and a couple beers. Amy did a great job behind the bar. Nice to have a good bar to hang out at in Huntley.

Venue is noisy...to be expected for pub style.  Service was attentive, but needed some follow up from us to get order completed.  The food...not so great.  Have been there twice.  Grilled sandwiches and flatbread are not cooked to crispness.  Thin crust pizza was burnt.  Hope the food preparation improves.

I would love to give Pub 47 Grill the 5 stars because their food and service is excellent and for that they are deserving. My husband and I have been here 3 times and have always enjoyed the food and service.The only problem is the noise level, it is deafening and you cannot carry on a conversation with the person across the table from you or the wait staff. This makes me sad because the food is so good, but unless I hear that they have done something to help with the sound in there I don't think I will be going back. Please, get someone in there that can do something to make the place a bit quieter, just so you don't have to scream to carry on a conversation, as everyone was doing on a very busy Sunday evening, because I really appreciate the excellent food and outstanding service.

Apparently they don't want any take away business as they had me on hold for several minutes and not even muted, I could  hear all the noise in the background. Plenty of other places to go to. Not the best way to begin your business. May I add that the man that answered the phone also should not have? Not very professional.

Love the place! Food is amazing, service was great! ERIC is super awesome waiter! We where welcomed when we arrived, they have 10 beers on tap and great dinner specials! Bread comes with dinner and walnut butter!

Had chef johns wild berry salad. It was one of the best salads I've had in a long time. Lettuce was crisp, fruit was plump and juicy. High quality ingredients. Looking forward to trying more from the menu in the future.

I have to say I was a bit disappointed for my first time ordering from here. I ordered a cheeseburger with Swiss cheese, pickles and onions, and a child's portion of macaroni and cheese for take out. When I got home I had a cheeseburger with American cheese, onions, and a pickle spear in the box, and a small order of pasta w red sauce. I called to let them know of the mistakes and in their defense they did ask if I wanted to come back in to make it right, I told them no as I had just got home and didn't feel like venturing out again. They did not however ask if I wanted some type of refund or credit to possibly use the next time I would come in. ALL of the food was very bland and tasteless, the pasta with red sauce I took 2 bites of and threw away, so not only was it wrong it was just not good at all. The burger tasted like they threw some meat on the grill and did nothing to it, no spices, no salt or pepper, no taste what so ever, I did not finish that either. I've seen some poor reports on here as far as takeout orders but that shouldn't be an issue as takeout or dining in the food should taste the same, and if what I had tonight is indicative of what the food is like I'm not sure right now if I will go back to give it another try or not. I really hope that the owners and or the people responsible take the time to read the reviews of their establishment, and take them seriously as there are not a ton of food options in the immediate area and they have a chance to distinguish themselves from all the other options. It's a nice place inside, and I hope they can get it together.

This is our GO TO pizza place. Best pizza in the Tri-Cities area by far. When it doubt, we order a pizza from here, typically sausage and garlic. We also grab slices during lunch time which are huge slices for a great deal.

Lunch at Charlie Fox is a great deal. They have several lunch special options for $5.99. My favorite is the large pizza slice with a salad and drink. The ingredients in their pizza and salad are so fresh and generous. The service was fast and friendly. Great value for lunch.

We visited Charlie Fox's Pizzeria in St. Charles for my husband's birthday in January. My experience there was just ok.  For a Friday night, the place was surprisingly not too busy. I initially visited because I read that this place was voted best in the Fox Valley or something like that, so maybe my expectations were just too high.

Let's start with what I liked. I did like the old school Trivial Pursuit cards that are on all of the tables. I liked having something to do while we waited for our food. I also thought the food was good.  Not great, just good. I've definitely had better pizza in the Fox Valley. We started with the Heart Attack on a Plate...ahem, I mean the Charlie Chips (kettle chips covered with bacon and mozzarella cheese) and, while greasy, it did taste good. The pizza was just average.

I did not like the service here. Everything just took SO LONG! Just being seated took about 10 minutes. When we walked in there were people at the counter picking up to-go orders and we didn't even get a "be with you in a few minutes". We just stood there, waiting. The staff could've been way more attentive. From ordering, to waiting on our food, then waiting for our check - everything just took forever. I couldn't understand the wait. There were plenty of empty tables so they weren't working at capacity, and it still took a really long time for everything.

Overall, with so many other pizza options in the area, I'm not sure that we'll return.
One of the best in St, Charles and the surrounding areas.  You do pay more here but you get what you pay for, so It is totally worth it.  Love their thin crust deluxe, my fav!

I absolutely love this place. Being from the city of Chicago I eat alot of pizza. Are any locations franchised. I  think there need to be one of these in the city. Whenever I come to St Charles, I always stop here no matter what I'm doing. I love this place and will always return. 

Kayla, you were amazing. Loved the service and you were dope as well. You were good at multitasking,  as I watched you with your other table.  Thank you so much.

New to the area. We had a great take out order from here. Pizza was great! Great price, yummy sauce . I will definitely be ordering again. Also had to try the spinach tomato bread, WOW!!! That can be a meal in itself.

The portion sizes are huge! I am by no means a pasta connoisseur but my lasagna was perfect for my liking. Plenty of sauce and lots of cheese and filling. The food came out quick probably because we were the only ones there on a late Saturday afternoon. I stole a couple fries from my wife and sons plate and also managed to take a bite of the cheese sticks that came with my nieces kids spaghetti. I should've taken bigger bites! 

We will be back for the pizza.

We dined in and we left happy and full.  The pizza here is delicious from the dough to the sauce to the CHEESE. .. so good. They have trivia cards at each table to keep you entertained.  The service was attentive and friendly. It's a little ways out but the pizza is worth it.  So much better than the generic crap we're used to from the other franchises.

We ordered the baked mostaccioli for delivery which was described as having riccota and mozzarella cheese on it and being baked til its bubbling and brown.  The pasta  showed up an hour later with no cheese on top.  What took so long if not the baking process???  When we called the manager he was very apologetic and sent a new one out right away, no questions asked.  The second order included the baked cheese but was just not very good in general.  We ordered the half tray with an order of cheesy garlic bread and our total came to $36.00! I thought this was an outrageous amount to pay for pasta.  Although it was a decent amount of food the quality was terrible and for the price we expected much better.  After calling a second time the manager was equally apologetic and gave us a $15.00 credit but besides that, we won't be ordering from then again.

This pizza is terrible, it tastes just like Rosati's which is horrid awful pizza. Besides that it was way over cooked , cheese like leather and burnt. And I agree 100% with the other bad reviews the phone person taking the order was rude, very short , didn't care to answer any questions,  I as a first timer had.... I gave him very specific delivery instructions and he ya ya'd me and didn't write anything  down. Will never ever order from here again - service way below average and pizza garbage and went 1 piece eaten right into it!

Foods is always good. It's completely worth the wait, if you want fast crappy pizza then go to little cesars or domino's. The ingredients are quality and the service is in no way shape or fom bad. They are so freaking good!

I'm baffled by these other reviews that are bashing wait times on weekends, come on people, then go to pizza hut. You're waiting for really tasty pizza at a terrific restaurant that everyone wants, so yeah there's going to be a wait. Everyone and their mom orders from here. If you want to wait less time get it from Charlie's in Geneva, but I warn you, they're quicker because they are not as good, people from Geneva get it from st. Charles because they just don't compare. 

Their fried mushrooms are amazing! The ranch that comes with is so yummy.  And the pizza with Italian beef and giardinaire is sooooo addicting. Whatever cheese they use yummmm, and they even have deals on certain days of the week. This place is worth the wait and the money for sure! Eat here and ignore the stuck up housewives who have nothing else to do with their time but order last minute then bitch and embelish their stories. 

I've never had a bad experience here, and I eat it a whole lot. Trust me, I had a friend work there once, we went a lot and I still order from here about twice a month. Tip your drivers well! They'll be happy to rewritten and quickly!

It looks like we aren't the only ones who are tired of the poor service and staff that doesn't seem to care.  We used to order from here 1-2 per month but the orders are incorrect way to often.  This last time my wife called them to chirp (I told her not to bother and we should just never order from the m again but she wanted to give them the chance to fix it).  The manager didn't seem to care and was very short with her.  I'll give them two stars because the think crust pizza is good, but its just not worth getting the wrong order from a place that doesn't seem to care.  We won't be back.  Plenty of other places to choose from.
50 min for a pickup!  Unacceptable. The pizza is good but not worth waiting 50 min for.

Honestly the best pizza in the chicago area. Thin crust cheese is classic. Im used to NY style pizza....I dislike deep dish...so this hits the spot. Easy to eat, eat, eat! Always use a coupon...you get a free small pie!

When my now Wife and I were dating (back in the day), we'd go for bike rides down the Fox River trail, down through Batavia, and because Charlie Fox's was there, we'd stop in.  Not to long after it closed.  We were saddened.  Right now, Pal Joey's from West Chicago has now taken up shop in that space.

Fast forward several years, and we're driving down 64 at Peck Rd. and what do we see?  Charlie Fox's!  Woohoo.  So of course, we stopped in.

Same great pizza.  And of course, since then, we have made friendly with one of the waitresses, who we usually get.  She knows our order and takes care of it automatically once we're seated.

Only complaint is that there are only two TV's, and they can be hard to watch.  But alas...

BTW, My Wife has always love the Charlie Fox Pie (or whatever it's called), for dessert.  It's a big cookie basically with ice cream or something on top of it.

I've ordered here a few times since the last fiasco. It seems that they put things back on track. The pizza is always great. The issue I had was with the mess as far as ordering, waiting for over an hour and then finding out my pizza wasn't even in the oven. No issues since then. They must have gotten new management or better training. I do really like their pizza. It's always great tasting and reasonably priced, with a coupon.

We have ordered from there a decent amount of times and more often than not, there is something wrong with our order.  This last time, we got green peppers on the pizza instead of the spinach we ordered.  The receipt was correct but not the food.  This was a HUGE deal as 2 of the 3 people eating DETEST green peppers.  By the time we opened the pizza (we waited fro the last adult to get home from work) they were closed and we could not rectify the situation.  They have given us the wrong order, sent orders to the wrong house etc etc.  The food is not bad (we LOVE the wings) but it's not really worth the trouble when more than 1/2 of the time your order is screwed up.  Will send my business to Pommodoro e Mozzarella instead.  MUCH more consistent and very yummy!

My family and I absolutely  love this place,  the cozy cedar wood on the walls and dim lighting  creates a calming ambience. From the moment we walk in to the moment we leave we feel quite welcome from the staff and owner! The pizza we order is mouth watering and we definitely  do not mind driving out of the way to relive the experience over and over!

Charlie Fox is AWESOME!  Their thin crust is crispy and the carnivore is my fave.  Heather was my server and she was attentive, but not irritating.  My drink was always refilled and they were packed on a Friday Night.

Really amazing pizza. By far the best in the Saint Charles area. I usually do take out when I eat her. However there has been a time or two where I have dined in, the staff was very friendly and attentive. The place was swarming with customers waiting to be seated. The dining area is a bit small. so it did get quite loud with everyone waiting, however the staff did not loose their cool. I would definitely recommend this place.
Typical, tasty pizza and really enjoyed their buffalo bone-in wings. Great go-to takeout pizza place.
Pizza was good. Not much for drink selections. Service was kind of 80 %. Is give it another try some day. The room was uncomfortably hot and very loud.

As far as their margherita pizza goes, I would not recommend. I ordered this pizza for my birthday dinner and it was so bad, it tasted like it was hosed down with water before they boxed it up. I've had amazing pizza that cost 1/3 the price of this and I have to say I'm so disappointed. I love pizza, it's so hard to get it wrong I don't understand what recipe they consider "margherita" or how it's even one of their specialty pizzas... but stay away. I joined yelp just so I could review this place because it was just so frustrating especially on my birthday.
Pizza had great ingredients and the ribs were delicious. Service was also on point. They had a nice dinning room with two plasma's to watch Sunday night football

I specifically joined Yelp to write a bad review on this place. In all reality, the pizza is not bad. It's actually fairly decent. My biggest problem with this place is the customer service. My family and I have been here 3 times so far, thinking each time that the service would be better. WRONG! The people working here are not attentive at all. I waited at the counter for 10 minutes on one of my visits before someone even came over to greet me and I know they saw me! Even when we ate in, the servers were very dull and even rude at times.

I believe that a restaurant is only as good as the people working for them. Unfortunately, for this place, the employees have not represented the business well. 3 strikes and they are out, in my mind. I will not return to this place again.

Very average. The crust and sauce were almost like something I would expect from a frozen pizza. Toppings were ok but overall I have had a lot better and will look elsewhere next time I am in the mood for pizza.

Pizza is just okay...I also solicited on behalf of local non profit, disappointed that they went into long explanation on how they don't donate but offer "% back dining nights" - which is great, but seriously ... is it too hard to donate a free pizza which allows recipient to possible try their pizza for first time and likely order more at the same time or again in the future?  People like to support local establishments....it would be nice if that were reciprocated.

As the only game in town we are 'forced' to go here. Got take out a couple of weeks ago, I ordered 45 mins in advance, got there and they were just putting it in. And again this week. That is it - they stay in business in spite of themselves. Over an hour wait this time. That's it - Go to Neo, go to Giordanos - go anywhere because they clearly do not care!!!
Great margarita pizza. A bit hectic on Friday nights but that indicates it popular. Friendly wait staff. Alway has a coupon on their website.  Good value and great product.

The fam and I love the pizza.  We also love that whenever we show up at lunch on the weekend, nobody else is there until we are nearly ready to leave.

At our last visit, we lucked out and got a free dessert (with pizza purchase, on Sunday's) that was big enough for the four of us to share. That was pretty sweet considering we also had a Groupon.

There is a no reason a delivery should take over an hour for a Pepperoni pizza. It may be good pizza but this is the second time they have taken over an hour to get us a basic pizza when we are located right up the street. Completely unacceptable!

we have had this pizza three times now, twice dine in, once delivered.  Always good food, server (Taylor) was awesome each time we were there!  Good family place, small, and they have trivial pursuit cards on the table, to help pass the time if you wait....which, expect to do if you order deep dish pizza.

They serve beer and wine as well, and the price is not too bad!
Took our son for his 6th bday, and Taylor brought him out a huge dessert, which he loved, and was comped!

This is a review of the new dining room added to this location. Overall, the Charlie Fox's pizzas and sandwiches are good, although certainly not the best.

The new dining room here at Rt 64 and Peck is almost spartan in appearance. Kind of like an updated and sterilized Barnaby's look. The ambiance is about the same, too, with a single LCD TV on the wall for atmosphere. You get your choice of "watch TV" or "not watch TV" when seated.

The food is the same food you can order for take-out or delivery. They bring you a basket of peanuts and encourage you to throw the shells on the floor. 

[NOTE TO LAWYERS: Contact Charlie Fox's to get your business card in their hands BEFORE the first person takes a slide on the shells]

Other than that, there's not much here to recommend. The beer list is limited to 3 or 4 domestic brews and two imports -- although they are next door to the Taphouse Grill.

We probably won't be back to the dining room, but we will eat their pizzas again.
Excellent pizza and smallish, cozy dining room experience, with a nice lodge-like decor. Very attentive waitress the day we were there. Excellent pizza and prices are fair.

We ate here (actually ordered takeout) for the first time and loved their thin crust pizza.  We ordered a large with half spinach veggie and half Hawaiian as well as a medium cheese for the children.  Both pizzas were well received and I thought both the spinach and Hawaiian were *excellent*.  Generous toppings on both and everything was fresh and tasty (which I hoped was the case considering the prices were slightly above average).  The kids liked the cheese pizza as well.  Service was friendly and pizza was ready on time. We will definitely be back!
Worst experience in a while. Took almost 2 hours for a delivery of an Italian Beef and Fried Chicken. Plus the manager didn't even care that we weren't very happy. Won't go back!!

Thought the food was awesome, but our server Taylor was even more awesome.  She might have been the best server I have ever had.  We had 1/2 pepperoni pizza and 1/2 bbq chicken with a cesar salad which was all delicious.  I would ask for Taylor when you go, she will make you a happier person.

We had the Chicago style stuffed deep dish and buffalo wings.   The pizza was excellent - excellent amount of cheese, sauce and toppings.   The crust was tasty too.   Wings were as expected and good served with a red hot sauce and ranch, but no celery sticks.

I would say the place is mostly "to go", The place has an outside seating area that works though.  I enjoyed checking out the shops in the local area too.

I talked with the owner and she is so nice. I hope they continue to do so well.

Next time I am in the area, I will be back!

Date of my visit: 11-November-2016
Time of my visit: Late dinner

I was in a mood for a calzone all week, so finally, today, I decided to have one for dinner.

I pass this place on my way to work, I used to know the place that used to occupy that space.  We phoned in our order. For pick up.  We ordered two calzones, one with BBQ chicken, another with BBQ chicken and onions.

About 30 minutes later, we picked it up.  The calzones looked huge!  I don't think I have ever seen them that big!

I can't speak for my girlfriend, so I will give my review.  I enjoyed, I thought it was a decent calzone.  It was a nice ratio between cheese and toppings.  Personally, I prefer thicker crust for a better grip, but I am also weird when it comes to that.

Overall, it's a sold B.  I would definitely recommend this place! And I'll be back for sure, I saw Gyro on the menu!

Stars are based solely on the food. If I were rate them on service and food, They'd lose at least one, possibly two

Ordered a half jalapeno/pepperoni and half sausage/mushroom/giardenara pizza. Also got cheese sticks. The pizza was absolutely fantastic. We just moved to the area and I've been shopping for a go to pizza place. This is it. The ingredients were fresh and they certainly did not skimp on them. I very much appreciate when places use fresh mushrooms too, which they did. The crust was very thin (which I like and had the perfect combo of crunch and chewiness. The crust was also flavorful, which is something many pizza places in the area lack. They use a LOT of cheese. I may ask them to tone it down next time. Pizza is delivered HOT.

I ordered the cheese sticks based on other reviewers' recommendations. They did not disappoint at all. The marinara dipping sauce was really good too.

On to the cons of which there are several. I ordered using Yelps grubhub knock-off, Eat24. I ordered at around 5 and set the delivery time for 730PM. I received the pizza around 6PM.

I ordered a large pizza. It was shoved in a box that seemed to be designed for a pizza about an inch or two smaller. This caused the pizza to get a little misshapen and curled up. Kind of annoying. 

The cheese sticks came in a small brown bag. They were crushed and torn apart. Still tasty but looked a mess.

It says a lot that even with the service issues, I intend on making this my regular place.

terrible cheesesteak. just terrible. absolutely tasteless. mozzarella does not belong on a cheesesteak, and the bun should not be over toasted, so that it crunches. meat was tough. 
one star added for the nice lady at the counter. lulu, maybe?
