Damn bruh get the gyro. It's fire. She said "just like they make it in Chicago" and I'm all like "haha okayyy" because I didn't hear her at first and was on the way out, so then I'm like "Psssh I'll be the judge of that" and the gyro is fire bruh she was not lying one bit. Imma rep this place till the death of me
What a great pie! Great ratio of toppings and thin crisp crust. Really delightful owners. Will be back for more!
Very disappointed, crust was hard almost stale tasting could barley bite through it. Cheese was also not great. Sauce was fine. Will not be back.

The reviews are all true!  We had a delicious thin crust pizza with loads of fresh garlic. We also had to order some freshly made mozzarella sticks which were excellent. The mozzarella sticks were light and flaky and melted well. Not much space to eat but it was a beautiful evening for their patio dining (slightly marred by the train noise, but that isn't the fault of the restaurant).

Cheese sticks!!! They have the best home made cheese sticks ever.  I come here any chance I get because they truly have the best Italian beef in the world and not to mention the pizza, WOW it's mind blowing. Their jalape̱os are so spicy and the thin crust pizza it's cooked to perfection.  Lulu's is the best!!!
Great delivery - pizza arrived hot. The Double A pizza was delicious. A bit too much cheese for my liking, so I will probably note that the next time I order. So far, best pizza in Glen Ellyn.

Their pizza is by far the best locally I've had in Glen ellyn. I'm a big fan of yummy pizza and who isn't?? Just enough cheese and toppings. Plus they have daily specials that you can check out on the website! I ordered delivery over the phone and it came on time hot and fresh! Had lots of flavor in the sauce and crust! Yum! I will be a returning customer!

Pizza! Pizza! Pizza! I am a pizza fanatic and this place has everything I need and want.   I come here for their delicious thin crust pizza with amazing homemade sauce.  I have heard wonders about the pan crust so that is next on my list.  They also have homemade cheese sticks that are to die for so they are always included in our order.  I've never been disappointed from the chicken tender to my husband's special calzones with extra pepperoni.  Well worth my travel from Highland, IN.  
*Oh and extra points for their friendly staff   ;)*

We recently moved to Glen Ellyn and tried Lulu's Pizzeria based on the Yelp reviews. I'm happy to say the stars are well deserved. 

As former southside Chicagoans, we prefer thin crust, TRUE Chicago-style pizza, and Lulu's has it nailed. Lulu's has everything I look for in a pizza. The crust is super thin and crisp, the sauce is super tasty, the toppings are top quality and generous, and the whole pie is cut in squares, like it's supposed to be. We are so thrilled to have found such a great neighborhood pizzeria just minutes away! Fantastic!!
Wow the extra thin crust is awesome. We ordered from a new place on a Saturday night last week and are back again tonight. Carlos makes an awesome pie! Be sure not to miss this Glen Ellyn gem!

Top rate pizza.  Yum!  First time customer - am sold.  They make their own crust and sauce.  Truly  delicious!  They offer choices of crust thickness. Thin was great but I will order extra thin next time. 

Everyone talks about how great another pizza joint in Glen Ellyn is.  Sorry.  I don't get it.  They never get the order right and if you order delivery, it takes longer than estimated and it gets there cold.  Not at Lulu's.  They gave me a delivery time and were here actually early.  And the pizza was piping hot.  

Don't go to the other place.  Call Lulu's.  You won't be disappointed.

Outstanding burgers and fries; I try to go there once a week just for french fries (at the very least). The homemade mozzarella sticks are so good (no deep fried cheese stick here!) The pizza, eggplant parm, chicken tenders and hot dog are also really good.
Steak tacos were amazing, the steak was perfectly cooked. The chips and salsa were so good as well!

I love this place but some of the young staff are really not good-- not very attentive and don't listen- had to tell the guy seating us 3 times for a booth.  Also, the carne had more gristle than it should so they do have some work to do on quality control.  Chimichanga was still good.  Strawberry margarita needed fresh fruit, not so much mix.

El Molino is my new favorite Mexican spot in the area. Granted, I haven't been to very many, but I do prefer this place over Algonquin Mexican Restaurant or North of the Border (although both of those are very good too). 

Once seated, they give you complimentary chips and salsa (green is mild, red is hot). Both salsas are good as well as the chips, but the red salsa is fire-hot.. I like hot, but it's too much for me. 

For appetizers, I've only tried the Sopes (with shredded beef) and they are amazing. I could totally order it as my meal and it's really filling (you get two with your order - see my photos). the beef is very flavorful and tender and all of the toppings make it perfect. 

When I dine in, I usually order the #2, which is a 1/2 skirt steak, chicken taco and cheese enchilada. The skirt steak is probably the best skirt steak I've had at any Mexican restaurant. Not chewy, not fatty.. Perfectly juicy and tender. The chicken taco is delicious and the cheese enchilada is pretty good (lots of cheese of you are a cheese lover, and very sausey). I've also tasted a chicken tamale, and it was delicious as well.

Service is very good too! Try El Molino!

Table was sticky and smelled like old rag when we sat down. The busboy who took care of the chips and water was more attentive then the waiter, who took 10 min just to contact us. Got 2 strawberry marg. Which tasted like they were made for a child. For 6.50, it should have a bit more alcohol. 
Food was ok, nothing to rave over. Wouldnt come back here.

I only stopped in here from a beer and some chips and salsa after work.  But if the popularity says anything about this place then it must be at least a 4 star place.  There were a few people when I got there late Friday afternoon, but by the time I had two beers, people were streaming in to eat dinner.  So I'd be willing to try it for dinner some time to enjoy the food along with its colorful atmosphere. (check out my pix)

Consistently good. Love their salsa Verde, jalape̱os  El Malino, queso fundito,  and Carne oxhaqueno (?spelling).  Service is good. Love going here....also check for a Groupon.
Just wish they had a outside patio.

El Molino serves delicious Mexican food and beverages. The staff is always welcoming and friendly, and the price is fair for the portions of what you get. Just don't fill up quickly on the chips! 

While some may consider the decor outdated, I would say it's nostalgic. I could make this my go-to Mexican place if it were nearby.

The food was ok but it was not real Mexican food. It was a" Americanized" . And not only that but how are you going to have a Mexican restaurant but no Mexicans or Latinos period.  Everyone who worked in that restaurant was Caucasian. Even all the customers.  Well like I said it was an OK restaurant it wasn't terrible but it's not a restaurant that I will be jumping to go to again.

We ordered from here the other day for take-out during lunch. They have quite a few things on their menu! We ordered chips, both salsas, the queso fundido, and the carne asada tacos. 

The man on the phone was very nice, but they did not let me pay for my order over the phone - you have to pay in person. Like most take-out orders, it was not piping hot by the time we got it, so we had to reheat a few things, but that happens. All of the food was very good - the tacos are great. I also really like the green salsa. The large bag of chips is huge!

My friend went to pick up the order, so I have no idea what the inside looks like or what it is like to dine-in.

Overall, they have some good food and take-out is very convenient!

Been here a few times in the past couple months. 

The decor is cute. Dated a bit, but still cute. But honestly I love their tablecloths! They are adorable. 

The water...oh my, just don't bother. It's eggy, bad tasting and like another reviewer honestly stated, it's undrinkable. They were not lying. It's horrible. Get a soft drink instead. Or better yet a margarita. Get the half pitcher if you are with someone who will share. 

Service has never been 100% spot-on but it is still okay. 

The food is absolutely great. Hot, flavorful - their Queso Fundido is enough to bring me back. Try it (get the large size, trust me). I always bring home a bag of their tortilla chips. They are amazing! Salsa is delicious and "hot" actually means "hot" here. Guacamole is so-so. Their Fiesta Platter is a great way to start if you have no clue what to order there. 

I will definitely be back here again soon!

My favorite Mexican restaurant! I have been coming here since I was a baby. I've prob had everything on the menu at least once and enjoy my meal every time. Great service chips and salsa are amazing I'll drive here sometimes just for chips and salsa. Would recommend to others and I will be back, my mouths watering just thinking about it.

Always great food and delicious green salsa. The dos Equis is top notch on tap and garnished with a lime. The service is fast and friendly. The Bus boys do an awesome job of keeping chips and drinks full. This place is family owned so if you like supporting small business definitely check it out. I agree with other patrons when it comes to the decor. This place would be beautiful with fresh white paint. It would bring out the awesome wood beams on the ceiling and make a very "Alamo" feel, but hey the food is great.

I moved out from Vegas a year and a half ago where good Mexican restaurants are plentiful. Didn't think I could have good Mexican food without going into the city and thankfully I was wrong. Had the machaca chimichanga...wow! The meat was extremely flavorful and tender, the Ranchero sauce I could bathe in it was that good. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the salsa. They serve deliciously crispy, salty chips with salsa that just tastes like hot sauce. It was all liquid and all heat, not much flavor. The green salsa was disgusting. If they made better salsa, this place would be uncomparable. If you want good Mwxican, definitely give them a try.

Great Mexican food if you've never had Mexican food. Been here twice. Great decor. Love being in the restaurant but the food is bland. The last time we were there the service was  abysmal. If you have guest in town from Iowa, they will love this place.
Came here on the advice of a co-worker. I was impressed with the knowledgeable staff and friendly service. I'll be back! Thanks for the wonderful meal!

El Molino is a pretty happening spot and well known in the area for their great Mexican food.

I've been here more than a handful of times and have never been disappointed in anything that I've ordered. Steaks are always juicy full of flavor and super tender. Beans and rice are great, even if it's a side still full of authentic Mexican flare. Salsas are spiced just right, and seafood is always on point.

Drinks on the other hand are a bit lack luster. Margs a little over priced for the amount that is served and the Sangria's barely have any alcohol. 

My only real complaint is the water....EWW, it's un-drinkable! It's nasty and definitely needs to be addressed.
Great food and service! I've been several times and never let down! Great ambience. I'd definitely recommend this place!

My husband and I were on our way home looking for somewhere close to eat using my Yelp app and thought Mexican food sounded good. My husband has eaten at El Molino before but it was my first time. I also quickly found a deal on Living Social which I had no issues redeeming when the bill came.

We loved their warm chips and salsas as a complimentary appetizer, always such a nice treat! 

My husband ordered the chicken fajitas. The peppers and onions were slightly crunchy just how he likes them and there was a very nice portion of chicken that was cooked perfectly as well. 

I ordered the enchiladas suizas and they were so good! I had a cheese, a chicken and a machaca beef enchilada and really enjoyed them all. 

The only part of our meal that could have been better was the guacamole. It was creamy but tasted like it came out of a package, we were disappointed. 

Service was quick and friendly, we'll come back!

We went here with our family.  The chips and salsa was very good loved the green salsa! The chicke tacos were great! The enchiladas with green sauce were good! Chili Rellonos were excellent.  Will continue to go for solid Mexican food!

This is a go to spot for me and my friends; in my opinion, it's the best Mexican restaurant in the area.

Atmosphere/location- both the exterior and interior are nicely decorated and feel  authentic. The inside is also clean. Only complaint are the booths... The seats are a little worn/ lumpy. 

Food/drinks- extensive menu. Everything I've tried has been good! Plus, the portions are very generous. They also have daily drink specials. 

Service- fast and friendly 

Prices- low prices / great value for your money

Food there lacked true Mexican seasoning, and I would say, lacked passion. I had a couple pulled pork tacos that had no meat. Plus having sour cream on tacos is definitely not a normal thing to do. Bland tasting, very disappointed.
First time last week, Very nice decor.  Food was just ok...I'll  try something else next time.

Server was great- Food not so much. Although I like my meal in a timely manner, literally 4 minutes after I order doesn't seem right. Carne Asada tacos were greasy, chewy/rubbery... Sangria tasted like watered-down cough syrup.

We've dined here several times. I love their chicken tacos. Yum!

It can get a little loud when it's busy, so if you are looking for a quiet atmosphere, perhaps try an "off time" and not during a big rush.

Otherwise, check it out -- very good. We've liked everything we've tried here so far.

Where to start where to start. First thing wrong was when one of us asked for a steak chimichanga they said they don't have steak they only have shredded beef. What the hell kind of Mexican restaurant doesn't have steak. Second the salsa for the chips they bring is just the red and green sauces used for on top of your food. Third the tamales were just a bunch of crap covered in spaghetti sauce. And fourth and final I was just about to finish my sprite when I looked in and there was a nice sized bug floating at the bottom. Yuck! Recommend eating here if you like to chew your drink. 


Ps the food came out like 35 seconds after we ordered so you can imagine how fresh it was.

El Molino has become a regular place for us for the time being. My best friends son is going through some health issues and is on a gluten free-soy free-dairy free-fun free diet and El Molino fit his new diet needs.

We never have a bad meal and our service is usually top-notch (although, our favorite waiter just recently got a new job and is no longer at El Molino).

I am not a big drinker... as in I maybe have two drinks a year but when I go to El Molino, I cannot pass up their strawberry margarita (frozen, sugar on the side, please). 

What I am most impressed with is when we discussed my friends sons diet issues with the waiter, he made sure the chef/cook knew and they have always gone out of their way to make sure he is fed well and fed right.

Used to visit here fairly regularly when I lived nearby.

First visit in 4+ years. Walked in and welcomed warmly.

Sat at one table, but thought a window would be nice since the sun was shining. Noticed some dirty silverware someone hid behind the table sign, and pointed this out. Second table, something sticky on silverware, possibly a spray from some juice.

Both times, servers were quick to respond and very friendly. They had a big night with some celebration, and it seems they were eager to get out and were a little sloppy. But, the sincere and very quick responses, along with the look of embarrassment on our server made me think this was not normal. ;) 

On to the excellent food!

The rest of the restaurant was clean, the chips & salsa left at the table were fresh and wonderfully flavored. The red was crisp and hot, while the green had a fresh and warm flavor.

My wife ordered an appetizer sampler (don't remember what it was called) and I tried the Panzon for lunch. The appetizer contained quesadilla's (upgraded to the portabella from the dinner menu), and two other items I don't remember. She loved them, and especially recommends the portabella quesadilla! The Panzon was made with machaca meat, and was outstanding. The chipotle sauce was warm and aromatic, with just the right amount of heat and flavor. The meat was well seasoned, and the corn tortilla was the perfect carrier for the rest. Rice and beans were decent, but the entire half of a perfectly ripe avacado was a bonus!

We didn't try the margarita's, but the friends I used to come here with drove 45 minutes for them. Since the owners are still the same, I'm assuming this still holds. ;) 

Service overall was outstanding, with our server stopping by on occasion to check on drinks and take away anything we were finished with, but not making us feel rushed. Perfect balance, here.

Ok let's cut to the chase, what's good here:

Chips - Good
Salsa - Great
Margaritas - GREAT! Pitchers are a good deal, strong too!
Combo Platters - Buyer beware they charge extra for substitutions, something a lot of other places will do for free.  I honestly think that this is a bit of a rip off...Why not charge a little more and offer a make your own combo it would be better received by me of course.  
Burritos - Filling!  
Chile Relinos - Outstanding!  Wish they came with tortillas however.  

The restaurant is also a little chilly so you might want to bring a coat!  In the summer it's not an issue but in the winter they seem to keep the place a bit on the cold side.  Burrr but good food.  If you're reading this and got to this point just go there it's good food!

Shredded beef!!!!!! Seriously 

Ground beef!!!!!! seriously 


If you are at a restaurant that claims Mexican food... There should not be shredded beef or ground beef on the menu.. Or soft or hard shell taco. 


That's just my opinion... 

We had a party of like 7. Chicken had no flavor and shredded beef was horrible. I ordered a hamburger... I orders that because the food on the menu was way over priced... 18 dollars for milanesa with nenes and rice... Everything else was like around 15 bucks .. So I got a cheap burger and out of our group everyone agreed that the burger was the best out of everything

The food at this restaurant was very forgettable.  My combination plate was swimming is a watery red sauce that made the tacos and quesadillias soggy. The sauces that arrived before the meal that accompanied the chips were watery and tasteless.

On the positive side our service was pleasant and  quick. 

With all the places that serve Mexican food in the area I would go elsewhere.

Very disappointing. Service was fine, but the food??? 15.95 for a steak "casserole" which is basically beans, rice, and steak thrown on a plate with a red sauce overtop. The Steak Chimichanga was the same exact thing except wrapped in a soggy tortilla with cheese over top for 14.95. I'd rather not spend close to 60.00 for two beers, a quesadilla, and two dinners everrrr again at this place. Save your money and find a better Mexican restaurant. They should be ashamed to charge those prices for that product.
Never liked this place when I had been there in the past.  Went there again last week for a special occasion...still not impressed.  Food is just not very good.  Even my Coke was warm and flat.

Last night, my family took me to El Molino for my birthday dinner. I have been coming to El Molino since the early 1980's, when the place first opened shop in an old dairy queen drive thru and the main dining room was actually where you would park your car. Growing up, it was my favorite restaurant - I hadn't been there in years, but was so looking forward to it!!! Pulling in, the place looks much the way it did in the 1990's - a comforting thing. I noticed the parking lot was a little light (it was always packed on the weekends), but it being a Sunday night, I didn't think much of it.

We had a reservation for 6 and were quickly shown to a table - though we had to add another place setting as it had been set up for a 5 top. A gentleman came and filled our water glasses immediately and made friendly conversation. Chips and salsa arrived asap and I was thrilled to note that the distinctive red salsa and green salsa hadn't changed at all - would know those flavors anywhere. A waiter came fairly quickly to take our drink order - a nice enough guy, but seemed a bit unsure of himself - maybe brand new to food service? 

We ordered 4 margaritas, a few soft drinks and some guacamole. After a time, the drinks came - no one seemed to like their margaritas. My brother in law, who is a mixologist couldn't even identify the peculiar flavor they seemed to have...he suspected that they were using an off-market brand equivalent of Grand Marnier, but wasn't sure what the strange taste was. The waiter took our dinner orders, writing everything down verbatim. He then recited the order (correctly) in a long, drawn out litany...several minutes passed and we still had not received our guac - we flagged him down and he apologized. The quac appearing almost instantly after this.

So, the quac...it was fine, well presented...just sort of "yawn..."...I could not detect any lime or salt, not a hint of spice nor any real trace of cilantro. It seemed as though it was avocado, tomato and onion and that was it. I don't know if they were trying to cater to weak American palates or what, but, though certainly edible, it was pretty bland and didn't do much for us.

The food came after a reasonable length of time. The waiter didn't seem to know which chimmi was beef and which was chicken...we realized soon that they were both beef, because he had forgotten to put in the chicken chimi (mine)...I sat there while everyone else was served, insisting they go ahead and start. The waiter said "Their just finishing yours, it will be up in 30 seconds" but it was clear he hadn't ordered it. After about 5 or 10 minutes, he comes out with it...the plate itself was about 400 degrees and - as I used to work in kitchens - I could tell someone had but it under a salamander broiler post-haste...the beans were fine, though bland...the rice was ok...the pico seemed fresh...a side of the bland guacamole accompanied the dish. The chimi itself was not crisp (as it should be and used to be back in the day)....the cheese was still quality Chihuahua cheese which I was happy to see - the chicken was pretty good, but again bland...

Overall here is what I would say...the physical building/atmosphere is perfectly fine. The service was very friendly and they tried - they were just sort of incompetent...the food...while I am not claiming this is "authentic Mexican food" - it does have some authentic undertones (I am thinking the salsa and some of the ingredients used)....this is really Tex-mex food - the food has suffered a bit over the years though...it is ok, but in my mind it was always just way way up there and very few other places could even touch it...I still feel that it is better than a lot of similar places in the area (though those with actual authentic food, I consider to be in a separate category - sometimes you want Mexican, sometimes you want tex-mex you know)...but I can't give this a super high rating. I will....with sadness give it a 3...and remember it in better times during my 1980's childhood....your getting a 3 ONLY out of loyalty from me
Best Mexican restaurant in the area. Really authentic. The portions are huge and the price is reasonable. Very clean inside

This is by far the best Mexican restaurant in the area. Always consistent quality at a great price. The guacamole is outstanding.

Great job!
They used to be better in my opinion. The prices are a little too much for quality of food. Staff is very nice, but overal food needs some improvement.

Fantastic Mexican food I had the giant chimichanga and it was the best I've ever had. The sauce was to due for my wife kept trying to steal some from me. She got the taco salad and ate the whole thing which is unusual for her haha. We topped it off with fried ice cream and she said it was the best she'd had.

I love my south of the border food and was pleasantly surprised by this place.  I went with a group of friends and was seated quickly. It was a Friday the place was packed.  We ordered a pitcher of Sangria and it was great.  The "guac" was fresh, chunky with just enough cilantro.
Our server was friendly and the food was fast.  The mole sauce was silky and chocolatey.  
The menu was pretty extensive so I plan on returning to try lots more.

Just got back from El Molino, Ive had better service before but the food never disappoints, some complain that its not authentic I say call it what you want  just lemme know when were going back! if they learned a little more about customer service they would need to double the size of the restaurant but the poor waiters seem to be the ones that have been there a very long time. Still... great food!

Went to lunch here today with my son with a deal from Living Social.   Our family use to go here monthly when we lived in the area but moved away 10'years ago so we thought we would give it a try for old time sake.  We were told to pick a seat and were given menus and water right away and served chips and salsa which were warm and fresh.  We both ordered the chicken burrito suiza which tasted exactly like I remembered.  The service was prompt and we had our meals About 5 minutes after ordering and the  portions were filling as well with great sides of rice, beans and salad.  The only reason I didn't give it a 5 was because I felt like the prices were a little high and the restaurant seems to need a little freshening up!  I would go back but only if it was on a deal.
This place is just okay. Nothing special. Ordered the fish tacos and the fish was wayyy too fishy. Rice and beans were ok. Again, just another chain like mexican restaurant. I'll skip this next time.

I had heard awesome things about this place and I was sorely disappointed!  The food was just so-so and the drinks were a bit weak.  Everything seemed to be lacking.  We were forced in to buying even more drinks because the tap water tasted like rotten eggs.  This made us not even want to try a fountain drink so we stuck to bottled beer and margaritas.  I hope they improve so we can return!

Came all the way from California to eat here! Ok. Sorta. Visiting family, my daughter wanted Mexican. Her grandma insisted this was the place to go. To be honest, I'm not big on Mexican food. After ordering a delicious margarita, our waiter helped me out. Andrew was friendly, attentive, and just plain cute. He suggested what I should order knowing I'm not big on the menu and ended up with enchiladas. And they were delicious! So thank you Andrew! Your expertise and non judgement of my crazy family was impressive.
The service is a little slow, but the food and margaritas are absolutely phenomenal. Chips and salsa is incredible too. By far and away my favorite Mexican restaurant.
Great Food, Decent Service, but if you forget your wallet at the restaurant don't expect to get it back.

Food was great the first couple of visits. What killed it for me was the last time we went. Their water tasted like rotten eggs. We asked for new water and it was the same. The food was okay that time also. We frequent other Mexican restaraunt a instead.

we dined here last night and were blown away with our server Max.
he is experienced, friendly and remembered
 all the little details
of our order.........the food was excellent.........run! don't walk to  
El Molina's
restaurant today...and ask for Max...you won't
 be disappointed:-)

p.s. they do need a water filtration system......the water does smell like rotten 
eggs:(((((

This is that local neighborhood place that everyone knows about.  It has authentic mexican flavors and not doesn't taste like canned Chi Chi"s anything.  The food portions are hearty sized and no one walks away hungry.    They have several different types of margaritas and several flavors I have seen anywhere else.   Mango,  Chambord, Strawberry!..   The choices are endless. 

I would say my favorite dish is the appetizer queso fundido!    Unbelievably tasty mix of chorizo and cheese all melted together in a dish made in heaven!

I was just here again last night, after hanging with some friends on Cinco De Mayo and I FORGOT to take pictures!! Ok- for you Yelpers I will go back just so I can. 
This is one great Mexican restaurant. Be warned, they draw in a crowd and rightfully so. The food rocks, the drinks are strong and yummy and the atmosphere is cool. They have a great bar in the middle of the restaurant, and I will say that these are some of my favorite margaritas in Chicago. I kid you not. They have 2 salsas with chips that they serve you upon arrival, a milder salsa verde and a kick-butt-hot red salsa. The chips are awesome because they are big and crunchy but not GREASY! MMMM. They automatically bring water to you also which is a nice touch. Missing in a lot of restaurants. Last night I had the El Molino Cheese Enchiladas covered in a yummy mole sauce (oh check it I did take ONE Picture!). My mom had the chicken enchiladas with the verde sauce. Both were scrumptious. Large portions. Unbelievably good. The atmosphere is LOUD when it is crowded but it is a great vibe. Outdoor patio seating as well. You must check this place out.

Awesome place for a burrito, but has the Gringo filler thing going on. A little bit of mushy and lacking meat and more fill. Can you dig? Good Margaritas-not great. Good. Its been there forever, and I used to go when I was a kid with my mom when we would head back from the mall. Good memories of Fried Chimichangas. In the area, a good choice.

Went here last night with my hubby,our baby, and a friend for dinner. (7pm on a very busy Friday.) We all enjoyed our meals very much. I had the spicy (chipotle sauce) enchiladas with chicken, the hubby had cheese chili rellenos, and our friend had the skirt steak. Everything was flavorful and really good. The chips and salsa were awesome. The only thing that I didn't really enjoy as much were  the regular on the rocks margaritas, which to me were way too sour. We'll definitely return in the future, but I may ask for a "sweeter" version of their margarita. Otherwise, we really liked this place.

Went here tonight for my third try. We had the Quesadilla with Chicken, Chimmichanga, and the burrito trio. One word describes the food...Blah! Everything tastes the same. There is no love in this food. There really cannot be. We placed our orders and we were served in 6 minutes from the time he left our table with our order. There is no way to prepare this fresh in that amount of time. The Chimichanga was like a wet soggy mess. No crispy shell. The shredded beef tasted like old wet pot roast with no flavor. The Sangria is not Sangria...I think they put a drop of red wine in it for color. No flavor of fruit and wine at all. I thought about returning and complaining, but it has not changed in a year so what's the use and some people keep praising it...I not being funny but I would take Taco Bell over this. I at least know what I'm going to get.

Tonight was my first experience at El Molino. We picked up the food for carry out. 

I liked the service provided by the person who answered my call and helped me with my order since no menu was available online or by fax. Very helpful and patient, willing to recommend items when I asked (such as the El Molino Enchilada).

We wanted to sample a few things so we had taco dinners served with rice & beans (one beef, one carne asada), chicken flouta & an enchilada (El Molino Enchilada). 

Highlights/Pros: 
I highly recommend the El Molino Enchilada. It has a very yummy red/tomato sauce and they recommended the muchaca beef (shredded beef) which was delicious.
The chicken flouta as expected is not of course overflowing with flavor (mild) but if you like something on the mild side that is deep fried it was really good.
I noticed the carne asada was quite tender and had limited fat, much appreciated. 
The green sauce was very flavorful.
The guacamole is very tasty. 

Cons:
A little on the pricey side compared to other mexican carry out options but the overall quality and presentation proved this to be worth it.
I didn't like that they charged $1 for the green sauce (it's a large portion) most places include that with the purchase of a dinner.
I have to believe that the cook forgot to add any toppings to my carne asada tacos since I can't imagine they would serve these plain (must have cheese, cilantro at least for more flavor and of course add green sauce and my favorite fresh avocado).
No menu available online or by fax.

Worst part of the experience was definitely the beef tacos. The ground beef appeared to have no seasoning and tasted extremely bland. I would recommend another meat choice for sure unless you are accustomed to eating simple  browned ground beef of course.

We will be back soon, and plan to dine onsite next time and try the Sangria!!

Yummy. I've been a patron of this restaurant since it opened when it was just a tiny place making do in the old dog 'n suds structure (yep, a long time). It was really good then and although I live further away now, I still go there when I can. I loved that they expanded and added space and a good bar years ago, and the food and drink is always reliably good. Best mex food in the area.

Love this place, it's just about in our back yard and when we need to get out and breath and catch up this is the place. Beef nachos are awesome. not to mention the fajitas. I only wish their quesadillas were bigger. Guacamole is incredible.
Mustang Sally Horse and Pet Sitting
Very good authentic Mexican food. Different  than the norm. Relaxing atmosphere and polite staff. I definitely recommend.

I am kind of surprised this restaurant has 4 stars. I thought it was pretty run of the mill Mexican nothing special.  Not to add insult to injury but I like chipotle much better and it's just fast food Mexican.  My taco salad was really bland the sauce wasn't anything special and the seasoning was lacking too. The chips and salsa tasted like a bottle of pace salsa. My margarita was definetly not authentic and was made from a mix.  The food wasn't gross or anything but for a sit down Mexican restaurant i expect more. Go to lalos in Schaumburg and chicago or chevys instead.

Here's all you need to know....food is decent..not great but decent...$12.25 
for 3 steak tacos, comes with beans and rice.....pricey ? , you decide. Service is good, quick, friendly......here's why i prob wont go back during peak hours....
This restaurant is THE NOISIEST PLACE ON EARTH...YOU CAN HARDLY HEAR THE PERSON SITTING NEXT TO YOU...BRING EAR PLUGS and DECIDE NOT TO TALK !!! I COULDN'T WAIT TO LEAVE !

Being pregnant and hungry all the time this was a life saver for me (and my husband who has had to listen to my cravings for 4 months now). We came here on a Saturday for lunch. Our food was well prepared and everything tasted fantastic. Been coming here since I was a little a girl and every visit has been satisfactory. I am withholding 1 star due to the women's bathroom scaring me. It needs a makeover and a good cleaning. ;)

I havent been here in a LONG TIME, so it felt good to come back and enjoy authentic Mexican food. Great Salsa, love the service, food was really tasty despite the fact that it was pretty greasy. Problem: very pricey. Overall: Delicious.

Wife and I had dinner here last night, it had been awhile since our last visit, due to bad experiences we had quit dining here, but thought we would give it another try.  The salsa and chips were good and fresh, they had a Hot and Mild choice.  My wife ordered the Chili Reno dinner and like it a lot, I had the enchilada dinner with both beef and chicken both dinners can with the standard rice and beans and over all we were happy with our food.  The service was prompt and friendly.
Not necessarily "authentic" but good food none the less.

I really like this place , and was there this past week
My wife and I and the kids have been coming here  for a good 20 years. Not that often 
but maybe once a year ,  I never have had a bad experience , It still looks like it did 20 years ago, but that fine they keep it up well ,  The service is always very good and friendly,  the food is always delicious , and the red salsa that you get with the chips is extremely hot (which is good) , This past visit  I had the (3) burrito's platter with Cherizzo and they where very good  my wife had the Chimmichanga which was  excellent , the picture of Margaritas was as always terrific,  I guess if you looking for authentic Mexican  you'll get something like that here, Its not like a authentic  mexican food joint in a strip center ,  that your guessing if its  safe to eat at  .
This is a nicer Mexican restaurant  and not a chain ,  they been here  for a long time  so I would say they are doing something right.

I really like this place. The food is outstanding and service is friendly. It may not look like a five star place from the outside but the food sure tastes good. For about what you would pay to go to Chilis you can have authentic Mexican food.

Good food and good margarita's.  

I had the enchiladas with machaco beef (shredded beef), with red sauce.  

Decent service and the place is always busy. To me that means they are doing a great job.  

Chips are good but I've had better salsa.

This has been such a favorite place of mine for so many years, but I truly can't say that anymore. The food just continues to decline. The guacamole is store bought quality, maybe even worse. Salsa terrible and now even the carna asada is bland.  Some very friendly wait staff still, but it's time we found a new place.

I had an impromptu business meeting yesterday and needed to pick a restaurant quick.  First thing that came to mind was Mexican.  I had not been to El Molino since I was a youngster in grade school so I didn't know what to expect.  

This restaurant has been in the area for years.  The building itself looks a bit run down, but that generally does not bother me.  Inside, the decor was typical Mexican Cantina.  Although we walked in right at the lunch hour, the restaurant was basically quiet.  A few other parties were dining as we were escorted to our seats.  

Chips and salsa arrived -- as another reviewer reported, BEST tomatillo salsa I have ever had as well.  Exquisite flavor.

I ordered a trio of enchaladas, one chicken, one cheese and one shredded beef.  Service was timely and soon thereafter, we all hand our lunches.  I ordered mine with a medium heat sauce and it was just right for me. Rice and beans rounded out the dish.  Flavor was very good. 

A good lunch experience to be sure, but I thought the prices were high.  $12pp for Mexican at lunch seems a bit steep.  They do not have a lunch menu per se, so you order off the dinner menu at the dinner menu prices.  I'd have easily given el Molino a 4-star rating if their prices were a bit more in line with the competition.

My spouse and I went here for dinner the other night on the recommendation of a friend who said this place served great Mexican food.  Unfortunately, we were not that impressed food-wise.  For us, the real measure of a Mexican restaurant is their chips and salsa.  The chips were ok but the salsa wasn't all the great.  The tomatillo salsa was extremely sour and needed more salt.  The red salsa did have a bit more heat but left a bad taste.  For dinner, we ordered the enchiladas suizas and enchiladas with the molino sauce.  I really wanted to love them, but didn't.  The enchiladas were bland and the sauce seemed to have dried up when the plate was put in the oven so everything tasted dry.  

While we weren't terribly impressed with the food, the service was completely different.  Everyone was super nice and helpful.  We were amazed at how quickly our food came out...less than 15 minutes after putting in our order.  But even with the great service...and maybe we just went on a bad night....I don't think we'll be back.

I've been going to this restaurant for about five years and it is about as good as it gets for me for local Mexican food.  I know, I know, people love Faros.  Me?  Nah.  This is it.  Their red salsa is so great.  SO GREAT.  I buy it to go.  The dish I always order is plain and simple: three flour soft shell tacos with ground beef, rice and beans.  After a rough day, that dish with a bottle of Negro Modelo fixes all!

I could eat their chips and salsa till I'm about to explode! ( and i usually do)  The enchiladas are delicious! The only reason why I will not give them 5 stars is because their service is usually horrendous! There's an older lady with short hair who is constantly miserable and an older mexican man who is very impatient and doesn't come around very often to make sure everything is ok. The food (mostly the chips and salsa) is what really keeps me coming back here!

Love this food. Yes, it's totally greasy and about 5,000 calories per dish but worth it. Most of the staff has been there forever and I love that. It's more Mexican food for Americans than Mexican food for Mexicans, and that's 100% ok with me. 

Best tomatillo salsa I have ever had. That alone is worth a trip to El Molino. Decor could use an update, though but that gets a pass

My actual rating is 1 1/2 stars but that is not an option. I was looking forward to El Molino because of the mostly positive Yelp reviews. I liked the atmosphere of the restaurant, especially the bar.  It's very cozy and inviting.  I ordered the margarita on special, the 1800 margarita for $6.  It was very good for $6.  After my friend arrived and we were seated is when the evening started to turn.  Our server acted rushed and aggravated with us the whole time we were there.  We were seated at 7pm, so it was hardly as though we were holding him up at closing time, nor was there a wait so it's not as though we were tying up the table.  He acted pissy when we weren't ready to order within a minute of sitting down, and proceeded to rush us the whole meal. I ordered chicken enchiladas which is usually good even when it's kind of lousy, and it was barely edible.  The portion size was good, but for $12 I'd have preferred it tasted decent.  Our food came out 5 minutes after we ordered, which made me rightly suspicious.  I know better than to send food back in restaurants after a long history of waitressing, so I ate it.  It didn't give me food poisoning, which is a plus.  My friend and I would've liked to order fried ice cream but the server dropped the check without offering dessert or anything else as though the building were about to go up in flames and he was desperate to exit. I won't be back.

I am only giving this two starts because the enchiladas were actually quite good. The service on the night me and my girlfriend went was terrible. We waited and waited for drinks, and any type of service the whole time we were in this place. We actually had to go up front to ask for our check because our waiter was no where to be found.

We also thought the prices were ridiculous for Mexican food.

2.5 stars (Yelp, why can't this be an option?!?!?)

As someone who loves Authentic Mexican food and a fairly new suburbanite transplanted from the city, my husband and i had been in search of a good Mexican restaurant and had been recommended by more than one person to check out El Molino.  After being picked up from the train station after work one night, i suggested we try it out.  Now, I'm not sure if my expectations were too high, but i was very disappointed in the food, especially given the price.  The chips and salsa were "meh" and my entree was average at best.  I probably wouldn't have minded it so much if the entrees weren't $15- to me, the meal i had should have been more in the $7-8 range.  Our waitress was extremely friendly and despite the place being pretty dead (it was late and a work night, so, its understandable), the atmosphere was pleasant.  I'm disappointed that we didn't have a better experience, but will continue our quest to find a truly great mexican restaurant in the NW suburbs!

All I have to say is if you love mole sauce the way I do then eat here.  This is a local favorite of mine.  They lose one star just because the service is not always amazing.  If this review were based solely on the food they would have five stars.  Wonderful food!!!

The best little hole-in-the-wall ever! It isn't anything fancy but the food/drinks are good, service is fast, and prices are right.  Picking up salsa and chips to-go is my secret to hosting a fun fiesta at home too! Shhhh don't tell anyone.

Food was pretty amazing. Don't be fooled by the appearance. I don't drink but my date loved the margeritas. They had to be strong because after the first she was calling me Abe Lincoln and asking me why we are going to the theater afterwards when I should be tending to the war or something like that?..anyways..it's a winner...give it a try!

Food was great and the amount you get for the money is worth it in my opinion; I almost always leave with left overs!  They have a lot of tables which at times can seem a little bit too close to each other comfort, especially when busy.  Definitely recommended.

I checked this place out the other night because it had good word of mouth out there it I can say it lived up to its reputation.  Just got a couple appetizers but they were good (nachos and quesadillas).  Server was friendly and prompt. Salsa could have been a bit more chunky but it wasnt bad by any means. I'll be back.

El Molino is my absolute favorite place for Mexican food.  The menu has a great selection but I always get the same thing - the vegetarian platter.  The service can be hit or miss - some servers are great and others not so much. But the food keeps us coming back for more!  We take our small kids here are the time - definitely a kid friendly place.  Also good for a girls night out.

Came here this past Saturday with my mom and son to take my mom out for her birthday. We were "greeted" by a less than friendly hostess and she sat us in the room to the right, all the way at the back right next to the servers station. Could we be sat anywhere worse? It was total crap because all we could hear was the clanging of dirty dishes being dropped into the tray and the bartender fighting with our server for not having anything stocked because the busboy was too busy taking care of the servers tables....yeah it was pretty bad. Our server was pretty frazzled, but he stayed on top of our table. 
We really did enjoy the food though. I had the shrimp casserole and my mom had the chimichanga. The two salsas we were served were great and the chips were nice and warm and we all left nice and full. We would have stayed longer and had some fried ice cream, but our table was so horrible that we had to eat and run. 
So, for the food: 4 stars, the service: 2 stars. Next time, I will watch where I get sat.
We have been back two times since the end of January and both visits were super.  Great service, great food!  I wish I could do half stars because I would give them 4.5...

The Portabello Mushroom Quesadillas are Unbelievable.  Whenever we go there my wife orders those Quesadillas...nothing else ever.  We also just ordered 4 Portabello Mushroom Quesadillas To-Go for a small gathering at our home.  They were unreal!!!

My husband and I went in there the other day, and I had the most divine Enchiladas en Mole. Seriously. So good. My husband had the combo meal with a strip steak and a cheese enchilada. The steak was also fantastic, although we had a steak fajita at el faro the other day that just can't be touched. I want to know how they do it.

Since I moved into the area, this is my favorite place to get Mexican.  The prices are great, food is always top notch and the margaritas are perfect mixture every-time without being too sour.  Not to mention that the free chips and salsa are so good I buy them for a quick takeout snack quite a bit,  and great to bring to parties and gatherings.

A few years ago, this restaurant used to be superb.  The menu was great and the salso they brought before the entres came was a stand out.  Recently they must have changed the way they prepare things because many menu items now taste bland, and the salsa tastes store bought.

Looooove this place. It's a little bit of a drive from Crystal Lake, but we love coming here. The food is warm and rich, the drinks are always refreshing and we always leave full and satisfied. The wait staff is always very friendly and helpful. And I am in full agreement about the chips and salsa, we order it every time :)

Very good - obviously big parties have their problems.  Great homemade margaritas (not that sour stomach killer) and the huevos dishes are fabulous.  Also exceptional fajitas and the beans are real and to die for.

We've been coming here for a couple of years now.  It can get loud and busy on the weekend but it's usually relaxing during the week.  I love the music they play and they always have the game on if it's a Chicago team.  My husband and I love mostly everything on the menu and they're glad to fix it the way you like it.  They get in new craft beers regularly and try to hook you up with one you'll like.  If not, they'll get you another!

The best part about McMae's is the staff.  Cindy and Jackie are always friendly and welcoming.  We'll be coming back for years.  See you there!

I don't know where my previous review ended up, but it's nowhere to be found. Hmmmm. 

McMae's is a local restaurant/bar with pretty good food, nice specials and Trivia. A moms' group that I belong to has met here a couple of times and I've been pleased on both visits. I came in another time with the husband, but he wasn't thrilled with the meal he ordered. 

Most recently we went on 1/2 price and trivia night. I will definitely go back for this combo again. Mister Trivia was hilarious and even though we were awful, he was kind and made some light-hearted jokes. The food was very good. I had filet sliders and had them sub in some crispy onion strings. Good call!  

The nachos were overwhelming and plenty to share. Another friend had a wrap and loved it. Looking back, there were no complaints. Yes I'd say this one is a winner.

I don't know about better than typical bar food. It's very typical and a little pricey. I would come again because I like the greasy burgers. The sweet potato fries were pretty good. Only one slightly raw one. 

The funny thing is that I had a water with the meal and it tasted funny. Almost like some one put floor cleaner in the glass. Stick with the beer, it's cheap.

As a bar, no thanks.  Typical middle aged boring suburbanite crowd.  I don't like bars where kids are allowed (it is also a restaurant).  Just not my idea of fun and ruins my vibe.  My Old Fashioned was nothing special.  Waaaaaay too much ice, not enough of the good stuff.  Lame.
Probably the best pub food ever.  Never had a bad meal here.  Their cheese and bacon stuffed burger is delicious!  Service can be a little slow, but totally worth the wait.
Great service, good prices but stay for the food. One of the best rueben sandwiches ever. Servers are attentive. Atmosphere of a real hometown hangout.

Decided to try this place after reading the reviews.  Not sure why this place was given 5 stars.  Surely was not just for the food.  Staff was friendly, but sandwiches and burgers were average. The sweet potatoes chips were slightly hard (raw).  Sorry, don't waste your time, if you are looking for a good food place.

Very friendly staff and delicious food. I've been going there pretty much every Tuesday night this year for trivia, and it is always a fun time. Every single time, everyone at my table - and we usually have around six or eight people - loved everything they've ordered. The food is AWESOME - especially the wraps!!

I'm never disappointed with McMaes.  It's your local neighborhood bar.  Prices are always reasonable and food is always good.  The chips are made in house and they are fantastic!  They make the nachos even better!  Great place to watch a game or hang out with some friends!
Good bar for a drink. Food wasn't spectacular . First time there since it was Ovis and yeah- miss the old chef. Regardless one of the nicer bars in bartlett

Awesome local bar.  The food and drinks are great.  The service is always excellent.  They have tons of different food and drink specials throughout the week.  Everything I have tried here was excellent.  I will definitely continue to come back

$5 patron margaritas on Fridays! I mean, come on! I love sitting at the bar, all the bartenders are awesome.  Food is good,  better than your typical bar food. Their tortilla chips are to die for. Try them.
Great staff and great food but the service brings me back.  Ribs are fantastic, burgers and wings too.  Great place to watch sports.

I love Cindy the bar tender. shes amazing!!! Shes probably the main reason I keep going there!  The only reason I didnt give them 5 stars is because I NEVER see the owner smile and he only mingles with the people he knows and likes.  Kind of annoying.  Other than that good food.
Great food & good atmosphere . Good local restaurant/ bar . No matter how busy it gets the owner always tries to get you a table fast.
awesome food everything i tried is great never disapointed

Very small quaint authentic Italian restaurant. Great ambiance. One of the best if not THE best eggplant parmigiana I've ever had!  Huge portions. 

Darrin our server, was very attentive and always there when needed. 

The Lemontini was out of this world!!! We will definitely come back when visiting this area again.
Best Chicken Marsala I've ever had!!!  Great atmosphere and awesome staff!!!  I actually like the seating in the small bar area more then the dining room...

Hands down best restaurant around.  Our server was knowledgeable and had excellent suggestions. The portions were so large, we had A gourmet lunch the following day. The atmosphere is warm and cozy and was truly a delightful experience. Highly recommend this restaurant.

This place was incredible. I went here on Valentine's Day, so they had a price fixe menu. Even with the smaller menu, I found it difficult to decide between all the delicious sounding meals. It was a great deal for all the food we got. We had a ton of leftovers!

The food was great, the ambience was very "big Italian family" and made me feel right at home. Our waiter that night was fantastic. He was super friendly and attentive. This is a place I will definitely return to!

Top notch Italian food! We started with fresh mozzarella with prosciutto and arugula and it was wonderful. The dinner salad was a great little dinner salad with romaine, tomatoes, cucumber, carrots, kalamata olives, croutons and a house vinegrette. I had the 10 oz filet mignon  special which was cooked to perfection, juicy and tender. My boyfriend had the frutta di mare which he can be picky about but loved; the serving size was enormous! After dinner martinis were yummy as well. 

The service was very professional.  I would recommend calling ahead for a reservation, we tried to go last weekend but they we closed for a private event. We had a reservation last night and I was glad we did because it is a smaller restaurant and they were packed the whole time we were there. 

Definitely worth a visit!

You know it's really hard for me to give any place a 5 star rating for starters, this is a hidden gem I must say.  We actually waited across the street for an hour for another restaurant and my party got restless!!

We hopped across the street to find this place and was very fortunate to get Elise, along with her great personality and service the food was just unbelievable.  I had the Salmon Risotto, a red cab and others had a creamy tomatoe pasta that the whole table tried to share lol. . The wait staff was on their game hand and foot. We've visited Italy three times and it's one of our favorite vacation spots in the world... the decor was great, music and again I say the food, the service was well matched. We'll be back soon to visit, hopefully Elise will be able to attend us again.

I will post another review about the food but I wanted to get this out there because this made our whole experience that much better. 

Darren, our server, was absolutely amazing. Exceptional customer service skills and manners for such a young man. 

We came across a change in the food that we were not too fond of but nothing crazy. But Darren's excellent service made us enjoy our evening no matter what. Thanks again Darren, you rock!

Da Baffone is excellent!! The food is authentic Italian (coming from an Italian who is used to eating home cooked italian food) and very well proportioned (I can never finish my meal). The owners are very professional! Carmela came to our table to ask how our meal was and asked us to visit again.. we went again for Mothers Day and they did not disappoint!! Darren served us, he was great! Professional and on top of it. He knew the whole menu by heart.  It was a 5 course meal for $30.00 can't beat that price!! And a glass of wine was included for everyone at the table! I will definitely be making this a Mothers Day tradition from now on.. it is a small restaurant so i do recommend making reservations or you may not get in on the weekend.. If you're in the Crystal Lake area go visit DaBaffone! They will not dissapoint..

We visited this restaurant for the first and last time yesterday.  We were met with an "attitude" by the hostess/owner? who seemed annoyed that we had not checked in...even though we had done so.  She was informed of this by another employee (host?).  At the same time, she was complaining to him that she did not have enough help clearing tables.  Shortly thereafter, we were seated at a small table for two that was very close to the bar and also in the "pathway" of servers coming in and out of the dining area.  I asked if we could have a different table that was out of this "pathway".  This request was accommodated.  We began the meal with bread...which was delicious...but the little gnat-type flies hovering over the bread was somewhat "offputting".  My husband ordered a veal dish accompanied by cream of mushroom soup.  I ordered a chicken/eggplant entree, accompanied by a salad.  My husband thought his soup was delicious.  I was not pleased with the salad.  The greens did not seem crisp...and looked somewhat brown.  We were both very disappointed in our entrees. My husband felt like he was eating "leftovers"...or food that had not been freshly prepared.  The chicken breast I had seemed white and "rubbery"...and the eggplant was "chewy".  Neither of us finished our entrees, nor did we have any desire to take home the leftovers.  Our server was very nice and attentive.  Unfortunately, the quality of his service, did not offset the poor quality of the food.
Visited again and had a much better experience! Good food, great service from the owner. Will be going back!

Who doesn't like Italian. This place is family owned which is nice for an Italian restaurant but not always the case! I do know the owners, but unfortunately still can't give a 5 star rating. I feel my experience with the food overall is just alright for Italian. However, the service is wonderful. They take the time to talk with you and know you. If you want Italian food and the Hawks game is on, you've found the better play to get both!! 

I'd say this place is a must try but maybe not a continuous agenda for me.

One of our go-to places for date night - we love leaving our phones at home and heading to downtown Crystal Lake for dinner. Their appetizers are delicious - highly recommend the goat cheese & marinara.

We always seem to miss their 1/2 price bottle of wine nights so try to get there for that! The ambience is great - very nice for date night or couple's dinner. It's a smaller restaurant so I would encourage a reservation especially for larger groups or on a Friday/Saturday night.

Great atmosphere, food was decent. In all honesty, if it weren't for the terrible service, I'd probably give them a 4 out of 5. 

But at the end of the day, the service was so terrible, I had to write this review. And if no stars were an option, I'd give it.  

It was a very busy night to be fair, however, I was there to celebrate my cousin's 9th birthday. As soon as we sat down, I told our waiter that she was turning 9. Shortly after, my party of 4 placed our order. Right AFTET we placed our order, the table next to us and behind us sat down (both also parties of 4). Now here's where it gets crazy. Both tables ordered, were served their dinner and had their leftovers packed to go, we were served! At that point, the manager was walking around talking to tables. I approached the hostess and asked if she could send over the manager. Very rudely she asked why. I gave her a brief explanation, and her response was simply, "well we've been very busy tonight." Nothing more. I returned to my table and the food was out a couple minutes later, however our waiter did not say one word to us. No apologies either. After we were done eating, our waiter took away our plates, (didn't offer to pack it up), the manager never came over and to add insult to injury, no dessert menu was brought out, and no cake/ice cream, etc was brought for my cousin's birthday.

One mistake is forgivable. Heck, multiple are. But the rudeness, and ignoring, and the manager not coming over after being requested is just unacceptable. 

Will never go here, again.

6 minutes late for our reservation and the crazy italian woman, I assume is an owner, made a huge scene at the host stand lecturing us and pointing her finger in my face about how their restaurant is very busy and we need to respect their schedule. 6 minutes people. I tried to explain that we had trouble parking but her yelling just got louder and more embarrassing. I was horrified at her behavior. It was like a scene from Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares.  Then she told us to get out and never come back. My pleasure.
A lovely evening, scallops wrapped in pancetta, veal marsala, gnocchi, tiramisu all great. Excellent service. Will definitely return!

An excellent choice for Italian cuisine! Started off with the steamed mussels in garlic white wine sauce which was real tender and tasty, not fishy at all. The veal picatta was so tender you can cut it with a fork, and served with a light lemon caper sauce over capellini pasta. The Braciola is delicious and it is hard not to order it every time I return, except I'm curious on tasting their other selections. I was there on a Tuesday, where the special is 1/2 price bottles of wine from their entire cellar! 
It's a small place and the wait can be an hour if your not there early. My only minor gripe is that we were sitting at the bar finishing our wine and apparently one of the waiters told another couple that we were leaving in a few minutes and they could have our seats. We were then offered a complementary taste of lemoncello by the bartender, and the couple came up to us to inquire how soon we would be leaving, so we felt a little rushed at the end. It won't  deter us from returning though,  the food is very tasty and the portions are large! It's a family run business and the owners are very friendly and accommodating.

This quaint restaurant has a true down home Italian feel.  We love to come here for the wonderful handmade gnocchi as well as the great wine selection.  Service is friendly and warm. They really make you feel at home.  Canolli's are home made a great as well. I recommend the sampler so you can try them all!  If you have a large group I would call ahead.

Olive Garden would have been a better choice. 

I ate here with my wife, daughter and mother in law. Each of us agree that for the price, we had gotten a better meal at Olive Garden. For starters we ordered the calamari, which was cool when served. The overall flavor was plain, which made us ask for extra marinara sauce. 

Our meals arrived after to parties that arrived after ours. I ordered a Chicken Cesar Salad. My wife ordered penni pasta with meat sauce. My mother in law had the salmon with salad. 

My salad was mediocre. The chicken was dry and looked like it was cooked on George Forman grill.

My wife's pasta was over cooked and soggy. The meat sauce tasted like canned pasta sauce.

My mother in laws salmon was actually the best dish. Nice size cut of salmon. Only issue was asparagus was limp and like the pasta soggy.

I really wanted to like this place but unfortunately it did not live up to the prices.
We had a wonderful experience. The food was delicious. Best linguine and clams I've ever had! Our server, Maggie was incredible!! We will be back for sure!

This place is about as authentic as you will find in CL for an italian restaurant, the food is delicious, the menu is varied and the drink list has a fair amount to choose from. Both times I've been here i have been satisfied. The place is small but has a nice cozy atmosphere. The only gripe i have is that because it is small there is typically a wait even on a weekday night so just make sure you book a reservation.

What a pleasant surprise! I went in with low expectations and I am looking forward to going back. 

I went with a friend on Friday night. Reservations were honored for our 6:30 time and it was packed. The restaurant is small and very tight. The waitress was calm and accurate, despite having multiple tables to handle. Food came out quickly, yet did not feel rushed. 

Friend had the chocolate martini and loved it. 

We ordered the bruchetta-delicious. It tasted like what it should. 

I ordered the chicken vesuvio, but asked for white meat only, boneless. It was very good. Order also came with a salad and vesuvio potatoes. 

Friend did a pick your pasta. The options are limitless. She enjoyed the dish and the portion size was enormous. It was angel hair with olive oil/garlic, fresh mozzarella and shrimp. 

We ordered the cannoli flight, which is 4 different types of cannolis sample sized. They are made in house, but did not seem freshly appeared as the cannoli shell was soft. 

Huge drink menu options.

Also, what was nice is that we parked in the back lot. There is a back door entrance so you don't have to walk around the entire area to get in. 

Thanks Da Baffone for a great meal in McHenry County, which seldom happens.

Continue to return to this great family owned restaurant because it is so damn good! We enjoy eating at the bar and always have a great time. The food is consistently outstanding and I highly recommend it! We love it!

Very good. Sat at bar and ordered dinner. Bartender did a great job of serving. Great fresh bread. Entrees were excellent Little Neck clams with linguine in a white sauce was excellent. Rigatoni with bolegnase, spinach, and mushroom was terrific... meaty and rich. All capped off with a free lemoncello. Great atmosphere in this cozy spot. Definitely a must go in downtown Crystal Lake.

Had an absolutely amazing experience tonight that started with our waiter, Darren. He was very knowledgable, helpful, and funny. I could see he was busting his butt with all the tables he had. Then we got our appetizer, amazing; entrees, amazing!! All good was unique, flavorful, and delicious. Serving sizes are large, so keep that in mind. Everything was delicious, clean, and overall an A+ experience!

Absolutely the most pleasant dining experience I've had in a very, very long time.  Great looking, authentic, family-owned business.  Sorry it took so long to make it in.  Make a reservation..it's so worth it.  Split a meal..The portions are huge!

Love this place.  We got hooked when they were running the kids eat free on Sundays and we've been back since that promotion ended.  Classic Italian food.

I eat Gluten Free and when they said they could make me a GF cream sauce to go with my GF pasta, pancetta, and peas, I was hooked!

If you were going to spend the money at Olive Garden, please go here instead.  You won't be disappointed!

We came here last night for our anniversary dinner. We live only a few short blocks away & hadn't made the call to eat here. 

It didn't take long for my wife and I to agree that we'd made the right decision! 

We came in on a Sunday night & were pleasantly greeted with a smile by the owner (that is by assumption). There is a nice wood bar to the left with a fully stocked bar...appeared to have a decent selection of wines but I did not sample. The dining room we were guided to was just off from where the bar area is. We found it perfectly intimate for the type of dining experience we were looking for. 

Once to our seats, we were greeted, drink orders taken and then received continued attention by our very nice server (cant remember his name). It appeared he was the only server on, but handled the four seated tables generously. I had a few Birra Moretti's and she had an iced tea. 

There were a lot of delicious appetizers on the menu, but knew they were going to fill up our plates so decided to hold off. 

My wife had a house salad and I ordered the French Onion soup before our entrees came. It was simply AMAZING! You could tell that everything was done fresh that day. I wanted to take a bath in that stuff. 

We both ordered one of the specials for the night. I ordered the linguine dish that had shrimp, calamari & mussels in a fresh tomato/wine sauce. Again it was just amazing. Seafood was fresh and the sauce was to die for. My wife had the Spinach Manicotti. She was just as pleased. Both entrees were huge and made for a great reheated lunch today! 

We topped off the meal with desert and had the peanut/chocolate Gelato. We split and had the bowl gone in no time! 

The electricity went out in downtown CL during the end of our dinner, but everything was handled perfectly and we were all made comfortable. 

Can't wait to go back and try some other dishes!!
Cozy little Italian restaurant. The food is authentic and delicious! The staff is very friendly. Recommend making reservations
If they want a drive thru , than let people know. In Italy you have courses. These owners are all about how fast you eat. If you plan on having a nice dinner with friends ,don't go here.

Wow.  Might venture to say best lasagna I've had... pasta cooked just right, great sauce, lots of cheese without being stringy or overkill.  Very impressed with my first visit, will definitely go back!  Nice environment inside too, did not seem like a suburban restaurant.

We came on early Saturday evening and were seated right away . The service was wonderful and the ambiance couldn't have been nicer. Our food was served in a timely fashion and was wonderfully delicious . 
We had linguine with white clam sauce and the lasagna. My husband had the tiramisu for desert and I had the lemon sorbet. Both really good . Definitely check this place out. They did get busy shortly after we got there so I would advise calling ahead
Omg!  This is hands down the best legit italian food ever!  It is a bit expensive but it is sooo worth it wine and dine at a great cozy atmosphere.
One our favorite Italian restaurants. We have always had great meals and enjoyed the atmosphere. We will always come back
Spent the evening with friends, fabulous meal and excellant service, will definately go back

Awesome food - Great place -Good vibe. 

NOT A CHAIN...  family run and your welcomed like your a friend and your business is appreciated. Up-scale-casual  tablecloth service with a wide menu selection.

been about 25 times, as good as it gets, never had a bad meal.

HINT: if the street parking is busy, you can park in the public lot behind the restaurant and enter in through the back.
We have been coming here for years and always have great service and great food. The atmosphere is always great.
Their olive oil and house dressing is amazing. Service is good. I had the eggplant Parmesan which was really good. I will come back when I'm in the area.

Two words: SO. GOOD. 

This is hands down the best Italian food I have ever had in the McHenry County area (with Cucina Bella in Algonquin coming in at a close second). I have to admit, I have only dined here twice, but each time was extra special. For my first dinner I had spaghetti and meatballs. I know, I know, totally mainstream but it was fantastic! Best meatballs I have ever had. The menu indicates this dish is made "for 2" but I requested a single serving and they had no problem accommodating. Not to mention I still had plenty of leftovers! I loved the food, service and atmosphere so much that I decided to book my wedding rehearsal dinner here. Now, this is not something they typically do. Since the restaurant opens at 4pm, they opened EARLY and allowed our wedding party to come in for a  late AND PRIVATE lunch between 2-4pm. It was awesome! Everyone loved it. We gave everyone a choice between lasagna, tortellini al forno and Chicken Parmigiana. The Tortellini al Forno is THE BOMB. 

This quickly became my husband's and mine's favorite restaurant. We plan on returning very very soon.

This is my favorite restaurant. My (Sicilian) family and I can be very critical of food, especially Italian food, and this place is our absolute favorite. The food is fresh and delicious. I've had several different pastas, fish, chicken dishes here...you name it. It's always been excellent. They have great wine, too - especially Chianti. The owners are so friendly. Our dining experience here has always allowed us to enjoy our family and create memories over excellent food. Amazing!

Having grown up in a little Italian neighborhood in Chicago, I knew that DaBaffone was going to have a lot of potential when I noticed that their Giambotta was prepared 'bone-in'.  This takes longer to prepare than the boneless cut, but the extra flavor is worth it!  The meal was superb.  Wife ordered a tasty shrimp, scallop and pasta dish.  Son a delicious grilled pork chop.  Daughter-in-law had a very salmon.  All sang the praises.  Truly a wonderful surprise in a far NW 'burb.

Love this place!!! Went here on a recommendation from a friend and it was great. I had the Gorgonzola salad and stuffed mushrooms for my meal--the mushrooms were out of this world! The salad was super fresh and really tasty. We had Maggie as our server and she was very sweet and attentive!

My husband and I chose to try this place out because of all the great reviews on it. Unfortunately that's where it stopped. We walked in and because we didn't have a reservation we were relegated to the bar area with VERY small pub tables. Much too small for any sort of meal, but we stayed because we were really hungry.  

My husband ordered the pork tenderloin (he liked it).  I had ordered pasta with aglio olio (my standard for an Italian restaurant).  After a few bites I noticed that my throat was starting to burn.  At that point I just assumed that it was the garlic that was making it spicy so I had my husband taste it.  He agreed that it was spicy.  The more I ate the more my mouth was burning and my lips were tingling.  We come to find out they use crushed red pepper to make their aglio olio.  I barely ate half of my meal.  We told the hostess that my dish was much too spicy for me to eat when she came by to check on us. At which point she asked if I wanted it wrapped up.  Ummmm, what part of much too spicy for me to eat did you not understand?  Other restaurants would comp your meal if you didn't like it.  This place?  No way!

They also seem to cater to their frequent patrons (based on how many people the hostess knew by first name when they came in with their reservations) and forget about the new customers.

We MAY try this place again after some time has passed, but for now we would much rather go to Olive Garden or Cucina Rosa in McHenry.  Much better food and friendlier staff.

I moved away from Crystal Lake over a year ago, and every time I come home I go to Da Baffone with my mom. We are treated like old friends each time we come in, and have the most amazing experience. The food is fabulous, and although my favorite salad is no longer on the menu (the Campagnola), there is plenty more to choose from. It's worth the price, but they also have awesome deals. Love the bar small plate appetizers and half price wine nights. Absolutely fabulous.

Absolutely the best family run Italian in the Northwest Suburbs.  I go every few weeks and bring home left overs.  Atmosphere is great because you feel like family.

Cannot say enough wonderful things about this place!

Enjoy

Went for the first time a couple weeks back.  Owners were present and working the host station.  Classic 'red sauce' italian joint, nice tablecloths and expansive menu. Classy but casual - perfect for a date night or to bring your parents for dinner.  Our server was awesome and her recommendations were spot on!  Classic 'red sauce' joint, nice tablecloths and expansive menu.  I had the veal picatta and my wife had a seafood pasta.  Large portions, well seasoned and good atmosphere.  We really enjoyed our time here and look forward to returning.  Small bar area in front was watching the hawks game as we left, an added bonus.  Cheers!

family dinner this last Wednesday..

good service. there was definitely an emphasis on not being rushed.  Our ice water was never renewed, but drink and table service was good otherwise.  

Tried the grilled calamari .. Good, a lot of salt, but decent.  Okay wine selection.  Veal Marsala was decent. 

but- this place could be  GREAT If they finally decide what they are. Are they a specialty  Italian trattoria in the heart of the Midwest, with unique, hard to find Italian specialties (think: meat , local cheese, bread and sausage, all available in Chicago with authentic Italian manufacturing sources) or another dull karaoke bar with derivative Italian food cliches?  the music was so loud my 80 year old parents had to shout more than usual at each other and at me during their meal.  It was jarring. PLEASE DROP THE KARAOKE and spend budget on ingredients. 

Go "good" to "great". I know you can do it.
Went with wife. We got some calamari and spaghetti with seafood, plus a bottle of Friuli white wine. Good enough. Would go again.

We've eaten here before & the food was great, but we stopped in again & were disappointed. We did not make reservations & the place was full. The owner was completely rude to us, made us feel very uncomfortable, and not welcome. We asked if the bar area was seat yourself but the owner said, "look around, it's already full".

This is the 3rd time I've been to family-owned and run, da Baffone.  Extensive wine list, flavorful authentic and creative menu.  Excellent, attentive, knowledgable and friendly service - made a huge impact on our dinner.
