The southwest corner is an enclosed multi use room which was being converted to a swing dance floor for the evening.  John and Tony's offers dinner and movie nights and this room also serves as the theatre.

The brunch menu was one page and offered a variety of items for $7.95 along with a separate lunch menu.  I opted for the omelet with Spinach, mushroom and goat cheese. A build your own with four ingredients for the same price as three is listed.  We were served a starter of small cinnamon rolls providing a nice touch. There was too much goat cheese and not enough egg and trying to eat the omelet was like eating paste. The meal comes with a very small portion of diced fried potatoes (which were slightly overdone) and one slice of toast; the size is enough to satisfy an appetite.  Coffee and tea are $2.25 with refills which I thought was pricey.

One of my friends had the dates wrapped in bacon (sides on the lunch menu) and French toast. These days anything wrapped in bacon in a sure thing, and she said this idea was on the top of the list.  

The bus boy did a phenomenal job keeping our beverages filled, asking if the meal was satisfactory and clearing.  I wish every restaurant would have someone taking pride in the service as this gentlemen did.  

If you want something a little more elegant, this is place to go.  If you want local and casual without the feeling of one of those generic family restaurants, go to the Olde North Pancake House just to the West, they've been a staple for a long time.

As a side note, watch your time on Sunday.  With an enormous church across the street in session, and three Sheriff cars patrolling the intersection, you may run into traffic.  The Sherriff have orange cones all over that intersection.

On Sunday morning's my husband and I always go out for breakfast.  We used to try different establishment's but  have become regulars at John and Tony's.  The quality of this buffet is excellent with a great selection of food for just a little more than what we paid to order breakfast off the menu  at other local restaurant s.   They have kept certain breakfast  foods as a staple, but change up some other items.  In addition to their awesome omelet station, they had pulled pork at the carving station (with a separate barbeque sauce, so you can choose how much you want) along with ham and turkey.  The buffet had tender fall off the bone ribs and figs wrapped in bacon.  

Occasionally my teen aged children have come with us and were able to find plenty of things on the buffet they enjoyed too!

My boyfriend and I went here for their sunday brunch and it was pretty good. Only $11! The service is good. A lady walks around with cinnamon rolls which its pretty sweet. Or waitress made sure our coffee cups were full all the time. You get the typical stuff like bacon, eggs, and sausage as well as biscuits and gravy, there was some white fish and pasta as well. There is also a oatmeal bar and a carving station with ham and ribs. We are going back to check out what dinner is like since we have a groupon.

Went there with a couple friends tonight. Have to say it was incredible. Quiet with great ambience and AMAZING food. If this place was in downtown Chicago it would be a hotspot. 
The hostess was friendly and obviously knew the menu well. 
The menu was diverse and the portions were generous. We had tilapia, pork chops and ahi tuna.all of which were excellent

Service is slow even after 8:00 PM on a Saturday night.  Prices are high for the type of restauant and food that you get Friday's.   Some of the food was under cooked, waited to have one order cooked to our request and waited as everyone at the table finished their food.   Service poor  and the manager questions me about my steak why I didn't like it?  Wow, I thought the customer is  number One !

My family and I went here for my Mom's birthday and we had high expectations from the beginning considering we all love steak and Italian food and the atmosphere seemed pleasing. We were sadly mistaken, who knew simple pasta dishes at an Italian restaurant could seem so difficult to make? I ordered the gluten free pasta aglio from the signature pasta part of the menu. When I got my meal the pasta was the most overcooked pasta I've ever been served, the broccoli was just plain disgusting and was equally as overcooked and the sun dried tomatoes had the texture of raisins. But that's not the worst part. The menu claims my dish has a light herb garlic oil and my dish tasted like nothing. I even tried putting pepper, cheese and more oil on and the "pasta" dish just soaked it right up. I rarely complain when going out to eat and wasn't surprised when my sisters Chicken Marsala was drenched in sauce, and her side of fettuccine Alfredo looked like it had been sitting under a heater for days. Not to mention that it tasted like nothing as well. My dad had the Reuben and you could tell it was disgusting based on how little of it he ate. Our waitress could care less and it seemed as if she had heard the same story many times before. It's amazing that this place got 3.5 stars because the cooks could care less if their customers get food poisoning or not. I've never experienced such horrible food in my life. Don't let the "Italian steakhouse" fool you and I highly recommend you stay away. Apparently this place doesn't know what seasoning is or food for that matter.

Overall - I would recommend this place and will go back again.  The food for dinner was great.  Relaxed and elegant atmosphere. On 4/21/12, Saturday dinner, my husband ordered the bacon wrapped date appetizer - delicious red pepper sauce compliments it so well!  The blue cheese salad dressing had plenty of cheese and flavor, but the lettuce was bitter.  I had the prime rib, my husband the filet, and both were excellent.  The sweet potato puree was too sweet.  My one recommendation would be to add salad forks.  I really don't want to use the same fork for salad and then my entr̩e.  Pleasant & attentive waitress & bus boy service.  I wish everyone would try to think about what they are wearing as some of the customers were just too casual for this establishment - please leave the baseball caps at home. This place is worth checking out, but from the other reviews here it may be hit or miss.

My coworker and I got grill chasers tonight in all plac s -- but winnetka! Added the flavor the town was missing. We had the pleasure of meeting Jamie and staff! The food was amazing. I had the Buffalo Roti wrap (all wraps are served on Roti, how awesome). It was freaking amazing! Yum yum! I hope you come back to winnetka!!

I was actually very impressed with this food truck. I'd rather eat grass than eat at FoodBarz again (the only other option for lunch in my building), so I was excited to see that Grill Chasers was coming to the office on this lovely Hump Day. 

Here's what I had: 

Chicago Bird Skewers: I had mine doused in Buffalo Burn sauce. The meat was tender, juicy, and seasoned well. The sauce was not exactly your typical buffalo sauce, but really good nonetheless, and not too hot. 

Jalapeno Ranch: This came as a "Chaser" for my skewers, and it was so good that I felt it deserved to be mentioned separately. Buttery, slightly spicy, and a great complement to the buffalo sauce. 

Roti Prata Pancake - I had no idea what to expect here, and what I got was the lightest and fluffiest flatbread you could ever imagine. I had no intention of eating this because I knew it was filled with butter, but then decided it was worth the obscene amount of calories it probably contained. 

The staff was nice and the line didn't take too long. Come back to Rosemont soon, Grill Chasers :)

Extremely nice servers. I sampled this place during the summer Lincolnshire Food Truck event. They do accept credit cards which is  HUGE plus on convenience. 
However, the food was very mediocre. I ordered the chipotle fries and the chipotle sauce was basically spicy mayo. The sauce made the fries much worse. $4 for the chipotle fries.
I ordered the grilled veggie and goat cheese wrap, the wrap was a bit burnt, which made everything bitter tasting. The grilled veggie was nice but overall the whole wrap needed some sauce or some melted cheese to it to blend it all together. $8 for that sandwich.
Overall for a $12 meal, I am expecting much more. I could get a very decent meal at a sit down restaurant for $12. 
However, overall the lincolnshire food truck event was a disappointment, only 5 trucks overall so honestly, it's a monopoly because there isnt much option.

Somehow I've never reviewed this wonderful food truck. After a bit of a hiatus, I tracked them down nearby at Metal Monkey Brewing. I used to look forward to deliciousness finding them at the food truck extravaganza. I'll have to keep them on my radar, as the kabobs are tough to pass on too.

Well, I gave 'em a shot today and sadly I wasn't that impressed. I'm really picky when it comes to chicken, so i can't blame Grill Chasers for my picky tastebuds. 

I ordered the Ole' Bird skewer which is chicken infused with orange and lime juice, garlic, chipotle peppers,  and ancho chili powder. I also tried to get the jalapeno mac and cheese but I was told they didn't have it. So that was disappointing. 

The mango salsa that accompanied the skewer was good. I also loved the Roti Prata pancake. But the skewer wasn't great. The first piece was good: full of flavor and slightly spicy (for my tastebuds, anyway. Others might consider it very spicy). But the second piece was chewy... not good chicken at all. I didn't even bother eating the third piece. 

The service was great though. The cashier was super friendly and the cooks had really upbeat attitudes. My entire order from start to finish took less than 5 minutes, so that's a big plus.

I might try them again if they return and have the jalapeno mac and cheese... maybe give the veggie wrap plate a chance. But I'll pass on the chewy chicken.

I've eaten at a lot of food trucks and this one is very middle of the road. They didn't do anything wrong. Their service was decently fast for the line and the people in the truck were pleasant but the food didn't wow me at all. I had a wrap but it wasn't anything that stood out as something that I couldn't have at any other truck. I also had a side order of fries but they we're just normal frozen fries with regular ketchup. Food truck game has stepped up the food a notch and I expect something a bit different from my trucks now.
Best Food truck ever!  Loved the food and the service.  Jamie brings a smile to everyone she serves and Gary makes sure your satisfied.  Awesome food selection.

Some of the best chicken I've ever had....  everything that we tried was incredible, the wings, the ole' skewers, the wraps, the cole slaw.....  We keep an eye out for this truck and will definitely be there the next time they're at Metal Monkey Brewing!

Ate at the Grill Chasers Food Truck during an event on the campus of Northwestern University.  Good sized menu and variety for a food truck. They specialize in grilled chicken wraps, wings, Mac-n-cheese and some creative French fry dishes. They use a roti pancake  for their wraps instead of a tortilla. MUCH better flavor and texture. Had a down south southern wrap and  the bacon beer cheese fries. Both were delicious and the fries were so big I could hardly finish them. Very friendly staff on board. I highly recommend you give them a try if you get the chance.

We had Grill Chasers serve at our company party in our parking lot a couple weeks ago, and I'm still getting remarks about how great the food was. 

Grilled chicken skewers, mac n cheese, fresh cup chipotle fries, making me hungry. Best part was all you can eat for a low price per person, and no clean up or prep on our part.

Def recommend for any company gatherings!

This is a promising food truck, but there is certainly room for improvement. 

The grilled wings were outstanding the first time I tried them.  The pieces were bursting with flavor and had the perfect amount of char.  The second time I had the wings, however, there was a marked difference.  The pieces were smaller and the meat was noticeably drier.  The chicken skewers were good, but Grill Chasers does not give you enough for the price - I definitely wanted more on my plate.  The Malaysian Roti Prata pancakes redeemed the dish, though - good stuff!  Finally, the mac and cheese was disappointing.  It was simply too bland.

I'll hit up Grill Chasers again, and hopefully my next visit will be better than my last.

GO GET A CHICKEN SKEWER!!!  They have amazing smoked chicken skewers with a selection of 5 sauces to either have brushed on or you can have a cup for dipping - OR BOTH!  This truck was my favorite new find at the Trucking Around Food Truck Extravaganza event in Schaumburg (See my review for more great trucks to try!)  

Grill Chasers has their chicken portioned for sampling, but the samples are generously portioned so you will be happy with the $5 you spend.  They come with a Malatian pancake that is WONDERFUL!  It is very similar to a French crepe, but smaller.  

This truck is worth stopping for and I will be hunting them out again!

I ate at Grill Chasers during the Food Truck event at the Schaumburg Boomers Stadium. The line was super long and the food was mediocre at best. We ordered two different types of chicken skewers which were $5 a piece and very skimpy. You get one dipping sauce per skewer but I ordered an extra one for of course an extra charge. The problem with this was I noticed I didn't get it once I sat down. The roti that came with the skewers was good but very greasy. The jalape̱o mac and cheese was overpriced as well. It was a tiny portion and Kraft mac and cheese is more gourmet than the stuff they are serving here. I love mac and cheese, yet I threw this stuff away.

The service was slow but friendly. They seemed overwhelmed. I am not sure how long this place will last if they don't get shape up soon!

Grill Chasers came out to our school today for pre-prom events and it was so good!! Jami made planning the private event super easy! The food was AMAZING!! Our students and staff loved everything about Grill Chasers and we'll hopefully be able to work with them again in the near future!!

Absolutely delicious!  The beer  cheese fries were out of this world.  Perfect amount of cheese and tasted more like garlic fries. The southern wrap and skewers were tasty too. Can't wait to get them back.

Caught this food truck at a business in town. The food was tasty. I had the Southern wrap which was a great mix of favors. I also had Beer bacon cheese fries which had plenty of all toppings. The meal left me craving for more and very curious about the other menu  items. Price was reasonable too.

We had this great little food truck come out to our office and the good was wonderful. The people working were friendly, quick (maybe 10 minute wait total), and attentive (which is hard to do in a food truck). 

I ordered a wrap, which I initially thought was too small, and fries. The wrap was delicious with perfectly cooked chicken. It was so filling that I did not finish my regular order of fries. I am also a new fan of their Asian Spicy Mayo (has sriracha), which was on my wrap and requested as my shooter for dipping my fries.  

I'm glad my work had them come out, and I hope they come back again.

Awesome!
Wish they would stay on Tower lane

I helped organize a company-wide picnic lunch back in August and we had Grill Chasers come for the food truck experience. We absolutely loved having them! We had over 100 employees and office members participate in the event, and afterwards, I heard nothing but raving reviews ( still get them to this day!)

Our company really wanted a healthy lunch option, but nothing fussy and too exotic, and the Grill Chasers team was so helpful in helping us plan our menu. We ended up having a beautiful August day and THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS! Grilled chicken, ole bird skewers and veggie skewers, slaw and salsa, roti prata pancakes, and assorted sauces; it was all fantastic. Perfect cuisine for our large groups' varied tastebuds and health conscious employees. And all the food was easy to eat on the fly or seated at a bench - no mess, no problem. 

I loved working close with the Grill Chasers team to plan our corporate event and would book them again in a heartbeat. I would definitely recommend them for catering any corporate event.

Saw Grill Chasers at the food truck event in Schaumburg (if you haven't gone, check out my review and they're continuing the event every last Friday of the month through October!) This one was probably my favorite of the night! So glad that they only offered their skewer tasters! For $5, I got two skewers of chicken prepared in my choice of sauce (I did the Sweet Q Glaze), a piece of their Roti Prata bread (A-MAZE-BALLS!), and a chaser, or dipping sauce. I chose the asian spiced mayo which was delish! You could tell they smoked the chicken before grilling (you actually saw the smoke ring on some parts!), and it was grilled off pretty well. I'd definitely go back...and probably hunt them down in the city!

I manage 2 class A commercial properties in Lisle, IL and our caf̩ has been under renovation the past 3.5 weeks so Grill Chasers has been one of the food trucks serving our tenants during the construction process. We absolutely loved having them here and their food and service was amazing! We got such great feedback from our tenants about how much they loved the food. Thank you so much for all you did for us these past few weeks! I would recommend them to anyone!

My workplace was looking for different lunch options as we are a full service studio and have people on-site who aren't able to leave for lunch. I researched and contacted several food trucks and decided to go with Grill Chasers. Jami, the president, was a pleasure to work with. She sent her menu way ahead of time allowing me to post them around the studio to get my fellow employees excited about the visit. I asked Jami if she could provide special items from her menu and she graciously agreed. 

Unfortunately for me, I had a family emergency on the day Grill Chasers came to the studio, but I know from Jami's phone call that the truck was on time and ready to serve lunch at the appointed time. There were absolutely no complaints about the food. Everyone loved it. No one complained about the prices or the portions. I hear the Bacon Beer Cheese Fries were delicious and the chicken was tender and flavorful. My co-workers also told me that the staff on the truck was super friendly and prepared the food quickly.

A couple of friends actually bought me some food that I was able to eat the next day. I had chicken skewers with the mango salsa. Even reheated it was excellent. Did I mention the mango salsa? Really, really good. There was another sauce, too. I don't know what it was called, but it was also delicious. As mentioned in other reviews, the roti prata pancake was also wonderful. 

I am so looking forward to having Grill Chasers back early next year. I thought Jami was professional, accommodating and friendly.  Can't wait to try the Bacon Beer Cheese Fries and the Baconator for myself!

Where do I begin.... As I was deciding where to consume energy for lunch, my olfactory gland was struck like a bolt of lighting from the fingertips on Zeus himself. My eyes wandering for the source of this pleasant mindblowing scent. There it was, Grill Chasers. Upon reading the menu. Only one item caught my eye. BACONATOR. Holy shit it's good, it's got perfectly cooked chicken that's as juicy as Nikki minaj's ass. It's got bacon all up in that bitch. And chipotle aeoli. I don't even know what aeoli is but it's straight off some food channel shit. You can come to this place and ask for 4 of the pancakes(which is like the tortilla the wraps come in) and not be disappointed. Grill chasers = mouth orgasm

I have had the pleasure of visiting the Grill Chaser three times.  I suggest following them on facebook and you can see when they are coming to a spot near you.

I loved the chicken skewer with the spicy chaser.  The roti is the perfect finish to the meal.  I would love to have them cater a party.  

Great food, friendly people, great price.....yes, yes and yes!!

TRENDSETTER ALERT!! 
we are all quickly becoming aware of the ongoing trend of food trucks. Finally, Chicagoland has decided to delve into the movement. It took me a while to sort through the good and the not so good... but I have come to a conclusion.

Grill chasers just may be the next big thing to move through Chicagoland. The cuisine from this truck is worth the wait. I have never had a more fulfilling experience at a fast food company, let alone a food truck! Grill Chasers has it down to a science. I have had half of their menu thus far, and can honestly say that every choice that I have made was nothing less than perfection.  Great daily specials, friendly  staff, highly regarded chefs, and good prices. If you are a foodie, Follow these guys... No regrets!!

Visited at Glencoe Grand Prix the service was fast and friendly. My wife had the chicken skewers with spicy BBQ she loved it I had the grilled chicken wings with buffalo sauce and the Mac and cheese both were great
Fantastic mac & cheese and wings!  First tried them when they were at Plank Road Tap Room.  Very friendly service as well.  Will keep coming back to this food truck!

First off let me say super friendly staff. Ate there when they were set up at Glencoe Grand Prix and tonight in Evanston. Now let's talk about the good. Wow is all I can say. The Kale cabbage coleslaw, Mac n cheese and the Chicago wrap was super good. Not your average food truck. If you see them set up somewhere, I highly recommend you stop and get a bite! You won't regret it!

I waited outside in the cold and wind nearly freezing my ears off to get a baconator sandwich and some mac & cheese.  OMG was it worth it!  One of the best sandwiches I have ever had!  What a combination of flavors.

I manage 2 class A commercial properties in Lisle, IL and our caf̩ has been under renovation the past 3.5 weeks so Grill Chasers has been one of the food trucks serving our tenants during the construction process. We absolutely loved having them here and their food and service was amazing! We got such great feedback from our tenants about how much they loved the food. Thank you so much for all you did for us these past few weeks! I would recommend them to anyone!

My workplace was looking for different lunch options as we are a full service studio and have people on-site who aren't able to leave for lunch. I researched and contacted several food trucks and decided to go with Grill Chasers. Jami, the president, was a pleasure to work with. She sent her menu way ahead of time allowing me to post them around the studio to get my fellow employees excited about the visit. I asked Jami if she could provide special items from her menu and she graciously agreed. 

Unfortunately for me, I had a family emergency on the day Grill Chasers came to the studio, but I know from Jami's phone call that the truck was on time and ready to serve lunch at the appointed time. There were absolutely no complaints about the food. Everyone loved it. No one complained about the prices or the portions. I hear the Bacon Beer Cheese Fries were delicious and the chicken was tender and flavorful. My co-workers also told me that the staff on the truck was super friendly and prepared the food quickly.

A couple of friends actually bought me some food that I was able to eat the next day. I had chicken skewers with the mango salsa. Even reheated it was excellent. Did I mention the mango salsa? Really, really good. There was another sauce, too. I don't know what it was called, but it was also delicious. As mentioned in other reviews, the roti prata pancake was also wonderful. 

I am so looking forward to having Grill Chasers back early next year. I thought Jami was professional, accommodating and friendly.  Can't wait to try the Bacon Beer Cheese Fries and the Baconator for myself!

Where do I begin.... As I was deciding where to consume energy for lunch, my olfactory gland was struck like a bolt of lighting from the fingertips on Zeus himself. My eyes wandering for the source of this pleasant mindblowing scent. There it was, Grill Chasers. Upon reading the menu. Only one item caught my eye. BACONATOR. Holy shit it's good, it's got perfectly cooked chicken that's as juicy as Nikki minaj's ass. It's got bacon all up in that bitch. And chipotle aeoli. I don't even know what aeoli is but it's straight off some food channel shit. You can come to this place and ask for 4 of the pancakes(which is like the tortilla the wraps come in) and not be disappointed. Grill chasers = mouth orgasm

I have had the pleasure of visiting the Grill Chaser three times.  I suggest following them on facebook and you can see when they are coming to a spot near you.

I loved the chicken skewer with the spicy chaser.  The roti is the perfect finish to the meal.  I would love to have them cater a party.  

Great food, friendly people, great price.....yes, yes and yes!!

TRENDSETTER ALERT!! 
we are all quickly becoming aware of the ongoing trend of food trucks. Finally, Chicagoland has decided to delve into the movement. It took me a while to sort through the good and the not so good... but I have come to a conclusion.

Grill chasers just may be the next big thing to move through Chicagoland. The cuisine from this truck is worth the wait. I have never had a more fulfilling experience at a fast food company, let alone a food truck! Grill Chasers has it down to a science. I have had half of their menu thus far, and can honestly say that every choice that I have made was nothing less than perfection.  Great daily specials, friendly  staff, highly regarded chefs, and good prices. If you are a foodie, Follow these guys... No regrets!!

Visited at Glencoe Grand Prix the service was fast and friendly. My wife had the chicken skewers with spicy BBQ she loved it I had the grilled chicken wings with buffalo sauce and the Mac and cheese both were great
Fantastic mac & cheese and wings!  First tried them when they were at Plank Road Tap Room.  Very friendly service as well.  Will keep coming back to this food truck!

First off let me say super friendly staff. Ate there when they were set up at Glencoe Grand Prix and tonight in Evanston. Now let's talk about the good. Wow is all I can say. The Kale cabbage coleslaw, Mac n cheese and the Chicago wrap was super good. Not your average food truck. If you see them set up somewhere, I highly recommend you stop and get a bite! You won't regret it!

I waited outside in the cold and wind nearly freezing my ears off to get a baconator sandwich and some mac & cheese.  OMG was it worth it!  One of the best sandwiches I have ever had!  What a combination of flavors.
Go for the bacon beer cheese fries and buffalo wrap. Can't beat the convenience right outside my office door. Thanks Grill Chasers!

I tried this food truck the other day and thought that the food was good. I had a few different types of sauces on the chicken skewers, and the pancake and slaw that came as sides were also good. Friendly service, also. I'd go back.

I live 10 miles East of the Anvil many times have driven past it. Knowing it was Members only club I never knew at times it is open to non-members. The general area is very quient and I know of one recent 1920 gangster movie used the area for its vintage look.
Being in the area Friday Night I googled it and discovered it at times it is open to non-members we went for brunch on sunday morning. Being the first to arrive (anxious) we were both awed by the charm of the building. Lots of stain glass and wood. I have been a road warrior for seven years and eat out a lot. The table presentation was very nice.
The food was very well presented with bigger than expected portions. Food Quality was very good with the price reasonable. 
We got a visitors pass and look forward to our return trip in a few week.
Remember to read the dress code before you go.

Reading the preponderance of club member reviews, I can only deduce that there is a completely different kitchen staff on those members-only days compared to the days they're open to the public.  Either that, or less care is taken with the food prep for non-members.

Upon arrival, service was attentive and pleasant.  However, even though we (party of 7) were there at 12:30 for Sunday brunch, and the place was mostly empty (e.g. there was just one other party of 4 or 5 in the Saddle Room with us), the food took a VERY long time to arrive.  This was ordering off the limited brunch menu, too, and a limited menu should mean faster food prep.

Once the food did come, nearly all of our party had something missing from their orders.  2 of us ordered the prime rib skillet, and neither got the horseradish sauce side; we both had to ask for it.  One of our party didn't get their asparagus side; they had to ask for it.  2 of us didn't get their potato side; they had to ask for it.  You get the idea.  Small things but LOTS of them give an overall bad impression.

Food was absolutely nothing special.  I ordered the prime rib skillet, potatoes crispy.  The side potatoes were crispy, the potatoes in the skillet were not.  Everyone else's side potatoes were equally crispy to mine, more crispy than they liked (and included burnt pieces).  I ordered my eggs over easy, they were medium.  Someone in our party ordered the filet mignon burger medium well, but it was done well instead and dry.  Another person's burger was done properly, but just nothing special taste-wise.

Frankly, it all seemed like the same quality you'd get from a budget chain place like Denny's.  Crab Benedict was...  OK.  Chicken and waffles were...  OK.  Prime rib skillet was...  OK.  We did have a special request for carrot cake for dessert which they accommodated and it was done very well.  Ultimately, though, we saw no reason to ever go back there again.  

Last thing, and I've never seen this at any restaurant I've been to in my life.  Some of the desserts on the menu had an additional $1 charge if you wanted it "to go."  Huh??  No idea what that's about; maybe that's a fancy dinner club thing?  What if I just ordered it normally, then didn't eat any of it and asked for a to-go box:  would I still have been assessed the $1 charge?  Strangest thing.
Post Otto ownership has changed things  not  for the better.  Inside of Anvil Club shines with the improvement   Now the food needs to shine .

Service was ok. Food was terrible. Manager was extremely rude. Would not come back and would not recommend to others.....
Thanks joe but we were dressed fine and we had no kids. We like I said the service was OK at most the food was terrible my risotto was over cooked / mushy / flavorless . And the manager on duty was extremely rude.

Where do I start with this place--a Yelper's delight. First of all it is a members only club with some evenings and brunch open to the public. We were invited by a member so apparently had access to a private room. We arrived at 630 the given time and this was on  Wednesday night so of course there was not a huge rush. Plenty of parking and a sign that clearly says "members only". I will have to say it did have the feel of an exclusive club and I being a brown person (with an attitude) didn't feel out of place as much as I thought I would--just had to throw that out there--at times it can be a concern. Staff was nice and server--although a bit distracted at times was fine. An array of cheese and crackers was brought to the lovely table where our group was seated and wine was served as well. Good unique selection of cheese- there was a blueberry blue I think and one had what I thought had a praline type of aftertaste. I do not drink alcohol so sorry no wine review from me. Members have their own key to their own wine closet on the premises. Interesting. I'd need a ginger ale locker please. Anyway the lobster bisque followed--buttery and velvety-not too salty. I ordered the special which was swordfish steak and opted for the mash potatoes and primavera veggies. Fortunately I love my onions blackened but I'm sure they weren't supposed to be that way since no one else had them burnt black. Can't remove a star because I enjoyed it but seriously--be consistent.  Swordfish was huge I think like 8 oz very nicely prepared--not fishy or over cooked at all--potatoes were equally delightful. After dinner a big table rolled out and bananas foster were prepared in front of us ...flames and all. AWESOME---here's a term I have not used in a while....foodgasmic! Served over vanilla ice cream as they should be. The best part was the smell of the brown sugar , butter and rum after they caramelized it. One thing the Anvil might want to look at is that the servers empty finished plated onto a tray so nearby you can see piled up dirty plates and a mound of uneaten food. It would be good to do this elsewhere or not in sight given the sexy swanky look of this place. It is a ambiance killer. On the nights and brunch where public is welcome I would encourage people to give it a try---great for a romantic dinner, special occasion and even maybe small groups. Appropriately priced.

They did a marvelous job renovating the space.  Truly beautiful.  Been there twice recently and both times the food has been extremely underwhelming and does not match the beauty of the building. Service the first time was wonderful. The second time it was just ok.

Honestly, this place is probably 2 stars but I feel responsible to skew my rating given the incredibly high ratings from other members. The average members age is well above average yelp user base. Many of them have sentimental values from prolonged membership , or are second gen members, form better times. I'm not sure if that's why the low review count and way too high of the rating. 

Let's say, the membership is not very expensive (and get you into rest of the associated supper clubs!) and newly renovated building is really nice. There are no small children running around... 

Than's about all nice things I have to say.

The few times I have been, general host/staff sounded snobby. Wait staffs were nice, but slow. Food took too long to come out. Chicken was definitely overcooked and medium steak ordered was delivered more well than medium. Most other food items are mediocre at best for the long wait - even with fairly decent presentation. 

Considering the membership commitment to gain access, avoid it. There are vastly superior dining experiences to be had elsewhere. If you are really curious, ask for a guest pass or wait for non-member entry times.

I just read Juice R's rating of the Anvil Club and felt compelled to offer my opinion of the Anvil Club. I have lived in New York City and Chicago for a good deal of my life and have had the pleasure of sampling many fine restaurants. I moved to the Northwest suburbs with a little intrepidation because I was used to great metropolitan restaurants and other than many of chain restaurants, fine dining here can be difficult. My wife and I became members quite by accident and since that time have been constantly happy and amazed at the quality of the food and service at the Anvil Club.  Being one of the "average members" and above the Yelp user base I hope that my age does not preclude my appreciation for fine food or my ability to park my Harley outside the Anvil Club.  The staff and General manager have been cordial and accommodating, The Chefs have credentials that equal or exceed many of the culinary staff in Metropolitan Chicago.  Matt, the head mixologist can direct you to some of the finest scotch I have ever tasted.  In short, this is one of the finest restaurants I have had the pleasure of dining at.  I personally feel that it is great that the membership is inexpensive as it opens a fine dining experience to a variety of clientele to experience the club.  I will conclude by giving the Anvil club high marks on food, service and ambience and as I put away my AARP card am thankful that I didn't have to pay for dinner with my father's credit card.

I've been a member for the last two years.  The food, service and atmosphere have never once disappointed me or my wife.  Excellent!

This is an old establishment with a mature clientele, but I can tell you my 33 yr. old daughter loves it.

My wife and I have been members at the Anvil Club for several years now. We were initially introduced by a client and soon found out we knew other members. After coming several times over a year we joined even though we live about 25 minutes away. Our biggest concern was how ofter we would use it. That hasn't been a problem as we look forward to coming out and don't just reserve it for special occasions. But enough with how we got introduced... 
The service is always fantastic. The wait and bar staff are as good if not better than any of the area Country Clubs I have had the pleasure of visiting. While the food and menu have improved under Michael F.  we have always found it to be very good. Have I been served an overcooked steak, sure but there was no question and it was quickly replaced. The seasonal menu's that that have been introduced have added to the appeal of dining here. Yes I like the old favorites like the Cowboy Ribeye but the Venison Loin with Roast parsnips is sensational as are most of the other seasonal items.  
If you like nice wine and a good cocktail the Anvil Club has one of the best bar selection I have found. It is not hard to find a new single malt to try and if you haven't had a Manhattan ask Carlos to make you one of his Perfect ones with Vya. 
As for the decor, I loved the original dark paneling and stock certificates on the walls in the men's room but I'm slowly getting used to the remodeling that was done last year and especially the update to the patio. 
This Club is not for everyone but it is for us and we will continue to bring our special friends and families who are always impressed.  
PS - they honor reservations and when was the last time you sat at a piano bar after dinner and sang some of your favorite songs with friends?
Member # XOXOXO

My company had our Christmas party here and the food was amazing.  I had the filet which was rich and tender and delightful.  

My wife had the chicken entree and, even though it was being served in a banquet style (10 tables in our room) it was perfectly cooked and juicy.

My wife and I have thought of becoming members here, but she and I dine out 'solo' infrequently  - we have an eight year old who is not allowed at the Anvil except for  Sundays - it wouldn't make sense financially at this point in time.

I am among the most senior members of the Anvil Club. My late father in law was a founding member. I was introduced to the Anvil Club in 1971 by another family and after that initial visit, never forgot the Club for how I was treated and served. I can remember I was bedazzled on the Club's artifacts and decoration. Tiffany glass, from George Pullman's mansion, Bar Face off of the Delta Queen River Boat. Plate Glass Mirror's made in the 19teenth century, Gargoyle's, & Cherub's, Stock Certificates of companies before the Great Depression, everywhere you looked. Waiters, Bartender's, Maitr'd's in Tuxedo's, beautiful oil paintings, wine cellar and in the summer, 5 distinctly separate rooms with their own theme, with the fifth, being under the stars,"the veranda".

Back in the late sixties and early seventies, there were other private steak houses
not far away. They are all gone and only the Anvil Club has survived. If anything that had been achieved because of the Club's ability to identify with family. Never as an individual did I come to this Club, but only as a family, as this organization rest with our families memories. Every album we have at home, has pictures of our entire family at some celebration enjoyed there. There would be Mom, Dad, Brother, Sister, Aunt, Uncle, Cousin & friends. For almost all of these occasions, there were Anvil staff there ready to take the pictures~!

Talk about service~? My wife was a diabetic and was suffering from not enough insulin while at the Club, the assistant Maitre'd at the time "Brian," on a snowing night ran to the pharmacy in town and got a vile of insulin for my wife. We as a family never forgot this incredible act of friendship he displayed~! Never have I or my wife been disappointed with any aspect of the Club.  I am retired now and have moved to Texas, but I still have my Anvil Membership and will always have it to use when I am, back in town. And when I am, I take my best friends' there to enjoy and say hello to all the servers and bartenders, I have come to know over the years. Yes we are on a "first name" basis~! God Bless this organization, The Anvil Club.
James D. Brome

We had a business lunch there this month and everything was top notch. Service was amazing, steak was perfect, and loved the buttery sauce it was served with. This place has so much history - and the renovations are coming along nicely. Can't wait for it to be finished. My only beef is the cocktails were pretty pricey. I think it was $11 for my Absolut and soda... I realize it's a private club and folks that can afford to be members probably don't blink at that, but I did. Food and service made up for it, though, so, 5 stars.

That man's a nut. I'm 24 years old and I think the Anvil Club is awesome. It's called ambience and HISTORY, Jeremy O. 

My family and friends have come here for special occasions for years now, and I've always loved the uniqueness of this dinner club. And as with most nice dinner spots, the lighting is dim, yes... it's romantic and usually calls for a lower noise volume, which is nice. Stop and have a drink first in the bar. It's really coolly decorated with antiques, and there is always someone on the piano. I should also mention that popcorn is served with your cocktails! The veranda is also very pretty for cocktails and appetizers in nice weather. The menu is good, standard with your normal meat, fish, surf-n-turf options... the filet is to die for. No joke. My sister and I always look forward to dining here with our parents and close friends.

What can I say.  I went here with great expectation only to be severely disapponted.  Creepy old and dark.  The clientel is on their last leg so I am not sure how much longer this "Supper Club" will be around.

Overpriced and really the food was not that good.  Save your cash and go elsewhere.

They have had their ups and downs over the last 10 years, but lately they have been getting it right thanks to new GM Michael Formichella, CMC, and new exec chef Eric Feldbusch. Now more than your father's "steakhouse," the Club also gets into the avante-garde with new proteins, foams and presentations. One can also have foie gras or sweetbreads if one desires. 

Last Friday evening we arrived and the bartender had begun making our cocktails as soon as we walked in the room. Popcorn is almost always perfect but on occasion arrives stale. Moving to the dining room we put ourselves in Chef's hands, we had no idea what he planned to prepare for us. Out came a trio of amuse bouche- pulled pork with pickle, smoked salmon with citrus creme and a barbecued chicken crostini- all excellent. Our appetizer was a seared scallop atop corn risotto with chive blossoms and corn shoots...heavenly; and a lovely presentation. Entrees were prime porterhouse steaks with foie topper, goat cheese potato croquettes and a vegetable medley. The steak was perfectly cooked and the croquettes were spectacular...I suggested he add a small plate option of these with crumbled goat cheese and Bordelais sauce as a spin on poutine- they were that good. The vegetables were cooked, but had texture- not at all mushy. We ended with a rich chocolate mousse. A terrific meal, start to finish.

Service is, as usual, excellent- friendly and attentive yet not overbearing. We were provided clean stems with each new wine. We will be going back this weekend for Chef's sweetbreads. 

The menu is a bit pricey, yes, but there are nightly specials so one does not need to break the bank to dine here. They have also relaxed the dress code and the age policies to accommodate present times. The new spring/summer menu will be unveiled tomorrow, and I for one cannot wait to see it. In the end, for what you spend here, you get good value. They have also repainted some rooms, put in new carpets and made other improvements, so it is not as dark, dingy or musty as it once was.

If you want to take your mate on a cozy romantic dinner this is the place to go. The service has always been good and the steaks - char-crusted, are the best. I have not managed to try any other dish because the steak is just so darn good!

It's pricey but look around on the outside and especially on the inside and you know you'll be paying. But far less then any steak place in Schaumburg or Chicago - and in our opinion none of those clowns have a shot at the Anvil Club.

A side note... Our friends went with us here and apparently did not want to impose on us so they called up too see if they could dine there just this past Chistmas Eve. Despite being a private club the owner went out of their way to find them an early hour table. That is what sales and service is about - good on them!
great food tonight

Coming from a family that raises beef cattle I tend to be a bit pickier when it comes to my meats but I was very much impressed with the quality at the Anvil Club.  In additional to the flavorful food, the club tells a story in every room and on every wall.  The rich history, live music and ambience make a night out more of an experience than just a dinner.  I look forward to going back in the warm weather and dining on the outside patio.
this is my 2 time at sliver lake the food is so good we will be back agin the egg drop soup is the best to

Ordered takeout several times after my 1st review of this place. Wow, what a difference a few years makes. Today will be the last time I ever order from here again. Food is constantly cold, bland, and when you go in to pick it up I have yet to be told thank you even after I say it to them?!?  
Never again, bye bye silver lake!

WORST PLACE EVER! DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY AT THIS RESTAURANT! IF I COULD GIVE THIS PLACE 0 STARS I WOULD! I payed with my credit card over the phone for a delivery purchase- when the driver arrived he claimed they never had my credit card information and i needed to pay cash- after then pulling up my credit card statement and realizing they DID charge my account for THREE TIMES what the original amount totaled i told them i absolutely am not giving them anymore information as my account was already charged. I spoke with the manager and he said he then wants his food back, which i had no problem doing since i refuse to eat at a restaurant with service like this. He said it was a pending transaction and i will not be charged. Well.. i received my credit card statement and low and behold i was charged! Not only was i charged triple the amount, i never got the food, nor did i give them authorization to charge my account (no signature no nothing). After speaking to the GM today he gave me nothing but attitude and claimed they did not charge me (despite it showing on my card) and that i can dispute the charge if i want. They also said they are not threatened by me and do whatever i need to do. I will post on every website to get people to stop going to this restaurant! WHATEVER YOU DO.. DO NOT GO TO THIS RESTAURANT! I

Wow, they r going 2 new levels 2 stick people. Ordered dinner for 3 delivered not the same portion as eating in.,the large order of kung pao beef was soggy overcooked Veges and 5 pieces of beef. We counted them. All the other food was about the same.
Very dissapointing. $50+ dollars waisted.

Our office orders from here regularly and they don't disappoint. Staff is always super friendly and we always have a good time when we sit in for lunch. The reason I'm giving 4 stars instead of 5, is because when we ordered take out everything was amazing and huge portions. When we sat in the portions were just a tad smaller, it wasn't a huge difference but noticeable. Otherwise awesome place to get Chinese food in south Elgin.

I don't know what happened to this restaurant,  they used to be somewhat decent. The last couple times qe have ordered from here the food has not been good. We ordered some general taos chicken yesterday and it tasted fishy like they were using one oil to fry everything. I couldn't take more than one bite.

Food is gross!!! My dog food looks & probably tastes better than this food.  We decided to order delivery, and they were very timely and accurate with order...that was the only thing pleasant about our experience! The crab Rangoon was dried out and the cheese was a powder consistency and chewy.  We also hand the General Tso's Chicken, and I couldn't find the chicken; it was basically fried chewy, mushy batter.  We also tried the Kong Pou beef, and my fianc̩ nearly choked on the beef since it was so tough and flavorless. Needless to say we tossed out the entire meal, and will never go back. It was inedible!!! Don't bother with this place!

Been going there for years. The staff is always friendly however the food is not what it used to be. The egg rolls were burnt last time and the beef and rice was not good at all. I keep going back thinking it was an off night, but each time I go back it still not good.  Very disappointed.

We ordered here and haven't really had too many bad issues until tonight.....

I ordered online, got an email confirmation...
And then the scary guy arrives asking for money??  You billed my debit card and then want cash beyond our tip??

Do NOT order from these jokers.  Once we paid double our order, the appetizers were so burnt they smelled like ash....

And worse??? I ordered chicken fried rice.....I got tofu!!

Run as fast as you can.
First visit . Staff friendly menu was small just a lunch menu. But food was great ! Loved the egg rolls . Will definitely go back again :)

I really don't expect much out of Chinese food--my husband likes it. In my opinion it's marginal at best, but this was far more bland than any other Chinese food I've had. It was quite expensive, and I didn't get the big portions that I would somewhere else. I would not try this place again. We ordered the Mongolian Beef, Orange Chicken, and egg rolls (worst ever).

We have been anxious to find a new Chinese take-out place since Chinese Express in South Elgin converted to Green Mango and went downhill. I have heard mixed things about Silver Lake but we tried it one night. I was pleasantly surprised. My daughter really liked the chicken lo mein (this is what she orders everywhere we go). I didn't think the orange chicken had enough orange flavor but she liked it. And the sweet and sour chicken was good (this is the one item hard to screw up). The won ton soup was very good. We tried it a second time because she wanted to cater Chinese for her 18th birthday. Again, it did not disappoint although I would say the portions are smaller than I am used to. My husband loved the Mongolian beef, egg rolls were really good, chicken fried rice was a little greasy but had a good flavor. So, we catered for her party. The pricing was very reasonable compared to other Chinese places in the area. They were also very accommodating and let us substitute lo mein for fried rice in our catering package. They included plates, forks, napkins, chopsticks, tons of extra sauces,etc. which I was not expecting. We also had the orange chicken, Mongolian Beef, Cashew Chicken, egg rolls. They included a large tray of white rice. My guests really enjoyed it and we were happy! Maybe the other Silver Lake locations are different due the chef but give this one a try! They also seemed to appreciate the business and gave me 5% off the catering order as they have a coupon circulating right now for that.
We used to be a consistent customer of this restaurant, but after several consistently bad meals we will no longer be a customer at all.  This place has really fallen through the floor on quality.

This review is for delivery only, we have ordered multiple times but have never eaten in the restaurant itself.

Ordering delivery from Silver Lake is easy- you can call or place your order online (which I personally love since it is so quick). Delivery has always been very speedy- typically 10 minutes faster than they state, which is really nice. They often offer discounts for ordering online as well.

Portions are very generous, we can often eat Chinese food for days after ordering from here. I love their crab puffs, chicken fried rice, and sweet and sour chicken. My husband loves some of their spicier dishes (which I do not eat). We will definitely continue to order from them in the future- oh and food is always super hot when it gets to our house- a definite plus.

We ordered carry-out. The food was really good! The meat quality was great. We ordered fried rice, beef with snow peas, and general tzaus (sp?) chicken. I thought that the portion vs. price for the beef with snow peas kinda sucked. I ordered a small and it was SMALL but only a couple of dollars less than the large. We got a large on the chicken and it was good. The chicken itself was huge; definitely not bite sized. Idk why I didn't like that but really it's personal preference and nothing against the restaurant.

I used to order from here when I lived at my parents house back in 2004 when I was in highschool. Always loved the food and service (always take out or delivery).  The food was always amazing and had a better taste than those fast food asian cuisines such as panda express. So now its 2015 and I've moved back to STC and have ordered delivery from there 3 times now on their website (which is super cool by the way) and have been 100% satisfied on both service and food quality each time. Even their delivery drivers are respectful and keep customer service in mind. I could not recommend a better place than here.  I wish I could give 6 stars but im sure you get my point. The only down fall (and its my fault) is its is after 10 and Im craving some amazing food! Haha looks like lunch tomorrow will be silver lake! :)

UPDATE: 8/15/2014
After yet another dissapointting order tonight I have to lower my rating. The food I ordered had no flavor but usually is the only thing on the menu that does lately. Everything is just drowned in a brown garlic sauce of some kind, maybe some pepper thrown at it. I'm over it. Stay away, this isn't the Silver Lake you grew up with.

Original:
Just OK. Their food if pretty good in the appetizer department, usually consistent in quality and delivery. My issue with the restaurant is that the quality of food you get seems to depend on who's cooking that night. Sometimes I get nice, crispy chicken in my food, sometimes it's mushy, almost a reheated quality about it. Don't hate it, but I don't flock here for good food anymore. 

Since opening more stores, the overall quality of the Silver Lake Restaurants has been steadily falling.
Updated

I had a sizzling garlic beef & chicken kow (sp?). I found the food to be very bland.
At least the service was decent.

This place would be perfect for someone that doesn't have tastebuds. The food has no flavor. I got a curry chicken, the description said, chicken in a curry sauce with potatoes. They threw french fries in the dish. Come on! Really? This place is a joke. Will never come back here!

My biggest pet peeve is a restaurant that half-asses their food. They clearly don't care about the food they're making, because it has no flavor. To have thrown french fries in a dish just shows laziness. They don't want to take the time to create a pleasant dish for the customer to enjoy. 

There were only two other people in the restaurant besides myself and my husband. Guess that should've been a sign this place has crappy food.

Just no.
We have ordered from here for a while but no more.
I ordered online. I was given "chicken" fried rice.  The order and confirmation reported beef, what we wanted.  When I opened up the "chicken" fried rice it was full of these tiny diced mushy clay colored cubes.  We called to let them know there was a mistake, that's when we were told it was chicken. It was gross.  They replaced the order, which was fine, except there was maybe a tablespoon of beef mixed into 2 cups of tasteless brown rice.  My Kung pao shrimp had a thin sauce, 7 or 8 shrimp and lots of green pepper, even tho the description included bok choi, there wasn't any.
  The last order I had was general tso chicken, which was mostly breading and stringy dark meat "chicken"
  The crab ran goons are mostly sugar and cream cheese in a wonton wrapper, not yummy .
  I'm done with you Silver Lake.  Your food has gone from mediocre at best to simply garbage.  I can buy frozen P.F. Changs and it would be better.
When you order a small portion they give a small rice...when you order a large portion they only give a small rice and you must purchase another small rice to have enough for the large order.

A modest and decent Chinese place to dine in Elgin. Which is worth a mention because Chinese food sucks in Elgin lol. 

Atmosphere:
Place looks like it is always closed from the outside lol. Don't be fooled! The interior is rather pleasant actually. They carefully pick out their neat decorations, but everything including the lighting is easy on the eyes. Silverware, dishes, etc. aren't the cleanest. It bothered me.

Service:
Been here twice and it always feels like I am being rushed. What is the hurry! This place is never that busy anyway. The service could use better manners and have a hint of friendliness. Also felt that our drinks were rarely refilled. 

Food:
Their price to quality ratio is a bit high in terms of Chinese food. I wouldn't consider the quality high or the portions generous. I would consider the food just slightly above average in quality. Nothing really stuck out either. Maybe I will try more items next time, but only because it is nearby work. 

It was an average experience. I probably won't dine here unless other people wanted to for convenience. Elgin is pretty weak sauce when it comes to the Chinese department though. So I would recommend this as a go to for most of the Elgin population until I find something better.

This is the first chinese place we've ordered from, since moving to this area. We thought it was great. I love the online ordering, 10% discount  was nice too. Food arrived hot. The spicy shrimp with cashews was my favorite. I didn't give it 5 stars because it is a little pricey. The portions were big though. Plenty of leftovers. I would definitely recommend this place to try.

Came here today for lunch. I had the worst egg roll that I have ever had in my life it was like it was filled with cinnamon spiced dog food. I had the Mongolian beef and it was flavorless with gristly crunchy beef with an awful sauce and Mexican rice too.  I think the thing that makes me upset about all these asian restaurants around here is the use of "Mexican" rice vs "Asian" rice.  Idk I guess I gave it two stars due to cost(you get what you pay for) and speed. To follow up. I eat at a ton of different "Asian" restaurants and I have noticed that at all the good restaurants, the workers come out and sit at the tables to eat the food they cook. Here the workers went out and came back with Portillos to eat. Says a lot for their confidence in the food.   Go down the road to Thai Town for better food and better atmosphere. Sorry guys.

I ordered food for myself and my 3yr old this Friday night. Their food can be hit or miss, i have been a fairly regular customer for 3 or 4 years. after two hours of waiting i checked my card and saw i was being billed for the food i called and was told that (even though i paid a delivery fee and put in the notes please send a pair of chop sticks) it was my fault the order was marked pickup and if i would like to pay a delivery fee they could send it out. i said if its been ready for the last hour and a half, how come no one called when it wasn't picked up. For that matter it was already 830 and i had already had dinner and put my child to bed. i was then told to bad not our fault. i said fine i guess after the 3 or 4 years of ordering i guess this will be my last order. i was then told by the manager and i quote " fine you no like our food you no have to eat ever again. Worst customer service ive experienced.

In general I like the food here. I order take out frequently. But I must hope that Chef Brian reads yelp because apparently his staff is not passing along comments, or, he is ignoring them. 

1) I HATE the idea that you serve a smaller portions to people who eat in your restaurant, as opposed to those who order take out. and.... I don't mean make your take out portions smaller.
2) The new chicken pad Thai is awful! I love pad Thai, and this taste nothing like any pad Thai I have had before. Want to check a good pad Thai Brian? go to White Pearl and try theirs. Authentic and awesome.
3) I have only ordered take out because I felt that the 1 long term waiter is unfriendly and arrogant. Not going to go into a lot of detail because it has been years since I ate in, but this waiter who is still their propelled me away from your restaurant.

But the positive  again, the food is very good, except the new pad thai which I am sure they will fix.

Friendly place with with great service. One drawback, the chicken doesn't taste like chicken! When I pointed that fact out to the server, I actually said 'this isn't chicken', he just said "okay, would you like something else?". No denial as one would expect, just "okay..."

I think not! 
So I ordered delivery for my business and when I opened my bag they did not leave me any utensils....and I ordered soup....how are you suppose to eat soup without a spoon? 
Also ordered crab rangoon, potstickers, fried rice.....there rangoons didn't have barely any crab in it and we're cold. The potstickers were greasy and just bad, the fried rice was burnt and looked old and tasted worse.

I called them to let them know I did not receive any utensils to eat my soup and the girl on the phone said, "we don't give napkins or utensils to delivery customers because they normally can supply that on there own." 
Rude. 
It's a delivery, you should always supply utensils and napkins.

Really good egg rolls
Weird texture on the Mongolian Beef
Really good General Tao's Chicken

Fast delivery!

I ordered delivery. The food came relatively quickly and was piping hot. My father ate sesame chicken. I ordered the Chicken Pad Thai. I was not overly impressed with my dish. It did not taste like any Pad Thai that I have had in the past at all. I would not recommend it. The sesame chicken wasn't great, but it was not bad either. The highlight of our experience was the eggrolls and the the wonton soup. Both were definite hits. I would recommend those two items from Silver Lake to anyone.

What's the first thing you do when you move to a new town?  Look for good pizza and Chinese food, that's what.

We haven't found the pizza yet, but Silver Lake is pretty good Chinese and is close to our home.  My wife and I have done eat-in and take out and the portions are huge and the quality good.  It's not the best Chinese I have ever had, but in the area it is number 1.

The service for dine-in is pretty good.  The food seems like it takes a long time to arrive and you can only read your Chinese horoscope so many times before you want to pull out your own teeth in boredom, but it is good and plenty to eat.

Take-out is probably your best option here.  Call ahead or order online and go pick it up.  They did get our order wrong one time but once and a while this happens.

Summary: Things are best left simplest. (Who adds bell pepper, and green onion to orange chicken((seriously))

I won't be ordering here again. I decided to give it a second chance, and I once again was not impressed. We had ordered delivery, and gotten egg rolls, orange chicken, sweet & sour chicken, Beef with broccoli, and a house fried rice. We like to order a variety of things before we judge a place. 

First off, the egg rolls, the first time I tried these they were good. This time, they were incredibly salty. Secondly, the orange chicken, extremely disappointing.. Did not have a Orange flavor at all, its served with bell pepper, broccoli, and green onion in a dark sauce and tasted either burnt or like sesame oil.

The sweet & Sour chicken, there's no way you can mess that up unless you burn it or under cook it. The sauce it comes with has pieces of pineapple and bell pepper((again)). 

I tried the beef and broccoli, my bf stated that it tasted fishy, but i'm not entirely certain i felt the same way, though it was not tasty enough to want to eat it. 

The house fried rice was not a big let down, it was decent.

I am not a huge fan of Chinese restaurants these days. I think I burned out on them a few years ago when we went to them often. But when my niece and nephew recently expressed their desire to have Chinese food when I was visiting my hometown for family business, we chose Silver Lake Chinese Restaurant on the recommendation of my mother's friend. 

I didn't have high expectations for Silver Lake Chinese Restaurant. It was located on a busy highway, in a strip mall, in a far-west suburb of Chicago. I anticipated large quantities of mediocre, salty, MSG laden food.

I was wrong...

I always order hot and sour soup in a Chinese restaurant. If it is good, I know my meal will be good, as well. If it is bad -- then I know I'm in for a mediocre meal. The best (and first) hot and sour soup I ever had was at Jimmy Tsang's in Pittsburgh in the early 1980's. I've been looking for hot and sour soup near that quality ever since.

So, after ordering plum wine (I actually requested red wine but the waiter misunderstood me and brought me plum wine (which was actually delicious -- kind of like apple cider and Amaretto) I ordered hot and sour soup, spring rolls and steamed dumplings (pot stickers), knowing a full meal was too much for me. (and knowing I could taste the food ordered by others)

The rest of the table ordered General Tao Chicken, orange flavored beef, orange flavored chicken, and empress chicken. At the last minute we also ordered a fried rice side. Each order was spiced according to the wishes of the orderer from mild to very hot. The waiter asked many questions in order to get the heat level right for the person ordering.

My hot and sour soup was amazing. Almost as good as Jimmy Tsang's. It was a trifle too salty, but perfect in every other way. 

The rest of the meal was also delicious. All of the dishes were very good. We realized we'd ordered far too much food when the waiter put the first plate on our table. We all gorged ourselves and had leftovers for two days. 

The service was attentive (there were not very many other customers in the restaurant that night) and fun. He joked with the kids and winked at me (thinking they were my children, I think). 

The only complaint I have is that I ordered tea and was given a tea bag of black tea. I saw containers of green tea behind the counter, and was expecting that. 

I highly recommend this restaurant and will probably go back when I'm in Elgin again. It rekindled my fondness for Chinese food -- I'll have to find a good one in Bethesda.

Went here on a Saturday night and was disappointed.  They were short staffed on servers so the attentiveness was lacking considerably and they screwed up our order.  Plus the shrimp was smaller than what we got in the past *and* it was slightly overcooked.  The kicker was that the manager didn't seem to care.  He just sat at a table with some people he knew and let the poor service take place.  It will be a while before we even think about visiting again.

This place is always great.  I was looking for a great, local Chinese place once I moved out to the Elgin area.  We tried a few places but were always very disappointed.  But then we found this gem...it's always great!  When we've dined it the service has always been great and helpful.  We have also done take-out as well.  This is the best Chinese food we've found in the area.  Great quality, not greasy, always great portions as well.  I also like how they ask for the heat level of the food so it's not too spicy (or to make it more if that's what you like!).  Yum!

Went back. Ordered a Singapore Rice Noodle w/extra curry: for those not familiar, it's a dry, curry flavored noodle dish made of very thin rice noodles, like vermicelli, bits of fried egg, bbq pork, tiny shrimp, slivers of onion and green pepper. This was competently executed as if I was back in Chinatown. But $11 for a large portion, which is a plastic container about 2-4 cups size, what would normally go for $9 around here. May try other things.

Great food at a reasonable price.
Service quick and friendly, not to fussy.
This is a place that you go back to time and time again.

Location: Looks small from the outside but surprised of the actual dining area. Very clean and always a great vide with good employees.

Food: Best chinese food i have had in elgin by far.  Love the Chow Fun Beef - you dont find this everywhere.
Taste and portions are great and prices are avg to most other places.

The only chinese place better than this is Yu's in Schaumburg

Just no.

When I opened up the "chicken" fried rice it was full of these tiny diced mushy clay colored cubes.  We called to let them know there was a mistake, that's when we were told it was chicken. It was gross.  They replaced the order, which was fine, except there was maybe a tablespoon of beef mixed into 2 cups of tasteless brown rice.  My Kung pao shrimp had a thin sauce, 7 or 8 shrimp and lots of green pepper, even tho the description included bok choi, there wasn't any.
  The last order I had was general tso chicken, which was mostly breading and stringy dark meat "chicken"
  The crab ran goons are mostly sugar and cream cheese in a wonton wrapper, not yummy .
  I'm done with you Silver Lake.  Your food has gone from mediocre at best to simply garbage.  I can buy frozen P.F. Changs and it would be better.

The highlight of our experience was the eggrolls and the the wonton soup. Both were definite hits. I would recommend those two items from Silver Lake to anyone.

What's the first thing you do when you move to a new town?  Look for good pizza and Chinese food, that's what.

We haven't found the pizza yet, but Silver Lake is pretty good Chinese and is close to our home.  My wife and I have done eat-in and take out and the portions are huge and the quality good.  It's not the best Chinese I have ever had, but in the area it is number 1.

This is a place that you go back to time and time again.

Location: Looks small from the outside but surprised of the actual dining area. Very clean and always a great vide with good employees.

Food: Best chinese food i have had in elgin by far.  Love the Chow Fun Beef - you dont find this everywhere.
Taste and portions are great and prices are avg to most other places.
