iI love Silver Lake! I worked here when it first opened as a hostess and became friends with everyone.  I am still friends with everybody to this day going on for 9 years. I have lived in 2 other states and I always come back to Silver Lake. Nothing has ever compared and they will have my business for a lifetime! The empress chicken is to die for as well as Mao pao spicy tofu! Leon and Cesar are amazing! The lunch is an awesome deal as well!
My husband and I are new to the area and have tried a couple different Chinese restaurants. This one has been the best. Great sweet and sour chicken. The sesame chicken was really great also.
the location in st charles is where i usually go and the food seems better there than at this location.  egg foo young was odd tasting and the shrimp was on the top instead of cooked in the patty.

Ordered for years and have noticed a decline in the food quality. Heard they possibly freeze and re heat portions. General Tao chicken was horrible and had to throw out. have optioned for other restaurant that have a more fresh taste
The food was very good. Im a snob for fried rice and egg rolls, and theirs passed the test. We ordered the small portions and still had plenty to take home! We will definately be returning.
I used to love this place - still pretty good egg rolls, but the last 2 times i went there I took home multiple containers of warm glop.
I'd go back. It's a little more upscale than your run of the mill Chinese restaurant around town. Portions are ridiculous, you will always go home with food.

I have ordered here from the past and have had great service......Lately it seems as though service and quality is on a downward spiral. I ordered online and selected a future time and order was delivered almost 20 minutes after i ordered it. When i called and told them order was 45 minutes early and my wife wasn't even home yet I was told to stick it my oven to keep it warm. If i had know this I wouldn't have ordered it. Sweet and Sour Chicken was overcooked and Crab Rangoon's where greasy. This food used to be great I don't know what happened. I regretfully will be looking for a new Chinese restaurant

I love this place for Chinese!  I almost always get the Beef Chow Fun and it's great.  The people here are really nice too, always polite and quick.  It's a pretty little place also, very nice decor.  Now I'm getting a craving just thinking about it, might have to go tonight.
I really like the Silver Lake.  I truly enjoy the orange beef, not terribly authentic but very tasty.  They also have a nice spicy hot and sour soup.   The Chef's specialties are their better dishes.
My husband and I are new to the area and have tried a couple different Chinese restaurants. This one has been the best. Great sweet and sour chicken. The sesame chicken was really great also.
the location in st charles is where i usually go and the food seems better there than at this location.  egg foo young was odd tasting and the shrimp was on the top instead of cooked in the patty.

Ordered for years and have noticed a decline in the food quality. Heard they possibly freeze and re heat portions. General Tao chicken was horrible and had to throw out. have optioned for other restaurant that have a more fresh taste
The food was very good. Im a snob for fried rice and egg rolls, and theirs passed the test. We ordered the small portions and still had plenty to take home! We will definately be returning.
I used to love this place - still pretty good egg rolls, but the last 2 times i went there I took home multiple containers of warm glop.
I'd go back. It's a little more upscale than your run of the mill Chinese restaurant around town. Portions are ridiculous, you will always go home with food.

I have ordered here from the past and have had great service......Lately it seems as though service and quality is on a downward spiral. I ordered online and selected a future time and order was delivered almost 20 minutes after i ordered it. When i called and told them order was 45 minutes early and my wife wasn't even home yet I was told to stick it my oven to keep it warm. If i had know this I wouldn't have ordered it. Sweet and Sour Chicken was overcooked and Crab Rangoon's where greasy. This food used to be great I don't know what happened. I regretfully will be looking for a new Chinese restaurant

I love this place for Chinese!  I almost always get the Beef Chow Fun and it's great.  The people here are really nice too, always polite and quick.  It's a pretty little place also, very nice decor.  Now I'm getting a craving just thinking about it, might have to go tonight.
I really like the Silver Lake.  I truly enjoy the orange beef, not terribly authentic but very tasty.  They also have a nice spicy hot and sour soup.   The Chef's specialties are their better dishes.

This is my favorite breakfast place in the area, hands down. Everything on their menu is amazing, it comes out of the kitchen fast, and the servers are super friendly!

The only thing that would make this better is if they had espresso drinks. Please make that happen, Jelly Cafe. I believe in you!

The beignets were not the elephant ear powdered sugar fluffiness I was expecting reminiscent of Cafe Du Monde (sad face). These beignets were more like a sugared donut hole, but they were good.

The bennie (eggs benedict) were good. I really loved the smokiness that the Canadian bacon had. I wasn't a fan of the hollaindaise sauce. The potatoes were good. More boiled than fried so I'm pretty sure they were healthier than normal breakfast potatoes. 

The service was friendly and fast for being a Saturday morning. If I were to be in the area again I'd stop by.

My fianc̩ and I have been coming here for about 3 years now and this place has NEVER disappointed us. The food is great and the service is even better. 

While we've been happy with any server there, Rosa is our absolute favorite. She always remembers us when we come in. She's very personable and attentive. 

My fianc̩ loves their Florentine Bennie. She says it's the best hollandaise sauce she's ever had. My favorite is their Jelly Club sandwich. The bacon is always cooked perfectly and the homemade pine nut pesto mayo is amazing. 

I'm sorry I don't have a picture to show you guys, but as soon as my plate comes it's gone pretty quickly. 

If you're looking for a new brunch spot than I highly recommend the Jelly Caf̩.

Still drooling over my banana bread French toast. It was basically like eating dessert for breakfast, but that's fine by me! I mean, there was a sliced banana on top, so that's one point in the healthy column...right?

At 11 am on a Thursday morning Jelly Cafe was pretty empty. Our waitress was prompt and friendly and our food came out really fast. My decaf coffee was always full and and hot and waters were full.

Their menu has so many things that sounded delicious, but the banana bread french toast definitely caught my eye, and here's why...

4 slices of banana bread. I repeat... Four. Slices. Topped with chocolate chips, sliced bananas, some sort of cream frosting, and powdered sugar. So freakin' good! Mind you, it's extremely filling and super sweet so despite how much I enjoyed it I was only able to eat about half of it. It reheated nicely as leftovers though! With all this sweetness I was glad I got a side of bacon to even things out. The bacon was thick-cut and very good - the perfect addition to French toast.

Great spot for breakfast or brunch! Keep in mind they close at 3 pm :)

I'm pretty upset I pass this cafe a few times a month and never stopped in - what a cute place!
After bookmarking, browsing and drooling over the photos of Jelly Cafe dishes on Yelp, I decided to give this place a try with Jacqueline B. for breakfast. 

Upon entering, I was greeted sweetly by multiple waitresses and was seated right away at a booth near the door. I have never been called "babe" so many times by women! The employees seemed appreciative and sweet to their customers. My coffee and water was served right away and I was excited to check the place out.

I'm not sure if it's just a newer concept or if it's a bit of an eyesore to me but I couldn't help but notice the open ceiling. I've noticed places acquiring the open ceiling look more and more but I'm not sure how I feel about it. The place is bubbly, colorful and happy so for some reason the industrial, hardware look on the ceiling didn't mesh well with the rest of the decor. This wasn't anything to be taken seriously or a reason to be given less stars, it was merely a first thought.

After browsing the yummy options in the menu, I decided on the Almond Berry French Toast...mostly because I had seen a few photos from fellow Yelpers who had gotten this picturesque dish and I had to get it for myself (and take my own pictures of course). One thing I must say is, HOW PERFECT. This was the prettiest french toast I had ever eaten! The toast itself was covered in tiny almond slivers which gave it a satisfying nutty flavor and crunch, they were so perfectly yellow and yet still soft and pillowy! And yes, I am still talking about the toast! Aside from the nuts, there was powdered sugar and vibrant strawberries and blueberries on the toast and plate as well - excellent photo op. The waitress came by often enough to get us re-fills on coffee, make sure we're doing alright, etc. 

Overall, I'd love to come back here because of it's convenient location to me and these dishes that come out of the kitchen are beautiful AND delicious!

Note: When they say it's a "breakfast & brunch" cafe, they mean it. Jelly Cafe closes at 3pm for the day so make it here early :)

My favorite breakfast place.   The skillets, eggs over easy are the best around,  end stop.   With so many places to choose from in Schaumburg we occasionally wander, but always end up coming back. 
Is the little things, good service,  put of coffee at the table,  nice atmosphere, and food can't be beat.

This is one of our favorite breakfast places in the suburbs!! They have a great menu with plenty of options but what keeps us coming back week after week is their specials! This week we both ordered off the special menu. I had the superfood omelet - kale, Sundried tomato and goat cheese in egg white omelette - delicious. My husband for the pecan roll French toast topped with peaches. We haven't had a meal we didn't like here and their jelly is delicious!! Would definitely recommend stopping here if you've never been!

Not overly impressed with the food, but the service was awesome. Friendly and efficient waitress. Therein lie the stars.

My scrambled eggs were overcooked and dry. The corned beef hash was mediocre. My wife was underwhelmed with her omelet.

The restaurant draws a good crowd. Maybe we ordered the wrong items...but eggs? If you can't get eggs right, well...you know.

And with the crowd comes the noise, and the restaurant does get loud. 

I suppose if you're in the neighborhood and craving breakfast, Jelly Cafe might be alright.

But with Katie's Kitchen, Egg Harbor Cafe, and a few other places in the area, you could do much better.

I cannot say enough great things about this place!! Food, server, atmosphere were all amazing! We had this latina server that was sooooo great! Her personality was awesome and she had such a great personality.  The food is beyomd great! We loved everything we ordered!

If there's any restaurant that'll get your husband singing Destiny's Child ("I don't think you're ready for this jelly!") on the whole car ride over, it's gotta be this one.

We were ready for this jelly and had a late Saturday brunch here.  Menu offers plentiful breakfasty options like pancakes, crepes, and various egg dishes all day, in addition to lunch-type stuff like sandwiches and wraps.  I tried the huevos rancheros, which was a hearty serving of chorizo, beans, and melted cheese on a crispy tortilla and 2 eggs prepared your way. I thought it was a little heavy handed on the salsa though, and the cubed potatoes were a bit wet. 

A pot roast skillet was enjoyed by the husband, although we both thought the corned beef hash was a swing and a whiff.  CBH had a lack of potatoes, the beef was stringy and kind of crispy... but we didn't care for it.  A-OK service.

food is consistently good.   Service hit or miss.

Try the mango or pina colada smoothie.  VERRY GOOD

Tried for first time with coupon.   Nothing out of the ordinary menuwise.  Got the Works skillet, bacon was the prepackaged chewy type.  Same bacon in wife's omlet, a disappoint.   Service was good.  They leave a pot of coffee at the table.   Very LOUD!!  They need to at least install some hanging baffles to bring it down,  84db on the app.  Air ducts were dripping sweat.  Will not be back.
Mother's Day Report: THIS PLACED ROCKED MY WIFE! They really made me look good and all I had to do was pay them.

Not sure why took me so long after moving here, to get here for breakfast. First of all, The interior is modern and very clean. A flower in a pretty little vase at our table, big glasses of ice cold water AND  our own little carafe of coffee. Score.
My fiance and I tried the eggs and corn beef and hash. My first time trying corned beef and hash..and it was great. Little to no salt which is a definite plus. The eggs were done perfectly and the potatoes are red skinned..yes! And the homemade jelly they provide?? Ridiculously good. We will definitely be back. 
The interior, service (our waitress was super friendly and provided great service), and freshly made, great food..will bring me back.

I've been here many times before and the food always been great. I love the atmosphere where I feel like I'm welcome and appreciated there.

All of the severs are nice and service is fast and efficient. The morning of 7/9/16 I had the banana walnut waffle with their own jelly and some butter. I gotta say Awesome! The waffle was made to perfection. With the fresh butter and home made Jelly, it makes the dish delicious.

Yesterday morning I had the breakfast quesadillas. I like having my eggs, bacon, and cheese in a different way. The salsa they give you with the food was really fresh with a kick of spice. The potatoes was cook well. I had a strawberry/mango smoothie and it was very refreshing.

We are in town for a wedding and thought we would give this little place a try based on the reviews. We were not disappointed. The staff was friendly and service was great! The food made our stomachs happy! My kids loved it as well.

Great choice for breakfast! 
We were seated right away and service was super fast! Chicken fajita omelette was AWESOME! 
We visited during the week. I imagine it fills up quickly on the weekends.

My wife and I's favorite place to eat  breakfast. Food always great 
Coffee dam good too.
Great food, friendly service! While enjoying our meal, I'm trying to justify some kind of trip back here...we live in CA. Ha!

A GREAT addition to the breakfast lunch spots in the burbs compared to a lot of sub standard crap out there. We've been coming here since they opened and it's worth the drive. 

The regular menu has a lot of good choices on it and the weekly specials just make it even better. They really show creative and tasty options and should cover whatever mood your in!!
Great food and service. Will be going back! Service was great, good food and reasonable prices. Can't wait to go back again!

BENNIE EGGS BENEDICT! best part was that the corned beef hash was delicious and crispy!

everything here sounds good and our waitress was very nice and attentive.
i would definitely come back! If you're in the area, check this place out!

First time here. I had the pot roast skillet and he had the chicken fajita skillet. The pot roast skillet was delicious. The onions in the chicken fajita skillet were a bit undercooked. Excited to try other items on the menu, even though I'll probably order the same thing the next few times.

I love this place! The food is great, (I recommend ordering from the specials menu,) prices are good, and service was quick and courteous. They have several hard-to-find menu items, like beignets, and even the coffee here is good. I have eaten here a number of times and never had a bad experience. I would recommend it to anyone!
Wish I could give them 3 1/2 stars. Food tasted good. But portions were huge and not really different than breakfast chain restaurants. Ambiance was good as well.

A little hidden breakfast gem. We got eggs benedict, egg white omelet, kids Oreo pancakes, oatmeal, and kids combo = $55 with tip included. The sizes are plenty big for take-home portions, so feel free to split the plate and make 2 meals of it. There was a constant line of people, but they kept it moving fast so waiting was only 10 minutes... on a busy Sunday morning.

And of course, they're known for their jelly so ask for a serving of toast and jelly to give it a try. It's supposed to be made in-house fresh, so worth a taste.

Really enjoyable breakfast...
Great service. After grand lux cafe the beignets here are awesome. I would go here just for the warm beignets. The overall food was great. The place is nice as well.

Breakfast was good nice little outdoor seating on a beautiful Sunday morning. We got there just in the nick of time around 11 a.m. for they got too busy. Food was great. Service was a little bit spotty but it looks like she was stretched pretty thin. Definitely a place to try.
Service was good. Restaurant was very clean, nice, and quite busy. Maybe I just got the wrong thing because the food is mediocre.

Had a good experience here. 
Was seated promptly, food was solid, service was adequate and coffee cup was continually refilled.
Omelette was just right and enjoyed the crisp bacon and ham. A solid choice for breakfast.

Came here spontaneously with my girlfriend. Looked it up on yelp because all of the good reviews it has. 

Place is small and loud. Have a little patio section for a couple of tables. Tables are very close to each other so don't expect too much privacy. The bathrooms are facing the tables which make it a little awkward to go to. Very nice inside though. 

Took the waiter 10 min to take our order since it was busy. Started off with orange juice which was a little on the sweeter side but good overall. Unfortunately, they don't give you any straws. 

Had the Hawaiian omelette and my gf had the asparagus and egg. It was DELICIOUS!  food hands down better than Elly's. 

If you're looking for a new breakfast place and you're in the area come on by.

Stopped in for breakfast around 1pm on a Monday. We were in for a short stay from out of town. Food was served as ordered but you could tell they precook the potatoes and bacon as they were warm but not hot when served. The eggs and pancakes were hot and fresh. Service was good. Wish you had a choice of hashbrowns or potatoes. Would have given 4 stars if all of the food would have been hot when served.

So breakfast is most important thing in our existing and fell good all day , so why not to step buy hear and eat delicious food ! Menu is huge a special for breakfast . I recomend this place for all .

Today was my first visit to Jelly Cafe. I was there for breakfast. I ordered a half breakfast panini.The waitress made a mistake and brought out a full sandwich. I was charged the higher price and questioned that since it was her mistake. The manager came out and took the extra half sandwich and said she was throwing it out. I've never been to a restaurant that did anything like that when a mistake was made. Very poor customer service. There were only two tables of customers so it was not hopping. I will not be going there again and will pass the word to my neighbors, friends and associates. I would give it zero stars if that was a choice. The food was mediocre.

I heard from the owner today regarding my visit. The owner's rendition of the incident was not quite accurate and was harsh in his/her response. They accused me of being "proud" of not leaving a tip and that was not true. I simply stated that I did not leave a tip. They wanted to make me feel bad that I slighted the 18 year old waiter. This all comes down to good customer service which there was none, That's fine. I will never visit again and make sure my opinion is said when anyone asks for a good local place to eat.

Went for breakfast today. Told us 30 minute wait no problem. Actually took about 20. 
Very friendly staff customer service was great. I had a skillet, it was good.   But what I didn't like was portion size.  For 10.99 I thought it would be bigger. Girlfriend had banana nut eagle. Good but chop walnuts a little smaller.

Great place. Had a great stack of pancakes with fresh strawberries. Its smaller but not loud at all.
Coffee was very tasty. My coworkers give it a thumbs up too.
Have been wanting to try this. They have great service and amazing food.

I love the inside of this little breakfast place... It is a little tiny wish it was bigger. Have had their omelettes which are great!!! Their fiesta one was amazing with fresh avocado and a good salsa to put on it. Have also had their Tilapia tacos which I loved!!!  Cute place good service . I recommend

Passed by several times with the fiance' and kept saying we are going to try it.  I was very surprised at the level of service combined with the upscale food.  Had the corned beef hash, which is not something I usually order anywhere, since it tends to be on the salty side.  Great choice.  This beef was tender and delicious and far from salty. The bread, marble rye, was fresh and delicious - red potatoes, very nice.  Haven't had the chance to make it back yet, but it is highly recommended.  The big kicker was our server, she was very cool and laid back with a bit of humor mixed in.  I realize being a server is hard work and I respect when people are able to work hard but still have a smile for their customer.  4 stars for the first time......hoping to go up from here......
Great food and service. Will be going back! Service was great, good food and reasonable prices. Can't wait to go back again!

BENNIE EGGS BENEDICT! best part was that the corned beef hash was delicious and crispy!

everything here sounds good and our waitress was very nice and attentive.
i would definitely come back! If you're in the area, check this place out!

First time here. I had the pot roast skillet and he had the chicken fajita skillet. The pot roast skillet was delicious. The onions in the chicken fajita skillet were a bit undercooked. Excited to try other items on the menu, even though I'll probably order the same thing the next few times.

I love this place! The food is great, (I recommend ordering from the specials menu,) prices are good, and service was quick and courteous. They have several hard-to-find menu items, like beignets, and even the coffee here is good. I have eaten here a number of times and never had a bad experience. I would recommend it to anyone!
Wish I could give them 3 1/2 stars. Food tasted good. But portions were huge and not really different than breakfast chain restaurants. Ambiance was good as well.

A little hidden breakfast gem. We got eggs benedict, egg white omelet, kids Oreo pancakes, oatmeal, and kids combo = $55 with tip included. The sizes are plenty big for take-home portions, so feel free to split the plate and make 2 meals of it. There was a constant line of people, but they kept it moving fast so waiting was only 10 minutes... on a busy Sunday morning.

And of course, they're known for their jelly so ask for a serving of toast and jelly to give it a try. It's supposed to be made in-house fresh, so worth a taste.

Really enjoyable breakfast...
Great service. After grand lux cafe the beignets here are awesome. I would go here just for the warm beignets. The overall food was great. The place is nice as well.

Breakfast was good nice little outdoor seating on a beautiful Sunday morning. We got there just in the nick of time around 11 a.m. for they got too busy. Food was great. Service was a little bit spotty but it looks like she was stretched pretty thin. Definitely a place to try.
Service was good. Restaurant was very clean, nice, and quite busy. Maybe I just got the wrong thing because the food is mediocre.

Had a good experience here. 
Was seated promptly, food was solid, service was adequate and coffee cup was continually refilled.
Omelette was just right and enjoyed the crisp bacon and ham. A solid choice for breakfast.

Came here spontaneously with my girlfriend. Looked it up on yelp because all of the good reviews it has. 

Place is small and loud. Have a little patio section for a couple of tables. Tables are very close to each other so don't expect too much privacy. The bathrooms are facing the tables which make it a little awkward to go to. Very nice inside though. 

Took the waiter 10 min to take our order since it was busy. Started off with orange juice which was a little on the sweeter side but good overall. Unfortunately, they don't give you any straws. 

Had the Hawaiian omelette and my gf had the asparagus and egg. It was DELICIOUS!  food hands down better than Elly's. 

If you're looking for a new breakfast place and you're in the area come on by.

Wish you had a choice of hashbrowns or potatoes. Would have given 4 stars if all of the food would have been hot when served.
