I had the Nutella strawberry pancakes and my boyfriend had the steak and eggs. The pancakes were good and no I was only able to eat half taking the other half home. The steak was a smidgen under cooked to my boyfriend's liking and he had asked for hash browns rather than the cubed potatoes and still got cubed potatoes. 

I also felt it was rather loud from all the other patrons talking. We were seated near two large groups. 

It's not a bad little place to grab a bite to eat. I'd like to see some sort of sweet/savory combination offerings. I don't remember seeing anything on the menu but I could be wrong.

Great breakfast spot. The wait staff can sometimes get overwhelmed and forget simple things when it gets busy.

Regardless, it's very much worth visiting. It's great to see competition pop up, as there's another popular breakfast spot in downtown Arlington Heights. The competition keeps everyone on their toes and the food quality high. The customers are the ones who win in that situation.

Oh, and for the love of God, Yelpers: no more beignets shots. Give 'em a rest.
For a quick breakfast, I'm starting to love this place. The waitress is very cheeky and sweet. Reminds me of home.

I finally made it here and it was quite pleasant.  The waitress was a joy... Friendly, upbeat, efficient as was the bus staff.  I felt very welcome.  I like how she said..."see you tomorrow" as I was leaving...well done!
I had the beignets (delicious)  to start followed by corned beef hash, eggs and potatoes.
It was all well prepared though they were the smallest egg yolks I've ever seen! 
I like having the coffee pot on the table so I can refill as I please.  That's a BIG plus.

Overall, I'd return ... Happy to have them so near to home !

Quote from my Dad:  "They have to put so much gravy on the biscuits to keep them from floating away".  Then he proceeded to mention how much he loved the light, airy biscuits throughout breakfast. So if you're a biscuits and gravy fan, this is your dish. 

I had a custom omelet with turkey sausage, spinach, mushrooms and goat cheese. It was tasty, but a lot of egg. Their omelets are made with 4 eggs; I must usually eat 3 egg omelets.  The menu said it was served with house red potatoes and saut̩ed onions, so I was hoping for baby red/new potatoes.  It's actually one big hash brown without any onions. 

Service was slow on a Sunday morning. We had a table in the back so I think they forgot about us. It was about 20 minutes between being sat and taking our drink order.  At least we didn't have to wait for a table (surprising for a Sunday) and our food came quickly. 

The Banana Walnut Belgium waffles looked very rich and sweet. It would be perfect to share those and then split an egg dish. Next time!

Since starting this review and not finishing it from my first visit, I've been back once.  Both times the food has been great, though I can say that service/food was better on my first visit. 

From our first time, we were greeted very friendly by the host, as well as having an attentive server. Second time around, no friendly host, and the service lacked, but it was closer to them closing, so that could explain it. However, I did order a side which I've been wanting to try (Beignets & Jelly) and he never brought it to my table, so I was pretty upset about that. 

I've gotten their Caprese Bennie which was excellent. It's their egg Benedict with 2 poached eggs, fresh mozzarella, pesto, grilled tomatoes, and a English muffin - it comes with a side of house red potatoes which are so good (don't forget the ketchup). I recommend this as it was one of the best Benedict's I've ever tried. The next time I was there, I ordered the croque madame breakfast sandwich - it was just OK. It was my only second time having this sandwich, so if it wasn't for the fact that I had the most amazing croque madame in a French bakery in Cali, this may have been better, but i will not get it again. 

The coffee is great here and they serve it in your own personal coffee pot, so you can refill it yourself without having to wait. My boyfriend had the grilled asparagus and egg, and considering he ordered it both times, he must have really liked it! 

The inside is nicely lit up because of the giant windows surrounding the restaurant. There are tables in the middle, and booths along the sides, which are very nice and private. Though the menu is not extensive, there are definitely some other things i would love to try; I just hope the service doesn't go downhill because that will in doubt turn me away from here.

Came in for Sunday Breakfast. A nice comfy room, fairly prompt service. Quite tasty food, good coffee. 
The only downside was how long the kitchen took to prepare our entrees.
We will likely return.

Amazing food! The staff is wonderful. Love starting My Monday mornings with the yummy California scramble and are fabulous favorite waitress Bonnie. Highly recommend this restaurant for breakfast or lunch.

Are brunch here on a quiet and beautiful Monday! We were sat in the outside covered area by the wall, perfect spot. I ordered the chilaquiles and substituted chorizo instead of chicken. This plate was more than enough food! There were a lot of chips, and melted cheese. There was plenty of chorizo in there as well, I got it topped with two over-easy eggs that were cooked perfectly. There was heat to this dish, which I very much enjoyed.

Overall it was a great meal!

I've had both breakfast and lunch here. The quality of the food is high and offers typical menu items with elegant additions to make it uniquely Benedict's. I was actually surprised by the fact that the menu prices were actually pretty reasonable for the service and quality you get in return.

A pleasant surprise.  Greeted by warmly welcoming staff and experienced wait staff and cordial bus persons.  An extensive menu with ample GF options.  Patrons are happy to be here.  Food quality is very good and each dish is carefully prepared to order.  Assortment of condiments to adjust depth of flavour to your liking.

Stopped here for brunch while nearby for business - I wish I lived closer because I'd have to come here a dozen times to try everything that looks good on the menu. The menu is huge - ten different omelettes, ten different benedicts, plus stratas, fritattas, quiches, skillets, crepes, waffles, french toast, and pancakes. And if that's not enough, they have salads and sandwiches too.

I got the corn & brie frittata with avocado salsa (on the specials menu), my husband got the breakfast tacos. The frittata was an amazing flavor combo, and really unique. I love brie, and the combo of brie, roasted corn, and avocado was perfect. The frittata came with oven roasted potatoes and a huge piece of freshly baked toast. The breakfast tacos were just what they sound like, tortillas stuffed full of eggs, cheese, and veggies. Only disappointment is that they were out of blue corn tortillas, but the food was so good he didn't notice until he was halfway through the dish.

If I'm ever anywhere near Crystal Lake again, I'm coming back here to eat.

Now I know what the hype is about. Great and unique breakfast meals. Great flavor and variety. We each had something a little exotic (salmon frittata anyone?).
Great for a special occasion brunch.

I always thought of Benedict's as a breakfast place, who knew they serve a great dinner as well. My wife had chicken pot pie topped with puffed pastry. It was warm, fresh and very satisfying on a cold night. I opted for an eight ounce burger. The fresh grass fed beef was moist and delicious, no need to add bacon, cheese, ect to give this burger flavor. The burger was served with kettle chips and an amazing slaw. The slaw has your standard cabbage, but then adds red and green apples, fresh cherries and cantaloupe - it was wonderful. Bottom line: great service, great food. Was a real pleasure.

The Bloody Marys for Brunch are always great here, especially by the second one. They have a wide variety of Benedicts available; I want to try them all! They also serve other breakfast items, as well. With a nice atmosphere and friendly wait staff, Benedicts La Strata is an excellent place to go to for brunch, especially during a quiet Sunday drive on a nice summer day.

The restaurant has a very good gluten free menu. We have always been happy with there selection of food. I highly recommend there gluten free pancakes. They're better than the original. Also the atmosphere is very personable and unique.

Sulfur.
This was my first time here. My wife has been here multiple times and praised the food. Unfortunately my first experience tasting anything was the water. Sulfur sulfur. We asked to change the carafe and glasses and still very strong sulfur flavor. The food was pretty good, the taste of their water made me think about the same water being used to cook the food, wash the fruits and vegetables, brew the coffee, etc. 

Since my wife said she never had this experience before, I will try this place again, but I can't give it more than 3 stars today. It would have been a 1 or 2 star, but the food is actually pretty good.

This is our favorite restaurant in town. They have a wide variety of unique options and I haven't had anything I don't like. Their Apple, bacon, Brie omelet is one of my favorites. Emily's bruschetta is also amazing.
Best place for consistent, good quality breakfast. Love their salads too. Very friendly waitresses too!

My parents introduced me to this restaurant this past August. My husband and I come there at least once a month for brunch.

We try to get there at 9:30am or earlier because it gets really crowded on the weekends.

We've tried various items on the menu but my husband's favorite is the special of the day Quiche and I love the BBQ Skillet (I forget the actual name).

Our favorite server is Bonnie. She is so nice and friendly and has given us great recommendations. We ran into her at Costco once and she even recognized us!

We love sitting in the screened in area when it's nice out!

Can't wait to go back again!

I cant say enough about Benedict's. This is by far one of the best breakfast places I have been. Everything I order is amazing. I go here at least once a week just to try something new. 

The espresso is one of the best I have had and is very fair priced. The staff is very friendly and will treat you like family. If you are looking for a nice, clean place to have breakfast, look no further.

The food was good here and I love the amount of options on the menu.  The only critique is that the breakfast potatoes came out cold. I assume they were pre cooked and their temperature was not maintained well in the kitchen. 

The reason I am giving this place 5 stars is that Whitney (our waitress) and Larry (the manager) were great!  We needed a change of an order and they were really receptive and the food came out really quickly.

I have not even ordered and I am in love! Great atmosphere friendly hostess and a positive waitress. Nice start! Menu is filled with an array of delights. I narrowed it down to four options in the first few minutes. Make that six. No maybe seven. Lol this could take some time.
Chicken pot pie was delicious. I will be back to try something else.

I like to come here by myself sometimes or with family.  The atmosphere is cozy but vibrant and almost always busy.  Everyone is friendly and every time I've been here, the staff hustles and shocks me by how fast I get my food.  I haven't been disappointed by what I get.  I also love how the food is presented on colored plates.  The patio is a nice plus for good weather.

Honestly, this is probably the best breakfast restaurant I've eaten at in the area. I've had the chance to eat here a few times, and every time the food is great. My only complaint - and the reason this review isn't 5 stars- is that after the meal, I felt kind of rushed out by the waitresses. This has happened the last few times I've been here, and the people I am with make the same comment about being rushed out. 
Besides that, this restaurant is great!

All I can say is WOW! We came in for lunch today with a group of 18 ladies, we go on a lunch outing once a month and Benedict's is by far our favorite! Our server Kathy was awesome! She had a great sense of humor and she was very attentive! She accommodated all of our needs and even did all seperate checks for us. Our food came out fast and hot. We love the menu here, has a little bit of everything!

We went for brunch yesterday. There were four of us.

The service was perfect and it was very busy,around 12 :10

We ordered the "ROTHSCHILD" eggs benedict and it was served the way that we had requested and was excellant.

We are now customers and will return.

Very satisfied. I finally got the chance to come in and have breakfast after hearing good things about this restaurant. I got the zucchini cakes with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce. So good and filling. Also, our waiter Bonnie was so sweet and attentive. I don't think I've ever had such great service. Highly recommend!

Pretty similar to my favorite breakfast restaurant in the area, Egg Harbor. It's pretty typical breakfast diner food, but it still tastes great. We called ahead and had reservations, but it still took us a little bit to be seated, which was fine. By the time we left around 10, the place was booming, so go early if you're going to go! My only complaints are that the service and the coffee were sub-par. Other than that, I would definitely check this place out.

Benedict's La Strata is a terrific place to enjoy some fabulous Italian cuisine and excellent service. My son of four years and 11 months absolutely loves the angel hair pasta and sauce. In addition the atmosphere is very put together and makes for a perfect stage to indulge in a very well prepared Italian meal. Be sure to try the bruschetta  appetizer, it has numerous delicious options to choose from that are incredible and very well thought out. I would recommend this great find to all. Merry Christmas to the staff of Benedict's La Starta.

First time eating here today & breakfast food is wonderful- fianc̩ & I both had veggie skillets. Portions were perfect, eggs were cooked just right, and the red peppers in the skillet were mouthwatering.  We will be back!

Menu has so many delicious sounding options that it was truly difficult to decide what to get. Highly recommend the apple bacon Brie omelette and the mushroom omelette.

Wait staff was very friendly and service was prompt. Also has a great covered patio for outside seating! 

All in all, delicious experience!

This is the most amazing spot for breakfast, brunch, lunch AND dinner! I am sure my friends get sick of me saying "let's go to Benedicts" but there's seriously such great food at great prices and great people to meet while you're there that why would you go anywhere else. I love any and all of the eggs benedict dishes but if poached eggs aren't your thing try the Louisiana skillet or the crepes! So good!
The best breakfast place around. Phenomenal food, great menu, and Intelligencia coffee!!! Try the Lousiana Skillet

We would not recommend dining here. We experienced poor and unprofessional customer service during brunch. Our server made multiple mistakes and blamed everyone else from the kitchen, to the hostess, to the customers rather than just apologizing and fixing the errors. The mistakes were minor up until a giant fiasco with the bill at the end, but they quickly added up to an unprofessional and laughable experience. Besides the poor service, we waited more than twice as long as we were told (90 minutes rather than 40) because the hostess sat another table ahead of us. The glasses were dirty and the mimosas were hot. Since I am forced to leave one star, I will say that it is for the biscuits and gravy, which were great, but not worth the hassle.

We love this place. Wish it was open later for breakfast as we always find ourselves craving their food after 2:30. Everything we've had is amazing. I am in love with their biscuits and gravy and their pomegranate and pear French toast. My hubby loves their eggs Benedict on English muffins. The service is always beyond amazing.

I always love coming to Benedict's whenever I want to spend some quality time with good friends. I've tried so many of their breakfasts, salads and sandwiches and they are all amazing! The servers are always great about being flexible about the ingredients in most menu items; a lot of my friends have dietary restrictions and they never have any problem finding something delicious that works for them! Great service, great food, a wonderful little place in the heart of downtown Crystal Lake. They've made a loyal customer out of me!

MAN their dinner menu looks solid! 
Unfortunate you can only grab that a couple of nights a week. 
And so this trip it was for breakfast, which was pretty tasty! 
I think starting with some apple beignets is a smart way to start the morning, and although these were tasty, I don't know that I'd rush back for them. But hey, at $3.50 an order, it wasn't a HUGE investment. The breakfast tacos on the other hand were SUPER tasty. They can benefit from an extra tortilla to hold all the goodness inside, so you might consider grabbing a few more, and I'd recommend some extra salsa too. I got mine with chicken which in the end was probably a silly move. I should have stuck with the chorizo which they recommend. Oh and major points for Intelligentsia coffee/espresso.
Usually the go to breakfast spot in the area. Not the cheapest but everything is good. Chicken chilaquiles on fleek.

3rd time is NOT a charm,  This used to be our favorite place but NO MORE!! Every time we have come here we wait over 35-40 minutes for our food AND it comes out over cooked and cold.  Just watched 2 tables who came after us get served and here we are WAITING only to be told, sorry we forgot to put your order in.....whatttttttt!!! We are outta here, hungry and pissed off!! There are far too many other places in Crystal Lake who appreciate serving their customers.  Beyond frustrating !!!!

Best McHenry County breakfast hands down....with each table having its own carafe of delicious coffee and pitcher of water. 
Love the smoked salmon wrapped poached eggs on potato pancakes with a side of Hollandaise plus a dessert dish of fresh fruit. Husband gets the Apple Brie Omelet. The menu appeals to any taste bud of the day....from simple to complex. 
Extensive made to order standard as well as inventive options. French-inspired decor, attentive, friendly service and dark chocolate mint sticks when servers bring your check. They even offer coffee-to-go for their table customers. 
Another fantastic offering for many customers.....a freshly-made Bloody Mary or Bellini or Mimosa with breakfast. 
On weekends, the kitchen creates freshly-made (yup, everything is fresh here) Apple or Plain French Beignets with a lovely dusting of confection white powder sugar. Everything here is top-notch will have to try the dinners on Fridays & Saturday evenings.

I came here for my husbands 50th bday brunch. I had a party of 12 and reserved, or so I thought the tables by the window. And it was a weekend so very busy, I understand, but after 30 minutes past my reserved time, we are still standing by the bar waiting to be seated. 
 The food took forever to come out, I had a server dump a bloody mary on me, and she forgot to remove it from my bill! Who does that? I thought it was a great place because  I had been here several times for breakfast with my sister. We loved it and great service. That is the difference between weekday staff and weekend I guess. I have not been back there since. If you go for just a couple people, fine, but I would never host another event there. Go elsewhere, they cannot handle the business they already have on a weekend. So, 3 stars if you want a semi costly breakfast if you go during the weekdays. 1 star if you wanted something special for an anniversary or milestone birthday, find another place.
First timers...  We had smoked salmon benedict, rueben and kids had pancakes.  It all tasted great!  The food came out quickly and our service was excellent.  We will definitely be going back.

We had dinner here on the Saturday before St. Patrick's Day.  Our first choice was Duke's, but given the holiday, it was packed.  We drove down Williams Street, and decided to stop at Benedict's.  The restaurant wasn't busy, and we were seated immediately.  This is where it all went down hill.  We each ordered wine with an appetizer.  Nobody ever came back to ask if we wanted another glass.  When they finally brought our entrees, we each ordered another glass of wine, and they never brought it!  We were completely forgotten about, and we even had to ask for the check.  I was facing the front of the restaurant, and noticed our waiter (female) kept disappearing around to the front.  I thought maybe they were under-staffed that evening, and perhaps she was also working in the kitchen.  Our service the entire evening was incredibly slow.  (food was pretty good though)  And when we got up to leave, we saw why our service was so slow.  Around the wall that she was disappearing to was the bar.  She was hanging out at the bar with her friends while completely ignoring her customers.  I only gave 2 stars for the food.  I doubt we'll return.

Let's just say that this is the best breakfast and lunch place in the local area. Great food that is not ordinary but really good, that can be devilishly fattening or really healthy. Go there and enjoy!
Still as awesome as before! Bonnie is just a delight as a waitress! Southwest Benny is the new favorite for me!

Was told the wait would be 25 mins, 40 mins later still waiting to be seated, while parties that came after us were seated first. That is really horrible service specially since i had a really hungry kid and being 8 months pregnant i was already starving
Fantastic food. The Benedict's chop salad with chicken is the best.

I think this is a very solid breakfast/lunch restaurant with a very friendly wait staff.  

I had heard so much about Benedict's La Strata from friends that I think my expectations were super high.  They almost got there but not quite.

Nice, warm atmosphere, and actually crowded for lunch at 1:30 on a Monday. Good for them.  Our waitress was super friendly and very professional.  I give her 5 stars.  The coffee was good, the food was good, I had the Despardo Skillet.  I just wasn't 5 star blown away.

If you are looking for a nice place to have a good breakfast or lunch I would recommend trying Benedicts, I plan on giving it a second look next time I'm in the area.

The food is unique and delicious and service is great! The best part is that I don't feel shuffled through like cattle similar to many other breakfast joints, and I also don't feel like I'm waiting forever for my food while I die of hunger pains and get drunk on sangria. Overall, I give this place a thumbs up!
Not a chain!!! So hard to get quality food from unique restaurants in the suburbs. This place has great food that is unique and delicious.

This place is pricey but it has decent food I have never ordered an actual Benedict from here but every time I go I have someone who does. I Purtilo particularly like their coffee I think it's really delicious. I plan on going again but not often it is pricey as I said before.

Ever since this place opened in downtown Cryatal Lake, it has become the "go to" place in town (and surrounding areas) for breakfast, brunch and lunch. The food is delicious, the menu variety is vast and teh service is superb. What more would you want out an eating establishment? The atmosphere is casual with a normal, conversational noise level. One of my personal favorites is the Andouille sausage and grits with shrimp added for a wonderful start to the day.

I have been very disappointed with the service and food quality the last few visits. I took my Mom out to breakfast last Saturday for Mother's Day and our experience was terrible from the minute we walked in the door. We were never put on the wait list when I called ahead, our server Whitney was less than personable and only came to our table 3 times (one of those times was when I asked someone to find her). The food took forever (they were not terribly busy) and when it finally came out it was cold. Our server never came to check on us once our food was delivered and I had to ask someone to find her. When I told her that our food was cold her answer was that it was busy. I am sorry that is not an excuse for our food to be cold. After she brought back our food from being microwaved (gross) she immediately dropped our check. This was the last straw for me. Sorry Benedict's but you are off my list!

Fantastic for breakfast - fantastic for dinner.  Yes - they're open for dinner!

I eat Gluten Free & there is always something wonderful at Benedict's.

I had breakfast here for the first time and though I really like fried eggs with a side of ham or sausage, I decided to go with something a little different considering that seems to be what they cater to. I had a frittata with artichoke hearts and goat cheese. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing but the color was some unappetizing shade of tan and it had very little flavor. The side of fruit was a very small portion. The coffee was better than average and I like that they bring a little pot to your table so that you don't have to wait for the waitress for a refill. That would have been annoying considering the service could have been better. If you're in the mood for a foo foo breakfast this might suit you, but I'd skip it if you just want a good plate of eggs.

I love, and I mean, love the breakfast here.  I, in fact, have never had a bad experience here... until I tried dinner.  The food was pretty mediocre, comparing it to the breakfast selection.  What I really had a problem with was my wife ordered the pasta bolognese and bit into a bay leaf.  It turned out it had small broken shards of bay leaf scattered in the sauce.  I call over our server and explained that this was a problem and a chocking hazard.  She then explained to me that more "up scale places do this".  I think it was because i was moving all day and came in with a hooded sweet shirt, that she thought I might not know what fine dinning is.  Well I let here know that I am in fact a chef, classically trained.

The server did nothing to correct the problem and we bagged our stuff to go.  I sorta feel bad that i have given hundreds of dollars to this place for breakfast and most likely will continue to do so.  I will not however, recommend, or be back for dinner again.

There for breakfast...Couple of things:  First, find a new hostess...the girl working there looked and acted stoned out of her mind.  She had dark hair and looked to be no more than 18 or 19.  That we had to repeat the word "Pat" to her 3 times when we weren't more than a foot away from her was the first clue something was wrong...she kept repeating it back to us as "Dot?"...with the 100 yard stare...she told us there would be a 20 minute wait for the patio...we were good with that, so we stepped outside for 10 minutes, as the foyer was filling up quickly...while we were outside, she gave our patio seats away.  Then we wound up being seated inside the restaurant at one of the smallest tables imaginable, since we didn't want to wait another God-knows-how-long for Bobette Marley to get us seated.  I ordered the eggs strata and was informed it's no longer available.  Why is it on your menu, then?...and isn't "strata" in your name? :/ You weren't simply out of the item; it's no longer being made...cross it off, if you don't want to incur the expense of menu reprints...how hard is that? I was offered an alternative that came with a "cheddar cheese sauce" that I can only describe as looking and tasting like melted cheez whiz.  The food was blah & disappointing, the service at the front of the house was utterly awful and it is very doubtful we will ever return.  The staff were impersonal and looked very stressed out.  I go out to eat on Sunday mornings to decompress and relax...the atmosphere of this place was the polar opposite of that. Too many legit restaurants in McHenry County to waste our time giving this bomb another try.  Cute d̩cor, but that's about all I can say on a positive note.  Oh, and that my obviously microwaved food arrived at the table quickly.  We took a pass on the canned corned beef hash, btw.  I realize it's disheartening to put so much effort into a business and receive less than stellar reviews, but you really need to rethink the quality of what you're offering instead of taking unnecessary shortcuts with critical components of a dish and hiring staff that can handle the front of the house, or at least tell them to check their attitudes at the door...maybe spring for pre-hire drug screening?  If I could give 0 stars, I would.  Not impressed.

The best place in Crystal Lake for breakfast, hell McHenry County!!!!  Hands down.  

Service is always fantastic, they always go above and beyond.  Food is always good.

It's Eggs Benedict Day, so having brunch here just seemed like the right thing to do today.   The restaurant itself is nicely decorated.  We were greeted immediately by an older gentleman while the hostess was walking back from sitting another party.   The hostess was less than welcoming, but the gentleman more than made up for her lack of hospitality.   Upon opening the menu,   the selections were quite extensive but not overwhelming.   I ordered a Bloody Mary which had all my favorite toppings (pickle spear, lemon, lime and olives). I picked the Smoked Salmon Benedict for my meal  while the hubby got the egg and steak.   Both were outstanding.   Although I thoroughly  enjoyed my meal,  what stood out the most for me was the perfectly cooked and seasoned steak my husband ordered.  I'm very pleased we gave this spot a try today.

Cannot and will not ever get over the food here. Everything is so amazing and I feel like it's truly different than other breakfast places in the area.
Whoever created the menu did a fantastic job. There is so much variety and creativity in all of their dishes! No matter what kind of food you like, you will fall in love with at least 3 menu items at Benedict's. Personally, I love the smoked salmon Benedict, the breakfast burrito, and the breakfast tacos! 
I ate dinner at Benedict's once, and it was terrific too. It was sad though because there were only two other couples there when we were on a Friday night at 6. Lovely, lovely wait staff too!
The only negative thing that I can say about Benedict's is that when I tried to schedule my sister's baby shower here a few months back, I called 4 times and no one called me back once! That's pretty bad customer service on the management's end.
All in all, Benedict's is a must try! Weekend mornings may have you waiting a half hour for a table, but it's all worth it in the end!

Breakfast heaven.

My hungrier half & I seldom get to go out to breakfast, and when we do, we usually hit up our "regular" spot, which is within walking distance of our house.  This time around, I wanted to try something new.  The original plan was to go to Richard Walkers, but I got vetoed (judging by some of the reviews out there, I'm not missing much).  I took to Yelp to save us from our routine, and I came across Benedict's La Strata.  What caught my eye, after perusing the menu, were a few standout details:

- They serve some organic items (apple juice and yogurt are the two that stick in my mind)
- They serve Intelligencia coffee, which is my absolute fave!
- Their menu is HUGE & varied, offering a little bit of everything from omelets to crepes, benedicts, pancakes, waffles, etc. (they also have a small lunch menu, but breakfast is most definitely their mainstay.
- They're local & not a huge chain (something that we both appreciate)

Bonus, when we called to see how busy they were, we were told that a party of 2 would be seated right away.  We hightailed it on over before the potential rush hit.

The decor is super cute, sort of a modern kitschy country farm thing going on, with red walls & rooster decor.  There is ample seating, so grabbing a table was no problem at all.  

Normally I'm not much of a "sweet" breakfast gal; I prefer omelets to pancakes any day.  But for some reason the stuffed cherry French toast caught my eye (& my stomach for that matter), and I couldn't resist.  To balance things out, I ordered myself some vanilla organic yogurt, the perfect compliment to my French toast.

My hungrier half got the breakfast burrito, because he's a sucker for anything wrapped up in a tortilla and/or containing chorizo.  His portion was HUGE, and even though he's a longtime member of the clean plate club, even he had to pony up and ask for a take home box.

There are so many amazing sounding dishes on Benedict's La Strata's menu that I can't wait to come back for some more!

Have been there for both breakfast and lunch multiple times and absolutely loved it! Food is fresh inventive and priced right. check it out and I'm sure you'll find you go to meal here. crab and avacado sandwich is awasome.

Enjoyable breakfast! Appropriate portions at reasonable prices. Only had to wait about 20 min for our party of 6 to be seated around 10:30 am on a Sunday. Wasn't too impressed with my bloody mary, but everyone seemed to enjoy their omelettes & benedicts.

Food is expensive and the taste is good but not worth the money.  My husband's biscuits and gravy came with enough grave to spread it like butter over the top of each biscuit.  He was very disappointed and even after asking for extra gravy, it didn't compare to what we have gotten at other restaurants.  Also, one of the first things we noticed were the water glasses - they have spots all over them. We weren't sure if they're not getting washed well enough or if they normally look like that. Either way, we don't want to wonder what the answer is - just give us some clean glasses. The seating order is odd too. It doesn't matter if you came before another family. If the table of 4 opens up and you only have 2 in your party, you are not getting seated until a table of 2 opens up. We will definitely be going elsewhere next time.

At first glance this joint may appear trendy, kind of snooty , and pretentious , but don't be fooled because it's a really friendly " come on in" atmosphere. 
Make sure you read menu item descriptions. I ordered the crab and avocado omelet which is drizzled with hollandaise sauce, the potatoes with onions, and a side English muffin. This simple dish just exploded with flavor. My mouth was having a party. 
Did you ever keep eating something because it tastes so good, but your actually full? This is the easiest way I could describe the experience. I will be back and I'm going for one of the the salads or the house speciality Eggs Benedict in multiple ways.
I'm not sure why I didn't rate 5 stars except for the fact I'm not sure this wasn't a one hit wonder. Stay tuned I will probably be updating this reviews after my next experience.

Awesome menu, great atmosphere, crazy-friendly service!
And they have REAL New Orleans style beignets!!!!!! SO YUM! (And I would know cuz I grew up in NOLA) if you can't get down to New Orleans for a beignet you've got to try theirs!

Oh Benedict's.  I can't quit you.

Well, I really have no good reason to want to!!

This was my first time at this location, and it was great (I personally prefer the Dundee location, though), but this was a great experience as well!

After being seated (ten-minute wait at 9 on a Sunday, but there were a LOT of people waiting after us), my sister and I perused the menu and picked out about 27 things off of the menu that we wanted.  

We may or may not have been "hungry shopping". ;)

So after much debate, she ordered the BLT Eggs benedict, I ordered the Egg white/turkey omelet (I added onions), and we had pumpkin pancakes off of the specials menu to share (like I said, HUNGRY).

The food came out SO quickly, and it was really, really delicious.  My sister's BLT Benedict was amazing--well, you add bacon to anything, it's going to be awesome!  My omelet was good, but there was a $.95 upcharge for adding onions....um, really?!  That's a small onion right there.  A DOLLAR?!?!  That seemed a little extreme...

Oh, and the pumpkin pancakes were AWESOME.  It came with three, so we each had one and I was able to take one home!!  YUM--it was just as good the next day.

Our waitress was really sweet as was any of the other people who came to serve us (the woman delivering food, the woman who refilled our drinks).  They were all really on top of things!


The only thing to keep my review from being five stars (other than a dollar for freaking onions) was the hostess.  She was a little...brisk.  That might be too nice of a word.  She was downright rude (brisk toward me, but I didn't get yelled at).  I get that you need to repeat the same thing a lot to customers ("I can't seat you until your entire party is here").  Heck, I even heard her say it to about 11 different people in my ten-minute wait, but that's what you signed on for when you got the job as hostess.  But I actually heard her YELL it at customers and give them major attitude when they would come in with two people and request a table for three.  The customer wasn't rude whatsoever, but basically got yelled at as the first impression.  Whoa...

This was my first visit. As other reviewers stated before me, it is great place for breakfast. The lady with colorful short hair, she was friendly and pleasant. Made me feel like I was local to the restaurant. Very nice. I had BLT Benedict and cappuccino. Cappuccino was great. Benedict was good too. However, the breakfast potato that was served made me think back of holiday inn breakfast.  I wish breakfast potato was warmer temperature and taste like it was freshly made, and have that crispy texture. But it was still good.  Bottom line. Good food and friendly service. Great place to start your morning.

Nice place. Clean. Food is above average. Place is always busy so that makes you feel like you are at the right place. 

Wife likes the mimosas. Coffee is ok. Portions are all good sized. 

One time I got the crab cakes Benedict... It was just ok. Wouldn't get it again. All other things are tried are good

Food is not the best, the portions for the price are small and the glasses had a ton spots on them. They looked filthly. I wouldnt have served someone in my house with glasses looking the way they did. The wait was horrendous (30 minutes) and even though our full party was there it seemed that people who were regulars that came in after us were getting preferential treatment and got seated before us. But whatever.  Normally I would attribute a long wait time to the food being really amazing but this was just not the case. Over all this place was a real dissapointment and their current 4 stars rating which is the reason I tried them out now feels misleading.

I like this place! They have a cute decor, intelligentsia coffee, great menu choices, and they have nice touches like ice water and coffee at the table. I had a strata and loved it. They offered fruit or potatoes with breakfast. There wasn't anything bad about the experience. Can't beat the location either--downtown Crystal Lake. The screened in patio is very nice too.
Asked about wifi, "we don't do that here." Mediocre, lackadaisical service. Blah, American cuisine. Pretty much only thing in town.

3.5 stars rounded up to four.

This is a solid breakfast place in Crystal Lake's cute downtown. Despite the central location, there's plenty of seating, and the place was poppin' at brunch.

The food was a step above your average breakfast place, with more interesting dishes that the usual omelets and skillets (though they have those, too). My wife had a smoked salmon benedict, which she liked, though poached eggs are not really my thing.

I had the Jambalaya Eggs, which were coated in cheese and sauce and were pretty tasty, if lacking in shrimp. They were, however, extremely rich. Make sure you're hungry!

I'm not that familiar with Crystal Lake, but Benedict's is a solid choice!

The crab cakes Benedict was awesome! I'd have it again. And again. And again...

Also, excellent coffee and terrific service. All around great experience.

The food here is stellar. I've ordered from here on a few occasions and everything's been pretty flavorful. Why the 3 stars? My biggest complaint is that they won't seat you until your whole party is there. I've only ordered take out up until this past week and when I went in, I noticed several elderly people were standing by the front door. I figured it was a really large party and they were all waiting for their friends/family. My friend was on her way so I thought I'd stand there and look at the menu. Then I got a text she was running late. So I asked to be seated. The first hostess said she'd seat the other party behind me  since everyone was there and then come back. When the second hostess came by, I assumed she'd take me to my seat. Nope! She mumbled, "We don't seat incomplete parties during lunch" then hurried away. Fortunately, the first hostess followed through when she got back, otherwise I would've taken my wait outside until my friend showed up and went elsewhere. I don't fully understand this practice of making people stand there, cluttering up the front--especially THE ELDERLY!!!! 

The second star was taken off because, while I love their skillets, many of their diced potatoes are rock hard because they've been cut too small. Other than that, I've had their Mediterranean Chicken sandwich and it was absolutely scrumptious.

I went a little out of my way to check this place out.  I understand they have been given annual awards on their food & whatnot, but I just can't bring myself to give this place more than 3 stars.

Let me start by saying the service we received was outstanding... No complaints there.  Our waitress was exceptionally friendly, helpful & on top of things.

My first issue begins with the ladies room. It's a pretty good rule of thumb that the cleanliness in the restrooms is an indicator of how the rest of the place is cleaned.  We drove in over an hour to get to this place so I REALLY had to use the facilities when we arrived. For me, there's nothing more gross then seeing a thick layer of dust on everything.  The garbage bin lids, the top of the paper towel machines & my biggest peeve, the fake plants. Dust that thick doesn't happen overnight...so one star off for not cleaning.

Lastly, I ordered the apple, brie, bacon omelet.  It came with an orange slice, about a 1/2 cup diced potatoes, an English muffin and I ordered a side of bacon.  Coffee is amazing because it's Intelligensia. The food came out in a very reasonable time but was not hot.  It wasn't cold but, I prefer my food hot if it's coming out of the kitchen that quickly. The bacon was a bit greasy but good.  The omelet concept was amazing but the flavors didn't marry & it was bland. This could have been easily prevented with a little salt in the kitchen. The potatoes we're not fresh, room temperature, dry & needing of salt.

I dined with my husband, MIL & SIL... everyone agreed it was a pleasant breakfast but the food was meh. 

Overall a nice experience but the food is bland & the owners or manager need to get on the cleaning.

Hands down the best place for breakfast in McHenry county! I am never disappointed and have a very long list of favorite dishes! Whatever you do, if it's your first visit, do not go on Sunday! They don't serve beignets on Sunday and it should be a crime to start your breakfast without them! Crepes are the best in town and I order them almost every time I go. The biscuits and gravy are a close second for me and I almost always order grits on the side no matter what I order!! Grits, no one serves grits in the Midwest and the grits are excellent! And to top off the perfect breakfast you need an excellent cup of coffee and they have that too! There are always seasonal menu options, kid friendly, affordable... Do I need to go on?? No i don't because you need to stop reading this and go get breakfast!

Bring a burb cloth or a bib because you're going to start drooling as soon as you look at their menu.  They offer such creative and DELICIOUS dishes!  I LOVE the blueberry strata, all of the various flavors of egg benedicts, the lemon poppyseed pancakes, the beignets, the lobster bisque, even their iced tea is SO much better than every other restaurant.  The kids menu is solid too.  It's kind of rare to find a kid's menu that offers fresh food.  Restaurants always seem to think kids should eat frozen, prepared, fatty, crap.  

Also the prices are very reasonable.  If you haven't been here, you just have to go.  I am certain you and whomever you dine with will be happy.  I still haven't gone for dinner, but my Mom and Dad did, and they were really impressed.  Bon appetit!

I have been to this restaurant probably 30 times or more for breakfast on sat. or sunday and every single time the service is quick, the food great, the staff awesome.  This is the best breakfast place period.
This is one of my favorite places in Crystal Lake to eat.  Great food and service, and love the atmosphere in the summer for outside dining.

After finally trying Benedict's La Strata I was hoping to be wowed by the food...but it wasn't the case. The food was good, but nothing special in my opinion. The things that surprised me the most were the prices. For some reason I expected this place to be pricier than most breakfast places, but it wasn't.

Getting back to the food - the corned beef hash and eggs were cooked fine, the home style potatoes left something to be desired. I prefer mine to be crunchier; these were a softer variety. I forget what my wife had, but I remember she was pleased with it, but not exceptionally so.

We'd definitely come back but it hasn't replaced our "go to" breakfast place.

Really great breakfast/lunch and/or brunch place.  Love the fact that that you can find many unique items on the menu.  Fun to try new dishes every time I go.
One neat option is sweet potato hash.  Wish that more places would give the option for sweet potato instead of regular 'ol Idaho tater which is nutritionally poor.

There are a lot of reasons to like this place, but for some reason it never stands out as absolutely amazing. I think that's because I've gone from being extremely impressed to just satisfied with different choices on the menu.

I will say breakfast is their thing. Stick to breakfast. Their lunch menu is okay, and I have never ventured to try dinner here. But breakfast is consistently good. The other thing that is a little wonky is their portion size. Some items you can barely finish, others will leave you ordering an extra item. When I go with friends we usually each order a breakfast item and then order something extra, like waffles or french toast to share.

The service is good, and they serve Intelligentsia coffee, which is amazing. Their decor and cups are really cute and gives the restaurant a cozy feel. They also have a big patio, which is really nice for the summer. I love places where you can comfortably eat outside. 

Overall, it's a worth try, but the prices are a bit higher and not everything on the menu is a home run, so be selective in what you order.

Ordered a Reuben... Came out tasting like it was microwaved.  When the waitress was told she said "no everything is cooked on the flat top".  Not a Sorry or any sort of apologjy; simply here's your bill.  This is unacceptable; especially when one bite was taken out of the sandwich.  

Will not be coming back here!
Beautiful downtown CL area, nicely designed atmosphere, good food and not a chain.
I have been here for both breakfast and lunch, and I can say both times were amazing.  It is hard to describe really good food.  You just have to try it for yourself.
One of the best restaurants in Crystal Lake, and great dinner options too!
I have been going here every week for the last few months and really enjoy this place!

I really like this place, and the service is always great however, I feel that it's just a little overrated. Everybody gets so worked up about it, and I think it's just your average breakfast place. The frittatas are just okay, and the service is nothing spectacular. The ambiance is cute, but other than that I would say just average.

Been here a few times already and they have THE BEST hollandaise ever. Maybe even the best eggs benedict! And let me tell you, I have had a lot of friggin eggs benedict. 

I really appreciate the balance of ingredients of the hollandaise - not too heavy and not too buttery. Eggs are ALWAYS poached PERFECTLY. The pom orange juice is super yummy, too.

Their coffee is excellent as well, but I think their 'fruit cup' can be more exotic and innovative.

Going to def have to try the seafood benedict soon! Can't wait to go back!

I LOVE Benedict's -- so much so that I go there once or twice a week for breakfast and lunch.

They have awesome food and generally, really friendly servie.  There's nothing bad on the menu and everything is FRESH!   Benedict's offers a refreshing alternative to a "greasy spoon" type breakfast.  The prices are reasonable too!  For two people with non-alcoholic drinks, our bill is generally between $25 and $30 dollars.

I do have a couple of gripes that I've been dying to share.  This pace is always packed on the weekends for breakfast and I've never seen it at less than half capacity at lunch during the week, so we know they're making money.  I really would love to see the water-stained ceiling tiles replaced and the women's restroom could use a little sprucing.  One of the toilet seats is stained -- nobody wants to sit on a stain! -- and there are chips in the paint on the stalls and walls.

Also, some of the staff need a refresher on customer service.  One waitress doesn't smile at all -- ever -- and she'll make you sad by proximity if she waits your table.  On just one of my many visits, I received incorrect order and when I addressed it with the server, she argued with me and told me that I ordered the wrong thing and showed me what she had written down -- like that was proof of anything.  It was unprofessional and didn't help the situation and it really put a damper on the meal.

The best part of this place is the coffee, no doubt.  Service was meh at best, but it was busy, so I'll cut them slack on that.  The water glasses were coated in a film of dish detergent, but I was willing to overlook that too.  I was excited that they had gluten free options on the menu, so I ordered an item on the menu that was clearly marked as being Gluten Free, and when it came there was an English muffin on the plate.  At that point I had to wonder if they even know what gluten free means and if it's safe for me to eat my food, but I boldly went ahead anyway.  I'd ordered the sweet potato hash with poached eggs.  The 'hash' was more like unseasoned BOILED sweet potatoes, some of it undercooked, not even remotely fried, no salt, no flavor.  It was totally unappetizing to me, and I'm someone who loves sweet potatoes.  Completely disappointing experience for me.  I probably won't be back.
Holy cow this is IT for breakfast in this town. Don't go anywhere else. Try the Bavarian omelette for a change of pace that is deeply satisfying. The caramel cappuccino is pretty great too!

The food is not bad and the prices are reasonable.  The reason I will not be returning to this restaurant is because I now have serious doubts about what is going on behind the scenes.  It started with the fact that they can not handle simple modifications to menu items such as "no cheese".  I have ordered food togo there 3 times now.  Each time I have had to have it remade.  Somehow the kitchen either does not receive the order correctly or they don't read it and the cashier who puts the order together does not check whether it is correct.  

Last time I ordered 2 dishes with no cheese and brought them home to see they were covered with cheese.  I called ahead to have them remade, checked them upon returning and the new dishes were STILL covered with cheese.  The manager put together the third attempt at making my order but even then it was missing the sides.  He gave me a card for 2 complementary meals for the trouble.

I finally decided to redeem the complementary meals today.  I clearly explained my order to the cashier.  One with no sour cream and the other with no english muffin.  Again, I clearly explained that I was using the card the manager had given me, my previous orders had not been made correctly and it was extremely important that there not be an english muffin with my food because I am gluten intolerant.  She repeated my order perfectly.  Then to my surprise, my food still come out with the muffin.  Not in a separate container or on the side but UNDERNEATH the eggs I had ordered.  This was especially frustrating because Benedict's markets themselves as celiac-friendly.  They label their menu items GF when appropriate and even serve gluten-free pancakes.  This gives a false sense of confidence in this restaurant to people with this dietary issue.  

Whether it is a failure in communication or a serious lack of attention to detail, I seriously doubt it only extends to food preparation.  Based on my experience in the industry, a kitchen staff that fails to make orders correctly and a service/managerial staff that fails to notice these mistakes are also neglecting food safety and cleanliness requirements.  I do not feel like the people working at or running this place care enough about the quality of their food or service to be earning my business.

We come here every week with the family and love the staff! We love the specials that seems to go with the seasons so we are never bored. The place is always hopping so when we go there we eat and socialize for a bit then leave so the next people can eat. I just wish some of these people( woman especially) would do the same. There is a Starbucks next door that they can catch up on the gossip. This is thee best place to eat in Crystal Lake. Happy New Year Benedicts and thanks for always giving us good service as well as amazing food.
Finally tried Benedicts for dinner...........it wasn't horrible....but it's a much better vibe at breakfast......

We went for breakfast and were not disappointed. Beignet appetizer is a must! So many delicious options from slow cooked apple oatmeal to Strata's and everything in between.  I opted for the seasonal Benny. Eggs were perfectly poached. Everyone at the table was  pleased with the taste,  quality, and overall experience.

I have been coming to La Strata for breakfast for about 3 years now.. The first time was during Crystal Lake's Johnny Appleseed Festival when me and my mother ate breakfast before walking around the fest. 

We were fawning over the breakfast menu for a good 10 minutes. They have every egg dish you would ever want, as well as every pancake, waffle, and skillet options. I haven't been brave (or hungry) enough for the Bavarian skillet. From what I remember it has like full sized bratwursts, onions, potatoes, swiss cheese all ontop of eggs.. This menu has something for every type of breakfast diner. 

They also serve Intelligentsia coffee (and also give you your own carafe) with freshly made beignets, covered in powdered sugar.. It really is a treat! 

My favorite time to go is during fall, you can sit out in the screened patio, with the nice fall breeze, sipping their delicious coffee. It is a great start to the weekend!

My family has been coming here for the past 5 years for breakfast on the weekends.  We've been to every breakfast place around, but this is the best in the Crystal Lake area.  The coffee is great and the skillets are always a good choice.

We stopped by here on our way back from a wedding in the burbs. It was the perfect way to cure our champagne hangovers.

Definitely a hidden gem in the area, it seemed liked everyone there was a local which is always a good sign :)

Definitely pay close attention to the specials, they seem to always be changing and are worth while. My boyfriend tried the pulled pork skillet, YES pulled pork for breakfast, and was hooked. I opted for a veggie skillet and really enjoyed it, ingredients were fresh and dead on.

It sounds like the place could definitely expand, they have space outside but it was one of the 100 degree days of summer and the A/C was not working, which made it kind of brutal, but definitely understand those things happen sometimes.

Also I wish they would serve the beignets on the weekend! when else can I rationalize dessert for breakfast? definitely not on a monday...

overall a pretty good brunch spot in a cute area that you can mosey around in afterwards.

Just wanted to add that we made a point in coming back so that my family could try the beignets.  I was the only one who had had beignets before (at Cafe du Mond in New Orleans (where else!)) and had raved about them when I saw them on the menu at Benedict's.

Like everything else, Benedict's beignets were terrific!  

I'd add a 6th star if I could!  :-)

I wish I could rate it 4.25 stars.  They did some things well, but not enough for me to take a special trip back.

The Great
The service was excellent! We got there soon after opening, and I was praying that  the food would not take forever. It didn't, and our server (Alexa) was awesome for suggesting the $5 Jumbo Long Islands (choose your flavor too) while we !

The Good (chili)
The brisket chili had the perfect blend of spices, and the cornbread was tremendous!

The So-So (crab boil)
I'm a southern woman, so I have high expectations for flavor. The  crab boil was a bit mild for my taste, but Alexa helped me out with some add-on seasoning. In the future, I would hope they let seasoning really "set" before serving.

I have been excited ever since the opening to come and eat here. BBQ if my favorite food and I couldn't wait to come and try what they offered. 

My wife and I decided that on my birthday we would go celebrate and eat there together.
We showed up at 6PM and stood at the host booth atleast 5 mins where up to 8 people gathered behind us. After we were finally seated, we sat and looked at the menu. For the next 15-20 mins, we didn't have one employee come up to us. No water or beverage order taken. I sat there and heard orders around us being taken, desserts offered, checks given and taken. People who were in line after us were having their orders taken. By this time it was 6:30PM and my wife and I decided we should just leave since we wouldn't be happy even if we eventually ordered.

We went there on Saturday night during the Cubs Playoffs and they did a great job mixing in the live music with the game.  Enjoyed the vibe there and they only turned the TV volume on during the highlights and we celebrated their victory with the live act.  Very cool.  The food was good and plentiful.  I guess you just expect places like this to serve portions that only a 400 lb person would find spot on but I understand that is the nature of this type of offering. . 

I had the ribs and the chicken combo (which were served prior with bread that was soaked in garlic butter).  (Maybe carry some Tic Tacs if you are on a date.. but then again, why are you going here on your date.. )  The ribs were great and I'd order again, but the chicken could have been a bit more seasoned.  Everyone else had the pulled pork dinner and they raved so that would definitely be an option.  The drink menu was standard (but they had a few cool looking drink offerings but we drank prior so no chance to sample anything beyond beer.. this menu was perfectly fine if we were in the mood for some cocktails.   

Service with a smile.  Would come again if we venture out that way again.

Took our oldest daughter for her Birthday 10/28. From the food to the service it all was amazing. Seated right away,  received our drinks with minutes of ordering as well as our dinner. Would highly recommend this restaurant.

Possibly the best restaurant of its genre in the Schaumburg-Hoffman area, Sweet Caroline's features a wide-ranging menu that embraces and extends beyond BBQ.  The "Pick 2" and "Pick 3" options allowed us to sample several specialties.  Meals begin with a basket of warm, crusty rolls anointed with melted butter.  Our group gave unanimous thumbs-up to the smoky BBQ chicken, ribs, fried chicken, snow crab legs, shrimp, tender brisket, and lobsta roll.  Generous sides were good to excellent.  Our enthusiastic server was quick to deliver, answer questions, and offer suggestions.

And the decor:  Just another rustic sports bar with jumbo TV screens and a party atmosphere?   Actually it's very well done, several notches above most BBQ joints.  Sweet Caroline's is part of Ala Carte Entertainment, which brought us other places we enjoy including Moretti's and The Snuggery (hey folks, how about expanding the craft beer selection?).

This place was amazing! 

First time here and wow...

1- upon arrival and place looking very clean and inviting, with outdoor seating.

2-live music and tv to watch sports.

3-staff super attentive to our table and friendly

4-there was a food and drink special menu "very nice"

5- we ordered and seafood dinner and it was huge we couldn't believe the amount of food plus it was beyond delicious. 

6- drinks were super yummy and right on point.

7- very casual place and relaxing. I enjoyed very much my visit here and I will return. I recommend this spot for a cool outdoor date. :)

I hope to get in to this joint and try the full experience. 

I had a rack of ribs from this place at the Schaumburg Septemberfest and I was very pleased. The rib meat was excellent, the sauce was excellent, and they were cooked to near perfection. They were a little on the small side, but I will attribute that to fair food. I hope to get into this place soon and have the full effect.

Interestingly decorated BBQ place. Great atmosphere.  I had the chicken and waffles and my wife had a combo plate so that we could sample different items.  The BAM BAM shrimp appetizer was 1/2 price so I started off with that.  We were there early on a weekday afternoon so it was pretty quite.  They were playing some great blues music throughout the restaurant. The shrimp was amazing. Dressing not to spicy and served on a bed of cabbage slaw. 

It was the first time I had eaten chicken and waffles so I wasn't sure how to eat it.  It comes with an amazing jalapeno jam, honey butter and a country gravy that I could have eaten with a spoon! The chicken was breaded and fairly large.  I wasn't aware that there were still bones in it which made it a bit difficult to eat while trying to cut into the waffles.   

The ribs were really good but on the short side (Only like 3-4"). They had just the right enough pull to them. Not fall off the bone but not tough at all. Very well done.  The pulled pork was ok. Not exceptional in any respect.  The brisket fell far short of my expectations.  Thinly sliced.  Fairly salty. Not much smoked flavor.  Didn't even look appealing for a piece of meat that had been smoked for hours.

Service was friendly and polite.

All in all I hope to return to explore the menu a bit more.

Had reservations still had to wait 30 minutes with no comfortable seating. Don't offer reservations if you can't keep up. And there should be more sitting space for people waiting. Ridiculous how tight it was. Food was great tho.

Friday at 5pm I called their main number for carry out. A voice said press 1 for carry out or delivery. I press 1 and there's no answer. A voice says press 0 for the operator. I press 0 and no answer and the voice comes on again. I press 0 again and no answer and i get the voice mail again. I hang up.

I wait 10 minutes and try it again, same thing, no answer from 1 or 0.

I call again and this time I press 2 to talk to a manger. I told the person who answered what just happened and they said that's because they are on another line. She transfers me and I place my order.

I go to pick up my order and the hostess told me carry out is around the corner to the right. I start walking around the building and the hostess came outside and said, no over there. She pointed at Moretti's Pizza. Sure enough, you pick up your Sweet Caroline's carryout at the Moretti's pizza carry out entrance.

The coconut onion rings were really big and coating was a bit over cooked which made it as hard as a rock in spots. They should make them smaller. The chicken wings were cooked well but didn't really have a lot of flavor which I expected with a dry rub. The shrimp and ribs were excellent. I could tell their sauces were homemade. The tarter sauce, sweet salsa and ranch sauce were also excellent.

Very busy night ,   Dinner took a while but the wait was worth it, the Cajun halibut special was wonderful ... the Cubs special Long Island Iced Tea was  good too ... special thanks to John the Manager for his extra special attention.

SO GOOD SO GOOD

I was singing like Neil Diamond by the end of the night. If you watch the Yelp video I posted you will hear my singing talents as I belt out, "Bop Bop Bop!" & "So Good. So Good!" Look out American Idol & The Voice I'm coming for you next. Yelpers start voting on my video now. Actually Friday nights are a lot of fun here. They have the "Live Pete Show" & he plays music from 5pm to 10:30pm. The guy is magical & smooth when he sings. I felt like I was listening to the coolest CD ever. Pete is a performer from his ultra cool jacket to the old time microphone. I could listen to this guy sing all night. In fact, we ended having a three hour fantastic dinner. 

When you walk in, you will notice all of the cool antique memorabilia on the walls. My favorite item was the giant neon Blatz beer sign hanging in the middle of the room. I want this in my house. This place has such a fantastic feel inside plus they had great holiday decorations. I loved how the restaurant was like a giant loft with the bar in the dinning room. It just added to the fun atmosphere.  Everyone in the restaurant could hear Live Pete playing music but it wasn't very loud, so we could still enjoy having a great dinner conversation without yelling across the table. 

When we sat at our table I notice that the  chairs were incredibly comfortable. It had taken us an hour from downtown Chicago to get here and when we sat in our seats it was so enjoyable. I didn't mind sitting down again. 

We started out with some cocktails. I ordered the hand crafted blackberry bourbon smash which was fantastic. I loved how the drink wasn't overly sweet and it was a great way to start my evening. We also ordered the Maryland lump crab cake & I will tell you it was one of the best crab cakes I've had in Chicago. It stands up above all of the fancy downtown joints. In fact, I liked this one the best cause it had a little spice to it. The chef hit it out of the park with this amazing opening dish. If I walked away now, I would be a happy man. There was also a side of coleslaw which was delicious with a nice spice to it. My little one started out with the clam chowder and it was phenomenal. I love that she is such a foodie. 

I was in need of a second cocktail when I decided to go with the Ginger Crush. I was in love with this drink & I would be enjoying it for the rest of the night. When I find a drink I love why would I choose anything else. This cocktail is very similar to a Moscow mule but made with tequila, fresh lemon, mint & ginger. This is my summer drink! I can't wait to come back here when it's warmer & drink this on the great outdoor patio. 

I loved the kids menu. We typically do not order off of it but my little one saw Filet Mignon on there & she had to have it. I feel sorry for her boyfriend cause she's not going to be a fast food date. I was really impressed with the steak. It came with two petite pieces and ranch fries. They even cooked it perfectly for a child. It was done medium & not dried out. The chef knew the timing on cooking the steak & I was happy cutting it up for her. My little one also jumped into the garlic butter bread rolls. We got three for the table but for some reason I only got one bite. My little one loves bread. These rolls reminded me of the addictive buns you get at Bob Chinn's. I wish I would have asked for another basket cause they were very good. 

For our entrees I went with the Shrimp Creole which was delish. I loved all of the spices. I could have used some of that bread to soak up the yummy sauce. The sauce was made with butter, beer & Cajun spices. I wish I had a shot glass of it to toast the table. The entree came with a choice of two sides & I went with the Mac N Cheese & the chili. The Mac N Cheese was creamy & yummy. I wished I had more. My side was a tease & I'm going to need to come back here for a full bowl. I was really impressed with the deep red chili with chunks of beef brisket. Again I can not wait to come back here for a giant bowl of this. 

My wife decided to go with the fish of the day. It was a grouper with a white wine sauce, fresh tomato, avocado over green & white asparagus & a fantastic polenta. My wife doesn't like polenta & she dived in. I'm a huge polenta fan & I couldn't stop stealing it off her plate. She had three giant pieces & I was able to steal about 2.4 of it. I'm lucky she didn't poke me with her butter knife. I really loved her fish & the sauce worked great on it. I wish that this dish was always on the menu cause it was a winner & I would drive out here for it. 

We were almost ready to throw in the towel when we had a family discussion for dessert. My wife and I were voting for key lime pie & our little one was voting for fresh hot maple bacon donuts. Our waiter Zack who was now a part of our family was voting for donuts, so we got both. Wow those donuts are magical! What a perfect ending for dinner. We'll be back soon with Neil Diamond at our table

I reviewed Sweet Caroline's and gave it 5 stars and they started Brunch now on Saturdays and Sundays (10-2) and we went yesterday and they maintain their 5 star rating.

Not many patrons when we went (10AM) and the service was attentive.  The brunch menu has a combination of traditional breakfast dishes along with BBQ options.  I had a skillet that had potatoes, cheese, roasted pablano peppers, brisket and a couple of eggs.  It was the best skillet I ever had.

Midway through, we were brought biscuits and gravy to try.  The biscuits were made fresh and were fluffy.  The gravy was perfect and had a hint of smokiness.  Best I've had.

I thought Sweet Caroline's was a great place for dinner.  Now I've added brunch to that list.  first rate in every regard.

Awesome service by Mark and the manager John. We walked in on Friday night with a party of 8. The manager John advised us of the wait and kept updating us. Fantastic, John knows customer service! And Mark our server was phenomenal! From great recommendations to a wonderful smile. This was our first time here and we will absolutely be coming back!

What a fun place!  This place has tons going on and it's all good!  Southern BBQ place with great entertainment and incredible specials every day.   Been here for lunch, happy hour and brunch.  All good from service to food to decor of place.  Hoffman Estates has a winner!  Omelettes are great, so are chicken and waffles and their southern skillet!  Calamari and shrimp....yum!  Pete the entertainer on Friday evenings is a blast.  Go here if you are bored with your normal places.  You will love it!

Tried this place for the first time a week or so ago. Our server Matt was great. Nice guy and he was super knowledgeable about the menu. Which was great since it was our first time. 
The brisket was super good & so we're the ribs I heard. 
The decor is nice. If you're looking for a place with a bar, this is probably a good place for you. Their bar takes up a huge part of the restaurant with plenty of seating. 
Will be back. :)

Was here on 10/11 with two friends. We all loved the food and the BBQ was very tasty. I did the combo platter and the smashed sweet potatoes and was very pleased. Everyone enjoyed their selections and sides.  We also ended up ordering two orders of the fried pickles - they are some of the best we have had in a very long time... Those vanished quickly from the table :)

They had a large party at some high top tables by the bar. Even with that group of people we still had plenty of attention from the wait staff. 

I would go back again and recommend you give them a try. I wish they had a booth set up vs. all tables. 

PS love that the BBQ is in bottles on the tables so you can do the taste test first.... Also saw some gambling machines on they way out so maybe you will win enough to come back a second night :)

Enjoy...

We were driving west on 90 headed to Mitsuwa and saw the billboard for this place.  The husband loves BBQ, so it was a done deal.  I was pleasantly surprised at what was in store.  It was Sunday, do brunch was still on, but the full menu was also available.  I got a shrimp po boy and some cheesy grits I could share with the kids.  Kids got a waffle with strawberry sauce and sausage patties.  Husband went for the ribs with sweet potatoes.  The sandwich was delicious (get the spicy keeper sauce on the side) and the girls ate everything on their plates as well as a lot of the grits.  Great service and all of this was under $50!  Husband thought the ribs were just okay (i.e. He wouldn't make the drive for them).

Ok did this joint last night...wasn't impressed with the Q! Pork used for the sliders was dry they load the sandwich with slaw to mask it. Thumbs down on the beans also pretty much ho hum. The crab cakes were just ok, sorry they should be outstanding when it's used in your name, "sorry maybe that's just me"! Everything is over salted my guess is to drive you to the bar.

On a good note the Mac was pretty good as were the rolls in garlic oil along with the service received.

To wrap this one up...bit pricy for the overall quality of what I tried. I might be fun for a night out drinking and snacking.

This place can much better if the bar area just had more energy, enthusiasm, and overall awareness.   Was really painful to sit there for more than 20 min.  Felt like I was always waiting to ask for something and there were 2 additional workers conversing with each other pretty much the entire time.  I could have easily stayed another 15-20 minutes ordering another drink but wasn't feeling it.

I had a very fun experience as well as a tasty experience  
One of the best clam chowder's that I have ever had . 
Buffalo shrimp is delicious  our server was great  The restaurant has a fun atmosphere very clean barbecue was great not one complaint!!!!
Fun place to go.   Great food, excellent service,  live music, sports on tv, and fun atmosphere.   The mgr.here is awesome!!!!!!!   Go as a group. Wonderful drink specials.

I tend to be very hard on BBQ restaurants because my husband and I had a BBQ competition team and I'm picky! But Sweet Caroline's passed with flying colors!

We did not order any seafood, just brisket, pulled pork and ribs. Our sides were BBQ beans, Mac and cheese and corn bread. The amount of smoke was just right, you tasted it but it was not bitter. The meat was a touch over cooked if you were in competition but it was tender, juicy, and flavorful. The ribs were very small, like a Danish cut. The bones were maybe 2.5 -3 inches long; but great taste. The dinner came with tasty rolls and Texas Toast. 

Our sides were delicious! I'd drive an hour for the corn bread alone! It comes freshly baked in a skillet with maple butter.  The beans were mild with a touch of smoke. The Mac and cheese was creamy and sooooo good! 

The atmosphere is a cross of Joe's Crab Shack and Famous Dave's. There is live entertainment on weekends.

I went here for my birthday with my boyfriend. We didn't make reservations but it was a Thursday. We were seated right away no line.  We sat outside. There was live music inside which we could still hear and see just fine and that was nice.  I did get the crab and he got BBQ chicken and brisket. The Brisket was killer. The Chicken was pretty good too, breast was a tad dry but they usually are for me. The crab was fantastic.  I enjoyed myself! I would go again :)

Just visited this restaurant with a couple of buddies and we averaged out our ratings of the food (below) in case you're wondering what to order.  Also, pushed this restaurant up to 4 stars because of the atmosphere.  Definitely comfortable.  

Bacon Maple Glazed Doughnuts - 5
Andouille Sausage - 4
Creamed Succotash - 4
Pulled Pork - 4
Coleslaw - 4
BBQ Baked Beans - 4
Key Lime Pie - 3
Ribs - 3
Crab Cake - 3
Brisket - 2
Mac-N-Cheese - 2
Nice place ,ambients of a bar ,loud with live singer  not bad music.the food is good not awesome had the crab pricey if not a thursday . Overall ,was good would go back but a weekly type of place

What an overall great experience. I went to finally try out this place since it's one of the newest in town and there aren't many unique seafood/BBQ spots in the area. 

Here are the pros: 
* Food
* Portions
* Food Options
* Location
* Parking

The food is amazing and Fresh! All the BBQ'd meats are placed on a slow cooker/roaster for about 14 hours so the meat has amazing flavor no matter what meat option you choose. 

You also get to use 3 different types of BBQ sauce to perfect your flavor experience to your liking. 

You also get treated to complimentary garlic rolls. These are amazing! They a baked at the restaurant and pretty much made to order. So the bread is soft and flavorful! You may feel questionable about the quantity they give (1 roll per guest) but trust me you'll be fine. 

When it comes to the actual dinner. The portions are really good and very fair for the price you pay. I went with the "Pick 2" option and I picked the pulled pork (cooked great and so tender) and half rack of ribs (Ribs were also tender and flavorful) I had more then enough to take home and the price was very decent. 

Save room for desert! You have to try the Bacon Maple Donuts! Holy $hit! So good! You get donuts and bacon and it's also dessert! What's not to like? 

Cons: 
* Wait times during the Weekend
* Queuing System

If you plan of going FRI, SAT, or SUN. It will benefit you if you reserve a spot ahead of time. The wait time was longer then quoted at the host table and they seem to give shorter wait times to parties of 4 or more VS parties of 2.  As we were seated (party of 2) after groups of 4 who checked in after us. 

The queuing system seems to need some work. Either the system they use or the users who are using it. 

All reservations are made with an app service called "NOWAITAPP" which prompts you for a phone number to book your reservation. Which in turn you get an SMS confirmation and another SMS notification when your table is ready. 

We didn't seem to get the notification that our table was ready so we are assuming the hosts were having issues with the check in system and when manual to some degree. 

Will I got back? Sure! Just during a time where it's not too busy.

The brisket was smoked perfectly and we had three different BBQ sauces to choice from.

Kathy had a lobster roll and Tim had Cajun shrimp.
