Large portion slow cooked pulled pork was tangy and sweet topped with crispy battered onions and coke slaw. Many drink options, moonshine mixers to margaritas. Booths and tables. Nice country-woods decor. Our waiter was friendly, offered suggestions, and kept our drinks full and the table clean. Next time I'll try the brisket and a moonshine drink.

Warning, this may be long! :) Yesterday was my third Sunday in a row visiting The Still. My boyfriend plays on a softball team and after the games some of us will go out for dinner. We thought The Still was our new place. I want this review to be as fair as possible, as I really love small local businesses and that's why we were so excited about The Still in the first place. That's why I'm giving them 3 stars instead of letting my feelings get the best of me and giving 1 star. 

Our first visit was great. We all enjoyed our meals, had great service and tried a few fun drinks. I asked about a drink menu and was told they were working on one. Our second visit was okay as well. Our waitress was less informed and pretty shy this time. They still didn't have a drink menu and she really didn't have any drink suggestions for us. The food was still good. We really liked the fried pickles, and the smoked sausage. I tried the broasted chicken this visit and it was just ok. The chicken itself was really tasty and juicy, but the broasted portion wasn't great. Boyfriend had the ribs and those were pretty good. 

Our third visit was yesterday. We came with a group of 12. We all ordered drinks, appetizers and meals. The first problem we noticed was how warm it was inside, I'm normally freezing all the time and even I was uncomfortable. The guys in our group were all sweating. We asked about the air and was told it was on, but not working very well. No huge deal, things happen. Our sweet waitress apologized. Where things started going wrong was when our food started coming out. Entrees were brought to our party 1 at a time, and all of them a couple minutes a part. Not one of us was served at the same time. Eventually 20 minutes later everyone in my party of 12 had food. All but two people had finished their meals.  Problem was I still wasn't served mine. Nobody even acknowledged us to say 'I'm sorry, the rest of your meals will be right up'. The people in our party who did have their food felt bad eating before everyone was served. At this point I didn't even want my food anymore. It still hadn't come, everyone else was done eating and I just didn't want to sit there and eat by myself. So when the owner walked by I stopped her and let her know what was happening. I told her that we had already been there for 90 min, everyone had eaten and I still didn't have my food. I told her that I just didn't want my meal anymore. I didn't yell at her, I didn't speak rudely. I simply let her know what was happening. The response I got from her was shocking. I wasn't offered an apology of any kind. Instead I was made to feel like a jerk for even letting her know. She very sternly (that's putting it nicely) told me that the kitchen was short staffed because of the holiday weekend, they couldn't keep up, they were doing the best they could. I wish I could properly describe the inflection and tone in her statement. She walked away offering no form of an apology. I sat there shocked feeling like she expected an apology from me for visiting her restaurant on a holiday weekend, as if my patronage of her restaurant was a big inconvenience. Im not responsible for staffing her kitchen. A few minutes later she walked by our table and without even stopping she 'aggressively' stated (I have no idea how else to explain it) that she took my drink, appetizer and my unserved meal off our tab). She didn't even stop to personally address me, just kept walking as she said it and again, no apology. My entire table of 12 was shocked. We couldn't believe how unfairly rude she was to me. Our waitress heard the way the owner spoke to us and she immediately came over and apologized to us, she seemed incredibly embarrassed. I should add that our waitress that day was great, very sweet.  

In the end, the owner handled the mistake accordingly by removing a drink and appetizer from our tab, I take that as the apology. However she did this very begrudgingly and with total disdain for myself. There was never a verbal apology. When I let her know there was an issue she immediately jumped to the defense. This is not customer service. I had even let her know that this was our third visit since they opened just a month ago. None of that seemed to matter to her. She didn't seem to appreciate the fact that we came with 12 people who could have become regular guests. When opening a new business, word of mouth is everything. Great customer service and a smile really go a long way. This all could have been resolved with a simple apology, a smile and a correction. Instead it looks like they lost our continued business. There was just no reason for things to have happened as they did.

Take this with a grain of salt since we went there the first week they were open. Food? Bad, overcooked, TOUGH brisket. Seriously folks, it's BBQ it's not that hard. Second... Prices... Outrageous. There are a LOT better places around. Charging $7 for "Hillbilly Salsa" or whatever that was ? That's nuts. A small bowl of chips and "Sorry, I have to charge you for more chips? That's insulting.

Drinks... meh, just some made up stuff.

Waitstaff, not good. Poorly managed. Maybe they'll get it right. I hope so, but if they don't change the prices, they'll be gone by March.

I've been to better. The wait staff was very good. The ribs were ok - tender. The pulled pork and the beef brisket were nothing to write home about. Both sandwiches needed a lot more meat. The brisket meat was fatty and sparse. I expected barbeque sauce on the table - none was to be found. For a place called 'The Still' they didn't have a printed drink menu - at least none was offered to me or my three friends.  There was plenty of parking. I won't be going back.

Good food. Good service. Good prices. Has the potential to become the new local favorite!
My biggest concern was the initial description I read touting it as a liquor-themed establishment -  not at all the kind of place Bartlett needs. It's actually very family friendly (the bar is separated from the dining area) and the focus is really on the smoked pork and other Tennessee-themed menu options. The moonshine is just an excellent bonus & deviates from the same ol' beer & wine menu in most restaurants.
The decor is a little bland, but I'm sure the character of the interior will develop as does the clientele.

So I've tried The Still twice now, and it's pretty good.  So far I've had the brisket and the brisket sandwich, plus I've tried the chicken, pulled pork, and chicken fingers.
The brisket was really good, not the best I've ever had, but smoky, tasty and if you live near Bartlett, you should like it.  I tasted the chicken and pork and they were good too but I like the brisket better.
Each meat came in a different sauce and all were delicious, either having smoke, tang, or heat.  The brisket sandwich made me not hate pretzel buns and join the rest of society but it was a little fattier than just ordering the meal.  The baked beans side is just average, the cornbread is very good, and the cole slaw you're on your own...I hate coleslaw more than Mondays. The chicken fingers are fantastic!  They're juicy and delicious and the batter is not like normal batter....it's light and airy and very good.
As for the place itself.  It's kinda weird.  The decor....well, it's not good.  The place is small and looks like a cafeteria a little bit. Someone said a wood floor would change the whole place and they were right.  There's a small bar in a different room so family types won't have to put up with you lonely drinker types and vice versa.  It looks nice but I didn't try it.  By the way, don't let the term moonshine scare you.  I tried two of their speciality drinks, both of which were refreshing and not boozy tasting at all.
The staff is friendly, but there's a blond lady there who, while friendly, seems awkward around people....I think she's one of the owners. The only advice I can give them is that sometimes they are a little light on the sauce for my taste. I wish they'd put some bottles of each sauce on the table so you could try them all and as much as you want.
All in all the place is a little pricey but definitely worth a try.  I know I'll be going back there more often.

We came in here a couple of weeks ago. There was a 30 minute or so wait. We went to the bar area which is very small. We stood for a while and finally a large group that had been in the seating area left...and left a huge mess. We sat in the midst of dirty glasses. No one came to pick them up. Gross. Once seated, we received our menus from the hostess but waited about another ten minutes for our waitress. In the middle of trying to order, she was called over to take the check from another table, and then went to another table to take their order! She didn't come back for another ten minutes! The food was decent, not spectacular, but the service was horrible. We will try them again sometime since there are so few restaurants in Bartlett and will hope it has improved.

Went there tonight for the first time. Just had the trio sleds and onion ring with ranch jalape̱o dipping sauce. Green line beer and a moonshine drink with pineapple and coconut liqueur. Service was excellent. Food was tasty , especially the brisket slider. Drinks great.  Prices right. Going back for a second time soon for the full dinner experience. Love the ambiance of a Texas smokehouse in Bartlett. This is a must try.

The Bbq is great and the moonshine drink specials awesome!  My husband had the brisket platter which was the most tender and flavorful I've had in a long time!  I went with the Georgia pulled chicken sandwich which was incredible. The blackberry Tennessee moonshine went down too easily!  Service was good but even though it is a small space, the waitstaff seemed a little stretched. The lack of five stars is because we had an issue with a wrong side order. They corrected it without an issue but the right side came well into our meal. Definitely a place we will frequent.

My husband and I stopped in Saturday to watch the World Cup game.  Nice, clean bar.  Moonshine lemonade was refreshing.  We tried the pulled pork nachos, pitchfork salad and Smokey Mountain Combo.  All were delicious.  Can't wait to go back and try some more Moonshine and BBQ.

A 3-part country eatery. Carryout - Restaurant - Separate bar room on the right. Angry orchard & two Revolution brewery taps (anti-hero & rosa) 7 different moonshines & got to see an old fashion made in front of me.

So far so good foodwise. Had the Moonshine Burger (beef, applewood smoked bacon, fried egg, grilled ham) with sweet potato fries. Cooked medium it was a very tasty dish.

Good staff, clean, family & after party friendly. A good place to pop in bartlett.

Stopped in at their bar. Had a Tennessee Lemonade which was very good. $7 a mason jar seemed a little bit high as it wasn't really that strong.  To each their own though, right?  Bartender was pleasant but kind of distant. she Thought I was there for take out.  Had the pulled pork sandwich. Came in like 5 minutes literally. Was pretty good, glad the bartender recommended some bbq sauce on it as it needed it. The sweet potato waffle fries weren't great though. 
Bar Atmosphere was just okay. Very small. They had two tvs. One had on shark tank the other had on Mash and Andy Griffith. Why?  Seemed to have a younger crowd there, I left early cause I was sick of watching black and white reruns.  Seems like if you are going to the bar, you might want to reconsider a go and into the dining room. Seems strange for a place whose schtick is moonshine.
These are all relatively minor characters complaints. The bbq was good, and that matters!
Finally some good Bbq and broasted chicken in the area. Arrive early if you want to miss the crowd. Give the sliders a try too. First time here and so far so good.

Southern hospitality and Sweet sweet moonshine. I recommend the Mac n Cheese. And the chicken fingers. And white lightening. And moonshine cherries. Excellent  service. I also feel like I got a real value for my dollar. I hope the place thrives. Just off the Bartlett train stop. Cozy, comfortable and delicious. I'll be back over and over again.

Bottom line for me - when the owner/staff is rude, I'll go elsewhere. We've been to The Still several times in the past year - the food ranged from good to just okay, depending on the visit. However, our friends (very sweet, polite people) were treated badly, where a member of the staff wasn't content to be rude in the restaurant, but chased them into the parking lot with insults - all because they preferred not to wait for a table. That's enough for me, and, our neighbors - we'll go elsewhere. Bartlett needs more restaurants, ones that care.
We've had the ribs and brisket and both were great along with the Mac n cheese. Awesome to have a great BBQ joint in the neighborhood.

Had dinner tonight for my husband's birthday.  Our server Amanda was terrific!  All 3 of us thought the food was delicious.  I had 1/2 slab of ribs with the loaded baked potato.   It also comes with a little square of cornbread a small side of baked beans and cole slaw.  The ribs fell off the bone.  The sauce was smokey and sweet at the same time.  Loved the slaw and happy we ordered extra.  My son had the flatbread bbq chicken with fried onions.   Also great.  My husband had the cheeseburger.  Simple yet so many places do not get his order correct!  He loved it.  Our drinks were refilled in a timely manner.  We are all looking forward to our leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  

They were busy.  The owner was helping deliver food drinks and make change.  Nice to see the teamwork!  We will definitely be back and I highly suggest all of you Bartletters to pay them a visit.

We went to lunch at the still twice last week, and we liked the food, although we were the only people in the place. We decided to go back tonight and had a bizarre experience, and based on other reviews I can see that this is a common theme.
We walked in and saw about 8 tables occupied, by no means a full house. We waited at the door a few minutes while trying to determine if we should take a seat. 2 waitresses walked past us but no acknowledgment, so we started walking to a table. A waitress passed and I looked at her and said " sit anywhere? " she ignored me like I was invisible. We sat and watched them walk back & forth, trying to make eye contact, even when they served the table right next to us. It was as if they wanted to teach us a lesson for seating ourselves. Another group walked in and they were seated almost immediately, and drink orders taken. After about 10 minutes of that we walked out. I've never walked out of a restaurant until tonight. Sorry to say I would never go back or take a chance on recommending this possible experience to someone else.

It was  crowded the night we went so we were told it would be a 15 minute wait but we could sit in the bar if we wanted to. That was fine with us . We were the only customers in the bar . There was no bartender to be seen. After approximately 10 minutes a woman did come into the bar, stood right in front of us, did not greet us, made several drinks and left the bar. Another group came into the bar and still no bartender. At about 15 minutes we were told  by another staff person that our table would be ready soon. My husband asked if we could order a drink and the server said."Oh I'll find the barteender". Finally the women who had previously made drinks behind the bar came in and took my husbands order.  We were seated.  When the waitress came to our table I asked to see a drink menu. She said they did not have one yet and "we are  working on it". When I asked what their speciality drink was, she said "one made with our moonshine". I asked what was in it. She told me "moonshine, lemonaide and Amaretto"  I said  I didn't like Amaretto. She never mentioned any other drinks so I just ordered water. I ordered the surf and turf which was catfish and brisket, my husband ordered the smoked turkey sandwich.  He said the turkey was good. My brisket was very tough, some bites so tough I couldn't even chew them. My catfish was bland and nothing special. My side of coleslaw was very small, about 2 tablespoons. They gave me more tarter sauce than coleslaw. The slaw was bland. The side of baked beans was good as well as the sweet potato fries. 
While we were eating multiple groups came it. Some were greeted by a staff person, others looked around for a hostess, saw none and seated themselves. One couple who had been waiting awhile for a hostess, finally seated themselves at one of the 2 empty tables. They were told by the bartender lady they couldn't sit there because another couple had been there ahead of them. They said no, that they had been there first, which they had.  The bartender woman didn't appear to believe them. They left the restaurant.   
Overall the service was very poor and the food nothing special. The owner seemed nice. We overheard him talking to some customers near us.  When our waitress asked how our food was and I said that my brisket was very tough, she made no comment.
I came here for the first time and was pleasantly surprised. The ribs and burgers were delicious! Veronica was our server and was friendly and helpful. Will definitely be returning soon!

We like to eat and shop in our little town of Bartlett, however, we really don't have a lot to choose from.  Some places are good, most not so good.  We've been wanting to try The Still Bar and Grill for some time now but were hesitant.  We finally went last night.  Let.  Me.  Tell.  You.  This place is fantastic.  The food - SO good!  The service - awesome.  The ambiance - comfortable.  I ordered the Nashville Nachos and my husband ordered the Smoky Mountain Combo, which was pulled pork, beef brisket and sausage.  His came with sweet corn bread, mashed potatoes and baked beans.  (Those beans... YUM!  And I hate beans.)  Mine came with bbq chicken, hillbilly caviar (corn and black bean salsa), colby jack cheese and coleslaw on top.  I also had the homemade key lime pie for dessert.  The price was reasonable , the staff was friendly and the food was great.  We'll be going again.... and again.... and again.

Mixed feelings - Disappointed with food. The place is tiny. The bar was small but cozy. The bartender was very nice after we got to talking with her. We will sure give this place another shot just because we really did like the atmosphere. Good drinks. Food- hubby ordered chili, he likes spicy food, but he said it was awfully hot, like someone dumped a cup of jalapeno seeds and a whole bottle of hot sauce in it, so hot in flavor he couldn't eat it!!  He got 3 tablespoons down and the rest went to waste. I told him to tell bartender (we ate in the bar) but he didn't want to make a fuss.  I ordered BBQ wings.  They brought me Hot wings. That's not what I ordered, but I just got off of work and I was starving and couldn't wait any longer. So that was bad but then....The wings were really bad, so dried out, so small!  Seriously the wings seemed to have been made days prior, then flash fried just to make them hot. There was little meat and the meat that was on the wings was completely dried out.  We also ordered the onion straw stack which was very delicious.  This place is worthy of 1 more try - I hope NOT to be disappointed.  There was a "regular" there, who said all the food was awesome. His burger looked great, so we'll give it one more chance.....
We had a very enjoyable time here.  The owner was very sociable and the food was delicious.  This place was very clean and we will definitely return soon.
I've been here a couple times. Nice little place for good food and drinks. Service is great and it's more down home type of place to have a nice relaxed time.

We stopped in on a week night and there was a pretty decent crowd.  My wife got the chicken and I got some pulled pork.  For the price paid both were decent but nothing amazing.  Not a place to go out of your way for but in the polar vortex of good restaurants it's nice to have a decent option other than TLs.

When walking in is a bit odd, you walk right into the dining area, no where to stand/wait. After being seated the staff was very friendly, drink menus are reasonably priced and the food is good as well. I'll be heading back.

Friday Fish Fry, yes!! Blue Gill....Orgasmic

French fries were good not great. Grilled Cheese was excellent. Clam Chowder was good also. I would definitely stop here again.
Terrific joint!    We had a group of 10 last night.   The staff was very friendly and accommodating.    Food was excellent.  Great sandwiches and tacos.   Service was great!

The atmosphere here is wonderful,
Fun and inviting! The food is typical bar food but on the high end of that spectrum. This is a lively place and a great place for visiting with friends or a family night out. The summers are especially alive with a lovely porch and outside games.

Not sure what all the rave reviews were about. Brought the whole family with anticipation that the fish fry was the best ever.  Definitely disappointed. Not something to go back to.  Definitely not for the price.  Just ok bar food.  And mediocre fish fry cod.  Not going back.  Service was good. I think after reading all the reviews and driving 40 minutes I was expecting more.

First time here. Typical local tavern. Exactly what we were hoping for. Reminds me of a bar in the Northwoods. We're a family of four, ordered 3 burgers, and one turkey wrap. Everything was excellent. Highly recommend this place.
fantastic neighborhood place, great outside area, good food, service in a cozy clean rustic environment. one of my favorites
The BEST Ruben sandwich!!! Always love going there when I am in town. Great food and service

I have been to Schmidt's three times, tried different things, and it has always been the best experience. The hamburgers are among the best I've tasted (why I'm yelping today on National Hamburger Day) with bacon from Reams meat market (also the best at what they do, by the way) The fish fry is outstanding with several seafood selections.  I have loved the bluegill, swai, and walleye.  If you like the "Wisconsin lakeside" fish fry, but don't want to drive north of the cheddar curtain, you need to come to Schmidt's.  

There is likely a 20 minute wait on Friday nights, as the fish fry is extremely popular.  Ice cold beer,  a veranda and outdoor area, give you a perfect place to hang and wait until your "blinker" goes off.  We have always had the most courteous and enjoyable wait staff at Schmidt's.
Great bloody Mary's and our server  Nicole was great!!!I recommend the mega bloody and I heard the wings have a great smokey flavor!!!!

Excellent fresh food, attentive bar tenders, just all around great people -LOVE THIS PLACE!! Had the mushroom cheddar burger with homemade coleslaw and cranberry martini- both things not on the menu and made to order with NO complaints! Great place for Buckeye fans - will put the game on for you no questions asked

Went to Schmidt's based on other reviews. They were right. Great little local restaurant. Nice evening to sit outside. Service was great and the burger was too notch. Will certainly go back. Highly recommend......you won't be disappointed.

Lunch was fine, but nothing to write home about.  With more time, we would've driven someplace with better options, but we were on a schedule, so we figured Schmidt's would do.  Service was decent, but I hate places that serve on paper plates.  I'm ok with paper napkins (since I go through a lot of them), but seriously, please give me a real plate and a knife that's not plastic.

The wings were good, though the server looked at us like we were nuts when we asked for some of all of the sauces (a $0.50 charge for each, I think).  My chef salad was decent, but nothing I couldn't have made at home, and I don't like when salads are artfully arranged on a plate with dressing on the side -- I like to mix my dressing in evenly, and I end up flinging salad all over the place trying to do that.

Final note, they need a larger ladies' room.  Two stalls is just not enough, guys.  The dead animals all over the walls of the restaurant were a nice touch though, confirming that yes, you are in the middle of nowhere.  Decent enough for where it is, but nothing special.

Love this place! I have never had a bad meal or bad service here. 

My man and I frequent this place often due to that fact it's motorcycle friendly and has an amazing outdoor patio and space. They even have bags if you want to play. 

The outdoor bar/TVs are great for summer/early fall sports games and relaxing. 

The service has always been great as well. The girls are sweet, attentive, and friendly. Never had a service issue. Great job everyone! 

The menu has excellent choices, great variety, and something for everyone. Portions are average to large. 

I can't complain about any of the different choices we have ever tried.  It's all been very good. We love swinging by Schmidt's during our rides.

They have an impressive fish fry on Fridays and bloody marys on Sundays! I have a hard time deciding to go here or to Eddie's because both have such awesome food and options for adding garnishes to the bloodys.

Absolutely LOVE going here! The food is great - Jimmy is an AWESOME cook! - and the waitresses are always on cue and care about the customers! I love the patio in the summer too! I recommend Schmidt's to everyone!

3.5 stars for Sunday lunch.  2 beer battered cod sandwiches.  Bun lightly buttered and toasted.  Very nice. Big piece of fish with a dense, hard batter.  If you like the light and fluffy batter, this is not for you.  (Maybe our fish was twice fried?)  Excellent 5 star cole slaw.  Fries were ok.  I opted for chips.  Not home made.  Deluxe side set up of lettuce, tomato and onion.   Awesome tarter sauce.  

The girls at the table next to us ordered $10 Bloody Mary drinks that were a meal in a glass.  Be sure to check out the photo I took.  Wow!

Nice place. That said, I've only been there for the Friday night fish fry. A bit high on price as fish frys go, but well done. Fast service, with a great friendly & courteous staff.  Outdoor tables with live music during the summer. Well positioned flat screen TV's inside. All age groups present, from young families to elderly couples. You'll like this place!

Yummy fish fry! Every time we've been here for the fish fry, it's been very tasty and we've always enjoyed a fresh cold beer.

Fun atmosphere!  Gets pretty crowded on Fridays, esp in summer.

I will say though that service for us has usually been pretty slow but since we get beers at the bar first we usually are too liquored up to notice (half kidding).  So I suggest going in expecting slow service but tasty food.

Stumbled in with a friend for a girls night dinner. Drinks were great. Pleasantly surprised by the martinis. We ordered a few varieties & each one was good. Dinner was decent, but nothing memorable. Service was efficient & price was right. Would frequent if I lived closer.

After moving to the area earlier this year, we've been to Schmidt's a handful of times. We love sitting on the patio to watch a Bears game or just to enjoy the nice weather. The servers have always been good to us, not sure why others found the service to be an issue. We've always ordered sandwiches or tacos on taco night. Food has always been good quality and tasty. The tenderloin and pulled pork sandwiches are my favorite. ;) Drinks are fine--we order bottled beers and they are nice and cold. We'll definitely continue visiting for good food and service in our local watering hole.

All the fish is delish! The beer battered onion rings are amazing! Some of the servers seem angry? But other than that, the food is great and live entertainment is available sometimes. Definitely go out on the patio when the weather is nice.

Let's go 3.5 Stars here/ Nice pub in Elburn with "Rustic Feel"... It's a pretty big place with a large patio as well!  Mixed clientele with lots of locals as well as people just passing thru.  Big menu/ above average Pub Grub/ Bartenders and Servers are very attentive!  Prices a bit above average as well.  As an added bonus, it's across the street from Ream's Meat Market... get dat did!

This place rocks. The atmosphere to the employees make this a place where I would frequent if it was closer to home. I was told about this ultimate Bloody Mary and I was not disappointed. It's a drink and a meal all in one. If your by Elburn or even if your not and looking for a good place to hang out and have good food check this place out.
Draft beer was cold, the burgers were awesome and so was the Reuben. Great portions. We'll be back for sure.

Had onion rings and a pork tenderloin (sandwich recommended by server) and it was really good. Service was VERY fast and our server couldn't have been more attentive. My dining partner was satisfied with her grilled cod sandwich but felt the house pico with tortilla chips was lacking. My ONLY problem was the temperature of the beer. It was Miller Lite, not a craft beer with a specific temp requirement so we wanted them COLD and a frosted glass would have been nice. The were NOT cold so tasted like we were chewing on warm bread.

Fun atmosphere but weak beer selection & yucky food. Everything tastes like cardboard & freezer burn. The animal heads on the wall are another reason this place is just not for me. Very dark inside & smells like stale beer. Would fit better in a college town where kids didn't know any better than to go here to eat & drink cheaply. Walk down the block to Eddie's...your stomach will thank you.

Very good food. Appetizers and sandwiches.  Dinner salad fresh and generous.   Prices to be expected.  Service was attentive.  Our party of 6 met here as it is mid point between our homes.  Not disappointing
No booster seats or high chairs for kids, also talked to friends who went with a party of 30 during football season and was turned away due to the size.  seems to only want to cater to select locals.

Very good bar food and a surprisingly large menu. Nice beer garden with outdoor TVs, a full service bar and entrance to restrooms. Medium noise level, just enough sound to keep it lively without disturbing your conversation or the games. I like microbrews, which they have a limited selection of. That is the only reason they do not get 5 stars.

Every time i go here it gets better and better. Had the smoked brisket chili today and it was great. Also had the brisket sandwich and it was melt in your mouth great. Wait staff is always polite and very attentive. This place is great.

I wish I could give Schmidt's more stars, but the service is hit or miss. I have been here about a half dozen times and it is not consistant at all. If you are fortunate to have Trisha or Penny for servers you will be a happy as a clam. Sunday we didn't have either of them. The girl we had was non existant with us as well as all her tables. Penny had the other half of the restaurant and her tables where doing great.  
As for the food, I don't know if the quality is slipping or the guy cooking is the issue. I had the brat burger and it was not good. The fries were dark brown to black. I know all places have their off days and I am sure this was one of those days. I know I will give them another try in the future and hope they take care of some of these problems. Then I will edit my rating.
Great homemade chips & salsa and really yummy Rueben.  Homemade coleslaw, eh....needed more vinegar.  Nice North Woods atmosphere.

All the food is really good. Monday night tacos is my favorite. I wish they'd bring back the fish tacos. Whatever chili lime sauce their chef made was good enough to bottle and sell!! Drink specials are not bad, love the live country bands they book.

Enjoyed this newer little location in Elburn. The food (burgers and fish fry were enjoyed at my table) was all delicious. Service was good, not great, but certainly attentive enough given the crowd. We will definitely be back for the fish fry (especially the blue gill) and beer in the future.
Fun place to go. Pretty tasty for bar food. Only issue is the waitresses/bartenders could be nicer. Usually every time I've been there they seem like they don't wanna be there , grouchy!

My husband raved about this place having an unbelievable beef brisket so we HAD to go check it out last weekend. 
I really, really like their outside bar area. What a nice, cozy atmosphere. The bartender was great - small bar so very attentive. We got a couple of beers and I wasn't super hungry so I ordered the chef salad and my hubby ordered, you guessed it, the brisket. 
The beef brisket came with honey mustard on it. Horrible! Even my husband was shocked. He didn't remember it being served that way in the past. And he said the quality of the meat was severely lacking. 
My salad was just ok. Mostly iceberg lettuce and overflowing the plate, which made it hard to mix up. Meh.
Pretty sweet little town bar. Very good food and great ambiance. Elburn could use more little restaurants like this. We will for sure be coming back!

We've been here a few times and it's always good - but we just tried the Friday fish fry and it was really outstanding. Schmidt's is a fun, busy place that puts you in a good mood. Our server was very friendly and attentive. Can't wait to try out the patio area this summer.

Went for dinner last night - great place! Very homey, casual atmosphere. Had an awesome waitress, wish I could remember her name - very attentive, friendly & helpful with suggestions on the menu. Quick service, but never felt hurried. Food was very good, drinks good, too. Fun place in the summer, too, with an outdoor area with bands & bags! Definitely recommend!
Great bar for cute little Elburn! I haven't had very good service, but it's a dive-y type of bar with locals and regulars. Good place for lunch.
I went there recently for lunch with a group of friends.  We all had good service and good food.    We will return.
Nice place, good food.  A true bar and grill.

We just ate lunch here today and it is now my favorite local place for a burger and a beer.  The cheeseburger was cooked exactly as I ordered, medium rare, and arrived hot and juicy on a super-fresh roll.  Skin-on fries were plentiful, crispy, and piping hot.  The other order was a grilled hot pastrami with Swiss cheese and was also very tasty. Home-made cole slaw came with both and tasted good and fresh.  Service was pleasant and attentive and the eating area clean and comfortable.  Next time we will dine out in the very attractive, new beer garden.

Drinks are fairly priced. Nice atmosphere to have drinks with friends. Food is average except for the Friday Fish Fry which is excellent. It has a wonderful outdoor area in the new beer garden. I hope the menu continues to improve & also give more food choices.

Tap D that's a rather rude comment! We enjoy going to Schmidt's. The new outdoor patio is going to be a real draw next summer when it's finished. The bartenders are very friendly and we've always had a good meal.
Good job!

I've had the chicken sandwich and burgers from there and I was not impressed.  When ordering a burger medium usually means burnt and Medicare is well done. The Cajun chicken sandwich tastes exactly like the regular grilled chicken sandwich.  and $4 for chips and salsa?!?! Overpriced and not every tasty. Very disappointed.

This review is mostly based on my bar experience here, and about 20% based on my boyfriend's food experience.

I'm not gonna lie -- I wanted to get flat out drunk, so my boyfriend and I decided to try this place since it's relatively new to LITH. We loved our bartender!!! He recommended drinks for us based on what we were ordering, helped me choose which flavor profiles would taste better in my cocktails, and was generally pleasant to speak with.

However, my man got hungry and ordered the wings (I believe they were slathered with some kind of sauce -- I was too imbibed to give a damn about food at that point.) He said they were the worst wings he's ever had in his life due to their rubberiness, high fat content, and bland sauce. I can't back this up, but he's a pretty agreeable guy, so when something tastes off to him, I believe him.

Go for the bar!!!

Thought i would check out this place! The service and atmosphere were great here. The food was good but not fantastic. However, it's a good bar to grab a couple drinks and share an appetizer with a friend.

The interior is really nice and yes there are tvs. When I went in, they had the hawks playing. 

I ordered the beef egg roll appetizer served with horseradish sauce. These are very good! I also got the Summer Salad with Chicken added. The salad was good but not great. My friend ordered simple fries with cheese on the side and the dessert Death by Chocolate. He thougft they were both okay. 

I would definitely come back but would try something else!

We visited for the first time recently and we had to wait awhile to be seated. As we stood awkwardly by the front door (there's really no place to wait without feeling like you are right on top of the hostess station, or staring down the other diners), we looked at the long empty table that had a family of 4 at one end and the rest was empty. I'm not sure why they didn't seat anyone else there. They could have easily sat another 2 parties with plenty of space in between. But .... we waited. Awkwardly.

I have to say, I was moments from walking out. My first impression was not a good one.

But I hung in there.

I had the tacos which were amazing. Absolutely delicious. I loved them. My daughter had a Caesar salad with steak, which she really enjoyed. My son ordered some sort of burger -- and was pleased. I forget what my husband ordered - but I believe he was happy with what he had.

Overall, I was glad I waited. The tacos were pretty yummy.

As for going back -- I might. Just for the tacos. But honestly -- they need to redesign the place or something. The tables are kind of on top of one another (at least in the area we sat in) and the floor plan by the entrance is just awkwardly weird. So, atmosphere standpoint - I didn't like it. Food wise -- good.

This is a pretty solid spot. The only thing preventing a 5 star review was the "waiting" area. Or should I say the small place in front of the door between seated tables and the bar. Poor layout and design. I understand they probably focused more on framing in as many tables as possible. But if I was an elderly couple, it would be difficult to stand for even a 10 minute wait. 

Besides that above, I don't have complaints. The service was pretty good. Especially being busy on a Friday night. Everyone in my party ordered something different. I got the spicy burger, others ordered the Mac and cheese and the shrimp po' boy. 

The burger was good. Dry. But good. I've had better burgers from five guys. But the flavors were there. The house cut fries were a bit soggy. I prefer crunchy fries. 

The Mac and cheese was incredible! Cheesy and just delicious. 

The shrimp po' boy was really good. Seasonings were spot on. 

We also ordered desserts. The cheesecake is average. The pie in a jar (peanut butter cup something) was really good. Plus, you get a free mason jar! 

Overall, I enjoyed this place. The nice beer selections and beer flights were a nice touch. I will be returning for seconds.

Came in here with my date and the service was nice and fast. The beer selection is vast so we got a suggestion from the server that worked out well. 
He ordered the rib sandwich which was huge and I got the poutine. Tip: don't try to be healthy and order the broccoli instead of the fries, they are cooked in bacon grease (though I'm sure amazing, kind of defeats the purpose). Good was tasty- though with all that butter, cheese and meat I don't know how you can't go wrong. 
The tables were placed a bit tightly so it got a little odd at times having the server's bum resting precariously on our table as we were trying to eat and drink when she was getting the order of the table next to us.

They have reuben eggrolls which sound quite good, but are only alright. The meatloaf sounded good, but I saw them bring it to another table, and I knew I could make better, so I went to Jewel across the street and got the stuff to make my own. I've been back since, and my meatloaf was better.
Good beer, good atmosphere though.

We've frequented this restaurant for months. Our first 4 visits, they were easily 5 stars. The calamari, Chicago egg rolls, burgers, and beef poutine are fantastic. Like stuff your mouth until you feel so full you feel sick good. Except the truffle fries. They weren't crispy, a bit disappointing. Up until our last order, service was consistently excellent & food spectacular. 

They lost a star. We ordered take out & although I requested ranch, confirmed it at pick up, and the hostess ringing me up read back my order when I paid, we didn't receive any ranch. What I though was ranch turned out to be pungent horseradish sauce. Like so pungent it burned my eyes & nose and I started gagging & almost lost my stomach. Had I known it was horseradish, I wouldn't have doused my food in it. First mistake. The second & biggest was serving us bad meat. The Chicago egg rolls which I so love were full rancid. We discovered it was the italian beef inside that literally tasted rotten. We couldn't eat our takeout. I really hope it was a fluke night, but I was incredibly dissatisfied & let down during our last experience. I struggled with how many stars to dock. Serving rotten food is almost unforgivable, but as I said our previous experiences have been superior & I gave the restaurant the benefit of the doubt.

Pros:  Excellent food and unique craft beers on tap.  Definitely a beer snob paradise.  Updated interior that is definitely aesthetically pleasing.  Best burgers, Mac and cheese and Chicago egg rolls I've had.

Cons:  No daily specials or happy hour.  How do you build your regulars like this?  
Interior needs sound dampening.  The wall reverberate the sound and may even intensify it.  Difficult to have a conversation if it is busy.  

Neither pro or con:  Seems to attempt to be more restaurant than bar.  Similar to Duke O'Brien's in Crystal lake without the bar atmosphere.  The later it gets, the emptier it gets, unlike Duke's which fashions itself as more of a bar later in the evening.  

Final thoughts:  Depending on what you are looking for, solid food and drink joint that has more restaurant vibe than evening/bar/nightlife style.

The food here is quite good, you just need to have the proper expectation going in.  It's not gourmet or fancy, but what they serve, is delicious.  The burgers are especially good.  I know you're asking, "how do they make burgers better than everyone else?"
Answer - I don't know, but they do.  They're really good!

Have visited this pub a few times now and had a good experience.  The 11 cheese mac, bacon with chicken is fantastic.   If you love beer and like try something new, you'll have a great time working your way through their list of taps and rotating "visiting" ales.  

It was Friday when we stopped in.  My wife had a salad with grilled steak and she loved it.  I couldn't decide on what to eat, so the GM actually had offered to prepare something for me that was not on the menu.  It was a BBQ beef brisket, on a pretzel role with pickle slices.  Does that sound good but ordinary to you?    One bite into it and I can assure you that if you love some brisket, and a mouth watering sandwich -  this is the one to get.   

Only one problem, it isn't currently on the menu...ask for "Murphy's BBQ Beef Brisket" when you visit and you may be served up this gastro-surprise.   My recommendation is to put it on the menu, it probably will become a favorite.   

We met the GM (Patrick Murphy) good Irish guy, came out to introduce himself and we had a nice conversation.   The people here are always friendly and that contributes to the overall experience of eating here.   The Barkeeps (bartenders) are a fun lot and are happy to serve you up free tasters.   This time we met Erica (originally from Argentina) and she was very engaging, fun and never did the smile leave her face.   

There are other restaurants in the area that offer far less.  It is nice to come away feeling like you got your money's worth, that your patronage was valued and in the process you helped a local business continue to prosper.  So bring your appetite and your money and enjoy your time at the Woods Creek Tavern.

Well we've been here 4 times, tonight was the end I ordered the blackened chicken sandwich which was ok, but my wife ordered the Jamaican jerk Chicken and it was terrible, the chicken had no flavor except for cinnamon.  They did not charge us for her dinner but this place has no trained cook.   I love the atmosphere but God food Is sub par at best!!  I hope they figure this out or they will be out of business!!

We came here for the first time for a little date night. Our Cubbies were on, so that was nice. 
They sat us fast, but put us in a tiny corner with a small table. Me being super pregnant, that was rough. We were right next to another table with 4 people. 
Hey, it was a little awkward but I'm not the type to say anything. I just complain later, lol. 

The menu was okay. We honestly didn't know what to get. We kind of expected a more expanded menu. The waitress said that the burgers are really tasty and popular.  
I decided to get the BBQ bacon burger and the hubby got the short ribs and the small town root beer.
The burger was great, good amount of bacon and sauce. The short ribs were amazing and boneless. We really enjoyed the sauce. I'd love to get them again! He really enjoyed the root beer as well. Definitely said it was stronger than expected. The garlic mash potatoes were tasty too. Thick in texture. The corn on the cob was a little over cooked and shriveled, lol...

We decided to get dessert since everyone was raving about them. We got the death by chocolate. 
Umm. What the hell is it? A cold pudding with chocolate powder? Not a fan. We literally laughed when she brought it to the table. Oops! Sorry :/
 It was a waste of money. It wasn't rich in chocolate that we were expecting.
It tasted like cold pudding with some powder on top mixed with some chocolate topping? We were disappointed. Next time we want to try the pie in the jar....

The ambience was fun since the Cubs were playing. The table next to us wasn't too thrilled but whatever. 
Looks like a good time if you want to sit at the bar and have a few expensive drinks and watch a game. The place overall looks small and crowded. But pretty. 

We are coming back for the ribs! And begging them not to put us in a corner for time out. Lol

The BBBLT is worth the heart attack. This is the second time I have come here and the food and service have been good. The interior design is consistent with a gastro pub.  The TV layouts are great for games.

I am giving this place five stars to offset the one star reviews, so will my wife. I think the people who gave this place a one star think its Applebee's and are surprised that they don't roll out a red carpet. This area is filled with people who think they know quality food because they've eaten at a semi quality steak house in downtown 5 years ago and compare everyplace they go to there after against it. Go down the street to Chili's if you want your 32oz frosted watered down beer. Don't ruin a newly opened privately owned businesses in our area without giving them a fair chance. 

Thank you Nikki, James, Ashley, Kim, and Amy for your excellent service now for a second time. We will be back. Hopefully these reviewers (who go out so often) update their reviews. Hope the reviewers  realize it's a soft opening and the Woods Creek staff and ownership are doing an excellent job addressing issues and complaints before the grand opening. One week since our last visit and noticeable differences. Good luck and welcome to the neighborhood!

Finally!! A restaurant in the area that isn't a chain. Took the family to dinner. Place was busy and after a short wait was seated. 

Sat down and immediately tended to by our waitress. She was attentive but didn't hover. Drinks were refilled in a timely manner. 

Food was very good. Wife had BBBLT and I had BBQ ribs. Kids had cheese and mac.

We skipped dessert but drooled over the options. 

We will be back.

I wish we didn't wait so long to try this place! My husband and I dined here tonight. Not sure why we haven't been here sooner, but it was definitely a great experience. Our server was excellent! Friendly, helpful, and provided us great service. The food- it was AWESOME! We started off with the poppers. They were different than we expected... Not the traditional poppers we had pictured but they were very tasty. I ordered the caprese chicken sandwich and my husband ordered the BBQ bacon cheeseburger. Let me tell you it was the best chicken sandwich I have ever had, hands down. And I have tried A LOT of "caprese" sandwich/pasta items. My husband said his burger was very good. Not the best he has ever had, but he was satisfied with it. 

Overall, our experience was great. 

Only negative thing we noticed was that the seating was very tight. But after all, it's the "bar" kind of environment where you go to have some drinks and watch sports.. Pretty typical.

Some feedback for the owners... The fries! I LOVE LOVE soggy fries (I won't touch crispy ones.. Just personal preference) so I was in heaven with their sweet potato fries! I would, however, consider having an "original" AND "extra crispy" option for fries. I feel there will be a lot more happy customers if there were an option!

We order Calamari at every establishment where it is offered. I could write a blog on Calamari, where to, and where not to order it. Today we stoped in to check the place out and of course we ordered the Calamari because it's offered. It is by far the best I have had, and I have eaten a lot of Calamari all over the country. It is lightly breaded, lightly fryed and served with fryed Capers, jalape̱os and drizzed with a spicy sause, EXCELLENT!!!! And the Old Tanker on draft is a bit bitter with a fruity/citrusy after bite and an excellent pairing.

It's a Sports Bar atmosphere with lots of TVs minus the tacky sports decor. With that said, I'm looking at a lot of TVS, brick walls (nice brick walls) and a black metal ceiling. It's missing something to absorb the acoustics, and I'm not talking about hanging a bunch of sports jerseys . We will be back for the Short Ribs.

I've been reading a lot of reviews for this place, and finally decided to try it tonight. Many reviews were negative, but then I got to thinking that the ones that were, were from people going to this place on Friday and Saturday night between 6&8 pm! Here's a clue- don't go at prime time!
Anyway, we got here at 6 and decided to sit at the bar. Nice bar. Reminded me of the bar from "Cheers". We were greeted by the bartender immediately, and she was very nice. I decided to get a flight of beers. 5 for $10. Not bad. I chose out of a tough list and enjoyed them all. My wife and I ordered the "cheese and macaroni" with bacon to split. Good thing we split it because it was huge, rich and delicious. We also ordered the braised beef poutine. This was also fantastic, and we ended up taking it home. Can't wait to go back and try more of their beers and food.

I can't believe it took us so long to try this place.  The waitress told us that everything there is made fresh and nothing comes from a container or bottle.  The pulled pork nachos where by far the best appetizer I've ever had.  I ordered the two handed philly steak sandwich for my entree and that was also really amazing.  My husband had the "That warm feeling" burger which was also really delicious!  I can't say enough how pleased we were with our meal.  We will definitely frequent this place regularly!

Went here for Dinner a few weeks ago, the food was good, but the service wasn't all that great. The server was kind of slow, took a long time to come ask us what we wanted to drink. I ordered the flight so i could try several of the beers and it seemed like they were out of half of my choices. Will definitely consider going back because of the food, and maybe the server was just having a bad day, it happens.

We were seated before stated time. That was nice.
Our server was semi-pleasant. That was nice.
They have a great beer selection. That was nice.
Lots of televisions showing various sports. That was nice.

Ordered the Blackened Bleu cheeseburger. That was NOT nice.

It was THE most vile burger I have ever eaten. I think the prep cook dumped the entire container of salt into the blackening seasoning, looked at his mistake for a few seconds, looked around to see if anyone noticed, shrugged his shoulders and said "Eff it" under his breath and then proceeded to smother my burger in this concoction. It was disgusting, I felt like a deer at the salt lick. 

My fries were also too salty. I walked out of this joint feeling like my tongue had shriveled up into a raisin from all of the salt! NOT even the delicious Allagash White cured my parchedness. That was NOT nice either! 

Needless to say, I most likely will not be returning.

"Good Food, Great Service...Late weekday hours"
Friend and I hit the local theater for an evening show and needed some food afterward. Luckily this place was open late and quite popular.
We had a couple the burgers with Fries, non alcoholic drinks and a desert each with tip that ran nearly $50.
The burgers were done well...tasty at maybe 8oz. Ample fries...the desert was a blueberry cheesecake.
Service was fantastic 
Overall it was a little pricey for our tastes but good quality food.

The burger was really good. Fries, blah. 

Skip the Mac and cheese. It was so...dry. How is Mac and cheese fry? Too much hard cheese and not enough cream/milk is my guess. The flavor was okay, but the cheese sauce wasn't very...saucy. 

I'd go back, but I'm not in a hurry or waiting for a table.

Stopped in for dinner on a Wednesday night. Was seated immediately then things went down hill from there. Waiter finally came over after about 15 minutes. My wife ordered a seltzer water with lime but received a tonic. After another 10 minutes we flagged down a waitress who assisted in replacing her drink. Waiter finally came by to take our order after another 20 minutes. Ordered Two dinner salads and the jerk chicken. That was the last time we saw the waiter until we received our check. 25 minutes later food arrived by another server without receiving the salads. After another 30 minutes I went to hostess stand to get our check. Waiter finally brought it over.  Found the place too noisy and service and attention too slow. Better choices out there.

Service wad good...granted it was a Wednesday evening and their were only 4 tables in the place. Food was good. I had the steak tacos and overall the flavors were good. The mac and cheese was excellent! Todd had the forgetaboutit burger and it was good but the meat was not cooked to his liking (not pink at all and he asked for medium rare). Other than that it was a good meal and reasonably priced.

New Years Day, kid free, decided to try someplace new. The service was SO GOOD!
 We ordered fried green tomatoes. They were yummy, except I don't eat bacon and there was bacon in the sauce on top (probably something that it should say on the menu). However, they were nice enough to make me a few without sauce on them! I had the BEST turkey burger I have ever eaten in my life (and I've had quite a few). We don't get out often without the kiddo, but we will be back!

We've been wanting to try this new spot, and tonight we finally had our chance. Arriving for an early dinner, we were greeted and sat quickly. 
Fabulous! There were a handful of tables occupied, and about a dozen people at the bar. Considering the odd time on a Friday, we thought that to be a good sign. 
Our server arrived and asked if we had ever dined there before, and then quickly explained the beer and wine options, as well as the soup of the day which she highlighted as being fantastic. 
With her suggestions noted, she left us to review the menu and make our selections. Hubby decided on a burger. I was undecided. The server was so excited about the days soup, that it made me want that (kudos to her! She totally sold the soup with her enthusiasm!!), but I knew just soup was not quite enough. A meatless salad for $9-$10 was not going to cut it. A small plate (appetizer)? Meh. Everything sounded heavy. Hubby convinced me to get the pastrami philly sandwich and that he would have some. 
We placed our order, and within a few minutes our meals arrived. My soup came alongside the philly which was served open faced. Husbands burger and fries looked great. 
The soup. Oh how I wanted to love it. The taste? Pure cornstarch. Total bummer as it had great potential (and a great marketer!). 
The philly. Oh. My. Where do I start? So this Philly was made with pastrami, cheese, etc. I love pastrami for its texture and flavor. But this pastrami was so salty, and so chewy, I couldn't eat beyond the first bite. I asked husband to try it to see if maybe I was just having an off day, but he could not muscle it down either. 
Husbands burger and fries: he says his burger was OK. Not awful, but very greasy. The bun literally slipped out of his hand when he first took it to his mouth (I laughed, but stopped when I took a bite of my sandwich).  The fries had zero flavor. Needed salt desperately. 
Which makes no sense. 
You butter your buns, but don't salt the fries? 
We looked around and there was no salt or pepper to be found nearby. Our server was awesome and was able to grab a salt shaker and pepper mill from the back...after about 5 minutes. 
Pepper mill? Empty. 
Salt? Near empty. 
Like I said, we wanted to try this place. And I really wanted to like my meal, as did hubby, but....not even close. 
The service was great. Friendly, informative, and concerned when I shared that the sandwich was really bad. (I didn't bother saying anything about the soup, nor did hubby mention his burger because at that point we just wanted to get going) the server took my sandwich off the bill, but did share that other guests RAVE about that sandwich. (Leaving me wondering what is wrong with my tastebuds) 
Will we go back? Yes. I think it's only fair to try it once more. And, it would be a sin to not return and try one of the incredible beers off their never ending list. 
Hopefully by our next visit the chef will have a better handle on how his recipes hold up and go out and adjust them accordingly. And maybe they'll throw some (filled) salt and pepper shakers onto their tables or at their beverage stations so servers can quickly hand them over when requested.

We have been to this establishment twice in the last few weeks.  We were excited for it to open and watched closely as they transformed the building into an inviting atmosphere.  The service both visits was great.  Waitresses both very accommodating, and were on top of it.  Unfortunately, the food didn't live up to expectations.  

Our first trip we visited as a date night, celebrating our anniversary.  We rarely have a night out without our 4 year old so we were excited to jump into the menu and try a little bit of everything.  We ordered a burger, Mac and cheese and the boneless ribs.  We also had sides of coleslaw, fries, garlic mashed potatoes and corn on the cob.  The ribs were over cooked and extremely chewy, almost as if they were "leftovers".  The mashed potatoes and coleslaw were the best parts of the meal.  The burger was "ok" at best.  Corn on the cob was so burnt and over cooked that the kernels were shriveled and not edible.  The Mac and cheese was tasty, but not good enough to take home as leftovers.  We felt it would not be good taken home unless we "doctored it up".  

Our second trip we had our 4 year old and we stopped by for lunch.  Again service was great.  This time we were heading to a movie, so my hubby and I split the pastrami sandwich ordered fries and slaw as sides and our little guy ordered buttered noodles.  The sandwich was barely luke warm, had no flavor except of peppers.  The bread was soggy upon arrival and the cheese was pretty non existent.  The sides again were good.  The buttered noodles, as if you could mess them up were sitting in a pool of oily butter.  Even our 4 year old commented on it, and had to pour it off.  

We won't be back anytime soon. Maybe in time they will work out the kinks.

Comfortable environment but only one bartender on a Saturday afternoon.

The bar was 3/4 full, we left only because we were ignored.

Staff was friendly but unorganized.

A new, independent restaurant in the area is usually reason to rejoice, but I was underwhelmed by Woods Creek.  The atmosphere was ok, and our server was pretty good, but the menu is seriously lacking.  No soup?  Really?

I settled on a shrimp po boy.  There were too few shrimp, and the ones that were there were soggy to the point of being mush.  I know amount of sauce is subjective, but there was a ridiculous amount of remoulade on the sandwich, making it almost inedible after scraping most of it off.  The sweet potato fries were also soggy.

We tried the pie in a jar...which is hard to screw up, but they managed.  The bananas were brown, there was a big was of graham dust under the pudding, and the candied nuts on top were stale.

I doubt I'll go back for anything other than beer.

We went last weekend. It was crowded, new kid on the block. There have been several comments about the hostesses not knowing what they're doing. At 4:45, they had about 20 people suddenly standing in the front, with not much room to stand, and lots of empty tables. And about 5 employees, I assume hostesses,  standing around. But, it's still a new restaurant, and I'm sure they will work through it.

 My husband had two beers, the same ones, but the check had two different beers, with two different prices. We didn't say anything, not the end of the world. The bartenders were kind of lost, but completely understandable, there are lots of beer taps, and it's new. They were all very nice.

We ordered the Chicago beef egg roll, which was really great. It's an Italian beef with giardiniera rolled in an egg roll  and fried. With a horseradish sauce for dipping. Delicious. What's not to love?

We also ordered the calamari, which was dreadful. It came out mushy, and for the 2nd time in 20 years, we sent food back. It came back out hotter, but still horrible.  I highly recommend stay away from that one.

They are a lot of disorganized, but trying very hard. Not any worse than you would expect within the first few weeks of opening. We will give it another try in a couple of months. I'm sure they will have worked out the kinks.

On a funnier note, I asked our bartender if the owner had owned other restaurants, and she didn't have a clue.

Nice.  Reasonable job on the pub with 31 craft beers + Miller Lite on tap.  Maybe a little light on the Gastro - with solid salad, sandwich & burger offerings.
My wife & I enjoyed the Philly Two-Hand Sandwich & the BBQ Bacon Burger.  Each was amped up nicely with solid toppings & good buns.  The sweet potato fries were okay - but weren't great once they started to cool.  The truffle fries were excellent!  We had a flight of three beers - the Founders R_b_us on Nitro was a smooth, summery draft.  I also enjoyed the Not Your Father's Root Beer from SmallTown Brewing (with 10.8% ABV).
The place was busy for a late Friday lunch, but the waitstaff was keeping up.  Devin took very good care of us.  I believe the owners invested over $1m converting this from a prior restaurant-which-shall-not-be-named.  Overall, they've done a good job. The stone finish is pleasant - though all of the hard surfaces keep noise levels a little high.
I'd recommend Woods Creek and plan to return.  There were definitely some tasty-looking options we didn't get to order on round 1.

2nd visit to Woods Creek and it was wonderful. Sat at the bar to watch the cubs and had a few drinks. The bartender Victoria is wonderful and couldnt ask for anything more. Friendly, attentive and so nice.  The GM Patrick came over and introduced himself. Him and my husband talked about beer and all the new beer they will be rolling out. Very nice guy and the service we recieved was above and beyond. No doubt we will be back. If u come here and have a bad experience i would suggest try again. They are wonderful people and have a good thing going.

Just ate here. Was completely awesome.  I had the shrimp poor boy sandwich thinking well it might be ok for something new to try. I was totally blown away.  It came with 5 huge shrimp on it which i had t take 2 off and eat separately because they wouldn't fit on the amazing home baked sour dough roll it came on. My wife said the cheeseburger was about the best she ever had and my mother had the philly made with pastrami and said it was aslo amazing and she is one picky bitch lol. 
  The place is very clean and our waitress dianne was extremely nice and helpful. Expect to wait to get seated as this place seems to really be taking off.
  Prices seemed to be a little high to me until we got to eat and then i gotta say it was worth every penny.  Can't wait to go back and try something else.

Loved it!!! I typically use Yelp when I'm out of town. It's not often that I use it at home. I thought I would give it a try and it did not disappoint. Wood creek is a decent place. Nice atmosphere, great beer selection and interesting menu. Three of us ate out and everyone was happy with their meal. Service was good and the price was fair. I had the Caprese chicken sandwich and I thought it was very good. One of the people I was with also had the blackened chicken which was also top shelf. I will definitely go back and would recommend it to anyone.

Not good. This was out first visit. I ordered the meatloaf with garlic mashed potatoes and corn. The meatloaf was a perfectly formed, hard, brick of tasteless meat smothered in think brown gravy and mushrooms. The corn was dried out and the potatoes tasted very bland. My husband got the caprese chicken. He took one bite and said "this is disgusting I can't eat this". We ended up not eating any of it and going back out for food elsewhere. We ordered takeout and were o time to pick it up do that's not the problem. I've had good meatloaf and corn via carry out before so that's not the problem either. I'm hoping this place is just going through an adjustment period and will improve its food quality as they read reviews.
It's extremely crammed in there no space at all. All the chairs are back to back no room to scoot in or out. The food is extremely greasy and not my favorite.

They Have gluten free choices. Which is what I need. The staff was knowledgeable about the gluten free vs gluten filled. They have turkey burgers but they are bound by bread crumbs. It was nice for them to take caution to gluten free! I had a grilled chicken sandwich gluten free bun added goat cheese and mashed sweet potatoes (they were so good) my husband had a fried shrimp sandwich and the shrimp were large & tasty. He got a hearty helping of sweet potato fries. ALL the staff where nice, friendly and very helpful. I can't wait to come back and try a new item from the menu.

Love, love, love this atmosphere. It is an absolutely beautiful building both inside and out. The servers are very friendly and bartenders are knowledgeable about their extensive craft beer list. And by the way, most craft beer is served in Belgian beer glass by way of design. Makes aromas and flavors that much more enjoyable. The Food is terrific. I like the variety. They offer larger entrees, burgers (that were YUMMY), and salads. I'll be back with some girlfriends FOR SURE!!

My husband & I went for dinner last Saturday.  Both of us ordered the house wine, cab for him, chardonnay for me.  Both were awful.  My chardonnay tasted more like vinegar than wine.  Next came the entrees.  DH choice was the chefs steak with garlic mashed potatoes.  It was good, not great.  Side veggies were Brussels sprouts, which were immediately banished from the table as he said they smelled terrible.  I had a 1/2 slab of ribs, which were tender, but a bit spicy for my taste, dry and not much sauce.  The fries they served were a disgrace; limp and mushy.  Pretty disappointing for a Saturday night date (or anytime),

I was here with a buddy of mine to watch Monday Night Football.  We were sitting at the bar and there was a couple next t us, who said it was their first time there as well.

I wound up getting the 5 beer sampler...which is GREAT because you get about a a good mouthful and a half...or about 2 tastes.  This was a nice way to try some of the brews, without having to get an entire pint/glass.  It also didn't help that out bar tender was really cute...short, but very personable, paid attention to what we were drinking and how full our glasses were, etc.

I got the Chicken Pot Pie and my buddy got the Woods Creek Philly.  Oddly enough, one of the couple sitting next to us got the Philly as well.  My pot pie was more like a bowl of really thick soup or some type of Chicken Pot Pie Stew.  It was good, but not what I was expecting.  However, my friend and neighbor at the bar raved about the Philly.  I was kind of jealous because I was thinking about getting that, but wanted to get something different.  My friend then went on to say, if the Philly had bacon on it, he would have lost his mind.

Overall, the place looks O.K.  It's more of a casual type of place, rather than a place where you might get all dressed up.  For a first date, I would say hold off and go with friends, as that's the vibe and atmosphere I got from the experience.  This would be a third or fourth date type of place, or if you wanted to take your father out for some good food and have a beer.

Judging by what other people wrote, I think my experience was a little better, but maybe that's  because I have to go back for the Philly Sandwich!

Beer selection is usually pretty good, but the food is hit or miss.  I've had the shrimp po boy twice, once it was pretty good, once it was gross.  Too much mayonnaise in the sauce and just tasted weird.  Maybe it was a growing pain.  All I know is I was really hoping for it to be better.  However the Chicago beef egg rolls are ridiculously awesome.

If I could give a zero star I would. Stopped in there on a recommendation. Got seated fine. Sat for 20 minutes no waitress to take order. However there was a gentleman seated  right behind me. Waitress came over to him asked if he wanted a box. Then cashed him out. Figured she'd wait on our table after that. Nope she decided she wanted  to talk  to the cooks. Meanwhile two hostesses up front not even busy there. We walked out. I wouldn't spend a dime in there. Too bad too. Can't imagine that building being cheap to run.

Great beer selection and great food to match! My boyfriend and I are big fans of craft beer and we love coming here to try anything new on the list of 50 beers. The food is also a reason in itself to come here. We comtinue to frequent this place even though I'm now pregnant and can no longer enjoy the beer list. I've had the cheese and mac, (so cheesy they put it first!) several of the burgers (the fuhgetaboutit is my fav!), and the blackened chicken (which has a nice spice to it). I love everything I try here! Good date night restaurant.

The beer & food are excellent here! My one complaint would be that they have only 1 bartender serving the entire restaurant. I guess I understand during off hours, but during the dinner rush? Our bartender, Stephanie did an amazing job, but I feel it would be better for customers if the at least had some extra help during dinner.
Not enough seating. Long wait for table was not worth it. We had the poppers, onion soup, salmon and Philly sandwich. Not wowed by any of it. Service was friendly but average. Will not be coming back

This place rocks!  The beer selection changes so you get chances to try new ones.  Start with a flight and than order one or two you love.  Can't believe I'm writing this, try the chicken tenders with the hot sauce.  These are grown up chicken tenders.  Always great service.

Warning!!  $13.75 for a tiny beer! 

Total disappointment.  We signed up for the beer club. Food was mediocre but we stuck with it for the microbrew selection.  Flights were fun until they started to exclude all of the good beers because they are "premium". As a beer fan, I was only going for these beers. Membership cancelled. Nobody asked why or tried to keep our business.  Live in the area but will be making the hike back to Dukes.

We stopped in at WCT at 420 on a Saturday and were pleasantly surprised to see no wait, so we're sat asap. Went over the beer list with the waitress, who was with us reasonably quickly and had a flight and beer in two shakes of a lambs tail. Dinner was much of the same: the waitress was helpful and knowledgable and recommended a few items, which we obliged. The entrees came out quickly and were delicious! Recommend the boneless ribs and chicken pot pie...

Got seated immediately but that was it. Sat there for a good 15 minutes awaiting our wait staff. Nothing but there was six ladies gapping behind the receptionist desk including the one who sat us at our table. Guess no one wanted to work. Seemed like a nice place but not if you want a drink or food.

Ok, Anton and I go to Antons sisters house for birthday party out dat way on the randle road so we meets Eddie dere at the Woods creek joint for to find hot dates and da cold beers. Dis place pretty fancy schmancy but da beers is cold and da bartender she looks reely good hot. Had some lite beers too trying to loose some fat but da food is so good at dis joint I loose nutting by dat. good burgers wid friess. Peoples were nice good thing eddie wears his new teeths for sunday. No fights is good ting for sure. no hot polski girls here no fresh kielbasa or pierogis but good anyways.nice joint. long ride to the city .we like to move it move it. Thanks Ok then.

Had the steak tacos which were good but a little light on the steak for the price.  They were good but needed more filling.  Tortilla chips served with it were fresh and crispy. One of the micro brews in the beer flight was pretty hideous.
No wine list but had some on tap.
Lots of TVs and very loud in case you want to have a conversation.  Did not see any booths and seating is very close.
Service was friendly and good.
Love the menu and the food is top notch. More sports bar than restaurant in my opinion.

I want to try this place since it opened b/c there really aren't any other new dinner places in the LITH area. I tried last night with my friends after a movie 7:30pm and the bad reviews were right - very poor seating, very loud, very poor hostesses. We were told the wait was 35-45 mins. We left after 10 mins when we saw empty tables with no one being seated. We went to Moretti's and had a good time. I tried again tonight at 5pm (party of 7). The hostess tried seating us at this long communal table shared with two other parties. When we asked if we could have the 2 open tables in the back pushed together, they said"No" because the tables were in two different server. We left and  I will not be giving this place a third try.
Excellent for craft beers.  Friendly staff, I personally thought the grilled cheese was too heavy on the cheese (can't believe I am saying this).  Will give a second try and update experience!

Awesome new restaurant. We've been here 3 times now and the service is always outstanding and the food is delicious. Great beer selection and fun atmosphere. We did get take out once which didn't hold up all that well but this wasn't really their fault it was ours for taking so long to get home.

Tuesday night dinner time and jam packed. Wife and I were able to grab a seat at the bar otherwise there would have been a 15-20 min wait. Just goes to show how starved the area is for non chain eating establishments. We ordered the Poutine app and a couple beers. I knew from my first visit that most brews are served in 12 oz glasses as opposed to the standard pint glasses you can expect everywhere else, but when I grabbed the ticket and saw that my 4.6% ABV brew was $7.50, I almost choked. C'mon, this is Lake in the Hills, not Chicago! The Poutine was OK but I just felt so gouged walking out $30 lighter for two 12 oz beers and an appetizer. The Iron Horse down the road has better Poutine and more market level pricing for their drinks. Stay away before more local establishments start to reach for the sky with their beer prices.

I can't tell you how happy I am that this place is here.  I've been in twice so far, and have loved everything we've gotten.  It's definitely a thumbs up!!  The first time was three of us.  I ordered the short ribs, and they're just fall off the bone.  The other two got the meatloaf and chicken pot pie.  They said it was so good that's all they will order when they go back.  Then next time was with my sister, and we just went in for burgers, which are so good.  You can't go wrong.  I think the beer list is impressive, without being intimidating, a plus.  And Simi is one of my fav wines, so how happy am I it's on tap! Whaaat....  
Anyway, I would totally recommend.  The service has been so nice and polite with no complains from us, and it's a pretty atmosphere with TVs for sports.
I'm a fan!
Thanks

Food was very good, burgers and sandwiches are all top notch.  A lot of specialty beers, but no prices are listed, you have to ask the staff how much a glass of each type of beer would be (inconvenient).   Noise level can be overbearing due to the open set up of the entire restaurant.  Lots of TV's and video gambling on premise.  Lunch hour is best time for noise level to be down so you can carry on a conversation.

First off I didn't eat here so cannot give a review for the food/menu. Just stopped in to check it out and have a beer or two. Weird kind of seating setup with tables scattered with most of the patrons trying to find a spot at the bar. Was able to make about 3 rounds across the bar until I was able to squeak in on one of the corners behind the bar. Waitress was nice and brought me the menu. Ordered a lager (can't remember which one).

I was astonished to see that they serve these 30+ draft brews in wine glass/sniffers.  Asked if they had "Tall" or "Big Boy" glasses like 23oz drafts served at Fire Bar, Moretti's, Thirsty Whale etc. NOPE. Not even the "normal" sized pint glasses. Just these tiny round sniffer type glasses. Even more surprising was my bill for a beer. 8 bucks for about 10 ounces. Needless to say the lager wasn't that great and at that price I chose NOT to have a second overpriced tiny beer. You have got to be joking? I mean come on.
