This is Lake in the Hills not Beverly Hills. Not sure what the owner was going for but I have a hunch he's trying to make the patrons pay for the "over the top" building material expense. Whatever the perogative, I'll be spending my dollars across the street or at the other competing pubs where I actually get some beer for my $

The food here is excellent! Best turkey burger I've ever had!  Lots of delicious sides including truffle fries, yum!  Wonderful selection of beers, many my husband and I had never heard of which is great,  because we love finding something new,  not the same old same old.   Is it busy on a Saturday night?  Yes.  Do they need more tables?  Definitely.   But we ate at the bar,  which a lot of people do,  and our server was great,  had a great time talking to the people near us and watching the hawks game.  Overall a great place for a date night.  Can't wait to go back!

21 TV's but the owner refuses to put any volume on them!!! He said "we aren't a sports bar"!?!? We Had to listen to music during the Bears game!!! I don't think so. We left and went to Morettis across the street. We will not be back.

SEATING:  ODD Experience.  First time here -- excited to check it out...  Arrived for dinner as a party of 4 at 8:00pm on Halloween.  Place was full, but no one was standing around waiting and the hostess said it would be a 30 minute wait. okkkaaay?  Maybe they were all at the bar waiting on open tables?   So we meandered over to this large looking table that looks like a second bar/community seating area and grabbed a few open seats. We started chatting and approx. 5 mins later another server/hostess comes over and explains that this is the conference table and not available for "open seating" and we would have to move.  No problem we got up and stood back over by the door.  Not 2 minutes later the original hostess who took our name comes over and asks if we would be ok sitting at the conference table seating and she points to the exact seats where we just got up.   I said -- You mean where we just were asked to get up and move from?  and she says "yes".   Hmmm...  We opted to wait for a traditional table and not sit at the weird large conference table with other guests. We were seated at a traditional table within 5 mins.  

NOISE LEVEL:  LOUD. what? Did I mention it was LOUD? Hard surface floor. stone walls. metal high ceiling.  LOUD.  Adding something to improve the acoustics and deaden some of the noise would make for a better dining experience for guests that actually want to hear the person sitting across from them. 

SERVICE: GOOD.  Our teenage mutant ninja turtle was pleasant and attentive. (It was Halloween and all wait staff was dressed up) (Can't recall her name)

PACE:  SLOW.  Dinner took longer than average to arrive.  Our group was just mentioning that we were wondering if something happened with our order and getting ready to ask the server and thinking we should check on the meal when it appeared.  

FOOD:  BEST part of the night!  Really good.  Better than I've had at a lot of places out this way!  Chicken Caprese Sandwich with yummy sweet potato fries.   Others had a shrimp Po'Boy that looked good with large shrimp on a great looking roll with shredded lettuce and a sauce drizzled on top --

Went for lunch ! Place is beautiful .. Hostess was very nice , our waitress was great ! Made a drink selection my daughter loved , menu is so so ... We made our food selection , food came out in a timely manner , but it was not quit our cup of tea , seeing the place & its name one would think of steak / chicken etc .. They gave artisan type food , and did not like the food selections we choose , i dont think i'd go back unless the menu changed .  Needless to say we had to cut or shopping day short , and be home next to the rest room
It was just "ok."  Not bad but nothing interesting on the menu worth going back for a second time.

Let me start by saying that my family and I eat out at least 5 to 6 times a week. We are always excited when a new restaurant opens. However to our disappointment, Woods Creek Tavern is not good.  We went at a time when it was not busy and the service was still slow. The worst of it was the black and blue burger my husband ordered. It was crispy and charred to the point of inedible. So we sent it back and just ordered a regular cheese burger. We ate our dinner without my husband. When he finally got his burger, the manager, who took no accountability and had an attitude said that all the black and blue burgers are charred not seasoned. I have never heard of that. Maybe they need to write that in their menu- crispy, charred, not seasoned. I think the manager and the cooks need to learn how to make a black and blue burger or at least let people know how the burger is made -  charred and crispy. After the problems with the burger, we got the bill and they still had the charred to a rock burger on the bill instead of a regular burger. We notified the waitress and she did make the  change. 

We will not return to this restaurant and we will notify our friends of our opinions and what happened. Hopefully this restaurant will make some changes, otherwise I believe it will not be successful as the other restaurants in the area.

This review is for take out. It was terrific. Cannot say enough good thing. Black Bean burger,Bacon Cheeseburger,Steak Tacos and wings. All terrific!! My fries were soggy (an inevitable factor in takeout) and they were still delicious! Much needed addition to Randall rd.

Sad to say, but I had to drop my stars from 5 to 3. I finally dragged my husband in to try this new much needed gastropub in our suburb. Alas, our experience was less than satisfactory. $7 for a 10oz beer is ridiculous.  Keep the fancy glasses and give us paying patrons a decent pour. The Cajon chicken sandwich was sad. 1 small breast atop a giant greasy bun. It lacked any flavor, but was certainly burned. I guess this is "cajon". The $3.50 pickles were fabulous,  but really? Cucumbers aren't that expensive,  please don't pass your debt on to us. (The sandwich didn't come with a pickle). My chicken tacos were soggy and, I hate to, tasteless.  Siracha sure helped brighten the meal. The homemade tortilla chips were great. 
I don't know if I'll come back. Maybe it was an off night. I mean going from the caprese sandwich which bursted with flavor and so big I had to take half home to this. Sad.

The food isn't too bad, but it also wasn't fantastic; just mediocre. The service was also very slow and the only option suitable to vegetarians was a grilled cheese sandwich. This would not be one of my top restaurant recommendations.

Great manager and a couple of their bartenders are a blast,  I enjoyed the variety of beers,  just need a more balance of selection less IPA's on the list would be great.  I am member and enjoy the benefits.

Great beer selection. Poor service. Took a long time to put in a food order and even longer to get the food. Their food was painfully average. The staff seemed more interested in prepping for close rather than serving their guests. Even though they weren't closing for another two hours. I know they just opened, but I can't find a good reason to come back. So many other options out there for craft beer and mediocre food. F this place fo real.

5 stars? No way. 

Our server was pretty good. Solid B. All the staff seemed to be active. Place just opened so the manager(s) should have been more engaged with the customers.

Food? We had burgers. Very tasty, priced on the high side of average.

Beer? Nice selection of craftbeers....but....no Weizen Beer of any kind?  I think the beer is overpriced. Served in tiny glasses. This is Chicago. We like big, tall cold beers. Don't want free beer. Normal tumbler, normal price. Beer shouldn't be in little brandy sniffers.

Finally the interior layout. I grade it a Z. Horrible. Whomever told you that giant long high table was a good idea needs to be hobbled. No intimacy in this place whatsoever. You need small kneewalls. Plastic plants, something to make it less plain. Take a look at Jameson's in Crystal Lake.

2 burgers, 3 small beers, 2 cokes, bruschetta appetizer was almost 65 bucks (that includes tip) you be the judge.

I was visiting family and they wanted to check out this new place. They heard good things about it.
So the place is small for one. Loud as Hell, and the food was crap! There was a few of us so we where trying all of foods we got, Wow Meatloaf salty and gross, Sweet mashed potatoes had an odd flavor to them, Pasta salad was nasty,Fried Green tomatoes had to much fried dough on them, The white wine was not even chilled.Way to much salt over all.I seen a couple come in sit down look at menu and walk out, and that's what we should of done.Staff was working hard to make things work so I give them that, It's not there fault the food is bad tasting. I felt bad leaving seeing all them people waiting to be seated for there food.

First time we went, food and service was sub par. In their defense, they had been open one month. We've been back another time and everything was to satisfaction. 

Try it out - give them a chance

Really good food, and very nice beer selection.  Clean, modern and casual tavern / pub.  Plenty of TV sets to watch, and not so noisy you can't hang out and have a conversation.   Calimari was really good as were the burgers.

Bland. Overpriced. I had high hopes for this place, 35 beers on tap, bar/pub food, burgers and POUTINE!? The hype was not worth it, and our tab for 4 people with one alcoholic drink was $80 with tip. The poutine was bland, you would expect spare rib to be full of flavor, it wasn't. The fries tasted old and were very basic, "fresh cut" fries. The burgers were juicy, can't fault them for that, but the flavors were very generic. Nothing special about them. The beer was cold, I didn't get much guidance to what I should try though. Just told to "shout a number" for my flight. Although our server was great otherwise.  I won't be going again, which is a disappointment because I love a good pub.

Called to see if they can accommodate a party of 8. Didn't ask for a reservation just simply asked if they can accommodate. Manager told me they are really too busy and don't think it's possible. I mean you are so busy that you don't need business? That might be right now but won't be forever. Never heard of something so ridiculous. "We are really so busy I don't think you will get seated".  You are in the hospitality industry people....come on!

My parents and I went when it first opened to sample beer and food. Beer selection is great. Tried a few things on the menu , Mac and cheese is great! Chicken salad sandwich was good, mussels also good. My complaint is I joined there flight club to get a free app and flight a month it's 10$ and they auto withdrawal on the first of the month well, every month since I get double charged. When I call and was told it was reversed and "chase bank made an error but caught it" I actually got charged instead of refunded. I didn't call back. This month I got charged on the 1st once and now today the 17 again..so I called to cancel let's see if this actually happens 
Also a word tithe owners that long table in the middle is a waste of space and those short tables on the back make you feel like you are pushed in the corner... High tops should be all around. If you go and sit at the bar you are golden otherwise I would leave and do not join the flight club, seems like a scam

Decided to try this out. We 're always up for a good beer list and decent food. We were super happy! The menu wasn't overwhelming, everything we ordered was excellent. They even let us try a few beers to help us decide what we liked. And Ashley, our server, was helpful without hovering. A great experience!

First I should qualify this by saying we got food "to go". That being said, I know when food might be "no-so-good" because it was to-go versus the food just being bad in general. This food is bad in general. I had the caprese chicken that says "sourdough" which certainly insinuates a roll, but in fact its sourdough bread....the chicken itself with the pesto aioli was similar to eating the inside of a snow tire.  The garlic mashed potatoes were ok.... my wife had the meatloaf....Patrick Kane had a better chance scoring with this meatloaf than he did with the woman in Buffalo...it was a brick of amalgamted meat mass covered in some sort of mushroom slurry that had virtually no flavor...but the flavor it DID have was awful.  We both had 1 bite and threw the food out. That place will never see our money again.

Burger  cooked perfectly to order. Meatloaf was really good, had onions, green and red peppers in it.  Gravy was really good. Nice size portion. Garlic mashed could have been a little more garlicy. But I love garlic.
Coors lite bottle overpriced at $4.

Went here for the first time on date night, a little bit of a wait to get seated (including some people who came in after us) but once we got seated it was a pretty good experience.  We're not beer people but the beer selection was pretty comprehensive so I tried a variety of flights. But the real winner was the food, simply delicious, all the way around...I could totally pass on the beer and just come to eat the food, a very nice menu and can't wait to try more!

This is our 2nd time here and we still feel the same way. We love it. We were excited about a new place finally opening up in LITH (that's not a chain)! I'm not a big beer drinker, but my husband is and I like that there are other options for me. The food was great! It's a bar, so I'm not looking for a crazy food menu with prime rib or snag thing like that. The BBBLT is insane. Not a huge fan of the Chicago egg roll, but it wasn't horrible, either. Great service, nice decor and friendly staff. We would definitely return.
Food was great. Everyone seemed nice. The wait was awful. No reservation or call in for waiting. Too bad because for dinner and a movie can't chance how long everything took.
Fast service, good food and beer selection. I'll be back.

This was our first time to visit.  We absolutely loved the menu and beer choices.  The service was excellent, the food quality was the best we've had in a while in our close neighborhood. Cassie, our server, was very attentive and the food runners seemed to be getting everything out quickly.  I read some, not so good reviews after t he by first opened, but come on people.   Give a business a break. It takes some time to get the kinks worked out.  The atmosphere is great!  We loved it

Service was good. The bar is awesome, big and a lot of tvs. However, the menu is relatively small and extremely over priced. My husband and I have lived in big cities across the U.S., we understand the point of a gastro pub...but, we're in Lake In The Hills...That being said, we won't be back, unless we hear they have great specials that can't be missed. Bummer overall.

Fantastic burgers, good quality meat.  My daughter ordered the swiss/mushroom burger which was PERFECT and well seasoned.  I Personally ordered the "Chicken Pot Pie" which was actually a thickened chicken soup with a puff pastry sitting on top.  A bit too much rosemary for my taste and the veggis (potatoes and carrots in particular) were undercooked.  I did send it back due to the crunchy potatoes BUT the waitress was good, told me the "pies" were flying out of the kitchen due to the cold weather, and the batch I received was indeed undercooked.  She quickly rectified the situation and brought out a fantastic grilled cheese that was so rich, i could only eat half!  Order the truffle fries. I ate every bite!  Service is good and will certainly be back.  Great family-owned addition to the area since I refuse to eat at chain restaurants.

Not a fan. They don't have a kids menu. 4 people over 100 dollars for 4 entrees and three drinks. One being a kids drink that was served in a kids cup and still the same price as an adult drink. No soups or side salads. Cheapest thing on the menu is 10 dollars. They were out of skirt steak and calamari. The servers only had two tables each yet I had to ask for refills and more sauces. They also have the tables very closely pushed together that every time a server would pass or a customer my chair would get hit. Every time. I had the BLT which I didn't even eat. The waitress suggested it because it comes with a layer of crunchy weaved bacon. The bacon was not crunch. The bread it came on was soggy from all the grease and barely toasted. I couldn't eat it. The fries were brown as if the oil hadn't been changed in a long time. I left hungry and unsatisfied. Doubt we will be back.
Food and service were excellent, however it is very noisy. Unable to carry on a conversation during the busy hours. Bring hearing protection if you go.

This place opened up at an old Applebee's  location.  Tried it once, won't go back. The prices are way too high, and the food doesn't come close to justifying that. Nondescript menu. The place is so noisy, even with just a few people inside, that you can't hold a conversation while you eat. I think it had to do with the abnormally high ceilings and wood floors. Nothing to absorb the noise. We couldn't wait to leave. With all the restaurants in this area I don't expect they'll be around too long.

Food is sort of good, but overpriced for what you get. Biggest disappointment is the beer selection- Miller Lite on tap? Few local brewery beers on draught, even fewer by bottle. Several big screen TV's with ESPN. This is supposed to be a gastropub, not a slightly upscale Applebees. We were promised a gastropub featuring a locally sourced and organic menu, 100% craft beers with at least half being local stuff, etc. Instead we get Sysco Foodservice grub, Coors Light bottles, and sports on TV. No thanks, Woods Creek. You'll be gone within a couple years- and forgotten.
Eating the cheese n Mac with BACON right now and it is absolutely incredible!! Also recommend adding blackened chicken to it to spice things up a bit!

I've been here twice already and loved it both times! They have a pretty good craft beer selection. I like that they have flights so you could try a bunch of different beers at once. It kind of reminds me of bars/pubs in Chicago so it was nice to have that kind of feel in the burbs. The service has been great and the bartenders gave us some good food recommendations/beers to try. I've gotten the mussels, truffle fries, and BBQ bacon burger. They were all really tasty and would order them again! If you like a juicy, messy burger I'd recommend this place. The mussels were garlicky and salty my friend and I both enjoyed them. Honestly, everything on the menu sounds good and would like to try more items. Warning, if you get That Warm Feeling burger, the peppers are hot!! :P 

 It's different from all the other chain restaurants on Randall and I like that. Everything is too common in this area so it's nice to see something different.

Great wrap around bar and beer selection.  It's a former Applebee's location so not a large place. The staff is friendly and the food is good but should be a step up for the price. It's improved gradually since opening.  

The Fried Green Tomatoes are my favorite.  The Wings are tasty but small. They also make a good Margarita. 

A nice place to stop at before or after a movie at the AMC next door.

Very crowded on a Friday at 5. But that's good. Really loud. Bartenders were a bit spacey. Last Saturday night the same thing. Liked ordering a flight of 3. I thought the bartender knew her stuff so that was nice. I liked the fried green tomatoes. Chicken tenders were alright. A bit too much breading. I'll go back for the beer flights. My cheeseburger was very good!

As noted by all the other reviews, the service is pretty bad, even when they're not busy.  The fish ceviche is good.  The camarones a la plancha(grilled) are not really a la plancha, they are more al vapor.  The micheladas are good.  Expect to spend $$$$ since it is a seafood restaurant, this really isn't the place to go to if you want tacos or other traditional Mexican dishes.

I came in on a sunday, early afternoon before dinner. Very akward restaurant immediately from walking in the front door. Tables are situated akwardly throughout the room and its a wierd space. 
 No hostess to greet us and I felt uncomfortable because I didnt know if we should sit or if the table that was available was clean or not. We sat anyways and waited 5-8mins just to get a menu. Long wait just to order drinks and only one waitress. We drank both of our drinks (when we finally got them) and still no waiter to take our order! We decided to leave and just pay for the micheladas which were the only good part of our dining experience. We had to find the waiter to pay our check, she never came back to the table.
I love la isla marias restaurant's but this location is a sad place. I will not be back.

Horrible service. The Waitress don't seem to much about service since they automatically want to charge u their not well deserved tip.  They also don't give a receipt so u need to be careful. This is just a spot to drink..not dine.

New remodeling done recently. Definetely looks a lot cleaner. Service is pretty bad. Ordered my food over 30 minutes ago, everyone else in my table received their order and they unfortunately seem to have forget about me. Just walked out and let them know that I didn't even want my food since I didn't want to eat alone. Did receive an apology from the hostess which was nice but a little late.

No traditional Mexican food which was ok because there were some decent but pricey options. The ceviche here is probably the best I have had but nothing else to rave about. The waitress seemed irritated we gringos were there and couldn't be bothered speaking English to is. Thankfully, I speak a little Spanish. There was music playing way too loud and there was no way to have a normal conversation. Place was sketchy and a little creepy. Large space but not much to fill it with so the atmosphere was uncomfortable. Food was not great and I couldn't wait to get out of there. Way too pricey.

We went there on a Sunday, for lunch.   The service here is awful, waitress are Just chatting. They were hanging  by the register,  would not stop  by our table.   I ordered a 7 mares stew, Once They brought my stew, I started eating and found a  small  piece of metal string in my plate.  I was grossed out,  again I was looking for the waitress to complain, but she would  not come over.   I had to go look for her, I explained my findings  to her,  she answered me that I had put the metal string on my plate.  I asked her if she was going to charge me for my plate,  she said she would, she blamed me of bringing  the metal and putting it there, Just so I could eat for free, mind you we ended up paying, $124.00 for the whole tab.  I would never go back here,  They never apologize, They blamed me for what I found in their food.  I could have possibly  ended up in the hospital, if I had not seen the metal in time.  It's not only a disgusting place, but dangerous.

From the minute we drove up to it it looked sketchy. Once we walked in I knew it was not going to be a good experience. The place looked dirty and was extremely messy and disorganized. We were there for a pick up order and it was still not ready after the time they had given us. Even tho the place was basically empty. The total was a lot for the small amount of food we ordered. Once I got home I realized that my breaded fish was still RAW.  And the shrimp empanadas were not very good and soggy. Worst experience I've had. I've been to other locations and it has always been pleasant. They should really step up their effort. If I could I would give them half a star.
First time here and it's different. Not much traditional food available. The food presentation is absolutely beautiful the taste was ok. I don't think I will go back.

I am only reviewing the bar area and on the drinks. My friends and I visited this bar during Baconfest which was right outside. It had a really fun atmosphere here. I really liked the different selection of beers they had. On top of all the standard beer, they had plenty on tap and even more seasonal beer including a pumkin cider! They also had Not Your Father's Root Beer on tap! We had a group of about 10 people and everyone was able to find something that they liked with no problems because of the great selection this bar offers.

The bartenders were also incredibly nice and friendly. The layout of the bar was pretty standard with bar stools and high tables for people to sit or stand around. I think it was because of Baconfest but it was quite crowded that night and we must have been standing at a bad place because we kept having to dodge people all night. Other than that it's a nice bar to stop at and grab a drink.

Fair to Middling at Best
First visit there and likely my last. Too bad....cute place! Call me picky but ...

Food: My skillet was described as having corned beef but it was their hash which was full of green and red peppers which I do not like. I suppose I could have asked but when menu said "corned beef" I thought I'd be getting ... well ... corned beef. The "home fries" at the base were not fresh...clearly those industrially cut, uniformly sized cubes. Also thought there would be a side of toast but I thought wrong. 

My companion ordered the corned beef hash and though it was seemingly homemade, which is good, it was served skillet - style which was not described in the menu. He expected the potatoes to be on the side and not all piled up w the hash and eggs,  and was disappointed with the presentation. Also...again...no toast. We like toast! For a $10 breakfast I think you should throw some in. 

Also...and I know part of this is somewhat out of their control, they had the outer bathroom door propped open. This part clearly under their control. There was a stall but, I dunno, am I wrong to want more privacy? There is seating just a short distance from the restrooms. Plus ... as a patron would you want to sit by an open bathroom door while eating your food?

In addition, the one toilet was clogged and disgusting. They sent me upstairs to another bathroom but ew....check the bathrooms regularly please!

Service: Nice when they were there...but slow. Maybe because we were outside but we weren't THAT far away. And it wasn't that busy. 
. 
So to be fair...maybe I just ordered their most mediocre item and hit the bathroom at just the wrong time but not sure I'd want to go back anytime soon. Plus ... did I mention? No toast!

Cool place.  Great bar area look and feel   Just stopped for Saturday AM drinks = bloodys and mimosas- both good.  Bloody comes with slice bacon - nice touch.  Breakfast dishes looked really good.  Have to come back and eat soon!

Do not skip the fried green tomato appetizer! So good. I was leary because it comes with deviled ham and I wasn't sure I like deviled ham but that was good too. Perfectly crisp and the tangy creole sauce paired well. The lunch combo of 1/2 sandwich, 1/2 salad and cup of soup is a great deal for $10. I had grilled cheese and my sis had a turkey club with crispy bacon that was enormous. Their bread is thick cut so even a half size is plenty. We had the House and  Caesar for the salad. Fresh and crisp greens on both. The soups were both killer. Split pea and the creamy, dreamy Beer Cheese. That alone will bring me back. Thanks again to our very attentive and sweet waitress, Tiffani. The building is interesting too and has a colorful history.

Overall: We had 7:30 reservations for four on a Friday night.  They were out of one of their specials (pork schnitzel) and the waitress explained they are only allowed to serve 20 diners each night and they always run out early.  A customer doesn't want to hear this.  They lost $20+ in sales because we planned to order two dinners specials but since the schnitzel was out, we ordered $10 meals.

Service: Our waitress didn't inform us they were out of schnitzel when she took our drink order and went on and on about how quickly it sells out and we should come earlier and they are holding 20 schnitzels for tomorrow. It was 7:30! She was also slow with second round of drinks.

Food: The fried green tomatoes app was delicious.  The MAC & cheese bites were bland and the two dipping sauces were just ok.  The veggie panini was good; however the sweet potato fries came out cold.

Rounding up to four stars. Prices are very good, food is above-average (except the beer cheddar soup which is astronomically amazing). Sunday's kids menu special of $0.99 is just...larceny in our part! Be sure to use the savings and tip the magician! Service seems to be their missing link. Slow, often absent from sight, and even with bus boys the tables aren't maintained correctly throughout the meal. Very pleased overall and will continue to visit with hopes the service improves.

I've been here numerous times now and I am a big fan.  I usually comes for lunch with my coworkers and very much enjoy the affordable lunch menu.  I've never sat anywhere but the bar area and the bartenders are quick to serve and do a great job helping you get in and out.  Which is nice because I don't really love long lunches when it means I'll still be working at 6 pm trying to get in all my hours.  

The lunch menu has a lot of great sandwich choices and my friends have said good things about the grilled cheese.  I'm partial to the buffalo chicken wrap and sweet potato fries.  It's been delicious every time.  

I recently met a girlfriend there for dinner and I got to check out their tap list.  They had quite a few offerings and a good variety.  I had no problem picking out something to drink.  Plus if you can't find something on draft they have plenty to offer in bottles.  The dinner menu is a nice alternative to the lunch menu.  It still has a lot of great sandwich options but also included some very tempting mac'n'cheese.  I tried out the turkey cobb panini and enjoyed it.  The service was once again great and I will keep coming back!

Happened upon Middleton's as we were planning on grabbing a burger at Bulldog's.  What a great find!  Walked in with an open mind and no expectations.  

Atmosphere:  Warm and quaint in a 2 story historic home/store.  1st floor split between dining area and full bar.  We sat in the dining area by the fireplace.  

Food & Drinks:  Great!!!  Solid craft beer selection.  We had the Jameson chicken, avocado burger, fish and chips and portabella mushroom appetizer.  All outstanding!  

Service:  Excellent!  Dorian was our server and she helped us through the menu and provided great service.  

We are definitely coming back!

Fantastic.  The Irish Onion Soup was so tasty as well as the roasted bacon Brussels sprouts.  My husband had the corned beef and cabbage and devoured it!  It's nice for kids also, the kids me u is inside of a children's book that they get to pick before we are seated.  The kids menu was your average food selection.  Our service was great, the food came out with perfect timing and the Ice cream Sundaes at the end were wonderful!    Very happy patrons!
Strongly recommend crab cakes.  Excellent wine and beer list.  Great place to kill time before dinner or to eat dinner.  We will definitely be back.

We've been here numerous times over the past 2-3 years, and every time we leave happy and full. Middleton's is located in a very old building with lots of charm. I think it was a brothel at one time, but don't quote me on that. When you walk in you are greeted by a friendly hostess. The bar is off to the right and a dinning room is off to the left.  When the weather is nice the open air front porch offers a wonderful relaxed option.  

The food is very good and portions are big.  Yesterday four of us went for breakfast.  We started by splitting one of their homemade cinnamon rolls - it was awesome.  I had biscuits and gravy with two eggs over easy.  My wife had one of the eggs Benedict variants.  My kids both had crepes.  All the food was excellent.  Our total bill was $53, which seemed very reasonable.  

My only knock was my bloody mary.  It was weak and bland.  

Overall, Middleton's is a great place to come with friends or family.  The restaurant is quaint and very family friendly.  The bar is a great place to watch a game, and offers an extensive list of craft brews. Sunday evenings a magician walks around and does impressive table-side magic tricks (reminds me of the good old days at Schulien's in Chicago). 

If you are in Wauconda, and looking for good food in a relaxed atmosphere - I highly recommend this place.

I can't believe I didn't already write a review for this place.  It's my favorite place to go when in Waconda!  I found this bar one day after work a while back when I was in Waconda and just looking for a beer.  I stopped and saw all the different beers they carry, so I told the bartender I wanted to try something from local breweries if he had anything.  He told me about Not Your Father's Root beer.  I tried a taste and loved it.   Then the second time I went here I was in the mood for eating some place other than the usual haunts.  I headed to Middleton's because I was impressed the first time.  The night was perfect outside so we sat on the balcony.  I recommend it for anyone who enjoys eating on a patio or balcony when the weather is nice.  That night they also live Jazz music.  I was in the area again today so I brought a coworker for lunch.  We sat in the bar and the bartender, Courtney, waited on us.  She tended bar and waited tables and did a great job.  The burgers were great, (except next time I think I'll tell them not to toast the bun).  Check it out if you're ever on Main street in Waconda.  It's worth the trip.

We had the lamb stew, and corn beef and cabbage; both were among the best we had. It was our first time there and definitely where the locals dine. They have an extensive beer list although my first two selections where sold out. Service was fast.

Love this place! Great food always, I usually opt for a burger because they are so good and I don't eat burgers too often otherwise. They usually have a speciality burger or I'll get the bacon avacado one.   Sweet potato fries are worth the extra!  The tap list is always fantastic, check beermenus.com for the latest. Fun for live music on weekends.

Looking for somewhere to have breakfast in wauconda came across this pub and decided to give it a chance. It was unreal great portions reasonable priced server was super pleasant! Couldn't have asked for a better experience!
It's hit or miss with the quality of their food.  The drinks are OK but the times we've been there it's been busy so getting service can sometimes take awhile.

Had the MOMs burger.  It was a big burger, 8oz, I ordered mine well done and it was still juicy.  There beer battered fries are really good too.  I would recommend you give it a try.

4 stars instead of 5 because it smelled like mothballs.

Three of us ate dinner here on. Friday night.  We were able to be seated at a table on the outdoor front porch.  We enjoyed the downtown atmosphere almost as much as the food.  We ordered the Fried Green Tomatoes and cheese curds as appetizers.  While not great both were pretty darn good.  The deviled ham that comes with FGT was very good.  We also ordered two different salads, the Berry salad with nuts was very good as was the cucumber and tomato salad with pistachio nuts.  Our group also ordered the corned beef dinner which was very good with a very generous portion.  Good service, good food, and good atmosphere means we will be visiting this place again.
We love this local restaurant. Great food and atmosphere. More Craft Beers then you could ever Drink!
I'm very glad I gave Middleton's a second chance.  Food was awesome, wait staff was superb!
Huge menu, lots of selections.  Had the pot roast poutine.  Started to fill up when we left.  Looked like a nice place to hang out and grab a drink.  Would return to try something else.

We decided to have a birthday celebration at Middleton's 10 a.m. for breakfast There Were Ten of us. I have to say it's a shame we had such a mediocre poorly planned breakfast at the restaurant. The waitress did Apologize a half of an hour after we got there they were finally taking our order she said they were understaffed didn't expect such a crowd on a Sunday morning even though it was a holiday weekend. I am very sorry to say we will not be using Middleton's for breakfast any More. My comment is if you're going to do breakfast on the weekends do it right. The table's are unprepared with jelly with butter for breakfast. We found out after the second cup of coffee but they were out of regular coffee and only serving decaf,  the eggs came out dry we were very disappointed. Very poorly planned meals. Beer and booze is easy to serve but if you're going to be a restaurant then be a restaurant.

Middleton's on Main is a very good restaurant with very polite staff. We were seated immediately on the main floor. I ordered the Apple glazed pork chops with mashed potatoes and spinach. My wife ordered the standard fare of fish and chips. The food was excellent with the only issue was with the coleslaw that was very Bland. My pork chop was double thick and was juicy. The mashed potatoes could have been much better. The fish and chips however was awesome. The cod fillets were in strips and the French fries seem to be double dipped in the fryer. Yummy! My wife also commented that the tartar sauce was as good as hers. Overall if my wife was pleased then we will be coming back to Middleton's on Main again.

Absolutely love this place, the building with open window walls to sit and enjoy the weather makes me think of New Orleans. Located in the middle of cute Main Street Wauconda, walking distance to the lake.

The food is exquisite Irish style gourmet. Pork belly bruschetta, beer balls, roasted Brussels sprouts all were so tasty. 

The beer menu was huge! I liked the grapefruit beer. 

Only downside, so many things I want to try and pricy for lunch. Excellent for dinner.

Definitely my favorite hang out in Wauconda. Great selection of craft beer on tap with good atmosphere and live music on the weekend. Also I haven't had food I didn't like, corned beef is my favorite.

My friends and I have been here several times for breakfast (Saturday & Sunday only), lunch and dinner.  Every time the food and the service have been really good.  They have a large selection of beers, both on tap and bottled.  The menu options are really good and if you don't see what you like tell your server.  My experience has been that the chef is happy to make adjustments or substitutions.

Fell in love with Middleton's on Main! The set up is really cool. It's clearly an older building but is holding up quite well if you ask me. There's two levels, main floor and an upstairs- both have outdoor seating which is neat. I sat on the balcony upstairs, getting a nice view of the street and enjoyed the nice weather.   I ordered an appetizer, Pretzel with a cheese dip. The cheese dip was amazing! I couldn't stop dipping my pretzel in it! The only downfall to it were the pretzels. They appeared to be the kind that are from a box and can easily microwave it. 
The entree I ordered was the Chicken Caprese Panini. It had a balsamic glaze with a pesto mayo and the combination was delicious. It gave the panini a nice flavorful juice. The chicken was a tad dry but thankfully the juice from the pesto and glaze helped. 
Service was decent. The employees are very kind but a tad slow. Which was odd, considering when I went it was on a Saturday afternoon and wasn't nearly close to being full. Then again I didn't see many employees around... 
Overall I would return in an instant, good location, atmosphere was good, and the food was the best part!

Middleton's on Main is the bomb!   

When Middleton's on Main took over the empty building, I was glad that Wauconda finally had a new restaurant/bar to offer the community.   Lindy's & Slyce cannot compete against Middleton's.   

My husband & I originally went to Middleton's on a Friday night to check out my friend's band playing, and I thought it would be great way to ck out the place.   Middleton's is an upscale Irish bar with a talented staff (from their servers to bar tenders to bus boys).  I could not believe how organized they were, how friendly they were with the customers, how familiar they were with their menu, and how clean it was.  I could not help but think that Robert Irvine could not correct the flow or process they had going on in the bar section.  

They have dining seating area (which I plan on coming back & having lunch or dinner there).   While their bar is on the right side of the building with upper seating to look over the bar.   

For drinks, I went with my usual (Captain & coke) but I wish I could have tried the Strawberry Hill because it sounded yummy & sweet (..... next time).   They had an elaborate list of mixed drinks, beers, wine, cordials to choose from.   

For food, we wanted to order appetizers to go with our drinks.    So I ordered their Fish (cod) & chips & my husband ordered their Mac & Cheese.   The batter on the cod was crunchy & the cod was tender & fresh.   The dill sauce was a great compliment for dipping.    But wait, it gets better--- their fries made me oooooooo & ahhhhhh.    Delicious!   I sampled the Mac & cheese, it was creamy & the bacon complimented the flavor.    They offer a lot of variety on their menu.   So I will be glad to come back & try their other menu items.   

I'm definitely a fan of Middleton's and 'you' should check out this awesome place.

Oh, how I miss when it was Lakeside Inn where you can get a good breakfast and good coffee. I have been there twice for breakfast and it subpar at best. The coffee is weak and the food is below average. Service was slow, the setting is still cool but wish this was better. If it works out I might come here for dinner one day as I hear better things about it.

Really a 3.5 star review, but I'll round up because it is clear that this place is such a beloved local favorite. The food was good, the beer list was extensive, and everyone was clearly having a great time. I would come back if I was in the area!

I came here for a friend's birthday, and a good time was had by all. Parking was a bit difficult (we wound up parking a few blocks away on a side street), and it was a bit loud in the bar with the loud music, but there were places we could have sat that would have been quieter, so I can't fault them for this. I loved the variety of little nooks here- a main dining room on the left, a hoppin' bar to the right, and small, more hidden dining area on the 2nd floor.

The food was pretty good- I wouldn't come here specifically for the food, but it was totally serviceable. I ate nachos, which came with a delicious cheese sauce AND melted shredded cheese. I got ground beef, which I would not recommend, as it was not well-seasoned- it just didn't taste spicy or Mexicanish at all. I realize I ordered these at an Irish pub, but they could have thrown some salsa in there. Still, small quibbles- I still ate them! My fiance ordered fish and chips, and they brought him some extra tarter sauce when he asked them without complaint or an extra charge. He ate them quickly enough I didn't even get a chance to try them. The service here was very friendly, prompt, and nice.

Stumbled on this place after our 1st destination was closed.  OMG how fortunate we were to find this place.  The interior is really nice with lots of wood.  The service was very friendly and attentive.  The server asked several times if everything was alright and if we needed anything.  One thing I really appreciated was that they kept the table clear of dishes and trash as we were don with stuff.  The wife and I split a Dirty Bastards Ale Cheese Fondue with delightful pretzel bread sticks. The wife had an apple butter glazed grilled bone in pork chop.  The crust and flavor was incredible - she gave me a bite - OMG.  I had a Guinness-marinated lamb stew in a bread bowl - again OMG flavorful.  We got MAC and Cheese with bacon and country ham for my adult son to take home.  Even reheated he said it was delightful and he is a mac and cheese fanatic.  One nice feature is that this place has a full and very nice bar with a separate dining area which is nice for families.  There is a really nice coffee shop across the street, plenty of parking and a nice little business area to walk around.  Definitely visit there website.
My mom and mine first time everything perfect.

OMG!!! Did my taste buds do a happy dance to the tune of Middleton's on Main in Wauconda. My husband and I started out with a appetizer called Dirty Bastards Ale Cheese Fondue with delightful pretzel bread sticks. Yum! Yum! Then comes the entrees. My husband ordered the Guinness-marinated Lamb stew(Irish) in a bread bowl and I ordered the Apple Butter Glazed Pork Chop with grilled white polenta cakes and saut̩ed spinach. My husband's lamb was so tender and flavorful and my pork chop had a wonderful crust on it and the apple butter was heavenly! I had never tasted polenta before and I loved it as well as the saut̩ed spinach.Like I said, my taste buds did a happy dance for the entire dining experience. We will definitely be back to try their other wonderful choices!!

Great food and great wine and beer list. Great fish fry too. My wife and I travel from Crystal Lake often for the great food and atmosphere. She's a Moriarty and I'm an O'Meara so this Irish gastropub is perfect treat for us. Never have had a bad meal: wonderful consistency.

I love this bar but their sheppards pie is a disgrace. How are you gonna call yourself a Irish pub and make the worst sheppards pie I have ever eaten. Clearly under cooked and made with what tasted like dog food quality meat frozen veggies and instant mashed potatoes.
Decent pub grub. Don't remember what I had but was not disappointed. Good beer selection.
Delicious, cute setting , fun setting and knowledgeable waitstaff . Creative menu and vast selection of beers / wines !! We will be back many more times

Went for a Bloody Mary with the hubby after dropping our boy off at Football. Very close to the field , figured we'd give it a whirl. I had the corned beef Ramen, which is exactly as it sounds. Broth, BIG chunks of Corned beef, Ramen noodles and veggies. Pretty good, but the broth was a tad bland. Hubby ate shepards pie that was made with TONS of fresh small, thinly sliced corned beef, veggies topped with mashed potatoes then broiled until the potatoes were a bit crispy! It was great! I know what I'm getting next visit! Our server was Colleen at the bar area. She is fun, attentive and makes a DELICIOUS Bloody Mary with olives, pickle and a bacon stirrer. It had just the right amount of flavor, spicy but not overly. We are fans and will definitely be back!! A+ all around!

Yummy burgers... REALLY good Reuben's..(however the bread could be grilled a bit)... Irish onion soup is a once and done item.
Fun atmosphere, friendly staff, LOTS of tv's for sporting events.  Last night it was both sports and the high wire walk over Chicago.
Big menu, interesting choices... Would be interested in trying other items.

Great decor and the best list of crafts beers you could ask for in the Wauconda area. The bartenders are knowledgeable about their beer selection too. Food is pretty good and with a few standouts like their chicken sandwich and fried pickles. Be careful when they are down a bartender in the bar though. It has happen a few times now and it greatly increases your wait times for food orders and drink orders in the bar!

Stopped by here for dinner last night. The atmosphere is great, the place is clean, and the history of the building is very interesting. The drink menu is pretty extensive, and I didn't even look at a beer menu. The food is outstanding. The menu has just the right amount of variety. I ordered the special (M.O.M.'s meatloaf). It wasn't the flavor of meatloaf I am accustomed to, but it was still great. It was more food than I really needed, but I couldn't stop myself from eating everything. It came with a side salad which I had with, what I am assuming is homemade, Smokey Bacon bleu cheese dressing. The meatloaf was covered in an unusual sweet, brown gravy with mashed potatoes and corn with onion straws on top. 

Others tried the grilled chicken sandwich and the Jameson Chicken. The grilled chicken sandwich wasn't anything great, but it is just a grilled chicken sandwich. The "bacon" they put on the top is a piece of ham that has been pan fried. The Jameson Chicken was very good. It was breaded and fried chicken cuts served with a white gravy that is infused with Jameson Whiskey, mashed potatoes, and wilted spinach. The gravy is excellent, and I was stealing fries to dip in the gravy. 

I will definitely have to take a trip back here to sit at the bar and try some beers (maybe even play bar trivia, Monday nights), and really get the full experience. This place may be a 5-star joint if you are there for more than just a meal.
Great place to end a long workday or week!  Friendly, good selections of yummy food and reasonable prices - try the Walleye BLT!

Really like the atmosphere here. Only had drinks with friends but they had a great drink menu. Really good Moscow Mules and gluten free menu. Bartenders were attentive and didn't mind going in the back to grab my gluten free beer.

Had a great time with my husband and my 2 daughters ( age 10 and 6) tonight.
Kids eat for .99 and the magician was there.
Had the lobster mac n cheese-- awesome, lots of lobster- chunks not tiny pieces.
Husband had the shepards pie-- he said it was very good. He also had the spiced holiday beer, since he's kinda a craft beer snob, he loved what he ordered.
Kids had chicken tenders and cheese pizza-- they at all of their meal so it must have been good.
No room for desert. But the selections looked yummy.
Will def come back!

Stopped here on an early Saturday afternoon to grab bite. Pretty regrettable decision. First off, there were ZERO customers in the place, zero. You'd think you'd get some good service since you were the only people in the room, nope. Slow, fairly rude services. Anywho, the pretzel appetizer was some out of the box frozen pretzels with some fairly good cheese, meh. We also ordered the Reuben which was average. The only redeeming qualities about this place was that it was a nice looking bar and they do have a great craft beer selection. Luckily we find ourselves out in Wauconda maybe once every 10 years. I can't wait to not go back.

If the sole purpose of your trip to Middleton's is to go to a quaint bar/pub and experience an exceptional beer menu paired with ok food then Middleton's is your spot!  
We were there on a Saturday afternoon, only group in the bar.......you'd think service wouldn't be our complaint right?  wrong!   Not sure what it is with bars/restaurants, the less people that are there the less attentive the server/bartender.
If you can get past that though I was VERY impressed by the overall feel of the bar and the fantastic beer menu......
I'll definitely be back, but not so much for the food as for the beer and ambiance.

We have gone here quite a few times, always great food, they have an awesome craft beer selection. The service leaves something to be desired, we are always greeted nicely and sat right away but the food takes a long time and the servers are not as attentive as they could be. I would recommend to sit in the bar area, the bartenders are quick to serve you.
Great Reuben sandwich, and rest of menu very good too.  Very good bar, wide beer variety.  Good, friendly service and homey Irish setting.

This is the second  40th  birthday party we had there,and it was just as great as the first one.the staff were very attentive and the food came out as promised and it was great. Great spot to have a fun family party. Love the old charm atmosphere . Our new favorite spot!

Im not sure what all the praise is for. My husband and I ate here 2 years ago and never been back.  Wasn't because of bad service was because of bad food. My husband ordered a steak and had no flavor what so ever. I had a cheeseburger and that had no flavor.  I did not want to pay for our food considering I did not eat more then a couple of bites. Instead we paid for our dinner after making sure we told them how unsatisfied we we're with our meal. I really do not recommend this restaurant.

Second visit and nothing but good. 
Great atmosphere with Irish music, good beer selection.
Servers are very attentive and friendly
Owners involved and friendly. Real commitment to listen and improve.
Menu items tried: salmon quesadilla excellent, fish and chips, about the best I've had. Great batter lots of fish good fries, corned beef - amazing!, veggie pannini with goat cheese great. 
So far nothin but gooood!

We were dining with friends on a casual evening out and decided Middleton's On Main would fit the bill. The couple we were with have been to Middleton's several times and extolled its virtue as a casual eatery. 

I loved the ambiance and a perky server was right there to take drink orders as soon as we took our seats. The menu is vast with choices from full course specials featuring seafood, meat, pasta and more. The choices of sandwiches \ burgers is impressive to say the least. 

I ordered a pork tenderloin special that featured paillard pork medallions in a cranberry sauce. Unfortunately, my pork (and my friends dish) were overcooked and dry. The sauce was excellent however. 

For an establishment that focuses on crafted beers the wine selection was surprisingly good. One of our friends did however ask for a wine that were out of that day. 

The service was really great. Our server was on point with all our orders and my wine glass was never empty. Keep wine in front of me all night and your tip will be excellent!  

Some of our group ordered sandwiches and those reportedly were fantastic. I will give Middleton's another opportunity shortly but will stick with the traditional pub fare and stay clear of more traditional entrees. 

All in all a nice place, near my home, and I will be back. If 3  1/2 stars were available I would have raised my rating. Over cooking my pork cost them a star however.

Another winner for downtown Wauconda. 

We stopped in for something to drink when we realized that our favorite coffee place -- Honey Hill -- across the street was closed.

We walked across to Middleton's and had some iced tea.  

However, after looking over their menu, we decided to try their Guiness hot wings.  Wow! what a treat! 

This place has a great location (it's the old Lakeside Inn) and friendly, helpful, service.  We will definitely be back for a dinner.

Great beer selection, great food. They have excellent specials, and the lamb stew is amazing. I like the Friday fish fry, which has thick crunchy batter. The fried pickles spears are very good, too.
We've always had great service here, and the atmosphere is very pleasant. It's also a good restaurant for kids.

Walked in for dinner to find two hosts (who looked barely over the age of 16) sitting on stools behind the host stand, talking to each other. Barely glanced at us, didn't greet us. I said hello and that there were two of us for dinner. Husband had the all-you-can-eat fish fry which he said was "pretty good" and I had the fish tacos which were barely tolerable. A few tiny bites of cod, some slimy cabbage and a thin slice of avocado in a flimsy corn tortilla. The rice dish that came on the side was OK. Service was lousy...waitress had that "I don't want to be here" attitude and only checked on us once during dinner. Husband had to ask for more fish - she never checked to see if he wanted or needed more. At the end of our meal, she came and placed the guest book on the table as she passed by. Never said anything like most waitstaff do such as, "I'll take this when you're ready. No hurry." We had one of those online deals where we paid $15 for $30 worth of food and our bill came out to be $29.95, so all we owed was tip. We placed the tip in the guest book and waited for the waitress to come by and pick it up...and waited and waited. She never came back to pick it up and say thank you or have a good night or anything. We finally just got up and left. Good thing we had only paid $15 for our food because even that amount was barely worth it. We won't be back.

I know everyone in Wauconda loves MIddletons, but being a foodie - I'm not as thrilled.

I've been a few different times.  For drinks, for dessert and for dinner.  Haven't had a great experience except that I'm with friends.

The most annoying thing to me, but I know some people actually would probably like this point, is the band that seems to always be playing.  I don't think I'm old, but when I get into Middletons, I feel old because I always feel like the music is WAY too loud.  In the bar - loud; over in the restaurant up and down - loud; and the WORST place ever to sit, the balcony across from the balcony where the band plays -- I think I lost about 30% of my hearing on that balcony. 

Beyond that - I love cocktails and I've tried a few of the ones on their menu and haven't been thrilled with any of them.  If you like beer, I know they have a pretty broad selection.

Desserts - tried a few and haven't been blown away by anything - they've got sugar in them so that makes me happy....  And the dinner that I tried was not that fabulous either.

The one thing I did like is the actual building itself.  If nothing else, go into Middletons for the history - they really did a good job of updating the restaurant, but leaving a lot of the original old building's bones.  I really do love going into the place just for the wood and brick and all.  Very cool.

Just what Wauconda needed.  This place is classic and clean, and in a great location.  Like the decor!  Good selection of food and drink.  Went with a crowd and all left happy.  Friendly service.  Finding parking on the street can be a challenge.

The menu surpasses nearby Lindy's in inventiveness and quality and the service is better. In addition, Middleton's has a wide selection of bottled beers and decent ones on tap, like Guiness and Newcastle.  What Middleton's doesn't have is a view if Bang's Lake, but don't let that sway you.

One of the best places in lake county. Unbelievable selection of beer (bottle and tap). Food is great!! Had the fish and chips and it was some of the best I have had in a long time. The thing that I liked most about Middleton' s is that it has a great atmosphere. Great bar area and comfortable restaurant. We usually go to Lindy's when we are in Wauconda, but the good is far superior and prices are better at Middleton's. I cannot wait to go back!!!!!!

Stopped by there for lunch on 11/9 at 11:30am! Didnt eat lunch because the young girl behind the hostess stand looked at the phone (didnt get out of her chair) said, "are you here for breakfast? " we said no lunch, she said "sorry lunch isnt until 12!, so we inturn walked out. 
Me being in the F & B Industry....Not a good move on her part! No one in the place and yes they were open!  Didnt go and ask if possibly kitchen was ready to go with lunch, and by the time we sat and ordered a beverage how far off was 12?
My husband and I are local and our first time here! Not a good way to start! 
Sorry I just had to vent. Seeing as though Good Restaurants are few and far!
Hope they change that!

Staff was very nice and accommodating. We had the fish fry and shrimp ramen. The fish was average but the ramen was not the greatest. The fries were pretty good though but the pretzels for an appetizer was really bland. We tried the famous root beer beer which was very different but good in its own way. Place was very neat looking inside and will be back for the staff, beer and atmosphere in hopes the food turns out better next time.

Went in on a busy Saturday night.  Two families (ours and some friends)- four adults and four little kids.  We were all EXHAUSTED from a day of swimming.  Kids were ornery.  There was the potential for badness in the form of one of our toddlers' tantrums ruining the night of an all-adult party at a nearby table.

Well..... there were NO tantrums.  In fact, all kids were relatively sedate and well behaved all evening.  There is something magic about this restaurant that allows adults to feel like adults (GREAT food, extensive beer list and good wine choices, dim lighting) and still allows kids to be content too (lots of kids books to borrow from the hostess stand, kids menu options were real food not an afterthought, enough room to walk around if necessary, diaper changing station in the bathroom, etc.)

Our server was AWESOME.  Very attentive.

Most importantly- I feel confident that we did not annoy a single other adult in the establishment that night.

Thank you, Middleton's On Main.  Thank you.

First off, the food was absolutely great. I had the Chicago Bangers and Mash which was very very tasty. The bratwurst was probably one of the best I have had period. Secondly, the beer selection was top notch. Finally, the service was lightning fast. We arrived around prime time on a Saturday evening. We were seated quickly (party of 4) and had food on the table within 15 to 20 minutes of sitting down. The hostess and wait staff were very professional and pleasant. 

Only let down is that because it is downtown Wauconda, parking can be difficult. I don't blame the restaurant for that though.

I would definitely go there again.

Had dinner here, no wait on a Friday night, so got seated right away. Ordered the fish fry and the batter was too thick and over-fried, almost burnt. It was ok, but I would not order it again. The apple crisp dessert was good, but not amazing like other places, there wasn't enough crisp and just all soggy apples. I am ok if I don't go back. 
On a side note, the waitress (short brown hair with glasses) was very rude to a runner of the food. He made a mistake of bringing the entrees at the same time as the apps and she was like "what is wrong with this picture??" and pretty much demoralized him and my whole table heard it. SO NOT COOL!!!

Went out for a cocktail mid afternoon on a Tuesday. The place just opened the day before. Adriane was our waitress and was fabulous! It was as if it was her home and she wanted us to feel welcome. We had a couple of different beers on tap, liked them all and the boar sliders. The sliders were perfect size and the taste was quite complex  due to the unpredictable ingredients. Then we shared the dessert sampler, again, the perfect size to compliment a cocktail in the afternoon. There were so many different flavors going on in this dessert that everyone will strike a hit with this one.
Atmosphere A+, service A+., food a+.will be back.....just one thing...get some music on the front porch.
Things are looking up! We had a really good experience last night. Service was perfect and food was so good. Hope this continues

Excellent bread pudding. Close to excellent calamari. Very friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable staff. Lovely atmosphere with plenty of outdoor seating. Very large beer selection. The wild boar sliders looked really good, but tasted a bit odd, I was not a fan. Would definitely go back though.
Just reopened.  Very attentive wait and bar staff.  Good food.
Love the Hash Browns for breakfest

just returned from

Excellent!  We sat outside on the first floor on a sunny early evening Saturday.  After being open for a few weeks, MoM operates as if they've been doing it for years.  Adriane, our server, was humble professional and extremely personable.  From walking in/out the service exceeded expectations.  And the owners are top notch with superb food choice to please any appetite.  Save room for dessert!  The bread pudding is absolutely the best my wife and I had ever!  Well done!

Amazing food, attentive servers, friendly owners, and a great atmosphere! 
I have tried: fried pickles, asparagus bruschetta, veggie pannini(LOVE IT), sweet potato truffle tots, corned beef rolls, Dublin coddle(Thursday night special), Drunken Goat salad, and bread pudding so far.  They ALL were delicious, and presented beautifully!  I'm told the Fish & Chips, and Friday Night's Fish Fry are also very good!

I highly recommend this place for lunch, dinner, & drinks!!

Much better than the old establishment / bar that occupied this space.  I walked in with my little son and the hostesses were really friendly. We felt super welcome. I had an urge for nachos and he had an urge for Mac N Cheese. I ordered the loaded chips appetizer and it came back as loaded Fries - oops my bad, I'm a little unversed in my high English (had to throw the leftovers in the boot of my car!). My son liked his mac n cheese and his juice. I loved my craft beers from the Michigan-Ohio region. Waitress was cool. Upstairs is a little cramped. Overall I'd say pretty good, especially for we Waucondites (is that a word?) who don't want to do the typical McHenry Olive Garden trek.  I'll probably go back in a couple months.
Yum! Love this place. Great food. Never had a bad meal. They have a family dining area or a bar area to eat in. Soups are wonderful. Breakfast is also the bomb.

I've had a tough time trying to decide what to write on this review.  My husband and I were there for lunch yesterday.  The food was good.  I'm a Mac and Cheese person, I try it all over the place, and theirs has a ton of blue cheese giving it a deep tang.  

That being said, I got EATEN ALIVE by mosquito's in this place.   I'm hyper sensitive to them, and am very very careful about them, using spray any time I'm outside.  I sat inside.  INSIDE.  I got 7 bites in a short period of time.  I walked in with no bites, walked out with SEVEN.  Not sure what the issue is here, but I'm not sure we'll return, which is a shame because between the mac and cheese and the beer cheese soup, I was looking forward to trying some more of their dishes.

My husband and I took my dad there tonight. Excellent as usual!  The staff is exceptional, friendly and professional.  The food is awesome, really.  I am in love with the salads they have and you have to try the fresh berry tea!  The fried pickles were a great treat for an appetizer and we had lobster bisque soup, just fabulous!  I am very fussy about where I eat and what I eat and this place is definitely on my number one list, you just have to try it.
tasting, checking this new cool place out. Gappy wit the Fixed Gear beer from milwaukee. now onto Tuesday's tapas specials
Great food...great drinks and great staff!!!  I love the updates and refreshments they have done to the inside and out!!!  Great to have such a landmark come back in such a great way!!!

It was my first time going to this fine establishment on a Sunday. It was FANTASTIC! The staff made it especially AMAZING. They were so friendly and helpful! I think their names were John and Mason. SO NICE! My friend and I came in expecting a regular bar and sub par bar food but the food was fantastic - everything on the menu looked wonderful.   It was too bad I could only pick one item to order! They had a fantastic beer selection which the bar staff kindly helped us choose what we'd like before pouring us a pint. The atmosphere is nice and comfortable. We are definately going to make this a regular hang out. 
A+ middletons!

Middletons on Main is the place to be!! We were there Tuesday night and what a treat.  Not only is their beer and food menu amazing but our service was outstanding.  I tried the chicken and wild rice risotto and my wife had the hang over burger, both awesome.  Our bartender was knowledgeable and attentive and steered us in the right direction.  We wish we had saved room for desert the cheesecakes and chocolate pot de cr̬me sound so delicious. We will definitely be back soon!! Hats off the the chef and staff!!  Thanks Wauconda for having such a stellar restaurant.

Middelton's just opened and I'm already impressed. We got lucky and just missed the lunch crowd. We sat upstairs on the balcony overlooking Main St. It's my favorite place to sit.

The host and wait staff were extremely friendly. They're still training yet very attentive to the diners. I was pleased with their beer list (although unable to enjoy at the time). I ordered the berry ice tea which had real raspberries. Highly recommended. For our appetizer, we ordered the salmon quesadillas. This was the highlight of the meal. Wow, I would go back and make this my meal. For lunch, I gave the Irish restaurant a try with their corned beef. The corned beef was delicious. I'm not much of a cabbage fan so I took a pass and substituted with new-to-me dish, sweet potato tater tots. Excellent as expected. My wife had the Farmer's Salad and gave it a positive review.

There's several places to choose in Wauconda now. I'd highly suggest giving Middelton's your first shot even if this place is packed (once the word gets out that it's a great place to eat).

This place great!  Test beer selection is phenomenal and the food is even better.  We sat at the upstairs bar and my only suggestion is to either have the bar stocked with most of the beer selections or get a dumbwaiter to the downstairs bar.  It takes too long for the bartender to put the drink order in and then go downstairs to pick up the drink order.  Very inconvenient to the guests and bartender.  All in all freeway place.  We will be back.

This was the first time I went to Middleton's on Main.. It was definitely great! I love the atmosphere there. Tasty beer selection but dissapointed that they do not offer any Hard Ciders. It is on the menu but when I spoke with the bartender she said that they dont really have any except for one that they have on tap but she didnt recommend it.. she gave me a sample and it definitely didnt taste like any hard cider I have had before, very bland and dull. So moving on to the food. I had the paddy melt and it was delicious, i could not stop eating the fries. The only complaint that i would have is that I asked for the burger to be cooked well done and it was more medium then well done. My friend had the scallops risotto and she was happy with it. To finish the meal we both had the apple crisp for dessert and it was phenominal!! I will definitely be coming back here.

My wife and I made our 1st visit here on 11/9/13, and at this point, it will be our only visit. We were seated immediately upon arriving around 5:15pm. We sat down and went through the expansive drink/beer/wine menus. We both decided on different tap beers, they were out of both. We skipped the alcohol and just ordered an appetizer while we went over the menu for our dinner. Our appetizer arrived quickly, and we then ordered soups and our entrees. Our soups were delivered immediately as we were still working on the appetizer. Then, within minutes, while still on the appetizer, soups still sitting there , our entrees were served. I could not believe what was happening. Now during all of this, our water glasses went empty and refills on our iced teas never happened. There were bus boys running all over this place and not one of them knew how to pick up a water pitcher. We finished most of the appetizer, half of our soups(bowls of the cheese soup) and part of our dinners. We had to eat so fast that we felt bloated, and were unable to really enjoy or even finish our meals. Most of it was cold by the time we were trying to finish. We took most of it home. I will say the food really was good, but the service was really clueless, and there was NO reason to rush us like that in a half empty dining room. I even wrote a "contact us" message stating the above to management. Its been 48 hours and haven't heard from them. They are quite deserving of this review.

11/21/2013- It's been 10 days and I still haven't heard from anyone from this place. I see how important customers are to them. They can close up for all I care.

Middleton's just started to host live music and the place serves as an amazing venue. The fish and chips are delicious. Jeff the manager and his staff are top notch! Definitely worth a trip from the city!

Wide menu selection.  Great wings!  Food was unique and prices were reasonable.  The staff was friendly and service was great.  Over 100 beers to select from.  They are in a 150 year old building that has a lot of character.  The atmosphere is great.

This is our favorite go to restaurant in the Wauconda area. Food never disappoints, service is always excellent and a great value for the quality. It isn't a place you get huge quantities of food, but if you want a nice size portion of really good food and some unique items with a GREAT beer and very nice wine menu, this is the place. Owners are awesome people really trying to bring a quality restaurant to this area. While there are no lake views, the 2 outside porches give you a nice outdoor option and the food FAR beats the 2 restaurants in the area with water views (Dock's and Lindy's Landing).

Love this restaurant! Me and my family started with the sweet potato tots with garlic aioli which was freaking good. For entrees I had the M.O.M.S. burger which was a huge size and juicy. My family members had jameson chicken and the guiness burger. Mmm everything was so good. And then for dessert we had bread pudding which was fantastic. Charming ambiance and nice waitress. We're coming back very soon.

Horrid.  Prime rib is very  tough like chewing gum w/poor flavor.  Almost choked on a couple pieces.  Very blue collar place.  Very loud place with kids running and screaming all over the place. Not voice friendly or a place to impress a date;  Salads not included so ad $5.00 to your entree. Drinks overpriced.  Will not go back to.

Entree and appetizer were fine & the waiter was extremely nice.  I feel the prices, esp. the drinks, were too high.  $3.00 for a diet coke is outrageous.  Dessert was nothing to brag about.  We shared the cake assortment which was seven tiny, tiny squares of frosted cake.  It looked like it was straight out of Costco.  Again, a bit over-priced at $8.00.  No wonder there were't many customers in there for lunch.  I don't think I'd ever go back again.
Tasty, interesting twists on food selections. Wide selection of drink choices, even the ice tea. Historic building and cheery staff make for a great atmosphere.

Excellent place. The food is terrific. I had their bbq chicken sandwich and it is was one of the best sandwiches I have had in a while. My husband had the Salmon salad and he loved it as well. The place is very cozy and the servers are friendly. Highly recommend.
Very cool and interesting menu.  The pretzel appetizer cheese dip is simply awesome!  I am impressed with the level of service and nice, relaxed atmosphere.

I live local, and I'm glad we have another fine resturant choice. We had the fish and chips (solid choice) and the Reuben. The Reuben was good.... The berry tea was perfect, but for the price they should give refills.  The cheese beer soup was fantastic, and will defiantly order again. The sweet potato tots, are very different. I liked them, but didn't love them. I really want to try the weekend breakfast next. Now for the negative... I kept a star back because of the service. Are waitress Kelly was shall we say horrid. She was slow (the resturant was not even busy during the Tuesday night) and seemed more interested in flirting with her fellow wait staff then to do her job. She always seemed just a tad annoyed. Her faults stood out more because of another waitress (sorry don't know her name, she was young with short light colored hair) was everything Kelly was not. She was personable, complimentary, funny & wanting to make us feel welcome even though SHE was NOT our waitress. I think next time we will request to sit in her section!

A very clean and presentable restaurant in the adorable downtown Arlington heights area! I'm not usually a big fan of Thai food, but after looking on Yelp, some of the dishes left me with a craving for it. It doesn't get too crowded so we were served right away too.

We ordered the big plate, spicy duck rolls, and pork pad Thai. The big plate was a great appetizer/dish to share and sample some things on the menu. The crispy salmon rolls weren't really what I expected- which was what I was most excited for- but still good. The array of sauces in this dish was awesome too- lots of different yummy flavors. I really liked the spicy duck rolls too, but beware- it is SPICY. The pork pad Thai was fresh and delicious as well.

I'm pretty sure this is the only (but one of the few) Thai spots I've tried and am willing to go back to! Some other items on the menu looked very promising too.

Pad see eiw with tofu ordered spicy

Flavor and seasoning is authentic thai. 

A nice undertone of spicy-Ness. Probably the best Thai food in the burbs hands down.

I was pleasantly surprised by this place... My 1st impression was how clean the place felt. The service was attentive and friendly and the food was pretty great. the menu is slightly Americanized and tries to be pan Asian (there was even dim sum on the menu?). it doesn't have the usual Thai names next to the English names (i.e the menu says papaya salad not sum tom next to it).... 

Anyways, I really liked the ground chicken salad (Larb) that I would get this again if I go back but I would ask for more than just medium spice. The massaman curry was great too. The seafood pad kee maw was not as spicy as I would have liked but the seafood itself was rather fresh and clean tasting. 

Given past experiences, I've become so skeptical of trying Thai place in the suburbs. This place was great overall.

Being a fan of Thai cuisine, I am always on the look out for good Thai restaurants. And this place is one of the best places to satisfy your Thai craving. I love spicy food, and when they say hot spice level, it actually is hot unlike other places. We tried their massaman and red curry, both were very good! Also try their hot sauce which they have in a bottle!

Mmmm it's been so hard to find a really good Thai restaurant in the area, but this place is great!

I love the atmosphere, it's casual but very nice. Not a hole in the wall here! The service was very good - they were great about checking up on us, refilling water, clearing plates, you name it. 

The food came out quickly, and it was delicious!! They have a great menu, something for everyone. Pad thai, curries, other noodles and rice, chicken, duck, etc. I ordered the chicken panang curry, and it was so good! I finished the entire thing. My friend ordered a noodle dish and loved it too. They don't have a great alcoholic drink menu (a few wines), but the wines they do have taste good. 

It is a smaller place, and fills up fast, but it wasn't too overcrowded or loud, which was nice.

Overall I really really liked it and will definitely be back for the panang curry!

While still on the walkabout to find a great Thai place we finally went to altThai. As others have said a modern decor to the interior. It feels nice and open unlike many places that have poor lighting and just feel dark and dingy. Although that might be what they're going for...
