Had lunch specials so they come with little sides that IMO are 100% better than any other Thai spot. Fresh cucumber salad was great and the pot stickers we're also good. The soup is real TomYum. 

The spicy ginger w/ seafood was great. Very clean seafood, cooked right, with hot peppers. They marinade the squid so it has a nice texture & not super chewy.

Also did the Pad Thai and was a big fan. Served with sprouts, ground peanuts, shredded cabbage, & carrots. It had the right amount of sauce and it was not oily like so many other places. The only thing I wasn't keen on was the BBQ pork. It's a clean cutlet that they slice for you with bbq flavor on the outside. It's not bad but I might have been expecting marinaded pork pieces that I have had in so many other Thai dishes but bbq'd flavored. If you think of this as well done dry cuts of pork w/ some bbq flavor you'll be ok.

Both these lunch portions were large compared to other Thai places so it's a good value for me. If I make one comment it's that the items I had could have used a bit more salt (WHAT?) I know I never say that as I hate over salted food! They do give you soy and hot sauce on the table but the flavors just needed a little boost. I will say I'd rather add that have it loaded up to begin with.  

I'll be back to try other things...

Came here off the street for lunch while working, great food, and great ambience.  The staff were incredibly friendly and the service was the best I've seen in a long while. Oh, their prices for lunch are very great too

This is not Thai food.  Thank heaven!  There is a Thai food restaurants near this if you want authentic Thai food. But the Thai food you'll get at this place in an alternative to that. And it is delicious!  I've been here many times.  I'm not an adventurous Asian food eater but the people I go with are, and every time we try new dishes here it is always consistently delicious. 
I can't say that for the other more authentic Thai restaurant I've been to in downtown Arlington Heights.  Which is why I don't go to there any more.

Stopped in for a light dinner before seeing a movie... since I had a couple hours to kill and didn't want to go home. 

Left work a little early to beat traffic... and low blood sugar is not a good look on me. :-)

So 2 appetizers later I check in... whoo a discount? Hey even $1.40 counts... hahah... too bad I had to discuss the validity of it multiple times with the waitresses... seriously annoying. 

Maybe they felt my stink eye thru the shades... or saw my rapidly reviewing fingers... but the changed their tune and said the Manager just okayed it.

Geez. Food good... service annoying. Won't be back for a good long while. Grumble

This place is good no doubt, but it did not feel that it was authentic.  Being a major thai food lover, this was definitely not the most authentic thai restaurant.  We ordered pad thai, panang curry, and fried tofu.  The pad thai was alright, and the panang curry was decent.  However, if I wanted authentic thai food, I would not go here.  Great service!

Must try the crab Rangoon!!!!!!! Best I've ever had. I'm not a fan of the soup they serve. Looks rather unappealing but they use superior ingredients in their dishes, way better quality proteins than most Asian restaurants. They never offer anything but water so I'm not even sure if they serve other beverages. Hence the 4 not 5.

I can't believe we haven't tried this place before... the food is delicious, inspired and fresh.  I had the papaya salad which was not only beautifully plated but also incredibly fresh and tasty. My son had the pad see ew, my mom the pad thai... all delicious - we'll definitely be back.  One note: I got a to-go order for my son and the portion was a lot smaller than the dish they serve.

This place is small , nice, clean and they will serve you the delicious thai food . Curry , Seafood or anything on menu I tried until now was super delicious at good price with enough portion of food . if someone wants to try good thai food you must visit this place .

Got a free bottle of wine leftover from the table over. My experience was already going good.

Waiters were attentive. My glass of water was continuously filled. 

Pot stickers were nice and crunchy. Not one bit soggy.

Blue crab fried rice was not bad. The crab was cold but the rice was hot. Weird temperature mixture. I like that they offered a fancy crab on their menu though.

I got the massaman curry. Pretty good. I just wish I had more rice because it was a big bowl of curry.

So I was down with a cold and was looking for some comforting food. A friend had recommended that we try altThai with the assurance that they had some of the best soup around. 

The day we went in was perhaps a quieter one since the signages were not fully lit up and we infact missed it on the first go. This had us a bit anxious to begin with. Eventually we trooped in and were seated. 

Our server was quick to notice that hubby was a vegetarian and accordingly suggested dishes without meat, seafood or fish sauce. The Tom Yum Chicken soup, Papaya Salad and Curry Fried rice were all excellent. The soup especially was hot, spicy and just perfect for my achy throat. So was the Papaya Salad - Crunchy, Fresh, Spicy & Lemony! 

There was a delay in the payments, since our seat was in a corner of the restaurant it seemed like we were forgotten while the rest of the staff went about wrapping up for the day. 

All things considered - great food, good service. Will be back :)

Great thai food. Had the spicy duck rolls and the seafood pad kee mow. Some of the best thai food I have ever had. Service was attentive and helpful. There are a few tables outside for a cool evening dinner or a summer lunch. Highly recommend trying it out.

This place it's amazing!!! I live Thai food but this place took it to the next level, If you like pad Thai this is the place to go, but also the Thai fried rice it's amazing. The place it's amazing with great atmosphere and the crew are friendly and the food was made super fast

Came here with a friend for lunch last week.

Their food is very fresh and their lunch specials are great.

Minus stars because their bathrooms are about 100 degrees and there is no baby change station which is annoying.

Although it's only a small restaurant, we were impressed with the friendly staff and the extensive menu of delicious dishes. The highlight of the meal was definitely the slow cooked massaman curry lamb - tender, moist meat with a delicious curry sauce and an accompaniment of roasted onions and potatoes. I requested the spice level hot and the kitchen did not disappoint. 

Great restaurant with very high standards. Keep up the great work!
A hidden gem in the north suburbs. GREAT, quality Thai food at a decent price. Get the pad Thai but make it spicy because the normal pad Thai dish is mild and needs a kick.

Alt Thai has been one of our favorite Thai places for a few years now. My wife and I visit frequently, and we've had a few family gatherings there, and they always accommodate. 
The service is great, the presentation is great, the food tastes great. 

One irritation. If it wasn't for the following, the would have all five stars. When we order a vegetable dish, we must specify for the cooks not to put fish sauce in. Why would you put fish on a vegetable dish? This is not listed in the menu. None of the staff mentioned for several visits, until one did. That's almost dishonest. Every time I order, and specify "no fish on my vegetables", it irritates me. Eventually, I will get irritated enough I find an alternative.

I find that with Thai restaurants it's hard to find one that is good AND isn't stingy on their portions. Everything we ordered was delicious n portions were good.
I've dined in and carry-out. 
Dining in experience:
I love the presentation using the beets, so simple yet eye pleasing. We dined in on a Sat evening and it was surprisingly not busy but food did take awhile to prepare compare to other places. 
We ordered several dishes to share, one of them being woon sen and requested mild for the kids. 2 out of 3 kids complained dish was too spicy (you have to specify your heat level for each dish). The one that didn't complain was older n she can tolerate some heat. The adults tried the dish and thought it was fine but we believe it was bc our tastebuds were numb by the spice frm trying all our other dishes. We came to the conclusion that they messed up on the heat level of all our dishes bc the one that we requested "hot" wasn't as spicy as a dish that we requested "medium". It wasn't a huge issue bc the flavor profile for all the dishes were on pt; was just an issue for the kids dish. We ended up ordering fried rice for them and made certain they made it mild. 
Service was ok, didn't seem very attentive. We were celebrating a bday and server said he would bring out dessert at the end and forgot, had to ask someone else. 
Carry-out experience:
They have a very good lunch special. Soup is included when u dine in but not carry-out. Portions of items not part of special seems to be smaller (imo) compared to same item ordered for dinner dine in and I believe pricing is the same. Plus u don't get the pretty presentation.

It's ridiculous how often my coworkers and I frequent Alt Thai for lunch.  We always say we're going to try this place and that place and....where do we wind up?  Alt Thai!  It's just that good.  For lunch you get Tom Yum soup (except me but only because I hate soup for some odd reason), eggroll or potstickers and your entr̩e.  The portions are so generous, I always have enough for leftovers for the next day, even without the soup.  Right now I am obsessed with the curry fried rice, medium spicy, with shrimp.  My mouth is watering even thinking about it.  Their medium is pretty spicy (and I like spicy food), so be warned.  We have tried most of the lunch items and they have all gotten the thumbs up.  And they always remember that one of our party is a vegetarian and accommodate her no problem.

The decor is modern. The food is good. Went here with 2 other people today.

We ordered the crab rangoon, papaya salad - spicy, tom yum seafood - spicy, panang chicken - spicy, and pad see ew tofu. 

Crab rangoon was so good. I loved it. They actually had seasonings in the filling! The papaya salad wasn't as fishy as I'd like it, but it was super spicy and still pretty good. I've had the best homemade papaya salad so nothing ever comes close. The tom yum seafood was delicious. Lots of seafood and spicy. Panang chicken was too watery. It was like a soup. The flavors were good, but I'm used to panang being creamier and thicker. I almost thought they accidentally brought us another tom yum. Pad see ew was good too. Even tho I usually wouldn't order tofu with any of these, I'm glad I did. It made it seem lighter than it was.

Make sure you check in for a free thai iced tea! :)

I'll def stop in again when I'm in the area & I'm craving some Thai.

Good suburban Thai, which is insanely hard to find.  Place is pretty busy and staff was friendly enough.  The city isn't that far for us, so unlikely we'll return.  But if u can't drive down to Chicago, this is a great place to get your fix in the burbs.

"A place which will never Disappoint you" :)

Have been here multiple times with my friends and tried one different things everytime. We call it experiment on new dishes along with the pre-tasted ones. Believe me each time the experience was good.
The staff is always ready for your service and gives attention to each table properly. 

The staff properly listens to your requirement of the food and takes proper instructions as you direct. We always order only specific veggies "no meat, no egg, no eggplant, no mushrooms" and we have never been disappointed with any unusual dish or unwanted ingredients in the food. 

The cleanliness of the place is also very well maintained. Usually when we go out in different restaurants many times it happens that the restaurant is clean but the restrooms are not in a good condition,  uncleaned and stinky. Over here the cleanliness is very well maintained and is always clean.

 Few dishes which we loved till now:(all dishes below we ate were Vegan)
Appetizers:
1. Fried Pot Stickers
2. Miang Khamp

Curry:
1. Panang Curry
2. Green Curry
3. Red Curry

Rice Dishes:
1. Basil fried rice
2. Curry fried rice

Desserts:
1. Deep fried vanilla icecream (comes in strawberry as well)

Overall exprience was always great and a recommendation of must try :)

Nice little place in downtown Arlington Heights.  The food is Thai and Asian-fusion, and the feel is contemporary and casual. Food is excellent.  The crab rangoon appetizer is better than any I've had elsewhere.  Pad Thai with shrimp was fresh, flavorful and not heavy-handed as some Asian restaurants tend to get.  Panang curry is out of this world, and the basil rice with chicken is also very flavorful and fresh.  It's kind of small so it fills fast on a Friday night, but don't let that deter you.  Service, food and ambience are all worth the wait.

This is one of the best thai restaurants I have been too. Panang curry, Hawaiian chicken, thai basil chicken and pretty much every dish on the menu is delicious. It even beats many thai restaurants in downtown chicago

My first visit I got the red curry. So I got it again my second visit since it was so good! But for some reason the second time it tasted like it was loaded with ginger.... I dislike ginger..

The service is excellent, and I love that they have liquor! Haha!

I never take pictures of my food, but when I was served the duck breast with Chinese broccoli at altThai, I was inspired.  Not only was the dish beautifully presented, but it was delicious, and the service was excellent--warm, friendly and attentive but not intrusive.  My husband's pad thai was delicious, so much so he cleaned his plate before I could get a second bite!  Great little find.  When I'm back in the 'burbs for work again I will definitely return!
They bumped our reservation without any warning and rude when we inquired. It has OK food, but there are other places with the same quality of good but much better service. So long altThai.
my fav thai cusine in the north west suburbs area.

I can't believe I've never been here before!  The food and service was EXCELLENT!  We were a group of 7 later in the evening on a Saturday night and everything was still top notch.  The food was super flavorful too.  WE WILL BE BACK!!

I was very disappointed with my food. I ordered Tom Kha soup with tofu and veggie spring rolls. When the tom kha soup came out it was just broth, a few pieces of tofu, and cilantro. I inquired about the fact that there weren't additional vegetables in the soup and the waitress told me that's how it comes, but if I wanted I could add veggies for an additional charge. I said I would like to add more veggies. Nonetheless, she wasn't too friendly about my request. When my soup came back with the extra veggies, I was disappointed to see that the soup was still mostly broth-- some mushrooms were added. Not only was I disappointed with the extreme lack of veggies and tofu for a $10 soup, but the soup itself was extremely tasteless and bland. I've had Tom Kha soup at many other Thai restaurants including having had it in my travels to Thailand. It's usually one of the most flavorful soups, which was a stark contrast to my experience at altThai. I also ordered vegetable spring rolls, which had way too much onion. I'm surprised this restaurants has such high yelp ratings.

Altthai has been a favorite of mine for many years. I went for carry out today. The very nice server took my order, lead me to a table, brought me a glass of water, she was very sweet. I always giggle when people complain about the service in most Asian restaurants. No how are you? Seriously? Drop a star even if the food is the best because the service was awkward? The language barrier is often difficult for people, and they're doing their best to bring you delicious food. Hope when you open your restaurant in Thailand it goes better for you. And slow service usually is the result of a "slow" kitchen making the food as it's ordered.

I'm eating my order of Larb (ground chicken salad), which is delicous!! The spice level is perfect, and the flavors are wonderful. I also ordered noodle soup with beef balls and pork. This dish is bland, which I expected, so I added a little Sriracha which was in my bag. They packaged the broth separately from the noodles and protein, which I appreciated.
It's was great the food and the service.  I'll be coming here more often.  Thanks for the great experience

Okay, so a 1 star review?  A tough assessment, right?  Not when you consider the poor quality of food and the lazy staff.  I had the Hawaiian chicken and it was awful.  It was basically chicken mcnugget with a sweet and sour sauce and pineapple.  I've honestly never had such a blatantly lazy meal before.  I was dumbfounded when it came to the table and just went on with it.  The service is lack luster, with the staff barely aware of why you might be there (to eat). And you're left on your own to sit for nearly a full hour to get your food.  Overall, a bad experience and bad food.
The service was wonderful, prices were good, and the food was delicious. Great atmosphere too!

Chicago gets cold in the winter. Oh Lord, does it get cold. Most of you are now thinking, no sh*t Sherlock, what'd you go there in the winter for? I travel every week for my job, and my most recent assignment had me visiting Chicagoland in November through January. I never seem to get a Florida assignment in the winter. :( But I digress. One cold and snowy night, I persuaded a coworker to scope out a particular Chinese bistro in Arlington Heights for dinner. Little did we know the place is closed on Mondays. So we drove around looking for someplace else Asian, and Google Maps sort of led us to altThai. I say sort of because we asked for Asian restaurants in Arlington Heights, but the map directions had us driving all around the place...it's tucked into a corner of a small  courtyard that also houses a Noodles & co., a sushi parlor, an ice cream parlor, and some other businesses. Thankfully, free garage parking was available so we didn't have to park on the snowy street.

The establishment is small and intimate, softly lit. Instead of cheesy quarter-tone music, light dinner jazz played overhead. Tables are small and seat no more than four. I'd guess they seat no more than 30 overall. Service was attentive without being pushy, and on both occasions we went, the server was quite knowledgeable about the food.

Because I was freezing my buns off, I started with the tom kha soup. (Note for those new to Thai food: Tom kha is the one with the coconut milk; tom yum is the broth.) Coworker went with the spinach soup with chicken balls. The serving of tom kha can be a meal by itself. Large portion, tangy, coconutty, with a variety of yummy ingredients. I had them put tofu in, but of course you can choose chicken if you prefer. When I go to a new Thai place, I always ask for medium spicy, figuring I can modulate up or down if needed. This place's "medium" is just a little bit on the hot side; I'd give it a 6 on a scale of 0 to 10 for heat.

Curries at altThai are just sensational. On my first visit, I chose the red curry, medium spicy with tofu. A huge bowl of vegetables and tofu with a soup-like portion of  coconut gravy came my way, with white rice. Brown rice or noodles are available for an upcharge, but I feel like spicy food isn't cooled off by brown rice very well even though I know it's better for me. What a savory, mellow taste. A perfect toe-warmer!

The next time we visited, I chose the same soup but for an entree, chose the Crispy Basil Salmon. Now, that name is linguistically ambiguous; you would think "crispy" refers to the salmon, but it doesn't. What I received was a large salmon filet, cooked properly, with crispy basil leaves on top and vegetables to the side. Apparently they fry the basil leaves, which is a nice crunchy garnish. The best part of this dish, besides the perfect salmon, is the melt-in-your-mouth eggplant that appears in the vegetable mix. A nice foil for the spice.

Sadly, my favorite Thai dessert, mango with sticky rice, was not available this winter; my server informed me it's seasonal, which is reasonable but still disappointing. I never get any other dessert in a Thai restaurant. So, I guess I'll just have to hope my company sends me to Chicago this spring or summer, so I can enjoy another terrific meal at altThai!

This place was pretty good. We had the veg dumplings - fried which tasted good. Had the iced tea which was OK. (got it free with yelp check-in) and got the chicken pad kee mao which was good. I got the HOT which was spicy but not that bad - handled by those who have had some really HOT food in Indian/Thai cuisines. This place has nice decor and service is not bad.

P.S. It's a bit difficult to find this place in the complex and parking in the night seemed difficult.

The food is great. Period. Now here are the reasons why I won't come back for a while.

There is very little communication between the server and the customer. Every time I have dined here, the server didn't make eye contact or offer water refills. I never got a smile, a hello, a thank you, or a "how are you?"

I really don't have high expectations, I just like to feel welcomed. I don't feel that way when I dine here. I get that this isn't a five star restaurant, but I don't like being ignored, and brushed aside. I feel uncomfortable and rushed when I eat and it's hard to feel at home. 

Another thing is that despite the fact that I love spicy food, and can usually gauge what mild, medium, and hot mean, the food is always way too spicy for what it claims to be. I've ordered each level of "hotness" and have found that the mild flavor still requires me to drink a good glass of ice cold water, the medium spiciness makes me sweat, gasp, and down several glasses of water, and upgrading to hot makes me breathe fire and gulp an entire pitcher of water. (Bring your own water so you don't have to flag down a server like I did for a simple refill.)

This is coming from someone who was raised in a Korean household and enjoys kimchi, curry, hot sauce, and hot peppers. 

If you don't have a high threshold for spicy foods, do not get anything worse than the mild option.

This is my second time here and I only have great things to say. 

It's a tad out of the way for where I live (Wheeling) but it is so worth it -- just don't go at rush hour. 

Mom and I ordered wine (Sonoma something, a Chardonnay, and mom got a Pinot noir of some kind), good wine for a pretty average price.

We shared the coconut shrimp, YUM! Would order again. Also would totally order this as my main dish if it came with more than 4. 

We also shared chicken Thai fried rice and chicken pad Thai (medium spice). So delicious and we're bringing home leftovers, so excited for lunch tomorrow, lol. Both have great flavors and spices. Fresh. Love it! Probably the best Thai food I've had in this area.

We also redeemed our free Thai iced tea for checking in, it's good! Different. Mom thinks it tastes like a creamsicle. For a free drink, why not.

The atmosphere and service are also great. There's some smooth jazz/easy listening playing right now. Our waitress was attentive and gave us good wine recommendations.

Hope to come back!

Just had another great meal here:  a new dish called 'garlic sauce'  Did not know what to expect due to it's simplicity of  ingredients, but that is what made it good.  
The sauce was amasing,  And it had also shredded hearts of romaine and spring onion for crunch and flavor. A light dish, but the flavor of the garlic sauce was outstanding.  Not overpowered with garlic, just a note, but the complexity and balance was perfect.  It was ideal with steamed jasmine rice.

I just went to Alt Thai with my in-laws, and wow, was I pleasantly surprised. I often eat at Asian restaurants and I am very picky. Everything I tried at Alt Thai was incredible! I tried several appetizers and test tasted several main courses. All of them exceeded my expectations. Additionally, the place is adorable, clean, and the waitstaff is wonderful.

Great staff, welcoming and kind. The food was well prepared and as well as was conceived prior to getting on my plate. Great place, price in mud range, and makes for a pleasant and peaceful dining experience. A+

Possibly my favorite Thai food place in the burbs. I go here at least once a week and have been keeping this tradition for a good 2 Years. The service is good, prices are great , the food is original yet modern and the place is kept clean. That's all I need and will continue the tradition.

If you wanted to go to a Thai food restaurant, I would suggest alt Thai. The chicken massaman and Thai iced tea is delicious! I'd go for lunch on weekdays because you get soup and salad before your entr̩e is served. alt Thai has a calm atmosphere, and reasonable prices.
Probably the only Thai place I even consider in the area. Pad Si Ew is amazing and even their "medium" spice is hot (and I love spicy food). Definitely try this place out.
Great place. I loved the decor. Modern simple, very peaceful,  comfortable, great food. I had the pineapple curry with roasted duck ( hot) that was out of this world. Service was great!

Great service. These guys are on top of things. I've been to some high rated places lately that have had sub par service and it's great to see there are still people that actually care about you. Recommending this place to everyone.

The food is generally very good. I usually get the pad woon sen. We order on the website regularly and just repeat the same order every time.  Despite this consistent ordering, the food varies quite a bit from order to order (amount of sauce, level of spiciness, amount of veggies). Sometimes it's very mediocre but when them make it well, it's really good.  Their website is also somewhat confusing, the time they say it will be ready is frequently wrong. My wife orders it gluten free and they will frequently make both of ours gluten free. 

All that said, 4 stars but it would be 5 with more consistency.
Small and nice place at arlington. . Well maintained, clean and sevice is very good. of course taste too.
Great food and service. I had the red curry with tofu, with brown rice and it was delicious. Tasty options for vegetarian and vegans.

My sister and I came on a Friday night at around 7, and we were seated without reservations.

The decor is trendy chic, which is why I found that the waiters wearing jeans to be slightly off?  I would suggest that they wear dark khakis instead.  It says business casual in a very trendy Google software-engineer kind of way..

My sister and I both had the chicken pad thai, and it was delicious.  The portion was generous.  Our water glasses were refilled constantly.  We didn't feel rushed.  The service was prompt and polite.

I'd recommend the place to anyone looking for somewhere hip to eat and not looking to eat at a corporate franchise in the downtown Arlington Heights area!

One of the better restaurants I've eaten at in a long time.

The ambiance is nice with minimal and simple decor that resembles a modern caf̩. As for how many people this restaurant can accommodate, I couldn't  imagine a huge party eating here but rather a family of 4 or so.

It was Friday evening and it wasn't packed as I expected. There were actually a lot of tables open so in the beginning I questioned the popularity of this place. However once we received our food, I questioned why this restaurant wasn't as crowded as it should have been.

Let me start off by saying that they're very generous with the seafood content in their entrees. We had so much scallop/shrimp in our entrees that it was almost overwhelming. We tried Caribbean fried rice, basil scallop (comes with a small bowl of rice), and seafood pad Thai. Caribbean fried rice and basil scallop were our favorites. Pad Thai rice noodle was still cooked perfectly but it didn't go over my expectation in terms of taste. However, if you're a fan of Pad Thai, I advise you get it. 

Service was great and even appetizers were served hot and fresh. We were pleasantly surprised on how good the appetizers were. The chicken satay was okay however. Chicken was cooked properly but the whole overall taste with the peanut sauce didn't impress me. Probably our least favorite. But try the shrimp and calamari appetizers. 

For a group of 3, the bill came out around $75. 3 appetizers, 3 entree and a free Thai iced tea for checking in on yelp? I'd say that's a pretty good price. 

I would definitely come back here again as it seems that there's a lot of people who order their meals for a pick up instead of eating at the restaurant. It might be because you get a 10% discount from ordering online. Regardless, altThai was a pleasant surprise.
Been here twice for lunch. Had the curry chicken this time. It was amazing. The pod stickers appetizers are great as well. Prices here are real reasonable & they're quick.
Very good! Gorgeous decor, great service & yummy food. Loved the Pad Ke Mow. Highly recommended!

I came with a group of friends on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. There were only a few tables I occupied at the time. I got the papaya salad while the others got the pad Thai and catfish salad. You can ask them to make your dish as spicy as you want, which is a plus. The portions are also decently sized. The bf LOVED his chicken pad Thai. However, my salad only had a few pieces of shrimp which was disappointing. The free Thai iced tea for checking in was delish!

I like this place. Clean, servers are friendly (this is unusual because most of the Thai places I have tried in Chicago area, the waitress/waiters are very unfriendly, not so in this place). Everything is ok except the food can be little salty and fried calamari is very soggy.

The best Thai food I have ever had.  The only reason I am not giving 5 stars is for the service.  It's always slow and the servers are very awkward.  The servers should not be in the service industry.  But the food is amazing and the prices are great!
been here twice, my kids like it,  nice modern urban decor and ambiance, good food and well presented ,  staff answers all questions about menu 14 for bottle of wine special , good service, I like

I love altThai- it's my first pick Thai restaurant. The ambience is lovely, cute decor and low-key sound level. You'll be given a choice of spiciness when you order your food, so you won't be out of your depth and sweating like Hephaestus.

My go-to orders are tofu pad thai with a thai ice coffee. Oh, how'd I forget! The drinks rock. Coffee is very, very good- creamy with what I think is either condensed milk or coconut milk. There are many tea options as well, including a classic matcha-based green ice tea that pairs well with the spice.

Last time I went (and I go every couple of weeks), the owner sent us a free dessert. When I asked what the occasion was, he brushed it off and said "just because!" That was a really nice touch- and the ice cream/fried banana were great, to boot! :)

All in all, altThai earns the 5 stars. Great food, great service. Great restaurant, I go back regularly.

My sister and I both say 5 stars for the chicken pad thai ($8.95). It was a really big portion and really good! I had to take some home for leftovers. They also put the cashews on the side which I enjoyed because I ALWAYS forget to ask for pad thai without the cashews.

The interior of the restaurant was interesting. The shape of the restaurant is kind of odd, with a bunch of corners and walls all over, making it inconvenient to place furniture. But it looked clean and modern. The furniture kind of looked like Ikea furniture- cheap but sleek. The table had a really neat rubbery table cloth wrapped around it- you could tell it was on the cheaper side but it looked nice.

The server was nice... he was a bit timid. Overall, I'd go again for the pad thai!

Very pleased to have discovered this place in downtown Arlington Heights.
Spring rolls were more sophisticated than most and loaded with fresh ingredients.
My friend had the Panang curry with fish and enjoyed it; she noted that the spice level was not dumbed down for the suburban palate.
I love crab and so had to try the crab-fried rice. It had a generous portion of blue crab, some of it stirred into the rice and the rest on top. Rice was not greasy or heavy as so many versions of fried rice are, plus there were a few more vegetables than normal.
Better than average wine list for this type of place, and the service was very good. I'll be back.
Convenient free underground parking on the same block.

My hubs and I have eaten here multiple times and use to order from here for delivery. For some reason they made their delivery area smaller so we fall just outside of it by 4 blocks. Since we have two little guys, hubs and I don't get out nearly as much for dinner anymore so it has been a while since we've had altThai. 

Went yesterday for dinner with my niece for the first time in months! It was busy. There was a long table of 15 people and children everywhere. We were seated at a "bar height" table in the back on the other side of the restrooms. We waited 20 mins for someone to come take our order. As we waited we watched 3 separate couples walk in and get seated. Those tables had the servers take their order and we still waited. When the fourth couple showed up, got seated at the two seater table by the wine cork display, and had their order taken within 3 mins of them being seated we left. 

Doubt they noticed since we went 25 mins without any service. 

Disappointed and won't be going back. I don't care how busy you are, keep track of your customers!!!

Wanted to stay in Saturday night to avoid the crowds and so we decided to try altThai. We ordered the thai curry fried rice, pad thai, crab rangoon, and the spicy duck roll. 

Ordered everything online and when I walked in to pick up, the place was packed. It was a small space, but everyone sitting seemed happy. I was immediately greeted by a server and pointed to the carryout line. Impressed at how they already had my order after 20 minutes of ordering it online. 

Now to the food...everything was superb! I love thai food and needless to say everything we had ordered was delicious, fresh, and better than most Thai places I've ordered from. The portions are good for 2 people.The reason I didn't give thsi place a 5 was the crab rangoon was dripping with oil when I picked it up. They also tend to make things on the spicy side, so when you order and they give u the option from mild, hot, hotter etc...you better know what you're getting into! I had to drink milk with my meal as my taste buds were on fire. Other than that, I would definitely go back to order here!

I love this place! The lunch specials are great! You get a very large portion for an incredibly fair price. The food is delicious and the staff is friendly. The service is fast and the atmosphere is welcoming and mellow.

Loved my chicken pad Thai and my husband loved his curry dish. Very good pot stickers too. Quite Pricey, for these 2 dishes and 2 orders of potstickers was $37. Small inside for dining in, more modern decor. Will go back again but wish it was less expensive

4 stars for the atmosphere and service. I liked its contemporary decor and noise level. It should be a great place for a lunch with your partner or a small group of friends. Food was OK so I take 1 star off -- I couldn't find 'authenticity' from it. But again, with some 50 bucks I fed three of us... can't complain.
Lovely setting and ambience, tasty food and friendly service make this restaurant my favorite local place for Thai food.  Presentation and plating of food is also a delight.  Enjoy!

One of my favorite Thai places we have been to. Been a few time and everything is fresh, flavorful, and generous portions. Service is great, and everyone is very friendly. It's usually very busy, but you don't have to wait long to get a table. 

Tip: They have great M-F lunch specials- select entrees with soup/salad and soup/egg roll for about $8/9 dollars! Also, if you check in on your Yelp app at the restaurant you'll receive a free Thai tea!

My family and I come to altThai way too much because it is just that good. The service is wonderful without being overbearing and the atmosphere, as a few people have said, is modern but relaxed. As for the food, between the four of us we have tried a decent chunk of the menu and have never had anything less than excellent. To start, we never ever skip the crab rangoon, and the other appetizers we have tried are great as well. Our new favorite main dish is the spicy catfish that was recommended to us by our waitress, and you can never go wrong with the massaman curry, pad Thai, or deep fried red snapper. We second the tip to order for mild, we each tried medium once and it was still delicious but a bit too much for our palates. When you have room left, go for the fried ice cream. To put it simply, this is easily the best restaurant we know of in the area, and it rivals places we've been in the city or anywhere.
Always good. Nice little place. Lovely plating.

One of my fav thai places in the suburb. Their red curry is the best and so is the pad thai. 

The best part of this restaurant is that its BYOB. 
Cute place in AH donwtown

Food was okay
Would not come back.
Great food! Definitely recommend this place

Delicious!  My first experience at a Thai restaurant because I was lucky enough to be traveling with two carnivores who also love Thai food.  As a vegan, altthai had a lot on their menu for me to choose from.  I ordered the Pad Kee Mao with tofu.  This is a wide noodle dish with veggies.  It was heavenly!  My friends loved what they ordered as well...Tom Yum soup, veggie spring rolls, Pad Thai with chicken and I forget the other main dish with beef  but they raved about it.  We all had large portions of food and were quite full and satisfied when we left.  All of that food and the bill was about $42 with tax included.  

The establishment was clean. The employees were friendly and attentive.  I wish I lived closer so I could go back again!

Love love love this restaurant! It's cute cozy and perfect for date nights. Plus the food is amazing. Only con: service takes longer than usual but maybe cuz we were there sat night. 

We had the spicy catfish and it was delicious! Just perfectly spicy(we requested it hot) but to be honest it wasn't that spicy for us(we love spicy food, I mean real spicy food-must be the Indian in me)

Overall I rate this place an A+ and kudos to yelp for 10% off when you check in!

Very good food. Nice, intimate seating in downtown Arlington Hts. Appetizers were good, service was very good and the pricing was not bad at all. I recommend trying and we will definitely be back for another dinner. 

Also, good for take out, as well. Call ahead for reservations and also expect at least 30 minutes for take out orders. Overall, you won't be disappointed in this small business.

Pretty great spot! Ambiance is upscale for a Thai place, which makes it a nice destination for date night. Wine menu is surprisingly decent and the food is really great. We get the same thing every time and it never disappoints. Garlic mussels, to die for... We usually end up having to order 2 orders, that's how good they are! Beef salad, and seafood tom yum soup, both equally as good. And then the duck with broccoli leaves... Yum! The staff is super friendly too, which is always a plus! This place is great and I would recommend to anyone.

Tried this place on a Saturday night. Was pretty busy, no wait though. They sat us quickly and were welcoming. We had the crab ragoon and I had the thai fried rice with chicken and my husband had the chicken pad thai. Everything was delicious. We will definitely be back.

Modern styling decor
Service was great, especially in a Thai restaurant, where food  can be hit, my water was never empty.   Tried some dishes I had never had based off Yelp recommendations, they were all well done and flavorful.  Crab Rangoons were standard but the filling was very savory.  Had dim sum sampler and it was also great.  Wasn't a big fan of pad Thai my girlfriend got, which is odd, since it is normally the only thing I order.  I got that Pad Ew stuff with chicken and ordered it hot.  It was hot but not unpleasant, perfect if you like spicy food.  My girlfriend got hers medium and it was way spicy, I'd stick to mild if you don't enjoy rather hot foods.  Overall experience was outstanding, all that plus a glass of wine for 35 bucks.  I would definitely come back.
Always solid! Nice atmosphere!  Friendly staff. Excellent food! I'm always pleased with the food.

The atmosphere at this corner restaurant is cold. The food, however, is HOT. 
This is Thai food the way I like it. Straight forward preparation with authentic flavors.
Every Thai restaurant is different, isn't it? How did their mom make Mussamen Curry, or Pad See Ewe back home?
All I can say is that the flavors are spot on. Curries? A little soupy, but awesome. 
Papaya Salad? Fresh and delicious (Healthy too!). 
If you're looking for a cozy charmer, this isn't the place for you. 
If you want the best Thai food in the area-Well, here it is.
Better than I expected. My new go to for Thai in the northwest suburb! Definitely will return

While the digs are crazy cute and the service, even during my carry-out experience was exceptionally accommodating, the food and especially the portion size were not among my favorites. 

I can't say enough great things about the service I received at while ordering and waiting for my food at Alt Thai, but I'm certainly non-plussed that nearly 3 weeks after they changed me for Tom Yum soup that I did NOT receive, I've still yet to have been refunded. 

It is really cute inside- great for a casual date and one of the only dining places on the block not swarmed by teens. 

The food that I did receive was underwhelming at best and the portion size of my Spicy basil w/ tofu looked like the leftover amount I'd have after eating that same dish at any other Thai food restaurant. SUPER small, didn't even span the bottom of the container and the rice was obviously very not fresh. I know I came during an off-peak hour but rice that doesn't seem like it was cooked yesterday, reheated and put in a box doesn't seem like a whole lot to ask. Normally I'm so excited about my Thai that I pretty much inhale it, here, even with the teeny bopper portion, I stopped a few bites in and went to work on a mega-giant wildlife puzzle I'd been working on for the past few days. I finished it a few hours later figuring that the rice couldn't taste all that much more stale than it did when I got it. 

Not a fan, and honestly teetering on a two-star, but their front-of-the-house staff saved them from that fate... now just need to get my monies back for the food they didn't give.

Hooray!  I knew if I was patient enough I would find delicious Thai in Chicagoland, different from the heavy style that seems to be prevalent in the midwest.  altThai may be out in the suburbs, but it's worth it if you prefer your Thai food, lighter, less oily, and more like the Thai food in Florida and the east coast.  The restaurant is in a cute little suburban complex and the atmosphere is new, clean, and modern.

We started with the crab rangoons, which were crispy and fried well but not dripping in oil.  The filling was cream cheese, crab, and also little bits of celery and other veggies that helped give it a great texture.  The rangoons come drizzled with sweet & sour sauce.

Next, I orderd the ginger tofu rice dish with brown rice and my fiance ordered the spicy basil noodles with beef.  Both were served as great portions (we both took half the meal home), and the sauce was not oily at all.  More importantly, the sauce was flavorful and tasty without being too heavy on soy sauce which seems to be the midwestern Thai style.  Light sauces, full of flavor, and fresh ingredients.  We'll be visiting altThai any time we're even remotely in the area.

Overpriced, tiny,,tiny portions food was fresh but flavors were bland. Nice atmosphere but I would prefer paying less for decor and getting better value. Very inauthentic cuisine. Service is attentive but slightly pushy.... In all not a bad place to go if you are entertaining someone but be prepared to pay alot for alittle. Not recommended if you are a lover of authentic thai cuisine...

I ate best salmon in my life in this location.
They serve it with teriyaki douse and fresh veggies.
Place is nice in modern style. They have few wines to try. Great place for lunch or even good romantic dinner.

This place has a great atmosphere, attentive staff and delicious food. We typically eat the same thing every time and it is always consistently good (modern in style and not dripping in sauce). We had the spring rolls to start and then the pad woon sen and the pad thai. Their portions are generous and their prices are very reasonable. This past time we dined in and had Tony as our server. We had our 16 month old with us and he was very patient and helpful. This place is great!
Love this charming place!  Food is fresh and delicious, excellent service. Wish it were closer to my home and I'd eat here more often. Reasonably priced, good portions
I enjoy coming here for the pad thai. The atmosphere is also enjoyable and the staff is really friendly.
This is great Thai food! It's a little off from authentic thai imo, however the flavors are great! It's crowded on Fri/ sat evenings so it best to make reservations!

My daughter and I like this smallish Thai place in downtown Arl Hts. Nice modern decor, adequate, if not great service. We enjoy Big Plate appetizer sampler, nice lunch specials, and variety of traditional and Fusion rice and noodle dishes. One of our favorite Thai places in North/Northwest suburbs.

One of my regular Thai places that never fails to please. I have tried different items each time and the experiences have definitely been more than satisfying. Don't forget to try their desserts, they are really good- not the average off the shelf stuff!  The staff now recognizes me and know my preferences. It's these sort of personal touches that yield this place a top spot. Constant favs: coconut juice, curry fried rice, basil fried rice and fried vanilla icecream :-)

I am a sucker for bibimbap, so I was excited to find a Korean fast food joint near my hotel. I chose the sliced ribeye with an egg and loaded up on toppings. I noticed a reviewer or two who took issue with the varying textures of the toppings, but to me that's one of the great things about bibimbap: no two bites taste the same. It's supposed to be a riot of flavors and textures. The only slight disappointment was that I ordered my meal in a stone bowl, which didn't quite crisp up the rice enough, IMO. 

But THIS should speak volumes: I enjoyed my meal so much that I came back again the next day. BOOM.

This place is like a Chipotle of Bibimbap!  I'm not going to write home about the authentic Korean food I experienced, but it is a good fast-casual option when you just don't feel like cooking.  But, the menu is pretty limited.  
Both my husband and I had the Bibimbap, so I can only review that.  We had the spicy pork and it was really salty which was a disappointment.  But, you get to pick out the various veggies, tofu, kimchi, etc. that you want in your bowl, so that was cool to be able to customize it.  Then, a fried egg was added from the kitchen (you have to have a fried egg with your Bibimbap!).  The serving size was gigantic, I probably could've eaten it in two meals, but I was hungry.  :)  The actual restaurant is rather small and there were some loud children there, so we just took our food to go.  
Overall, I enjoyed the food, but when I go back, I will get the Bibimbap with a different meat or try their tacos.

This place is small but it certainly offers some delicious and unique food.

I had the Galbi bibimibap which was basically
Marinated ribs with various vegetables of which you can choose. They are warmed up and sit in piles in the bowl. I guess it's your job to mix them up. Overall a yummy dish but I maybe expected something different. The ribs were the best part!

I also had the garlic soy chicken wings and kogii fries. The fries were kinda like chili cheese fries but not spicy. They offer another kind of fries I tried and they were spicy but had more flavor.

The wings were the biggest surprise to me. They were crispy on the outside, tender on the inside. The flavor was cooked into the skin perfectly. If you love wings then don't pass these up. 

This place is great for a small group but don't expect to come with a group of 4 or more. They have limited space. Also the food can 10-15 to prepare based on what you want.

Overall an enjoyable experience. I will try to return should I be in the area.

Been a while since my first visit to Kogii Kogii, and my bf and I decided to make a return trip, after some earnest contacts from the manager after the last experience. I did indeed see this time that everyone in the front or back room was wearing a hat, so that was good. 

Though one of the messages had invited me for a free meal, for the purposes of a fair and balanced Yelp review we paid our way and got the garlic-soy Korean fried chicken, as well as some dumplings again. 

The fried dumplings were just as tasty as the first time: greasy-good with the chile sauce at the table.

But the star here was the fried chicken wings!! Managing to be both sticky with the sauce yet remaining crispy-skinned, the meat was also marvelously moist: I was using Anthony Bourdain words like "succulent" and "luscious" as we licked our fingers. Also, these wings dwarf the babies at Buffalo Wild Wings or wherever: I couldn't even finish my order of ten (after the dumplings). I've gotta say too: don't kid yourself, even though this is chicken, it ain't a healthy meal; as my bf put it, "It's basically an elephant ear with some chicken inside." Still, so darn tasty!! 

So we will definitely be back whenever we feel the need for a fried treat!

This place is just okay.
I just have had better korean in the city or in arlington heights.

Chicken wings are actually okay! But like I said I've had better.

Bibimbap is a bit bland - i duno what it is but its just not what i'm looking for.

DO NOT GET THE Chapchae - i should have taken a picture but the portion was like 1/8th of the to go pan. All soy sauce - yuck.

Tacos - they forgot to give us sauce sooooo... it tasted a bit bland.

The only good thing is the chicken really.

Kogii Kogii Express is a new Korean casual quick eats restaurant located in the busy Naperville Freedom Commons plaza. Freedom Commons is becoming the go to spot for dining in Naperville as the vast array of culinary selections range from casual to fine dining. My only gripe was the lack of Asian dining choices so I'm happy to see this place open up.

Bibimbap is the main attraction here and Kogii Kogii Express offers a unique make your own chipotle style bibimbap station. For those that don't know what bibimbap is, it's a traditional Korean rice bowl dish that contains rice topped with a multitude of veggies, meat, fried egg, and Korean chili paste gochjang sauce that's all supposed to be mixed up together. "Bibim" literally means mixed up in Korean. Kogii Kogii's bibimbap is pretty awesome.  My favorite is the spicy pork but you can't go wrong with the Bulkogii (ribeye) or Galbi (short ribs). I love the fact that I can choose which veggies I want on top. They do charge you $1 extra for a fried egg or stone pot option. I usually skip the stone pot if its a hot day. For vegetarians out there you can have your bowl topped with no meat or tofu as another option.

The fried chicken wings here are also one of my favorite things to eat and in my opinion the best Korean fried chicken in Chicagoland and may even be the best wings in Chicagoland. They are that good. You can choose either garlic soy or Seoul sassy sauce (pretty spicy). The wings are super crisp and very meaty. A small order ($5.99) which consists of 5 pieces and a bowl of rice is enough to fill me up on most days.

Check out the Korean Churros which are pan fried dduk (rice cake) topped with spicy sauce or cinnamon sugar or the deep fried Chocopie for dessert! 

Overall Kogii Kogii Express is a unique and refreshing addition to the Naperville food scene.  Parking is a bit tough to find during weekday lunch rush due to all the office workers nearby but they do have dedicated parking spot for take out orders. Check it out!

I always crave Korean food and wanted to check this place out (I may have gotten it confused with the Kogii Kogii in Riverwoods). This is more of a Korean fast food place - the portions are smaller and cheaper. I got the bulgogi and my boyfriend got the kalbi, both came with a bowl of rice (white or brown) and a choice of two sides (we chose kimchi and tofu). The choices for sides are pretty limited and the tofu was cold, flavorless and hard to chew on. Other than that, everything else was pretty good but nothing really noteworthy. Will probably try the wings next time, but I'll also try the Kogii Kogii in Riverwoods!

I've heard a lot about Bibimbap, and this was my first experience trying this Korean staple in the suburbs. I ordered the bowl and got the beef over white rice. I like that they have a vegetable bar and they let you choose your own veggies. I went with mushrooms, carrots, bean sprouts, bok choy, cucumber, and pickled radish. And of course, I added the fried egg, though I was a little put off by a $1.00 upcharge. but hey, that's not as bad as guacamole at Chipotle. The flavor of the rice and meat was excellent, especially with a heaping of the chili sauce. I recommend adding a nice portion of the sauce to add another layer of flavor.

The Korean chicken wings were pretty good. They were crispy and juicy, and I liked that they took 10 minutes to come out because that showed that they are made fresh and are not just sitting under a heat lamp. However, the garlic soy flavor was a little sweet for my taste. Next time, I'd try the Seoul Sassy to add some spice.

I would consider returning when I'm in the area. I can't say it's one of my absolute favorite restaurants, but it's a different kind of fast food and very enjoyable for a decent price. 3.5.

Not everyone can or should make tacos,There is a ratio of meat vs toppings that should be followed. We ordered the taco trio,kimchi fries,and the Seoul sassy fried chicken...total was about $20

O.K. I write long reviews so to save you time- eat there,but don't expect much in terms of great customer service or great tacos.Get the chicken.

We walked in and were not greeted,as we got closer to the menu board the lady just stared at us as if we were Pink Aliens... I noticed a tip jar near the cash register(good luck with that lady who does not smile).

Our food took about 15 minutes.As I waited I observed another customer receiving the same Lack of customer service.

The taco trio was merely O.K. I have a high standard for tacos as its my favorite food.When I travel To other countries I see if they have a version of tacos;It's that serious.The meat ratio sucked,the tacos were mostly veggies.My issue with the taco trio is that all 3 tacos had the same toppings.All veggies don't complement all meats. The corn tortilla was awful.My guess is they were steamed in the microwave which makes them mushy. I'm guessing the chef learned how to cook tortillas from the back of the package- but that ain't how ya do it for tacos man!!!! My tacos came sloppily arranged in a large sheet of TIN FOIL!! Too many mistakes...

The Kimchi fries were good,but once again ratios should be noted.A large amount of fries with a little bit of toppings and cheese sauce. I feel like I'd have to ask for extra cheese/sour cream if I return. The fries were actually good without any toppings.

The best thing was the Seoul Sassy wings. They were crispy,and delicious!! Those wings deserve a solid 4 stars,I even ate them cold the next day and they still held their crunch.

Go for the wings!! The Kimchi fries have a cool flavor- try them,the tacos ehhhhhh.

This place is quickly becoming my favorite Korean restaurant in the western suburbs. It defines fusion comfort food perfectly, with a small variety of choices but packed with great flavors.  Their wings especially are amazing and cooked perfectly.  It may be the first time where the juices and flavors literally burst out when I take a bite, and I personally hope it is one dish that they will never change. 

Definitely a place worth the drive for.  It does not fall short to the high end restaurants in the plaza that it is located in.

Pretty good, especially for Naperville.  Yes, better Korean food can be had in the "city", but this is definitely worth trying.  I've been here a few times, quick thoughts:

- Spicy Pork was tasty, a bit oily but good
- Wings (both regular and spicy) were very good
- Dumplings are also light and very good (kids love them)
- Kimchee fries - good, pretty solid.  Have had better at select food trucks, but worth it.

I was disappointed in the Spicy Chicken - it was a bit dry (need chicken thigh meat!) when I had it.  I haven't had the bibimbap personally but my wife likes it.  Haven't had that Galbi yet but that's pretty hard to screw up.

The owners/waitstaff are super nice and it really doesn't take too long.  There isn't much seating and a lot of people seem to takeout.

My only other "complaint" is Naperville Commons parking - completely insufficient so if you come at a busy time, you could be circling for parking for like 10m+.

This place doesn't look like much and has a small menu, but the food is great!! I really enjoyed the whole create your own bibimbap. The spicy pork was very good, not too spicy. And there was a spicy sauce on the tables to add more flavor. Great place for lunch!

its chipotle with cold Korean sides you pick to top your bibimbap.
I ordered doll (hot clay bowl) bimbimbop, I don't think she heard me because i ended up getting regular.  you pick rice (brown) and protein (bulgogi) and they walk you down the small selection of toppings. which do you want?  I wanted it all.  and she passed it to me.  I grabbed a spoon and sat down.  the "sauce" on the table is spicy, (gochugang) and you mix your bowl all up.  I did ask about my soft fried egg, and she said i did not ask for it. I know now.  Sat down to dine. A little hard to mix the rice up with plastic spoons but it worked. Taste was ok/good. Gave three stars hoping it won't effect the balance either way. 

Original was edited because I sounded mean! 

Edited
Food is fresh and tasty. Menu was a bit confusing. They seemed to really skimp on the veggies in the BiBimBop, but all-in-all it was quite tasty.

I am solidly between 3.5 and 4 stars.  It was good, but definitely wasn't the best I had ever had.  I went with a coworker on Friday for lunch.  I have to say that I was very confused by the process, and because the employees weren't really able to communicate to me what I needed to do, it kind of soured my opinion a bit.  There were a bunch of sauces at the end that I wanted to know more about but the lady behind the counter just smiled at me like I hadn't asked a question at all.  Anyway, I had the bibimbap bowl with beef and upgraded to the stone bowl and the egg for a 1$ each.  The stone bowl wasn't worth the dollar.... the rice browned a little bit, but didn't get crunchy.  I wish I had just had them put everything on, but I didn't understand that everything was included (If that just makes me a dummy, I guess too bad).

Anyway, the food was fine, once I got over the ordering stress.  The restaurant is very, very small.  The two person tables are JUST barely big enough for two trays.  Trays are required if you get a hot stone bowl.  There's no room for anything else.  They give you teeeny tiny cups for water.  Seriously - dentist swishing sized cups.  I had to get up a bunch of times to get more water.  The sound of the refrigerators for the bottles of drinks that they sell is also really loud throughout the whole restaurant.  There are a few outside tables, but all of the ones with umbrellas are for a different restaurant.  If its not super hot, then I recommend sitting outside.  It would be great if this business would get their own outside tables.

Anyway, I won't be going back, I don't think.  Naf Naf and White Chocolate Grill are better options in that plaza.

Came in town to visit a friend and stopped by this new sister restaurant to original Kogii Kogii.  The concept of this place is excellent for quick Korean fix. Quick, affordable and delicious!  I ordered the soy garlic and spicy fried Korean chicken and it was amazing!! Crispy, juicy and full of flavor! The spicy chicken wasn't too hot (for my Korean taste buds) but may be too spicy for some. The hot stone bibimbap with egg on top was sizzling hot and flavorful as well. Definitely worth your money and time. I was not expecting this place in Naperville, but glad it's here.

Just stopped in here today for lunch. The Food was excellent! Made my own bowl with Rib Eye. Def will be back there again soon. I know they are new and are still working out some kinks, I suggest letting the guests know that they have a number on their ticket, I accidentally took someone else's food that was similar to mine and ate half of it before I check my receipt as they called a number numerous times. With a mouth full of food, I then realized I had a number and the number being called was mine - I took the wrong food LOL... Luckily the food I took belonged to someone in my group so we just switched. 

Great place, great food.

Me and my hubby wanted to check out new Korean restaurant in the heart of Naperville. We had galbi dolsot bibimbap, kimchi fries, spicy chicken plate! Everything was soooo delicious. So tasteful even i can choose the vegetable for my bibimbap bowl. The galbi was well marinated , the fires with kimchi was quite enjoyable. 
I come back soon with my friends!

I was actually on my way to Naf Naf when I seen this place and it was new. Had a Bibimbap bowl with marinated ribeye and all of the veggies, brown rice, boiled egg, kimchi. One of the best bowls that I have ever had. $10 and I was stuffed after I wolfed down this bowl. Wish I had this place in my area. Just happened to be passing through Naperville for work and had time for lunch. Glad I stopped here.

This place is a good deal for lunch and you walk out full. Will definitely be back when I am I am in the area. 

If you live or work by this place you should go.

I was very disappointed tonight. My husband and I walked in at 8:15 pm and the employee said they were closed. The website lists 9 pm as closing time, but the door lists 8:30 pm as closing. They were already all cleaned up and chairs were being put up. I was looking forward to trying this place as Naperville doesn't have a lot of Korean food options. I wanted to give it 1 star, but since I didn't try their food, I'm giving it 2 stars.

Awesome! Healthy Korean fast food! Portions are great and food is fresh! Tried the bibimbop, kimchi fries, and the tacos today. Bibimbop was savory with lots of veggies, kimchi fries were crispy, and the tacos were juicy! Thumbs up on the food!
It's my first time to Kogi Kogi and love their Bibimpap! The staffs are nice and friendly. The place was a bit small but clean. Definitely coming back!

Delicious! My husband & I had the Bibimbap Bowl with white rice, bulkogii (marinated ribeye), fried egg, & choice of veggies. It's sorta like a Korean Chipotle. They have tacos too. We also ordered fried chicken with Garlic Soy sauce, so good & crispy! So happy there's a Korean food place around here in the suburbs!! We'll definitely be back!

Fake ass Korean food, are you kidding me!!? Literally the women here are so rude and trying to rush me. Can I have more than 3 seconds to think about my order???? I've never had worse. Tastes like fake version of bonchon and bonchon is already the fake version of real Korean food. I understand it's fast food but really it sucks. And the dolsot bibimbap is not even in a nice hot stone bowl it's like a hot platter. Only thing I liked was the dumplings which are store bought because I can buy the same thing at hmart. The dipping sauce sucks too.

Fun little Korean place with fast, friendly service and great food. The menu is a little confusing, however, and a little expensive for the amount of food you get. It seems like the place doesn't quite run smoothly yet since it opened just yesterday, but that will probably improve over time. I got the spicy pork bibimbap bowl and the garlic soy chicken wings.
Bim bim bop was good but the tacos are not that great.    Will go back to try the chicken wings.
Excellent quality food. Very approachable for people who haven't eaten Korean before. Good prices. Will definitely come again

Very good options for those on a Paleo or like diet.  The permutations are impressive.  You can really make a tasty AND healthy bowl.  I had the bibimbap (rice bowl) with the spicy pork and marinated short ribs over white rice.  I then proceeded to load it up with almost every item from the bar.  My favorites are the kim chi, pickled jalapeno and pickled radish.  I added the fried egg and had that put into the stone pot (a heated cast iron bowl that adds more heat to the mix). I would recommend spending the extra for the bowl (worth it).  I will come back soon and try the other items on the menu.
Good food and friendly service. The tacos and bowl were both delicious. Didn't have high expectations but pleasantly surprised. Glad this place opened up and will definitely return.

They get five stars for just being in the area and not by 59 or something. Food is decent not too salty as some places can be. Selection of tacos. Rice bowls, entrees, or fried chicken. The fried chicken is amazing and Carmelites like how I ate the Korean Chinese style fried chicken growing up. I recommend the garlic soy unless u can handle a very very spicy hot chicken. Tacos were definitely nowhere near the level of Del Seoul's. I'd stay away. The rice bowls are done like your Chipotle ones... In a bowl where you choose all your toppings. And definitely do try their fries. Both the kimchi and kogi fries were delish!!! Haven't tried an entree yet only because I'd rather make that stuff at home. Wish they had a salad bowl option with no rice at all. I don't remember if they have any type of brown rice either. Never gone when it's busy but if you're getting chicken, I'd call and order ahead or call for pickup. They had a lot of bugs flying around the ceiling. We've only ordered carry out. Nice decor. Easy to find off the 88 expressway and freedom by diehl. Edit add on: oh yeah other lady mentioned service. For a fast food place not so great but for a Korean place, it wasn't the worst. Korean restaurants kind of have a bad rep for bad service because of lack of staff or a bad day. Do wish there was a bit more energy. If you are the only employee there be happy. First time I went there was a young girl and she was very nice and helpful. Keep it up!

Super yummy and quick lunch food. Great alternative to salads or sandwiches. Can get a veggie option. The bibimbap with brown rice, veggies and eggs was so delicious!  Nice service! Will definitely come back.

This is a great place to grab a quick bite to eat if you are craving Korean. We tried the bulkogii bibimbap, small order of garlic soy wings, and the spicy chicken plate. Ingredients are fresh, portions are good, and prices are reasonable.  My kids loved the chicken which was crisp and meaty.  Great to see another Korean option pop up in this area.

So we were planning to go to kogii kogii in riverwoods but when typing it in Yelp, this express one came up. We were sooo excited because not only is it wayy closer than the original but this one had Korean tacos!! So happy we don't have to go to the city for them anymore. 

They are definitely more fast food type. The food was out fast but not so fast where it's kind of suspicious. The kimchee fries were amazing! They were nice and crispy, which I love, but they were still potato-y? If you catch my drift. The tacos were good, but gotta put the red pepper sauce they have on the table. 

I love my Korean style fried chicken! So I was looking forward to these. They were crispy, meaty and delicious. I personally like my chicken more crispy, but I guess my heart and health would prefer them like this haha. But the flavor was so good I didn't even care. Also, it might've been because it had sauce on it. I usually get plain crispy chicken, so I will try that next time!

The restaurant itself is very clean and modern looking. I like the presentation. Also, there was another man next to us and when he had left the employee cleaned the table right away. Love that they're on top of their game. Can't wait to come back and try the galbi rice bowl!! It's such a reasonable price, doesn't cost an arm and a leg like other places.

Fantastic little restaurant close to our hotel after a long drive in from Nebraska! Very friendly staff and tasty food! My friend for bibimbap and I got the bulkogii rice plate. I loved it but found the sauce a little too salty. My friend was hoping for fresh-cooked bulkogii instead of re-heated (but we went close to closing). Highly recommend from a tired traveler!

YES Korean food !!!

Get the galbi plate with kimchi and white rice. I haven't had good Korean fast food in a long time. 

We just found it by mistake when we were driving to hmart.

three stars because the food is pretty good and surprisingly fast service. However, the portions for the price is too small. I ordered galbi, kim chee fried rice, 5 piece chicken wings and two drinks all of that almost $60 like whaaat. for the portions i would think all my food would equal $35. but all in all food is good.
Like a Korean Chipotle; you start with good brown rice and build up your bowl with yummy veg and topping choices. Very fast.

So, I've been lamenting the lack of a good Korean fried chicken in the western suburbs lately, and I didn't realize they had it here until I tried it today.  It's good.  I got the garlic-soy flavoring and it was exactly what I was looking for.  It's just wings, but that's not too bad.

Also tried the bulkogii, which was tasty.  My wife had the bibimbap with tofu, and she thought it was okay. She was a bit underwhelmed by the tofu which was cold, and maybe that's by design but it was unexpected by her.  The jap chae noodles were tasty.

Two small concerns:  The website doesn't really convey the express menu, it just has the main restaurant's menu, which is more extensive.  Also, I didn't see it explained anywhere what "Kogii Fries" were, and I could have asked or taken a gamble, but I had bought too much to try it out as it was. 

Anyway, it's a quality place, and it seems to beat the somewhat lackluster food court at Naperville's Super H-Mart.

The food is ok. Meat in our bowls came out cold. The food is overpriced. Service was vary friendly though. I honestly don't see what the big deal about this place is... It's good but it's not that good.

Went to this place for an early dinner. The food was very good, the experience was so-so.

I got there around 4:45 and there was only one other group of two in the restaurant. The eat-in area is very small so there must do mostly carry-out business. I had never been there before, so I was a little disoriented about exactly how you ordered and how you got your food and the staff didn't really help. There were three ladies behind the register who all looked at me while I ordered (I got the bibimbap bowl with spicy pork, kimchi fries and a coke) but then none of them told me what was going on, so I just took a seat figuring someone would bring my food to me since there isn't any spot that looks like a "pick-up" area. Then they had me come back to get the vegetables for the bowl but didn't explain if they were all included at no charge or if I had to pay extra for others. Then they all left and took my bowl with them. Uh... OK.... Finally one lady brought my bowl back and set it on a counter behind the register. I took it back to a table but wasn't sure if they forgot my fries or if those were coming later or what. They had a bunch of coolers with drinks in them in different spots but I wasn't sure if I was supposed to just grab a bottle of coke or what. I finally just took one and no one said anything so I guess that's what I was supposed to do. I started eating my bowl and about 10 minutes later someone called "order number 44" which when I checked my receipt was my order number, nobody mentioned that I even had an order number when I placed my order. So the place has some obvious order flow and communication issues...

As for the food, everything was excellent. The bowl was delicious, if anything, I put too many vegetables in it. The kimchi fries, when they came, were very good. Everything was freshly made and the correct temperature. Spice-wise, I don't like things overly spicy and they had toned it down from what I was expecting, so I was happy with it but it might not have the kick you are looking for if you like a lot of heat in your Korean food. The size of the bowl with the fries and a drink were way more than I could eat. If you have two people I would recommend splitting the bowl or the fries because i didn't come close to finishing either of them.

It was a little pricey for one person for a "fast-casual" type dinner, my total with tax was just under $21. I would probably skip the fries next time which would have brought the cost down closer to $16-$17 which is more typical of what I would expect to spend.

This place just opened and we are so happy to see more choices for Korean food in Naperville.  We tried the kalbi bibimbap, garlic soy chicken wings, and kimchi fries.  The bibimbap was the big winner and we enjoyed the big portions and fresh ingredients on the the bibimbap.  The chicken wings were also very good -- not too saucy and very crispy (perhaps the portion size could be a bit bigger for the price).  The kimchi fries were delicious but I would have liked more kimchi on top (just my preference).  Relative to other choices in the area, KKE gets 5 stars from me.  I'll be coming back here for sure.

Tried this place for the first time today. My husband and I both loved their food! I got the hot stone bibimbap with spicy pork. He got chicken wings. We also shared kimchi fries. Everything was delicious. A fun and modern twist to Korean food.
First time I have ever posted on Yelp. This place is delicious. Service was great. If I lived here I would eat here all the time.

I actually happened upon this place by accident and  so happy I did! Not only is the service super fast, but the inside is clean, all of the staff is very friendly, and the food is amazing every time I come in. I don't typically rave about burgers and soup, but this place hands down has one of the best burgers I've ever had and the cheddar ale soup as well as the clam chowder are amazing. I can't wait to start trying their beers :)

This is one of my go-to places in West Dundee. All of their food is great. My favorite is their nachos with beef and beer cheese. The service has always been good. If you come on a weekend for dinner expect to wait.

Instant huge fan.  The layout of their restaurant reminds me of Ted's Montana Grill, another favorite of mine.  The interior has an old school restaurant-brewery feel with it's mahogany woodwork, black & white photo's and random decor.  Like the other Emmett's, this one too is in a historical building which add's a lot of character.
I chose Emmett's for the beer but I'll be honest, I was just as hungry after bowling and bocce down the street.  Our waiter was quick to offer us samples of any beer and went over each in detail.  I tried both porter's (Irish and Imperial) and the Hefeweizen.  Porter's are generally a safe bet but neither struck a chord.  The Hefe was excellent though, and saved the day.
Dinner...I had the turkey club with sweet potato fries, a staple in my dinner diet.  Both were top notch.  
If you care to do a where's waldo moment, be sure to spy the bear with a bowler.  
This Emmet's is my kinda place...we'll be back!
Cheers.

I loved it!

It's in the adorable downtown part of West Dundee.  The burgers are absolute heaven!  The beer is pretty good too!

This place is the best! We come here semi-regularly, and most often for New Years Eves.

New Year's Eve 2015 was a very special one for us - it was sort of our informal 10-year high school reunion, and we had people coming from very far away for the event. We chose Emmett's because we'd spent several New Year's Eves there before, and we thought it a nice place for our larger-than-usual group.

All I can say is that the quality of service was great. The food is always great, but what really stuck out to us was the friendliness of the staff and their willingness to make sure our unique event was special. We had 17 adults and 4 children, and were seated in the nicely-decorated and -lit upstairs room at a long table towards the outside wall. It was perfect. There were other tables up there that saw guests here and there through the night, but we were mostly alone, which worked well for everyone, I think, in that it was very reception-like. It was like a private event. We had room to move around the table, and room to gather before dinner for a makeshift "cocktail hour," and we didn't have to worry about being too bothersome to other guests or restricted in our own frivolity.

The 12+ separate checks were handled with ease as well, and we didn't have to worry about a thing. Everything went smoothly and quickly, and our waitstaff was just great. Everything about the night ended up wonderful, and Emmett's was a big part of that.

Thank you! We shall return!

This is a nice place in West Dundee.  Nice atmosphere and the service we received at the bar was good.  We were only there for a few beers and the ones we had were OK.  Nothing wrong with my experiences but just not my taste.  I had the Octoberfest and my wife had the IPA.  Both were good but I would try something different next time.  We didn't have food but the meals we saw looked and smelled quite good.  I would go again given the atmosphere and to try another few of their beers.  I would recommend giving this place a try.

So what's to do on a dreary Monday Memorial Day morning?
A) Drink copious amounts of strong French press coffee-yes.
B) Read a few pages of The Sympathizer-OK.
3) Drive to Gat Guns and obliterate several terrorist themed targets-Of course, what's more patriotic than that?
D) Follow that unbridled pleasure with a visit to Emmett's Brewing, based on the "Nearby" setting and the favorable reviews on the Yelp Mobile App.

Perhaps the best Caprese salad I've had (at least in recent memory).  Additionally the house brewed IPA was a winner, and the d̩cor is very cool-that old timey, dark woody, prohibition eray feel.  Nice service as well.
