A nice little place off the main street. We sat on the outdoor patio and had a good time. Service was good as well. I had the fish and chips and thought they were just "Ok" and were a little pricey for the amount of food.

Pros truffle fries, cons are the jumbo lump crab sandwich special, not a lump to be found!! Told the waitress and she didn't apologize, she just in a pissy tone asked " well you want something else". No check please!!! They didn't charge for it,also my other half had the Thai chicken wrap,dry and probably 2 oz of chicken. Won't be going back

I love the food here - they have a wonderful menu.  We have had many memorable dinners here as well as many special events.  They food is always done well, even when it is for a large party of 40+ served buffet style.

But as others have stated, where they also shine is their consistently wonderful service.  The staff is always cheerful and willing to go the extra mile to make sure that everything is perfect.

I had just come back from a trip to Munich, Germany and was curious to see how authentic their Munich Dunkel beer was. 

My fianc̩ and I went on a Tuesday. They have a taco Tuesday special where their tacos are only $2. I ordered a fried fish taco and a soft pretzel. The pretzel was delicious but a little pricey for how small it was. The cheese dipping sauce was yummy. The fish taco was so crispy! It was quite a larger serving size and had a good fish to breading ratio. I wouldn't have been able to eat 2 of them for lunch without being overly stuffed. My fianc̩ had their veggie burger which he said was good and the patty was substantial for being a veggie patty. 

We also had a flight of their beers. We asked them to replace the IPA that normally came in the flight with the Munich Dunkel. We really liked the Munich light, oatmeal stout, and Munich Dunkel. The red ale was not bad but we were not fans of their 1am English Ale (we aren't big on bitter hoppy beers). We're definitely going to be joining their beer club.

My girlfriend, friends, and I frequent here quite often. I obviously don't review every time we go, because its a solid place and 'nuff said. 
The lady and I were just in after they did some renovations, just wanted to say it looks phenomenal. More exposed brick in the pub area, and an added fireplace in the main dining area.
As always, the beer and food is amazing! And the wait staff is always friendly and accommodating. 
Seriously hit this place up if you're in the area, you will not be disappointed. 
My recommendations would be their McCarthy Red Ale (or seasonal Belgiums), and any of their burgers or fish tacos, and truffle fries. The lady LOVES their Cheddar Ale soup and the pretzel twist, along with their Victory Pale Ale.

It's like I have a brewery radar because whenever one is nearby I automatically want to eat at it. Trying new microbrews just makes me happy. 

I've been to the Emmett's in Palatine before and tried the red ale so this time I went with one of the seasonal brews--Honey Rye Ale.  It was light and refreshing.  My second beer was the regular Oatmeal Stout.  This one was much darker and heavier but had great flavor.  My friend graciously allowed me to try her smoked beer (hallis, I believe) and it was very....interesting.  The smoked flavor was quite overpowering.

I was having the hardest time deciding what to order for my meal.  I took the advice of another reviewer and ordered the cheddar ale soup with the pretzel roll and loved it.  It helped warm me back up too! I also ordered the small plate size of the pork belly taco with sweet potato fries.  The fries were perfectly battered and nice and salty.  The pork belly taco was just okay and the flavor just wasn't quite right to me. I love the small plate concept and was excited that it was on the menu as I get to try more things.  I felt like I had the perfect amount of food.

Service was good.  Our server did seem to disappear for a bit after serving our food when I wanted to order another beer, but I think she was also serving patrons at the bar.  She split our check without a fuss which was greatly appreciated.
Service is always on point, I go here regularly and it never disappoints. Good food good drinks.

First thing you see when entering Emmett's are their giant beer brewing drum things. Neat! We sat in the pub/bar portion which was clean, nice, and classier than I'd expect of this sort of place. Our server was nice though nothing extraordinary, she was kind enough to explain to us the differences in some of their own brews, which one of our party ordered (the Hefeweizen, a rather banana-y tasting beer). Gave us some time with our menus, a good variety of tasty sounding meals, varying from salads to sandwiches to cuts of meat, pretty typical spread.
    Food comes. I got a Chicken and raspberry salad, topped with blue cheese, walnuts (as I recall), craisins, pear slices, chicken (duh), and a raspberry vinaigrette. Salad was in theory good, though it needed some work. Go a little easier on the craisins and that chicken was comparable to the leg of the table we sat at: dry. It was alright though, just needs some work to make it great. Boyfriend got a Cobb salad. As I recall he had no complaints, good, traditional Cobb salad. Boyfriend's brother: got a club sandwich. You have varying options for your side, he got the sweet potato fries. So. Good! He enjoyed the sandwich as well. Friend: he got some sort of burger with an egg on it, bacon on top, and the white truffle fries. White truffle fries= delicious (this place has it down with the fries apparently). Bacon?.... we weren't quite sure what it was. Wasn't quite on the burger and it looked more like ground up... something.
    Bathrooms were nice. Clean. I had a moment of surprise when walking up to the door and it had the picture of the guy and girl on it, so I thought "wow, I haven't been in a co-ed bathroom since France!", but low and behold, it was just the gateway door to two other doors leading into segregated bathrooms. There was the end of a d̩j-poo moment (lol, sorry, poo pourri reference).
    I'm not often in West Dundee, so this isn't exactly a go-to place for me (though I think there are other locations...), but it seems to be a hit or a miss sort of place, more often a hit is my guess, so go try some local brews!

If you are on a tight budget, this probably wouldn't be the best place to bring your family or a friend, though I will say the food is slightly above average, and the burgers/fries definitely have other surrounding restaurants beat. As far as appetizers, I was extremely disappointed when I ordered the Walleye bites for 12 dollars and received a fancy garnished plate with 5 tiny tenders as big as my thumb, now I understand they may prepare everything by hand, but come on! For 12 dollars I should of been able to down at least 20 of those things with my beer. Other starters I've had are the calamari (fresh & excellent, small portion), and the cheddar ale soup with a pretzel twist, which I highly recommended.
 
       As for the beer I really have no complaints, they are also a little pricey, but they claim they have to charge those amounts because all of the ingredients are imported (mehh..could still lower a buck or two). Being I'm not a fan of real hoppy brews, the Munich Light is probably my favorite, though I must say I really enjoy the Red Ale, as well as their seasonal Pilsener, I would suggest ordering the beer sampler so you can just decide for yourself. 
 
       Overall the atmosphere in Emmett's is very warm and relaxed, from the moment you walk through the doors and see the giant beer tanks in the windows, to the beautiful decorations/pictures, and the solid bar where you can view downtown Dundee while your sipping a pint. I do have one request though, if anyone from Emmett's is reading this, PLEASE PLEASE change the gosh awful radio station you  have playing here 24/7, it's the most awful, whiny, soft rock annoying crap I have ever heard. If there was something like soft instrumental, classical or jazz, it would fit into the Emmett's atmosphere much better. As for the staff, my friend and I have been coming here since we were 12, and they have always treated us with kindness and respect.

I've had Emmett's beer quite a few times before actually visiting this location, and I was pleasantly surprised. First of all, the brewpub is beautiful inside, and much larger than you'd think when you see it from the street. Inside, there's a substantial bar and a very large dining area.

The selection if beer available on tap is larger than I expected, and they have some really good brews. I didn't like that the flight includes the two beers you can get in a six pack (we've had those, so what's the point?), but they let you sample before getting a full pour, so I guess it works out in the end.

Everything is awesome about this place except the average flavored food.  Location = awesome, decor = awesome, patio = extra awesome, bar = awesome.  If they could kick the food flavoring up a notch, this would be the spot!

I've been coming here for years and I have never been overwhelmed with their menu. The few items I did like, like the Buffalo Burger and the Grouper have long been discontinued,  I do like their 1am micro brew though. We stopped in today and I ordered the Firestarter Burger with grilled jalape̱os and the jalape̱os were not grilled. I have always woundered, do the entities that be ever eat here anonymously? I'll stick to the Monday all you can eat potato skins from now on.

I visited Emmett's with a large group of people this past weekend. 

I was pleased that we got what only could be called superior service; anything and everything that we asked for was taken care of smoothly and efficiently. This made our meal so much more pleasant and enjoyable!

I tried the turkey burger which was a treat being topped with just the right amount of pesto sauce. I chose sweet potato fries for my side and would order them again. Both items were fresh and tasty.

I have to say that I was slightly under-whelmed by Emmett's beers, but they were a solid 8-9 on a 10 point scale. I will have to visit again when I am not having a meal so that I can just focus on the taste of the beer.

One person in our group ordered carrot cake and was brought a slice that looked like a quarter of a cake. Beware if you are not a hearty dessert eater or don't have at least 3 friends to help you polish off this mountain of a confection.

The only negative is that parking is somewhat sparse around Emmett's. There is a fair sized parking lot behind their building but it was absolutely full at 2 PM on a Sunday. I am not sure where all the people that belonged to those cars went?

Overall I felt that Emmett's is a notch or two above your average brewpub and at least one of those notches is the very good and friendly service. I'd suggest giving them a try if you haven't yet.
The atmosphere and location are great. All of their brews that I tried were great and the food was good.

The cornbeef and cabbage was uneatable.  The management was rude and did not care I was even told that that one of the owners were there but he would not come talk to me.  Amanda the Manager was rude and lied about what one of our group said to her.  Awful place do not there.  Right down the street is a much better place where the owner and management care about their people.
Had lunch here today and ordered the pulled bbq sandwich, it was phenomenal! Nice atmosphere and great service!

Been to Emmett's plenty of times for lunch and dinner.  The first time I came here was with my mom after my wedding dress came in at Shelley's next door, and after most fittings we would visit Emmett's since we enjoyed our visit so much.

Fish tacos are great, you can get the ahi tuna and its like having sushi!..  Cheddar ale soup is fantastic with their homemade pretzel rods... love the Caprese Turkey Burger.. and the staff has always been super helpful and attentive.  Never have had a problem with service being slow.  If you stick to sandwiches and burgers, prices are totally reasonable, the entrees can be a bit pricey though.

Ambiance is really nice, definitely an upscale brewery in a cute area of West Dundee.  Outdoor seating is a plus.

Really happy with my visit here. Emmett's was recommended to me by a Carpentersville Police Detective and he was spot on. The food was fantastic and an unbelievable value but what really set Emmett's part IMO was the service. Top shelf and as good as you'll find.
Everyone seemed to be enjoying the beer but I stick to water:)

Will definitely return in the future. 5 stars all  the way.

First time at this place and we noticed it is a very classy joint with a personal touch.  We sat at the bar and tried the 1am ale I think, which was very smooth and had a complex flavor I loved.  There is a good selection of veg apps and main entrees.  I tried the black bean burger, which I have to say is prob one of the best I have ever had.  Its two burgers stacked with cheddar cheese with siracha aoli sauce and a pretzel bun, out of this world!!!  I also opted for the Truffle fries which are soooo worth it.  You will feel like you having a small heart attack, but it is def worth it.  
Staff was attentive and the food was excellent, so we will definitely be back next time we are in the area.

Emmits has great beer and food and although the menu has changed recently they still have great food and a great atmosphere, not only for eating but also if you want to go drinking at the bar.

They always have sometype of beer special and also, do yourself a favor, get the truffle fries, THEY ARE AMAZING!

The only reason I am knocking a star off is because service is not always the best.

I'm giving our meal a 3 tonight. Potato skins were good but more potato than we like and not enough bacon. Sausage cheese flatbread pizza was ok. Kobe burger was decent but a little too seared on the outside which altered the taste. Cooked medium rare which I asked for though so that was good. Sweet potato fries were excellent. Fried perfectly. Small plate mini brie burger was a perfect size for me after the appetizers oh and very tasty, hold the caramelized onions. Caprese salad was delicious but I don't think they were heirloom tomatoes and if they were they were sliced a bit too thin. But overall very enjoyable!

Great beers on draft and decent food. I've been here a few times over the last couple
Of years. The Menu is somewhat small and hasn't really changed too much. They are fairly Close to where I live so it is worth it.
Second time here, I was not happy with the food. Got the rock shrimp - really not that good. It was just a little flavored and so small in quantity.
Good food but over priced in my opinion. Just had a starter and beer.  Wait staff was great.

Its really 3.5 but 4 is ok considering what is available in the area - burgers and beer  

The beer selection is outstanding with bar staff that are knowledgeable  Different lagers, pilsners and ales and they are good

Food is actually pretty good.  I had the pot roast one night and chicken saltimbocca the next.  Pot roast was better but the chicken was well prepared.  Chicken was smothered in artichoke hearts so it was hard to find, but the meat portion was huge  

In an area of amazingly no variety this seems to be the best choice

Emmett's at first glance is a hybrid of fine dining and local bar atmosphere. The bar (on a Tuesday) is packed, which I later learned, through my caring server, Danielle, was due in part to a beer club brat event. It seemed counterintuitive for this fine dining establishment, but it is clear that they know where their true loyalty lies. 

I started with the pale ale, which is described as having a "big hop flavor, aroma and bitterness, which are all supported be substantial malt character." This beer did, in fact, live up to the description and was a great way to start my evening. 

From there, I ordered the Sesame Seared Ahi Tuna. It was cooked rare and served with a creamy lightly dressed slaw and wasabi aioli. The hot wasabi was the perfect pairing to the cool slaw. 

At this point in my meal, I remembered that I only had 1GB of data left on my monthly plan, so I asked if they had WIFI. Danielle wasn't sure, so she went to check and told me it should come up under 'AleHouse.' Although it did not come up on my phone, I have to believe that something was either wrong with the router because it seems like everyone in the area had free WIFI. Perhaps they just don't get enough people in their fine establishment that care about that sort of thing. 

My wonderful waitress, Danielle, then talked to me about the entree section of the menu. She suggested a few items including the tortellini and stuffed chicken, but I finally settled on the Flat Iron Steak. It came with the option of soup or salad, which prompted me, on this cooler summer day, to choose the house cheddar ale soup (you can't go wrong with a soup that has beer in it at a brewery, right?). 

The soup was a good choice. It was creamy and flavorful. It paired adequately with the delectable house made pretzel, although I would have preferred that one of them was a little less salty. It was full bodied  flavor upon flavor, which made it difficult to enjoy without one of their many handcrafted beers to wash it down (not that I didn't mind an excuse to drink on of their amazing beers). 

In between my soup and meal, I ordered a red ale, which was exactly what I was expecting. My flat iron steak came and was cooked to perfection- rare (of course). The potatoes were done to the way that I enjoy them- less cream and butter and more potato and flavor. The asparagus, although unseasoned, was refreshing on the palette. Again, my only wish is that there was less salt in the dish. The steak's Chimichurri was heavy on the NaCl and even though the potatoes were not that salty, it still felt that way since the steak was coated. I will say, the chef, Emanuel, did a fine, dare I not say stellar,  job of cooking and presenting the dish. 

JJ, the manager on this Tuesday evening, looks young but is very personable. After talking to him, it was clear that I should recommend that readers come to the Heritage Festival partially hosted in their back parking lot this fall. 

Overall, Emmett's has a winning combination of epic brewery, very attentive service, and food that (although, in my personal opinion could have been seasoned differently) is very tasty and unique for this particular area. You will not find a restaurant that serves dinner in Dundee that does it better than this.

EDIT: After dinner, I went to the bar where Melissa literally remembered me from 8 months ago. She even knew I wasn't wearing my glasses! You can tell that she cares about the people that she serves and is very aware of the varying social dynamics that come with a place as unique as Emmett's. If there is one shining star to this restaurant brewery, it is her. "Thank you" is all that I can say. Prompt and accommodating personal service. Who could ask for anything more?

Come here with good company but don't expect anything mind-blowing.  I had the brie burger and a beer sampler which came with a pale ale, red ale, german lager, english ale, and an oatmeal stout.  I ordered the burger cooked medium and it came out fairly well done.  I didn't bother complaining since it was around 9pm and we were all tired from being pounded on by little kids at painballing...kids these days.  The service was spotty and it took our waitress a long time to bring us our waters when we were seated.  Overall it was a decent experience but I probably wouldn't go back .

Cool bar with good atmosphere. Ordered a burger that was very good, although I didn't get the truffle fries that I ordered. I was one of three people sitting at the bar but for some reason the bartender seamed very busy. I would have easily had a couple of beers but was paid no attention to. Did not ask how my meal was and could not even get a glass of water let alone another beer. Had to ask for my tab. Constantly amazed how much poor service comes from bartenders when it would be so easy to push multiple drinks on a customer.

We were passing through town and wanted something local. 
The service was good but the food was average nothing special for the price. 
Everything was just okay...

Let me preface this with this is their second Yelp account.  I guess you keep making new ones until you get good reviews...

I'll start off with my beer was awesome.  That is the end of awesome.  I ordered the Rack of pork, turns out it was a pork chop on the bone (the waitress suggested this meal to me).  The meat on the bone was awesome, the other 90% was dry and under-seasoned.  Come to think of it, my potatoes and mushy vegetables were under-seasoned as well.  The beer was awesome!  Too bad I paid $20 for a dish I could have done better myself at home... correction... a dish I have done better at home.

Come to Emmett's for the beer, go somewhere else for food.

Don't be fooled by these other reviews where people are eating soup, salad, or pretzels.  If you can't do that right then you're McDonalds.

Went to Emmett's on a Friday for lunch with a coworker. Order soup and a veggie burger, she ordered a salad. Service was at a snail's pace. So slow that we had to ask if our food was coming because we had to return to work. Food was promised in 5 minutes. It never came and had to ask to have our food wrapped to go. Took 15 minutes for that to happen. Had to track someone to then pay our bill. Their excuse for the slow service was that they had a large group in house for a business lunch. To me, that is no excuse. Will never go back to Emmett's.

Food is good, beer is great, but the service?  Holy crap is it slow!  We've been dozens of times - it's sort of a last resort place for us, but only because of the service.  And it's always been that way.  For years.  The servers are really nice people, but I think either the training sucks or the kitchen just has terrible management which extends the ticket times.

Came here for dinner with a group of friends. I arrived later than some of my friends and it seemed that they were waiting a while for a table that could fit all of us (8 people). Finally, we were seated outside. Our waitress told us about their famous Red Ale which they had cask conditioned. My boyfriend, being the beer aficionado, ordered one while I had the regular Red. Come to find out when the waitress returned that they ran out of the cask conditioned ale and they probably should have taken it down from their chalk board. Yeah, probably. The regular Red was good. Had a good amount of bitterness to it but not overwhelming. I also had the Victory Pale Ale which was pretty good. Again, it's a little hoppy, so don't get it if you don't like hops. 

The food was okay. My burger and fries was good but then again it's pretty hard to mess that up. I got it because it was the cheapest thing on the menu. My bf decided to get the pork tenderloin for $17. That's pretty pricey for a little tavern restaurant and he was pretty disappointed with it. Only three little pork squares! For that price at a place like this, there should have been way more on the plate. 

My friends held out until 9pm and ordered from the late night menu which I definitely would have done if I wasn't so famished. For $1.50, you can get a mini burger with a side of fries. That's a great deal. You may not be getting a lot of food, but you can order something else and you might end up getting more food that way for the price than ordering off the menu.

Overall, this isn't my favorite place. I've had better craft beers elsewhere and better food. This is pretty standard and I guess okay if you're in the area, but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Awesome food options.

I took a client here not knowing how rowdy it may or may not get.  It was a success.  The energy was in the air as it was playoff hockey time.

Great bar fare and interesting brews.

Went to Emmett's with some friends for dinner. It was delicious. After changing my mind half a dozen times, I ended up with the beer cheese soup and a small caprese salad. Both were amazing and definitely enough to fill me up. 

We also got the pretzels as an appetizer, it came with a horseradish sauce and one other, but I would have loved a nice cheese sauce to dip the pretzels in...seemed like a no brainer, and everyone at the table agreed. We didn't like the dipping sauces provided.

We also got dessert, the husband and I split an apple pie type dessert which was delicious.

The atmosphere was dark and classy but not super-dressy (we were in jeans and didn't feel out of place).

I'd go back for sure, there were a few things on the menu I'd love to try.

This place was awesome. I know it's a brewery, so while we didn't go there for that reason, I feel obligated to comment on the beer. I had the Oatmeal Stout and loved it. My husband had two of their seasonal special IPAs (I don't know which) and enjoyed them both. Now for the food... 
We had the spinach and artichoke dip as an appetizer and it was the best ever. The hearty dip and warm triangles of pita bread have me craving it at 6am! 
I didn't care for Cheddar Ale Soup. I can't place my finger on it, but something was off. My husband had already mowed through his cup of Chicken and Brown Rice  Soup and I offered him what was left of mine. This man will eat anything if it's even semi-decent, and he only took a couple bites. So maybe it was an off day for their soup, but this was a miss for both of us. 
The portion was rather small, but his Flank Steak was cooked to perfection (rare). I had the Baked Macaroni and Cheese. Yum!!! Bacon, chunks of tomatoes, broccoli and that spiral pasta in the cheesy ale sauce were perfection! 
We'll be going back for sure!!

First, I'm not a beer guy (I'll have one or two a week, But Light, frosted glass, and I'm good) -but all my friends who are love this place...I just don't get it - beer should be cold and taste like beer (got the sampler - the one that tasted like coffee was gross, I put ice in the room tempature one - and the rest for me were.... ehhhhh) - sampler at Lucky Monk MUCH better.
Food was OK - nothing to write home about - but a nice interior, and the bartender was nice and, in addition to my sampler, gave me 3 more sampler sized beers - none of which I'd recommend).

Atmosphere was nice at first , with warm fireplace and tv. After 20 minutes though there was this HORRIBLE LOUD banging that continued throughout our entire hour stay. When I asked the waiter about it, she was sarcastic and said oh that's just the bartender banging ice. And I said well several other patrons complained too and if the ice is frozen in chunks they should have broken it up before customers arrived. I told her for that alone I would likely not come back but she didn't seem to care, as she just walked away. Wait staff seems uncaring and immature. Food was just fair . Pot roast was WAY over salted- thinking they used a prepackaged seasoning instead of from scratch, and the meat was tough. I'm used to pull apart slow cooker pot roast and this was like a tough low quality over cooked meat . Dark beer was decent but then again what can go wring with bottled beer? Spinach artichoke appetizer was the only tasty thing. If I had a better response from my waitresses I'd likely be back to give it another chance. But not likely now.

Nice place but they seriously need to amp up on some additional staff. Service here is super slow and inattentive. I did not get a chance to check out the beer selection or brewery but the food downright sucked. We ordered quite a few different appetizers, all except for 1 were nothing to tie home about. Couldn't even eat one of em. Definitely don't come here for the food or service. Hopefully the brewery is better.

I hope someone reads these from Emmett's, whatever changes or short cuts or bad chef hires you maid in West Dundee. Change them back we stopped going here because the food is no longer what is was. (I'm filtering here) 
We've given second and third chances thinking it was an off day... nope .
Something changed and not for the good.

I can't believe I haven't put in a review for Emmets yet.  I'm not one to go back - I always like checking out places I've never been to before.  However - hubby and I do seem to end up back at Emmet's every couple of months and a beer, and depending on hunger, appetizers and/or dinner.

So - ended up there this weekend.  There's something comforting to me about the historic building and the worn patina of the beatifully done interior.   I like the photos on the wall, the layout, the people watching - And the beer is really really good.

I had Lobster fetuccini (sp?).  It was delicious.   So was the beer.  Hubby had chicken-caesar salad - not bad, but not great - it's touted as "traditional" caesar salad, but there was not an anchovy to be tasted - so, if you like anchovy style dressing, skip ordering here.  If you like creamy caesar dressing, then maybe give it a try.  (For the record - we both like the anchovies - hard to find....  if anyone knows where to find that, send me a message!)

We do occasionally get less-good service.   This weekend was great, though the kitchen was a bit slow.  However, I see that as an opportunity to enjoy the beer.  (Have I mentioned - the beer is really yummy.)

Would I recommend:  Yes.
Would I return:  Yes.

as always their beer is delicious, but I also had a sesame seed seared tuna steak over jasmine rice with a wasabi scented drizzle (i think that's what it said) with roasted red pepper and sauteed pea pods. I gotta tell you it damn near curled my toes, but for that dinner and one beer costing $28.19 without a tip( I did leave a $6 and 81 cent tip to round it off to $35), it will probably be another year before I stop back in.... it's pricey but I have yet to be disappointed

Nice location, classic dark wood pub. They seemed to be overwhelmed at the time although it was between lunch and dinner when I arrived just after 2pm. There was a half-filled water carafe occupying the empty bar space I sat down nearest and a pile of lunch plates just in front of me on the bar. A couple of locals loudly conversed a chair away from me and at least one of them, seemed to have been over-served. I was greeted promptly by the bar tender and the specials were explained. I ordered an Oktoberfest and it was solid. A traditional Amber M_rzen, malty, robust and highly quaffable. I ordered the Sausage En Croute appetizer from the specials menu and it was tasty with a wonderful, cheesy beer sauce to dip the pastry encased sausage. I chased my app, with their cask conditioned oatmeal stout. It was cellar cool and of perfect temperature, kudos to the staff for understanding how to serve a stout. This was a great beer that perfectly complimented the 3-wing trio. All of which were spicy, savory, sticky and enjoyable. I followed with the Dark Helmet black ale which disappointed. The DH was watery, lackluster and under-hopped. I recommend it to Lite beer connoisseur's only. Finally, nearing the end of my meal the pile of spent platters in front of me was cleared, but I felt underwhelmed with the casual, lack of housekeeping. The bar was poorly organized and liquor bottles were erratically stationed... To the point that I was put off, there was a readily apparent lack of pride for the workspace... Maybe it was my OCD but it came off as slovenly. Management needed to step in here and offer some much needed guidance. The food was otherwise excellent, and my service wasn't lacking but the appearance of the bar was far from professional. Could've been an easy 4, but I have to give a 3/5. If it was a busy Saturday night I could have forgiven the appearance much more easily but it was pretty slow.

We love gong here. Great beer selection. Food is great.  And Jessica is the best waitress. Very knowledgeable on menu and beer they brew..  And your kids feel just as welcome  They have the best hot wings. On Wednesday is a special wing nite. People order piles and have a great time

I always forget to write a review for Emmett's by our latest dining experience was exceptional so I thought I would sit down and write about it.  We went for the second time to their Easter Brunch and if you make a reservation early you are guaranteed a great table.  Their is a good variety of food, salads, desserts and even a carving station.  I highly recommend it is worth the price.
What a great place. Great food and a great staff turn Emmett's into a place that's worth returning to. Great spot for Fox River Trail users to make a pit spot for some great grub and great beer!

This review is based on the service. The only reason it gets 2 stars is because the food was good, and my martini was great. 

HOWEVER- the service was the worst i have ever had. I am a waitress myself, and I am definitely not one to ever complain. But to have a server mess up 3 out of 5 checks is ridiculous. Then, she left one drink off of my tab, which I didn't notice, but we already paid, then brought another check back to me and said sorry you have to pay again. THEN, another couple had 2 beers on their check that they never got, and when they told her that they never got those beers (all of the glasses were still on the table because she never took a single one away) she said "im sorry i cant change the bill again.." so basically, "you have to pay for those beers even though you didn't actually ever get them" 

Not only were the bills messed up repeatedly, she didn't know the menu at all, and had no idea what products they had or didn't have. One guest didn't get a drink for 40 minutes because every time she ordered they were out of it. She then decided to just go standard and for a coors light. The server said ok, and 10 minutes later came back and said "i'm sorry we only carry bud light and miller light." I'm sorry, but those are standard beers that anyone should know if its carried or not. 

The manager was very kind and took care of everything in the end because after the server argued with us she wouldn't come back to our table. 

Needless to say, I would go back for the food and drinks, but if I ever saw that server again I would walk right out. If only I could remember her name...

I need to start this review by saying I'm a server and bartender for over 10 years. Because this is a negative review I will only comment on what I experienced directly. The service is bad. Sever was short and only visited the table 5 times in total. At least 10-15 minutes between visits. No refills and didn't check on order accuracy. took initial order, food order, picked up plates, dropped check without asking for refills or anything, and dropped the credit card receipt. That's no effort or really busy/understaffed. I didn't even get a chance to bull shit her and tell her the food is "ok." She was just absent. The server in me struggled to even tip 15%, but she wasn't rude or mean so oh well. The service was not even the worst part. The food: I ordered the Kobe Burger, med rare, sweet potato fries. What I got? I'm not really sure, but it wasn't Kobe beef. It was definitely a frozen patty of some sort, perfectly round. It had a frozen patty texture and appearance on the inside. I'd be willing to bet a testicle that this "Kobe" beef patty came from a box or plastic bag. Of course they over cooked it. The taste resembled a somewhere between a Mcdonalds and Portillo's burger. Not terrible, but nowhere worth 14.95 and absolutely not KOBE beef. For some reason I got a full huge slice of onion (there's not a person on earth that has that much onion on a burger) and no lettuce. Even the person applying the condiments doesn't care for this place. The presentation: 0, I didn't even get cheesy parsley on my plate, no effort. The sweet potato fries were frozen fries, no doubt as the middle of a few of mine were actually almost frozen. Presentation: 0, not even an attempt. The tuna taco was ok, a good deal at $2, but what isn't? If you're looking for a place for a good burger and beer skip this place. I feel like I got robbed for $60. There's my piece. I won't be returning as I'd rather be kicked in the nuts and eat off the dollar menu. Enter at your own risk you have been warned.

Beer and wings GOOD!
Service is slower than slow AWFUL!
Attempt at fancy food GROSS! (Stick to bar food please)
OVERPRICED!
Took my wife, parents, and siblings here; I am embarrassed to be the one that chose the place.   Where do the servers  disappear to? My  stuffed chicken entree was 16.99; it was a tiny portion (about the size of a McChicken) It was inedible.

This place has always had potential, but the same problems have plaqued this place simce day 1.   Nonexistent service.    2. Overpriced bar food.

Note: The master brewer even bailed on this place; this is why they had to change some of beer names....i.e. McCarthy Red had to be renamed Red Ale.
Emmett's is OK.  Food is decent.  Drinks are expensive.  It's more of an restaurant rather than a tavern or bar.  I like bars.

I REALLY wanted to like this place. The bar is absolutely gorgeous and the servers were always very nice. 2 stars is all I can give it. I've been here 5 times and ordered, appetizers, salads, soups, pasta, and steak. One Star is for the cheddar ale soup which is amazing. And the other is for the beer.  We actually had purchased the Beer Club Membership for $25 which they charged for each of us so you can imagine our surprise with an extra $50 added to our bill.  I may get some carryout soup thats all.
Food was okay.

I've been to Emmett's a handful of times, and each time I've been impressed! First of all the cheddar ale soup is top notch and comes with a pretzel bread stick which takes it up that extra level for me; Warm freshly baked bread and the perfect beer-cheese soup. But if that's not your thing never fear! They offer a wide variety of other choices like truffle fries (omg yes!) and bar appetizers and great burgers/sandwiches and the like. The beer here is also amazing...which it should be since it's a brewery! I need to make the trek here more often since I have sadly only sampled 2 on the list. 

I attended a wedding here a few months ago and wanted to give 2 thumbs up for that! Great venue space, delicious food and drinks, all around good times! Because of the wedding I got to try more of Emmett's delicious offerings. ..all I have to say is Raspberry Tiramisu. *Insert drool icon here* It like Jesus came down and blessed each bite!

Don't get the food.  It's....meh.  I can't think of a better way to describe it.  It is just food.  Nothing to see here folks.  

The reason you SHOULD go here, though, is the beer.  That Oatmeal Stout they have is maybe one of my favorite versions of fermented grain juice ever.  It's so good.  The servers here are usually pretty good, too.  Especially accommodating to large parties and people trickling in and out.
Great beers, good food and nice ambiance.  One of my favorite local pubs.

Friendly service yet again! This time our server was working his *first* day. Niiiice hiring!  Had the Brie slider, walleye bites and apple strudel. Brie slider is so indulgent without being filling. Walleye bites...5 pieces of fried goodness...not the biggest piece of fish but delicious. Apple strudel...no skimping on the filling, warm and plenty of caramel...yum!

Came for dinner with wife and oldest daughter.  Started with a Pale Ale which was  very good.  Daughter had Red Ale, also great. I had beer batter cod, wife had Ceasar Salad with salmon and daughter had cob salad.  All very good. Brew pub in an old historic bank building.  Tons of character in this building. Total with tip $77. Try this place ASAP

I've tried many things on the menu, and its all been really good.  Soup, fish tacos, etc etc.  Of course their beer, and even their catering for special events.  The upstairs is a great place for an event.  The staff has always made me feel very welcome.

The food here is terrible.  A friend recommended this place to us and we tried it, twice.  The first time we ordered appetizers, beer, and a burger and the prime rib sandwich.  The apps were pretty good: the cheese and meat plate were very tasty, the pretzels were yummy, but the walleye nuggets were greasy and small.  My question is: how do you screw up a burger or prime rib sandwich?  Well, they did.  The burger was greasy, tasteless, and the bun stale.  The prime rib was rubber and tasteless.  The beer, however, was great. 
We thought we'd give it a second go and only order apps.  Well, that was a mistake.  We ordered the pretzels again (great) and the nachos with beef.  They took plain old beef, fried it up, and put it on the nachos.  No spice, no flavor, nothing.  The chips were stale.  The only saving graces of this experience was how accommodating the staff was.  When I told the young lady that the chips were stale (I didn't try the beef on it yet) she immediately took the plate back and brought out a fresh batch and the beer was good.  Perhaps if I drank more beer then the food would be better?  I'm not going to go back to find out.  Too bad.

This review is based soley on drinks and atmosphere, as I did not eat here. Will amend if I ever do.

So this seems like a pretty popular place. They have an outdoor patio that everyone waits for. They also have a variety of their own beers. Bar tenders and servers were pleasant and friendly. I asked the bar tender her opinion between two beers, she described them to me, I picked one, and then she brought me samples of both, which I thought was really nice, I ended up picking her original suggestions. 

I would equate this place to a Rock Bottom Brewery. Will have to go eat here sometime in the future.

visted this place over a week end .. Nice selection of beers. Simple names used for beers unlike lot other breweries. trufflefries and seafood trilogy were execellent.. I tried munich light and pale ale... the only thing is its a bit pricy ....
One of my favorite places! Great ambiance,  awesome food and helpful servers. The pretzels and cheddar ale soup are awesome,  and on Tuesdays they have $3 pints and $2 tacos, a really good special!

Been here 3 times. First time good service good food. Last 2 times food and service has been awful. This place is only good for drinks and appetizer. Don't mind the hostess she doesn't know how to greet well. Honestly had better food at dive bars for a third of the price.

Their menu was redone a few months ago, and I really like the new options (especially the small plates)! The Brie burger is my favorite (which they also have a slider small plate version that comes with fries, too!). I love their sweet potato fries! I'm not a huge beer person, so I can't speak to their offerings, but they have a great french martini!

Here's the short of it:

Their Beer-4.5- I love the Victory Pale Ale

Their Food-4.0- The Portabello Fries w/ sauce are unreal.  Walleye Bites very good also.

Their Service-1.5- Except for a few rare occassions, their service is horrifying.  Why do we keep going back?  Because we live here and because the quality of the Food and the Beer outweigh the terrible service.

While back in my old stomping ground we decided to pop into Emmett's for a lunch rendezvous and I have to say, I was very impressed. I'm not sure if they are part of a chain (it screams Firkin & Pheasant corporate entity) but it had a certain homey vibe none the less. 

Our waitress, whoever she was, was by far the perkiest and most professional server I've ever encountered in the greater Fox Valley Area so Manager, it was the shorter of the two working on 3/4/11 at lunch time. Seriously, way on top of just about everything (except switching my Swiss for cheddar on my club) and very pleasant, hitting on all points of service a secret shopper would be looking for i.e. 1 minute greet time, two minute drink service and up-sell, add-on and impulse options. We were on a tight schedule so no extras, however, I wanted to steal the beautiful pretzel sticks parading by but me and the girls opted out! 

Our food was decent by not only FV standards but by my ridiculously high standards in general. Kobe burger was so deliriously delish I actually stole a bite from my bff. My club (sans ham) was tasty and filling while my other companion enjoyed some very passable fish tacos. Sides offer fries, sweet potato fries, fruit or cole slaw and while the fruit was mostly honeydew the appropriate (I mean not overwhelming amount) serving of fries and the sorta sweet slaw were hits. I was kinda glad the fries weren't abundant because I would have eaten every one so the serving size was just perfect. 

Huge beer selection, decent wines by the glass and they were pimping the Hurricanes on Fat Friday but alas, no drinking for us because we had to workity work work later. Saving the fifth star for when I can do me some drinking! And be warned, you are walking distance from my bff's house......get ready Emmett's, I'm coming back!
They always have great seasonal microbrews, very nice decorations in a old historical building always make it a nice experience. This is a must if you are in the Dundee area and looking to relax.

Don't get conned into joining their beer club. I joined the beer club at their Palatine location where I was told the benefits included a 10% discount off my meal cost. Then I went to the West Dundee location and was told this discount was good for Sunday and Monday only. The food is average, and good beer is easy to find elsewhere. Insulting a customer's understanding of a promotion is not acceptable. They saved themselves the $1.60 discount I expected but lost me and my friends as customers. Go eat somewhere else..
A great spot in West Dundee.  Food and drink selection are great along with a very classy interior and service staff.

Been there quite a few times over the years.  Went there again last night. Beers are always great. Service was terrific and very professional. Food is good quality and well prepared. Had the prime rib special last night. Overall, a nice cut of meat but needs to be seasoned. It was very bland but was prepared medium rare just as requested. 

Great experience and will be back.

I dropped into Emmett's while driving through West Dundee on the way back from Galena. There seemed to be a lot of nice places to dine in West Dundee, but my wife having eaten at he Palatine location suggested we go to Emmett's. The decor is very warm and cozy and they make a nice Martini. Now for the real outstanding stuff, the food. I had the Pan Seared Grouper, Jasmine Rice and Roasted Garlic Edamame. The Grouper was amazing and I adore Grouper and due to it being scarce in most places I order it whenever I can, and Emmett's is right up there with the best I have had. The truly amazing part of the meal was the Roasted Garlic Edamame; I have never had anything quite like it and can't wait to return to have it again, this place is right at the top of my list!!!

Alright, let's qualify this review.

Beer: 5+ Stars

Food: 3 Stars

Hence the 4 overall.

I've been a regular patron at Emmett's since the place opened 10 or so years ago. My review is going to be biased towards this place as I love great craft beer and this place delivers in spades. The beer (especially the hoppier ales) are some of the finest examples one can find anywhere at any price. Having been across this great nation of ours sampling craft brews throughout, Emmett's still stands up as one of the finest such institutions in the US.

Strong words, I know.

But Ryan Clooney (the brewmaster) is a true master of his art. If you're a beer geek/connoisseur/fan and are within an hour of this place YOU MUST GO. Folks you'll thank me for this. 

Many years ago the food would have equaled this rating, but since losing their original chef, the food has been hit or miss ever since. There are still great epicurean moments to be had, but there are quite a few swing and a miss instances as well.

But you don't go here for the food. You go here for that sweet, sweet ale in copious quantities.

Interesting. I didn't like that they only had 4 beers to chose from beyond their house brews. Your beers are good, not great, and some aren't even all that good.

The main reason I went here is because the design on their site/menu/etc looks a lot like another restaurant I like (Lucky Monk), but I was nowhere near as satisfied.

Food was good.

A very solid pub/restaurant.  Went after work for dinner and drinks.  The beer selection was limited beyond the house brews, but for an occasional stop by that isn't a factor.  The lack of options would prevent it from being a regular stop.  The menu is standard bar fare with pretenses of gourmet. Service was good, actually better than I expected as the bartender was working the entire room but still managed to be responsive to both myself as well as the other groups around.

As this was my first visit, I started with the sampler platter of the house brews.  I'm a big hoppy beer fan and I was impressed by the Pale and Red Ales.  The rest were fine, but not my cup of tea.  After finishing the sampler platter, the bartender let me sample the two seasonal brews.  The Second St. Amber was good, while the other wasn't memorable (as I can't recall the name right now).  Overall good beers, not great ones.

I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich with the upgraded truffle fries.  The sandwich was tasty.  They didn't smother the sandwich with BBQ, the meat was allowed to carry the sandwich.  The truffles fires were quite good, much better than the ones at the Lucky Monk.

The bar was fairly loud, but that's to be expected.  I would go back with a group.

Just went to Emmets for the last time. Hubby had a 9.00 angus burger that was obviously (in our opinion) not freshly made ( it had what looked like manufactured grill marks on it). The burger was just that, meat on a bun, no lettuce, tomato, or onion! I had the pub burger trio (sliders). The buns were so hard you could not bite into them, the burgers were dry and tasteless, the toppings were unidentifiable with strong odd flavors.

The bartender-waitress was absent most of the time and when there she did not seem happy or very friendly.

On the plus, the seasonal beer was good!
Very good beers made in house.  The beer flight sampler is a must for all beer lovers.

Mmmm. I want to go back to Emmett's. Too bad we don't live in Algonquin anymore.

Honestly, I don't 100% remember what we had here anymore. But I remember liking it and being suitably impressed.

The service was very good. We shared a pretzel appetizer, which was completely delicious with a fantastic cheese spread. Dinner is where it gets hazy. I think I may have had fish (potato tilapia?), and I believe The Husband had a burger. I recall us being very satisfied.

It being a brewpub, we could not let the beer go unnoticed, despite neither of us being big beer drinkers. I had a hard cider as my main drink (yum); the awesome waiter brought us samples! of three different beers for us to try. And honestly, they were really good. I believe we liked the 1 AM ale the best. I would never drink a random can of Bud or whatever, but I would have a beer at Emmett's. And that's saying something for this wine-lover.

I would love to go back. I'm just looking for an excuse.

Love Emmett's.  

The food is good (LOVE the Truffle Fries) but just about anything off the menu is very tasty.  I especially love the fish taco's.

I'm not  a big beer guy but the few I've had are good.

Emmett's always delivers on amazing food and beer.  It is a brewery, so you go for the beer and enjoy the food.  I love that if you are unsure on a beer, they will bring you taste of it.  I love to try new beers, but I am really picky about what I like.  I don't know enough about beer to just read the description and decide if I will like it.  
The food is wonderful.  The meat here is always high quality.  From the burgers to the beef brisket to the steak salad, it is delicious.  I love the spinach artichoke dip.  If you like carrot cake, you have to try it here.  I would say it is by far the best carrot cake I have ever eaten!!!!  Between drinks and food, the meal can add up .  They do have different specials on most nights.  The last time I went I was delighted to learn it was half price pitchers!  Awesome deal!  
It is a great place to go for a good meal and a good beer!

After my previous great experience I wanted to bring a few friends here for lunch. 
Emmett's wasn't busy, maybe 2 or 3 other tables, so we were seated right away... and then came the waiting. We waited for menus, we waited to be waited on, we waited for our food and then we waited for our check. All for unacceptable lengths of time. Our waiter kept disappearing somewhere in the back (maybe he had other tables to wait on?) but what bugged me the most was that the other person servicing the only other occupied table in our area completely paid us no heed. Neither did the person tending the bar. We just sat there waiting and waiting. 
To make things worse when our food finally came only one person's food was hot, the rest of the group had luke warm, dry food. 

It was really disappointing, especially since I had recommend this place, brought my friends in, and raved about how great the food was.

This place is very pretty, lots of intricate woodwork, and cozy atmosphere. My sister and I were shopping next door for wedding dresses, and came here starving. We both got the Cheddar Ale soup which was like a bowl of creamy beer-flavored nacho cheese served with a hot pretzel stick-YUM! And then I ordered the slider trio with sweet potato fries. This came with a buffalo chicken slider, pulled pork and coleslaw slider, and a brie burger slider. They were all delish. My sister ordered a beer (don't remember the name, it was very light and hoppy) but she wasn't impressed. Definitely a little pricey, but food wasn't disappointing and service was efficient. My only complaint is that the bartender (who was our server) spent a lot of time watching a game that was on behind the bar and flirting with the hostess right near our table to the point that it was really kind of distracting- a little unprofessional and I'm glad nothing went wrong with the food or timing cause I would have probably complained, at least jokingly,  about it before we left (at least be a little more discreet and attentive to your tables). We laughed about it at the time, and I would go back when I'm back in this area or try their additional locations.

Have been to Emmitt's three times, won't be going back.  

First time, awesome experience.  Service was most helpful, drinks were delicious, and bison burger was big, juicy, and delicious.

Second time, not so great.  Service was decent but the food quality dropped.  

Third time was the make it or break it, and it broke.  Ordered a Tanqueray martini on the rocks, my drink of choice.  It tasted watered down and lifeless.  Wondering if it was the "rocks" to blame I asked for another, this time served shaken.  Same lifeless tasteless martini.  How is it possible to have a weak martini???  I did!

Remembering how delicious the bison burger was I ordered it, med rare.  Burger came out medium, perfectly round, and perfectly dry.  I asked if it was fresh or frozen, I was assured it was fresh.  No way.  

My wife ordered the sea bass special......and realized why it was the special.  An fish that is ordinarily very mild came out quite "fishy".

After two weak martinis and a bottle of wine I figured I would end with a double espresso, twist.  "Sorry, sir, we don't have an espresso machine.  I settled for a very weak cup of coffee.

I think a struggling business has caused them to cut some corners and trim some expense.  It is too bad because I thought the place had real potential.

On to the next.......

I probably go to Emmett's about once every couple of weeks. My favorite beer is by far Victory Pale Ale The bar/restaurant itself is beautiful and the waiters/waitresses are oh so nice! My favorite items are the walleye bites, cheddar ale soup, pretzel bread sticks and the sweet potato fries. The only complaint is about the red velvet cupcake. It was pretty dry. My friend loved the French Onion soup and said it was one of the best she has ever had. The brewmaster platter is also fun to get. Just a mixings of bread, meats, cheeses and spreads. Very yummy. Thanks Emmett's for  a relaxing time, every time!

Not much else in the neighborhood when you are holed up at a crappy Marriott waiting to meet buyers from Sears HQ. What a gem to find though. 4 stars for the beers. The cask conditioned ales are friggin out of this world... too bad we drank them out of the current one. I mean, thanks for the blue balls... they poured two frothy ales out, then two more, and then they were empty! Although the 12 other beers on tap were great, nothing compared to the cask. Service was friendly and pretty quick. 

Food - just okay for bar food. Well, I assume definitely above Chili's or Applebees, but I have not been to either of those since my early 20's. Deep fried cheese curds were good, and the wings were massive, with good flavor. We went back the next day (in hopes the cask was changed, which is wasn't... BOO!) and I ordered a salad which was at best mediocre. Anyway, great drinking spot.

We've given up on Emmett's. The service just isn't there. And I'm not talking about when it's peak time, or crowded. Friends and I had gotten in the habit of going for TGIF and would arrive long before the rush. There would be a few patrons at the bar, and maybe a couple other tables of guests. Yet we would wait and wait and wait and wait. And then wait some more. Why, I have no idea. Except that the servers seemed to like to hang out in the bar with the bar patrons. It's a shame. We really liked their fish tacos and peach martinis. Oh well.  What's the point if you can't get the server to take your order? That killed it. Overpriced, too.

I have been here twice. The first time was around the holidays, and the cozy atmosphere was charming. The food was great and our server was attentive and kind. Both times I went with my four year old.

Last time didn't go as well. It was a Sunday evening and it wasn't crowded. I am not a beer drinker so I can't comment on the beer selection but the wine selection is good. First off our server forgot the menu for my son. Not tragic but he forgot it twice. The menu he finally brought had drawings from another child all over it. That was just weird. Then the server disappeared for twenty minutes (seemed to be his MO that day). I was annoyed at best, I mean we are in a restaurant, we are hungry and thirsty you know. He made an appearance so we ordered, I decided on the beer battered cod and it came with soup,  which was chicken with rice. They were good and satisfying. But our server was just terrible. He constantly disappeared, never offered refills and had to be reminded constantly for things such as a glass of water. I will go back as it is close by and a fun place, but that waiter needs to be retrained. I have had better service at Denny's for a third of the price.

We love Emmet's.  The menu changes periodically but is generally very good.  Their pork sandwiches are my favorites, generally tasty selection of beers brewed in house.  The service is relaxed but not inattentive.

Been here multiple time. Always impressed by the beer but the food is hit or miss. Sometimes it takes forever and is not that decent. Other times it is great. The service tends to be very slow and understaffed from my experience.

Great place to catch a game with the Sears after work crowd.   They have pretty good bar food, great daily drink specials and decent service even when they are busy.   Noticed there are some new faces which is good but I have always had great, friendly bar service at this location.

Not your average divy sports bar, a little bit cleaner, a little bit nice and definitely a great location.

Just to be fair, before responding to the manager's reply to my review asking what happened, i wanted to ensure it wasnt an isolated event... It wasnt.
Ive been back with friends several times since.

1) the staff lacks enthusiasm about serving others. With the exception of the bartenders.. They are very busy yet are attentive.. Meanwhile the wait staff is counting the minutes till they're off.

2) the food, seriously every thing we've ever ordered.. From burgers to fries to wings,.. All taste like it's frozen and just cooked as-is.. No seasoning, no flavor.

I'll stop here.

Can I just say, the manager is very gorgeous and so polite.
We'll definitely be coming back in.
$1 Burgers!

Service?  Not at this place. 

We arrived at 11:30 on a Sunday night, and it wasn't that busy. It still took the host a while to greet us and show us to a table. And then the server immediately came to our table, took our drink orders, and before I could ask her a question, she rushed off. After about 10 minutes, long after we were ready to order, I was wondering where she was.  Well, I saw her: hunched over the bar, flirting with a couple of guys.

I was hungry, and I didn't have all night for her to schmooze some guy for a bigger tip, so I left and went elsewhere. Nice try, Rookies, but you blew your chance.

Sat down at my friends table that already ordered.  Took a whole 30 minutes (yes I actually timed it) before I got to place my beer order and the place was not full (there were still empty tables for the NFL playoffs).  So I'm bitter...very bitter, that I watched the entire first quarter without a beer despite the table already having a waitress.  After that, I made sure to nurse my beer pre next beer or order (even at +50% beer left) every time she came back.

They actually had a decent beer special for a weekend day if you're up for that (as far as I can see, mainly good domestic special otherwise meh).  The same can not be said for their food specials.  Yes, I understand that it's bar food and was the monthly special, but it was a pre-made frozen burger that was way undercooked and it just gross me the ef out.

This location had nothing special that would keep me coming back.

Food was good I had the 3 mini burgers and as appetizer we had nachos. The service is rude and disrespectful! We went around 10 pm on a Saturday night and it was not busy at all and we waited a long time for our food. I accidentally spilled my cup (it only had ice left) when they brought out our food and we asked for napkins and she just threw them on the table towards me. Because of the service I won't be back

For it's type, typical sports bar, this is a pretty decent option if you are local to Hoffman Estates. Though it's certainly not worth a large pilgrimage from afar. 

The beer selection is pretty decent and the food is cheap and certainly falls into the "bar food" category. Meaning burgers, chicken tenders, nachos, etc. The food we had was really good, but you also have to factor in that after 3 beers any food they put in front of me is going to have an elevated status. 

You are also pretty much surrounded by huge flat screens in every direction the second you walk in the door. If you happen to be a sports person, this is a great option. Assuming this place has NFL Sunday ticket, this might be my new post up spot for the coming season to keep tabs on my fantasy rosters. They also have all the UFC fights on pay per view, which is another huge draw for me. 

The service here was really prompt, especially considering how busy the place was. Also, (and I realize this is an intangible that has no bearing on my review) but our waitress was hot as the Sun. I'm not talking garden variety not being able to turn your head away at a stop light kinda hot. This girl could start wars. 

I am sure I will be back here in the future. It's close to my place, the food is decent and they pipe in sports broadcasting like a NASA command center.

The food has always been very good when I've stopped in, a step or two up from the normal bar food. The specials are always easy on the wallet. 

It does get noisy in here and hard to hold a conversation, but I see a lot of after work groups here offten talking, laughing and having a good time.
It is a sports bar with tacky sports decor.

Recently on one of my visits the bill with tip was 40.00, I put a ten in the slots and won 50 bucks.

"Rookie".......from the Urban Dictionary.  Top Definition. Rookie. A Beginner. A starter. Somebody that just doing or trying something for the first time.

Located in a strip mall.
Service attitude was typical of someone who doesn't want to be there, the food was typical bar style deep fried frozen products, just a entry level place that a few middle age buddies bought in together, I pegged this in a second with the manager & gang hanging out at the bar hitting on the waitress.
I'll be back when they have a drink special for .50 cent Corona Light bottles.

We ate here last night with our baseball team from St. Louis.  Cash only that night and it was not good service.  The queso and chips were the worst I've ever had anywhere.  They called it queso, but it was a canned nacho cheese.  Queso is a white cheese folks!  

The waitress with credit card systems offline seemed lost.  I waited 15 mins for my water while I was already eating.  Our beer took forever on the refill.  

The best thing they had going was the $3.99 chicken sandwich deal!  Other than that, we were not impressed at all.

I really like this place! I've gone here about 5 or 6 times both dine in and carry out. 

It's definitely bar food, but good bar food! They give you popcorn for free at the table when you dine in and they usually have pretty good food and drink specials. Including $1 hotdogs and burgers.

The service is always really great, everyone's friendly even when you carry out. 

Tons of tv's everywhere, it's a good place to go grab a bite and watch the game.

I wish they had some of the specials even for carry out just because I work across the street so we'd probably get it more often. Some of the other food is a little overpriced. 


Good place though! I'll be back often!

Oh rookies. You're literally the only somewhat decent local bar. Which just basically proves how shitty things are around here. 

So to people thinking about going here. It's not horrible. My rating is low because I'm a regular and I see this place for what it actually is. 

THE FOOD BLOWWWSSS. (WAIT LET ME TAKE THAT BACK) 
DID YOU LIKE CAFETERIA FOOD AS A KID?? IF YOU DID, YOULL LOVE IT. 

Also it's really really odd to see the 45 year old + owners hanging around the bar feeling up the servers and bartenders. These girls barely look old enough to serve. It's so utterly blatant and uncomfortable. On the bright side because of this the girls are quick with your drinks since they know what will happen should they stand still lol. There are a couple of shady regulars. There's this 38 year old Caucasian guy who dresses like he's ice cube, steer clear of him. He gets greased up and thinks he is ice cube from the nwa days. Constantly harassing people outside.

The reason I'm giving them three stars is because of the fact that they do have a lot of Tvs and decent drink specials from time to time. The free popcorn is a nice touch, the service again is pretty good.

I imagine that Rookie's would be much better at night. As it is, we went for lunch on a weekday. I had the Santa Fe salad that I found entirely forgettable. I worked very hard to remember the name just so I could write this review, actually. I hear that the veggie burger is very good but other than that the food is sub par. The server was friendly but never refilled anyone's drink. I do not plan on returning.
Would like to say that the manager is amazingly hansom. And he really knows how to handle his buns...

Terrible Experience. I went one evening and received poor service. Our waitress had her boyfriend at the bar so she would go between hugging him and bringing us our food. I ordered a burger and when it came out of the kitchen, it was placed on the crowded bar top where it was pushed down person by person. I didn't know at this point that is was my food. So I was appalled when the waitress finally remembered our order and brought over the cold sandwich. I've had bad experiences in the past but that was the last straw for me.

The st.charles location is great. This locations sucks. Everytime. The waitress was a total bimbo, took her 20 minutes to get our drink order. 
She admired the "queso" is just nacho cheese. Fuck this place.
Decent bar food (nachos and appetizer sampler are pretty good), good beer specials and plenty access to TVs so perfect for game day or happy hours but the service is always slow!

Where do I start...we were seated in a crowded section although the entire place was open. Next, we get a waiter that can't keep up with her tables. It took 15 minutes before I was asked if we wanted to order food. I ordered a drink that looked great on the menu, but when I received it...nothing but juice. I asked to have my drink replaced with something else and got another drink that contained no alcohol. I received my food...COLD!!! My gyro meat was sliced extra thick and was very salty. I will never return to this rookies again.

I love the star rating because each star expresses exactly how I feel. I've definitely experienced better (especially at the Hoffman Estates branch).

I came here on a Friday night with about 8 ladies. We were seated promptly but that was the only prompt action that was taken the whole night. We waited 5 minutes before we were asked what we would like to drink, closer to 15 minutes before we got our drinks (and our drinks didn't even come out all at once, pretty ridiculous if you ask me). Our later guests had to wait another 15 minutes before their drinks came.

Our server Jessica was not attentive, did not come by to ask us if we were doing alright. And when she did and we asked for water and napkins, it seemed like it was inconveniencing her and she didn't even bring us napkins. 

Our checks were separated, which we asked before hand and she said it would be fine. Fine if she actually knew who was ordering what, very rookie mistake (pun intended). Once I did receive my bill, I noticed that there was an 18% gratuity on our bill. I'm not quite sure I've ever gotten group gratuity at a bar and I'm not sure I was happy about it especially with the service that we received. But then again, maybe we received the service we did because of the 18% tip she knew she was going to receive. 

She also dropped my card along the way and came back and told me I didn't add my card to the check I handed her... really? Once she found it next to our table, she didn't even apologize for her mistake. 

Definitely left a bad taste in my mouth. If I go back to Rookies, it'll be at Hoffman Estates.
Decent beer selection, food was good. Nice sports bar kind of tucked out of the way but worth finding.
Great food at a great price!  Awesome burger special for a dollar.  Great price for the beer.  Love all the televisions playing non stop sports!
Last day of $1 burgers.  Busy and packed during lunch rush.  Good burgers! Best service we ever had in a rookies pub and grill!  Kudos to Madeline!

2 stars for the lively atmosphere, but the food is so mediocre. I'm pretty sure the wait staff is throwing food together in the back or microwaving frozen food. The salad I ordered was not good at all and the dressing came in packets.

Used to go to Rookies Hoffman Estates weekly. Especially for hockey games and ufc.  Won't ever return that's for sure. The staff is extremely slow, lazy, and rude. The food is so so at best. Drinks are usually made fine. Managers seem to have no clue what customers want anymore either. 
I went from loving this place to never returning.

Average sports bar. Came here one night to just hang out with some people and watch some basketball. It's good for that. Lots of TVs. They have drink specials too. which is always a plus. On this night they had a live DJ that was music video spinning so that was pretty sweet. 4 stars for the nightlife aspect.

2 stars for the food though. So it averages out to 3. I went on like a Friday so they had the 50 cent mini tacos. These are like literally mini, like the size of a chicken nugget. Not good quality either, tasted like it was microwaved. So I ordered a bunch of those cause I didn't think they were that small but it was no where near filling me up. Got the cheese and sausage panzerotti which is pretty muc ha big pzone. You can't go wrong wit ha Pzone, but this one seemed huge but was mostly filled with air. It tasted good, but had like barely any meat. Was pretty disappointed since it was like 9 bucks.

Service was alright. Our waitress was nice, a little slow though. Didn't check up on us too often. We had a bigger than usually group, probably like 12 of us. Mostly we ordered drinks, but she didn't think to have us split the check. So we had to go through it and split it ourselves. No harm no foul though, just a slight pain.

I've been to this place numerous times in the past, but most recently was today.  My friend and I went right after church, hoping to catch the Bulls game. When we arrived, there were plenty of seats opened. Our waitress, I forgot her name, was very nice helping us out. Usually in the past I would always order burgers since that's what they're known for, but today was different. My friend and the waitress said the pizza was good. We ordered a pepperoni pizza and man, it was good. It was also a good deal considering it was just for the two of us. I've read that sometimes, there are specials on pizzas. I will consider getting it next time I go. I should also mention, like the other locations, that I love the $1 monthly specials.  This restaurant is just about the perfect place to watch live sports on TV.   Can't wait to go back again.

It was my first time at Rookies in Hoffman Estates, and well, let's be honest, Rookies in general.

I went for a birthday celebration with my boyfriends family, about 8-11 people total. I called to see if they took reservations, and I was a little upset. However I saw a comment box and sent in a request/question, submitted it, and literally about 30 second later I got a response from John Alimissis stating that he can accommodate our party no problem. After a couple of emails it was all set. Definitely a perk!

When we walked in early, they were prepared and sat us down with no problems. We had a server named Brie who was super awesome, friendly, and overall a fantastic waitress!! She was very attentive and even brought me a birthday sundae!

I would have to say that this is a place I will definitely be coming back to, especially for the upcoming football season!!

Thanks Rookies!

They are improving on customer service.  Shout out to the management team for paying closer attention to this.  I enjoy $1.00 burger and hotdog months!   Very clean and good atmosphere to watch games.  Overall I would say its a great local bar

Yuck! Decided to try them out today for my football game.
Boneless buffalo wings were on special for 50cents. They were tiny! More like popcorn chicken! Single bites only.
Hubby and I split a taco pizza. Was the driest pizza I've ever eaten. Crust was dense and tough. Topped with dried out re fried beans, a sprinkling of cheddar and some pico. We let the server know it wasn't good. She said, "I've never had it. So you don't want the rest boxed?"
The mini pitcher special was nice, but not nice enough to offset the rest.

Really disappointing dinner tonight. Took our waitress almost 10 minutes to acknowledge us and take our order. Ordered 4 waters and 2 beers; got 3 waters and 1 beer. Had to go to the bar to get it corrected. Our food did come out fast but we needed plates and ranch which again we waited for. I spoke to the manager who apologized but when our bill came he only comp'd us one beer. Service was really disappointing. Will be dining elsewhere next time.

The bar atmosphere is really nice. A great set up with plenty of tv's. BUT the food is the worst bar food I have ever had. The boneless buffalo wings tasted like chalk and the burgers taste like they are made out of substitute meat. Do not order food when you come here, but if you only want a drink then you are in the clear!

Wings were very good but for hot wings not too hot, the blue cheese was very runny and didn't have any taste. Burgers were great! Bartender was ok, not very nice to use but very friendly w regulars. Barely greeted us and just served us - no one asked how our food was or anything. Much better service at Elgin location.

FAMOUS FOR (My ratings in parens)
- $1 Burgers

I TRIED
- Poppers, Cheese Sticks, Chicken Fingers, Mac & Cheese Bites, Buffalo Wings, Gyros, and Onion Rings. (4/10)
- Beer Nuggets (6/10)
- Santa Fe Cobb Salad (3/10)
- Burgers (a lot) (4/10)
- Chicken Club Wrap (5/10)
- Prime Rib Grinder (5/10)
- Gyros Plate (6/10)
- BBQ Ribs & Chicken (4/10)

I work in, like, the Bermuda Circle. It's a giant circle going as far west as 59 and as far east as Woodfield Mall. It's Bermuda because my money magically disappears and my waistline magically increases. And every couple years or so, I grow a new chin. I know all the little food "barrios" around my work because my coworkers and I eat out every day just to get out of the office.

Anyway, Rookies is part of this "barrio" that includes Red Robin, BW3, and a lot of typical lunch places (well...it's typical if you've been eating there for 6 years). Rookies was one of the newer additions who enticed us with $1 Burgers a month before it opened.

Anyway, you walk in to this place and get the best part...POPCORN! Good ol' movie theater style popcorn. I could seriously just go and eat popcorn and drink Diet Coke all day. Oh yeah, and I've seen 670 AM The Score there a couple times during football season which was kinda cool too.

It's a nice looking sports bar, but more of an ADD type of sports bar than a "Chicago Games On The Big Screen" kind. All the TVs are about the same size and they might be like 46" plasmas, but they're dwarfed by the place's high ceilings and what not. It's a nice casual sports bar that's very big and open so sports fans and hungry non-sports fans can cohabit the place.

Oh, right...the food.

So, as I've said, I eat around these places a lot, and even though Rookies isn't anywhere near my favorite, it's just another choice in the daily lunch rotation. With so many opportunities to eat here, I have eaten just about everything off of this menu. You know how you have that favorite burger at Red Robin or that favorite sauce at BW3? I was trying to find that here, but man, I've struck out like 15 times! There is NOTHING on this menu worth mentioning. Everything's average, everything's mediocre. I've never tried the $1 burger, but man, if the $9 is that bad, I don't even want to know how bad $1 is!

SANTA FE COBB SALAD
You know cheap salad when you see one. I mean, Wendy's salads have more respect for themselves than this! It's real easy to picture too. You know what a cobb salad looks like, right? Well, now imagine that it was served to you at Denny's or IHOP at 4AM. Now you know what it's like here!

GYRO PLATE
If there's anything that I've actually ordered more than once, other than Diet Coke, it's this. I mean, it's hard to mess up, really. Nothing special about it, though, that would separate it from any other place.
